review: Cook, Serve, Delicious is fun rhythm time-sink that i've thoroughly enjoyed. The game is very patient with new players and affords you enough time to master each recipe you unlock. There is also the NG+ mode which makes the game immensely intense and difficult right off the bat for those who want an extra challenge. Definitely recommend buying this, worth every penny and more. I will definitely be checking out CSD 2 and 3, and am excited for the new CSD coming out later this year.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031223198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1709304586}
review:
[url=https://jannekeparrish.com/reviews/cook-serve-delicious] Full review [/url]

[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/44626948-Loons/] My curator page [/url]

Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a restaurant simulation and management game with what I like to call tactile elements. The player runs a restaurant, building it from a small hole in the wall in an office tower to a thriving five star experience. The player manages the menu, takes on additional tasks and chores, and above all, cooks and serves meals to impatient customers. 

This cooking element is the true meat of the game, and provides the tactile experience. Each recipe requires the player to cook it using a variety of keyboard (or mouse, I suppose, if you’re a masochist) inputs in a precise order. While this seems simple enough, as the game’s pace gets faster and faster, these keyboard inputs and placing a check on muscle memory become more and more challenging. 

This game loop of designing a menu, serving it, and reinvesting makes up the bulk of the game. While there are small side events here and there and a betting mechanic that forces a bit more tension, the challenge of the game isn’t necessarily in the decisions the player makes to design their restaurant. Instead, the challenge of the game is keeping up with orders and serving them correctly. As simple as this sounds, the frantic pace and sheer satisfaction that comes from raising the perfection streak is addictive. It is deeply satisfying to watch meal after meal rumble out of the kitchen and listen to the satisfied monching sounds of customers on their way back out to their lives. 

This is not to say the game can’t get repetitive. While the recipes may vary, and the steps to serve food may change, the fundamental elements do not. If the process of frantically smashing buttons to make and serve food gets tedious, the game falls apart. Progression is based on the number of days that pass, meaning it can take a long time for a player to earn a star, regardless of how well their restaurant is doing. The game proceeds slowly, even as the individual rounds zip by. 

However, the slow progression doesn’t detract from the fundamental joy of slinging plates at people and watching numbers tick up. More than anything, Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a game about living in and enjoying the moment, whether it be fast-paced or calmer. It is a deeply satisfying experience, and one I keep coming back to.

Plus, it’s about food, and who doesn’t love a good food game?

author: {'steamid': '76561198191639233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1715, 'last_played': 1705655431}
review:
Different from other time management + restaurant games I've played, but still quite fun. I like how you can customize your menu to make a day more or less difficult, as well as the "bets" (ie. challenges) you're offered along the way. There were a couple things I wasn't too fond of - mostly the chores (especially the "robbery" event thing) that are mostly just a nuisance to do and no amount of upgrading will make them go away entirely. They also don't even make sense within the logic of the world. But by far the thing I found most annoying in the game was that it doesn't save your settings, so every time I open up the game I have to turn down the Sound FX volume (because it is very loud). Anyway, despite my gripes, I'd still recommend the game. 

It also occurred to me whilst playing, that this would actually be great practice for people who are learning how to type - it certainly rewards knowing where each key is without having to look, requires quick key pressing, and offers a variety of tasks with different inputs that might help reinforce your memory of where everything is on a keyboard.

review: Occasionally I like playing games that force me to focus intensely in short twitchy bursts.  This one does that without amping the pressure to the point it gets stressful.  I wish there were more accessibility options for some of the commands, particularly the button mashing.  But so far I've been able to avoid that.  I don't think I'll be able to avoid it entirely though.  Since there are more recent iterations of the game out, I doubt this aspect of the game will receive any attention, but additional options for ppl with carpal tunnel or arthritis would be good for a game with wide appeal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198204043643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4116, 'last_played': 1699563818}
review:
Tenía este juego en mi librería, creo que lo gané random en un sorteo, pero ya ni me acuerdo. Y me arrepiento de no haberlo probado antes. 

Si te gustan los juegos de cocina, o jugaste de pequeño al típico Cooking Mama, este te va a flipar. Sí es verdad que difiere de lo que es Cooking Mama, pues está enfocado a que tú eres el dueño y cocinero de tu restaurante y tienes que mejorarlo a base de obtener dinero vendiendo tus platos, sirviéndolos a base de pequeños minijuegos que varían según el plato que estés preparando. Tiene un cierto grado de dificultad, te va a forzar a adquirir habilidad y maña en los minijuegos y hacer estrategias con los platos que tienes, porque tendrás momentos frenéticos llamados 'Rush hours', donde las comandas no dejarán de llegar. 

La curvatura de dificultad no es mala, aunque sí que al principio te sentirás un poco perdido al no enterarte del todo qué está pasando, pero a las pocas horas ya empezarás a pillarle el truco. Los logros en general son alcanzables y no son de estos logros casi imposibles, pero algunos tienen un tono más elevado de dificultad y te obligará a estudiar un poquito en cómo superarlos.

- Puntos a favor: es un juegazo, muy bien hecho, bien planteado, buenos minijuegos, buen escalado de dificultad, no hay prácticamente bugs (al menos yo no me topé ninguno) y los retos son hasta divertidos, aunque con alguno sufres.

- Puntos negativos: algunos de los logros. El logro de citas no pega en absoluto, no es tedioso en sí porque lo puedes completar fácilmente si estás atento mucho antes de llegar a los 10k de platos servidos, pero me sigue pareciendo un tanto tedioso. El logro de los 15k platos servidos, que al final es puro grindeo, no es difícil porque una vez llegas al Platinum Restaurant te dejan trasladar el save con los avances a una nueva partida en dificultad extrema (donde sacar los logros de dificultad extrema), y se te guardan esas cosas donde podrás terminarlas ahí . Pero los logros de grindear, no me gustan del todo en general, me parece alargar el juego por alargar. Igualmente no debería habar problemas, al menos no te exige una ingente cantidad de horas para obtenerlo. 

Resumen: 9/10, vale mucho la pena.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025204938', 'num_games_owned': 2982, 'num_reviews': 489, 'playtime_forever': 1377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1377, 'last_played': 1685860118}
review: I really enjoyed this one!  It was a sort of quirky sense of humor and it isn't too hard either.  Strategizing what menu you want to move forward with is a nice touch.  Are you going for easy to make recipes that make little money, or more complex recipes to boost your income?  Want to focus on unhealthy junk food?  Or healthier options?  Your choice!

author: {'steamid': '76561198073928591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1697780294}
review:
玩了一会儿潜水员戴夫，前来考古了属于是。

基本玩法非常清楚，快速识别+肌肉记忆的订单/灭火/打地鼠游戏。食物分层做得很细，品类也不少，打字完成的手感极佳。随着升级增加配料种类和售价是非常好的内容曲线。可能唯一“不足”的就是生涯模式下，提升餐厅星级需要20天的节奏有点太慢了，其他条件三五天就满足了，剩下的时间稍稍有些难以打发hhh。

总之目前的体验非常好，有可能不会完全打通，但作为休闲游戏（虽然要全神贯注玩）真的很不错！

author: {'steamid': '76561198994199105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3986, 'last_played': 1709693189}

author: {'steamid': '76561199473642293', 'num_games_owned': 955, 'num_reviews': 242, 'playtime_forever': 780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1694541249}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious is a remarkable management game that elegantly balances simplicity and entertainment. The game's core concept revolves around managing a restaurant and delivering scrumptious dishes to eager customers. Its straightforward mechanics and engaging gameplay make it an enjoyable experience for both casual players and those seeking a more strategic challenge.

One of the game's standout features is its intuitive control system, which streamlines the process of cooking and serving various dishes. This allows players to quickly grasp the basics while still providing room for mastery as the game progresses. The gradual increase in complexity ensures that players are continuously engaged and motivated to improve their skills.

The depth of customization adds a layer of personalization to the gameplay. From crafting your menu to upgrading kitchen equipment, Cook, Serve, Delicious offers ample opportunities to tailor your restaurant to your liking. This not only enhances the strategic element but also encourages creativity as you strive to create a dining establishment that reflects your vision.

The progression system is well-paced, striking a balance between challenge and reward. As you tackle increasingly demanding rushes and strive for higher ratings, the sense of accomplishment is palpable. This motivational curve is complemented by the game's charming visual style, which brings the bustling kitchen environment to life with vibrant colors and delightful animations.

Furthermore, the inclusion of various recipes and ingredients adds diversity to the gameplay, ensuring that monotony never sets in. The game's attention to detail in accurately portraying different cuisines and cooking techniques is commendable, contributing to an educational aspect that subtly enhances the gaming experience.

In conclusion, Cook, Serve, Delicious effortlessly combines simplicity and enjoyment in a culinary management game that will captivate players of all levels. Its user-friendly mechanics, customization options, and gradual progression make for an engaging gameplay journey. Whether you're a fan of time management games or simply looking for a delightful way to unwind, Cook, Serve, Delicious stands as a shining example of a well-crafted, enjoyable gaming experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042044934', 'num_games_owned': 2133, 'num_reviews': 336, 'playtime_forever': 2041, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2041, 'last_played': 1692621529}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious is an excellently stressful yet enjoyable experience where you own a restaurant and need to complete orders throughout the day. It has a little depth, but isn't as deep as it might want you to believe. However, it's still something I recommend due to how enjoyable the core concept and gameplay is. 

Before diving into the actual gameplay, I'd like to cover possibly the most divisive part of the game, the visuals. This game has a great UI design, and yet has one of those art styles you'd see on Adult Swim that is almost intended to disgust you. This isn't me saying the designs are bad, it's just that the way they were intentionally designed in in a way that is not visually appealing in the more generic sense. If you are a stickler for a art direction, this game may be off-putting. However, for the same reasons just listed you may like it due to it having a much more unique and interesting visual style that is indeed out of the norm.

The gameplay though, that is where this game shines. So, when you start your restaurant you need to make a menu. Each item on that menu has a unique method of being prepared before being served. You decide what you put on your menu, and then throughout the work day you'll have people slowly trickle in asking for food. Now, in order to actually make the food you need to do a specific set of button presses, and each sequence is unique to the recipe of the food you're making. It can be as simple of Corndogs which has 4 recipes (1 with nothing on it, 1 with ketchup, 1 with mustard, 1 with both.) or it can be as complex as Pizza with well over 20 different recipes all using different sauces and toppings.

Now, this wouldn't be much fun if you had as much time as you wanted to complete each order, now would it? To remedy this, customers who are waiting to be served have a patience meter, if the patience meter runs out they just up and leave, making less customers come in the next day due to negative publicity and making sure you earn nothing from their order. You also have to manage doing the dishes, taking out the trash, not burning cooked foods, etc. There is also rush hours which cause customers to flood in quickly at certain times of day, and a buzz mechanic which makes the game harder but more rewarding when you're doing well but also easier when you're doing worse at the expense of reducing progression speed. Pair all of this together and you have a perfectly fun game that rewards you for challenging yourself and rewards mastering recipes, while never punishing you [i] too [/i] hard for failure.

The audio is something I haven't covered yet, and I'll keep it brief. It's a bit like the visuals, almost purposefully weird and almost gross at times. This again is either a positive or a negative depending on your tendencies, but for me it ends up being a bit positive.

It is overall a very well crafted game that launched the CSD IP, and it's getting a remake come next year. I still highly recommend getting this OG version before the remake, and I especially recommend getting it if it is on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128287463', 'num_games_owned': 619, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 1254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1254, 'last_played': 1690704122}
review:
[b]Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a fine game and is worth your money if what you see in the trailer looks appealing to you. I am not recommending this game because it is vastly outclassed by its sequel (and maybe 3, but I've yet to play it) and this is also getting a remaster, which this game sorely needs imo, although based on what they've shown I may recommend against that one too..[/b]

CSD has two main issues, barring technical ones (many expected options are lacking). The principle among them is that progress is too slow.

i waited many, many years to review CSD because I wanted to beat it first, but frankly after 20 hours in and barely being at the 2* rank, I felt demotivated to press on. I wanted to play CSD2, but still felt compelled to complete this one first. Thus, I was stuck. For many years I deprived myself of indulging on CSD2's vast superiority out of strange, misguided obligation to beat this first, but this game is not worth beating. It kinda stinks by comparison!

It's almost like Assassin's Creed in a way. The first game was a groundbreaking and mega-franchise spawning title. But in hindsight the game sucks and by today's standards it feels very bad. Time does not always look favorably on games, but the good ones are usually still good years on (I'm looking at you Worms Armageddon).

CSD's other main issue is that there's lack of variety and depth [i]given the length which is pressed upon you.[/i]

CSD would get a recommend with flying colors if you could finish the main career/story in the number of hours I have in now. 

Sadly, you can't. It drags on, and the sequel, now that I've played a decent chunk of it, has more variety, more depth, and smoother progression curve so far as well.

All in all, CSD is an okay game, but given the market now, there's no real reason to get this.

Wait for the remaster or skip and get the sequel.

[b]5.5/10[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198322516618', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1694256474}
review:
This game is very fun to play and slightly addictive. It works wonderfully on the Steam Deck with controller input but some menus (no pun intended) require keyboard and mouse. You can configure the trackpad for that but I think these menus are optional to the game.

The main gameplay loop is very simple: there are food orders and you need to prepare them by clicking on a sequences of buttons without messing up. They expire if you don't go fast enough. It does not require synchronization (like dance games). There is also a bit of management to do as you can optimize your menu to get better efficiency. But I think it's optional, it just takes longer if you are not optimizing much.

The gameplay is unique and fun. I highly recommend it.

(I don't recommend the game if you are on a diet. All the food is very tempting)

author: {'steamid': '76561198092751545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 350, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1710734743}
review:
Keeps my brain busy. Pretty simplistic looking, but still can be quite a challenge and it's different than other cooking games I've played. Cook, Serve, Delicious 3 is also pretty great and looks it too with better graphics and the ability to auto serve, but this one is more "easy" to manage without the prep stations and only starting with 4 order slots (you get more the more stars your restaurant has). Good way to get your foot in the door to the mechanics of CSD. 

TLDR: CSD is a pretty great game that tests memorization and speed. Quite a blasty blast. Makes me hungry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023714891', 'num_games_owned': 3264, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 2862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2862, 'last_played': 1689315966}
review:
Ранее проходил игру, сделав все достижения, на GOG. С тех пор вышла третья часть и потихоньку пилится четвёртая. Суть у всех одна — готовить кушать, попутно следя, чтобы не сгорела еда и ваша попа в попытке всё это поставить на контроль.

Это не симулятор, поэтому процесс готовки блюд крайне прост по своей задумке — в большинстве своем каждая заказанная позиция из меню представляет собой мини-игру, где нужно разложить ингредиенты в определенном порядке. На вырученные деньги можно улучшать свою забегаловку и закупаться новыми блюдами или улучшать уже имеющиеся, чтобы делать деньги. Особо стоит отметить, что игрок сам решает, насколько будет ему сложно, ведь именно он составляет себе меню на день.

Концептуально ядро игры напоминает лучшие флеш-игры былых времён — суть понятна сразу и за десятки часов практически не изменится, основа в виде репитативности происходящего либо проглотит вас, будто вы и есть главное блюдо либо отпустит минут через пятнадцать.

Не сказать, что игра как-то примечательно выглядит, но спешу отметить аппетитность происходящего — еда нарисована очень просто, но звуки и атмосфера (на которую работает не только визуал, но и постоянное действие, вызванное спешкой) создают приятное погружение, дополняющие здешние интерактивные натюрморты.

Без минусов, конечно, никуда. Помимо вышеуказанного однообразия в игре есть ряд недоработанных механик (например, свидания максимально бесполезны и их сделали будто исключительно ради одного достижения, а система баффов перегружена, при этом вникать в нее по большому счёту смысла нет), а ряд блюд сделаны настолько неудобно, что проще их не брать (да-да, я смотрю на тебя осуждающе, кебаб, пусть ты и очень вкусный). Управление с геймпада сделано очень хорошо, но я так и не смог к нему адаптироваться, потому что руки не смогли позабыть этот чудовищный контроль на клавиатуре с периодическим использованием мыши. Звучит грязно, но я привык, и в какой-то момент просто начал получать удовольствие.

Вердикт: вкусно — и точка.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135531559', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1256, 'last_played': 1608341793}
review:
Para salir de lo común es un excelente juego y vaya que es divertido cuando ya lo dominas.

Eres un joven emprendedor que empieza con su pequeño restaurante, vendiendo lo más básico como comida rápida, a la vez que realizas labores de rutina como lavar los trastos, deshacerte de la basura, colocar trampas para los roedores y hasta evitar los asaltos de uno que otro ladrón.

La idea del juego es hacer todas estas acciones juntas tratando de satisfacer el exquisito paladar de tus clientes teniendo cuidado de poner atención de como quieren sus órdenes... y según obtienes ingresos, consigues mejores recetas que según su delicadeza te provean de aún mejores ingresos. Es un juego que aunque para pasar el rato debes tener una buena destreza con las manos y una buena percepción visual de tu entorno para ser el mejor chef.

A nivel visual es bastante sencillo, pero su gameplay que es lo más importante, hace de este juego un juego bastante único. Lo recomiendo ampliamente para pasar un fin de semana entretenido.

Mi puntuación 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198076701412', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1717, 'last_played': 1695353298}
review:
This game, on the surface, seems like a little time waster that you can enjoy a few times and maybe drop it after a while.

But that's NOT what this is. This game is beyond addicting, and memorizing the keybinds for all the different foods while you decide what to value between buzz, income, and ease of preparation is an engaging gameplay loop that has kept me entertained for over 100 days in the game. This game is also an excellent test of your typing skills while not feeling unfair with limiting key presses.

And hey, if you don't like the default keybinds, the game lets you change those.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081931575', 'num_games_owned': 1166, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 2875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2806, 'last_played': 1692545829}
review:
This is very good game and always will be my favorite from whole CSD games series, this is where it all started - you're lone cook on a way to your 5-star restaurant in SherriSoda Tower where you will be dealing with all kind of stuff like cooking and doing chores all by using keyboard (or mouse/touchscreen). You can buy upgrades to make chores easier and buy new recipes or upgrade current one to make game harder. Even the way how you progress and build your menu affects the buzz (the higher it is the more customers you get), chores and so on. Even after beating the game you can test your skills in Battle Kitchen challenger and endless modes.

Separately I would like to mention that this game has quite good soundtrack making the experience even better.

I can't recommend this game enough, just give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561199009839822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3924, 'last_played': 1684809439}
review:
这游戏略微挑人，适合人群：1、喜欢美食做饭类游戏，2、喜欢键盘的打击感，噼里啪啦响，类比劲舞团。因为每升一级需要游戏里重复操作20天，流程比较冗长，如果感受不到乐趣，那简直就是坐牢。好在打击手感实在优秀，这应该是我坚持把它打完的最大理由了。
几点注意事项：
1、成就里的顾客数、菜品数这些，是分存档的，不是各个存档通用的。
2、约会软件Cook4Luv的几轮约会，最好一口气做完，选短信回复尽量别选错，因为但凡错一次，约会失败又得从头开始，挺煎熬的。
3、音乐有些单一，到rush hour听着还挺紧张，建议把BGM关了，只留打击音效，放自己的歌听，心情会更好。
4、最好一段时间内集中刷完，我是中途搁置了，隔了几年捡起来，键位映射什么的全忘了，就从头又玩了一遍，累啊。

author: {'steamid': '76561198166953106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2324, 'last_played': 1684204623}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious! Is very archaic, simple yet addictive in almost every way.

The Battle Chef edition brings in new features that would be expanded on in its sequel, CSD2 but as much as the following games improve an already good formula I still think it's worth picking up CSD.

With its more arcade style of game play it feels like an old school flash restaurant manager, and a much more intense version of those types of games. 

If you like challenging yourself you can give the Challenges a try, and push yourself to new heights!

I would recommend this game to anybody who enjoys fun, Chaotic games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198392560842', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 389, 'playtime_forever': 2551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2551, 'last_played': 1683614266}
review:

Le jeu crée de vrais automatismes, on a pas un moment de liberté ni de répit il faut enchaîner les touches pour satisfaire les clients.
[b] Des heures et des heures à faire des plats pour gagner quelques sous c'est abusif, bref, si vous voulez cuisinez ou servir des gens faites 1 vrai job irl et si vous voulez jouer à 1 jeu, ben ne prenez pas celui-ci [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198026508942', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1680636661}
review:
Comme ce jeu n'est pas traduit dans ma langue, le français, et qu'il faut comprendre très vite pour réaliser les plats, ce jeu s'est révélé être très vite injouable pour moi.
De plus la musique m'a vite énervé et les graphismes je les trouvais laids.
J'aime cependant le sujet et la jouabilité, bien que complexe avec tout ce qu'il y a à retenir.
Je suis déçu, ok c'était annoncé qu'il n'était pas traduit, mais comme je l'ai eu dans un œuf de pâques, je ne l'ai pas choisi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263786925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1614, 'last_played': 1702380835}
review:
★★★★☆(4/5)

打字遊戲玩起來還是相當不錯，只是面對多種菜單，每個操作都不一樣，
玩到後期人一多很容易手忙腳亂，與其說是打字，更像是考驗你的記性。

因為原料英文第一個字母容易重複，例如Chicken和Cheese兩種材料，
只能取一個為C，另一個只能取其他字母如K替代，
通常你是看著菜單材料來打字，有時一忙就很容易K打錯成C。

review: Cook, Serve, Delicious is a fantastic game that will keep you hooked for hours on end. With its fast-paced gameplay and challenging mechanics, you'll find yourself constantly on the edge of your seat as you rush to serve customers and keep your restaurant running smoothly. The game's simple but addictive gameplay, combined with its charming graphics and sound design, make it an absolute joy to play. Whether you're a seasoned gamer or just looking for a fun way to pass the time, Cook, Serve, Delicious is a must-play game that you won't regret.

review:
hra je veľmi veľmi príjemná
hra je veľmi pekná a môžem povedať, že je to pomerne náročná hra (aspoň zo začiatku)
spravujete si reštauráciu, volíte denné menu a musíte sledovať aj počasie, ktoré vám môže denné menu, resp, to, čo ako denné menu máte, ovplyvniť

zo začiatku odporúčam si prejsť jednotlivými tutoriálmi na jedlá, ktoré si budete voliť a zvoľte si kľudne tie jednoduchšie - totižto, hra vás moc šetriť nebude

hra je super, veľmi vhodná na cestovanie - zaberá málo miesta, nie je náročná na grafiku a aj napriek tomu vyzerá a správa sa skvelo a veľmi jednoduché ovládanie

Peace and all good, 
Meximo73

author: {'steamid': '76561197975607244', 'num_games_owned': 2352, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 505, 'last_played': 1558797444}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a fantastic cooking simulation game that offers a unique and engaging gameplay experience. In the game, you play as a chef who runs a restaurant and must manage every aspect of the business, from cooking and serving dishes to managing your finances and upgrading your restaurant.

One of the standout features of Cook, Serve, Delicious! is its realistic and detailed cooking gameplay. Each dish requires precise timing and attention to detail, and the controls are intuitive and responsive. The variety of dishes available is also impressive, with over 180 different recipes to prepare and serve to your customers.

In addition to the cooking gameplay, the management aspects of the game are also well-done. Managing your finances and upgrading your restaurant can be challenging, but it is rewarding to see your restaurant grow and become more successful.

Overall, Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a must-play for fans of cooking simulations and management games. The gameplay is challenging but satisfying, and the variety of dishes and upgrades keeps the game fresh and interesting. So, I would definitely recommend this game to others.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067170472', 'num_games_owned': 949, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 3972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3972, 'last_played': 1669643537}
review: Came back to this one after spending a good amount of time with the (excellent) third part. Still holds up, real sense of progression - a quality that kind of left the sequels. Super satisfying gameplay once you get into it; nailing a day with high-difficulty foods and powering through those rush hours flawlessly is close to a religious experience. Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198050862129', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 768, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 768, 'last_played': 1503203328}
review:
It's one of those high pressure fast paced games. It is a modern version of some ancient arcade games really.

With this one customers appear and the players have to make gobs of food and drink at a fast pace without making a bunch of mistakes.

I found it to be pretty good. It was one of those games that could be fun when one is in the mood for this sort of thing. However, I stopped playing it long ago.

author: {'steamid': '76561199100837772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1209, 'last_played': 1690666563}
review: delicious

author: {'steamid': '76561198236211666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1024, 'last_played': 1704073852}
review: The most tactile management game. You feel a real connection and investment with your restaurant because you're not detached from it but you're down in the trenches making every dish and doing every chore yourself. The recipes you learn will become like friends (or enemies) to you as you are forced to memorize them to get through rush hour. Also the soundtrack goes way harder than it has any right to and you will catch yourself humming the songs throughout the day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075353613', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1687188869}
review:
It really makes a lot of fun. It can be stressful, but you will be proud when the rush hour is over.
You need to buy/unlock new equipment and foods, so you will have motivation to achieve more money.
It also has little events, so it never gets boring

review: Bu oyun, google üzerinden oynanan o güzelim yemek oyunlarının tamamen klavye hakimiyeti gerektiren hali. bunu ve 2.'sini birlikte paket olarak aldım (indirimden), 3.'sünü de başka bir oyun sağlayıcı ücretsiz verdi oradan indirdim. 2.'si ve 3.'sü bu oyuna göre çok daha karmaşık, bu en temel hali. ve onları oynayınca, çözebilince bunu oynayasınız kalmıyor pek. bu oyunu oyuna nasıl ısınırım, oyunu nasıl çözerim demek için oynamak çok daha iyi olabilir sizin için. ben uzun bir süre bunu oynadım 2.'yi çözemedim, sonra bir anda onu çözebildim ve bunu oynamamaya başladım, sonrasında da 2.yi çözebildiğim için 3.'yü oynamaya başladım. 3 oyun da internet olmadan oynanıyor ve steam cloud'la eşleşmese de sorun çıkarmadan ilerlemeyi kaydediyor sadece kütüphanede saat işlemiyor. özetle her şekilde serinin 3 oyunu da muhteşem. İndirime giriyor sanırım sürekli, indirimden paket olarak üçünü birden alabilirsiniz.

[h1] --=[총평]=-- [/h1]

<쿡, 서브, 딜리셔스! (COOK, SERVE, DELICIOUS!) 는 마치 어린 시절 해 봤던 것 같은 비주얼의 식당 경영 타이쿤 게임입니다.

"웬 플래시게임 같은 걸 돈 주고 함" 이라 생각하실 수 있는데, 저도 게임을 해 보기 전에는 비슷한 생각이었습니다. 막상 해 보니 생각보다 컨텐츠 양이 상당히 많고, 몰입력이 강해서 좀 하다 보면 한 시간 두 시간 금방 지나 있습니다.

게임의 난이도도 생각보다 꽤 빡셉니다. 눌러줘야 하는 키가 정말 많고 실수할 여지도 적지 않으며, 게임 후반부에 가면 익숙해진 만큼 손님이 차는 속도도 엄청 빨라서 속도감이 굉장합니다.

정가 만 원이고, 할인도 밥 먹듯이 해서 싸게 사면 2000원 언더로도 구할 수 있습니다. 그런 게임치고는 정말 할 거 많은 좋은 킬링타임용 게임이라고 생각합니다.

다만 이 시리즈가 히트를 쳐서, 이미 후속작 2편, 3편이 나온 상황이고, 23년 초에 4편도 출시 예정이라고 합니다. 가능하다면 1편보다는 최신작으로 게임을 즐기시는 걸 추천합니다.


———————————


이와 같은 더 많은 게임 리뷰 소식을 받아보고 싶으시면 제[url=store.steampowered.com/curator/35338611/] 게임 큐레이터 페이지[/url]를 팔로우해주세요. [url=steamcommunity.com/groups/palejack] 큐레이션 스팀 그룹[/url]에도 많은 가입 부탁드립니다. 감사합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198306942316', 'num_games_owned': 630, 'num_reviews': 231, 'playtime_forever': 1896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1896, 'last_played': 1663899843}
review: Cook serve delicious is one of my top favorite game series. It's a fun game to play with friends, but can also be relaxing while you're enjoying TV, or a movie. I decided to go backwards and while I finished the second one first, I wanted to see where their roots came from. Going backwards isn't recommended since the controls and mechanics are vastly different, but its a different experience that I'm happy to report I made it to the end. Worth picking up, just keep in mind, the 2nd/3rd is far better than the first, but, if you're just starting out, you'll be very surprised at how much they've improved.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035161842', 'num_games_owned': 1432, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 2326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2326, 'last_played': 1662726523}
review:
Ever wanted to run a 5 Star Restaurant?
 
[h1]Pros[/h1] 
+ Simple
+ Fun
+ Local co-op
+ Increasing difficulty
 
[h1]Cons[/h1] 
- Very repetitive after 10+ hours
- One misplaced comma in the salad recipe, which ruined a few of my perfect days
 
[h1]Summary[/h1] 
Very easy game to understand and play, but very hard to master at the same time.
Once you get into the rhythm the game is relaxing but can be stressful as well.
 
You will be preparing around 20 different food items and doing chores at the same time while trying to make your customers happy.
Each upgrade will make the game easier while getting stars will make the game harder.
 
Prepare to click a lot or memorise a lot of keys.
 
[b]Playtime:[/b] 20 - 30 hours
 
[b]Achievements:[/b]  Challenging, way too much of unnecessary grind
 
[b]Overall:[/b] Worth a try
 
 
[h2]Additional notes[/h2]
[i] Achievements rant[/i]
[b]“15k Customers Served”[/b] is a bad achievement, every other achievement makes sense, but this one is here for no reason. 
After 15-25 hours, you finish the whole game, do some of the missing achievements and pretty easily reach the 10k served customers, and now the last remaining achievement is this garbage one.
 
There is no challenge in this achievement just grinding the extra 5 000+ served customers for hours because someone thought that 15 000 is a nice number. Why couldn't it end at 10k? Guess we will never know.
 
Also, it counts the progression only on one save and new game+, so me having 2 other saves with around 2k customers served each does not help me at all.

review:
[h1][b]A great start for the saga[/b][/h1]

[hr][/hr]

This game has 2 difficulties, intermediate and extreme. They are as mentioned. You can choose to adapt to the game as well as the game can adapt to you. The recipes have default assignments but you can modify them to your liking (only letters, no special characters). I have really enjoyed this game and still have a lot more to explore. It includes a few more game modes and a local co-op I think. But with Steam Remote Play Together will remove this barrier.

[b]Rate: 88/100[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561199144041656', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3695, 'last_played': 1657916357}
review:
тот прекрасный тип игр, когда тебе тупо некогда моргать. 
чтобы играть в CookServe, ты должен полностью выключить привычную постоянно мыслящую часть мозга и включить ту, что будет заставлять твои пальцы ебашить по клаве, пока твоя голова ещё даже не успела разобраться, что там нажимать-то.

для меня это улучшенная версия старого доброго cooking dash, но с усиленным hard-mode и с намного большей вариативностью. Интересная, хоть поначалу и пугающая своей перспективой, задумка в выстраивании собственного меню даёт возможность снижать себе нагрузку в игре - ставишь в меню, что лучше всего получается, а что не получается - не ставишь - противопоставляется постоянно поставляемыми челленджами, на которых можно заработать и потешить самолюбие.
создатели CSD заботливо украсили её юморком, добавив в почту, через которую с нами общается игра, мистический или придурковатый спам, с которого можно искренне погиенить.

Cook-Serve-Delicious замечательно задрочная играчка, от которой хорошо, но иногда плохо.
несмотря на то, что я опасаюсь, что в следующих частях будет жосче, играть в них точно буду

author: {'steamid': '76561198862457911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2720, 'last_played': 1658286100}

review: This game is a fun little time management one. The only thing I wish it had was an option to change some of the keybinds, but you CAN do that in the sequel. I'm a noob that just clicks for the most part instead of pressing the keys for ingredients, that's just easier for me, but you can do either, which is pretty neat. You get a ton of gameplay out of it, and lots of recipes/buffs you can unlock to make your life a lil easier and wallet a lil more full.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039779258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1656606410}
review:
Fun game simulating manual labor of kitchen work but on a keyboard. The game is well polished and I haven't found a bug or problem so far.

After ~2 hours I feel like the game is becoming repetitive. Especially the part where you have to keep grinding to 20 plays to achieve a star rating. The daily income also seems to be less than $500 which is small compared to most menu/equipment. You have to play 3-5 times to buy stuff that makes things more excited. Which I think makes the fun factor drop after you get past about the first 12 or so plays.

author: {'steamid': '76561198321134678', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1897, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1425, 'last_played': 1705527223}
review:
C.S.D-1... It's hard to start, if you've never played these types of games before. 
It can be super overwhelming at first but once you understand the mechanics of the buttons and remember some of the recipes, the game is super fun!
You are small chef who needs to build a restaurants up from 0 stars to 5 stars, small milestones along the way, and challenges to test the speed of your typing skills.

One of my Favourite recipes is Lasagne.. Spamming PSCR x 3 is fun :D
or burgers are super satisfying.

Pro Tip Never play on an empty stomach.
If you can play this game on a controller efficiently then you are a GOD!

author: {'steamid': '76561199015032574', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1693130424}

author: {'steamid': '76561198078932442', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 2633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2633, 'last_played': 1699128319}
review: This is a game that has no right to be as good as it is. It’s a high-pressure skill-based restaurant simulator and it is simultaneously one of the most anxiety-inducing and one of the most addictive games I’ve ever played. It has a lot of content, a lot of dishes, and a hell of a lot of challenge. If that’s the kind of thing you like, absolutely get this, it’s very cheap and I got a solid 40 hours out of it without even 100%ing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198962238240', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 263, 'playtime_forever': 1955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1692158378}
review:
I got this in a bundle with 2 and 3 and was at first focused more on 3 than anything else. I would not really call it a mistake, but the original certainly holds up. I kind of wish I had worked my way up the ladder in the first place, but I am going to have that fun working my way back up now! Especially with the 4th game on the horizon.

It might seem a little difficult, but the game is definitely possible to conquer. Especially with some planning with menus and early purchases. If all else fails, practice makes perfect and you can try out both your recipes and all the chores before you ever agree to a full day with them. That on top of the original game's personality and charm makes it more than worth a chance if you are interested,

author: {'steamid': '76561198060612684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 2097, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1245, 'last_played': 1675431247}
review:
Without irony one of the best games i own!

Its simple, addictive and incredibly fun and while the two sequels do a lot of things better, they also do a lot of things differently that might be less fun if you like CSD1's gameplay loop.

Basically, you run a restaurant and you serve orders. You serve orders by putting in various buttom prompts, each of which correspond with a particular ingredient. Its equal levels of stressful and fun as it can get very hectic during rush hour, which happens twice a day!

Some of the freaking recipes later on get so fucking esoteric, you feel like you are putting in the Konami Code or something like that, as its all hotkey-based!

Owned it for about 8 years but only now decided to bother writing a review for it, still, i'll probably revisit it again one of these days and maybe become addicted all over again..

author: {'steamid': '76561198080493208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1318, 'last_played': 1513732909}
review:
It's funny how the mind can interpret situations and circumstances. For example stress can be both perceived as excitement or terror, depending on the individual and the presentation of the stimulus - I like roller coasters, but hate busy traffic. Take Cook, Serve, Delicious for instance. This game, in many ways is the the antithesis of my personality. I'm generally very slow and methodical in my approach to things. I like to move with caution and in a deliberate manner and I most definitely do NOT like to be rushed. I hate the term "multi-tasking" and a society that embraces such notions. And in CSD, you are tasked with managing a constant and ever-changing stream of requirements via keyboard inputs corresponding to customer orders. As you look out from behind the counter through your high-rise window upon the cityscape beyond, you receive dining orders in your (initially) humble, urban cafe from customers and fill those orders per their finicky specifications. Filling long lines of requests within sometimes strict, and varying time limitations, you can have as many as eight patrons waiting to be served exactly what they want - numerous variations on every item you have chosen to include in your daily menu. This menu will get increasingly complex as you upgrade your offerings, allowing for seemingly innumerable requests on any given day. And heaven forbid you get behind. You'll have orders chiming that they're ready to be finished or delivered one after the other, many requiring mostly pre-serve prep work and many others needing to be completed after some cooking is done. You've also got 2 rush hours per day to contend with, which can really up the hustle and bustle quotient of running your own eatery. If you are prone to getting frazzled, you'll probably experience that sensation at some point here. On top of the aforementioned, being successful only makes things *worse*. After I built up my establishment to a 5-star locale and managed to not screw up too many orders over a period of time, while keeping my menu fresh day in and day out, I eventually reached a state where my "Buzz" was over 100% causing a flood of customers from open until close, as if the entire day was one long rush hour. Oh, and let's not forget your chores that must be done during all this. Dishes pile up, garbage must be disposed of, rat traps have to be set, and you can even get robbed, requiring you to quickly form a sketch of the perp if you have any hope of recovering the money stolen. Sheesh. Keeping all the balls successfully in the air can really be a task. At the end of some days, I was spent and felt as if I had been doing the actual work represented in-game. I'm not epileptic, but I think I felt a twinge of what that must be like as my brain sizzled on overdrive at times.

However...I had so much fun being put into this state of chaos. In part it was surely because it was self-inflicted and I love to have a challenge in my gaming time. I also really loved the window dressing propping up the admittedly basic bones of things. Gradually building your restaurant and pleasing a base that frequent your establishment gives a sense of gratification and pride, feeling oddly satisfying to please your virtual diners. I felt bad when I had a bad order - when I pushed the button to give customer 1 their half-baked pizza order instead of giving customer 2 their order - a hamburger that was about to burst into flames, I was disappointed in myself. Not only because I knew it would lower my buzz for tomorrow, but because of the presentation, I felt a sense of obligation to satisfy those who were giving my business their money, including dropping tips oftentimes. As things currently stand, I'm only a couple of special events away from earning my "platinum" status - something that I thought would have been insurmountable 20 hours ago in-game. And I probably will go ahead and reach the highest standard I can for my once-trashy dive, and revel in the glory of a job well-done. I expected that this game would be fun going in, but I ended up enjoying it even more than I had imagined. It's an easy recommendation and a solid 4/5 for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070149304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3312, 'last_played': 1647701939}
review: Даже странно что свой первый в жизни обзор в стиме я пишу об этой игре. Мне всегда нравились подобные игрульки, где надо на скорость что-то готовить. Раньше играл в алаваровские игрули типа кекс шоп, потом пытался играть в подобное на телефоне, но там как обычно со временем перестаёшь успевать готовить и нужен донат на бустеры. И вот, я перехватил это на распродаже за примерно 20р., потому что повёлся на симпатичные скрины с едой. И не прогадал. Игруля очень залипательная. Пусть вас не смущает отсутствие перевода и русификаторов, в игре в основном очень простой английский, а то что надо делать понятно интуитивно. Так же, если привыкли играть на геимпаде - эта игра отлично под него заточена, я бы сказал что это игра для геймпада. Просто откинулся в кресле и кайфуй. А в чём собственно кайф? Кайф тут получаешь после каждого выполненного заказа, приятные звуки и смайлы действуют на подкорку мозга так, что ты уже не можешь остановиться, и как наркоман хочешь слышать это ещё и ещё. В игре красиво нарисована еда, но со временем перестаёшь это замечать, потому что сосредоточен на скорости готовки. Музыка расслабляющая ненавязчивая, но к сожалению треков мало и со временем они начинают немного надоедать. В игре полно улучшений для каждого блюда в меню, благодаря этому постоянно чувствуется прогресс, их становится сложнее готовить от того и интереснее. Так же есть и улучшения для самого ресторана, но их не так много. Вообще игра очень минималистично сделана: прочитал почту, принял какую-нибудь ставку (да, в игре можно принимать ставки по типу - сделать 20 идеальных заказов имея в меню лазанью и гамбургеры), выставил блюда в меню, и вперёд - обслуживать покупателей. Есть небольшие фишечки, например надо мыть посуду, выбрасывать мусор, а иногда вас даже могут попытаться ограбить. Я не так давно купил новый компьютер, чтобы играть в ААА игрули, но вместо этого чаще остальных запускал именно эту, потому что обычный игровой день хоть и длится достаточно быстро, игра так же быстро насыщает тебя положительными эмоциями. Потратил 55 часов жизни, о чём нисколько не жалею и уже прикупил вторую часть - ХОЧУ ЕЩЁ.

author: {'steamid': '76561199171866674', 'num_games_owned': 378, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1690401760}
review:
If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198830606604', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 3857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2611, 'last_played': 1648104027}
review:
Love this game. Lots to grind. For the Robbery achievement, it would be nice if it happened more frequently at least in the Extreme Difficulty mode because I only got it once (was not prepared lol) so that achievement will probably be the last one I complete. 

Other than that, leveling up and upgrading is great and I like how everything is focused on maxing out things to completion in order to make more money etc. The side challenges of VIPs, the dating pool, the cooking show challenges, keeping the Health Inspector satisfied and the Crazy Dave bets are probably my favorite parts. It forces you to think about what you should put on your menu the next day to satisfy people who will be visiting while also keeping a fresh menu since everyone gets bored fast and that decreases your buzz. You have to weigh out the pros and cons of everything and it feels more realistic because of that. 

All in all, it's a simple fun game that forces you to be quick on your feet. (If you're not big on typing, this might whip you into shape.) Mavis Beacon Teaches Typing was my first typing game ever a long time ago, so this was a fun refresher on how addictive these games can be.

Edit: The only con I could add is that I finished 99% achievements at around 10k customers served. Not sure if it was because I played with as little mistakes in each round or what, but there was only one achievement left for serving 15k customers. Each level approximately gave me around 100 customers a round towards the end of the game. So I had to serve about 4,000 more people as the last task for completing the game, which was tedious and redundant.

author: {'steamid': '76561199100002045', 'num_games_owned': 24, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1657887679}
review:
"Cook, Serve, Delicious!" is a game where you take the place of a cook/bartender/barista in a fast food restaurant. I hesitated to buy it at first (despite the good reviews; I thought this game was going to be like one of those horrible mobile games), but I eventually bought it, and I'm very glad I did.

This game is a simple yet a fun game to play, even if you have a short periods of time to game (such as 30 minutes per day). Each day in-game is about 5 - 10 minutes. There are many dishes and 'events', such as unclogging a toilet (or something like that) and liking someone's photo which contains a picture of a dish. 


RATING - 10/10!!
One of the best games I've played!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007816901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6367, 'last_played': 1708563769}
review: This game is just loads of fun.  Progress feels natural as it's not the tasks that get easier, but YOU getting better at doing them.  When you first start, it feels overwhelming, but as you get through levels and recipes, you learn how to best perform them, and eventually you are knocking out perfect days with little issue.  It keeps throwing new challenges at you most days to take you out of your comfort zone and test your precision just as you begin to feel confident.  Upgrading recipes doesn't make them easier, it makes them harder.  So you can master a recipe, then upgrade it to challenge yourself.  An absolute gem of a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011506911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 2153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2153, 'last_played': 1649122816}
review:
Start here and move along in chronological order through the series. In my opinion, every title improves upon the previous one (CSD3 > CSD2 > CSD)

Everything about this game is a delight. The typing mechanics really get you in a flow state while you're racking up a 50x combo. The role-playing and strategy aspect of the game keep you engaged as you choose your daily menus and plan out your upgrades. The soundtrack is a delight for the ears and the art style is fun to watch. There's even a bit of humor baked in there if you browse through those spammy corporate-office-park emails that any white collar worker can relate to seeing at a boring desk job.

I really love this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041693464', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1702740462}
review:
If you like cooking and look for a game which is challenging but also suitable for people with few spare time, this game is perfect for you. 
Nice graphics, some restsaurant development and management elements (don't expect a managerial game, though!), irony will provide you with a very enjoyable gaming experience. Furthermore, despite having just begun playing the game, it looks to me like it has good longevity thanks to career mode and challenges.  

I strongly recommend Cook, Serve, Delicious! and I am looking forward to trying the two sequels!  :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198202387779', 'num_games_owned': 640, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1623411837}
review:
The beginning was nice, but after about an hour it feels really repetitive.
Also I just couldn't keep up with the crazy combos during rush hour.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127575819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1643707047}
review:
[h1]ワンオペゲー大好き[/h1]
こういうワンオペゲー大好きです。
スマホのアプリゲーや某アイドル音ゲーのお料理サブゲームなどやり込みました。

ただ、そういうアプリゲーの難点はコンテンツの乏しさやリプレイ性の低さ。
すぐに全面クリアしてしまったり、後半の面に進むと無理な難易度で押してきたりして飽きてしまいます。

これまで類似したゲームを探していましたが、このゲームほど長く遊べそうだと感じるゲームはありませんでした。

[h1]このゲームのいいところ[/h1]
[list]
[*]昼と夜にラッシュ時間帯があって忙殺される体験ができる。
[*]メニューの数がかなり多い
[*]自分でメニューの組み合わせを作れる
[/list]

ラッシュ時の体験が本当に最高に楽しいです。
料理を作っている最中に、なんのオーダーが入ったか？、次はどの順番でしょりするか？を考えながらすすめる。
これが醍醐味でしょう。

[h1]よくないところ[/h1]
[list]
[*]日本語非対応
[/list]

非公式Modでプレイが容易になるレベルまで対策できますが、食材のショートカットキーが英単語に絡めたキーになっているので、日本語にすることで逆に難しくなるかもしれません。
（オニオン→O、オリーヴ→Vなど。。。）

[b]trilogy packを買ったのでこの作品をやり込んだら２と３も遊びます！！！！[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198043882240', 'num_games_owned': 311, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1637, 'last_played': 1646948526}
review:
Honestly played CSD3 first, but, I stopped a good ways in because I wanted to play them in order. This one did not disappoint! The games are unrelated and can be played in any order, but it was need to see how the mechanics had developed from this one to the most recent release in the franchise.

It's like the new version of Diner Dash. Instead of focusing on the service aspect this is all just cooking, like cooking mama on steroids.

I really appreciate the fast paced game play that helps mentally keep me on my toes. It's interesting how you have to learn strats to be able to be as fast as possible but also accurate. I plan to try and get as many achievements as possible on this title before moving on to the next one. Really great game!

(if enough people are still playing this title in 2021/2022, you might consider re-starting the weekly challenges for those working their way through the game~)

author: {'steamid': '76561198873963619', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1968, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1394, 'last_played': 1698119447}
review: Hands down the best cooking game I've ever played. Rests on touchtyping ability, which is something I have, meaning it has the most complicated and intricate yet totally comprehensive set of commands I've ever had to internalize. Highly, highly recommend if you like this sort of thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018736275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3496, 'last_played': 1704856254}
review: Solid 8.5/10, maybe a 9 if you're really gung-ho for a career-progression food game. Excellent as a restaurant growth game AND a food pattern game! I wanted something a bit less organized and quest-y, but the restrictions on progress are reasonable and not frustrating. If you want to play for fun, there's normal mode; if you want to test your heart, there's an insane mode that will keep you on the verge of panic through a 14-hour "day" of being the sole cook and order taker in an entire restaurant. The normal mode is like that too, but there's not automatically a hundred customers storming the gates every day.    A lot of the controls leave a lot to be desired, with TERRIBLE consistency of keybinds to ingredients between different foods, but there are a lot more foods than easily-available letters and there's no real way around that. At least you can set keybinds how you want it if you can find a better way to make it work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202648511', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 2308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2218, 'last_played': 1635731315}
review:
I was hesitant about getting this game at first, seeing how everyone said that it's hard or something. Honestly, the game is not too difficult as long as you know how to use the keyboard without looking. This plays like those old keyboard typing games or those classic dine-n-dash games. Even has some similarities to that penguin diner game back in the 2000s. It's really nostalgic and I absolutely love it! 

I waited until I'm nearly done with the game before I left a review. Yes, the content of this game is HUGE for the price you pay for it. It's definitely worth buying even at full price, but on sale it was down to about 3-4 dollars.

I highly recommend this game for anyone that wants some simple, nostalgic game like those old flash games. It is challenging though when things start to get more hectic on screen, but the way you play it is really simple and easy to learn. I would highly recommend any parent to buy this for their child if they are learning to use to keyboard. It definitely forces you to become extremely proficient in knowing where each letter is on the keyboard. As an adult, this game is no problem for me, but I would have loved to have this game as a kid when I was learning to type too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198285070643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 883, 'last_played': 1694531986}
review: This is the most stressful game I've ever played in my life but the satisfaction of blazing through orders is like no other. Even after not playing the game for months I can come back to it and my hands still retain their muscle memory, whipping out salads and fish like it's nobody's business. If I'm feeling adventurous I'll add an unfamiliar food to my menu and instantly regret not practising it before 8 people have ordered it during rush hour. O for Onions not for Olives, T for Toro not for Tuna... sometimes the best thing is to change the key bindings before you're used to them, either way you'll cry once you upgrade your food and you lose your flow and comfort in new ingredients and recipes. 10/10 one of the best games I've played and one that I'll keep going back to like a masochist.

author: {'steamid': '76561199213539862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 630, 'last_played': 1634557912}

author: {'steamid': '76561198017924360', 'num_games_owned': 1605, 'num_reviews': 225, 'playtime_forever': 1768, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1768, 'last_played': 1590357610}
review:
Cook Serve Delicious! è un gioco di abilità e memoria nel quale si gestisce la cucina di un ristorante.
Il ciclo di base del gioco gira attorno alle giornate lavorative: ogni giornata dura circa 6 minuti e mezzo. In questo periodo dovremo soddisfare più rapidamente possibile le ordinazioni dei clienti. Per preparare un piatto occorre premere una sequenza di tasti il più rapidamente possibile. La giornata ha due momenti di “rush hour” corrispondenti a pranzo e cena dove arrivano più ordinazioni contemporanee, mentre per tutto il resto del tempo il ritmo di gioco è abbastanza rilassato. Le ricette sono di vario tipo: alcune richiedono la pressione di molti tasti, e in particolare occorre ricordare a memoria la corrispondenza tra lettera e ingrediente, non sempre intuitiva. Altre ricette hanno una componente di tempo, del tipo che occorre tenere premuto un tasto per un tempo esatto: queste ricette non funzionano bene insieme perché portano via troppo tempo per essere completate. Oltre a servire le ordinazioni dobbiamo anche occuparci della pulizia del locale e altre attività correlate: anche queste richiedono più che altro combinazioni di tasti e possono portare via parecchio tempo. Questo gioco che è alla base dei due capitoli successivi può risultare abbastanza monotono, in particolare se i giocatori tendono a concentrarsi solo su alcuni piatti preferiti con cui comporre il menù. Detto questo però il primo Cook Serve Delicous! è probabilmente la versione più rilassata e semplice da imparare della trilogia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198995488432', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 752, 'last_played': 1675871293}
review:
my biggest complaint would be that the game's a tad bit slow when it comes to difficulty progression: twenty in-game days to gain a star for the restaurant is just too long of a time, and the intensity of the gameplay in a normal campaign is just really low mostly. there's an extreme mode to "cope with" the problem, but the thing is it'd be better off to finish the intended normal campaign to understand all the recipes, not to mention shifting the lane midway is just impractical when one's already partially invested. when I finished the normal campaign with platinum star rating and all that, it feels like such a grind to get to this state and ng+ becomes like a chore at this point.

and as much as I appreciate the ability to adjust the difficulty through menu arrangement and recipe upgrades, income generation is rather low early-game to the point where you can maybe unlock a new recipe/upgrade every two days at best, and without at least 80% buzz (which is normally difficult to reach until late-game, it's normally around 60% maximum during early stages in which the customer flow is still fairly slow) I don't think it's not gonna be much of a challenge at all honestly.

so yeah, if you'd like to dip your toes into the series, i'd advise to start out from the second entry instead. it's a more polished game with local co-op too, while providing the same core experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004884317', 'num_games_owned': 415, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 581, 'last_played': 1631316167}
review:
This is a bad game.

To start with, it's not an accurate representation of working in a kitchen-I would legitimately recommend one of the Papa's (x)eria *Flash games* over this. 
First and foremost, it prioritizes drama over allowing you to maintain flow-simple dishes are either undesirable or 'cheap' figuratively and literally, whereas more expensive dishes will be MADE complicated, whether they actually are or not. Add a combo meter that determines whether your restaurant gets popular or not and you have a recipe (pun not intended) for teeth-gritting frustration.
The game depends entirely on getting you into a position of flow for overall success, but dozens of failure states exist to prevent you from achieving flow or-should you achieve it-to knock you back out. Every food requires a flight-simulator-like collection of button presses, and half the foods in the game are prone to "going stale", again slowing down the attraction of customers to your restaurant and therefore preventing you from building up the muscle memory necessary to quickly prepare dishes and attend to the next one in queue.
Nearly a quarter of the dishes in the game would be made before shift or during lulls to serve quickly and easily, not made bespoke for every customer-Soup is the most egregious offender, but Lasagna is nearly as bad. 
On top of this, if you start to prepare a dish and then realize you've gotten it wrong, you are not allowed to cancel it and restart; you are forced to serve a bad dish and break your combo. 

If none of these feel like dealbreakers to you, then you may actually enjoy this game. If the description I've listed makes you grit your teeth and scowl, then you should play literally anything else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132426916', 'num_games_owned': 367, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 4788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4479, 'last_played': 1638069209}
review:
I first saw this game being played on YT and picked it up as a time killer in college. I quickly fell in love with it! It isn't the most realistic as far as mechanics but it does capture the feeling of running a restaurant/kitchen in some ways, and rushes feel as tense as they should. Doesn't trigger flashbacks of my prev jobs in the food industry tho thankfully!

The k&m bindings are pretty good, although I found that the arrow bound ones can make you easily lose your place on the keyboard and accidentally send out the wrong order (oops...) sometimes. I found the controller bindings pretty useless personally and didn't bother. There are a couple dif modes like Iron Chef and the Hungry Festivities to add variety.

The food variety is pretty good but not as expansive as I'd like. Crazy Dave bets and investments have a good risk/reward balance and Cook4Luv or the Food Critic options can also add challenge. However there is a ridiculous amount of spam emails rcv'd (in game, not to your actual email!) that just serves to clutter it up and only occasionally have any use.

Overall: 7 / Delicious

review: Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a chaotic yet enjoyable cooking game where you type to make food. It's a fun first game in a series, and if you enjoy this one, you'll enjoy the others as they expand on what this game has to offer. There's enough variety in food to where the gameplay won't get stale until you've gotten to the end and possibly grinding out for the final achievements if you're going for them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035271775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 1960, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1960, 'last_played': 1603467680}
review: Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a game I didn't know I needed. First of a trilogy of exponentially escalating sequels, it is a lot more barebone than 2 and 3, but it remains nonetheless a really entertaining experience. Before the "lore" became so unexpectedly prominent in its follow-ups, CSD had a very classic premise for cooking games: you just opened the eponymous restaurant and must serve your customers properly and without excessive waits, juggling the many recipes available, rush hours (showers of impatient customers happening twice a day around lunch and dinner time) and menu variety to avoid becoming stale. "Buzz" is a stat that determines how many people will visit your restaurant, influenced by its prestige, menu variety and other factors, acting both as a rough difficulty meter and, obviously, a chance for better earnings. There are a few dozen types of food and drinks, most of which have several variants that can be often unlocked by leveling them up, which in turn makes them more lucrative for you. Orders are prepared by pressing the keyboard button corresponding to whatever you're supposed to add to them, in a usually but not always intuitive fashion. And that's about it, really. What makes the game, obviously, is the food variety, which is encouraged/forced by the buzz mechanic of menu items becoming stale over repeated use, and the thoroughly addicting gameplay itself, which is fast-paced but precise, rewards muscle and visual memory and feels really satisfying when you're throwing out orders like clockwork during the absolute chaos that is rush hour. CSD 1 is considerably less expansive, varied and long-lasting than its follow-ups, but the more barebone approach can be satisfying in its own right, offering a large taste of CSD's core gameplay without all the bells and whistles found in the sequels. Should you choose to grab the entire series in a bundle as I did, CSD 1 also doubles as a very extended warm-up to the more faceted mechanics of 2 and 3, while being a solid game in its own right.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130923159', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3262, 'last_played': 1629384615}
review:
There's things I like and dislike about all of the CSD games, but I think this one is my favorite. 

Pros: I like how you are able to upgrade your food by adding more ingredients to make it more of a challenge.
I like how CSD 1 has events, such as dates, catering, iron chef, and hunger festivities for an added challenge and for added funds.
Similarly, I like the bets you can do where you mainly aim at getting a certain combo with certain items on your menu.
I like how you are upgrading your personal restaurant.

Cons: I swear the robbers are impossible to catch when you are cooking. I think CSD 2 does a better job at fighting them off and saving your cash.
It can be glitchy when you accept bets. It'll tell you sometimes you don't have the right items on your menu when you do, so you have to exit the session and restart.
There aren't THAT many food items, which is what they improve upon in CSD 2.

Despite what they improved upon in the next CSD, this one is my favorite because it's the only one where you upgrade your current food items and have all of the events. I think the events are what make it stand out and really fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992874418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1630507171}
review:
[h1]非公式ながら日本語でプレイ出来る貴重なCook,Serve,Delicious![/h1]

続編であるCook,Serve,Delicious２をそれなりにやりこんでいる者です。
第1作目のこちらは持っていなかったのですが、有難いことに非公式ながら日本語化してくださっている方がいるので、順序が逆ですが第1作目をやってみました。

やはり日本語の方が圧倒的にプレイし易く、条件反射でたたくキーボード操作も断然早くなりますね（当たり前ですが）。

また、サブゲーム的な「雑用」のうち、最難関と思われる「強盗撃退」に関しても、目撃者が英語で長々と証言する「強盗の見た目の特徴」を短時間でサッと覚えて選択肢をすばやく押さないといけないので、原語のままだとネイティブクラスでなければ先ずクリア不可能なのですが、日本語表示だと一発でクリア出来ました。

このゲームのシリーズは、新しい作品になるほどメニューやUIが大きく進化しているので、基本的には新作をおススメしたいところですが、基本的なゲーム内容はどれも同じ（オーダーに合わせて素早くタイピングするだけ）ですし、どうしても「英語の壁」はあるので、日本語プレイにこだわるのであれば、こちらの第１作目はたいへんプレイしやすくて良いと思います。

author: {'steamid': '76561198007046580', 'num_games_owned': 1682, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1627266810}
review:
This typing game is repetitive, grindy, and can be hectic. There is [i]some[/i] strategy required on how to arrange your menu and what foods to upgrade, but nothing very deep. 

Somehow however, it still manages to be enjoyable to play if you like these sorts of games. I don't think it's a masterpiece, but if you're looking for a game to engage with that you have to think about a little but not too much, this might be for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091153684', 'num_games_owned': 355, 'num_reviews': 205, 'playtime_forever': 2516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2516, 'last_played': 1589050970}
review: Playing this game was undoubtedly a mistake for me. I didn’t enjoy Cook, Serve, Delicious, it’s simultaneously incredibly repetitive, and incredibly hectic. Its greatest setback is that the process of cooking a dish is almost identical every time. Even the most complicated dishes where customers requests may have some variance, are not being randomly generated, but are one of a few present orders, so even those dishes you’ll soon enough be familiar with each possible order to the point that it becomes repetition. The game tries to counter this by having dishes get ‘menu rot’ if you serve them every day, but that just gets countered by swapping back and forth between two menu setups, and of course you’re going to end up picking the dishes that are the easiest (and most repetitive) to prepare that are also the most profitable because of how easy it is to do them perfectly, and before you know it the game becomes one big grind. I got a similar feeling playing Cook, Serve, Delicious as to playing a ‘clicker’ game, except Cook, Serve, Delicious requests so much more attention and input than a clicker game. I’m sure this is someone’s zen game, but it just didn’t click for me. I can’t speak for the sequels, but I don’t feel that Cook, Serve, Delicious is particularly worth the argues amount of time it wants from you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101019570', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 1430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1645864052}
review: If you're someone who is into typing games and/or time management styled games, this is a must buy. The progression is very well done as you work your dingy 0 star restaurant up to a classy and flamboyant 5 star eatery. The quirky email system is also a genius way to provide the player with information after every completed work day.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198157356195', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1626787923}
review:
2017年購買的遊戲，當初試玩了一下就放置了，過了四年才又重新打開來，
結果靜下心來玩後整個驚為天人，玩得不亦樂乎XD
可能跟自己後來和家人開店做生意有關，覺得在很多地方都有共鳴和感受到其中的趣味。
遊戲的按鍵組合可以隨自己慣用的方式去做搭配，雖然目前我都還沒改鍵過，但有需要的人可以使用來讓自己更上手~
遊戲裡的音效也相當逗趣而且好聽，還蠻喜歡裡面放配料時的音效，很舒爽~
背景音樂雖然只有幾首，但很愜意舒適，搭配得非常好。
開店一天的時間約10分鐘不到，非常適合每天下班想紓壓紓壓打打字，或打發時間時玩，
隨著一天天的開店成果和用賺的錢添購設備、升級菜單，與店一起慢慢成長升星，
難度也會漸漸提高，但成就感也會日漸增長~
很期待之後慢慢把星級提升，讓餐廳環境越來越棒！
唯一比較可惜的是可能是第一代的關係，畫面有些簡陋，但不影響遊玩，依舊非常享受其中！
遊戲上算是蠻固定玩法的，期望有豐富系統和豐富菜色的話可能會有點小失望，但作為小品遊戲來說的話已經是很不錯的作品了！
之後也有打算把後來出的二代三代買下來，期待這系列後續的製作與開發~

author: {'steamid': '76561198046439705', 'num_games_owned': 2328, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2757, 'last_played': 1552944604}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious is a fun, time management, cooking themed game. The simple design of the game yet abundant amount of content in it, with nice art that doesn't tire your eyes whenever you play, and nice sound effects with very cute songs that will get stuck in your head. 
The game is absolutely fun, but I wanna put a couple disclaimers.
1. Are you a Perfectionist?
If you are gonna repeat a day until that day is perfect, you will suffer. In fact, I started this game 3 times and managed to hit all stars on my last playthrough, and the reason why I couldn't last first two attempts was because I tried to perfect everyday and eventually burnt out from the game, because the main game cycle is a bit repetitive. 
2. Are you prone to carpal tunnel?
Rethink this game then cause my hands hurt. 
3. Are you looking for a chill playthrough?
Some things are definitely challenging, but you can have a relatively fun, not so sweaty playthrough if you wanna. 

Cook, Server, Delicious is an amazing game. Even though there is 2nd and 3rd games atm, this game is still worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147937223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2774, 'last_played': 1625163425}
review:
Si te gusta poner a prueba tus capacidades de gestión (sobre todo del estrés), llevar un restaurante, poner a prueba tu velocidad de reacción o memoria, es el juego correcto. Con mejoras tanto de equipamiento y de los platos en sí (me gustan las mejoras, todo lo que se pueda hacer upgrade, voy a por ello), objetivos para sumar estrellas a tu restaurante y que sea mas "fancy", y eventos/retos para poner a prueba tus skills como catering, un programa de cocina o una sociedad secreta de cocineros. 

Ah, y también hay un programa de citas, por si quieres cocinarle algo a ese pivón que está esperando en la barra ;)
