review: Loved this game in co-op. One player does the cooking and the other can select the orders. The second player obviously has a lot less to do but a workday is short and you can switch places each time. I actually prefer this over the multiplayer in the second game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081873060', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1643545100}
review: This cooking game is great for people comfortable with sequences and memorizing assigned keys. It pushes you to learn some basics and then it advances and throws you up to a new heady level. Steady progression and lots of recipes and equipment to unlock as you get better. A great start to a popular series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135711616', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 581, 'last_played': 1620094912}
review:
Estaba entre comprarme 150gr. de jamon cocido paladini o la trilogia de Cook, Serve, Delicious!
Por el momento solo jugue al 1, asi que todavia me queda ver que trae de novedoso el 2 y el 3, pero es extrañamente adictivo.
Lo compre pensando que era un juego de cocina, pero es mas bien un juego de velocidad en cuanto a tipeo de ciertas teclas ya que si lo que se busca es el aspecto de cocina en si, mejor ir por otra cosa como el Cooking simulator.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096090820', 'num_games_owned': 1032, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 1551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 873, 'last_played': 1701478873}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030933869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 443, 'last_played': 1619892554}

author: {'steamid': '76561197994170638', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 4067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1679560307}
review:
Okay game. Not terrible but has flaws. Game has strong points too so don't reject it because of cover.

AAA-AAAAA replay value. Many recepies. Many ways to create a menu.
AA-AAAAA balance. Think of Normal difficulty as tutorial. Extreme difficulty provides some challenge with more buzz and super rush hour. Player can adjust many things with menu.
AAA storytelling
AA-AAA gameplay. Campaign is slow paced but other modes are fast and far more demanding.
A-AA graphics
A interface (no way to rebind orders 1, 2, 3, 4 keys in-game, no way to press continue, no way to use main menu)
A optimization, quite demanding

author: {'steamid': '76561197972326904', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2114, 'last_played': 1620959619}
review:
Yet again, I find myself up late at night bashing my keys, desperately trying to complete every order that comes in while my restaurant’s counter billows smoke. 

I hadn’t thought at the time that this game would grab me as much as it did - I had spent 2020 deliberately not buying any games as a New Year’s resolution and had been slowly and deliberately making it through my backlog of forgotten games of Steam sales past. At the end of the year, I was offered a certain amount of Steam credit as a Christmas gift. The sale was on, and Cook, Serve, Delicious! and its sequel were less than $5 and seemed a perfect afterthought request to pack out the full maximum of his gift.

I had seen some of the third in the series played, and had made the assumption that it was a nice, casual game that I could jump into every once in a while if I got bored of whatever larger narrative experience I was playing (it was the 5th or 6th playthrough of Dishonored…).

I have been unable to play much else since. I must cook and serve, deliciously.

The simple gameplay loop of completing orders over a full day’s shift on its own would probably be enough for me, but the music that changes based on the time of day/level of difficulty being thrown at you makes me enter a zen state of calm. I find myself bouncing in my chair to the music while I mutter out my own made-up acronyms to remember the recipes (salad with everything on it: TCB, Oh My God!, Soup du Jour: you’re a WUSs to order this).

The visuals have a certain cuteness to it, and looks like some love and thought went into it: the little flecks of oil that fly out of the fryer when you dunk chicken wings, or the bits of veggies or sauces that go flying as you build a monster pizza. One of my favorite games I’ve yet played this year.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258598142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 21, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1709693570}
review:
For years I've been looking for cooking themed games that's not some brainless shitty mobile games for kids and this is it. At first it was a little difficult to get into and get used to the control but eventually things starting to make sense with the buzz and effects after a couple of in game days. 
Plus, the funny mild plot delivered through the emails is a nice touch. Challenging enough to keep me playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993464013', 'num_games_owned': 689, 'num_reviews': 404, 'playtime_forever': 1756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1567, 'last_played': 1616376963}
review:
This is a shockingly fun game. I saw my wife playing it and thought it looked interesting so it picked it up on sale. I was sure I would either not like it much or get bored of really quickly. I was wrong on both counts. This game is incredibly addicting and well balanced. It is never too easy or too hard. There is just enough grind in generating enough to much to buy and upgrade items but not so much to make it annoying. I feel it has just the right amount of grind depending on what you wanna buy and what you wanna upgrade.
The 'buzz' feature which controls how fast and thus, difficult, the game gets, is a terrific feature and like I said above, well balanced. Essentially, it will progressively get harder as the game moves along but then if you ever get in over your head, the buzz rapidly drops which slows things down enough by bringing less people into the restaurant. This allows you to take a breather and get your bearings.
Excellent game, almost done with it and can't wait to finish it and move on to the sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996887747', 'num_games_owned': 492, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 647, 'last_played': 1614586069}
review: All my customers keep ordering a plain cheese pizza. It reminds me of my first husband, Raoul, who liked his food to be as dry and as bland as he was. He bought me the this game and told me it'd make me a better cook, ironically while eating plain tortilla chips from the bowl. On the Fourth of July after I played this, I made us both burgers with bacon, onions, and cheese. He wound up picking off the bacon, cheese, and onions, leaving just one lonely patty on the bread. Now that we're no longer married I spend our anniversary enjoying a nice brown raccuda filet and a glass of Casu Marzu wine.

review:
As a Melburnian, I find the portrayal of coffee in this game offensive.

[b]Vastly[/b] easier to play on keyboard than controller, because the key bindings (mostly) match the first letters of ingredients.  Subtly different mechanics for each recipe add to the challenge.

The buy/assign recipe screen could do with better filter/sort options.  Also the green/red attributes of each recipe should have different shapes (outlines/silhouettes) for easier recognition.  (Apple's Human Interface Guidelines used to recommend this; [url=https://developer.apple.com/design/human-interface-guidelines/macos/icons-and-images/app-icon/]macOS 11[/url] appears to have gone insane.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198030593806', 'num_games_owned': 618, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3784, 'last_played': 1605718652}
review:
[h1]Rating:4/10[/h1]
100% difficulty rating: 4/10
SUMMARY: In this game, you play the role of a chef that has to prepare dishes as fast as possible before customers loose patience.
[b]This game is quite a lot of fun, but it can be grindy and / or annoying at times. It's completely overshadowed by CSD 2 and 3 (Cook Serve Delicious 2 and 3). They have a lot more content, and while CSD 1 has some fun ideas in the endgame, it's not really worth it compared to the other games. [/b]
Food and upgrades can be really slow to earn, especially if you're aiming for every achievement (It took me 60 hours to earn everything). Some recipes are also very confusing and hard to navigate (I'm mainly thinking about the upgraded banana foster. I still don't know how to make it, and the tutorial was no help.) It's also a lot less challenging than 2, at least.
[b]If you're a fan of 2 and 3 and need another entry to play, I would advise you to get it, but you should not get this game first. If you're interested by this game, go buy one of the other two games![/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198380592896', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1622342917}
review: Fun challenging cooking game

author: {'steamid': '76561199025350827', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 3474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1265, 'last_played': 1653431440}
review:
After playing around in CSD 1 and 2, I stand by my point that CSD1 is the best CSD that ever been made.

Pros:
+ Simple cooking themed game, yet so addictive.
+ The variety of foods will make you learn, and it's so satisfying when you can serve it perfectly as time goes by.
+ The amount of freedom to manage your own menus from day to day is so satisfying.

Cons:
- After playing for hours and hours you gonna wish there are a lot more new menus.

This game truly encapsulates the beauty and the fun of being simple.
It successfully apply the term "easy to learn, hard to master" into a video game.
This game knows how to apply a constant pressure and stress to you, but the great thing is all of that are manageable and it feels very rewarding, something that in my opinion CSD2 fails to deliver.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122477946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1663169948}

author: {'steamid': '76561198074838295', 'num_games_owned': 1071, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1610656294}
review:
The best typing/cooking chef simulator series; hat's off to the creative mind(s) who decided to make this a thing! 

Pro tip: Grab yourself some snacks for the time between days :D

author: {'steamid': '76561199024566783', 'num_games_owned': 118, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1673972982}
review:
CSD还是相对适合循序渐进一点，从第一作开始打起，能更好适应一点游戏的机制，而且也能提升对游戏的兴趣吧（纯个人感受）
在即时经营类游戏里，感觉CSD做得还是比较好的。之前也玩过美女餐厅系列、艾米丽的餐厅系列，Cooking Fever，这些游戏虽然说场景很丰富，但是个人感觉关卡相对冗长了一点，但是对于CSD来说这块问题更少一点，感觉机制上更难，且更有节奏感，对玩家而言粘着性更强一点（但是造成的后果就是入门门槛太高了，，，）。

author: {'steamid': '76561198111658235', 'num_games_owned': 37, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8027, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3648, 'last_played': 1709606961}
review: Easy to play and get into / stay invested in. Yes it can be crazy and get out of hand but it follows a logic of if it takes longer do it first. Which is similar to what chefs in a real life kitchen experience and go through. the things in the game that you can buy with the in game cash that you earn make life in the game easier and other chefs challenge you and there are tickets allowing you to bet on yourself a perfect day orders correct etc. nothing better than making a perfect order and then the costumer takes a picture of it which you can like in the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969062133', 'num_games_owned': 2104, 'num_reviews': 1248, 'playtime_forever': 1838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1838, 'last_played': 1605904392}
review: A timing and speed typing game where you manage incoming orders in a restaurant, and fulfill them by doing specific sequences of keystrokes based on the recipe ordered. At first it seems overwhelming, but eventually muscle memory starts to take over and you're slamming out lasagnas faster than you thought possible. I first played this game when I was recovering from surgery a few years back but never managed to beat it, but I finally circled back and while I feel it overstays its welcome a little bit (ending the game after you get a five star restaurant would have been just fine with me) it's a lot of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143525659', 'num_games_owned': 258, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 772, 'last_played': 1640812661}
review:
Quando adquiri esse jogo, estava esperando por uma experiência de culinária simples, mas acabei me deparando com algo incrivelmente desafiador. Imagine só: você é responsável por cada tarefa de um restaurante, desde anotar os pedidos, cozinhar, servir, lavar pratos, esvaziar o lixo, até enfrentar problemas como ratos e ladrões, além de tirar fotos com os clientes e até mesmo sair para encontros. Tudo isso acontece sob a constante pressão dos horários de pico, com um inspetor rigoroso observando cada ação. 
Apesar da comida deliciosa que é apresentada no jogo, você inevitavelmente começa a sentir frustração em relação aos clientes que fazem pedidos, pois, enquanto você se esforça para preparar um prato apetitoso, acaba perdendo ou queimando todos os outros pedidos. 
Mas, tirando todo o estresse, o jogo se torna altamente envolvente. Você irá desistir, mas em um certo momento voltará para tentar novamente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028323571', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 4977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1608997539}
review:
내가 요리사가 되어 손님이 요구하는 음식을 만들어 주는 게임입니다 이 게임은 손님이 주문할때 대화상자를 보여주는데 그거 보고 순서대로 재료 넣어서 요리해서 주면 되기에 간단하고 쉽습니다 이 게임의 목표는 별 5개의 레스토랑을 만드는 것 입니다 처음 시작할때는 손님이 별로 없어서 느긋합니다 하지만 별 1개 이상 부터 손님이 조금씩 많아지며 많이 바빠지기 시작합니다

러시아워라고 사람이 붐비는 시간(이 게임 시간 상 12시와 6시)에 손님들 음식 만들어주는 것도 바쁜데 설거지에 쥐도 잡아야되고 쓰레기도 비워야되고 화장실도 가야되고..정말 전국구 유명 맛집 사장님의 고증을 이 게임이 잘살렸네요 이렇게 바쁜데 막 이거 넣어달라 저거 넣어달라 요구하는 진상손님도 볼수있고 몇 번씩 매니저가 와서 매장 감시도 합니다 러시때 여러분의 손이 얼마나 빠른지 테스트 할 수 있습니다 특히 햄버거 음료수 피자 라자냐 샐러드 같이 손님들의 요구가 많고 재료가 많이 들어가는 음식에 말이죠 손이 고자면 놓치기 쉽상입니다..! 음식 업글해줌에 따라 돈은 좀 더 받지만 요구하는 재료가 더 많아져서 복잡하네요;; 

이 게임에서 가장 인상적이였던건 음..화장실 볼일보고 또 쥐 잡고 쓰레기 버린후에 손 씻느거랄까요 그 만큼 위생관리에 신경 쓴다는 것을 잘 보여주네요

이 게임 정말 도전감이 생기고 중독성이 강하네요 한번 시작하니 몇시간째 하고 있는지 모르겠습니다..ㅋㅋ  정말 할꺼없을때 하면 시간 가는줄 모르고 하게 되고 좋습니다 고로 추천!  

p.s)러시때 모든 재료 넣어달라는 새끼 진짜 죽이고 싶네..

author: {'steamid': '76561198193239015', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2134, 'last_played': 1669274477}
review: For being the first of it's series, I'd say that CSD was pretty good. Although some tasks seemed impossible, it was alright after some practice and memorizing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198975340191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1607267657}
review: Algo precisa ficar claro antes de comprar o jogo: NÃO é pra todos. Se você assim como eu teve a impressão de ser um jogo simples de cozinhar, e de certa forma ter a sensação de possuir um restaurante, você está enganado. Não há sensação de cozinhar nem um prato, o jogador só fica clicando de forma rápida e decorada, ou digitando caso for mais ''avançado'', você não bota os ingredientes, só clica de forma absolutamente DECORADA e sem emoção pra eles irem direto no prato. Os gráficos são super aceitáveis pra um jogo de 5 reais (muitos jogos em flash grátis tem gráficos iguais/superiores) enfim, eu só vejo gostando desse jogo quem gosta de jogos estilo piano tiles, onde você tem que ter ótimos reflexos e velocidade. Não compre se o seu desejo é um jogo de cozinhar/gerenciar um restaurante!

author: {'steamid': '76561198450546330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1607173200}
review:
Too slow and easy. I tried to make it past the first twenty days because maybe it's more challenging and fun later but I get too bored and it's a slog.

I bought this as a bundle with the sequels, the others are more enjoyable. Skip this unless you're really a completionist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089878656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1556, 'last_played': 1602975588}
review:
[b][RESEÑA SIN SPOILERS][/b]

Nota: el juego está completamente en inglés. 

[h1]APARTADO TÉCNICO[/h1]
El juego tiene unos controles muy sencillos, y te permite usar el teclado, el ratón, el mando o todos a la vez, depende de tu estilo de juego y comodidad a la hora de preparar los platos.

Respecto a los gráficos no es que sea un dibujo que te haga suspirar cada vez que entras en el juego, pero cumple su función y no se hace molesto al no ser un estilo muy particular y raro, es bastante estándar de por sí.

La banda sonora no es muy variada y personalmente no me ha causado ninguna impresión, pero al fin y al cabo es un juego que es pequeño y no pretende ser complejo en cuanto a banda sonora o de controles, ni gráficamente impresionante. No se hace molesta la música, pero si te llega a molestar puedes silenciar en las opciones y todos felices.

La interfaz también es muy sencilla, de primeras puede parecer que hay mucha cosa pero te acostumbras enseguida y además incluye un tutorial en general (al empezar el juego) y más adelante un mini-tutorial para cada plato que hay.

[h1]TRAMA[/h1]
No tiene trama más allá de ir mejorando tu restaurante y tus platos. Recibes correos electrónicos que dan vidilla al juego, como datos extras e incluso graciosos. Hay una especie de ''subtrama'' que incluye posibles ''romances'' con personas que irán a tu restaurante con antojo de un plato es específico. También hay clientes VIP y eventos especiales que pueden alargar un poco más la vida del juego, y algunos son necesarios para alcanzar el máximo nivel y tienen su pequeña ''historia''.

[h1]DIFICULTAD[/h1]
Es un juego bastante estresante y rápido, pero si eres una persona que trabaja bien bajo estrés y además lo disfruta probablemente te enganche durante bastantes horas, ya que el juego da sensación de recompensa una vez vas avanzando y adaptándote a sus mecánicas. Más allá del estrés que estás dispuesto a soportar en un juego no hay nada más en cuanto a dificultad. Personalmente pondría dificultad media, pero depende mucho de la complejidad de los platos que tengas en el menú.

[h1]CONCLUSIÓN[/h1]
Lo recomiendo únicamente si buscas un juego rápido y sin muchas (o nulas) mecánicas de gestión, ya que está más enfocado en preparar platos y ser lo más veloz posible que a gestionar y montar poco a poco tu propio imperio con inversiones complejas y de riesgo. Si estás buscando un juego de gestión de restaurante más serio no va a cumplir tus expectativas. Personalmente me ha entretenido algunas horas y me han dado ganas de jugar hasta conseguir todos los platos al máximo y las estrellas platino para el restaurante. En ese aspecto es muy satisfactorio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262398856', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1602874831}
review: Cooking game, but with a twist. I've played my fair share of cooking games, but the way this is handled is so unique. Each customer orders a food that's on your menu, and you have to prepare the meal accordingly. There are several different ways to prepare each food depending on how many times you've upgraded said food. You also have chores mixed in as well. The amount of customers you can serve at a time expands with each of your restaurant expansions. The strategy doesn't end there. The types of food you choose to serve on your menu before the day starts also plays a big part in how much positive or negative buzz you make. If you serve too many fatty foods or too much liquor you'll create bad buzz. If you serve healthy foods you'll create positive buzz.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113405125', 'num_games_owned': 1039, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 1341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1341, 'last_played': 1599399323}
review:
Me ha gustado bastante, he jugado principalmente el modo carrera.

Pros:
- Super Adictivo.
- Bastante variado gracias a los diferentes platos. upgrades, y eventos.
- La manera de cocinar cada plato es diferente y hace que cada día sea desafiante.
- Dificultad ajustada.
- Te obliga a buscar combinaciones con los diferentes platos para conseguir el objetivo que te propongas ese día.

Contras: 
- Artisticamente es un juego de movil.
- Los menús para desbloquear comida, upgrades, etc son un poco caóticos, y tampoco puedes saber el precio de cada plato en el apartado de menu.
- No hay casi gestión de restaurante.
- Al principio se ha de farmear bastante para conseguir mejoras y nuevos platos.

Truco: cuando tengáis que abrir una botella de vino, clicad en el simbolo que aparece en pantalla para descorchar y a la vez presionad el boton en el teclado (abajo) para hacerlo mucho más rápido.

8

author: {'steamid': '76561198031280421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 4676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4676, 'last_played': 1480242329}
review:
[b]tl;dr[/b]
Fast paced game where you take orders, cook and serve delicious meals. Decide between controller or keyboard controls.
Achievements have to be earned by hard work, but all are doable.

[b]Story[/b]
You want to be the best cook. Therefore you prepare yourself and you prepare food, drinks and desserts for your customers.

[b]Gameplay[/b]
You have a well made tutorial that lets you try the different food before you put it on your actual menu.
I have played this game with keyboard only because I prefer it that way. Keyboard controls are implemented greatly. I was told controller input also works pretty well.
This game is more than only preparing food: You can actively get new recipes and put them on your menu. Different menus influcence your buzz which influences the amount of customers. You can also influence if you have more breakfast-related stuff or dinner.
There is a lot to do and it is great fun.

[b]Looks[/b]
The food looks tasty. That’s the most important thing here. Jokes aside, the game looks pretty good and might make you hungry while playing.

[b]Achievements[/b]
Some achievements require practice and maybe hard work, but all of them are doable. If you like this kind of games, you will be able to unlock them all.

[b]Pros[/b]
[list][*]food looks very appealing
[*]convenient controls
[*]being able to change the menu is great
[*]influencing buzz by the menu’s composition is great
[*]the different game modes are a good idea
[/list]

[b]Cons[/b]
[list][*]might get you hungry because of the appealing food you serve
[*]sometimes a bit stressy, but that the acutal point of some levels, so no real downside
[/list]

[b] Conclusion [/b]
Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a tasty game which may provide many hours of fun. If you’re into taking orders, preparing and serving food and have no problem with time pressure, this might be the perfect game for you.
The tutorial is really good and you can try every food as practice before you take it in your actual menu. You can influence your buzz (which determines how many customers will arrive) so you have fewer customers at the beginning to give you some more time and less pressure – if you want it that way.
The achievements are doable. Some of them require (of course) some practice and dedication because running a kitchen is not a piece of cake.

author: {'steamid': '76561198232440356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1599305832}
review: I guess it's an ok game for its genre but not really my thing. I thought it looked like more fun, but it kind of got repetitive and quickly became more of an odd mix of boring and stressful than fun. (Which I guess if you want a sim for throwing out meals at peak hour would be the case.) You spend the day serving meals which often have little differences and do chores on timers as they pop up which involves mashing the right keys as quickly as possible. Got stuck doing the dishes, or mess up an order and people get grumpy and you lose buzz I guess. Because you need to build up your place in star ratings as well as money reserves, it means serving the same stuff you have access to over and over. If you're really into these sorts of sims you might like this one, but for casual players without a special interest in the genre I think it's less likely to appeal for long.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041991868', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 4156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3288, 'last_played': 1707742751}
review:
Simple mechanics, fast paced gameplay usually with a decent difficulty curve. I would've liked more items to serve, but I think keeping it simple to only a few dishes helped the game a bit more in the long run over its two sequels. I'd rather be wanting more than feeling like there's way too many similar recipes (Something 2 struggles with).

Fun, will keep you entertained for a few hours. Take a look sometime, if the idea of memorizing a bunch of quick paced button combos with a food theme sounds like your kind of thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164831891', 'num_games_owned': 792, 'num_reviews': 779, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1573679426}
review: Bom jogo. Como muitos jogos de gerenciamento, esse busca transformar a lanchonete simples em um restaurante famoso. O ritmo do jogo é frenético e bem cansativo. De qualquer forma, acredito que é melhor jogar logo as versões mais recentes desse game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042227702', 'num_games_owned': 685, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1970, 'last_played': 1599982962}
review: Puts you under pressure to read and enter made up recipes quickly and is just a fun muscle memory game. I won't describe the art style as exceptionally good but overall it's kinda cute. Music is fitting but nothing to write home about. Beyond the basic gameplay loop of actually cooking it also has a decent amount of charm between working hours where you read emails, make cooking bets and choose what foods to put on the menu for the next shift. Generally just a nice game to come back to sometimes since running a day of service is only about 10 minutes

author: {'steamid': '76561198036654987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1597969728}
review:
Decepcionante.
Me dejé llevar por las reseñas más positivas para este juego original, que en el de sus secuelas; craso error. Este es un juego MUY INFERIOR a sus secuelas.
Se trata de un juego de preparar comidas; como ésos de los que hay docenas para móviles. Las ordenes de los comensales llegan y uno tiene que prepararlas con los ingredientes correctos. Los gráficos y el sonido son mediocres, se ven mejores en algunos títulos de móvil.
También, la descripción me pareció engañosa. Parece insinuar que hay algo de estrategia en el juego, cuando en realidad no; también da a entender que hay cientos de recetas para preparar, pero son recetas del mismo platillo! En total no son más de 30 platillos para escoger.
Este juego no ofrece nada nuevo o que valga la pena respecto a los cientos de opciones que hay para móviles.
Si nunca has jugado un juego de este tipo, tal vez te llame la atención; de lo contrario, mejor quédate con los juegos gratuitos de móvil.

review:
Otro de los juegos en los que no iria ni pulgar abajo ni arriba.

Manejas un restaurante en primera persona, esta lindo el tema de la grafica, Sonidos, ambientacion, controles.

Vas mejorando los platos que ofreces y tu infraestructura pero es terriblemente grindeador y repetitivo.

4-7 horas de duracion, pocos requisitos y relativamente barato, tambien tiene cromos (aspectos positivos)

5.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198011517439', 'num_games_owned': 1780, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1651, 'last_played': 1596994016}
review: Good time management/typing game. You start off slowly and then as you grow you get access to more foods and more recipes. Some of the foods are really annoying, but the good thing is that you can pick which ones you like best and ignore the ones that you hate. This may come at a cost of serving lower income foods, but it lets you set the difficulty level appropriately to where you want it to be. I didn't bother with most of the foods, except in the required and sometimes frustrating extra events that will have you doing a wide variety. Menu rot requires you to do at least some cycling of foods, but overall I stuck with about the same 10 foods and was satisfied with that, though it does eventually get repetitive. Could use an undo/trash button and a description of what I did wrong because often I would mess up apparently and not know why.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074582015', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1602269079}
review: Esto es una joya, esto es droga pura, si sos adicto a hacer mil cosas a la vez papu, esto es lo tuyo, si en el combo metes recetas, indie, casual, cocina, levelear, desafios, poner a prueba tu memoria, objetivos y unos clientes con cara de ojete, no falla por ningun lado. Se lo compré a mis pibes en el celu a mi en el celu a mi jermu en el celu en todos lados quiero tener este juego disponible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096145395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 3084, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2152, 'last_played': 1597000144}
review: Great cooking game that definitely isn't for everyone. It's a fast paced management game that is simple to learn but difficult to master once you unlock all of the recipes and upgrades. The game can feel like a grind-fest at times but it's overall a good casual game that you can dabble in every now and then to kill some time and grow your restaurant/career. It's also nice to have achievements that appear to actually be obtainable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198312468790', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1235, 'last_played': 1594453669}
review:
Honestly I had seen this game advertised/discounted/on the top lists so many times. The graphics didn't appeal to me, the gameplay (from watching videos) looked boring. However I couldn't ignore the GLOWING reviews and the cult status, and with the recent release of CSD3 I thought I could try the series as CSD was discounted. 

Oh my goodness I was hooked within 10 minutes. The pace, difficulty, cooking theme, upgrades and "loose story" had me hooked. I don't have as much time to play videogames as I'd like anymore, however I quickly racked up over 20 hours on this game. I have completed it and can't wait to move onto CSD2. 

I even gifted my sister the game I loved it so much!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014979726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 830, 'last_played': 1594763158}
review: I don't remember how or why I got this game, but I gave it a whirl and now I'm addicted.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971620653', 'num_games_owned': 373, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1599833560}
review: Fun casual game that's primarily a test of typing skills/multitasking as you build buzz for your run-down restaurant and cater to dudes in ratty tanktops and day drinkers, wash dishes, catch robbers, and flush the toilet 100x.  The tone is surprisingly lighthearted for what can turn into a right pressure-cooker, particularly during rush hour.  As you upgrade your tools and recipes, you can serve more customers and get access to more lucrative menu items.  Both the management and service aspects are well-handled.  Not realistic enough to be a simulator, per se, but does what it promises, and very well indeed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198414187094', 'num_games_owned': 555, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1594038985}
review:
It's probably not the smartest idea for me to purchase this game with a broken wrist after a car accident. Nevertheless, I still really enjoying the game. Even that I had to do all the keyboard smashing with my broken left hand.

The game's core idea is simple but engaging.
Everyone would be able to figure out what the game really is in the first glance of the tutorial.
The gameplay is easy to manage, but the vibe and tension during the gameplay (and music) keep the players really excited and focus.
The upgrades and achievements/challenges will motive the players to keep playing. 
Overall, this is an interesting, fun game which makes the players on the edge of their chair and accomplishing at the same time.

It is also probably a good game for people who want to practice typing speed. lol

P.S The BGM is really well-used as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057911876', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1594201139}
review:
It's good, but I think it has significant flaws like extremely slow progression and repetitive gameplay. It takes a long time to progress your equipment and foods which means you have to rely on the same foods over and over again which is boring. I recommend it when it's on sale, but not for full price.

Oh and whoever made the washing up mechanic in this game is a horrible person.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128032228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3135, 'last_played': 1591981907}

author: {'steamid': '76561198210414700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1656315311}
review:
I work in a restaurant at the moment. I thought this game looked as stressful as my actual job during rush hour, but what could go wrong? So I bought it. Well, it turns out this game is one of the most stressful and fun games I've played. If you're looking for something that is a quick game to kill time without having to go into a gaming session, this game is for you.

The major pros is that it's kind of like Cooking Dash if you played it when you were younger. You don't move around the kitchen, but you pick up tickets to make the food and then, well, you cook and serve it. Tickets have a time limit and in between tickets you have to take care of the dining room and back of house. Challenges include having to change up the menu every couple of days to make sure that things don't get boring. Rush hour is when things get stressful, but the rewarding feeling of getting through it is oh so worth it. 

The only con I have is that it really is quite a challenge to memorize the different keys to use to make the food. The other option you have is to use the mouse, but the keyboard is the way to go for speeeeeed. The game is a pretty accurate representation of a line cook's life on the line. So much so I would call it "line cook simulator". Overall, pleasantly surprised at how much I enjoy this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198123322860', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1611391441}

author: {'steamid': '76561198064217762', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 1682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1305, 'last_played': 1609368233}
review: This is a fun cooking game which can be quite fast-paced depending on the number of customers that come into your restaurant. You have a limited time to serve each customer and if you serve all the orders correctly you get a bonus amount of money at the end of the day. Money helps you to upgrade equipment and dishes as well as helps you buy tickets to unlock events. And completing each event levels up your restaurant. If you have a good memory then it is easy to remember the keyboard's bindings associated with each ingredient for each dish. 7/10

review:
Not exactly a hardcore cooking sim, but incredibly fun and a great restaurant management game to boot.

CSD is a time attack typing game - all the cooking gameplay revolves around the typing element. As far as mapping cuisine to the typing process, it does a good enough job. This game is also extremely addictive!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018812372', 'num_games_owned': 426, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1591312782}
review:
I'm gonna be completely honest: do not bother with CSD!!, but instead go straight for CSD!! 2. It was hard for me to gauge and I feel bad about reviewing it as such, because the presentation is mostly fine, but CSD!! ultimately bored me too much to even continue. What CSD!! 2 fixes is: all of the ingredients are in [b]required sequence[/b] instead of allowing you to, as you can in CSD, unrealistically pour soda first and then ice (for example). CSD!! 2 also has [b]holding stations[/b] for excess/leftover batches of food to dole out to customers, which you can even prepare in advance, so it has far more layers of complexity matching actual restaurant work.

[b]TL;DR:[/b] CSD!! feels brainless/very low-level, even at its peak, compared to its successor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018342997', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3073, 'last_played': 1591084371}
review:
A couple of months ago, I bought a mechanical keyboard for $150 and a coworker was surprised when I told him. He asked why I wouldn’t get an office keyboard for a tenth of the price. Clearly he’s never beaten Cook, Serve, Delicious! on extreme difficulty or else he would know.

For each tug at a wine’s cork, each pounding of a tenderizer onto a chicken breast, each ingredient added to a salad bowl, there is visceral feedback, both audio and touch. The superb audio feedback is due to the crisp sound design of the video game. But the touch feedback is from the strokes of the keyboard; it’s external. To experience Cook, Serve, Delicious! at it’s fullest, a mechanical keyboard is highly recommended. Because it’s not so much a cooking simulation as it is a stenographer at a courtroom for zoo animals simulation.

The core gameplay loop is simple, but the pursuit of translating of orders into keystrokes without any mistakes, a perfect day, is what makes Cook, Serve, Delicious! challenging and fun.

Ultimately, the game is a couple steps above restaurant sims that could be found on Miniclip. And although there is a clear skill gap between a good and bad cooker, server, and delicious-er, many will find getting good at this game isn’t worth it. They might assess that there’s not enough meat on the bone to sink more than 10 hours into it. It was for me though.

4/7 - Average to Above Average

author: {'steamid': '76561198188664927', 'num_games_owned': 1601, 'num_reviews': 385, 'playtime_forever': 1501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1470, 'last_played': 1606601930}
review:
https://youtu.be/_hZJU5ybchw
[quote]Follow my Curator page, [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41363546-Fruit-N-Doggie-Reviews/]Fruit N Doggie Reviews,[/url] so you can be updated whenever I post a new review.[/quote]
[h1]Overall Rating - High Quality ★★★★☆[/h1]

[h1]First Impressions[/h1]
I saw Cook Serve Delicious (CSD) on the cheap, and though it didn't look too thrilling, seemed to be received very well, so there was little harm in getting it. More than a few people released footage of the first several minutes of the game on YouTube, as it somehow gained a surge of popularity for a while. I haven't seen the sequels being uploaded on YouTube as much, but both of them have great reviews as well. How does the original hold up in comparison; has it grown moldy in the back of the fridge, long forgotten, or is it still delicious?


[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
There are two main parts to CSD, with the first being management. As head chef, and owner of the restaurant, it's up to you to decide which dishes you're going to serve. These options have to be purchased, which you'll do as you turn a profit, receive good reviews, develop a solid reputation, and open up new possibilities. You'll have to consider the favorability of a dish, maximize your profitability, and set up food service that you'll be able to keep up with. Some combinations can be harder to work with, as dishes will become more complicated, and take longer to produce than your starting options, especially as you upgrade them. The second component is when you open the restaurant, and keep up with all the responsibilities involved; taking orders, prepping food, doing dishes, and even cleaning toilets. Fast, accurate service is the key to highly satisfied customers. It makes for hectic gameplay, but it's quite addictive.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2115228391
[h1]Controls[/h1]
Having played this release with the keyboard, it's what I'm used to, and I think it works quite well, as long as you can remember all of the inputs from one dish to another. The way this game handles things, there's no universal controls. You won't use something like "C" to chop all the veggies you'd use, from soup, to a stir fry. Instead, each one has a distinct focus. For instance, when baking potatoes, you wait for them to be cooked, pick it up once it's ready, and throw on the toppings the customer asked for. When prepping a steak, you season it according to the order, send it to the grill, and serve them all after a certain time passes. There's no concern over doneness, such as rare or medium rare. It takes time to learn, but they all have their own logic to them. Once you get the hang of it, it's much easier to work with than it first appears. Undoubtedly though, some are more of a pain than others, such as making soup.


[h1]Story[/h1]
CSD follows the perspective of an aspiring restaurateur and chef, who works their way up to the higher levels of cuisine and sophistication, as you'd expect for a cooking game. The story is presented through email messages you receive, which seems sufficient enough to be professional and reasonable. It doesn't actually show a character or avatar going through this experience though, so it can feel kind of flat.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2118361986
[h1]Visuals[/h1]
The presentation in CSD is on the simple side, with hand-drawn images making up the backgrounds, customers, and food items. They all have a consistent aesthetic, which gives a sense of cohesion that other games don't always have. There's not much animation, or movement in the game, aside from basic "sliding," such as when the knife moves up and down to chop vegetables, or ice is dispensed for a soft drink. However, it gets the point across, and you'll often be too busy and frantic to pay close attention, "Huh, that chopping animation looks kind of weird. Oh crap, we just got hit with a rush, and I have five more soups to prepare! Move it, move it, move it!"


[h1]Sound Design[/h1]
Preparing various dishes leads to different sound effects appropriate to the task at hand. Frying chicken causes grease spatters, meat sizzles on the grill-top, etc. There's a lot more songs than I'd have guessed for this game, having looked up the soundtrack. CSD covers a few styles of music such as jazz and salsa, but they all have a strong instrumental basis, and I find it helps set a calm mood as you play. If things got any more frantic, I don't think my heart could take it.


[h1]Pros[/h1]
🌟 Though dishes do get more advanced, none become too complex or perplexing to recreate. All are done with simple commands, like tapping a button three times per ingredient. Also, though you will need to time certain foods precisely, they always have a clear cue when it's ready. Thankfully, there's no fiddly bits involved, such as slicing the pizza after it's made. 
🌟 When you get into the flow and rhythm of the game, it can feel satisfying keeping up with all the chaos. However, it can also get overwhelming, as there's a fine line between fast-paced, and a frenzy.
🌟 The controls and mechanics are well conceived, as though I hadn't played for about three years, I was able to pick the game up again relatively fast.


[h1]Cons[/h1]
❌ I find having to reorganize the menu and select what dishes to make tedious. It'd be fine if I could prepare anything I wanted without consequence, but if I want to maximize my progress, I have to serve what makes people happy. This is somewhat realistic, but draws too close to business management, and the feeling of work, to be enjoyable.
❌ Climbing all the way to the top is fairly demanding, so though it's a somewhat laid-back game, it's not an easy one to finish casually, as it requires forethought and effort. Completing it all, achievements included, will take 20+ hours.


[h1]Tips[/h1]
🔍 Some mistakes you make can be salvaged, so the dish won't receive a bad service rating, but others can't. For instance, if you start opening the wrong wine bottle, there's nothing you can do to fix it, but adding only one wrong ingredient to fried rice can still receive an average rating.
🔍 Rote memory becomes your best friend in this game. It's worthwhile to learn a few staple dishes, like soup and salad, so you can churn them out consistently and comfortably.


[h1]Final Thoughts[/h1]
CSD isn't a laid-back, chill title. It's fast-paced, demanding nature is more strenuous than a relaxing game would be like. However, that doesn't mean it's stressful, or isn't fun. In fact, it can be downright addictive, though how long you invest into the restaurant may relate to how many of the complicated dishes you can master. Considering how I still haven't played either sequel, as there's two other games from this series, this one could be worth skipping in favor of those releases. I think the best course of action would be to start out with this game, since it's the cheapest one. In theory it might only improve from here, and it's much easier to continue with a series as they get more fun, instead of the other way around. Despite not finishing everything yet, I've still had a good time playing this game, and recommend trying it out.

review:
Seems like just another cooking game until you play it. The game mechanics, graphics, sounds, everything about this game has me hooked. It reminds me of a rhythm game in that once you memorize the recipes for each dish, you can get that flow. Sometimes you crush 7 orders in a row and don't know how you did it.
I wasn't sure about this game, but when it went on sale I snatched it up. What a blast. I played for hours on my first try. So glad I have CSD2 and 3 to play when I beat this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198178988351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1687916185}
review:
El concepto del juego es sencillo: levantar tu propio emprendimiento gastronómico desde cero, escogiendo y mejorando tu menú y equipamiento en el proceso y, por supuesto, atendiendo las órdenes de los clientes. 

Al principio parece fácil, pero a medida que se avanza, la dificultad aumenta, despachando órdenes tan rápido a tal punto que es lo más cercano a la experiencia real de trabajar en un bar/restaurante. Cada plato tiene su método de preparación y combinación de ingredientes (cada cual asignado a una tecla). Hay que ser rápido, pero por sobre todas las cosas, preciso.

Es muy adictivo, y en cuanto a lo técnico anda 10 puntos, 0 bugs encontrados hasta ahora. 
Muy recomendable si buscan un juego casual para divertirse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198269545052', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3438, 'last_played': 1584817305}
review: 我刚刚打开商店页面想要写测评，听见那个rash hour的bgm，手脚蜷缩，我恐怕应该用这个做起床铃。好。csd第一代是挺有趣的，就是开自己的饭店，选择自己的菜单，升级自己设备等等，花样不是很多，但是有一个很明确的目标就是我要五星我要五星我要五星。第二代最近在玩，说实话少了很多方向性，少了很多目标，所有的食物你不用购买就可以玩到，感觉变成了就是一个为了收集金牌的游戏了。我玩第二代的时候，从来就没有了第一代为了攒点钱，为了突破什么条件，去实现什么的感觉了。所以我觉得，可以从第一代玩起，且个人感觉第一代比二代难。

author: {'steamid': '76561198417059108', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1693442450}

author: {'steamid': '76561198005957960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1780, 'last_played': 1535120230}
review: This is the beginning of the best games series ever. If you love games that put you into a zen state of wanting to master each keystroke then this game is for you. It is sort of like a typing game. I personally use the keyboard. Some of the bindings take a little time to remember but they are fair and really that is part of the gameplay. The sound effects and music really keep you zoned in. The challenge level is fair with a balanced difficulty curve. It can be picked up and played or binged out on quite easily. Whenever I am done playing I know it wont by long before I come back for more. There are also restaurant management aspects that you can do when you need a little break. It is worth every penny and will probably make you want to try the games that came out after it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970529265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1393, 'last_played': 1590064491}
review: Seeing that Cook, Serve, Delicious 3 was on verge of début, I came back to revisit CSD 1 after several years absence.  It's a delightful game.  Far the most exciting and fun typing game (except maybe CSD 2 and 3[?]); far more engaging than Mavis Beacon Teaches Typing.  I can't imagine playing game with controller opposed to keyboard.  Best played drinking beer, plate of soft pretzels nearby.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009841821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 6084, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3948, 'last_played': 1684519383}
review: Very fun and addictive! Highly recommend playing with a controller, not a keyboard/mouse. (My number of hours played is inaccurate because I accidentally left it running overnight,) It got more challenging as it went along but never felt unfair. I like how you can control the amount of challenge by choosing which foods to include on the menu, and by influencing your amount of buzz (and therefore number/frequency of customers). I also like that there's a way to practice tasks outside of a regular workday. Different foods have different kinds of challenges (picking the right ingredients, or cooking for the right length of time, or placing ingredients in the right order, even tapping really fast to uncork a bottle). Some of the foods are required for certain challenges. If you're not able to tap quickly, the wine is the only food that requires that, and maybe you can use a controller with a turbo button to handle that task. Anyway, I enjoyed this game very much, it's fast paced and fun, and the days are relatively short so I found it perfect for break times throughout my day :)

review:
J'ai acheté ce jeu pour ma copine (car elle aime les thèmes liés à la cuisine et aux restaurants). Au final, J’y joue à sa place -_-«.
 Ce jeu a l’allure d’un jeu flash à 5 centimes, mais ne vous y fiez pas : le gameplay est vraiment addictif et offre une bonne marge de progression. Un jeu au gameplay très travaillé qui m’offre bien plus de sensations de jeu que la plupart des jeux AAA ! 
Ha oui une dernière chose, les sensations au clavier sont naz ! Vous devez jouer au pad !

Pour décrire COOK, SERVE, DELICIOUS!, je dirais que c’est un mixe entre guitar hero et Cooking Dash

author: {'steamid': '76561197998885255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1020, 'last_played': 1589471125}
review:
Came back to this game after long time. Got touch typing mastered but the game is still not very enjoyable when more complex recipes show up. All this because there is no key indication on the order. You have to check the order with the ingredient list loosing precious seconds. I have even thought to get one of the sequels but they have exactly same issue.
I can't understand why such easy thing as highlighting necessary letter on the order itself is not a thing. There are so many easy ways to do in ie.:
1 -  s P r i n k l e s
2 -  ( P )  S p r i n k l e s
3 -  S p r i n k l e s  ( P )
4 -  S [color=red]p[/color] r i n k l e s 
It's really funny how such small thing can ruin a game :/

author: {'steamid': '76561198071760486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2868, 'last_played': 1588610667}
review:
In an era dominated by in-depth management sims and gritty action games, Cook, Serve, Delicious is a light, arcade-like breath of fresh air. Mechanics like changing a menu and purchasing new dishes + equipment provide a light management aspect between stages while the food preparation and chore management create a fun fast-paced restaurant environment without getting too bogged down in any one detail. 

The Battle Mode is also a fun source for some quick one-off challenges that reward you by unlocking additional chefs for free.

Overall, I would recommend this title for some excellent pick-up and play action but it may not be the game to fully realize your restaurant simulation dreams.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968887154', 'num_games_owned': 1205, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1588806920}
review: Frustrating at first, until you get the hang of it, and certain patterns to each recipe. Then the remaining frustration mainly will just come from being overwhelmed when you have so things going on at once. But still, the game carries a certain addictive charm to it that makes you want to keep playing. Overall, pretty fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198815369774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1699552389}
review:
A pretty decent game that can keep you occupied for a good amount of time. Although it gets repetitive, I'd say that the different dishes and their prep styles can keep you engaged.

My only gripe is that the milestones are too far apart which makes it feel even more grindy than it is. I guess 20 days of the restaurant makes sense as a minimum requirement to level it up but as I am the only employee and I have to keep doing the chores, cooking and trying to identify and sketch the burglar, a shorter requirement would have made me feel much better,

Still, a better game than its sequel

author: {'steamid': '76561199022631289', 'num_games_owned': 52, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1680335369}
review:
加进愿望单很久了，昨天早晨起床看到降价到3元，惊坐起，立刻购买。
最近大型模拟/经营类游戏玩得有些疲劳＋头疼，cook,serve,delicious就刚刚好，随时都可以来上一局，游戏时间随自己掌控。时间管理类经营游戏也一直是从小到大的最爱，绝对不会腻。
购买前其实有点怵，看了评论区怕会很难，但真正游玩时发现还是很容易上手的，比起一般的餐厅模拟彻底解放了鼠标，使得双手得到充分的运动！（最近有些鼠标手的样子玩别的游戏以及滑手机都真的手疼
刚开始游玩时不知怎么误关了音乐只留了音效，使我误以为这个游戏没有BGM，然后就自己拿音乐软件放音乐来配，感觉也不错噢ｗ

author: {'steamid': '76561198044513744', 'num_games_owned': 441, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1320, 'last_played': 1587962216}
review: You slap the keyboard in combinations following a recipe to make food and deliver orders. Very intense and challenging, at times stressful but rewarding nonetheless. Provides accomplishment and progression as you unlock new and trickier menu items that are also available to upgrade to increase prices, varieties and combinations. Over time you build muscle memory over different food items without having to look at the recipe and somewhat improves your typing skill and accuracy. There are management aspects to the game as well, selecting which food items goes into the day's menu and you can and should change it up everyday. This game is great and I would consider it to be my favourites. Can't wait to play the sequel.

review:
1. 收到投资研发邮件直接买下那个东西
2. 不要为了挣几百块钱参与难到爆炸的betting，有时间重复开始不如多开几天张
3. [strike] 手活好当我没说 [/strike]
4. 食物升星先升简单且钱多的，小龙虾我i了
5. 在你的订单上还有一堆东西的时候给你发暧昧短信的约会对象，你会恨不得杀了他
6. 要求订单上有soup，pizza，pasta，steak的VIP用户请滚出我的餐厅
7. ↑键因为酒按烂了，↓键因为汤按烂了，T键因为鸡胸肉烂了
8. 五星通关之后再也不想考虑Spice是P还是I，Onion是O还是N了
[spoiler] 考托福作文打不够400字的都应该玩这个游戏练练手速 [/spoiler]

review: My ten year old played this game and said it was too hard so i thought, i love cooking games so i will probably love it! No! its too hard for me! Its not user friendly! The controls arent set up well, there is no instruction on how long to leave something down (like when you are frying to tell you when its done), no way to remove something if you added an extra item to a burger. The game isnt forgiving.....It just isnt even easy at the beginning even to learn how to play

author: {'steamid': '76561198047849476', 'num_games_owned': 666, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3005, 'last_played': 1605470859}
review:
So so so so so addicting! I love this game. As you can see, I have put many hours into this game. So worth the cheap price. I just can't wait to get my hands on a copy of the sequel. 
I highly recommend this time-management food game. You basically have to manage your restaurant and then make and serve the food everyday. It is a blast and the more you play, the faster you'll get at making the food and it gets crazy. The local multiplayer mode is fun as well, albeit not perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120829684', 'num_games_owned': 821, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 2491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2436, 'last_played': 1620387300}
review:
Довольно старенькая геймплейная основа, которая доведена до ума с помощью большого кол-ва небольших механик и логических цепей. Есть и цели, и куда расти, и что делать - тоже понятно. Часов за 30 пройти впринципе можно.

Удивительно, что вторая и третья части игры выглядят абсолютно другими и уникальными. Круто когда есть такие разрабы, делающие интересные сиквелы к играм, хоть и к инди-играм

Единственное, что нужно - так это минимальные знания английского, ибо письма, квесты и рецепты переводить придется часто

author: {'steamid': '76561198339012887', 'num_games_owned': 2307, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 1987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 967, 'last_played': 1597547068}
review:
Some of my weeb friends(@Archi) are very into CSD series so I get CSD in the sale and have a try.
Really interesting game with unknown dishes that I've never seen irl. I could read every single word but I still don't know what the recipe exactly is...
The main game is relaxing with impressive BGM especially during the rush hour, however the challenge part is really hard-core. In some events you even need to handle eight inpatient customers at the same time! Maybe it's my slow typing speed that limits my cheevos... 
So far I've unlocked most of the dishes and upgrades, my favorite recipe is the fish even though I don't like to cook fish irl lol.

Hope there could be some Chinese food in the future, especially my beloved Cantonese desserts!


我的一些阿宅朋友（阿奇同学，说的就是你这个超级游戏宅，我知道你看不懂中文）超爱CSD系列，所以当开发者打折的时候，我就迫不及待的入手了系列并开始了烹饪之旅！

游戏目前只有英文版，食谱里充斥着奇奇怪怪的外国料理，每个单词我都认识但是合在一起就看不懂这道菜到底是什么鬼，反正按部就班的操作然后上菜就是了。

通过这个游戏，我认识到了自己的局限性——打字速度太慢了并且盲打技术非常的不okay，但是真正的勇士敢于直面惨淡的人生，不是吗？在日复一日的洗碗中，我成功解锁了大部分食物并升级了餐厅，然而总是卡在该死的挑战环节——同时招待八位客人，我是八爪鱼吗？

总之还是很推荐这款游戏的，适合碎片时间休闲一下，并且可以锻炼打字速度。

期待游戏里以后能出中国食物，尤其是我最爱的广式糖水！

author: {'steamid': '76561198271185864', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 2647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2460, 'last_played': 1587390043}
review:
其实早早就买了1和2，也玩过一段时间的1，但后来可耻滴爬墙玩别的游戏去了……直到前两天发现3都出了，因为想玩3，所以要先把1和2玩到全成就……好吧我觉得自己也是挺拧巴的_(:з」∠)_

个人推荐使用键盘玩，如果有一定的单词基础可能会玩得更顺畅一些。越玩到后面越手忙脚乱，我大概在升到4星前几乎每一局都是完美FULL COMBO，直到我信心满满地把升满星的几个4、5星料理放在了同一天……

反正现在也只能在家办公，作为消磨时光的游戏每天玩上几局还是挺不错的，尤其是坚持下去你会发现自己的反应速度、同时处理多件事的能力会越来越强。（简直是预防老年痴呆的必备游戏23333）

友情提示：深夜最好不要玩，可能会玩到想冲去冰箱翻食材做夜宵。

author: {'steamid': '76561198844681327', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 943, 'last_played': 1583058033}
review: 还挺好玩的，尤其是rush time的紧张感，还有精心选择每日菜单，以保证BUZZ尽可能大，同时产生的垃圾，脏盘子等尽可能少，不然每天做这些日常琐事真的会耽误做菜的。游戏没有官方中文，但是仔细看一会都能明白什么意思。配料的按键基本上都是英文首字母，还挺好记得。

author: {'steamid': '76561198042050010', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 6319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6293, 'last_played': 1684450396}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035826989', 'num_games_owned': 650, 'num_reviews': 190, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1583201502}
review:
Holy hell this game is aggravating. If you enjoy being rushed, having massive headaches and feeling stress. This game is for you.
Very little time to do things. Burgers catching fire while you flush the toilet for the umpteenth time because some fat sack of shit didn't do it while eating the food you made them for the very minimal amount of money they gave you.
You know it costs a restaurant 500 dollars to put chips (Fries) on the menu? I didn't, I don't think that's true.

You can't stop washing the dishes for a second just to pour someones drink.
You have to put away all the trash in one go, you can't just do some of it.
You have to do all of this yourself.
People get upset if they see the same thing on your menu many days in a row... That's not a thing in real life. I've never gone to a restaurant and said "Bloody hell, you're still serving this? You were serving this yesterday!" 
Soda is incredibly difficult to pour correctly, especially if people are rushing you.
Customers are impatient arse holes who give up and leave your restaurant if you aren't lightning fast.

Yes, there are ways to make these easier, but you have to play through an absolute nightmare of a game to get to those.

If you're at all like me and find these things awful. Avoid this game. It's actually very upsetting to play. I'm happy knowing I'll never play it again.
And I think I'll treat kitchen staff nicer from now on.
Not that I treated them badly before... just... nicer...

Fuck this game...

author: {'steamid': '76561198386242770', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 12032, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12032, 'last_played': 1582485936}
review:
Addictive!
I've played this game on and off for nearly 2 years and I have finally finished it! (Determined by me reaching 100% on Steam achievements). The game will depend largely on muscle memory. You cook food that customers order by slapping together ingredients assigned to the keys on your keyboard. Over time, you're going to remember what ingredients belong to which key so an order will just involve typing out a memorised string of letters.
Customers will get mad and leave if you don't take their orders in time. Food will burn if you don't serve it quickly enough after it's ready. The time crunch makes it very challenging and fun.
Other modes were available like local co-op and weekly challenges. I only played these a bit but I prefer to play the story mode. 
I can't name anything that I didn't like about the game. The game music wasn't to my liking but that is irrelevant because it's just my personal taste.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045301435', 'num_games_owned': 2013, 'num_reviews': 693, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1428951466}
review: While I found the concept to be really interesting, I also found that the game is rather unforgiving even in the opening. My WPM is on average, about 82, and I still struggle with this game. I would say that it's a good choice for someone learning to type, but not really a good game for someone who already knows how to do it very well. 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197970314107', 'num_games_owned': 2302, 'num_reviews': 917, 'playtime_forever': 327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1589074183}
review:
When I think of management games, it’s usually with a relaxed sigh and a dreamy grin. I love management sims because they’re often wonderfully chill, allowing me to build trade empires or airports or feudal villages at my leisure. So imagine me sitting there with my dopey, lazy grin on my face when Cook, Serve, Delicious! comes out from the back, kicks me in the shins, and orders me back into the kitchen. It’s like the developers tried as hard as they could to capture the soul-crushing stress of running an actual restaurant, and by some miracle crammed it into a game alongside a heapin’ helping of fun and plenty of heart.

SherriSoda Tower has fallen on hard times, and many of its premier businesses and restaurants have closed their doors for good. But the management has decided to come roaring back by reviving the old Cook, Serve, Delicious! restaurant, and they’ve put you in charge of this lofty endeavor. To do that, you’ll have manage the whole joint yourself, from setting the menu to working the kitchen to serving the meals to running the chores to investing your earnings, and I’m sure I’m forgetting something in there. It’s you against an army of the tower’s hungriest visitors every day, and you will be judged harshly on your choice of offerings and how well you prepare them. Survive the scrutiny, and maybe a few catering gigs, television appearances, and robberies along the way, and you might just have a five-star restaurant to your name some day.

Before we delve into the many distractions from your culinary quest, let’s break down exactly what you’re doing here and why it’ll make you sweat. Each day, your restaurant operates from 8am to 10pm, which passes in a few minutes of real time. You have a number of serving stations, depending on the rank of your restaurant, that orders will come in on. Each order will be something on your active menu, and will require you to complete some small button-based task. It could be as easy as pressing C and R to put cheese and ranch on a salad, or as complex as selecting and chopping five different vegetables for your soup. You’ll also have chores to do like dishes and trash, and none of these tasks will wait around for long. Add to that the lunch and dinner rushes where all of your stations will be constantly full, and maybe you can see where the stress begins.

I want to make two things abundantly clear: CSD is really fun, and CSD is really stressful. The fun comes from learning how all your recipes work, how to slice fish and tenderize steaks and deep fry sopapillas with just a few swift key presses. When you get into a groove you feel amazing, like some kind of culinary demigod weaving together the chaotic threads of food services. And then you put the wrong layer on your lasagna, lose your combo, and panic. You need focus and practice to be good at CSD, and until you build those skills you’re going to be sweating through every rush. It doesn’t help that the stakes can be great here, like hundreds of dollars riding on rewards and randomized bets that you can keep a perfect combo going all day. And while not stressful, the management side of the game has serious pacing issues where you can complete all the requirements for your next star, except you still have to complete 15 more days of the same routine just because.

The main antagonist of the game is the grind, because you’ll most likely complete your challenges and even save up some decent cash for upgrades way before you meet the days passed requirement to progress. Buying new foods to serve or upgrading them for more lucrative and complex dishes helps, but some of the upgrades are terribly expensive and foods have a dizzying number of status effects that influence your buzz, meaning your actual menu selections will be artificially limited. On the bright side, the developers did add plenty of additional modes over time to entertain you if the business side gets you down. There’s a whole Iron Chef knockoff that offers multiplayer and online challenges, allowing you to experience more of the menu and some peak prep pressure. And it’s worth mentioning that the in-game email system and little snippets of story and worldbuilding you get here and there are surprisingly well done and worth your attention.

In the end, Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a load of great gameplay tied to some middling management. There’s not much out there like preparing a soda or a pizza here, dancing your fingers across the keys to offer up piping hot plates. But if you want to work your way through the game proper, you’re going to be stuck doing the same thing for hours upon hours, and even the most fun simulations can get tedious if they’re not offering much new along the way. The ways your menu and upgrades are limited only exacerbate the problem, though there are other modes you can escape to for relief. And you’ll need relief, because as much fun as this one is, it’s bound to stress you out at points. It’s a good, rewarding stress though, and something that you owe it to yourself to try.



Did you enjoy this review? I certainly hope so, and I certainly hope you'll check out more of them at https://goldplatedgames.com/ or on my [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/11322459/]curation page[/url]!

review: Its a cathartic little game. it feels nice to learn the foods and the recipes. it's fun to then execute on that knowledge to try and string up huge combos.  the buzz and upgrades are also available if you really want to min max everything and the emails you get every day do some world building that is a nice touch that you can also completely ignore for the most part.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032319475', 'num_games_owned': 291, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2303, 'last_played': 1691355306}
review:
A classic game. If you've never had the opportunity to work a terrible fast food job and are looking to simulate the experience in the best way possible, look no further. All the fun of stressful, high-action day packed into just 9 minutes instead of 8 hours! 
This one is not necessarily inferior to the second game at all. There are less foods to choose from, sure, but what foods there are are much more carefully balanced, and there is a stronger sense of progression as you work your way from a no-name hole in the wall serving pretzels and corn dogs to a five-star restaurant serving famous VIPs the fanciest wine and lobster. If you played and enjoyed the second one, don't be afraid at all to jump into this one too, just don't expect to get away with using mouse controls!

author: {'steamid': '76561198019428702', 'num_games_owned': 2713, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1449, 'last_played': 1577035986}
review:
It's not that this game isn't fun, but the controls get frustrating after a while. They're not intuitive, and it's difficult to change them to match the tools that you're using. Some of the cooking items have way too many options (a pizza can easily have more than 8 options to add to it, which accurately mimics real-world pizza but causes difficulty for players who may not have the required dexterity to get across the keyboard OR handle the controller).

It's really inaccessible.

review: Touch Typing Simulator 2015 is definitely a fun game. The dishes are varied, with different styles of button mashing required, but enough that you can get it into muscle memory. My only real gripe is that it feels padded out - I often feel like there's not much progression with the game. It's great, however, for pulling it out, banging out a stage or two, and coming back a day later.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127829512', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1034, 'last_played': 1643480297}
review:
Excellent game, bought it for the nostalgic feeling of all the days spent on web restaurant games in my childhood. The soundtrack is very catchy and enjoyable. Artwork is nicely different from all the overly cartoonish same genre games I've played in the past.

Only place for improvement is the limited keybinding possibility, only English letters work, arrows, other letters and all other keys are ruled out. This makes the playing slightly uncomfortable, having to stretch the hand over keys that can't be used. 

Bought it on sale but I think it's worth the full price. It's chill and extremely stressing at the same time so if you hate being in a hurry don't try this. On the other hand failing isn't that much of a big deal on Cook, Serve, Delicious! Didn't rage quit even once and I have a strong tendency for that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11095, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1576162373}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious is a mobile app that's been dumped on Steam as a cheap, lazy cash grab.  It's a mobile phone "cooking" simulator game that revolves around clicking on food orders and then tapping on your phone screen on the various ingredients to satisfy the order.

There's no sensible reason for the developers to fix the game on keyboard only when it would make a lot more sense from an interface perspective for the mouse to be used.   Like many mobile clickers, there's an upgrade scheme, but it doesn't really do much for you.   For the eye stinging $10 USD price tag for a mobile clicker game, I do not understand why this is so popular on Steam.  There's no compelling gameplay here, and what there is could have been implemented far better.

Once more we see greedy mobile devs trying to screw over PC gamers. On Steam, this is $10 USD, on app stores, it's $2 USD. Mobile devs must learn PC gamers are not here to be gouged, and can't be expected to pay [b]FIVE times as much[/b] for a crappy bundle worsening mobile game so they can pretend their gaming rigs are iPhones.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967042033', 'num_games_owned': 323, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 665, 'last_played': 1575902243}
review: Após jogar uma 10h posso dizer que gostei muito do jogo. Basicamente você é dono de um restaurante em uma torre e precisa ir evoluindo o seu negócio (até chegar a 5 estrelas). O leque de comidas não é tão grande e o jogo fica um pouco repetitivo com o decorrer do tempo, já que depois que você adquire as melhores comidas, basicamente fica em busca de chegar às 5 estrelas. Existe um modo battle que ainda não joguei, então não posso dizer muito sobre ele. RESUMINDO: O jogo é legal, principalmente se você gosta daquele joguinhos antigos de servir comida. É meio repetitivo, mas que jogo desse tipo não é? Enfim, estou muito satisfeito, já comprei o 2 e sei que o 3 está para sair e vou comprar também.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027221726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 1824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1824, 'last_played': 1573348721}
review:
This is a nice casual game.  You have a queue of up to 8 customers at a time, as well as various "chores" you would have to do.  Takes some memory of what key goes to what*, and it can get quite hectic at rush hour trying to keep track of everything.  If you like this sort of game I recommend it, especially if it's on sale.

*The game always shows you which keys you need, but when things get really busy you won't have time to read it.  Good keyboarding skills or at least knowing which keys are where on the keyboard will help you in this game.

review: for starters i want to  say i am far from a professional reviewer. but i will let all of you know through my experience with this game how it was. at 1st glance of this game you don't think much of this game. it's a cooking simulator. but looks can be very decieving. this game is as fun and addicting as it is difficult. this game can be a real pain in the butt especially later on in the game and really depends on how you approach it. the higher stars you get the harder and more intense it gets. this game can be really fast paced and a little overwhelming at times. i recommend this game if this is your type of game. also you can use a pc/360 controller with it to play. but i use a keyboard. i hope everyone enjoys this game as much as i did. and i give this game a overall 9/10(due to some framerate issues because of my pc)
