author: {'steamid': '76561198394488644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1580831147}
review: Along with being one of the (very unexpectedly!) funniest games I’ve played this year, the game’s disarming & charming aesthetic did not prepare me for what is undoubtedly the best WarioWare-like game I have ever played. In fact, I probably ended up spending more time with Cook, Serve, Delicious! than with almost any other game this year. The gameplay is simple in nature but blisteringly fast, resulting in a challenge that is more than enough to keep the average player interested. The game does not overstay its welcome, as it evolves in numerous ingenious ways by the time you’ve reached the end.”

author: {'steamid': '76561198006067879', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 3604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2431, 'last_played': 1675556254}
review:
This is the original Cook, Serve, Delicious.

A very strategic slow/medium/fast paced game to play, your goal is to cook a variety of dishes for your customers.

At the same time, certain in-game events occur such as dishes, trash, robberies, and others. You'll need to put those into your factor.

Strategy is a key aspect towards this game, if you want to be a 5-star or higher chef. I strongly recommend this game.

Pros (+)
+ Expansive single-player game mode
+ Cooking Challenges (I think they are still a thing)

Neutral (/)
/ Nothing

Negative (-)
- Most of the time to rank up you must [spoiler] Complete 20 Days [/spoiler] as well as complete other goals. It can get repetitive, but the other challenges make up for this.

Overall rating: 9.3 / 10
It's also cheap (pretty sure it's $10 now)

author: {'steamid': '76561198053652741', 'num_games_owned': 818, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 3025, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2904, 'last_played': 1572951466}

author: {'steamid': '76561198103203222', 'num_games_owned': 269, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1572158126}
review:
The game definitely isn't bad, but it gets really repetitive really fast. It takes 20 "days" or whatever to get to the next level of restaurant and each one is basically the exact same thing for 10 minutes. There's a couple of rushes, but the majority is just downtime for 10 minutes. Now do that 20 times in a row. 

You can get new foods to keep it more interesting, but there's really not a point and it still doesn't add much variety. It's an ok game on sale, but otherwise, I would skip it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025461832', 'num_games_owned': 728, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1647374073}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999045600', 'num_games_owned': 694, 'num_reviews': 226, 'playtime_forever': 7355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3708, 'last_played': 1699222661}
review: Cooking games are a guilty pleasure of mine, and this one is the best because it offers a much better challenge than most. It's a speed-based game that tests your typing and memory skills because you have to hit buttons in a certain order and very quickly to keep your customers happy.  It also has a restaurant management component that is fairly straightforward and simple, but it's still satisfying to see your little hole-in-the wall dump slowly transform into a five-star restaurant.  This is one of those games that cause me to lose track of time because it's so addictive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198348291087', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1696096148}
review:
好玩！！

一款煮饭仔跟打字相结合的小游戏——通过打字来做菜上菜（还有搞卫生）。

· 虽然游戏没有官方中文，但是玩法简单，基本要做的操作通过客人要求显示单词的首字母就可以打了，所以没有中文也能玩得嗨起。不过个别因为首字母撞了所以要打第二个字母的单词刚开始打总是有点反应不过来，游戏里面非常“贴心”地给每道菜提供了练习的模式；

· 游戏画面很简单，但是完全不影响我明明上一秒在做菜，下一秒就去通马桶洗厕所&倒垃圾的矛盾心情+食欲瞬间消失（那个冲马桶的音效还真的是无比杀食）。

不知道如果官方有中文会怎么玩，可能是拼音首字母……有中文的话可能玩起来会反应得更快一点，不过没有也ok，很好玩~

author: {'steamid': '76561198105909279', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 750, 'last_played': 1598159118}
review: Ever worked in a restaurant before? No? Me neither! Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a fast-paced, keyboard swiping indie where you gotta prepare food for your patrons. Better do it quick too, else you'll be losing your perfect combo. With a surprisingly effective concept executed perfectly and loads of dishes to master, events to conquer, the like, the game will make you ask for seconds every time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993522454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1568162111}
review:
[h1] tl;dr: Fun for those who like games like Diner Dash  [/h1]

[h1] What I liked  [/h1]
[olist]
   [*] The ability to mostly use my keyboard. I liked that I could nearly play the entire game with keyclicks versus having to rely on the speed of mouse-clicking everything.
   [*] I liked making the food. The game definitely picks up difficulty once you start upgrading food, such as adding new ingredients. This adds the ability for the customer to make more custom requests, so reading the order becomes more important. 
   [*] While there were times of stress when I had several “complex” dishes on the menu to juggle, I still felt like this game was relaxing and fit exactly what I was looking for.
[/olist]

[h1] What I wish was different  [/h1]
[olist]
   [*] I wish you could decorate your space. While I like that the game is mostly focused on food and improving your menu, I still like being able to customize everything.
   [*] I wish the road to 2 stars happened a little quicker. Since money accumulation takes a bit, it seemed like I was forced into juggling the same menu items over and over, making the gameplay a little too repetitive. This could have been me strategizing equipment upgrades over menu, but I feel like a lot of the equipment upgrades were needed over upgrading my menu items first. Instead of 20 days in a row to hit 2 stars, I would have liked it to be 10 days, that way you get a taste of what unlocking a star gets you, sooner.
[/olist]

author: {'steamid': '76561198194265298', 'num_games_owned': 306, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1565949291}
review:
Oyunu daha basit bekliyorken bu kadar güzel zorlukta çıkması şaşırttı ve sevindirdi. Oynanışına bayıldım diyebilirim bu yüzden. Zaten arada bir girmelik, çerezlik bir oyun.
Grafikler sıkılmayacağınız türden. Grafiklerle ilgili sorun sayılabilecekse aynı müşterileri görmek sıkıntı.
Müzikler de güzel fakat bir yerden sonra sürekli aynı müzikleri duymak sıkabiliyor.
Bu küçük sıkıntıları geçersek benim en sıkıntı yaşadığım olay şu: Gün çok uzun mu sürüyor ondan mı bilmiyorum fakat gün bitince başka güne başlayasım gelmiyor. Oyun bir yerden sonra tekrara bindiği için 20 gün görevlerini bitirmek işkence olabiliyor. Henüz 2. yıldızdayım ve ileride yeni özelliklerin açılacağını biliyorum fakat oynayasım gelmiyor. Sanırım bir yerden sonra tekrara biniyor bu yüzden de oynayasınız gelmiyor ama 7 saate kadar beni eğlendirdiğini söyleyebilirim.

author: {'steamid': '76561198344664149', 'num_games_owned': 143, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 4148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1816, 'last_played': 1625562671}
review:
[h1][b]目指せ！五つ星レストラン！★★★★★[/b][/h1]

（ノーマル、NG+全クリ　全実績解除済み）
作者がPSゲーム「俺の料理」を参考にして作った料理アクションゲーム。
様々な自分でメニューを考えたり、客から注文された料理のタスクをこなしたりしながらオフィスビルに賑わいを取り戻そう！！

評価点
・メニューごとに異なる調理方法、自分のお気に入りの料理も見つかるはず！
・全部英語だけど分かりやすい文章(長いものもあるけど慣れればなんとかなる！)
・BGMがシリーズの中で最もジャズ寄り♪

ビミョーな点
・難易度は高め。後述のマンネリ化もあって実績解除も大変。
・強盗、デートイベントが面倒。強盗とか英文が長すぎて全然顔書けないよ～…
・レストランの星を上げるためには最低20日間経営しなきゃいけないけど、それまで同じことの繰り返しだからグダるかも。
・BGM自体は好みだけど、大体1ループが30秒しかなくて短すぎるよ。。


このゲームは難しいけど、慣れるとかなりハマる。作業ゲーとか好きな人にはオススメ！
さぁ、まずはこのゲームから始めてCSDシリーズに沼ろう👍

author: {'steamid': '76561198082588464', 'num_games_owned': 835, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2720, 'last_played': 1590111920}
review:
I never thought I could get so invested within a cooking game.
What, at the end of the day, it's just a bunch of QTE's, right?
Oh, how sorely mistaken I was...
It is an addictive, easy-to-learn, hard-to-master cooking game that will be sure to keep you invested, with near infinite replayability, for those who want to be the best chefs!
It will not let you down, that is for sure!

author: {'steamid': '76561198136920209', 'num_games_owned': 2447, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1563036312}
review:
[h1]Я заказал свой бургер уже десять секунд назад? Где он!?[/h1]

[i]Существует немало подобных игр, где нужно готовить для клиентов на скорость и данный кликер представляет собой один из них. Погнали учиться готовить![/i]

[code][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/11769719/]А больше крутых и качественных обзоров ты найдёшь в группе куратора. Подпишись и подними нам настроение! Спасибо![/url][/code]
[list]
[*][b]Геймплей[/b] состоит в приготовлении различных блюд для клиентов на скорость посредством прокликивания определённых комбинаций кнопок. По сути, на этом всё. У вас есть четыре окна заказов, которые могут поступать вам в различное время и на их выполнение вам выделяется ограниченное количество секунд. Чем быстрее вы выполняете заказ, тем больше репутации получаете. 

Скорость исполнения заказов варьируется от нескольких мгновений, до минуты в зависимости от сложности заказа. Если это обычный корндог или кружка пива, то будет достаточно подождать пару секунд и нажать одну кнопку. Заказ готов! Но если вы готовите для клиента какое-либо изысканное или просто трудозатратное по времени и ингредиентам блюдо, то придётся мириться с тем, что вам придётся достаточно долго прождать его готовности и при этом имеется вероятность упустить других клиентов или вообще запороть блюдо. Ошибки бывают у всех… Ах да, в заказах нельзя нарушать ни один пункт, а иначе снижение итоговой оценки и, соответственно, репутации. [spoiler]привереды…[/spoiler]

Для каждого блюда нужно также смотреть на различные наборы характеристик, привязанных непосредственно к блюду. К примеру, блюдо может быть лёгким в изготовлении, но может подходить не всем категориям обслуживаемых посетителей. 

Ещё помимо исполнения заказов могут попасться различные случайные события вроде мытья посуды, выноса мусора или ловли крыс. По сути своей, это негативные мудлеты, которые дополнительно ужимают вас в сроках изготовления кулинарных шедевров и порой заставляют терять некоторое количество драгоценных приливов финансов.

Испытанием на прочность будет так называемый «Час пик», где на протяжении часа вы можете выполнить или даже перевыполнить всю дневную норму заказываемых позиций (а это с девяти утра до десяти вечера, на минуточку). Готовка в этот час сродни скоростным гонкам на смерть. Заказов куча и это повезёт если они будут простыми, а если нет – готовьтесь терять шекели. А ещё приплюсовать негативные события и… буит мясо. И таких часов на дню может быть несколько, так что готовьтесь напрячь ваши «французские булочки».

У игры нет русского перевода, но всё становится интуитивно понятно через несколько минут игры и пару пропущенных заказов. Знание языка не станет преградой в этом проекте от слова совсем.

Игра имеет несколько режимов, а именно:

[olist]
[*]Карьера, имеющая за собой цель добиться всеобщего признания, как одного из лучших шеф-поваров и получить заветные пять звёзд для своего ресторанного бизнеса, попутно меняя интерьер здания и открывая всё новые и новые позиции в меню.

[*]Челленджи (вызовы) с разными наборами заданий, в которых могут принимать участие от одно до четырёх реальных игроков.
[/olist]

Также игра имеет локальный кооператив на двух человек, что позволяет слегка разгрузить местами напряжённый игровой процесс и насладиться игрой по полной программе.

[*][b]Магазин[/b]

Хочется отдельно сказать про магазин, где можно найти достаточно немаленький спектр доступных для изготовления блюд. Он варьируется в большом диапазоне. Это могут быть как простейшие вроде тех же корндогов, так и сложные в изготовлении блюда вроде пицц, различных супов и так далее. И, надо сказать, рецепты эти вы будете окупать очень долго кропотливым трудом, ибо каждый из них стоит с пол горшочка зелёного леприконского. Ещё для уже купленных рецептов можно закупать улучшения, которые увеличат получаемую прибыль с единицы продукции.

Можно также приобрести различные примочки для кухни вроде ускоренного приготовления той или иной категории блюд, увеличение времени ожидания клиента или того же сервиса по уборке мусора дабы исключить этот негативные пункты из повестки дня (последнее кстати является максимально полезным, возьмите на заметку).
[/list]
[b]Заключение[/b]

Vertigo Gaming Inc создали прекрасный представитель жанра кликеров без видимых недостатков. Он прост в игровой части и приятен в визуальной.

[b]Графическая составляющая[/b] выглядит стандартно для качественной флэш-игры, перенесённой на просторы Steam. Не знаю, действительно ли они вдохновлялись подобными «флэшками» или даже не заглядывались на них, но графика получилась вполне сносной, будто отчасти рисованной карандашом. Не придерёшься.

[b]Музыкальное сопровождение[/b] потрясающее. Оно не напрягает и прекрасно слушается, подстёгивая игрока к действию. Особенно заходит нагнетающий саундтрек во время Час пика.

В итоге хочется сказать, что игра может и похожа на браузерные поделки, но в Steam её перенесли более чем бережно. Она стоит каждой потраченной копейки и именно поэтому я порекомендую данный продукт к ознакомлению.

[h1]Спасибо тем, кто дочитал мой обзор до конца![/h1]
[h1]С уважением, KaneDillinger.[/h1]

review: Really fun, gives me crazy fingers. But if people want me to serve them beer all morning long they should flush the toilet themselves. They don't. So I make a salad half way then flush the toilet, then finish the salad. It's the only way to teach them a lesson.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154397969', 'num_games_owned': 2310, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1562275274}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious isn't a bad game, but it gets stale fairly quickly. Yes, there are a number of recipes and upgrades, but ultimately every challenge is still the same challenge. Press some keys in the right order, press some more keys in the right order, repeat. I see other reviews mentioning management of available dishes and upgrades, but honestly, they're so negligible that it's a joke to call it "management." Swapping out stale recipes and trying to maximize earnings based on buzz bonuses is only slightly worth the effort at best.

I decided to call it quits shortly after netting two stars; there's really just not enough unique content to justify continuing to play. If the game progressed more quickly, I think it would feel more rewarding, but I can't imagine myself dumping another ten hours into this just to finish.

Overall: mediocre; there are probably better free mobile games in the same genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073259006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 784, 'last_played': 1405162584}
review:
Head upwards and then take the path to the left. Follow this around until the path splits into two. Take the upper path, and it’ll lead to the first clearing. Backtrack to the split and this time take the lower path.

Follow the path until it splits again and head upwards. Follow this path to another clearing. Backtrack again and this time take the path leading downwards. Follow the path down and to the left. You’ll come to an area with 6 exits. Take the exit at the bottom of the screen to find another clearing.

Leave the clearing and take the lower left exit. Follow this upwards and take the first left you come to. Follow this path all along (it splits in a few places but always joins up again) until you’re at the edge of the jungle and can see the mountains below you.

Head left and take the first path upwards to find a clearing. Head back down and continue left. Take the next path up to find the first hut and continue upwards for another clearing. Head back down to the bottom path and start walking to the right.

Count the paths upwards and head up the fifth path. Follow this path upwards (do not take the first left when you get to it – continue upwards) until you get to another area with 6 exits. First, take the lower exit to find a clearing, then take the upper-right exit for another clearing.

Head back down and then retrace your steps along the bottom-right path until you reach the mountain path again. Continue right and take the next path upwards. Follow either of the two paths here and continue upwards until you reach an area with 6 exits.

First, take the upper exit to find another clearing, then take the bottom-right exit to leave. Take the next path leading downwards and then the next left immediately after it. Follow this down to a lake. Head back up and take the first right. Next follow the path all the way down until you reach the mountains. Follow this path all the way to the left – it’s quite a journey.

Take the first upward path you get to and continue upwards until you reach a lake. Take the bottom-right exit and then head down to find another clearing. Head back up, continue along the bottom-right path and take the next path downwards. Here you’ll find your second hut. Continue downwards for another clearing, then head all the way up until you can only turn right.

Continue to the right and head upwards to reach another area with 6 exits. First take the bottom-right path to find a clearing. Secondly, take the upper-right path for another clearing. Thirdly, take the bottom-left path for a third clearing. Finally, head straight upwards to find a fourth clearing.

Leave the clearing and take the first path on the upper left (in the area with 5 exits, not 6, directly below the clearing). Continue left and you’ll find another area with 6 exits. Take the lower-left path and then head downwards to find your third hut.

Head up and take the path in the upper-left. When you reach the lake, continue upwards past two more lakes. Turn right at that third lake and head upwards to find a fourth lake. Now head back down to the first of these four lakes.

Take the bottom-right path under the lake. Follow this around to another area with 6 exits. Take the exit leading downwards to find a clearing. Leave the clearing and continue up through the top exit. Follow the path to the right then all the way up for another clearing.

Backtrack downwards and take the first left you come to (which will lead above the path you arrived from just now). This leads to another clearing. Head back and retrace your steps along the lower path to the area with 6 exits.

This time take the upper-left exit to find your fourth hut. Keep going upwards. There is only one path to follow here (where it splits, it rejoins again). Keep going up and you’ll soon have a long walk to the left, with the mountains above you.

Once you reach the mountains on the left, head up and then to the right. Take the first path leading downwards that you get to. Keep going down to find another area with 6 exits. Take the downwards path to find your fifth and final hut. This will unlock:

review:
最近食欲無いんだよなー。。。なんて言っている人に試して欲しい、食欲増進系ゲーム

但し日本語化出来ない。
（再割り当て可能だが、ゲームの料理コマンドを実行するキーには、基本的にその英語の頭文字が割り当てられる）
この基本設定で料理動作のすばやさと正確性を極限まで追求することになるので、
料理系の英短語を知らない人にはお勧めし難い。

author: {'steamid': '76561198039960381', 'num_games_owned': 708, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2456, 'last_played': 1564751454}
review:
Length : About 20+ hours main campaign (upgrade to 5 star restuarant)
 30-40 hours to 100%

Tags : casual, coffee break, 

You basically manage a restaurant, setting the daily menu, buying equipment, upgrading your restaurant. The core gameplay consists of taking customer order for different dishes and executing them. This mainly involves pressing/clicking buttons in correct order and within time-frame. So also a time-management game. Every food type has a different method of preparation -  essentially a different game mechanic which you need to learn.

Pros
- Okay as a coffee-break game. Can pick up and drop game for a quick 5 minute session. But not exactly a stress-reliever or relaxing type game.
- Decent
- Low system requirements
- Can be mostly played with keyboard only. If you play it accordingly ,i suppose the game can help improve some aspects of your  touch-typing skills. Was able to realise and correct wrong habits w.r.t. the number row which was affecting my game.

-  Decent progression. couple of Side-quests  and gameplay modes to keep things interesting.
 -Achievements : (4/5 ). .Not too many , not too few.They provide good incentive to try out all the food types and side-quests in the game. You should probably look into getting them after you have understood the basics, so that the game stays interesting

Cons
- Game is about 30% too long. Overstays its welcome. The game was initially very fun but at some point , it begins to feel like work. That is because they stretch out each stage to 20 matches (20 in-game days of a restaurant.) Same applies to achievements (1500 orders per food category for example) .  
- Story (1/5)  : Not really point of game. I suppose some of the emails in-game are funny.
- Achievements : Quite a few of them are bit too grindey in nature. Nothing impossibly difficult but probably will take minimum 30 hours to 100% them.

Linux support : Played entire game without issue except  2 weekly challenge achievements (unlock special guests) seemed to be bugged and you can't unlock those guests. All the other achievements work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019585215', 'num_games_owned': 734, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1556330759}
review:
I've wondered for a while where the threshold between frustrating and enjoyably difficult begins and ends, and I think Cook, Serve, Delicious has helped me understand that a lot better. 

The actual "running the restaurant" part is fast-paced and hectic right from the get-go, but every single little task has an element of skill associated with it. This means that the more you practice it and get used to it, the faster you'll breeze through the seemingly endless checklist of tasks each in-game day presents to you. And more importantly: the better a state of flow you'll enter. I've never played a game before that made me focus so hard on what I was doing that the world literally blurred around me. That level of focus is at the core of what makes CSD so much fun, and here's the kicker: even if you screw up one or two tasks, the game isn't going to rake you over the coals for it. You're allowed to learn, to screw up, and grow from the experience. And that's pretty rad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050157835', 'num_games_owned': 1409, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 1323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1562263255}
review:
I thought "How much fun could a game about cooking and serving stuff be?"  Well, the game is unexpectedly engaging, and while playing you can feel your response times improving as you become more competent.

You're running a restaurant and customers come in and order foods on a menu that you select each day.  As you play you can upgrade the foods and manage your menu options.  The gameplay loop is managing the orders and maintaining your restaurant, and during rush hour it can get pretty hectic.  

For example, a customer might order "fried chicken" and to prepare it you select the order "1", press the "down arrow" to drop it in the fryer, remove the chicken from the fryer (don't burn it) at the right time by releasing the "arrow", and then when done press "p" to put the chicken in a container to be served, then press "enter" to serve it.  For a salad, customers might order different ingredients, so different combinations of keypresses come into play depending on what the customer wants.  You also have to do things like wash dishes or clean the bathrooms, so it keeps you on your toes.  All functions have different series of keypresses.  Sometimes you might have orders on the grill while you're tending to other orders, so the game will keep you on your toes and juggling orders, especially a rush hour where there's nearly more customers than you can keep track off.

As you earn money you can buy more foods for your restaurant and increase your restaurant's reputation.  It's important to put together daily menus that you can manage well also, because some things are more complex to prepare than others, so the right mix of quick/easy vs. more complex is important to maintain. You also have to change up your menus because like a normal cafeteria, people like to have variety and buy more when you mix it up.

***MAIN CON (edit):  The conflicts with keybinds can build up over the course of a game so that it becomes increasingly confusing as your menu and options expands.  You can edit your keybinds, but it's sometimes difficult to find intuitive keybinds that don't conflict.  For example:  For Tomatoes depending on the recipe I've used T, O, and D (diced).  For mushrooms M or U.  Onions O or N.  And sometimes it's simply not possible to use the intuitive key because it's used by something else.  For example T might be Tomatoe Sauce in pizza and then you need something else for the tomatoes as a topping.  In some recipes M might be the obvious key for meat, so you need something else for mushrooms.  etc.  This became frustrating for me at the 4-star level when having pasta and soup on the menu in particular, especially if combined on the menu with something like burgers and pizza.  You're trying to go so fast but the appropriate keys keep changing.  Due to this it can throw all your learned muscle memory into disarray as you keep trying to find a set of keys so recipe ingredients aren't always in conflict.  I sortof wish the possible ingredient lists could be edited to eliminate possible conflicts, or change an ingredient's name to something that better matched it's key ***

But anyhow, there's a strong satisfaction that comes from being able to execute all of the orders properly, and you do feel yourself getting better as you play.  It's unexpectedly rewarding in this sense.  It pushes alot of the right buttons.  Good game.

review: I didn't finished it but I enjoy what I played of it.  It had me making food in real life, like pretzels and trying different salad combos at lunch at my local deli. Anytime a game makes you want to explore more is a plus. I do think the game is easier if you have a game controller rather than using the keyboard.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990453351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 970, 'playtime_forever': 889, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 889, 'last_played': 1559928392}
review:
This game is really good! 

At the first glance over this game, you may think that it just another serving game and there is nothing different between the other games in this genre. But, when you play the game for roughly half an hour you are going to be impressed by the amount of things that the game has to offer you. 

I will definitely recommend this game to anyone and everybody can get fun with the simplicity of the game mechanics. Go pick this up!

author: {'steamid': '76561197966570381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 526, 'last_played': 1388695970}
review:
Somewhere between rythm game and management sim, this fun little gem will train you in the art of blindly whipping together a lasagna while scanning the incoming orders for pressing chores.

Varied, challenging and stressful without ever being unfair. The nice slope in difficulty slowly draws you in to the point where you look at what you're doing and wonder why exactly you've mastered this wonderfully useless new skill.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113093362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 985, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1628500242}

author: {'steamid': '76561198401112269', 'num_games_owned': 669, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 1794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1794, 'last_played': 1559052180}
review:
[h1]Fique completamente viciado ou morra de tédio.[/h1]

A humanidade é rodeada de mistérios: eram deuses os astronautas? Existe vida após a morte? Por que eu gastei 30 horas nesse jogo? Para o último, arrisco uma resposta.

[i]Cook, Serve, Delicious![/i] tem uma proposta que quase todo mundo já viu nos saudosos jogos de navegador: você administra um restaurante, executa as receitas, existe um tempo limite para que o cliente fique satisfeito, e por aí vai. O coração da jogabilidade, portanto, reside em fazer as receitas o mais rápido possível, usando atalhos de teclado (não imagino como alguém consegue jogar isso com controle).

O jogo é repetitivo; talvez minha maior crítica seja ao tamanho da campanha, que chegando perto do final parece se estender mais do que deveria. Entretanto, o segredo do título reside em seu [b]sistema de progressão[/b].

É necessário adquirir as comidas que serão servidas, cada uma com suas vantagens e desvantagens (por exemplo: fazer mais sucesso de noite, sujar muitos pratos, etc), sendo que a maioria delas pode ser upada. Os upgrades custam dinheiro, trazem mais ingredientes, novas receitas relativas àquela comida e ainda deixam o preço dela mais caro no menu. Você também pode melhorar seus equipamentos, o que confere vantagens na jogabilidade. Portanto, você se vê de início com lindos alimentos, uma sonoplastia ótima (que dá fome) e começa a dominar algumas receitas. Expandi-las traz novos desafios, e incorporar cada mudança de receita vai ficando mais complicado e, ao mesmo tempo, satisfatório.

Eu [b]amo[/b] o fato do jogo se livrar de algumas mecânicas que sempre me irritaram nos jogos de navegador: poder "descartar" a receita em andamento e humor decrescente nos clientes, conforme o tempo. Aqui, o design é limpo, sem zilhões de medidores de humor para ocupar a tela, e existem três resultados para sua receita: ruim, mediano e perfeito. O título foi pensado a favor da velocidade: é possível entregar receitas prontas enquanto prepara outras. Não fez uma receita perfeita, o combo recomeça e pronto. Portanto, ser multitarefa e ágil é algo exigido, recompensado e cada vez mais difícil.

Também acho interessante frisar que os atalhos de teclado são muito bem pensados. Conforme você os decora, é possível preparar as receitas extremamente rápido, bem como executar as tarefas de cuidado com o restaurante. Cada letra tem sua lógica - tomates às vezes serão T, às vezes serão O, e há uma lógica relativa aos ingredientes mais importantes. As setas costumam imitar o movimento feito, o que também é divertido e instintivo. Conforme o jogo passa, você vai se sentindo de fato um chef habilidoso. 

Além de todos os aspectos polidos da jogabilidade, o título conta com uma "história" narrada através do e-mail do restaurante: são apostas de pessoas malucas que testam suas habilidades, previsão de chuva que faz com que alguns alimentos tenham bônus extras, piadinhas, enfim. A verdade é que o coração do jogo é repetitivo, mas as pequenas surpresas e variações geram compensações imediatas, e é fácil entrar num ciclo de [i]compulsão por administrar seu restaurante virtual[/i].

Portanto, é bem simples saber se o jogo é pra você: se após 1 hora você sentir que ele não te pegou pelo estômago, a tendência é que a sensação de monotonia se estenda - as poucas críticas negativas são de gente que achou chato/sem graça. Agora, se depois dessa uma hora você está planejando seu cardápio minuciosamente e dando risada de algum vidente que te mandou mensagem, saiba que o jogo tem bastante conteúdo, desafios cada vez mais difíceis e um sistema de evolução engajador, que sempre vai te recompensar por um bom trabalho feito/estratégia executada.

Talvez seja um título de nicho, que não vá agradar a todos. Por si só, é sólido, bonito, bem executado e oferece muito mais do que o esperado. Quando você menos esperar, estará digitando receita após receita como um maníaco, e buscando combos como se não houvesse amanhã. Recomendadíssimo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198081662606', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1558883434}
review:
[h1]Симулятор солдата[/h1]
В этой игре вам предстоит взять на себя роль универсального солдата!
Вы готовите, убираете и толчок драите. В общем всё как в армии!!!

А в целом неплохая убивалка времени с этапом развития от забегаловки до ресторана 5 звезд.
Вы начинаете обычным поваром с меню фаст фудом и благодаря усилиям развиваетесь, осваиваете новые блюда, появляются богатые клиенты и ваша цель стать лучшим рестораном города.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049498441', 'num_games_owned': 5235, 'num_reviews': 434, 'playtime_forever': 1374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1362, 'last_played': 1558753943}
review:
손가락이 바쁘지 않다 느낀다면 꼭 추천합니다.
나는 바쁘지만 손님들은 급하고 해결해야할 건 많은데 음악도 같이 빨라져서
손가락이 꼬이는 바로 그 순간을 비참하게 만들어버리는 게임이 궁금하다면 꼭 이 게임을 하세요.

게임에 나오는 음식들이 맛있어보이고 배경 음악도 훌륭하고 
가격대비 즐길 수 있는게 많습니다. 실제 레스토랑처럼 오늘의 메뉴를 정하고 레시피를 발전 시키는 재미가 있습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134395384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3028, 'last_played': 1555000938}
review:
You manage a restaurant and build it up over time. You're also apparently the only person working there as you have to prepare all the food. Essentially a management sim mixed with a bunch of quick minigames based around preparing food. It's accessible to almost anyone while providing a very unique experience that steadily builds in difficulty and complexity. There's also a surprisingly large amount of content on offer here, allowing many hours of time to be sunk into this game.

Some may find the game a little too long and repetitive as it takes a while to earn each star and also earn money. There's also some spelling/grammar mistakes and other minor issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198226990204', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2190, 'last_played': 1558658628}
review:
I love this game. It is addictive, not too difficult for the sake of being frustrating to the player, and is beautiful to look at. The controls are easy to learn and hard to master, the extra levels are fun and feel like nice additions to the story, and overall, this is just an amazing game. Easily one of my favourites. 
The only downsides are the trash chore, which is easily the worst, and that some of the menu items like the soup are way too difficult. I don't have any other complaints.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989591969', 'num_games_owned': 4088, 'num_reviews': 271, 'playtime_forever': 3434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3406, 'last_played': 1577561708}
review:
On the surface this is a simple, casual simulation about on a par with what you might find for free on Facebook. And there are plenty of cooking games on Steam which are exactly like that.

But CSD is a bit more than that. There is *just* enough complication and progression to keep you interested and give plenty of replay value in order to try and beat your previous scores or reach the conclusion in a shorter space of time than before without getting bogged down in tedious grinding and micromanagement.

Plus, there's a dish called "My Hammy" which is a bonus :D

Haven't played the sequel yet. I hope they haven't added too much clutter

author: {'steamid': '76561198231874740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 1754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1742, 'last_played': 1591458486}
review:
[u]In short:[/u] This is a fun, restaurant-themed typing game. Repetition is a core game mechanic, but there is still a lot of variety and many different challenges are offered. The game is very polished and I enjoyed its presentation, especially the amazing music. I had a blast for well over 20 hours, which is totally worth the asking price.

[u]In long:[/u] There are appaently many different takes as to what the core [b][u]gameplay[/u][/b] actually is. People call CSD a restaurant simulation, a cooking game, some even see it as a classic controller game. But what really clicked for me is the typing aspect! It does admittedly require quite a bit of customization in the form of changing dozens of hotkeys. But once everything's set up, your fingers will never leave home row and it's a blast to play! Gameplay is divided into "days", lasting about 10min each. Depending on your popularity ("buzz") customers will come and order one of the 3-6 foods on your menu. As you level up, more foods, more recipies and more customer slots are added.
The [b][u]difficulty[/u][/b] is a bit of a mixed bag. In some ways the first few days are the most challenging. You have no familiarity with the recipies and no muscle memory, customers will be horribly impatient and chores like taking out the trash will be frequent and time-consuming. But just in the first 20 days you unlock several upgrades that alleviate most of the pressure from customers and chores, while you build up your skills at the same time. Like I said above, it really helps to customize your hotkeys, as out-of-the-box they are very inconsistent (the same ingredient may have two different hotkeys on two different recipies) and sometimes awkward (use of arrow keys). Beyond that it's really up to you how difficult you make your recipe card. 3 slow-cooking foods like steak and fish filet which you've never upgraded means you can achieve a perfect day in your sleep. 6 advanced and fully-upgraded foods like soup, sushi and pasta will probably drown you in a tide of impatient customers and botched orders. The optional challenges where you have to clear waves of orders of the same food provide a welcome change of pace, as do optional bets, dates an special guests, each asking you to adapt your menu to meet certain criteria. There is an awesome sense of progression as you build your muscle memory to accomodate new recipies. This is one of those games where you can totally get into the "flow" and breeze through orders at a pace that seems inhuman to an outside observer, all the while spouting crazy mnemonics to remember hotkeys (there's only so many letters in the alphabet, so sooner or later you arrive at stuff like "Yutter" and "Arlic" for butter and garlic). After 100 in-game days (roughly 20 hours of gameplay) some of the content starts recycling, which is also right around where you max out your restaurant rating and "extreme mode" unlocks. It's an interesting concept, but more for farming than for enjoable gameplay. I quit after 10k served customers, leaving only the 15k achievement open.

In terms of [b][u]presentation[/u][/b] I liked the visual style. It's not too flashy, but it all fits together nicely. And truth be told, you'll spend most of your time staring at numbers, recipies and ingredient lists, so there's not too much room for admiring backgrounds or customer models. I do appreciate the clarity of the interface (and also the cheeky obstacles when a fully upgraded food might suddendly add a recipy for "everything" instead of listing all the ingredients). The music is absolutely incredible. I've heard the tracks probably hundreds of times, but I've still not grown tired of them. From chill lounge jazz to intense up-beat music when rush hour hits - it's pretty much perfect. The sound effects are great across-the-board, which is important as you rely on audio cues a lot of the time.

In terms of [b][u]technical implementation[/u][/b] the game gets passing marks. Windowed mode works well and is adjustable. There are some annoying flashes and on-screen splash graphics, which thankfully can be disabled. The game takes up very little resources. Unfortunately there is no way to regulate the volume. I usually look for separate sliders for music and sound effects and I still would have liked to see them included, but truth be told, the sound mixing is really good and I never really felt a need for volume sliders. The game did also crash on me at least twice. It was annoying for sure, but with the game auto-saving between days you only ever lose under 10min of progress.

In [b][u]conclusion[/u][/b] this is an amazing typing game with about 20 hours of enjoyable unique content, allowing you to build up your typing skills through repetition and ever increasing challenges. I don't usually enjoy hectic games, but after a while it became sort of zen, albeit at a ludicrous pace. Finishing a perfect day with no botched orders always felt amazing. The brilliant music also helps to make this a memorable great experience that I think is well worth playing full price. On sale this is an absolute steal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021422660', 'num_games_owned': 3620, 'num_reviews': 1228, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1560940967}
review:
[h1] Игрушка про виртуальную кулинарию [/h1]

Может и интересное занятие - готовить виртуально, если основано на реальных рецептах. Но тут полностью на английском, поэтому решительно ничего не понятно, к тому же текст просто чудовищно маленький и сложночитаемый. Но меню готовки выглядит добротно. 

Лично мне с моим не очень хорошим знанием английского здесь делать нечего и может дождусь когда-нибудь официального перевода без русификаторов, которые здесь постоянно советуют... FTL же перевели всё-таки.

Поэтому пока не рекомендую. Хоть тут и крайне положительные отзывы, поэтому рискую нарваться... Но я хочу понимать, что здесь происходит и без установки сторонних улучшений.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039165368', 'num_games_owned': 413, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 2774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2473, 'last_played': 1644615996}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025848743', 'num_games_owned': 615, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 1222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1222, 'last_played': 1551469915}
review:
Basically, it's a typing game with a management sim underneath the hood. Serving customers earns money which needs to be invested in more food types which again helps attracting more customers. Some equipment can be bought to easen up demands. But at its heart is remembering letter sequences to type in quickly depending on the meals requested by the customers. Some foods will be staples on the menu due to their easy fulfillment, others due to their good revenue. Some foods need to be added to the menu when special guests announce their visit or to win bets.

Cook, Serve, Delicious is compelling... and repetitive. I like typing games, so I went all the way and played until I got the platinum rating and unlocked new game+. But playing to the end was a bit like work. Each of the 5 stars and unlocking the final platinum rating needs playing through 20 days. A set of 20 days is approx. 3.5 hours and altogether I served > 7000 customers. Some satisfaction was to be had but I'm through with it now and don't feel the need to get its successor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144431914', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1103, 'last_played': 1556478809}

author: {'steamid': '76561198278293337', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1655109164}
review:
感谢人美心善的Edwin大大送我一款这么有趣的打字＋模拟经营的烹饪游戏！

打字部分玩法有点类似小时候玩的一些益智类打字游戏，通过满足客人在屏幕下方写出的要求，按照食材首字母打字就可以做出满足客人条件的菜，反之如果少打或者多打食材会相应让顾客评价下降。
模拟经营部分是靠每天打字卖菜赚钱，开发新的菜式，让餐厅晋升星级，菜品和厨具都可以升级！非常耐玩！


画面有一点像4399小游戏……就是那种【打XX屁股】小游戏那个Flash画风……233333

下载好游戏的时候正好我定的鸭腿饭到了，一打开游戏我迷茫了，因为我好久不说英语了TAT！！英语是多么重要！！但是这个游戏对英语水平要求不高，客人的要求是具体的某个食材的名字，每个食材都用逗号隔开了，所以你只要按逗号分类，看每个逗号前面单词的首字母直接敲就行，然后本身这个游戏还挺学英语的，非常益智非常全年龄，老少皆宜！

然后玩了几局，前面有一点高重复性，一星升到二星好慢啊，看条件至少要敲20盘字……可是我鸭腿饭还没吃几口_(:з」∠)_我敲两盘退出来吃饭了……可以说，游戏的时候基本是没手吃饭的（现实吃饭）……客人一多起来就手忙脚乱=口=

author: {'steamid': '76561198137565296', 'num_games_owned': 66, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2862, 'last_played': 1693175935}
review: I was addicted to this game for long stretches of time over the past few years. If you like time management games (think Diner Dash) then you should check this one out. The goal is to build dishes as the chef (and sole person working the place) in level that start slow and get faster and faster. Keep the customers happy by completing each dish as quickly as possible. The game has depth and you can build your own menu, buy upgrades for your restaurants, and beat mini challenges. There are tons of little interactions all throughout the game, not to mention the PLETHORA of dishes you can choose from. Like I said, attention holding and 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994336693', 'num_games_owned': 2306, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 3611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1144, 'last_played': 1568271064}
review:
CSD is one of the few (or the only?) cooking time management game that ISN'T plagued by the modern epidemic of energy bars, gems, and levels that progress into the realm of impossibility unless you spend real money on upgrades and nonsense like that.

The game spices it up by including chores squeezed into your already frantic queue as well as cooking events outside of your restaurant. Enjoyable but demanding, CSD makes haphazardly slapping together a burger so oddly satisfying.

Oh and please please read the spam mail. So much funny.

[h1]7 / 10[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198023671892', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1568603309}
review:
Just realized I had this from a bundle. Glad I discovered it! I'm having a great time.

Each dish and chore is a fun micro-game that reminds me fondly of games like WarioWare. The larger management metagame is on the simple side, but it asks you to make impactful decisions-- and that's surely better than a complicated, meaningless series of choices.

It's good!

author: {'steamid': '76561198108270275', 'num_games_owned': 823, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 2662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1267, 'last_played': 1652042631}
review:
Comment passer d'un kiosque à bretzel à restaurant 5 étoiles dans une tour à bureau? Et bien c'est ici qu'on le découvre.

Un véritable jeu d'adresse, que ce soit au clavier ou avec une manette, qui nous met au défi de satisfaire nos clients jours après jours avec des nouvelles de plus en plus étoffées et complexes à réaliser, avec le stress des heures de pointes, des inspecteurs qui viennent assurer notre rapidité et notre qualité de service, des VIP qui veulent goûter à tout, des menus que l'on doit varier quotidiennement. Et ça, c'est quand on ne se lance pas nous même dans un concours télévisé ou dans un pari avec la compétition.

Ce jeu est tout simplement génial, avec une difficulté qui augmente automatiquement avec le jeu au fil des étoiles obtenues, mais que l'on peut également gérer à notre façon en débloquant de nouvelles recettes plus complexes ou avec une plus grande variété d'ingrédients. Bien que ce soit un peu répétitif, on reste littéralement scotché derrière notre comptoir pour remplir une journée, puis une autre, une autre encore, et pourquoi pas une petite dernière.

Oh, et une dernière pour la route.

Totalement addictif !!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198303993330', 'num_games_owned': 1425, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 3145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3145, 'last_played': 1558850389}
review:
When thinking about cooking games, what instantly comes to mind for most is a calming experience cooking food in a simulation-like manner, and very rarely does that mental image include anything resembling stress, rage, panic, and intense button mashing. Those things are exactly what Cook, Serve, Delicious is about and what at first looks like a casual game about running a restaurant reveals itself to be a stressful management sim that's less about the food and more about trying to keep calm as everything quite literally burns around you.

While it's not the most stunningly well made casual cooking game out there, Cook, Serve Delicious has got to be the best cooking game I've played so far - and I haven't played the sequel which I can only imagine is much improved. Everything feels fluid to play, the combos - especially on a controller, which is how I personally completed the game - are all very easy to execute and become almost like second nature with practice as the game goes on. It's a game that's not impossible to do consistently perfect on, but it takes a lot of practice to become comfortable enough with everything to achieve that perfection.

Cook, Serve, Delicious and its challenges start off slow and you're fully open to choose and customize what foods you want to serve. Picking harder foods will raise the challenge level, compared to purchasing easier foods to put on your restaurant's menu. If things are getting too challenging, adjust your menu accordingly and the game tones back down. Various bets and food-specific events will appear should you choose to take them, but you never have to. Cook, Serve, Delicious is a cooking game about playing your way, rather than doing what the menu tells you to do in the unrealistic way most cooking games play out their restaurant fantasy.

Once you've completed the main game, there's plenty of replay value that means Cook, Serve, Delicious will never really get old until you decide to play the sequel. While you have the option to replay the game itself, you can also replay the game in challenge mode for extra achievements or play the battle kitchen to practice combos with different foods and play against friends. No part of this game ever becomes dull unless you're someone who doesn't like repetitive grinding, but even then it takes a while to get to the point where you've comfortably learned everything, and there's always complex foods that will take you a while to master learning how to do.

From a visual standpoint, Cook, Serve, Delicious has everything down really well. The foods look realistic even if stylized and cooking different foods drop crumbs for visual effects, adding to the fast pace of the game. While it's not the most graphically detailed and accurate to real life game out there, for what it's worth and for the tone of the game it's a very fitting and perfectly done art style. There are sound effects and music to further amplify the pace and tone of the game, but for the most part I played with them off because they felt more distracting than helpful and I believe Cook, Serve, Delicious is a casual enough game great to be played with your own music going in the background without missing anything.

My only wish that would have made Cook, Serve, Delicious an even better game would be the addition for mods or custom content. I feel like the community could have come up with many more foods and challenges far beyond what the game has to offer already, and perhaps that's an option for when Cook, Serve, Delicious 3 comes out. I would absolutely love to see more games like this from the developer, and maybe games that expand into other popular casual game genres with the challenge twist I would trust Vertigo Gaming Inc. to implement.

To those who enjoy cooking games but feel as though the ones out there are too strict with their challenges or aren't challenging enough for them, Cook, Serve, Delicious is the answer to that craving. At this point in time there's a second game available as well for when the replay value has diminished that I highly would recommend getting the bundle for as well. It may not be the best or most impressive game out there, but I feel as though it definitely takes that top spot for this niche genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988931399', 'num_games_owned': 681, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 764, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 763, 'last_played': 1558903385}
review:
A really wonderful casual game, if you can keep pace with the customer orders and odd chores to keep your restaurant clean. The designers put some great thought into the way you prepare the various foods, drinks and deserts, though some that at a glance might seem easy to make are not, such as soup which is a real pain in the butt. Early on it was a bit frustrating not making much money for each day's work and saving up for new food items and equipment upgrades, but after a few hours playing you can really make bank, especially when you're at the 2 star level.

However, I just reached 3 stars and I might have hit my personal ceiling. As you rank up, the queue slots for tasks increases, meaning you have to get better prioritizing. I'm now at 7 task slots and it's crazy stressful, at least with fine steak, lobster, classy salads, and premium wines on the menu. Guess I could always go back to just serving chicken, pizza, and beer.

It is very helpful that you can try out foods before you buy them to see whether or not you like making them, though I wish the same were true for food upgrades. Extra game modes add some nice variety. I haven't tried the kitchen challenges yet, sounds sort of like Iron Chef, but most of the Catering Jobs, where you only have to do 2 dishes and get $25 for each serving, were a lot of fun and very lucrative.

The only negatives I found were the occasional robberies where you have to either make an accurate drawing of the robber  or you lose a bunch of cash, as well as a strange dating side feature which doesn't seem to lead to anything, at least so far.

4/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198106848235', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1676, 'last_played': 1706934539}
review:
Just as the visuals suggest, this game is very keyboard driven (with controller support, although I have never attempted to play with one), so if you feel your keyboard skills are a bit subpar, you might find this game to be frustrating. At least at first.
Cook, Serve, Delicious has difficulty settings to provide beginners a chance to teach themselves the rhythm, and to challenge experienced players to keep up with the chaos of the kitchen. You are only one pair of hands in the kitchen after all.
You could easily lose hours preparing food, fighting your way to the top and earning that last gold star, with several other challenges and goals mixed in to make the game play non-tedious and interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050041285', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1629200353}
review:
일하는 게임이다. 그런데 하다보면 자신도 모르는 사이 즐기고 있을 것이다.
왜냐, 원래 일이라는게 그렇거든.
일을 하면 결과가 나오고 성취감이 생기니까 재밌지.
단지 현실에서는 성취감 느끼기 전에 더럽게 힘드니까 느끼기 힘든거고.
여기서는 키보드만 누르면 음식이 나오지만 실제로는 칼질하고 뜨거운거 만지고 그래야 하니깐.
게임처럼 일하는데 힘들지 않았으면 세상 모든 나라가 도시마다 랜드마크가 있을거다.
그러면 지구는 좀 힘들겠다.
누가 헤어스타일로 장난친 기분일거 아냐.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047952830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1548792692}
review:
Kendinizin sahip olduğu bir restoranı yönettiğiniz bu oyun, basit gibi görünse de aslında öyle değil.

Kısaca açıklamam gerekirse, menülerden malzemelere kadar her şeyi geliştirerek kendi restoranınızı işletiyorsunuz.

MENÜ SEÇİMİ

Oyundaki en önemli mekaniklerden biri, doğru tuşlara basma becerisi ve hızlı sipariş hazırlama olabilir. Ancak menünüzü kendinize ve müşterilerinize göre özelleştirmek çok önemlidir. Oyunda çeşitli yiyecek ve içecekleri menünüze ekleyebilme şansınız olduğunda, her seçiminizin farklı gereksinimlere sahip olduğunu bilmelisiniz.

PARMAKLARINIZI HAZIR TUTUN

Hızlı düşünme ve hızlı hareket etme yeteneğinizi gerektiren bir oyun yapısı sunuyor. Menüdeki yiyecek ve içeceklerin yapılışını, boyutlarını ve diğer birçok kombinasyonunu ezberleyerek, müşterilerin isteklerine göre doğru seçimleri yapmanız gerekiyor. Bu, hafızanızı ve parmaklarınızı çalıştırmak için çılgın bir oyun deneyimi sunuyor.

STRESLİ BİR MACERA

Oyunda belirli saatlerde yoğunluğunuzun arttığı stresli anlar bulunmaktadır. Öğle saatleri ve iş çıkış saatleri gibi zamanlarda yoğunluk daha da artar. Öğle veya akşam saatlerinde ise daha sakin bir akışınız olabilir. Bu süreçte size kolaylık dilerim.

TEPKİ SÜRESİ

Oyunun hızı kadar tepki süresi de harika, isterseniz bilgisayarda, isterseniz mobil cihazlarda oynayın, sizi strese sokarken akşam dükkanı kapatırken veya yoğun saatlerin sonunda sizi güldürmeyi başarıyor. Muhteşem tepki süreleriyle size büyük bir motivasyon sağlıyor.

KAFANIZ BURADA OLACAK

Herhangi bir dikkatsizlik veya hata kabul etmeyen bu harika oyun, hızlı ve doğru çalışmanızı teşvik ediyor. Oyunu biraz öğrendikten sonra başarma hissi ve tatmin duygusu daha da yükseliyor.

BÜFTEĞİMİ 8 KEZ DÖVÜLSÜN, TUZSUZ OLSUN

Müşterilerin sıraya girdiği saatler genellikle en zor zamanlardır. Müşterilerin yemeklerini iyi pişirmeniz ve doğru boyutlarda içecek servisi yapmanız gerekmektedir. Aksi takdirde mem

nun kalmayabilirler veya daha da kötüsü, mutsuz olup en kötü notu verebilirler.

POLİS NEREDE?

Oyunda yan olaylar da eksik olmaz. Hijyen denetimi, alkol denetimi ve hatta hırsızlar gibi istenmeyen durumlarla karşılaşabilirsiniz. Neyse ki, bu sorunların çözümleri ilerleyen aşamalarda sunulmaktadır.

SONUÇ OLARAK

5 dakika oynayıp çıkabileceğinizi düşündüğünüz bir oyun, aslında 5 saatinizi içine çekebilecek kadar tatlı bir deneyim sunuyor. Pişman olmayacaksınız. Tekrar tekrar oynayarak saçınızın çıkacağı veya kalmayacağı bir oyun deneyimi yaşayabilirsiniz.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014163253', 'num_games_owned': 391, 'num_reviews': 388, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1541908602}
review:
[u][b]-Quick Review-[/b][/u]
Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a management crazy detailed restaurant simulator developed by Vertigo Gaming and released October 8, 2013. I found myself panicking and burning people's food more often than I'd like to admit.

[u][b]-Detailed breakdown review-[/b][/u]
[b]Story:[/b] Have you ever wanted to take a restaurant business from McDonalds cheap burger fast food joint, all the way up to Five-Star luxury restaurant? If that sounds interesting to you, Cook, Serve, Delicious' story will bring you in!
You run a zero star cafe (inherited from your Estranged Uncle Tod, I'm sure), to get to your first star these are the requirements: 1) Complete 20 Days of Service, 2) get x12 perfect combo on three seperate days, purchase six foods/drinks for your menu, 3) make over $100 in tips, 4) Pass a Saftey inspection, serve four foods in one day, 5) have at least 10% positive buzz from customers.

Now at last probably sounds daunting... it sure did for me. But I found myself chipping away at it very quickly, the longest one to get was the 20 Days of Service.

[b]Gameplay:[/b] test
For a Game "simply" about cooking food, there's a lot to unpack mechanically. You start your day by selecting between available food you can prepare in your restaurant, each food has pro's and cons, some work well together, others don't.

They all also require DIFFERENT actions to make food, so for getting someone a carbonated beverage, you tap [i](ha! pun!)[/i] to the right or left to choose the drink, and up and down to change the cup size, and hit "I" for ice [i](too easy? upgrade it so you can type B for "boost" to add a squirt of poison to the drinks)[/i].
And believe it or not that's one of the SIMPLER ones. some require getting into a rythem, like making Lasagna. I don't remember the key strokes, but it's like Pasta, cheese, sauce, x4. pcs pcs pcs pcs pcs BAM in the oven, let it cook, hit number key 2, BAM served.

There are even MORE factors that go into play, some foods preform better based on events and weather, there's this thing called "buzz" which will bring in more customers, there are two "rush hours" every day...

[b]Conclusion:[/b] I'm in a bit of an odd spot here. I highly recommend the game, Cook, Serve, Delicious! is obviously well developed, has tons of features, and plenty to keep someone interested...

But I've NEVER wanted to work in the food industry, I chose working at a Grocery store as a kid rather then working at a local restaurant. And even after being laid off, I considered working at a grocery store again, before restaurant work.

But again, I'm in this bizzare spot where I know the game is good, but I personally don't like it, I hate feeling like I'm working an actual job, rather then playing a video game. ...Again, I don't know what it is about the game that doesn't get me, but maybe I'll return it it sometime.

However... you, dear reader. If this game sounds interesting to you, by all means, pick it up and give it a try! Thanks for reading.

[b]Unscripted Thoughts Video:[/b]
https://youtu.be/3hWLT8PyQiY

author: {'steamid': '76561198003473030', 'num_games_owned': 353, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1545655847}
review:
Considering I have a high likelihood of setting the house on fire when making a simple piece of toast, trying to claim I have any culinary ability would simply be me stating a downright lie. That doesn't stop me from having respect for those that do have such a skill, however - not only do they have the ability to make magic under high pressure, but we all get the added bonus of being able to eat the results. Cook Serve Delicious is therefore here to perhaps let the culinary disaster zones like myself feel the joys of such a talent - but can it really manage to cook up a storm?

[h1]The heat is on[/h1]

Well, at the very least, it boils down the many tasks associated with being a chef into gameplay that's remarkably easy to understand. Put simply; people come into your restaurant and order food. Then you have to press the right buttons, sometimes in the right sequence and with the right timing, to give them that food. Even when the game starts by barraging you with information about 'buzz'  and much else besides, these basic ideas are something you can can firmly hold on to as you tap out your first few orders. 

Then rush hour hits.

Suddenly, each order stops being drip fed to you, and instead begin to fly at you at an almost frightening pace. Orders get burnt and customers get grumpy as you desperately work out how to put lettuce on a burger, and it all starts to feel a little bit impossible. Yet, given time, you begin to improve. You learn the button patterns, instil them into your muscle memory, and use your new found skills to finally fight against. the flood. Eventually rush hour becomes a challenge, but one that no longer seems impossible to survive, even when you have to hit warp speeds to simply stay ahead of the game. 

Obtaining this ability to keep your cool under immense pressure is where Cook Serve Delicious truly starts to come into its own. It's one of those titles where it's easily possible to enter 'the zone', where you're completing everything faultlessly with nary a conscious thought, only realising how much of a culinary God you actually are when the day ends. You'll keep going shift after shift seeking the thrill that perfection brings, your talents ever increasing, until the point you're feeling so good about yourself you begin to think an invitation to Masterchef must be heading your way in the post.

Reaching this point comes at a cost, however, that being in the sheer amount of repetition you have to endure to reach it. It comes with the territory, I suppose - the nature of being a chef will always involve making the same meals over and over, and realistically the only way to start doing every process on auto-pilot is by completing them a lot. Despite this, nothing changes the fact that there's only a set amount of times you can make an item before you slowly start going insane.

[h1]Repeated servings[/h1]

I, for instance, have made what feels like an infinite number of salads. Seriously, I've started seeing them in my sleep. If you put some salad front of me now, I'm not sure I could stop myself from running away from it screaming. My point is that things can start to feel a little stale at points, and if you're looking for a game that is always trying to make everything varied and exciting, you're probably in the wrong place.

To its credit, Cook Serve Delicious does desperately try and keep things as fresh as the meals you're serving. There's a good variety of food to purchase, with most being upgradable to more taxing variants, meaning there's always new things to learn and master. The previously mentioned 'buzz' system then adds a thin layer of strategy, forcing you to juggle around what you're serving to get the most people coming through the door. Finally, there's a bunch of brutal challenges modes to try your hand at, many of which are so difficult I'm uncertain any human mind could process them.

Yet even with all these additions, there are other little faults that really don't help matters. For one, and despite all the choice on offer, certain foods seem objectively better than others - offering minimal negative effect and consistently remaining an easy and reliable money spinner. Making progress and unlocking further tasks can also often feel laborious - you'll likely be tired of your current restaurant long before you can actually unlock the next, for instance. Then there's the bottom line; the sheer fact that, no matter how  many tweaks and adjustments the game makes, it all comes back down to making the same old food orders. If may take a while before your enjoyment levels start to wane, but when they do, your interest in the game is destined to drop sharply. 

Despite this, however, I keep finding myself consistently drawn back to the strange world of Cook Serve Delicious. I want that thrill of mastering order after order without breaking a sweat, and I do want to eventually achieve the lofty goal of getting a five star restaurant after hours of toil and heartbreak. It even makes me a great deal more interested in picking up the sequel, just to see what new features that may have up its sleeves. This may be a unique little title, then, but if you can think you stand the heat this is certainly a kitchen you should be getting into.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050075320', 'num_games_owned': 473, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1544937784}
review: So originally I just downloaded this to get the trading cards, but decided I'd keep an open mind. First, it is one of the most stressful yet fulfilling random games I've ever played. Once you get the rhythm, it's great. However, for someone with anxiety, it was terrifying and somewhat hilarious. Highly recommend if you feel like you want to enjoy some mental-stress torture while trying to run a restaurant. (Also 10/10, completely how working in food services feels.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197977773242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 523, 'last_played': 1544032479}
review:
Love it and hate it in equal measure. It's fun and addictive, but gradually becomes more of a job and less of a game... which would be fine if you were getting paid to play it... but paying to work? ... it's exhilerating during rush hour but kind of exhausting too... and yet it's weirdly compulsive.... you're stressed about what just happened, but you click on "Start New Day" anyway... this is some freaky sh*t :)
On a 100% positive though, for those of us that do have better paid and less stressful jobs, it really does make you appreciate your place in society more :)

The controls are (probably purposefully) un-intuitive and illogical. Serving customers is not fun, it just gets faster and faster. The basic concept of the game is kinda fine, I just hope they didn't ruin all these cooking games with mega-rush hyper-speed gameplay.

review:
[h1]Speed Memory with a restaurant theme[/h1]

Would be my description for this game. This is not a management game, it's a think-quick-and-press-buttons-fast game.

My problem with this game is that it drags on for too long. The gameplay just becomes a chore after a while, even after hours upon hours I was only at 3 stars out of 5. Then I quit.

I would recommend to get it on sale. Try it and if you don't like it you only lost 2,49, so who cares.

review:

식재료 단축키 지정해두고 주문 들어오는대로 순서대로 재료 쌓아서 굽고 타기 전에 꺼내서 손님에게 내놓으면 되는데, 재료가 많은 음식을 만들다보면 손가락이 꼬이는ㅠㅠ 그러다보면 복잡한 음식은 메뉴에 올리기도 싫은 지경이...

머리 많이 쓰지 않고 단순 노가다로 도전과제 채우고 싶은 분들께 추천하는 게임.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104365530', 'num_games_owned': 3373, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 2938, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2891, 'last_played': 1542683580}
review:
The great cooking challenge of our times.
First of all, the music is GREAT. Best music for the game itself, and really good to listen on it's own."Red salsa" is a favorite of mine.

The game itself is a restaurant "simulator". You take orders from your clients, make the different steps to cook the dish asked (some can take some extra time cooking, for example the pastas and the hamburgers), and then serve. When you serve the food it can take three levels, great, OK, and bad. Whenever you make a great dish, your combo augments in one, and you can bet on how many great dishes you serve for money.
Also you need to get up in the stars on your restaurant, by completing some tasks during the day.
There are different dishes, with a lot of recipes on everyone, and you cant take a menu of up to six for every day, choosing from the foods that you bought.

The game can be a challenge in many parts. I played trying to keep buzz at an all time high, which maybe is not necessary, and sometimes, with 99% buzz, is crazy to attend all the orders.
But everyday have that 'one more turn' feeling, and the way you make the dishes is really fun. The graphics are good, not in the quality sense, but in the style. I really dig the "depressed office" with funny hats of some of the workers who came to eat at my restaurant, and in some catering events.

The story is bare bones, but is there: a restaurant who fall in disgrace and got to get up to his former glory of a 5 star restaurant. During the game you discover new things to do, like a cooking tv show who invite you to participate, and the origin of the mysterious golden tickets.

The game itself doesn't have a lose state, or I didn't find one. At first it could be hard to get enough money to make all the upgrades that you might want, but after a while (When you reach three stars mostly) money is not a problem. The only downside to me is that, to upgrade the restaurant by one star, on every checklist you have to wait twenty days, and most of the time every other item on the checklist is easier to do than that, so you get stuck doing day after day only waiting for the days to pass.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032665087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1498339737}
review:
Gra o gotowaniu? Czemu nie! Gra, w której prowadzisz tytułową restaurację, tworzysz dania szybko stukając w klawisze i starasz się klienci wracali oraz żeby BHP ci nie gryzło w dupę. Gra ma też odrobinę warstwy strategicznej. Tworzysz menu w taki sposób, żeby twoi klienci przychodzili częściej. Z czasem dochodzą coraz to bardziej skomplikowane zamówienia, dania, wyzwania (cateringi, iron chef challenge).
Gra dla tych, co mają sprawną koordynacje ręka-oko.
Jest też sequel(też dobry) , ale ja polecam zacząć od jedynki.

Smacznego!

author: {'steamid': '76561198413884135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 3386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2997, 'last_played': 1599658716}
review:
[i]If you type like a T-Rex with 2 fingers, this game is not for you. [/i]

This is a good game to train your brain-eye-finger coordination. There are 2 different difficulty modes - standard and extreme difficulty. 

Not easy to get 100% achievement, that's for sure - you need to be very familiar with your keyboard. If you are using controller, I think it would be more difficult. At the time of writing this review, I am still short of 2 more achievements. 

[i]Tip: Based on my personal experience, it is easier to get achievements for "Food PIn" by playing "Extreme Difficulty" mode. [/i]

[b]100% Achievement?[/b] Yes but will take a long while, depending on how often you play and how good is your brain-eye-finger coordination
[b]Timer?[/b] Yes of course, you will be required to serve before the food gets removed from the sidebar. 
[b]Children Friendly?[/b] Yes, at least better than any Zombie killing games =.=

author: {'steamid': '76561198072488856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1667, 'last_played': 1639621759}
review:
This is a really addicting game! Though it seems like a simple typing game, you end up just racking your brain in trying to get all the food combinations and having to multi-task your next orders correctly. 
Funny thing is, this is one of those games that might give you stress during the gameplay, but you just feel so good finishing each day. Highly recommend (haven't tried CSD2 so can't compare the two).

author: {'steamid': '76561198838002672', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 854, 'last_played': 1541822704}
review: I really enjoy this game. The challenges increase in difficulty and keep the game interesting. There is not much of a story line here but the game doesn't need one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099939189', 'num_games_owned': 361, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2203, 'last_played': 1541937944}

it's just a simple typing game ... just chill and type until u get all the achievements :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198002508822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1498492025}
review:
It's just a plain Quick-Time-Event Simulator. That's it. 

I would really love for it to be something more than that. Other aspects of the game aren't deep or appealing enough to standout on their own. All this game is asking from the player is to grind QTE. Learn QTE. Grind more QTE. Until they either get sick of it or become a QTE wizard. In both cases however it will be a waste of time or money.

It looked fun from the distance. And it should of stayed there. Avoid.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991507114', 'num_games_owned': 1178, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 1247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1247, 'last_played': 1541853798}
review:
Wer Geschicklichkeits- und Gedächnisspielen etwas abgewinnen kann, dem ist dieses Spiel sehr zu empfehlen. Die Lernkurve ist sehr gut und das Spiel wird zunehmend schwerer je weiter das Restaurant upgegradet wird und je mehr Gerichte dazu kommen. Nur der Weg zwischen den Upgrades ist oft ein wenig grindig, da man meistens nur noch darauf wartet, die 20 Tage absolvieren zu müssen. Da hätten es 15 Tage auf jeder Stufe auch getan.

Ansonsten wird man aber für gut 15-20 Stunden unterhalten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202163516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1528900565}
review: As someone with (mild) dyslexia who is sometimes a bit slow at reading and processing informaiton, I couldn't really enjoy the game. Can't imagine how difficult it would be for someone with quite bad dyslexia! I can see it being a fun game otherwise but personally I wouldn't recommend if you struggle with reading quickly and processing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040884867', 'num_games_owned': 2418, 'num_reviews': 901, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1417137651}
review:
[b]At this point, just go for [i]Cook, Serve, Delicious! 2!![/i].[/b] But yes, these games are both fantastic and so wonderfully addictive. Playing local multiplayer with a significant other is just fantastic fun. There is a ton of content and it's all high quality. The price-point for these games is too low, as well. 

[b]One of the best (albeit lesser known) game series on Steam.[/b] A must-own.

author: {'steamid': '76561198355102131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 5110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 669, 'last_played': 1689280812}

review: I've been playing shitloads of cooking games. I don't know why, but I love those type of games. This one, I have to say, is the challenge I didn't think I needed. It's hard to pass a level without making a single mistake. The controls are a bit weird but it's something new!
