author: {'steamid': '76561198435157201', 'num_games_owned': 4787, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 3328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3328, 'last_played': 1540701045}
review:
[h1]通关感言[/h1]
谜之有意思的打字游戏。（从谜之声跑过来的玩家）
虽然做好了并不休闲的心理准备，但是为了通关，到现在已逾50个小时，可以说是令人咋舌了。去年我摔伤了手指，到现在还没有康复（其实是因为懒，没做复健，估计要康复得再动手术了），在这样一个物理手残的景况下，拿到这个游戏的全成就，我真是身残志坚了……
诚如评论区某位老哥说的，这游戏最优秀的地方，是成功地抓住了作为一个烧菜游戏最应该有的要点：那就是菜一定要[b]看起来好吃[/b]！如果一个厨房游戏没有琳琅满目的[b]菜谱[/b]和赏心悦目的[b]菜式[/b]来充实，我敢说游戏的乐趣能下降一半。
实际体验的时候，感觉却是有点问题的，从一星到四星的过程都非常紧凑，不断有新菜谱和事件出来给玩家以富有新意的刺激，但是到五星级餐厅以后，[b]菜谱终于被全部穷尽了[/b]，大部分事件也都结束，导致五星到铂金五星的这20天游戏开始变得[b]索然无味[/b]……从一开始的玩得停不下来到后来慢慢地感觉到这游戏成了我的负担（心累），不得不说和游戏节奏不太恰当有一定的关系。
[h1]关于Bug[/h1]
这游戏有个非常影响体验的Bug，就是存档的时候菜单的状态[b]没有完整地被保存下来[/b]。这是什么意思呢？比如说对于Crazy Dave Bet事件，如果[b]选好菜单[/b]、[b]Accept[/b]了以后，[b]关闭[/b]游戏再[b]重新打开[/b]，[b]读档[/b]并直接选择[b]开始[/b]，有可能明明[b]菜单已经符合了要求[/b]，但左上角提示Bet的[b]要求没有达到[/b]。这时候，必须要[b]读档[/b]后，[b]先打开菜单页面[/b]，然后[b]退出菜单页面[/b]再[b]选择开始[/b]新的一天。
这个Bug存在于很多事件中，包括：
[list]
    [*]Crazy Dave Bet
    [*]Robot Bet (Silver Tickets)
    [*]Cook4Luv
[/list]
[h1]关于坑点[/h1]
玩这个游戏的时候，被Cook4Luv这个事件坑成了狗，直接导致我在满足铂金五星的条件时，又多打了40天……这是因为，一开始完全没有意识到Cook4Luv需要选择正确的选项，所以遇到选项都根本不看，乱选两个。结果被Reject了三次。导致我明明已经达到通关条件了，还是不得不再等Cook4Luv轮回来。而且某次Reject还是因为前面提到的那个Bug[spoiler]（令人印象深刻）[/spoiler]。经过多次失败后，我总结出了一个经验，在这个事件，无论有没有成功上菜，在晚高峰后都会收到[spoiler]Love Letter[/spoiler]短信，这时应当留意短信的两个地方：
[olist]
    [*]短信的开头：你的对象会跟你说一段话，这取决于有没有成功上菜。比如如果菜单里没有ta要求的那个菜，ta会在这里说“我没看到我需要的菜！”，这时这次约会就妥妥地失败了，需要重开。如果前面的部分正确处理了，ta会在这里赞扬你的菜。
    [*]短信的结尾：如果你正确上菜了，那么这次约会成功还是失败就取决于你的选项了。而短信的结尾内容格式是固定的，如果你两个都选对了，你的对象会说“Goodbye see ya later”什么的，反之ta会说“Maybe we should break up ...”什么的，这时候你需要重开。
[/olist]
但总之，千万不能放任出错，然后被Reject，不然的话就要等下一次轮过来，这个过程异常痛苦，相信你不会想再来一遍。顺带一提，只要约会成功了，就会收到4个Golden Ticket，而成就完成的触发，就在你拿到最后一个对象的Golden Ticket时。
[h1]关于Extreme Difficulty[/h1]
非常坑爹的一个模式，所有人的耐心会直接为0，好在这个模式也就需要玩个20天左右就能拿到所有相关成就了，不然怕不是要被折磨死。最后一个拿到的相关成就是Impossible Perfect Day，我已经把我自己通关的视频上传了上来。理论上，使用指南里推荐的菜谱（咖啡、沙拉、热狗、蝴蝶面、鱼和龙虾），拿到200个以上的Combo是没什么问题的。
[h1]结语[/h1]
拜拜了您嘞，终于可以把这游戏从我的电脑上请走了[spoiler]（一脸衰样）[/spoiler]。

author: {'steamid': '76561198102020074', 'num_games_owned': 470, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 1402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1395, 'last_played': 1580041886}
review:
Juego extremadamente divertido y frenético que convierte el enfoque táctico de previos simuladores de cocina y lo transforma en un arcade con un completísimo sistema de riesgo recompensa. El game over es inexistente, por lo que el fracaso/victoria se resume a qué tanto quieras optimizar tu run del juego en términos de duración y beneficios diarios, lo cual le quita algo de tensión... Pero lo compensa con divertidísimos modos extra y muchas recetas, cada una más novedosa que la anterior, y mejoras a viejas recetas que les añaden nuevos ingredientes. 

Mi única queja es que la asignación de teclas por defecto en algunos platos es confusa (un mismo ingrediente se asigna a teclas distintas en platos distintos debido a que hay overlapping entre nombres de unos y otros, lo cual da lugar a innecesaria frustración) y que algunos de los minijuegos no se prestan a hacerse en un ambiente en el que estás tan apresurado (el de desencorchar vino y el del pinchito por ejemplo)

author: {'steamid': '76561198234044152', 'num_games_owned': 460, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 4807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4512, 'last_played': 1537888605}
review:
全成就解锁撒花评测。

这是个很不错的打字游戏i，循序渐进解锁新的内容，使得游戏的难度和复杂度逐渐提升，内容比较丰富，音乐配图和邮件内容也比较精彩。

这个游戏带给我最大的收获可能是下面两个：第一，学到了很多新的关于食材和美食的英文单词和表达方式。第二，锻炼快速打字过程中眼手脑协调能力。游戏过程大致是眼睛看到菜单（菜名、所需食材）大脑分析键位后左右手分区打字配合完成。经过练习现在很容易可以做到在最高难度下全perfect过关。受益真的很多。

游戏时长70小时（全成就）专心做成就的话肯定用不到这么多

给个推荐，另外Cook，Serve，Delicious！2 也早已发售了，我初步体验了一下，内容比较1代补充了不少，感兴趣的也可以尝试一下。下一步我可能要去认真玩2代啦。

author: {'steamid': '76561198859402795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1775, 'last_played': 1538417108}
review: Think guitar hero only instead of playing songs, you're serving food.  This game is super addicting and I would highly recommend to anyone who likes rhythm style games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118005728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 563, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1537773067}
review: Cook, Serve, Delicious! gets repetitive and boring real quick. The graphics are meh, music is annoying and the gameplay is repetitious and not fun. Most restaurant sims that I've played have upgrades to customize the restaurant. This only has passive upgrades that are pretty worthless. Get it in a bundle like I did or super cheap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098257938', 'num_games_owned': 555, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 1651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1651, 'last_played': 1590317208}
review:
[h1]"Finally, some good f*cking food!"[/h1] [b]- Гордон Рамзи[/b]

Замечательный симулятор шеф-повара и менеджера в сфере кулинарии. Это такая игра, в которой приятно находиться, не смотря на то, что планируешь расслабиться, а на деле напрягаешься по максимуму. И тем не менее, это сильно доставляет. 

Сюжетное развитие такое: начинаем свой путь обычным поваром, в каком-то стрёмном месте, подавая джанк-фуд сомнительным товарищам. Зарабатываем кэш, совершенствуем как бизнес, так и личные навыки готовки, поднимаясь по карьерной лестнице до мастера в 5-ти звёздочном ресторане. [spoiler]Papa Franku will be pleased.[/spoiler]

На первый взгляд игра кажется простой в усвоении: посмотрел/понял как всё устроено, что и как работает и т.д. Однако, игра бросает настоящий челлендж, заставляя вас потом и кровью познавать все прелести самосовершенствования, идеального приготовления и обслуживания огромного количества посетителей, а также чувствуя боль мышц кистей после долгого зависания в игре. А ведь это работает, чувствуешь словно на самом деле весь день кашеварил кулинарные шедевры. И да, чтобы игрок не расслаблялся, весь процесс идёт в ускоренном режиме, успех которого зависит от того, как быстро вы реагируете на заказ очередного клиента, как сильно вы отбиваете мясцо и правильно его приправляете. Как громко вы кричите (можно просто в голове) аки бурят, [strike]разрубая катаной[/strike] разделывая рыбу, попутно накладывая 100500 слоёв лазаньи и пиццы, не путаетесь в [b]ХДВ[/b] [spoiler]хорошее дешёвое/дорогое вино[/spoiler] и варите чертовски [strike]с*ку сложный[/strike] вкусный супчик для [b]VIP[/b] и не только. Сытые клиенты - счастливые клиенты ($) [spoiler]С*ка, курица остыла![/spoiler]

У игры очень приятный визуальный и музыкальный стиль, от которого не устаёшь, а желание задержаться ещё "на денёк" только усиливается. Да, от игры сложно оторваться.

Если вы любитель вкусно покушать, а поход в ресторан нечто большее, чем просто излишки материального благополучия, то игру стоит попробовать (на вкус, ага). Поначалу, "хардкорный" темп может отпугнуть своей непривычностью, но уверяю вас, чем дальше, тем лучше и веселее, главное не сдаваться. Кликайте, нажимайте, готовьте, развивайтесь, говорите/кричите/смейтесь в монитор как хотите и что хотите, а воображение дорисует всё то безумие пылающей кухни само. 

[h1]- "Пудинг - красавчик?"[/h1]
[h1]- "Пудинг... да-а-а... красавчик... хе-хе-хе."[/h1] [b]- Константин Ивлев[/b] 

[h1]Моя оценка:[/h1] [b]8 из 10[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198025647144', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 1707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1313, 'last_played': 1590151850}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious! m'a été offert, et je ne m'y serais certainement pas intéressé autrement. Pourtant il m'a fait passer un excellent moment.
C'est un jeu où vous alternez des phases de gestion-lite (acheter et développer des plats, concevoir son menu, prendre des paris...), avec des phases de pure adrénaline qui consistent essentiellement à enchaîner des QTE pour préparer des plats dans un restaurant bondé.
Au début, cela peut paraître difficile, surtout que le débit des clients est un peu fort pour un débutant, mais rater quelques commandes n'est pas si pénalisant et vous pouvez composer votre menu à votre guise pour progresser peu à peu en commençant par les plats qui vous vont le mieux. Rapidement, vous verrez, vous enchaînerez les "perfect days" et irez chercher les plats plus compliqués pour gagner plus d'argent et ne pas vous ennuyer lors de vos journées dans votre restaurant de plus en plus fréquenté.
Un jeu simple, mais pas si évident à maîtriser, un peu répétitif sur de longues sessions mais très addictif (allez, mon menu est prêt, encore un jour et puis je vais me coucher... comment ça il est 2H du matin ?).

author: {'steamid': '76561198069159152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2402, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1537408931}
review:
This is a restaurant simulation game, sort of like one of those cooking games that was on Facebook years ago. This one is rather intense, but still a very fun game... once you get the hang of it. Seriously, the rush hours and some of the other events can be very stressful.

Not sure how true it is to the restauranteur experience, but still...

author: {'steamid': '76561198131516091', 'num_games_owned': 2698, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 5070, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5044, 'last_played': 1681657370}
review:
저는, 재택근무를 자주 합니다. 따라서 필연적으로 집에서 식사하게 될 일이 많은데, 제 아내는 집안일을 무척 귀찮아하는 경향이 있습니다. 물론 여기에는 요리도 포함됩니다. 따라서, 이미 20여 년간 외식을 하며 살았던 제게 절실한 것은 바로 가정요리였는데... 현실은......... (말잇못) 아, 잠깐 눈물 좀 닦고. 

아무튼 부실한 반찬, 가끔 생산되는 쌀밥에 지쳐가던 찰나, 제 라이브러리에서 몇 년째 묵혀두었던 이 게임이 생각나서 아내에게 추천해줬습니다. 혹시나 이 게임을 통해 아내가 요리에 대한 재미를 깨닫는다면 얼마나 좋을까 하고 기대했었죠. 

트레일러를 본 아내는 일견, '재미는 있겠네. 시간날 때 해볼게.'라 말하고는 이 게임을 설치도 하지 않고 그저 '즐겨찾기'에 등록만 해두었습니다. 그리고 아내가 설치하기까지는 약 한 달이 흘렀습니다. 어느 날 불현듯 생각났는지 설치를 하더군요. 

그리고 과감한 실행!

.............아내는 처음에 4가지 메뉴에 음료수 자판기로 시작했습니다. 음료자판기의 악랄함(+저렴함)에 치를 떤 아내는 순식간에 음료수는 맥주로 통일한다고 선언했습니다. 그리고 보기에도 살찔 거 같은 튀김과 맥주요리를 손님들에게 선보였습니다. ...튀김도 하루이틀이라야 말이죠. 가게에는 기름짠내가 진동했고, 선호도는 사정없이 떨어졌습니다. 아내는 그제야 메뉴의 다양성에 눈길을 돌렸습니다. 바로 샐러드입죠. 그리고 아내의 샐러드 찬양이 시작되었습니다.

다음날 아침, 저의 식단은 양배추 샐러드에 방울토마토가 올라간 것이었습니다. 
이것이 일주일간 지속되었습죠. 

샐러드가 비록 건강식이긴 하나... 이것만으로는 장사가 되지 않는다는 것을 파악한 아내는 라자냐에 도전하기로 했습니다. 그리고 열심히 모니터를 보며 라자냐 레시피를 연습한 다음, 가게메뉴로 라자냐를 꺼내들었습니다. 라자냐는 꽤 잘 팔리는 거 같더군요. 

그리고 그날 저녁, 저희 집에는 웬 라자냐 포장지가 입고되었습니다. 보니까 대충 8000원 정도던데, 양은 그다지 많지 않아 보이더군요. 하지만 반조리식품이라 손이 거의 가지 않는 것이 장점 같았습니다. ...맛은... ㅅㅂ ... 생략합니다.

그리고 계속 게임을 하던 아내는 이제 스파게티에 눈을 돌렸고, 그날 저녁 저희집에선 스파게티면이 브랜드별로 정모를 가졌습니다. 그 다음날에는 해외 나가서 사왔던 스파게티소스들이 국제 모임을 열었다고 들었습니다. 스페인, 포르투갈, 이탈리아, 독일, 터키, 일본, 대만....... 세상에 종류도 무척 다양하더군요.

그리고 그 날 저녁은..... 물론, 말 안 해도 아시겠지요?





근데, 이 모든 일은... 아내가 이 게임에 질렸을 무렵, 게임과 함께 사라지고 말았습니다. 





......2편도 사야 하나.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059898309', 'num_games_owned': 4768, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 4056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4056, 'last_played': 1517941115}
review:
[h1]önsöz:[/h1]

-bir şiş kebap lütfen
...
-buyrun
-bu ne biçim şiş kebap!
-anlayamadım?
-iki soğan arasında domates var, ben iki domates arasında soğan olandan istemiştim!
-?!?

bir alışveriş merkezinde lokanta işleteceğiz.
amacımız, kazandığımızı dükkana harcayıp dünya çapında bir şefe dönüşmek.

[h1]mekanikler/oynanış:[/h1]

oyun, restoran simülasyonu kılığında, harika bir klavye-egzersiz aracı.
müşterilerin istedikleri yemekleri, malzemelerin kısayollarını kullanarak hazırlıyoruz.
müşterilerin istedikleri yemekleri fare kullanarak hazırlamak da mümkün ama bu sadece acı ve başarısızlık olarak size dönüyor.

oyunda mali konulara fazla kafayı takmıyoruz.
parayı harcayabileceğimiz ana kalem, yeni yemek tarifleri/malzemeleri alıp yeteneklerimizi/yemeklerimizi geliştirmek.
ilerleyip dünya çapında bir şef de olsak, restoranda tek başımıza çalışıyoruz; aşçılık, garsonluk, temizlikçilik, hepsi bizde.

oyun aynı zamanda, stres eşiğimizi defalarca sınıyor.
"rush hour" denen yoğun saatlerde normalden çok daha seri çalışmamız gerekiyor.
çorbaya kereviz doğrarken tuvalet tıkanıyor, onu temizlerken beyaz atlet kekonun teki lazanya istiyor, biriken çöpleri dökerken dükkan soyuluyor, adamın eşkalini tarif ederken çorba taşıyor vs.

[h1]sonuç:[/h1]

cook, serve, delicious! inanılmaz eğlenceli bir oyun.
klavye hızınızı geliştirmek istiyorsanız, stresle baş etmede sorununuz yoksa mutlaka oynamanızı tavsiye ederim.

-bir lazanya lütfen
...
-buyrun
-bu ne biçim lazanya ulan!
-pardon?
-kıyması az olmuş!
-pscrpscrpscr!

author: {'steamid': '76561198067404510', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1711, 'last_played': 1669591568}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious is a fun, addicting excercise in paying attention, multi-tasking and not screwing up. It offers just the right amount of challenge, where finishing a perfect day feels worthy of a victory dance. You must perform quick button presses to create recipies, all while juggling multiple orders and chores like toilet and dish cleaning to boot.

With options to upgrade your equipment and food for even more challenge and variety, there's enough progression to keep the interest there as you go about attempting to complete day after day. In addition to that, you can take a break from the daily rush and get your anxiety and blood pressure going with various fun cooking challenges. 

It's a well-made game with a charming artstyle and great music. At the very least it'll make you appreciate those short-order cooks just a little bit more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198834599587', 'num_games_owned': 427, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1531460127}
review: I bought this game on the Steam Summer Sale really looking forward to playing this game. One of my favorite genres in mobile games and PC games has been cooking management based games so I was hoping to enjoy this game, but this one was not for me so I ended up requesting a refund. The reason I did not enjoy this game was the fast-paced learning curve, the more complex recipes from the beginning, and the punishing game mechanics such as menu rot, and a variety of other negatives based on the type of food the item was. Overall it led to an unfun experience for me when I prefer these types of games to be a little more casual than this game was. The type of person who will enjoy this game will be the kind looking for fast pace, complexity, and more things to manage at once. It is not a poorly put together game, it is just not a game that appealed to me personally. I am not recommending this game based on my personal experience and preference, but I would recommend it for those who like cooking games to give it a try. If you don't like it you can always request a refund if you find you don't like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092451271', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1567, 'last_played': 1536539983}
review:
This game is addictingly fun.

I love cooking games and this is one of the best, by far.

It's so satisfying when you can do a day of perfect orders, and the difficulty curve is great, working you up nicely till your day becomes constantly pressing keys like you're playing typing of the dead. You get to decide what types of food are your favorites and you can upgrade them to make it as varying in recipies and difficulty as you like.

The sounds and visuals are adorable, and heck, the music's not bad either.

10/10.

review:
Play this if your life does not have enough stress and anxiety. It literally spices up your life

(Seriously, get it though, it's quite fun)

review: If you like cooking games like papa's pizeria or bush hot dogs you will surely enjoy this one although it's mechanics work a bit different. In this game you are the owner of a restaurant and you are trying to earn stars to do so you use the money you earn in the game to buy supplies and different cooking devices.Best thing in this game lots of food to choose from : Hoto Dogus, Pretzels. Hamburgers, Fries, Kebab, Pizza and a lot more. Worst thing "The Rush Hour" and the serious munchies you get.

author: {'steamid': '76561198298972288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1530773626}
review: It was fun while It lasted, trying out the different modes and the menus. It's quite hard for someone like me with slow reaction when the rush hour comes. Amusing game to entertain you for quite sometime. I love cooking games and my boyfriend knows that and gifted me this to try It out. alas, wasn't really my cup of tea. 11/10 would recommend someone with good memory and fast reaction time unlike me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009961300', 'num_games_owned': 683, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1532803968}
review:
I think the thing that sets this apart from other similar games is hotkeys. Man does it beat clicking and dragging or tapping and swiping. There's also a very satisfying punch sound effect when adding ingredients to a dish. That, in combination with a mechanical keyboard just feels right.

I would say that there is a bit of lag during rush hour which can either be frustrating (when trying to complete chores quickly), or helpful (like when you're struggling to remember to press up to make the drink size go up, I don't know why I have trouble with that), but I'm sure that could be helped by lowering quality from the highest. I kept meaning to try it out to see if it helps, but I kept getting sucked into the next day and the next challenege.

10/10 It just feels right

author: {'steamid': '76561198052309645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 241, 'playtime_forever': 2725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2664, 'last_played': 1523751994}
review:
I didn't see it coming. I didn't want to play one of "those" cooking games. Still I decided to give a chance to Cook, Serve Delicious.

I didn't see it coming! This is not what I expected. What I got was a cooking game that defied my every bit of capacity and attention. It is a very challenging game.

It all depends on your own ability. You can play and get to the end of the game if you're not so good, you just won't be able to make your restaurant the best. If you're a master chef, you'll be able to invest your money and upgrade everything. 

There's also a lot of other things going that are very interesting, like relationships, contests, robberies, crowd funding, etc...

It's kinda hard to fully give the idea of what this game is. But in short: challenging, rich in content and very, very fun.

8/10

review:

Resumo: Cook,Serve,Delicious e um jogo que lembra aqueles joguinhos em flash que a gente jogava quando tinha 10 anos chegava da escola e ia direto entrar em sites e flash jogar, porém ele tem muitas coisa que diferencia desses jogos, como por exemplo o sistema de upgrade que apesar de simples funciona muito bem, tem comida no seu restaurante que você so consegue fazer depois de comprar um especifico utensilio de cozinha, o cardápio muitos jogos em flash você nao escolhe o cardapio, ja no CSD você que faz seu cardapio com 4 tipos de alimentos ou bebida(no começo) e todos esses alimentos você tem que comprar para ser liberado, e um ponto importante que tem umas comidas especiais que voce vai liberando de acordo de como voce vai jogando.
Outro ponto importante e que o jogo tem umas missões que ele vai te dando para voce comprir, por exemplo: fazer um dia perfeito sem errar isso aumenta mais ainda o conteudo do jogo.
E para finalizar essa analise o jogo alem do "Modo história" tem outros modos como alguns challenges diarios e samanais onde tem uns desafios que voce tem que cumprir para tentar chegar ao topo do Leadbord.

O jogo e muito bom e recomendo comprar se você quer passar o tempo com algum jogo diferente ou relembrar sua infancia com aqueles jogos de cozinha em flash, só que com um jogo mais completo

author: {'steamid': '76561198034130561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4796, 'last_played': 1536375095}

author: {'steamid': '76561198026461767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 217, 'playtime_forever': 857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 857, 'last_played': 1509251147}
review:
I got more hours out of it than I intended. It's a delightfully addictive management sim that had a nice learning curve to it. A lot of time it felt challenging, but not overwhelmingly so. The game revolves around a series of tasks that any restaurant owner would do in the course of a day. As the owner, you're tasked with triaging tasks so that you can maintain a clean restaurant while cooking great food. The end goal is to meet goals to have a five-star restaurant. 

The climb to getting it was fun, and the upgrades to both food quality and equipment were worth going from day to day. Random events also keep it spicy. But in 2018, you're better off trying the sequel first. The mechanics have stayed largely the same, but there's more variety in things to cook and clean. But if you're a fan of good management games, I can't recommend this game enough. But I think the second game is just more of the same of this - not a great thing for fans of the first, but great for people who haven't played CSD1.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988078429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1511900632}

author: {'steamid': '76561198104194390', 'num_games_owned': 785, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1558732538}
review:
[h1]Soy mentor en Steam!![/h1]
[url]http://store.steampowered.com/curator/31570421/[/url]

'Cook, Serve, Delicious' un simulador de restaurante que da libertad total sobre lo que el jugador quiere para su propio negocio.

El juego se centra en un viejo y deteriorado restaurante que era el corazón de un gran edificio, hasta que tuvo que cerrar sus actividades tras una caída histórica en las ventas. Pero la creciente economía local y con la ocupación del edificio al completo, trae de vuelta el negocio y tenes completo control para devolverlo a su status de comidas cinco estrellas de clase mundial.

Para ello, empezarás con unos pocos miles de dólares y treinta platos para elegir y confeccionar tu menú así como el equipamiento del restaurante y más. Casi todo esta desbloqueado desde el principio para poder adquirirlo; es tu restaurante y debes averiguar cual es la mejor estrategia a seguir para tener el local lleno de clientes.

Y si no fuera suficiente, además tendrás la oportunidad de ser seleccionado para participar en el programa de televisión El Cocinero de Hierro, ser jefe de cocina en fiestas privadas, recibir correos de clientes mostrando consejos o puro spam según les guste tu dirección y muchas cosas más.

¿Quieres poner a prueba tus dotes culinarias?

author: {'steamid': '76561198042941966', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1159, 'last_played': 1530136014}
review:
I don't play this types of games at all, but I saw a streamer play it and it looked interesting enough so I bought it on sale.  Boy, I never thought I'd fall in love with a game like this so quick, let alone play it.  I immediately got addicted to this game, like no other before.  I must of played a few hours stright off the bat, which wasn't so good when I had to go to bed and now my dreams were filled with trying to fullfill orders.

I found great satisfaction with trying to master every order and put together long perfect combos.  I felt like I was actually running my own resturant and had to make tough choices with what to put on the menu.  One of the better parts of the game (which they took out in the 2nd game) was they gave you bonus objectives in which you could purchase to try and win big money for certain combos in a row.  There were 2 variations of it, the first one you got e-mail challanges where a guy would list a goal for you and you decided if you wanted for pony up some of your own money and go for the goal.  If you failed then you lost your invested money, if you won you doubled your money.  The other version always had a bonus objective available to you.  It basically would always list certain ingredients, and if you were to accept you had to use all  those ingredients and get whatever perfect streak they ask of you.  In doing this you spent a valuble ticket which were hard to come by, and if you failed then you lost your ticket and had to wait until u got another.  All of this just made everything feel more meaningful.  

I love the fact that this game really makes you hone in your keyboard skills (if you use one).  I've always been pretty decent  at the keyboard, but this will make you master it.  I've always been good with the letter keys, but I wasn't as strong in using my 1-7 keys.  I'd constantly push the wrong buttons, but with hours and hours of practice you start to master it, and that is very satisfying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020258212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1529818499}
review:
小七店員模擬器
不只要煮食物和煎食物，還要清理廁所、丟垃圾、洗碗盤

+可以自訂快捷鍵

-要讓餐廳升等需要的精力和時間會比較久
-對手速不快的玩家很不利

author: {'steamid': '76561198153152943', 'num_games_owned': 41, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1529850171}
review:
I'm a huge fan of cooking games, so I couldn't pass on this - but Cook, serve, delicious is in most aspects way worse than most browser/cellphone cooking games.
Graphics is real bad, unpolished, doesn't even let you pick a resolution, no ultrawide support; controls are clunky and slow; work days are long with boooring free time between one customer and the other; the whole game basically consists of memorizing the key bindings for each recipe. Dishes look/sound disgusting most of the times.
The coolest thing about cooking games is having to run across a kitchen while keeping track of 10 different delicious preparations, but all of that is lost with this static, sequential system.
Also, you need to play 20 days just in order to get a star (that's about 3 hours of gameplay), even if by day 8 you fulfill all other requirements.
Only worth the 80% off price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037513710', 'num_games_owned': 486, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 1978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1626116412}
review: Definitely fun and keeps you engaged with upgrading your restaurant, changing your menu, upgrading food items (which in turn adds complexity to preparing them), and keeps you on your toes with betting on perfect days (no mistakes) and quick service (getting food out fast for higher tips)... BUT, the progression is AGONIZINGLY slow, requiring a minimum number of days before upgrading your restaurant, even when all of the other goals are completed. Fun game, but I definitely did not want to slog through it for hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087450353', 'num_games_owned': 351, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1120, 'last_played': 1623448495}
review: Had a surprising amount of fun playing this - kind of relaxing but really stressful at the same time, as the game is balances slower times with rush hour well. It isn't exactly an accurate or realistic cooking simulator, but the mechanics are just good fun, and the sense of progressing your restaurant is truly satisfying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048809163', 'num_games_owned': 1184, 'num_reviews': 191, 'playtime_forever': 954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1603089789}
review:
調理、提供、うまい

事前にメニューに載せた料理を客が注文してくるので手早く調理して提供するゲーム
近いゲームだとプレイステーションの『俺の料理』にかなり似ている
ただ向こうほどスティックなどでの繊細な操作ではなく
客の細かい注文のトッピングやサイズ選択に対してボタンを押す感じだ
ただ料理だけでなく、皿洗い、自身のトイレ、ネズミ取りの罠設置、ゴミ捨て等の雑用もある

稼いだお金で設備をアップグレードしたり新しい料理のレシピも得ることができる
・・・料理結構オーソドックスなのが多い（フライドポテトとか）から
金払って習得するのに若干違和感があるが、まぁそこはゲームだし
原材料とかご都合主義で考えておきますかね

昼間と日没後には恐怖と稼ぎ頭のラッシュアワーがある
ラッシュアワーになると３～６つ常時オーダーが出るくらい大忙しになる
しかも人件費をケチっているので一人で切り盛りしないといけない
操作になれるまでは６スロット全部に料理をセットせず２～３品目ぐらいから初めて慣らしていくか
作り置きされているプレッツエル等をセットしておくといいかもしれない

日本語は残念ながらなし、システム的にMODも難しい模様
しかしトッピングで８割型TomatoならTと言ったように頭文字のアルファベットが連動してるので
むしろ英語で問題ない

・・なのだが１つだけ個人的に辛い要素がある、それは強盗イベント
所持金のいくばくかを持っていかれ、犯人の特徴が『文章で表示される』
キーの左右で顔パーツを選んで決定！で逮捕あるいは逃走
正直パーツ数と項目が多いのでかなり面倒・・ラッシュアワー時に来ないのがせめてもの救いだが
このイベントが来ると結構ESC押してやり直してます
まぁ、500$でセキュリティ強化できますので解放できるようになったら早めにするといいですよ

author: {'steamid': '76561197980796094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 435, 'playtime_forever': 662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 662, 'last_played': 1447079354}
review:
Hectic time management game about cooking! The mechanics are al dente, the looks are mouth watering and the sound design is well done. Between cooking challenges, upgrading your business, feeding customers, putting doable menues together and sanitizing the toilets there is this awesome feeling waiting at the end of the evening rush hour. Had a lot of fun with this one. 

Follow my curator at https://store.steampowered.com/curator/28337205-Fair-Minded-Witness/

PS: As a bavarian myself, I can tell you, noone eats Brezn with cinnamon. That's just wrong...

author: {'steamid': '76561197966511621', 'num_games_owned': 1215, 'num_reviews': 609, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1526586636}
review: This is not a restaurant simulator, it's an action game. You press the right keys or click on items with the mouse. It's quite similar to Papers, Please where you have to go through a series of motions for each 'customer'. I wouldn't recommend it because the clickable area is too small, the menus are confusing and they use stupid icons instead of text for the characteristics of food items. You have to hover over them to actually see what they mean, it's such a bizarre design choice. The worst thing is that you have to play like 24 'days' to be able to earn a single star. The gameplay isn't interesting enough to warrant that amount of repetition.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074500153', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 3707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2854, 'last_played': 1617147593}
review: Amazing game. I still play it every now and again when I need something satisfying. I will always recommend this game. I actually prefer this game to the 2nd installment in the franchise.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972099476', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1506, 'last_played': 1514849426}
review: Extremely well done combo of cooking game and typing tutor - lots of fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000610228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1417066226}
review: At first this game looked really pointless and boring tbh, that was until I played it.  The gameplay is quite simple and extremely addictive and a great time-waster game.  The gameplay revolves around running a restaurant and serving dishes, each dish has its own method of production and/or ingredient list which requires you to add the correct ingredients or properly prep the dish in order to correctly fill the orders.  While seemingly a boring and repetitive idea, it ends up being very engaging and addicting, especially later in the game when your business gets popular and the orders flow in at breakneck pace.  All in all a very fun game that is definitely worth its price tag.

review: I've always liked cooking games but a lot of them aren't challenging enough so they get old quickly. So Cook, Serve, Delicious was really a blessing to me and I particularly enjoy doing the bets and chasing for the combos. Making the combinations for the daily menu also keeps it interesting. There's side events too

review: It's an addicting cooking sim / restaurant management game but it does get stale quicker than I'd like and is somehow both easy and difficult at the same time.  Give it a try, it's one of the more fun "job" games I've played in a while and it does a good job of rewarding efficiency, attentiveness and forethought.

author: {'steamid': '76561198353418549', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 450, 'last_played': 1693860968}

author: {'steamid': '76561198086172837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1337, 'last_played': 1590587766}
review:
Brilliant, frustrating, time sucking game!
This isn't like other restaurant sims where you click a few buttons and watch the money trickle in. No way Jose! This game will have you furiously mashing your buttons praying you get the order right while watching your other orders slowly burn to a crisp. As frustraing as it is, you always end up going back to tackle that challenging dish - I'm looking at you soup!

If you like a challenge and don't mind some hardcore keyboard abuse then this is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138037627', 'num_games_owned': 436, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2097, 'last_played': 1700149023}
review:
홀 담당은 모든 주문과 손님을 딜레이 없이 받아서 주방장인 우리들의 손만 고생하는 게임

음식의 질림이나 날씨, 조리 시간, 고액의 팁을 계산하면서 메뉴짜는게 의외로 재미있다

AAA게임에 조금 물리면 이게임을 해보는걸 추천

review: I love this game, but one of the challenges ( potatoe of shame) is broken and It's the only achievement I need for a platinum star restaurant. Still a great game though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198233981596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 962, 'last_played': 1661455799}
review: Cook, Serve, Delicious is a good game, I think. I found its content as peculiar as its title, with just the right amount of things to manage, and very fun sequences of cooking (which is really important in that kind of game). You need to be concentrated, and it's not always easy to deal with all the orders, but it's not hardcore, and casual players would certainly like it. If you fancy that kind of game, you will appreciate CSD.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145658063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1522670719}
review: 金山打字通精神续作

author: {'steamid': '76561198019332496', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2025, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1052, 'last_played': 1679158036}
review:
Great fun.

The game concept is fresh and amusing. The early game is challenging, but not too hard, meaning that most people will progress quite well. The later gameplay is VERY hard.

The multitasking, split second timing, organisation, and fast decision making will leave your head spinning.

You start with a 1-star restaurant, and progress to a 5-star restaurant as you gain skills. It's well worth the money. The developer has obviously got good ideas, a fun sense of humour, and is active in supporting the game. Top stuff!

author: {'steamid': '76561198092286970', 'num_games_owned': 391, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 3199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2464, 'last_played': 1602859461}
review:
I've always been a fan for those high stakes gestioning cooking games, but at some point you become so used to the mechanics, it is very long even in the hardest ones in infinite mode to reach that peaks "in the zone" you're looking for.

Cook, Serve, Delicious! does that beautifully. You are from the get go in Extreme mode in the zone and it is amazing. Every inch of the game is meant to challenge you in the most satisfying way possible. I cannot think of anyone who likes this genre to not pick this game up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198304877890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1562457466}
review: Un muy buen y desafiante juego de time managment de restaurantes, lo recomiendo mucho.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042460330', 'num_games_owned': 2705, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1527442848}
review:
There's a lot of addictive substances in this world... nicotine, heroin, coke, etc... but none are as wholeheartedly addicting as Cook, Serve, Delicious!

I don't feel like this game needs too in depth a review (I mean, it's a cooking game - most people have played one).  All you need to know is that Cook, Serve, Delicious is in a completely different category in terms of both quality and difficulty.  Be ready for a fun (or, yunno infuriating), well-designed challenge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105561788', 'num_games_owned': 587, 'num_reviews': 332, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1590248494}
review: I don't know why i bought this game. Just Cook, Serve, Delicious!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970761123', 'num_games_owned': 2953, 'num_reviews': 896, 'playtime_forever': 1861, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1801, 'last_played': 1521712998}
review:
Cook serve delicious is what Cooking Mama could be if it was made into a huge game.  While the recipes are a bit simpler, and the repetition is far greater, Cook Serve Delicious has a bit of a similar feel and a similar grading system.

There’s a minor story here, but it’s safe to ignore it.  You run a restaurant, you serve people, and build your restaurant your way.  One thing that is kind of nice about this game is the game doesn’t really stray from that.  You have all the choices to make your restaurant.

The game starts with getting a restaurant in a prestigious building.  Then buying three foods (or four), serving them, and dealing with the rush of customers.  The thing with the new systems this game throws at the player is that it can be overwhelming, depending on which food choices and “chores” come up.

Each dish has different rules.  A corn dog has a mustard button, a ketchup button, a combo (hitting both buttons), or “nothing on it’ where you serve it as is.  Whereas, steak has to be properly seasoned with different button presses or directions from the controller and then wait until it’s done cooking.

Almost every food has different rules and prices, and most items are interesting to serve.  While Steak sells for more, it is more complicated. While chicken, which sells for almost as much, is hit one button six times, press another once and wait.

There are some issues where food has different positives and negatives.  If you want a really high “buzz”, you’ll have to carefully curate your menu so you can maximize buzz, and that’s interesting.  After a while, you kind of skip this as buzz only has minimal impact on the restaurant.  By the end of the game, I was just serving what I wanted and changing the menu when “rot” happened, some food get a negative from being on the menu for two days.

The thing is the buzz system isn’t that necessary.  The game really lets you make whatever food you want and there are only a few systems that try to steer you towards certain food. The higher value foods are usually what you are steered towards so you’re free to make your own restaurant.  

Even the negatives aren’t that bad.  If you have a lot of negative buzz, it only lowers the numbers of customers that come by a small amount.  That sounds bad but it makes it easier to get a perfect day, which is worth 250 dollars.  When the difference between a busy day or a dull day is only a couple of hundred dollars, the perfect day bonus makes the negatives not as painful.

A perfect day is basically hitting every dish perfectly, doing every chore, and that’s it.  You have to balance orders, speed, and everything but if everything is done “perfectly” you nab a nice payday.  Early on in the game, it’s somewhat easy, I got it on the eleventh, twelfth and thirteenth day in a row.  Later on (much later) it’s almost impossible but it’s a nice feat to aim for. 

So as I mentioned some food before, the food is the star of the game, there are 30 dishes to make.  Some of them are really great, some are weak, and some are awful.  I love to fillet the fish, the chicken is a lot of money for monotony, soup is a total pain in the butt, and wine is button mashing.  You will find some choices you prefer, and that’s what the game is about.  Finding what you want to make or playing with new food types. 

Food can also be upgraded and this is the big piece of the game.  Not only can you cook steak but you can cook a more valuable steak.  But again the upgrades are unbalanced.  Steak has a ton of new recipes and additives.  It’s a good example of a solid upgrade, as are soups.  When they add optional pieces to the food the upgrade feels like a big change. 

For examples of the bad upgrades, there are fish, wine, lobster, and chicken.  Most of them are just worth more.  Fish has 5 upgrades, only one changes anything (potentially add lemon to the fish fillet).  The wine has a variable cost and they select a bottle (one of five), the bottle chosen is the price of the wine.  The chicken has just a price upgrade.  You just get more money for chicken. 

The thing is the upgrades are good, some need more explanation (particularly bananas foster which adds a potential flambe).  I’d have liked to try out a recipe upgrade similar to how you can try out the recipes in the first place.  You can’t sadly, so it’s mostly a blind buy.

The game has another issue.  The restaurant will have long empty times.  Even when my restaurant is super busy and people are coming in droves, they mostly come at rush hour.  Half the day is cooking for one or two people each hour.  You can’t prep for later meals, you just gotta wait around and hope you get the chores during the slow time instead of during the rush hour. 

In addition, when you are cooking a dish if you add tomatoes to a pizza, you can’t remove them.  If you add a lemon wedge to a fish, you can’t take it off.  Any mistake is an error that keeps you from perfect.  I get the idea of “perfection” but it’s annoying to ruin a perfect day when you catch it in the first second.  You can’t restart an order, you’re done. 

Some food will give you a bad rating for any mistake, like sushi, and some food can take a few mistakes before it’s “Bad”.  Bad food gives negative buzz, and no money “ok” orders just break a streak and mean no tip.  It’s variable for what causes a “bad” order. 

Progression in this game is a big issue.  It’s going to be the make or break part of this game for almost anyone.  There are 5 (or really 6 as there are final goals) stars you can earn in the game. And I can give a full list of the requirements but there are only three worth talking about.  You have to cook for 20 days, you have to pass food inspections, and sometimes you have to pass a certain challenge.  There are others like buy enough equipment or cook enough perfects in a day, but by the time you do the first 20 days worth of play, you’ll have almost all these done.  They’re not hard. 

What that means is that the game is grindy.  And honestly, I didn’t feel challenged until the final star’s challenge.  But I did have to spend 20 days on each level, and at about 6 minutes a day, that’s 2 hours of just play time to get the next star and open up stuff.  

Once you pass the first star, the game gets interesting.  There’s catering, an Iron Chef game show (just doing a bunch of orders) and a secret ninja training (make every dish perfectly) at the end of the game.  But for the most part, you’re just grinding out days in the restaurant. 

If you don’t mind the grind, this game is quite fun.  If you do mind grinding, this might be torture.  The game doesn’t change much except having few more daily customers.  Most upgrades can be bought before you’re at two or three stars, and for your favorite food, will definitely be maxed.  There are changes at the higher level but there is a lot of time to get there as well.

Finally, there’s co-op and… it’s not a great co-op, one person cooks, the other expedites, but the expediter is not a great job.  On the other hand, Cook Serve Delicious 2 has a dual chef version of co-op, and it’s a better system. 

And ultimately the same can be said for the review.  Cook Serve Delicious is a lot of fun, but Cook Serve Delicious 2 is a superior game.  I recommend this game, but I think most people should buy the sequel instead.  It’s 3 bucks more and worth every cent.  Ultimately either game is going to be enjoyable though.

If you enjoyed this review or want to see what other games I enjoyed you can find my curator page at this link. http://store.steampowered.com/curator/31803828-Kinglink-Reviews/ Give me a follow.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137435080', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 2407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2000, 'last_played': 1526702089}
review: Above all a typing game, Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a fun and entertaining game, where you, running a restaurant and serving meals, type out the recipes and ingredients needed as you cook your way against time. The game, despite what it may seem, is intense and a lot of fun and the typing gameplay is broken up by fun challenges, bets, and side things such as accepting VIP requests, dates, and kickstarter projects. If you are looking for a fun fast-paced game with nice art and music set in running a restaurant, I would definitely recommend this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043796376', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2768, 'last_played': 1530398238}
review:
I kept passing over this game because I'd already played a ton of and gotten bored with restaurant games. I genuinely regret not playing this game sooner because it is incredibly addicting. It's fast paced, has it's own unique charm, and offers a decent challenge on extreme difficulty.

The only downside to me is the lack of volume control. I used the audio cues to help me keep track of orders, but was disappointed that it was louder than my music player and I had no way to adjust it.

All lin all a solid game, though, and well worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022198593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 216, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1519863685}
review:
[h1]飲食店で経営から接客まですべてをワンオペできるゲーム[/h1]

あらかじめメニューを決めたり改良したりする経営パートとそれを用いて実際に店舗を運営する接客パートに分かれています。
どちらかというと接客の部分がメインコンテンツに感じました。

注文を受けるときにそれぞれの嗜好に合わせて細かくトッピングなどが代わりますのでそれを一瞬で判断してあとはどれだけ効率的に調理できるかがポイントになってくると思います。
練習モードもあるのでたくさん練習して効率をつきつめて行きましょう。
経営,接客パート共にそれなりのボリュームもあると思いますので全部遊んでみようと思えばそれなりの時間を遊べると思います。１に飽きたら２がリリースされましたのでそちらもどうぞ。

[b]お腹すきました[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198077987889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3723, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3723, 'last_played': 1519194859}
review:
[h1] An absolute Blast! [/h1]

Cook Serve Delicious is a hardcore Resturant Simulator, CSD reminds me of when my sister used to play Dinner Dash on our computer back in the day, but much more rewarding with food upgrades and buzz which is this games way of determing how many people will show up on a paticular day, events can occur which will help increase buzz. There is a variety of things to do from dating to endurance challenges to wager matches.

[h1] Visuals [/h1]

CSD looks and runs incredibly well even on lower end hardware, as you rank up in the carrer mode your resturant starts to grow along with you, the NPC's while plenty, I just wish their were just a bit more.

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]

You can CSD with a variety of controllers from PS4 controllers to even the Wii U Pro Controller, but I used the keyboard, its very fast paced espically during rush hour, with the keyboard you use a plethroa of keys to make your orders and which can be rebinded if you so wish. The number rows are used for selecting your orders. This game has made me a much better typer, it's difficulty amps up and you'll feel defeated, but once you finally beat that day or event you feel amazing.

[h1] Conclusion [/h1]

Just buy this game, it's brilliant, addicting, rewarding and all around a fun game took me 25 ish hours to get from 0 to all the way to platnuim star. I just wish their were more variety in terms of NPC's but thats a minor nitpick. But it on sale if one happens to happen but you won't be disapponted if you buy it in full, I wasn't anyways.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039386132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1263, 'last_played': 1676603224}

author: {'steamid': '76561198010162373', 'num_games_owned': 794, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 3791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3791, 'last_played': 1498482966}
review:
A typing sim mashed up with a time management sim, set in a restaurant business, and it gets everything right!

There is a lot for you to do in terms of challenges, leader boards, difficulty modes and extra missions. The crux of the game is to use your keyboard (or some other controller, though keyboard is advised) to prepare and serve meals, and to complete hygienic kitchen chores (or prevent a hold-up).

While a lot of typing games (like Typing of the Dead) rely on you typing out words or phrases quickly as soon as the prompt appears, CSD has you typing shortcuts to ingredients and recipe steps according to your own strategy. The game does set a pace for you during rush-hour, but it's up to you how you want to handle orders. The new, quick order first or the old, slow order first? And don't forget to wash the old dishes!

The settings is somewhat cartoony, somewhere between tongue-and-cheek and adorably sincere, which fits the game really well. 
I also like how the game handles levelling up. As you get better at handling orders and meeting hygiene standards, you can upgrade your restaurant. At length, you can give your restaurant an extra star and replace your old furniture, decor, and toilet with clean, new-fangled things.
It's definitely edifying to make it all the way to a five-star, world-famous restaurant after starting out in a greasy spoon!

I recommend this to people who enjoy typing sims and/or time management sims. I started out with Typing of the Dead and the Papa Louie flashgames, so it's not surprising that I would really like CSD!
Even though the sequel hasn't received the rave reviews of the original, I still recommend it. It has added the long-awaited customization option, plus a more configurable sandbox mode and a campaign, or "Tower" mode, that has you play the chef in a variety of restaurants with widely diverse menus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198207513256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 927, 'last_played': 1521399076}

author: {'steamid': '76561198068398726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 810, 'last_played': 1538589440}

author: {'steamid': '76561198006890537', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1315, 'last_played': 1692491624}
review:
I wish I had known about this game while the weekly challenges were still a thing.

Somehow this game manages to combine the tranquil slowly-building-up-an-empire-with-no-pressure-or-time-limit feeling of Stardew Valley with fast-paced and beat-mania-esque gameplay, with the skin of something like Cooking Mama. The game drives you to achieve more and more difficult goals, while slowly and subtly training you to improve again and again and again. Constantly engaging, always happy to let you take a break, this game is a masterpiece. I'm looking forward to playing Cook, Serve, Delicious 2 once I've finished with this title.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996081733', 'num_games_owned': 1665, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 2885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1048, 'last_played': 1596081044}

Can get really hectic at times, and I had to practice a few recipes outside of the day of cooking to be able to pass some of the challenges. I mostly stick to about 10ish recipes that I've become good at and are high value.

review: This is what playing a healer for a MMORPG feels like. author: {'steamid': '76561197985581776', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1489361296}
review:
Well, I bought it. I enjoyed it. But found out the restaurant and cooking all day long buissness is not for me. Not that the game is not fun. I just... the struggle is REAL. Trash is piling up, dirty dishes, I fail misserably in executing all the tasks in an orderly fashiong. And I just can't take it anny more. I got realy depressed when the customers got mad at me. 

** OUT OF BUISSNESS**

Ressume: Do you love cooking? Do you love taking out the trash, and cleaning dishes? Do you have what it takes to make every sh** stain comming in to your joint happy? DO YOU WANT THE FULL EXPERIENCE of owning a hole in the wall in the gutter to a 5 star restaurant. And do you want to spend real time making your way to the top from scratch? Then do not hesitate! 

80% sales? Is this a joke?! I played it for 5 hours.. and payed full price , so it's worth 1.50 euro in my book.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072213215', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1515944727}
review:
Mientras que es un buen simulador de restaurantes y tiene mi aprobado, no me acaba de convencer por pequeños detalles que hacen de esta experiencia algo menos divertida de lo que me esperaba.
Este juego requiere tener mucha memoria y control del estrés que te ponen cuando tienes muchos platos (quería jugarlo para relajarme, imaginad), cada uno con sus ingredientes, maneras de cocinado, etc. Normalmente con pulsar la letra inicial de un ingrediente ya va bien, pero otras veces son combinaciones de ingredientes o las iniciales no coinciden con la tecla, lo cual es un follón. Mientras que los controles son ajustables, esto no ayuda. También me hace gracia que mi restaurante empiece con una popularidad de la hostia y, aunque haga todos los días casi perfectos, baja hasta quedarse casi al mínimo. Si lo hago bien... ¿no debería ser al contrario?
La cantidad de texto es abismal, intentaron crear una mejor presentación pero realmente no necesitas leer ninguno de los avisos para saber que x plato tendrá una mejora, cuando ya sale listada en la sección de "Mejoras".
Y luego, lo más importante, es el no poder dejar a medias según qué procesos. No sé porqué he de pelearme con absolutamente todos los platos cuando un pedido está a punto de expirar (los clientes tienen prisa, pero con lo rápido que va el reloj es normal, supongo). Vamos, en el frankfurt de al lado de mi curro pueden dejar las patatas fritas haciéndose mientras atienden a la clientela o preparan otros platos y las patatas especialmente salen cojonudas XDDDD
Si quieres ser un "cocinero multiusos" en tu tiempo libre, con buena memoria, con ganas de estar en tensión constante cuando se acerca la hora punta y mucha paciencia para ir mejorando el restaurante sin demasiados incentivos por el camino, este es tu juego.
Le pondría un 5 de nota, así que está "aprobado", pero no lo recomendaría a no ser que lo tengas en tu biblioteca por algún bundle y quieras darle un intento.

review:
J'y ai passé tellement d'heures... SI vous aimez jouer du clavier comme sur un jeu de rythme foncez.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073354483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 901, 'last_played': 1543703834}
review:
Have you every thought what it might feel like to actually be great at multitasking? 
Are you trying to get better at TF2 or Overwatch?
Maybe you are thinking what is the fastest way to get carpal tunnel syndrome?

This is the game for you! This game allows you to multitask at the greatest efficency and requires you to bring attention to several components you never thought were relavent. Giving bad orders encourages you to get better and gain the most money over time. Because of the variety of the game you can make the game easy or very complicated. Complicated makes you better at the game and gain the greatest ammount of efficency in the game to progress and manage several orders at once. After a while the challenge feels so smooth you can once in your life feel like you accomplished something profound.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013296662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1515403055}
review:
I played mostly offline, so I have clocked longer than shown.  I have finished the first 20 days of play.

This is a very well made game that has a brilliant way of mixing upgrades and difficulty in to the gameplay that is really a lot of fun and the heart of this game.

However, it takes so tremendously long to do anything, it's not worth your time.  
To get to a '1 star' restaurant, I must play  20 matches.  I'd achieved all possible accomplishments well before then, and unlocked most of the possible upgrades.
There are 5 stars to achieve, as well as catering levels and Iron Chef tournaments.

Looking it up, there are 20 more days per star, taking about ten minutes each.  The developer said each star used to have 10 more days, but it was really awful and so it was lowered to the gruelling figure it is now.


Everything about the game works.  It simply demands too much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198280152597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 7640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5927, 'last_played': 1651161139}
review:
Eh voilà! 101H de jeu. Je pense que je suis maintenant bien placée pour vous parler de Cook, Serve, Delicious! Voici une liste des + et des - de ce petit jeu très sympathique.

[+]
> Graphiques originaux, simples et agréables.
> C'est un jeu auquel on peut jouer longtemps (comme l'en prouvent mes heures de jeu) ;-)
> C'est tellement satisfaisant quand on réussis une journée parfaite haha!
> Possibilités de multijoueur
> Différents modes de jeu (si on en a marre de la carrière, on peut simplement se faire de petits "battle" rapides

[-]
> Peut sembler répétitif.
> Peut sembler un peu long à démarrer, mais dès qu'on achète quelques améliorations et qu'on avance dans le jeu, on augmente en dynamisme et en difficulté.

AUTRES
> EXTRÊMEMENT RAGEANT, mais, étrangement, dans un bon sens. Personnellement, ça me faisait tellement ch*&? de ne pas faire de journées parfaites que ça me poussait à continuer à jouer x)

Bref, j'ai acheter le 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125032142', 'num_games_owned': 493, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1633, 'last_played': 1574204420}
review:
[h1] En mi opinión personal le doy un 7,5 [/h1]

En este juego nos pondremos en el papel de un chef y tendremos que pasar días, es decir, partidas de 5 a 10 minutos, en donde tendremos que atender a la clientela sirviéndoles las comidas que previamente pusimos en el menú. Hay un total de 30 comidas (20 normales y 10 especiales) y cada una tendrá sus beneficios y desventajas que afectaran tanto a la cantidad de gente que ira al restaurante como a la cantidad de "eventos" que aparecerán. Estos eventos pueden ser tirar la basura, poner trampas para ratones, lavar los platos, entre otros.

Es un juego bastante largo de completar (20 a 30 horas) y tiene una jugabilidad bastante frenética que de seguro te hará pasar un buen rato.. o te dará un estrés bastante importante. Además, cada plato tiene una preparación específica por lo que se necesitara de cierta práctica para realizar las comidas de una manera más o menos rápida.

Cabe aclarar que para pasar de rango (es decir conseguir estrellas) se necesitara realizar una cierta cantidad de días, por lo que el juego se puede volver muy repetitivo luego de unas horas.

Obviando ese dato recomiendo bastante este juego y por lo que vale no creo que te lleves un disgusto.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988574356', 'num_games_owned': 1260, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1607983613}
review:
[h1]La faim justifie les moyens[/h1]
[b]CSD[/b] (pour les intimes) est un jeu de cuisine. Un jeu de cuisine ? Mais pour quoi faire ? Pour souffrir pardi !
Car sans être aussi punitif que des titres hardcore comme [b]Enter the Gungeon[/b] ou encore la série des [b]Dark Souls[/b], ce titre à priori sans prétention requiert des petits doigts musclés et une bonne dose de gestion/anticipation pour être dompté !
Nous passerons l'histoire, anecdotique, où l'on incarne le repreneur sans le sou d'un petit boui-boui infâme et triste. Ce contexte est un prétexte à nous faire trimer depuis les fanges de la World Food avec pour objectif l'excellence du sommet de l'art culinaire, tel un Cyril Lignac mais en mieux...

[h1]Mais où est ce putain de livre de recettes ?[/h1]
Après avoir acheté quelques plats de base et établi un menu, vous allez répondre aux commandes des clients en gérant la composition et l'ordre des ingrédients, les temps de cuisson et l'accumulation des commandes. Pour revenir deux secondes sur la confection du menu, prenez garde aux goûts des clients (le poisson à l'heure du café peut légitimement en rebuter pas mal) !
Il y a également la vaisselle à gérer et la gestion des déchets. Bref, pas de temps morts dans votre cuisine !
Et tout le piment de CSD, c'est de vous faire vivre votre journée de turbin intégralement au clavier. Chaque ingrédient est liée à une touche, les numéros des tâches également. Ainsi une recette peut ressembler à ça : CMRPSCRPSCR. Oui voilà, quand je vous disais qu'il fallait éviter d'être dyslexique des doigts...

[h1]L'addition s'il vous plaît[/h1]
Au final, on regrettera simplement le mode multijoueur, malheureusement uniquement disponible en LOCAL. C'est pourtant un régal que de batailler à deux dans cette cuisine. Sollicitant autant les petits muscles de vos doigts que les quelques neurones encore en état de votre cerveau, il s'agit d'un classique du genre, maîtrisé et représentant un vrai challenge.

[b]*** NOTE : 3.5/5 ***[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198272325537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1595829033}
review:
this game is good

it's a time management game where you take the reigns of a resturant. go from some rinky-dink shack to a five star resturaunt with the press of a few thousand buttons in the matter of seconds. manage chores and your annoying customers who seem to only want whatever inconviences you the most. serve beer so many times you'll start counting down the seconds when you pour yourself a glass of water at night. 

this is a good game

author: {'steamid': '76561198041070313', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 2406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2119, 'last_played': 1684447496}
review: I have no complaints about Cook, Serve, Delicious. It's a game that has an absurd amount of content, all with lots of interesting twists and takes along the way. The learning curve is nice and smooth, and even as you approach the end, it still provides a hardcore mode to further test your skills. It's frantic, fast-paced, skillful, and definitely worth the asking price and more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156234028', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1691783438}
review: It's fun in about 30 minute sessions. It can feel like too much work at times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084874653', 'num_games_owned': 235, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 4800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1541189408}
review:
I got this as a gift.  I won't lie; I had my misgivings.  "I spent seven years working in retail and having to multitask," I thought.  "Why would I want to be reminded of that?"

I was delighted to find that this game was an awesome blend of challenging and fun.  Time and resource management are a big part of this game, and it's not always easy to keep up with everything, especially once Rush Hour kicks in.  

But slowly, it comes: you develop the muscle memory for certain core menu items, you upgrade equipment, save for food upgrades (profit!).  And you find that you've lost track of time because you have been so focused on playing for the past few hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014939296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1514497133}
review: Sort of reminds me of osu except with food. Quite fun and challenging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066369679', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1030, 'last_played': 1545687027}
review:
I am addicted to Cook, Serve, Delicious! There is something oddly satisfying about this game - I echo the comments about how it feels rewarding to learn and master each menu item but you are constantly on your feet as you are required to change your menu daily to keep it fresh.

Also, I never thought I would begin to hate pasta, pizza and soup.

author: {'steamid': '76561198345735306', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 503, 'last_played': 1616183619}

author: {'steamid': '76561198367845116', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1674, 'last_played': 1558778147}
review: Jogo muito bom para passar o tempo, e sem dúvida um dos melhores jogos de cooking/restaurante.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025812458', 'num_games_owned': 1977, 'num_reviews': 445, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1514462975}
review: Cook, Serve, Delicious is a great game. There is something truly rewarding about getting the muscle memory down for menu items. You start to get comfortable and super efficient, but you're not allowed to get too comfortable as you're basically forced to switch up menus, deal with rush hour, worry about cleaning, getting robbed, etc. It's a game that's goes from relaxing and rythmic to frenetic and tense within moments. Definitely one of the best casual/management games on Steam. Local co-op is chaotic fun too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142668430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1517844138}

author: {'steamid': '76561198120067367', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4116, 'last_played': 1514333415}
review:
ようやく全実績解除できたので書けます.....!!!!

このゲームはPS用ゲーム「俺の料理」のような料理をひたすら提供して、皿洗いなどのトラブルを処理するゲームとなっています。
すべて英語で日本語対応はされておりませんが、全実績解除を狙うなら翻訳する気力を持っていれば楽しく遊べます。

ゲームを始めたとき際にはチュートリアルで見ただけで大体理解できるように作られております。
（※尚トラブル系のチュートリアルは自分から見に行かないと見れない模様）

お店の評価を上げていけば料理の質も上げれるようになり、その分調理も難しくなりますが上手くさばき切れた時の脳汁は文字に起こせないレベルです！

プレイヤーは自分のお店を最終的に星5レストランまで評価を上げるのが目的となりますが、それだけじゃありません。
このゲーム、ギャルゲー(?)が出来るゲームでもあるのです！！

そのほかにも、上級者向けに対してのハードモードがあったり、対人戦なども出来るので、フレンドとどちらが先に料理を作りきれるのかなどの対決もできます。(フレンドは非売品です)
っとそんな感じで77時間遊べるくらいにはボリュームはあるのですが、やはり短所もあります。

お店の評価を上げるために何日か開店をしないといけないのですが、それが長い長い...
後はギャルゲーをクリアするためには9回以上?は開店しないといけないため時間がかかります。
そして当たり前ですが当然作業ゲーですので、人によって好き嫌いが激しいゲームかと思われます。
[spoiler]まぁ現在は壺ゲーが流行っているので皆大丈夫でしょう[/spoiler]

「俺の料理」が好きな人だったり、作業ゲーが好きな方にはおすすめできるゲームだと言えます。

ギャルゲー『cook4luv』で積んでる方へ
[spoiler] 筆者は相手が『Melissa』で選択肢を選んだ顔文字がすべて『:/』になる奴を選んで実績解除しました。参考にどぞ！[/spoiler]

いいクッキングライフを！

author: {'steamid': '76561197984747139', 'num_games_owned': 545, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1502657613}
review:
This game is utterly ridiculous and fun to play if you're into this sort of stuff. It lures me in with somewhat of an Economic simulation, as you have to turn your takeaway into a real Restaurant and gain Stars as well as money. Some side Quests and Gambling offers, promise extra money if you achieve special goals and on perfect days you get Bonuses as well, encouraging you to do extra well at serving your food.

During the day you have to serve your customers food and prepare all of it yourself. Here you're required to multi task as you not only serve different kinds of foods that need different steps in preparation and you run the risk of overcooking something, while readying the order for another, but you also have to deal with cleaning the toilets and taking out the trash. Some Upgrades to the shop ease your pain there, but considering they're expensive and you could use that money to get another tool to prepare better and more pricey food makes you wonder if you really need it now.

I think this game is a fun little mix of Button mashing in the right order, multitasking which keeps you engaged and planning on how to best get your business running. It also has a bit of humour in it, but considering the simplicity of the game it gets rather repetetive with time. But if stuff like that speaks to you, I can only recommend it. Especially for that price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075324976', 'num_games_owned': 907, 'num_reviews': 688, 'playtime_forever': 3024, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1597588265}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044059004', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1146, 'last_played': 1630685480}

author: {'steamid': '76561197988977958', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1669261198}
review:
As time-management games go, this is one of the best because it really connects you to food preparation -- not just running around the kitchen matching courses, or clicking on chefs to do the work for you. I love that the controls are so complex that you can map them to a keyboard. I also like that they've miraculously mapped them to controllers, too. This is primarily a game about the satisfaction of perfect runs, and the building of muscle memory required to perform them.

So what's it about? You're a cook. You must prepare food for hordes of endlessly starving and irritated people. They come in waves, notably at lunch and dinner a horde of orc-like customers stream into the place requesting sodas, fries, salad, fried chicken, pizza, pasta... it's a good variety. You get to pick your menu, which is regularly updated as you make process, and the game forces you to mix it up so it doesn't get too old.

When I first started playing this game, there was a problem with my laptop's hybrid video card, so it ran at about half the speed. If you find yourself waiting minutes between customers, make sure you're assigning the game to the right video card. Don't be an idiot like me and assume the game is awful.

Also, what's up with all the exhausted professionals coming into my establishment at 9am requesting a large frosty mug of beer? I mean, I'm not going to turn them away, they make their own choices, but hair of the dog at a cafeteria-style buffet, in front of your co-workers?

author: {'steamid': '76561198384351293', 'num_games_owned': 1169, 'num_reviews': 723, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1512636334}
review:
fairly fun dine-and-dash game. it gets very involved and hectic. i enjoyed it more with a controller, but performed better with keyboard.

the progression is very slow and the game seems to drag on, which is weird for a dine-and-dash game (don't let my hours played fool you, i put in somewhere between 20-30 hrs offline). i felt it took too long to move on between each tier and recipes cost too much.

otherwise, very fun and frantic. still gets a recommend from me, even though it's more of a 7.5/10 game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066340699', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1590142281}
review: Not a relaxing game. 60% panic, 30% pressing the wrong key by accident, 10% disappointment in myself for pressing the wrong key by accident. 100% would recommend.

review:

高峰期做汤真的想死，材料那么多眼睛都看不过来噜   motherf***er客人要求还那么奇怪。

author: {'steamid': '76561198046657855', 'num_games_owned': 334, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 2977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2890, 'last_played': 1676811582}
review:
For a game that I've spent barely 2$ on sale, you should TOTALLY buy the game for its full price. This game is just simple enough yet challenging and fun enough to keep you busy for quite awhile!

Do note however that the game at first might seem too hard but don't fret! It's all about muscle memory and keeping your cool while working fast under pressure!

Recommended for keyboard maniacs. Don't think you'd have an easy time if you only play with controls however...

review: Vous avez toujours rêvé de diriger un restaurant ? De commencer en bas de l'échelle et vous élever progressivement vers les étoiles ? Vous aimez les jeux du genre "typographique",  la Cuisine, les jeux fait par et avec passion ? Le Challenge ? Alors prenez le temps de jeter un oeil du côté de Cook Serve Delicious : il a tout pour vous régaler. Et la sortie de sa suite il y a quelques temps à peine revient vous mettre l'eau à la bouche !

author: {'steamid': '76561198046934520', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1681377576}
review:
非常有意思的一款遊戲～喜歡經營類的朋友一定不能錯過！
遊戲方式很特別的是要利用打字來完成，英打苦手的話也可以利用滑鼠來玩。（只是後期可能沒那麼輕鬆）
音樂、美術及很多小細節都讓人覺得是很用心的一款遊戲，整體感很棒，希望官方出繁中化啊！

author: {'steamid': '76561197971867511', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2054, 'last_played': 1558735260}
review:
Es ist schnell, es ist hektisch, es ist süchtig machend!

"Cook, Serve, Delicius!" gründet sich auf ein einfaches Prinzip: Halte dich an die Rezepte und schau, dass dein Restaurant läuft... Das mag an den ersten Tagen noch simpel sein, wird aber bald zu einer enormen Herausforderung. 
Man beginnt als ein Neuling in einem Restaurant mit wenigen Rezpten, welche noch recht simpel ausfallen. Bei jedem Gast, der zu einem kommt heißt es dann: Bediene ihn gemäß seinem Wunsch, wobei es auf Timing und die korrekte Ausfürhung der Zubereitung ankommt.
MIt jedem Tag gewinnt man Geld hinzu, was man in sein Restaurant investiert: Bessere Geräte, mehr Rezepte, etc. Nach einer bestimmten Anzahl an bewältigten Herausforderung gewinnt man Sterne für sein Restaurant hinzu und schaltet somit neue Möglichkeiten, unter anderen auch besondere Herausforderungen frei.
Rezepte werden im Laufe des Spielverlaufes deutlich komplexer und der Zeitdruck steigt, da auch die Gäste Zahl steigt.
Im Idealfall bewirkt es beim Spieler, dass der eigene Ansporn steigt noch besser und schneller zu sein. Auch wenn es manchmal zum Haare raufen ist und man sich oftmals ärgert, wenn doch das falsche Dressing auf dem Salat gelandet ist^^
 
Für wen das Spiel etwas ist:
Alle, die eine Herausforderung suchen und für die Stress ein Grundnahrungsmittel ist.

Für wen das Spiel nicht ist:
Alle, die mit dem Zwei-FInger-Suchsystem die Tastatur bedienen und jedem, mit hohem Blutdruck.

Von mir gibt es jedenfalls was den Spielspaß betrifft 10/10 Punkten!
