author: {'steamid': '76561198075306694', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1616, 'last_played': 1490273249}
review:
[b]A word of warning,[/b] you’d be deeply misguided if you used this game as any sort of concrete guide on cooking. The only skill with a utensil that you’ll pick up from this game is blazing fast reaction to keyboard key prompts. Not much use in the kitchen, perhaps other than for making alphabet soup. [b](YEEEEEEEAAAAAAAAAAAA)[/b]

[b]Unlike[/b] melted cheese and tomato sauce, or beef and gravy, or seaweed and raw fish, this game and I were not a match that really made sense in the first place. [h1]Cook, Serve, Delicious![/h1] caught my eye not because I was looking for a cartoony cooking sim. Steam itself was bombarding me with recommendations for this game. And it all came to a head after I watched my favourite youtuber (shoutout to the magnificent bastard himself, I remain) play through a couple of rounds of it that I was struck by the elegance in the simplicity of the gameplay, the frenetic pace during rush hours and the fact that the guy playing SUCKED SO BAD. Huh. I could do better, says myself. 

I got it on sale for way less than most of the meals that you’ll serve up in the game. And like a chef discovering his secret sauce, or the 11 herbs and spices for the first time, it was a revelation.  

[b]Technically,[/b] you work as the main chef line cook, waiter, cashier, dishwasher and sole proprietor of Cook, Serve Delicious, a new culinary establishment in the SherriSoda Tower. Did they think it was a good idea to let me run the place? Heck, I don’t even know how many knives this place has! Or that I’m supposed to keep track of all of them, but I’m on TV now, that sort of thing is beneath me! Hence, why the game is [b]quite thin on actual finances and management,[/b] beyond buying new equipment like fryers to unlock deep-fried foods, for instance. Or buying recipes for new and existing menu items to either add them to a player-selectable menu of dishes du jour or increase the complexity of the food preparation with the benefit of increased price per upgrade.

[b]Not that you’ll be found wanting for cash,[/b] nor is the accumulation of bucks the primary focus of the game. The main progression of the game is working towards your ultimate goal of having those glamourous five stars bestowed upon your humble establishment. You start as a crummy diner selling little but fried sopapillas and beer, but string together enough unbroken combos and you may very well see your restaurant upgraded with more stars, and serving progressively more palatable dishes.

[b]Part of the “end game”[/b] that is offered up is THE ONE, THE ONLY, [b]IRON CHEF!![/b] (Oh god I miss that show. The Japanese version, of course.)
No, no. [i]I meant Iron Cook.[/i] Far less legally questionable name, eh? What it is; a challenge mode where a theme which dictates the handful of recipes that you will be bombarded with over several rounds; a horde survival mode where you race against time to [i]make things you want to eat, instead of killing things that want to eat you.[/i]

[b]There are plenty[/b] other gamemodes: timed, weekly challenges, coop even, with support for up to four players in a single session. However, once you start seeing the same menu items on order over and over again, preparing the same soup and salad combination gets a bit stale. But while it lasts, the combinations of possible menu preparations and increasing intensity of orders means at higher levels, rush hour means your restaurant escalates into a state of utter chaos.

[i]These games are deceptively addictive.[/i] I’ve already sunk in a disproportionate amount into the arguably better sequel. The original is dirt cheap (80% off in the Autumn 2017 sale) so I would highly suggest [b]playing the first before its sequel, Cook, Serve, Delicious! 2[/b] for interested newcomers.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
[h1]ARBITRARY BAGEL RATING : 7/9 bagels[/h1]
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

author: {'steamid': '76561198072403170', 'num_games_owned': 1057, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2241, 'last_played': 1511582719}
review:
Something like a casual rhythm game but not based on musical timing. You will need to master the hotkeys in order to fill orders accurately and quickly. Game is simplistic but fun and can offer a compelling challenge. The only real weakness in gameplay is that food selection is easy to minmax.  The difficult time-consuming recipes aren't rewarding enough, and once you have the most efficient foods unlocked you'll find yourself constantly rotating between the same dishes unless you're forced to pick something else.

Graphical presentation is largely 2D and static, with a colorful, polished art style that makes the food look appetizing. The game seems well-optimized and has a snappy response to user input even on older hardware. A gem of indie design, it showcases that even when you have a small budget you can still make a good game by prioritizing tight gameplay and focused production values over pure aesthetics.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966813775', 'num_games_owned': 535, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1511583065}

Begin as a lowly proprietor of a fry cookery, end as the owner of a luxurious (and dnagerously competitive) 5 star restaurant! Make your way through the twists and turns of learning to cook better quality dishes, figure out how to keep your customers (and the Health Inspectors!) happy! Do all this, but remember:


Cook, Serve, Delicious!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993223835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1629, 'last_played': 1502038558}
review:
It's 10 minutes to closing time when he walks in.
"A pizza with everything on it, please."
I stare at him. I stare at the clock above the door to the back room. Can't he see that I've already put most of the dishes into the dishwasher? Why did he have to walk into my restaurant at such a late hour?
"I.." I start, before I lock my eyes into his and see a pain in them I haven't seen since I looked myself in the mirror this morning. I can't just tell him to leave, just because I want to get back home to my empty apartment, so I can watch re-runs of shows I don't even like. Alone. Just like he looks. I have to do my duty.
"..Sure, it'll be done in 15 minutes."
I make the pizza and I put on the salami, the olives, the freshly cut oregano, all the rest of the ingredients he wants on it. I'm sure this will be the best pizza he'll ever have, I even put a little extra cheese on it, just to give the guy some more to live for. Who doesn't love cheese, ya know?
Finally when the pizza is done and in its take-away box I hand it to him. He looks at it and opens the lid.
"There's too much cheese on this."
He leaves and doesn't even give me a tip.
I stand there and look at the door that he's already walked out through. All I can do is stare in disbelief. What has the world become?

author: {'steamid': '76561197960880229', 'num_games_owned': 711, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1511425592}
review:
A challenging multitasking simulator where the individual tasks involve filling customers' restaurant orders or performing other daily restaurant chores.  The interface can, at times, feel like you are interacting with a rhythm game, trying to clear the queue of keys or clicks as quickly and accurately as possible.  The progression curve is relatively forgiving on the normal setting, introducing a simple concept or mechanic on each "day" (i.e. each game round).  As you develop a familiarity with the various steps required to prepare the dishes or perform the cleanup chores, you will be better equipped to customize the active menu.  You will also be more informed about where your precious seconds are being gobbled up by interfering events and chores.

The art style and sound elements are complementary, informing the player that preparing and serving food in the game is not such a graceful ballet.  The assets reflect this meal prep as a slapdash affair, successful when you haphazrdly jam the elements together as quickly and accurately as possible, the overall goal to churn the customers through.  The frantic key-pressing and inevitable screw-ups lend an element of humor to the experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071416645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1357, 'last_played': 1518275362}
review:
A fun, frenetic little restaurant game that's a little deeper than it looks.

Premise: You take over a garbage pit of a diner with the intention of making it a five-star restaurant. You do this by selecting a menu for maximum profitability and "buzz", and then prepping the food via a series of typing mini-games.

The Good: There is a lot of stuff to do in this game; 30-ish unique dishes to prepare, each with their own mini-game with (generally) unique mechanics. The difficulty of serving these foods varys from holding a single button for two seconds then hitting another button (fried chicken) to curating complex sequences of patterns with harsh failure conditions (kebabs) and the brilliant part is, the difficulty is largely self-directed as you can feel free to keep your menu as simple or as complex as you believe you can handle. The game throws a series of ever-varying challenges at you in the meanwhile (safety inspections, betting on your own performance, stopping crime, and a very bizarre dating sim) which keeps it from feeling like you're doing the same thing every day even if you are. When I got to the endgame I still enjoyed the act of filling orders in and of itself, which is a pretty impressive statement considering I'd done so for something on the order of 15 hours. The balance between being frantic enough to be interesting and being zen enough to be pleasant is incredibly well-struck in my opinion. Also, the game has custom key rebinding on all mini-games which is an awesome feature.

The Bad: There is almost literally no consequence for failure. You could bungle half your orders and the only thing that would happen is a loss of buzz for the next day, which is exactly the same as saying an automatic reduction in difficulty. I suppose this is a good thing when you are first learning the game, but after about day 7 I stopped feeling any remorse for my mistakes because the game wouldn't really let me. Feel free to meta-game by running your buzz up high, loading your menu up with your most difficult and expensive items, and then rapidly serving out rushed and error-filled orders for more profit than you ever could have obtained by actually attempting to be good at the game.

Conclusion: This game is excellent for killing a bit of time and despite its occasionally manic rush hours I find it very relaxing. It's hard to get bored by it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198038581953', 'num_games_owned': 653, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1590941419}

review:
Un juego sencillito, tienes que preparar los platos que los clientes te piden. Lo mejor es que pasas un rato entretenido, hay puntos donde te estresas bastante porque no puedes atender a todos los clientes. También tiene cierta configuración donde tú eliges qué platos ofrece tu restaurante (cada uno tiene un precio y preparación determinada) o incluso puedes comprar mejoras o máquinas para ofrecer nuevos platos.

Lo peor: Es la sensación de que no tiene fin, juegas y juegas pero sólo para pasar el rato, no esperes conseguir grandes hitos.

review: 让我更感兴趣的是，这个游戏把一些日常生活对餐厅中一些要素，赋予分类指标和量化指标，而且做的很恰当，比如一些食物是快餐但是可能会卖很多，桌上零食可以让顾客多等一会，可以有每日菜品等促销活动，等等。了解餐厅运行背后的原理实在是颇有意思的一件事，这款游戏给了让我愉悦的角度。当了解这些内容之后就不怎么有动力继续玩下去。很难得的游戏

author: {'steamid': '76561198030343279', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1493577830}
review: I was going through random stuff from my old humble bundles that I hadn't bought the bundles for. There, I found this gem. I honestly don't know what's so great about it; it's just wonderful. Thoroughly addicting, plenty of different challenges and enough control over what you do. I don't even like doing all the combo stuff and screwing them all up, but somehow it's entirely ejoyable here. Also, always check your email. Especially the spam. Worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040828497', 'num_games_owned': 6418, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 722, 'last_played': 1689064463}
review:
Pretty slow to progress and very much on the easy side in that regard, but as you get better and better at the game, it's satisfying to tear through orders. You have to impose challenges on yourself to get fun out of the game in a normal mode playthrough.

There is an harder difficulty, CSD 2 is out and I'd rather play that. If CSD 2 wasn't out I would definitely give that for a good spin.

It get repetitive, but the repetitive thing you're doing gets much more fun under pressure.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980530446', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 2238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2155, 'last_played': 1581280570}
review: Fun time-management / typing game.  The upgrades and different foods give you something to work toward and a sense of progression.  Some folks might find it repetitive, but I feel like there are enough special events to keep things interesting.  Good game.  Thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994506042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 779, 'last_played': 1509953450}
review:
This is the farming simulator of cooking games.

What if I told you that you could become a five star chef with a waggle of an analog stick and a few button presses? Well, in this game you can live out that fantasy. CSD is nothing if not an oversimplified QTE fest.

But that's why you play games, right? You want something to pass some time with. It's pretty entertaining either way. I can say I had some fun with this one. This is a game built entirely upon muscle memory, and I had realized this after picking this game up after a long hiatus. Instantly, all of my xiaolin-like culinary training flowed back into my fingertips. Apply the dressing, the cheese, two scoops of vanilla with nuts; jumbo water cup with ice and flavor blast, pounding on chicken exactly six times with some dangerous fury. I recommend playing this game with music blasting. Preferably k-pop or something you can sway back and forth with. That's the optimal cooking setting, obviously.

So what else? The music gets repetitive. The visuals aren't that exciting or interesting. After you've seen all the possible patrons, and you've baked them all lasagna 20x over, what is there to do? Where does the ultimate QTE chef go? To the real kitchen, my friends. Waggle that analog to flay that fish, and hold down on that analog to pour that beer to foamy muffin top perfection.

This game is a huge waste of time. That could be a good thing or a bad thing. I don't find it as particularly satisfying as others. But hey, it was fun while it was on my radar. It's an alright way to spend some otherwise potentially productive time. Thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198409550159', 'num_games_owned': 527, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1287, 'last_played': 1621227253}
review:
This was given to me by one of my friends. I already knew I was going to enjoy this game because of the type of mobile games that I play, but I never envisioned myself spending hours mashing away on the keyboard to get perfect combos.

This game is addictive in a challenging but fun way.

As you progress, the levels (if you can call it that) get more challenging. You get good at memorizing the keybinds that you've set up for the ingredients. And also prioritizing which orders to take first, to chain that combo.

+ Simplistic but colorful graphics, any computer from this decade can run it.
+ Instructions are easy to learn and follow.
+ The recipes and ingredient combinations are interesting.
+ Orders received in the main career campaign are randomized, giving replay value.
+ The "spam mail" in the game are actually funny.

- Tips are randomized, combos don't affect it. Although getting more perfect orders correlates to more tips.
- Starting a new save may cause errors with keyboard and mouse usage. Fix: Change gamepad settings, cycle through the options until you get back to keyboard and mouse.

tl;dr Overall this is a nice game. If you like casual games and mobile games, you'll probably like this one too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022717686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 1594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1466, 'last_played': 1684697659}
review:
Cook serve delicious es mucho más de lo que aparenta a primera vista. En aparicencia juego en flash, este juegaco de la parra demuestra que no se necesitan grandes gráficos para desarrollar un juegaco en toda regla. Pese a su categoría de  "casual" CSD nos pone al mando de un restaurante, teniendo que preparar cada vez platos más complejos, viendo como crece tu restaurante, con un modo "management" muy bien llevado que hace sentirte recompensado contestamente. Se trata de casi un juego de mecanografía, donde medir correctamente los tiempos, conocer las recetas y ser veloz con los dedos son las herramientas básicas para lograr un día perfecto.

Sin duda un juego viciante como pocos, que no paro de recomendar a mis amigos, más por lo que me costó a mi, poco menos de dos euros. Me ha gustado tanto el juego y me ha parecido tan mal no dar al desarrollador lo que se merece (ojo, solo uno, con un par) que le he tirado mi dinero a la cara en la segunda parte, que aunque mejora muchas de las cosas del original, peca de otras que hacen a esta primera parte ENORME.

Sin más recomendar este juego de SOBRESALIENTE.

review:

You can upgrade your kitchen to work at a faster rate to serve those hungry hungry people. It is rumoured that Gordon Ramsay used this experience to imporve and 'hone' his skills. author: {'steamid': '76561198046385933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 547, 'last_played': 1522071305}
review:
[h1] Cook, Serve, Delicious! [/h1]

Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a cooking game that was released a few years ago.
The basic idea of this game is that you can buy and upgrade food and try to get more stars for your restaurant. You do this by playing the game a lot and trying to go trough the day with at least mistakes as possible.

You start the game with some cash and have the ability to buy some food and equipment. 
The main gameplay consists of pressing different kinds of keys on your keyboard to prepare te food and give it to the customers, the gameplay sounds pretty simplistic but later on it gets pretty hectic.
There are foods that are easier and less complicated to make but also some more difficult ones.
The basic idea is that if you press the :T: key on your keyboard you add the tomato ingrediënt.

The game starts of pretty slow and it takes some getting used to the mechanics, but after you get more stars for your restaurant the game speeds up and gets a lot more fun. upgrading your restaurant takes pretty long as an example on of the requirements to get a new star is completing 20 days of work. This does not take that long because a day takes only like 5-10 minutes to complete.

There are quite a lot of mechanics in this game as an example you can date other cooks and also work for a catering service to get some extra cash. You also get to choose what food your restaurant serves and there are regular safety inspections and chores that you have to do to get more positive buzz.
Buzz basicly is how popular your restaurant is and more positive buzz means you get more customers.

This game is really fun and addicting to play, it is also is pretty rewarding and there is a good variety of products to choose from.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065508767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1551049580}
review:
For a binary yes/no, it'll have to be no.
It's fun, but gets repetitive really quickly. The fact that so much mechanical repetition (VERY bad for your joints!) and nearly 10 hours of gameplay is required to reach 2 stars and actually start doing something is a shame. The game should have been sped up (e.g. not needing 20 days of business, since I always fulfil the other requirements within half of the time given), but that won't happen since there's now a CSD 2 (and 3). It's a bit of a shame such simple issues couldn't be fixed before launching a sequel.

However, it should be added that this game has aged pretty well and looks way less than its 4 (edit: now 9 going on 10, but still pretty decent) years of age. Also, there is less dumb repetition in CSD 2 and 3 (mostly because the premise is different, but the point still stands), which means that quite a few rheumatologists will be out of work. Ultimately, with CSD 2 and 3 on the market, this game is not worth your money, especially since you will inevitably get illogically angry at the idiotic simulations and mechanisms in the game, which the positives and addicting parts aren't enough to overcome overall. Don't get me wrong, I had fun, but looking back it probably is marginally not worth it at the full price (which I did not get it at), and why get this game when CSD 3 is better in almost every way and so functionally similar?

Finally, there is no universe in which steak is healthy: it may be healthier than some or even many of the things people eat, but objectively it is not healthy as all. And with the levels of alcohol consumption encountered in the game, the same could be said for wine.

Random bugs include (which could've been pretty easy to fix):
Money from bets not posting
Buzz not generated from events such as 'posting to social media' when they should be
Statistics of food (which affects achievements) taking into account trial foods (always) and not taking into food actually served in-game (sometimes)

(edit: changed some of the references from CSD 2 to 3, since 3 is more similar to 1 than 2; got to five-star restaurant after review but haven't played since)

author: {'steamid': '76561198067133214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1626, 'last_played': 1506458440}
review:
Je profite de la sortie de CSD2! pour recommander le premier opus : c'est juste excellent. Un jeu d'arcade à base culinaire, fallait y penser. C'est addictif, à la difficulté et la progression bien dosées, ça amène à de vrais moments de frénésie, et c'est extrêmement drôle. 
Surtout en coop. Même si ce mode n'est pas aussi bien fait que dans CSD2, le fait de séparer les tâches donne de bons moments.
Bref, excellent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025521278', 'num_games_owned': 881, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1504060446}
review:
Sembra un gioco flash a cui non daresti nemmeno 10 minuti della tua vita.. ma molto presto diventerà la tua droga preferita.
Il gioco è molto semplice, si decidono i piatti del giorno e si passa tutta la giornata lavorativa a cucinare i suddetti, ci sono un minimo di complicazioni come la pulizia, le ispezioni, le ore di punta e così via.. Ma purtroppo scade tutto nella ripetitività molto in fretta, le idee ci sono, i disegni deliziosi e semplicistici pure, ma purtroppo la poca profondità non mi ha fatto andare oltre le ore giocate.

6/10 - Consigliato a chi ama questo genere di giochi ed anche a chi li sottovaluta, un simpatico indie riuscito ma non perfezionato.
> Da giocare completamente con la tastiera <

author: {'steamid': '76561198024291769', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1505767409}
review:
A great game combining fast paced service with elements of management.

I work as a cook (no I wouldn't say chef...yet) and to wind  down after a stressful day at work I relax with an even more stressful day in CSD! When the orders stack up, the dishes has to be washed and the health inspector is monitoring my every move I transcend into the bluriness of a hectic service only to emerge as a new man ready to do the exact same thing the next day. And I love it!

I'm still only at one star so I have many more hours of frantic fun in front of me but I can allready say this; CSD is a great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198076409141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3374, 'last_played': 1504563107}
review: It's insane that I have not written a proper review for Cook, Serve, Delicious! I absolutely love this game and come back to it to continue to fufill the orders of my imaginary, hungry customers. The game adds a variety of challenges as you upgrade your recipes from one star to five stars because you have to not only remember all the ingredients but the keys assigned to those ingredients, especially the actual keys when you want to be faster than when using the mouse. The weekly challenges were great as well because you got to put your skills against others and make your way up the leaderboard. I wholeheartedly recommend Cook, Serve, Delicious 1 especially if you're interested in getting Cook, Serve, Delicious 2, but unsure. Honestly, I am sure it will be great too!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998552768', 'num_games_owned': 418, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 140639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51668, 'last_played': 1697329583}
review:
I am an animal with over 1,000 actual hours of playtime in this very, very, very fun game. It's as casual or as hard as you demand, constantly scaling to your skill level during the campaign. It's 1 to 1 controls are tight as hell, and if there's any key binding you don't like, you can change literally anything in the controls menu. There are never any mistakes that aren't completely the player's fault, which is frustrating but also incredibly rewarding.

If the campaign becomes too easy over lots of playtime, you can always take your skills to the "eSports" leaderboard where you try to do as many orders as fast as possible for as long as possible. This mode is incredibly fast and will prove challenging to even the most skilled typists.  I myself couldn't string 10 orders together in this mode. Now I am #8 on the leaderboard with over 380 perfect orders in a row.

Even people who consider themselves "casual gamers" can find loads to enjoy in Cook, Serve, Delicious! The campaign's pace will start slower if you make enough mistakes on the first day. This is really helpful for learning the game naturally and the game picks up its pace to match the player once they start doing well and demonstrating familiarity with the controls.

Its an extremely grind heavy game focused on repeating variations on the same task over and over again, but it keeps it interesting with a constant stream of upgrades to equipment and recipes, and by having extremely tight and customizable keyboard controls that should never frustrate you.

Unbelievably inexpensive for literally over 1,000 hours of glorious playtime.

The music can get slightly stale after so many hours so I reccommend finding some sweet jazz tracks once you get bored, this game is even more amazing with jazz.

review: Einfach zu lernen, schwer zu meistern, das beschreibt es wohl am Besten. Es gibt zwar auch einige Speisen, die frustrierend sein können, aber diese muss man ja nicht unbedingt ins Menü aufnehmen. Ich hatte jedenfalls meinen Spaß.

author: {'steamid': '76561198304880726', 'num_games_owned': 6575, 'num_reviews': 1717, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1667577533}
review:
It's a really fun cooking management game, but it's not entirely intuitive or special.

I've played better phone games that are similar in gameplay, but what I do like about this one over others is the keyboard involvement. Being able to speed through sections of your orders because the keys line up right or easily, is really fun.

Sometimes though, the ingredients to add to the foods are hard to coordinate. Soda beverages I also found a little clunky, but I'm sure perfection comes with time.

Otherwise, this is a really great game. Not the best of its kind but definitely worth a play if you're into the style. The finer details definitely give this game longevity, such as the buzz system.

Don't play too long though, else it becomes just another job...!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045655704', 'num_games_owned': 3545, 'num_reviews': 207, 'playtime_forever': 1391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1351, 'last_played': 1505046450}
review:
Qui n'a jamais rêvé d'avoir son propre petit restaurant, de préparer soi-même chaque plat, de s'occuper de chaque tâche ménagère et de travailler sans relâche 11 heures par jour ? Probablement...tout le monde en fait...mais [i]Cook, Serve, Delicious![/i] nous permet de le faire, et le moins qu'on puisse dire, c'est que ça fonctionne bien.

L'économie locale se développe à nouveau et c'est à nous que la tour SherriSoda confie la tâche de redonner au vieux restaurant sa gloire d'antan. Notre but est donc de développer notre restaurant jusqu'à lui faire atteindre le très honorable rang de restaurant 5 étoiles. La route sera longue et parsemée d'embuches, d'autant plus qu'on est la seule personne à y travailler et qu'on n'aime manifestement pas déléguer...
On doit donc tout faire, depuis la cuisine jusqu'à nettoyer les toilettes, la vaisselle, et sortir les poubelles. Et tout en même temps bien sûr. Dans ce jeu, on ne chôme pas. Le rythme est soutenu et les erreurs fréquentes, parce que chaque tâche a sa combinaison, et que les plats peuvent être personnalisés par les clients. Il faut être rapide, mais sans se précipiter pour éviter les faux pas.
À côté des journées de travail, il y a un petit côté gestion. On va forcément commencer par acheter de la nourriture à servir aux clients. Le jeu nous donne la possibilité de servir 20 plats ("plats" n'est pas le terme adéquat, puisque cela comprend la bière, le vin, et autres produits que l'on n'a pas besoin de cuisiner) dits "standards", plus 10 autres "speciaux". Ces derniers se débloquent en gagnant les étoiles pour le restaurant. Chaque produit a son lot d'avantages et d'inconvénients, attirant différents types de client en fonction de leur "prestige". On n'attire pas les gens de la haute avec de la bière et des lasagnes, mais avec du homard et du vin hors de prix. Plus la clientèle est aisée, plus l'argent rentre, et plus le restaurant est "classe". On doit donc améliorer cette nourriture, ainsi que l'équipement du restaurant pour la cuisiner et chouchouter le client. Et bien sûr, plus on améliore la nourriture, plus il y a de variantes en cuisine, rajoutant des options aux choix des clients et donc de la difficulté. Les tâches annexes (vaisselle, etc...) évoluent également avec l'amélioration du restaurant.

[i]Cook, Serve, Delicious![/i] est très complet et bien pensé. Par exemple, le menu du jour comprend 4 plats différents, et il faut changer ce qui n'est pas "frais" tous les deux jours tout au plus. Divers mini-jeux s'ajoutent avec l'avancement du jeu, comme décrire un portrait robot du mec qui vient de vous braquer, ou participer à un club de rencontre et servir à manger à votre rendez-vous. La difficulté augmente graduellement, elle ne nous submerge pas. On peut s'essayer à la préparation d'un met avant de l'acheter histoire de ne pas être pris au dépourvu face au client, et ça c'est extrêmement pratique.
Et aujourd'hui le jeu est rempli de différents modes à côté du mode campagne pour rajouter du fun et du challenge. On peut y jouer à 2 (local uniquement), même en mode campagne si j'ai bien compris. Il n'a cessé de s'améliorer avec de nouvelles fonctions depuis sa sortie. Mais maintenant que le 2 va sortir, celles-ci seront évidemment beaucoup moins nombreuses dans le futur.

Avant de finir, un petit mot sur le côté visuel et musicale, bien que ce soit très subjectif. Graphiquement, c'est un peu spécial, enfin j'ai trouvé, pour les personnages en tout cas. Mais ça a son style, son charme, c'est une affaire de goût. Musicalement par contre, bon oui c'est une affaire de goût aussi, mais j'ai beaucoup aimé l'ambiance que le jeu donne et ses musiques. C'est accrocheur.

Détails : 1) pour ceux que l'anglais dérange, malheureusement le jeu n'est qu'en anglais. 2) Jouable à la manette.

Pour conclure, [i]Cook, Serve, Delicious![/i] est un petit jeu très amusant et très addictif. Pas cher et très complet, il vous amènera à la première dizaine d'heures de jeu sans même vous en rendre compte. Il y a bien sûr un côté répétitif, on refait les mêmes choses encore et encore pour s'y habituer et pouvoir les faire plus rapidement, mais on prend plaisir à s'améliorer. Comme Steam, recommendation extrêmement positive de ma part.

[code]Vous avez aimé cette évaluation ? Retrouvez-en d'autres en rejoignant notre groupe de rédaction : [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/onlespreferefroids#curation]On les préfère froids.[/url][/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561197964120751', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 920, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 910, 'last_played': 1508824855}
review:
I love this game. I love it, and think it's fantastic.

However! There's no real penalty for screwing up. The only effect of making mistakes is that your "buzz" is lowered, and the only thing "buzz" does is increase how many customers show up. You don't actually have any ongoing expenses running the restaurant, so it doesn't actually matter at all how well you do.

I feel that this is a serious, critical flaw in the game. It feels like it doesn't really matter how well you perform, because there's no consequence for failure. I think this game could be improved 1000% if it was possible to lose the game, eg by going out of business because you ran out of money or failed too many health inspections.

Nevertheless, even without that the game is extremely good. Really, really good. The mechanics are tight and enjoyable. I tend to play like every order matters, and it heightens my enjoyment of the game.

All in all, it's a good game and I recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986527965', 'num_games_owned': 726, 'num_reviews': 412, 'playtime_forever': 1867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1417, 'last_played': 1589469880}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious isn't a bad game.  In fact, I think it's a pretty decent game.  The issue is that it's plagued by a bunch of problems that really should've been addressed.

The game itself is pretty simple.  You start by buying a couple different foods and pieces of equipment.  Each food has various perks and disadvantages assigned to them and are cooked in different ways/have different ingredients.  You'll then put several foods into your active menu to cook for the day.  Orders will pop up at a speed based on your current 'buzz' which is affected by things such as how many perfect orders you made, how many bad orders you made, what foods are in your active menu, etc.  Low buzz means a long time between orders whereas high buzz will keep you pretty busy.  There are 2 rush hours (Lunch & Dinner) over the course of each day where orders come in a steady fast pace regardless of your current buzz.  You'll also have to deal with chores during the day that occur at a rate dependent on the types of food you're serving.  At the end of the day, you get some stats on how well you did and go back to the menu where you can use the money you earned to buy new foods, food upgrades, new equipment.  Your restaurant starts out with no stars but over the course of 20 days, you'll gain 1 if you meet all the requirements.  You then do 20 more days to earn your 2 star restaurant, and repeat until you're at 5+ stars.  There's also some side things that will pop up from time to time in your in-game email that will allow you to accept/decline challenges for additional money, buzz, etc.  That's most of the game in a nutshell.

The game does a lot of things well.  It starts out simple and grows more complicated as you get more order slots and upgraded meals.  You'll be tight on money early on in the game and have to make choices between whether you'd prefer new equipment, food upgrades, or trying out new foods.  Many of the foods have unique methods for making them.  Drinks all have their own unique methods for making them.  It can be very satisfying to be in the zone and knocking out order after order as they come in as fast as you can handle them.  You're also free to change the key bindings for every food to set them as you prefer..

So now the problems.  1.  The start game to mid-game portions are way too slow.  You start out only being able to put 3 things in your active menu and only able to have up to 4 orders max.  As you earn additional stars, you then go to 4, 5, and 6 active menu items, and 5, 6, 7, and 8 orders at once.  The problem is that it takes 20 days to earn those additional stars.  Usually by day 2 or 3 you'll already be in a groove, which means you have to sit there and play an additional 17-18 days before you unlock the next star and make the game slightly more difficult.  You start off with a pretty low buzz in your first restaurant and outside of rush hours, you might get 1-2 orders per hour.  It gets dull and repetitive very quickly.

2.  The foods are not balanced in any way.  You start out with all food items available for you to purchase (besides items on the specialty menu that unlock as you earn stars).  Most of the cheapest foods aren't worth buying as they have many negative traits, don't earn much money, and either aren't upgradeable or only upgrade once or twice.  Most of the more expensive items have a bunch of positive traits, are worth a lot of money, and can usually be upgraded 3 or 4 times.  Most of the cheaper foods also include the 'fatty foods' trait which decreases your buzz by 5% for each 'fatty food' on your menu over 2, further giving you reasons to never use them.  Most foods suffer from 'menu rot' which decreases your buzz by 5% for each food you have on the active menu more than 2 days in a row.  Several of the better foods have the 'staple' ability that makes them not suffer from 'menu rot', so you can just keep them on your active menu forever.  3 of the staple foods (salad, wine, and soup) also include the 'health nuts' perk which makes them worth +5% buzz for each 'health nut' item on the menu, which allows you to further abuse these overpowered food items. Beyond that, some of the cheaper foods are more complicated/time consuming to make then the more expensive foods.  Things like steak, fish, chicken, lobster, and wine are incredibly easy to make, have a bunch of positive perks, and are worth a lot of money to make whereas things like soda, baked potatoes, nachos, etc are far more difficult to make, have a bunch of negative perks and aren't worth much money.  Once you fill your menu with the more expensive easy to make foods, there's almost never a reason to put anything else on the menu.  Also, you'd think the locked specialty menu would include some good items, but most of them are terrible.  There're only 2 or 3 that are worth getting.

3.  The entire difficulty of the game is based solely on you accidentally hitting the wrong buttons.  Once you start making an order, there is no way to remove ingredients you've added nor is there an option to throw out the dish and restart it.  So if you're making something and realize you've put the wrong ingredient in, oh well, now you're stuck handing out that bad order.  Did your finger slip while pressing a button and you accidentally put something else in?  Oh well, enjoy handing out that bad order.  Did you reach for a key and accidentally press in-between it and another key, oh well, enjoy handing out that bad order.  I don't mind if I screw up, don't realize it, and hand out a bad order, but it's obnoxious to know you screwed up and have no way to fix it.  Once you start cooking a food, if you press the number for it before it finishes cooking, the game serves the order and counts it as undercooked, which results in an 'average' or 'bad' order depending on how far along it was.  There's no reason you'd ever want to serve an undercooked meal, so the ability to do this was clearly added as another way to artificially make the game more difficult.

4.  Not a big deal, but the default key bindings are annoying.  You usually want ingredients assigned to whatever the first letter of that ingredient is.  Some foods have multiple ingredients starting with the same letter, but one of them will be unlocked later on with an upgrade.  For some stupid reason, some of the foods have that letter assigned to the locked ingredient instead of the one you start with by default.  Why would you do this?  Beyond that, when you go into the key binding menu, it lists every single possible ingredient for the dish including the stuff you haven't unlocked yet.  There's no indicator showing you which ingredients you currently have access to.  So you're forced to go into the practice area and prep the food so you know which ingredients you actually have.  Was it really too much work to put a little check mark or something by the ingredients you currently have?

Again, this isn't a bad game, but playing more than 4-5 days in a single session causes it to become monotonous.  The campaign needs a significant reduction in it's length.  Maybe 5 days for your first restaurant, 8 days for the second, etc.  20 days to get through each is way to much.  Foods need balanced, and there needs to be some sort of real difficulty outside of the artificial garbage they currently have.  Fun in small spurts, but after playing this, I'm not sure I want to play the 2nd one unless they've addressed these issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164394302', 'num_games_owned': 107, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1613997800}
review:
很好玩，很简单
我一开始去找了汉化补丁，发现并没有。虽然上手后发现这游戏并不纠结英文【大部分时候是看图说话模式，邮件大多重复内容[如庆祝你今天做的很完美或者打赌巴拉巴拉]，在购买食物时下面有练习模式[练习模式下按ctrl可以看到顾客的不同要求，练习注意]，个人推荐从炸鸡，热狗，沙拉等操作简单的开始贩卖。具体请在游戏中自行判断
不足是顾客人物形象都没脖子[天天吃快餐当然没有脖子了]，而食物也略微简单了些，没有后续更新补充，制作的种类略少。另必须开20天餐厅才能获得一颗星，时间过长，基本一局估计5-7分钟不等【就是手酸】。RUSH TIME的标题会让屏幕变白，无法清楚的看到正在制作的食物。另，虽然图片没有特别精美，但是晚上最好吃过饭再玩这个....或者不要太晚游戏.....
总之，我很推荐，适合打发时间，基本过个几天开上一会儿，养成一个餐厅挺好
听说2要出了，祝大卖>w<

author: {'steamid': '76561198114721285', 'num_games_owned': 1847, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 3284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3266, 'last_played': 1504095727}
review:
CSD比以往同类游戏更成功的原因是，它抓住了重点，或者说是开发者很清楚自己的游戏需要什么：美味的食物，烹饪条理性带来的满足感，以及最重要的，要理想化，剔除令人不快的部分。所以即便内容所见即所得、中后期没什么意外惊喜出现，CSD也足够好玩了。

游戏基础内容是快速操作完成顾客订单。在这之上加入菜单调整影响客流量，即由玩家自己平衡劳务收益与工作/操作强度。升级菜品提升定价的同时也会增加额外烹饪步骤/操作量。奖励任务、宴会筹办、综艺节目、秘境挑战、VIP顾客等等则或鼓励或强制玩家掌握更复杂的菜品。

说下来，仅以此提升乐趣和难度不免单调，增加的是肌肉记忆的量，趣味层面变化不大：整个过程无非营业时应变接单顺序，局外策略比如店面升级也多是数值强化，8人排队上限的兵来将挡水来土掩的大路数没有变。所以后期体验就会显得有点崩，玩半天还是那么一套东西。

但就是玩着爽，我不信谁能拒绝啪啪声的做饭音效。

[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34646096-80-Days/]更多评测 [/url]＠[url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/80days]80days[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198238946714', 'num_games_owned': 4724, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 3439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2049, 'last_played': 1504498885}
review:
정신없이 휘몰아치는 러시아워타임에서 당신의 순발력과 기억력을 시험하게될것입니다.
밀어닥치는 손님들때문에 행복한 비명을 지르는 식당주인아저씨의 심정을 잘 표현했다고 생각합니다
요리할수있는 종류가 많고 모두 다른 기믹들을 가지고있어 질리지않고 계속 하게 만드네요. 
짬짬이 하기도 좋군요.
5성레스토랑에 모든 토너먼트 우승이 목표가되고 랭킹제시스템으로 컴퓨터가 지정하는 메뉴로 전세계유저와 점수를 경합할수있습니다.
그외 아이템도있고 업그래이드도있으며 이메일이와서 내기를 거는경우도있고 스폰서도있으며 데이트도해야하고 할게 많더군요.압도적 긍정적인 평가가 나오는건 당연하다고 생각이 듭니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036671040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 2489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2064, 'last_played': 1664312686}
review:
Great idea, fun to play, addicting too, but horribly unintuitive. This game often gives you very little instruction of what to do (and even when it does, it can be buried in a wall of fluff text). The worst part is when the game simply chooses not to acknowledge an important button-press, usually when you're in the middle of something vital, causing you to unintentionally ruin several recipes.
Not only that but the game is riddled with glitches, several times you'll fry something for a mere second and have it turn black and unusable, other times youl'l click buttons and they simply won't work. But of course the devs have stopped caring about patching the game and making it, y'know, USABLE, because they're too busy working on a sequel, which I assume will be just as bug-ridden as the first game was. Absolute waste of money if you value being able to play your games.
DO NOT BUY.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077161308', 'num_games_owned': 1297, 'num_reviews': 203, 'playtime_forever': 680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 680, 'last_played': 1503176142}
review:
A grind and a half that feels at home on the keyboard.

Everything on the surface about Cook, Serve, Delicious! absolutely screams mobile game. The grind, the slow upgrades, the basic style, the ugly cluttered UI/menus, the bad font choices, the music that's repetitive 15mins in... But when you get down to the main course of the meal you discover some absolute goodness that is very much meant to be served steaming on a keyboard platter. While mouse and mobile/controller style options are indeed available to click away, the real fun is with the keyboard. Every menu item you serve in the game has multiple recipes with key stroke sequences. Move a sodapop back and forth between flavors with the arrow keys, press down to fill, and add ice with the "I" key. Q, C, O, J will get you queso, sour cream, onions, and jalapenos on some nachos. E, B, S, C, enter will get you some egg. bacon, sausage and cheese on a breakfast sandwich and toss it in the oven. Etc etc etc. And to top it all off, each item is completely free to being customized. You can assign whatever key to whatever ingredient on whatever dish. It makes for quite the satisfying grind when you have six different menu items and just as many customers queued up to serve and you're slapping your keyboard to keep up. 

A career mode with goals and a few tacked on side interests (Iron Chef challenges, catering challenges, daily bet challenges, etc) get you grinding and grinding and grinding. The goal is to go from a no star to five star restaurant. Each step takes at least 20days plus other objectives. In my experiences thus far, its been five days too long each step. Which makes some of my play time feel artificial. The grind is very much real here. I'm at three star 10hrs in. All the window dressings and appetizers I mentioned at the start hurt the game too. The art/style/UI is unique but not my cup of tea (w/ flavor blast!) at all. Just doesn't work for my tastes (I want to say eyesore about the UI in particular, but not be completely mean about it). Audio department lacks as well, but some of the cooking noises work well. Too well. By my fifth beer pour my mouth was watering. All this is inconsequential to the core grind and gameplay though. Which is deceptively fun and "five star" if you will. 

Price is more than right (on sale), grind is real and lengthy, gameplay is satisfying on keyboard and its a dish I would recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007614870', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1202, 'last_played': 1434773590}
review:
Oh my gosh so amazing and addictive. There is nothing else quite like it. Typing games come closest, where both speed and precision are very important. Add the extremely satisfying feedback to your actions on top of that, and you have a very delicious game.

There is a  great deal of strategic and tactical decision-making in CSD – you have to decide which foods to put on your menu, weighing how many customers they attract, how much revenue they bring in, and how involved they are in prep (spaghetti has multiple cooking stages, spaced out; pizza has a wealthy of finicky customer options with its toppings) as well as your own personal skill in preparing each dish. Tactically, you also have to decide when to start, finish, and serve various customers (and do little restaurant-maintenance tasks throughout the day) to keep everyone happy and food quality optimized. It really is a terrific balancing act of thoughtful strategy and fast-paced, quick-hit gaming – just a wonderful, really satisfying game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994000906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 798, 'playtime_forever': 1572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1572, 'last_played': 1502992299}
review:
Listen. I do a lot of gag reviews that don't say anything, right? But I'm going to level with you. This is one of my favorite games of all time.

It puts me in a state of zen. I feel like Neo but I'm dodging onions and carrots and spices. And I'm not even that good at it!

25+ hours of campaign, plus endgame content with no difficulty ceiling whatsoever. And for what it's worth the mobile version is fucking amazing to play as well so buy it twice. I'm as hyped for the sequel to this as I am for Sonic Mania.

[b]Beware the shish kebabs.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198049229708', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 4383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 143, 'playtime_at_review': 4148, 'last_played': 1710877159}
review:
If you're not a fan of time management and memory games, this might not be for you. It's pretty high-pressure at times, especially if you play on extreme difficulty, and I just about tied myself in knots playing it with the keyboard. However, with a controller, I found it easier to get into the swing of things. It supports a bunch of different controllers natively, too, so if you've got a PS3, PS4, Xbox 360... your controller will probably work pretty well with it,

The achievements are fiendishly difficult to get all of, but I enjoyed the challenge, and if you're less of a perfectionist, the levels themselves will be easier on you. (I kept insisting on getting a perfect streak.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198138558085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1564, 'last_played': 1502214536}
review:
Enjoyed this one but it perhaps out-stayed it's welcome towards the end with a fairly limited amounts of food and drink, a problem supposedly resolved by the soon to be released sequel.

Playing on mouse and keyboard, essentially the game is a challenge of learning the keyboard shortcuts for each ingredient and being both precise and quick in applying this knowledge to orders as they come in. For such a simple concept it is surprisingly intense and fast moving particularly during rush hours and especially with complex dishes on your menu. 

The game, though graphically undemanding, has a lovely and very cohesive style. My only criticism here would be that as I progressed through the star ratings I did find myself wishing for a little more variety in the backdrops and maybe three or four extra customer models.

Also worth mentioning is the soundtrack that is surprisingly catchy. I found myself tapping my foot more than a few times playing this and when you find a rhythm with both the tunes and the frantic pace it's pretty zen like!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998569345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3719, 'last_played': 1505447586}
review:
Easy to play but hard to master. Great soundtrack and a fun game to play.

You get to make and serve a variety of foods ranging from sushi, burgers, soup. Not only that you get to manage chores like trapping rats, flushing the toilet and washing dishes.

Expect to get stressed as you get to the higher levels with the fast rush hour orders. The extreme mode is interesting to try out.

If you want all the achievements in the game, expect to put in some time and effort!

author: {'steamid': '76561198081284650', 'num_games_owned': 82, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1324, 'last_played': 1692202425}
review:
This game is very simple and a lot of fun.

Pros:
- Varied Recipes
- Simple controls
- The soundtrack is pretty good

Cons:
- The amount of recipes to remember and the buttons to click for the different recipes are too confusing. @_@
- You are alone doing everything from cleaning toilet to FINDING A ******* ROBBER.
- The stress and the salt of failling as a cook.

Who knew that cooking could be this easy and hard at the same time ;-;

review: This game is incredibly fun. Gameplay is cooking various recipes ingredient by ingredient using assigned keys for each one. If you've got your keyboard memorized, the game will be that much easier, but still engaging and fun. There is a lot of great humor and extras in this game (betting, catering challenges, cooking for online dates, etc.). I can tell the devs put love into it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044201948', 'num_games_owned': 629, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1395, 'last_played': 1490573261}
review:
8/10

A great game that would be even greater if it wasn't so god damn [i]tedious.[/i] Don't get me wrong, Cook, Serve, Delicious is a ton of fun. You get hours of enjoyment trying to keep up with all the QTE events, juggling menus, pushing your restaurant to 5 Stars, and just playing the game. I adore it for what it was, and enjoy the foods available, as well as the upgrades. The challenge levels and modes also provide a nice break from the regular gameplay.

However, the game becomes tedious within about ten hours, and around that point, it starts to feel like a chore to keep going. The foods are upgraded so far it becomes mind boggling trying to keep up with all the shortcuts, and I had to remap them all to be the same across foods to keep my reflexes from screwing me up.

Overall, I think this is a fantastic game with a few little things that could be improved upon. And I am definitely looking forward to the sequel to see how it improves upon an already fantastic formula.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114901816', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2272, 'last_played': 1500493752}
review: I see one of the tags for the game is "leisure". Well, good sirs, I couldn't disagree more. When you go on a bet with Crazy Dave to finish of a day perfect, and you have 3 burgers and 2 pizzas in the oven, the dishes needs washing and the trash is piling up, it's anything BUT leisure. Frustratingly hard at times, referring mainly too the more advances servings and the iron cook challenges, but I've spent about 40 hours on it. And STILL can't get past the two last iron cook challenges. Good fun, but excpect to be stressed as hell, fucking up things when you get out of the rythm, just wishing you didn't have both soup, pizza and burgers on the same day!

author: {'steamid': '76561197991217314', 'num_games_owned': 564, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 376, 'last_played': 1544659660}
review:
Initially i was a little unsure of whether i'd want to keep playing it and i couldn't handle the rush hour at all. But once you've done it a few times, you learn it pretty quick and get into the swing of things. Sure you may not play it endlessly for days on end, but you'll always hop on it for a little fun, when you want something a little more simple, or when you're just in the mood to "cook" things. I'm sure most of the meals i've served would've caused severe food poisoning. Might explain why i always need to flush the DAMN TOILET.

The only bad point i could say about it, is since some ingredients start with the same letter, it can be hard setting up alternate keybinds for ingredients on certain dishes (i set N on oNions since O was taken for Olives). 

TL;DR, it's a great little game for the price that will grow on you and offer little comfy game sessions of which i can't think of any other game that offers this. Highly recommend it. There is a sequel coming out as well if you're interested.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165694737', 'num_games_owned': 275, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1520132997}
review:
If you play Ore No Ryouri (I'm the Chef) back in the PS1 era, then this game is for you.

This game is no doubt insanely fun like it. It's easy to learn, but hard to master. The game will have you plan out your day by letting you set up your own menu with foods that have both boosters and detractors. Example being Soda, it's a staple food which means it won't become stale after 2 days. However, it suffers from being trashy which means that you'll be taking out the trash much often, and it's a must have for fatties which can be considered weird damaging your Buzz.

Buzz is the satisfaction of your customers with your restaurant. The higher your buzz, the more customers you get. This also means that there's possibly less customers coming in during Rush Hours. Having a high percentage of Buzz can help you get more customers. 

Now, it won't always be a normal day. You will be dealing with two Rush Hours everyday. Morning Rush and Evening Rush. This means that customers comes in at an increased rate. More orders will come in and you can make some pretty nice cash if you're able to breeze through it. Keep in mind that it can put a lot of pressure into you as during Rush Hours you will have to multitask in very small time.

Before you start your day, you have to prep your menu and equipments in Management Mode. You choose what you want to serve to your customers and the foods you chosen will affect your Buzz. You can also buy equipments which unlocks more food for you to buy, cuts down on chores, and keeping your customers patient much longer. You'll also get emails that involves the weather, bets, spam, and even special events which you can do later in the game as you progress. You can even practice the foods you plan to serve or buy to help you grasp the idea of how to prepare, cook, and serve it.

It's not just serving foods to the customers you'll have to do, it's the chores you have to do too. You will be cleaning dishes, taking out trash, set up a rat trap, flushing toilets, and identifying robbers. These can often be focused as high priority as it can damage your Buzz. Though often if you have to deal with chores during Rush Hours or when a Customer is about to leave from being impatient, it might be better to focus on the customers first before you do the chores.

Throughout the game, you will be dealing with the Health Inspector. This is when the time to do these chores are cut down dramatically and you will have to multitask with chores and customers often. If you don't pass, this affects your buzz with a detractor Failed Safety Inspection.

Overall, the game is easy to learn, hard to master. It takes a lot of practice to become really good at the game. Multitasking and managing is gonna be your best friend to the entirety of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967354699', 'num_games_owned': 807, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1535280370}
review:
This is an intresting game. It makes you think fast, and over all, it makes you practice your reflexes!
During a "day" in the game, you really have to stay focus. It will become more and more athletic over the time!

But as I said, if you want to practice your reflexes and reaction time, this is the perfect game!

(Pro tip: Just keep a bottle of water around when you play, this game can be a real sport :P )

review: Once you boil it all down gameplay consists of observing what gamepad inputs and timings are required then you follow along. review:

Aber trotzdem ein tolles "Minigame" mit dem man auch Stunden vorm Rechner verbringen kann. ;)

Gerade für Kochenthusiasten ein kleines Muss für die Bibliothek !

Hoffe Teil 2, welcher im Herbst erscheinen müsste, wird mind. genauso gut !

author: {'steamid': '76561198077382950', 'num_games_owned': 588, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 563, 'last_played': 1501175793}
review:
I've been debating buying this game for quite a while.
When I ended up buying it, I didn't expect too much of it - I thought it would be like a well done mobile port maybe? Like something mildly entertaining I'd play for a couple hours before getting bored. The $2 price seemed fair to me for such an experience, so I decided to buy it.

Now that I've started playing it - I have literally no idea why I thought it's like that, this game is masterfully crafted, from the main gameplay (which is really engaging and fun and skillful), to the management phases (which are surprisingly tactical), to the amusing emails you get throughout the game.

I think one system I really liked about the game is that you sort of set the difficulty for yourself. If you're doing badly, then the game will be easier - in this game most upgrades give you more money, but (in some cases) they also make the game more difficult, creating a kind of system where the game gets progressively more difficult as you get better and more able to handle it.

I'd definitely recommend this game for anyone looking for something that doesn't require too much thought and is not frustrating, while being challenging and fun. It's a great unwind game for me and I've been really enjoying it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009677852', 'num_games_owned': 935, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1690961203}
review:
This is the kind of game that you'll put hours into without realising it, on my first play, I had only intended to play it for about an hour whilst I had another game downloading, before I knew it I had spent a good four hours on it.

It has a well paced progression, you can't just immediately become the best resteraunt, it requires time and effort, the challenge curve is well done, and once you get into the groove of it, you'll be serving customers like the God damn Flash, be careful though, it can be pretty easy to lose your wind if you lose focus.

The art style is simple but charming, sound design is very well done, and the voice acting for the customers gives me a giggle now and then.

I bought it during sale, £1.39, and I do not regret the purchase whatsoever, I'd say it's even worth buying at full price, if you can afford it and are looking for a game to spend hours on.

It's also very satisfying if you play with a mechanical keyboard, the clicking and clacking of keys almost becomes theraputic after a while.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150302463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1581959042}
review:
非常考驗記憶跟眼明手快。

做為老闆兼員工得處理各種繁忙瑣事，除了要準備好相應的搭配給客人之外，還要洗餐盤、刷馬桶、倒垃圾﹍﹍天啊整個快起肖，會玩到腦袋當機XDDDDDDDD

遊戲畫風非常簡陋但不會影響到作品品質，目前剛玩，覺得它需要花點巧思，但對於英文不通的人來說只要懂得買食材、升級裝備、手速腦力夠強，應該是照樣能玩得嚇嚇叫啦（？）
覺得搞笑的一點還有連小偷的樣貌也要幫人家畫出來，花時間搞這個結果沒空理其他事項，官方絕對是惡意的（笑哭

整體來說遊戲還不錯玩。

author: {'steamid': '76561198076086271', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1499387839}
review:
I absolutely enjoy every second of this game so far, from the fast-paced typing gameplay to the careful consideration of menu rotation and food purchases. The concept of taking your restaurant from a little hole-in-the-wall joint to a full on, 5 star classy establishment is super addicting and keeps pushing you to play "just one more day!" (I have played the game prior to purchasing it on Steam). I like that the game has clearly taken a lot of real-life restaurant elements and combined them into something so engaging and exciting- I am a self-professed Kitchen Nightmares junkie, so being able to use some of the business tips I've gleaned from the series has been fun! I super love the random emails you get in the game, brings something new to look forward to each day period in the game :) and I will admit that the cash bonus you are awarded for achieving a "Perfect Day" helps keep you on your toes all the time, always striving. 

I would recommend this game to you if you like light business sims, typing games, cooking/restaurant managing, or something you can play either quickly (play an in-game day here or there) or for extended time periods (but be careful, it really is addicting lol).

author: {'steamid': '76561198281885319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1499859161}
review:
我好喜这个游戏。
首先cooking这个主题本来就是我的菜

从一个烹饪菜鸟，在一个简陋的破餐馆，开始只会烧一些简单的菜，慢慢地提升自己的技能，操控也娴熟起来。
然后餐馆开始升星，装饰变得漂亮了，能够烹饪的菜肴也逐渐丰富起来，非常有成就感。

结束一天的工作，看看电脑上邮件，有些风趣幽默，让人忍俊不禁。
有些是客人发来的感谢信，看完后觉得斗志满满。就这样调整心情后又开始第二天忙碌的厨师生活。

每次学习或者工作累了以后，就打开笔记本来上一局，舒缓一下压力。十分不错的休闲游戏。

review: Not sure how to describe Cook, Serve, Delicious. Like, it's sort of a restaurant sim, but it's more of a typing game, I guess? Except you aren't typing actual words, and anyway I prefer to play it with a controller? Let's just say it's an incredibly addicting exercise in muscle memory. CSD is incredibly satisfying to play, the customizable menu essentially lets you set your own difficulty, and the buzz mechanic encourages you to constantly try new stuff and mix things up. Also, the music is pretty great.

review: Simplement le meilleur jeu de cuisine auquel j'aie jamais joué. Le côté jeu de rythme devient vite addictif. Personnellement je joue au clavier et le gameplay me rappelle beaucoup the typing of the dead dans la rapideté d'exécution et le plaisir de faire des combos. Si vous voulez redécouvrir ce genre beaucoup trop représenté sur mobile devices et lui redonner ses lettres de noblesse, achetez ce jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039271857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1902, 'last_played': 1676415155}
review: Cook, Serve, Delicious! is one of my favorite games of all time.  It is a wonderful casual, yet addicting "just one more day" experience.  This game I can pick up for just a short while or binge on!  I highly reccomend this game and it is a great deal even at it's full price!  Plus, the developer is a great guy who is constantly updating and releasing new content.  He also listens to the community and is always implementing fantastic new ideas!  So excited for the sequel!!

review: In honor of CSD!2 coming out this fall, I figured I would grace one of my favorite games with my second ever review of a game in Steam. This game is a pinnicle of anxiety-inducing "fun". I use quotes because as it's happening, you will hate everything. You will panic during rush hours and feel overwhelmed. But, as night settles in and the customers slowly trickle out, you will realize that life truly is Delicious!

author: {'steamid': '76561198058979202', 'num_games_owned': 299, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 2936, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2030, 'last_played': 1645134250}
review:
Si vous aimez la difficulté croissante dans les jeux vidéos, les défis et autres modes de jeu nécessitant d'apprendre par coeur des combinaisons de touches pour espérer réussir, ce jeu est fait pour vous!
Pour faire simple, il s'agit d'un jeu de gestion de restaurant où le joueur prépare les commandes de ces clients, avec les touches du clavier.
Au début cela est assez simple, peu de client arrivent, les nourritures que l'ont achète sont assez simple à préparer (2-3 touches), mais on se laisse vite prendre par le jeux, qui nous demande de plus en plus de s'adapter à la clientèle croissante, tant bien que l'on réussisse à servir correctement (système de buzz/bad buzz en fonction de la réussite de la journée précédente).
Plus on joue, plus on peut monter son restaurant en étoile, sachant qu'il fau remplir un certain nombre de critères pour obtenir une étoile supplémentaire.
Et si vous avez fini l'aventure principale, c'est à dire que vous ayez obtenu le maximum d'étoiles possible,vous pouvez choisir le mode de difficulté extreme (celui là faut vraiment s'accrocher), ou bien faire des défis ajouté dans l'extension Iron Cook qui, je le rappelle, est une sorte de DLC ou grosse maj GRATUITE intégrée au jeu depuis un bon petit temps.
Avec tout cela vous obtenez un jeu marrant, addictif et même un peu compétitif!
Je le conseille vivement, et par ailleurs, le 2 devrai sortir d'ici fin Aout 2017 donc soyez au taquet!

author: {'steamid': '76561198056102078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1609, 'last_played': 1608444917}
review:
I picked this game up because I had recently hammered through Overcooked and needed something else to satisfy my silly cartoon kitchen madness itch. This game is impossible to put down. I'm memorizing key patterns and dervishing across my keyboard with frantic speed, trying not to let the orders pile up, fishing for tips, and fantasizing about that next upgrade. 

Give it a shot. You'll be hard pressed to put it down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173380797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1555941268}
review: Attention à ceux qui comme moi cherchaient un jeu de gestion, Cook Serve Delicious est plutôt un jeu d'agilité où de temps en temps il faut gérer la carte de son restaurant ainsi que ses accessoires. Mais le coeur du jeu c'est l'agilité. Perso j'ai joué au clavier, c'était déjà pas simple, donc à la manette je n'imagine même pas... Très répétitif mais plutôt fun, c'est un jeu auquel je pense rejouer de temps en temps, pour faire une pause entre d'autres jeux plus développés et prenants.

Co-op não é um espetáculo, mas ao menos tem. Pelo preço é sem dúvidas um jogo surpreendente, um dos meus favoritos da Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056639180', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1002, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1690982478}
review:
Not played much of this game but when I do I always enjoy myself. It's a game where the only thing you can get mad at is yourself for being an idiot and getting an order wrong. Call me sadistic but I like that feeling. 

I'll only play it for an hour at a time but it's all I need to enjoy it, and I'll keep coming back to it just to get my fix.

Neat little game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092103790', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 916, 'last_played': 1608697475}
review:
Вы когда-нибудь мечтали сыграть на пианино в детстве? А с приходом компьютера и интернета в каждый дом обучиться слепому десятипальцевому набору?
Если да - то это игра для вас. Забудьте, что такое "манипулятор типа мышь". В этой игре она вам не понадобится!
В этой игре каждому ингридиенту назначена быстрая клавиша набора. И чем дальше в лес, тем больше и быстрее вам нужно будет "собирать"/набирать ингридиенты.
Из минусов могу отметить только одно: необходимо базовае знание английского языка, дабы в кратце понимать, о чём вас просят посетители, а в дальнейшем и дополнительно поставленных задач.

author: {'steamid': '76561198248103400', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1560535716}
review:
Cook, serve, delicious is one of those games that are easy to learn, but hard to master. You play as a restaurant owner that serves a line of waiting customers. You have to prepare each individual order by pressing the right button for each ingredient on your keyboard (you can also play with mouse or controller), and while it is pretty simple, it gets frantic very fast. You get to pick your own menu and upgrade your kitchen and recipes, which most of the time also makes them more complex to make but also more rewarding. 

The game never gets boring as it keeps you constantly on your toes by a steady influx of customers, rush hour (which is a more fast paced part of your day) as well as several chores and sometimes even robberies (!) where you get to identify your assaulter. There are also several challenge stages for specific food groups which can get REALLY difficult to complete, but help you lead your restaurant toward your 5 star goal.

Gameplay gets more fast paced as you progress and can be pretty stressful, but is also very rewarding when you manage to get that perfect combo streak at the end of the day. If you are into this time sensitive serving "genre", this game will keep you hooked into it for hours at a time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093493343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1365, 'last_played': 1498073846}
review:

review:
재밌다.
옛날 플래쉬게임, 특히 비비빅의 분식왕이나 슈의 라면가게 같은거 좋아하는 사람한테 완전 잘 맞음. 키보드 연타하는 맛도 있고, 매일 메뉴 바꾸고 순서 맞춰서 요리하는 거 등 신경 쓸 부분이 많아서 잘 안 질린다. 메일 시스템 같은 것도 그냥 소소하게 읽기 재밌는 컨텐츠 중 하나.
Weekly Challenge도 재밌게 했었는데 이제 갱신 중단돼서 조금 아쉽다..
2도 출시됐다는데 사야겠다

author: {'steamid': '76561198319120557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1266, 'last_played': 1490843982}
review:
An excellent typing game under the guise of a cooking game. You prepare foods by hitting the keys corresponding to the right ingredients, which sounds easy, but becomes hectic past a certain point.
Burger with bacon, lettuce and tomatoes? "BLT". 
Lasagna? "PSCRPSCRPSCR" 
Pizza with everything except tomatoes? "Err..."

Very recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059113707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1497571558}
review:
This game has potential, but it can't seem to make up it's mind whether or not it wants to be a keyboard game or a mouse game. 

If you like memorizing keypress orders maybe this is ok for you, but this doesn't do it for me. 

The interface needs a fair amount of work to make it more interesting. If you want me to use the mouse, don't make me click keyboard buttons on the screen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076300183', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1531, 'last_played': 1497480114}
review:
Decent and chill game, if you like time management games (like Flipline Studios Papa's series)  it may be for you.

I like that different dishes have different methods of cooking that gets harder with upgrades. Although I would like to learn reasoning behind design of some dishes. Some are really hard w/o offering appropriate payoff. Other dishes are relatively simple and give you a lot of money and perks. For example nachos is very complicated and time consuming w/ middle line pricing and so so perks. On other hand steaks are really easy for its price and perks.

Also progression seams very limited and you can't furnish your establishment apart for some passive upgrades.

All in all, my advice, wait for second one (in production) or play Papa's Pastaria or Papa's Cupcakeria for free. Don't take me wrong, this is decent game, there are just better options price wise.
Although I'm interested to see what authors will do  with second one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136957091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1398, 'last_played': 1496902357}

author: {'steamid': '76561198141710161', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1118, 'last_played': 1672787648}
review:
I bought this for the sole purpose of having another local multiplayer game and it's amazing! It's clear that the creators really put a lot of time and consideration into this game and it is definitely on my favorites list.

Pros:
+Great soundtrack
+Funny emails on the in-game computer that include challenges
+Variety of foods and beverages
+Variety of ways to customize your menu
+Easy switch between cook and expediter when playing co-op locally
+Variety of ways to cook foods with options for improvements that increase the difficulty


Cons:
+No online multiplayer
+Cook, Serve, Delicious! 2 is not out yet. :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198311097418', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 3094, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3090, 'last_played': 1669505329}
review:
A relaxing game to play after doing hard work. The gameplay maybe fast-paced but there's no real negative consequences for doing badly. The music is real smooth and jazzy. The visuals are hunger-inducing and easy on the eyes.

P.S: There's a really high skill ceiling for those seeking a challenge. Would definitely recommend :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198089374202', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 1938, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1753, 'last_played': 1495738391}
review:
It took almost two years of on and off casual play but I have finally completed Cook Serve Delicious! CSD is excellent and you can see that the dev put a lot of passion into the project. The community is still active with weekly challenges and forum posts. The gameplay focuses on challenges around preparing the food. You can access upgrades for your food and restuarant but don't have the ability to decorate your restuarant like you would be able to in other games in this genre which is something I hope will be included in CSD 2. This is a game that you can easily play casually or as a hardcore gamer.

I would definitely recommend this to anyone that enjoys cooking games.
