author: {'steamid': '76561198117244154', 'num_games_owned': 475, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1461182708}
review:
Gra kojarzy mi się, jak za dawnych lat grało się w przeglądarce w podobne cuda. Ale tym razem, nasze postępy się zapisują i możemy ciągle dalej rozwijać swoją restaurację :) Wspaniała gierka na odprężenie lub na tłusty czwartek, gdy jesteś na diecie. Z pozoru łatwa, a w rzeczywistości trzeba tyle klikać, że łatwo o pomyłkę :P Niby na padzie łatwiej, ale jednak na klawiaturze się mniej gubię.
Grałam lokalną współpracę i było dużo śmiechu :)! Niestety za dobrze nam nie szło :P
Podsumowując polecam i chętnie wracam do tej gry raz na jakiś czas :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198024862468', 'num_games_owned': 217, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1724, 'last_played': 1646251729}
review:
Alors ça c'est la bonne surprise, ca ne paye pas de mine mais le jeu est vite addictif. 

On y achete son menu, on apprend à le maitriser pour évoluer en étoiles. Il faut être agile du clavier parce qu'il faut enchainer les plats pendant le service, avec 2 rush hour !

Pour avoir un resto à 5 étoiles j'en suis à 28h de jeu, donc la durée de vie est plutôt correcte pour ce prix.
Il y a egalement une partie avec des challenges online.

A savoir, le jeu n'est pas en francais, pour créer les plats ca ne pose pas de réel problème. Lors des challenges des intitulés de plats sont en anglais ce qui peut être compliqué sur le moment mais on passe à la commande suivante et c'est réglé. Rien d'insurmontable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030892147', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1271, 'last_played': 1505135578}
review:
A great game and a great developer. The developer kept updating this game way beyond release date for completely free, the updates were large and included entirely new game modes. They didn't seem to be like other games that drop one or two big updates for marketing purposes and then leave the game entirely for years (e.g. when new expansions come out) as there were a lot of updates in this game and not linked to any flashy marketing tactics.

To me this is exemplary, the devs seems to really care about the game and they are a great example for other developers and larger studios. I believe they can build a really good franchise if they can keep at it, and I hope their efforts are being recognised by the playerbase.


I look forwards to the Cook Serve Delicious 2 and thank the devs for this amazing game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198218157399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1613233751}
review:
Es un juego bastante difícil, para los que su idioma nativo no es el inglés a la hora de preparar las comidas y poner los ingredientes, no creo que lo tengan difícil ya que se pueden personalizar dichas teclas.

El juego está muy bien pensando en el tema de elegir los menús de cada día con todas las variables que hay, como el inspector de sanidad, el ladrón... Además de muchísimos platos a cocinar.

Llevo pocas horas de juego pero eso en poco se soluciona, y tengo unas ganas locas de probar el cooperativo local o los desafíos pero aún me estoy haciendo al modo de juego.

En definitiva, recomiendo el juego, yo lo tenía en lista de deseados pero en Chrono.gg lo adquirí gratis así que ese dinero que me he ahorrado.

No creo que lo vayan a sacar en español, pero sería un puntazo. Ahí lo dejo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063327951', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 2437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2416, 'last_played': 1460737975}
review:
This is a simple looking game, but challenging at higher difficulties. By choosing certain foods you can increase or decrease how difficult a round is. It is satisfying to find that you can memorize recipes and keep up with the orders during a rush hour.

This game requires a decent dexterity on a keyboard, being able to rapidly press keys in a certain order without pressing the buttons next to it. I would recommend it, because this game is different from anything else I have played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063650834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 5748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4468, 'last_played': 1691285189}
review:
Was soll ich dazu sagen. schaut einfach auf meine Spielzeit^^ nun zu meiner Review:
Nur durch Zufall auf dieses Spiel auf Steam gekommen kaufte ich es mir weil ich schon lange nach einem Zeit Managmentspiel suchte und dieses hier hat es in sich. Ich glaube dass es die meisten nicht länger als 10 Stunden gespielt haben wird einfach der sein dass das Spiel irgendwann so anspruchsvoll und schwierig wird dass die meisten danach aufgeben. Zur Verteidigung derer muss man sagen dass das Spiel echt stressig wird mit dem SPielfortschritt, auch wenn man sich einige Hilfsmittel erwerben kann. Ich bin nach 40 Stunden mit dem normalen Modus sehr weitgekommen nun gehts in den schweren (sehr stressigen :D) Modus über. Ich kann es nur allen empfehlen die auch nach einem Zeitmagaement Spiel suchen und Fingerfertigkeit besitzen und schnelle Reaktionen haben. Allen anderen kann ich es nicht wirklich empfehlen da es irgendwann ziemlich schwer wird (ohne Fehler zu sein). Ich freue mich auf jeden Fall schon tierisch auf den Zweiten Teil der noch in diesem Jahr (2017) erscheinen soll. Fühlsz du dich angesprochen dann kaufe es dir und wünsche dir noch viel Spaß mit dem Spiel :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198096938329', 'num_games_owned': 2017, 'num_reviews': 268, 'playtime_forever': 937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 792, 'last_played': 1585608639}
review:
Es un juego que a medida que vas avanzando se hace más complicado. Es básicamente tener que recordar los diferentes comandos/series para realizar cada comida y acción.
[list]
[*]El juego es sencillo con la típica trama de que la protagonista empieza con su restaurante nuevo.
[*]Tienes que ir modificando el menú diariamente ya que eso o te da o te quita bonus.
[*]Tiene una parte de retos semanales muy divertido pero que la verdad uno necesita del conocimiento de todos los platos para poder jugarlo ya que sino se hace muuuy complicado.
[*]La música me encanta acompaña el juego y ayuda a relajarte, debido que aveces creo algo de stress por la propia mecánica del juego.
[*]Es un juego de memoria y habilidad para realizar cada plato.
[/list]
La verdad me tiene enganchado y soy sólo nivel 2 de restaurante con lo que me queda mucho camino y platos por comprar. Por eso los challenges me cuestan pero es obvio que estan hechos para la gente que tiene un nivel alto de restaurante y quiere demostrar sus habilidades. La verdad me encanta para jugar de vez en cuando aunque es cierto que si juegas cada día obtienes mejores y mantienes los bonuses del día anterior lo que lo hace más adictivo. Cada plato tiene su forma de realizarlo con el teclado, por eso entrenas la memoria.

review:

The game is very fast paced and hard to get a hang of some of the recipes. While some may get bored of the repetiveness of it, I found it more driving. The achievements were mildly hard to get, and gave me another reason to finish the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055298567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1522497906}
review:
I love cooking and this game is based on a very simple concept and well executed. 
Some catchy music, dynamic backgrounds, time pressure, cooking timers, different recipes for a challenge, upgrade systems and so on. Wonderful experience for me. 

Things that could be better:
- Pasta recipe is way too complicated and needs simplification
- More music
- A Ratatouille dish... for unknown reasons ;)
- the buzz system could need some improvements, it is almost always too low (less harder punishments plis)
- (IMPORTANT:) Fullscreen mode. PLEASE make it happen!
- Some soundeffects for combos. Like someone saying DELICIOUS! when you reach a 10+ combo, MICHELIN! If you reach a 50+ combo or TOO RAW! (Gordon Ramsey like) when you fuck up a few dishes in a row.
- Backgrounds with higher resolutions. You could also let the player chose the city that he wants to have his restaurant in and adjust the background accordingly (If the player choses Paris, you can show the Eifeltower for example).


... It would also be so nice if you could decorate your restaurant in a way that you like (Asian/European/Plants/Wood/Metal)

To everyone who loves cooking: Yes, it's worth the money, buy it! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198102019499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1491568347}

author: {'steamid': '76561198172768685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2063, 'last_played': 1664508784}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious I got off a Humble Bundle a long while back, and it was the best dollar I have ever spent. This game is just one of those games where you never feel pressured to succeed, unless you are trying to pressure yourself to, because their seems to be no real consequences for your actions. Failure just restricts your progress, but at the same time, you don't really benifit much from perfecting every customers order either besides earning an extra $250 and getting additional restaurant buzz, and that makes this the perfect game to just chill out to when playing it.

The thing about Cook, Serve, Delicious! is it has no definitive difficulty spike, the game is only as hard as you make it. Even on Extreme Difficulty, if you just serve Salad and Fish all the time, then you can breeze through it. The difficult is more so based on what foods you choose to cook and upgrades you choose to purchase, and I like that alot. It give the player more freedom through their actions and give them a better overall playing experience.

One thing I will fault Cook, Serve, Delicious! for however is the 20 Days Of Service requirement for getting your next star rating. This really is just here to drag on the game even further than it should be (even though its a simulator game) while also restricting player progress. Cut that number down to 14 days and I'd be more content with it. Besides that however, Cook, Serve, Delicious! doesn't have many flaws besides its lack of variety in menu options, which is something I hope the new game which is coming out soon will admend, but also makes up for it through the upgrading process of menu items.

Overall, Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a rather fun and addicting game in short bursts. Again, there isn't really much to say regarding the gameplay of Cook, Serve, Delicious! since it's rather simple and self-explanation, and by that I mean make food for customer, don't make customer mad, but you quickly realize that alot of the food options in Cook, Serve, Delicious! are kinda similar to one another. I definitely say it's worth the full $10 is costs, due to the mix of cooking challenges, betting options and text messages that you get being rather quirky, fun, challenging and overall enjoyable since it spices up the gameplay a bit and really shows the amount of love and care Vertigo Gaming put into their game. I can't wait for the sequel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198157386667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1748, 'last_played': 1491669040}

author: {'steamid': '76561198054393567', 'num_games_owned': 772, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 2894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2894, 'last_played': 1488735007}
review:
Cook, serve, delicious is one of those games that are easy to learn, but hard to master. You play as a restaurant owner that serves a line of waiting customers. You have to prepare each individual order by pressing the right button for each ingredient on your keyboard (you can also play with mouse or controller), and while it is pretty simple, it gets frantic very fast. You get to pick your own menu and upgrade your kitchen and recipes, which most of the time also makes them more complex to make but also more rewarding. 

The game never gets boring as it keeps you constantly on your toes by a steady influx of customers, rush hour (which is a more fast paced part of your day) as well as several chores and sometimes even robberies (!) where you get to identify your assaulter. There are also several challenge stages for specific food groups which can get REALLY difficult to complete, but help you lead your restaurant toward your 5 star goal.

Gameplay gets more fast paced as you progress and can be pretty stressful, but is also very rewarding when you manage to get that perfect combo streak at the end of the day. If you are into this time sensitive serving "genre", this game will keep you hooked into it for hours at a time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069920427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 1370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1533152256}

author: {'steamid': '76561198047328877', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 2223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2192, 'last_played': 1505849725}
review:
This is a great simulation game! 

At a first glance, this game looks like it'll be tough as nails. It appears to demand perfection and punish you harshly for mistakes - but the very opposite is true! 

Your very first items are all very simple to make, and help teach you the base mechanics and buttons of the game. While serving up corndogs and soda might not be the most exciting thing ever, it'll help to automate things like picking up orders and serving them. 
The difficulty in this game is always determined by the player. If you miss a ton of orders, there will be less customers the next day, allowing you to learn at a slower pace. Additionally, there are many different recipes that vary in difficulty which you can put on your menu to make things easier on yourself. 

The food all looks great, and is enormously satisfying to make. The sound effects of a burger being slapped together is a feeling like no other, and you will feel like a gaming champion when you reach a perfect day with difficult recipes on your menu.

There are a ton of small fun things that the game offers to enhance your gameplay. Some emails and characters will ask for you to carry certain recipes or combinations, gently nudging you to change up your status quo and use recipes that you normally avoid.
Becoming good at cooking in this game is satisfying, and it remains fun throughout the entire experience! 

The only Con I can think of is that the checklist for upgrading your restaurant takes too long to complete. Not because the challenges are demanding, but because it always requires 20 days of gameplay before you can advance. Sometimes this means you need to play through 7-12 days just to advance your restaurant and unlock new upgrades. 
Also, a few of the recipes can be tricky in their wording, which sometimes leads to frustration and an inability to complete the recipe. ( I'm looking at you, Stacked Enchilada's! ) 

All in all, this is a great game that I would recommend to anyone. Go for perfect scores on online leaderboards, or just do a few casual rounds trying to perfect that soup recipe you unlocked - it's all fair game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198071050903', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1622217325}

author: {'steamid': '76561198260060192', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1473, 'last_played': 1603773159}

Completely worth your money. Go grab it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012058361', 'num_games_owned': 676, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1580312486}
review: I was really bored on the 25th of March 2017 so I decided to launch up Cook, Serve, Delicious and talk about it to my best pal in the world Trevor Ophey. I had alot of fun its alright nice meme.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013414879', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1543802108}
review:
Really fun game and has more depth than you would give it credit for. You not only have to quickly mash keys in order to prepare perfect meals, but you also have to plan your expenses and your daily menu. Certain meals comboed with each other give you beneftis, or hurt your restaurant "buzz".

So basically, definitely grab this. It's cheap, fun and relaxing, although rush hour can be pretty tense, you are not punished too much for messing up, unless you try to go for really high streak of perfect orders.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979519257', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1537493607}
review:
This game is awesome! I haven't played the co op yet, but the single player is a lot of fun. It does remind me a lot of working in the food industry. The constant juggling between remembering orders, and performing tasks while people continue to pile the work load on, all until a short break and then nothing happens.

The management aspects of the game are fun. The in-game emails can be quirky and silly. The start of each game day is a commitment though, and it can be difficult to play it unless you can divert most, if not all, your attention to it. It is my opinion that the retail price of $10 is worth the value this game provides, and if it's on any sort of sale or bundle then it's probably a steal! The game has similarities to a luminosity brain training game, except it is actually fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198357042823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 8281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3836, 'last_played': 1625707145}

author: {'steamid': '76561198054426823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 862, 'last_played': 1644978651}
review:
This game is fun and engaging. You press buttons according to what food gets ordered.. all over the keyboard. You'll have buttons for each little ingredient and spice, requiring you to act quick to prepare foods. Each day or 'round' you'll have access to a main interface from which you'll check your emails, change up your daily menu and more. The emails add some humor and interest, making you want to continue. In short, the precise button-mash gameplay is great; it requires planning and strategy along with quick reflexes.

If you've been limited to action or FPS titles, it may be easy to see this one as a "typing game". Your input UI will be lined with letters, but you'll still have to read the recipe and press accordingly, so in no way will it feel scripted. To complicate things, your foods are upgradable, adding in new recipes that customers will love to change things about. The game is fast paced and gets challenging, even offering competitive leaderboards for an "Iron Chef" style experience, complete with new background scenes and an impressive roster of playable chefs. 

The sound effects pop and sizzle satisfyingly and are combined with tight controls. The music is enjoyable, and also relevant to how busy your restaurant is. Additionally, the art direction shines and contributes to displaying your progression towards being a 5 star restaurant.

If it's on sale, or even if it's not, you're looking to have some fast fun with this gem. You'll see quickly that a lot of detail went into making this game enjoyable, and that's something you aren't going to see with every title. 

10/10 all day long.

author: {'steamid': '76561198279725789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1493094225}

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198042211264', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1267, 'last_played': 1574485968}
review: One of my favorite games in my Steam library. There is so much content. Tons of recipes and upgrades for each of the recipes, plus multiplayer modes, challenge modes, and all kinds of little secrets that pop up around the game. I recommend this game because it is so challenging and so satisfying once you figure out how to get a perfect day. This game is definitely worth full price, but if you are not sure if it is for you, pick it up on sale!

review:
This is a pretty great game. Starts easy, then quickly ramps up as you level up. After only about 15 hours I'm at a 5 star restaurant and the restaurant is busy all the time. It gets super hectic during rush hour, and don't even think it's not stressful doing the Iron challenges! 
This is a good game to play a couple of hours at a time, as your brain starts getting fried if you play more than that! 
This game can be played exclusively on the keyboard and actually works a lot better if you don't use a mouse. 

If you like time management games, you'll like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989200097', 'num_games_owned': 864, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 1489028339}
review:
I rarely give games a thumbs down but unfortunately I didn't like this game for several reasons. 

Game progression is way too slow. It takes 20 in-game days to upgrade your restaurant, which really doesn't help keep interest because you're not making enough money to really get variety out of your menu/upgrades. There is just so much repitition that the game became a boring grind fest too quickly. I'm pretty sure that most of the time I spent playing this game was waiting for customers to come in for me to serve. The only fun part is playing during rush hour and unfortunately that is only a small part of each day. 

Normally I try to beat every game I play but sadly I gave up on this one after reaching one star. It was a cool idea but the pace needs to be picked up drastically after the player gets the hang of how things work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047555494', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2513, 'last_played': 1705349431}
review: This game has no great graphics or music or a complex storyline and it tends to become a bit repetitive, however I found it to be great fun for a few nights. The game will keep your heart bouncing as you will spend most of your time hammering your keyboard and battling against the clock. You won't be typing text, but quickly entering shortcuts in a precise order to prepare food in the game. You will both serve customers and participate in contests. There is a concept of levelling up/upgrading your restaurant and gaining new ingredients/recipes as you get more skilled in preparing dishes. You also need to plan a bit, for you are responsible of managing daily menus where each dish has its pros and cons. Cleaning the bathroom, doing the dishes, taking trash away and some other activities will also interfere with your cooking. Skilled use of the keyboard and high dexterity are the key to success in this game. Simple but hooking!

author: {'steamid': '76561198074323968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1530347641}

author: {'steamid': '76561198036592261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1584289261}

author: {'steamid': '76561198092285430', 'num_games_owned': 3948, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 3942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 878, 'last_played': 1596565534}
review:
Ist wohl nicht für jedermanns Geschmack.
Mir gefällt es. Es gibt einen Haufen Challenges und es dauert lange alle Gerichte zu Meistern. Anfangs habe ich es mit einem Keyboard und Maus gespielt, doch sobald man weiter kommt ist die Steuerung so einfach viel zu umständlich. Mein billiger Controller funktioniert leider nicht, daher habe ich das Spiel eine Weile auf Eis gelegt. Jetzt spiele ich es mit einem Huion Grafiktablett und es macht wieder Spaß!
Ich würde wirklich jedem empfehlen, es mit einem Controller oder einem Touchscreen zu spielen! Ansonsten ein nettes Spiel für zwischendurch!

author: {'steamid': '76561198209914909', 'num_games_owned': 110, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1494810898}
review:
Jesus christ. 
At first I didn't pay much attention to the reviews.
"How hard can a cooking game possibly be? I've played many of them during my childhood" I thought.
I was almost brought to tears from frustration. My heart is pumping. Rush hour may possibly give me a heart attack before the age of 25.
10/10 good time waster and I feel like I just ran a marathon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133045227', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1547411134}

Il a pas mal de possibilités d'évolution, j'ai pas encore eu la motivation d'avancer énormément mais je pense que ça vaut le coup. Mais comme je disais c'est un jeu à consommer par petites sessions car étant très répétitif (malgré la tentative de diversité des commandes liées aux consommations du resto), on s'ennuie quand même un peu trop facilement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034582392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1500, 'last_played': 1487129471}
review: Instant classic, this game is literally the definition of positive stress. Give yourself a mental workout playing this game, and become fulfilled earning a perfect combo day. Cook it up, people!

author: {'steamid': '76561198132466924', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2714, 'last_played': 1517716699}
review:
[h1]Cook, Serve, Delicious![/h1] e primeiramente um jogo de digitação e secundariamente um jogo de administração.

A primeira parte, o preparo dos pratos, envolve digitação onde cada letra corresponde a um dos ingredientes de cada prato. Por exemplo, para o preparo de uma pizza de pepperoni: T corresponde a molho de tomate, C queijo e P pepperoni. 

A segunda parte, envolve a escolha de quais pratos serão servidos a cada dia no cardapio, o jogo tem bastante diversidade, pizza, sushi, lagosta e etc. Com o dinheiro ganho a cada dia pode-se comprar mais prato e melhorar eles (pratos de niveis maiores são mais complexos).

Jogo extremamente viciante, recomendado para quem tem boa agilidade.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031324041', 'num_games_owned': 1122, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 1070, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 966, 'last_played': 1487701332}
review:
Fast and frantic much like working in a real kitchen, this game makes me want to go back into the industry.
Its just a case of taking the orders and getting them out there! 

There are ALOT of people who struggle with the pace of the game so may I suggest for a beginner that you go with :

Corndog ( hotdog) - Its simple and easy and you can bang them out a half dozen at a time. Rush hour is no problem.

Beer - Also very easy and a nice earner in the evenings.

Fried chicken- Again, its incredibly easy you can use this or French Fries its the same actions.

Soda - A selection of drinks, its a little more difficult but ...really you need more than just beer in your business.

Salad...- Get used to this one , its incredibly easy once you learn all the dressings and it can be upgraded many times . Its also good as you need an alternative for the more "healthy individuals" among us.

This menu can take you as far as a 2 star restaurant with ease after that you can add in Fresh Fish, Chicken Breast, Coffee,  Wine,Lobster as subsitutes . They are the easiest of the more expensive products. 

Happy Cooking!

author: {'steamid': '76561198129774648', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1615, 'last_played': 1544325728}
review:
I'm literally so addicted to this game. The good thing about this is that you can find a really good balance between easy gameplay and then switch it up if you really want to challege yourself if you're already good at the time-management game thing. 

Another cool thing is that you can customize the key bindings, so you can move actions to more comfortable places on your keyboard. 

It's one of my favourite cooking time-management games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028941884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1594241294}

author: {'steamid': '76561198045527176', 'num_games_owned': 1442, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 2551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1898, 'last_played': 1486712212}
review:
This game is an exercise in repetition.

On the plus side, the graphics are endearing (if limited), the mechanics are straightforward and easy to understand, and the in-game text has a bit of charm.

However, the game quickly just becomes a grind-fest. During the normal campaign, there is very little incentive to branch out in the menu (I understand menu rot as a mechanic, but it doesn't make any sense in the context of a restaurant). The difficult curve doesn't really ramp up, even near the end. Honestly, I believe many of the players will stick with a menu consisting of a bunch of staples and a couple of items that are easy to make (fish, hint hint).

But really the fatal flaw is the crazy amount of repetition that bogs the game down. It begins exciting and becomes painful. I hope CSD 2 fixes these issues, and I can't wait to try it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198111555170', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1528161048}
review:
Ask yourself, do you like quick paced games? Do you enjoy a challenge? Finally, do you like food? If you have answered "Yes" to any of these questions, pick this game up. 

The goal of this game is to serve up food in your restraunt as fast as humanly possible with the keys on your keyboard or controller. Everything is shortcutted for the maxiumum speed. You have to react very fast, and for some this can be stressful. There is choice between what you can serve, what will sell, what people are bored of, and the like. You need to be both strategic and quick.

There isn't much else to say about this game. I love it for when I get bored of other games, I just pop this on and play for a minute. It isn't for everyone, but I do think everyone should give it a shot.

8/10. The graphics could be better, the music is elevator-like, and sometimes keys are not logical. I wouldn't pick this up for less than 10$ though.

review: Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a fun idea that's enjoyable while it lasts, but once you realize its core gameplay consists entirely of performing the same glorified QTEs for hours on end, you'll likely lose the patience to keep playing. author: {'steamid': '76561198165087053', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 748, 'last_played': 1454599315}
review:
很適合想強迫放空的人遊玩，上班壓力大到東想西想之類的。
遊戲應該改名叫做瑜珈冥想大師，直視你的內心，放下一切世俗之類的。

玩到最後只剩反射動作，客人一下單的瞬間你連思考都來不及，就已經把餐點做好並送出。你自己都會很訝異：我剛剛做了什麼？！怎麼高標過關了？！

對了，有個遊戲控制器很重要（手把啦）。

就一直重複重複重複作業，不用思考，還有發洩到。

不過一開始還沒習慣之前可能會摔個幾次手把，加油，撐過就是你的了。

想學一些英文菜單/點餐/烹調/尺寸等，又想無腦一直按按鈕的人，非常推薦你們玩這款遊戲喲！

請等特價再買。

author: {'steamid': '76561198072756098', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 851, 'last_played': 1515740577}
review:
Alright, let's get started!
"Gimme a baked potato! Put some butter and chives on it!"
Wait, why is chives H and not C--
"Pizza! Everything on it!"
Onions are N and olives are V?! Which one is--
"Steak! Season it thrice over and juice it once!"
IT'S ONLY DAY 6!
"Get the goddamn trash out of here!"
"Dishes are piled up!"
"Gimme lasanga! Pasta, sauce, cheese, and Parmesan, three times over!"
"Rush hour time! Now things are gonna get harder!"
...Crap.
"Burger, 3 patties, in this order!"

Basically, a damn fun game. Fast paced, visually enjoyable, and the music for every part of the day is great, especially the rush hour. If you took a typing class in the past, you'll be glad you did while you're playing this game. Even if you can customize which ingredients are what when you're making a dish, some letters for ingredients are hard to get down at first, even if it's understandable that mushrooms (U) can't be the same letter as meats (M), but they'll come with practice.
And the challenge modes.
Hot damn. If you really wanna get into *into* this game, it's gonna take a whooooole lot of devotion.

P.S., there's not actually talking other than the little murmurs customers make when they're served, it was just to convey the chaotic rush you'll get playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076499717', 'num_games_owned': 316, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 4973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1022, 'last_played': 1697277694}

author: {'steamid': '76561198116527414', 'num_games_owned': 392, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1839, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1839, 'last_played': 1485527539}
review:
Gordon Ramsay made me do it! - Seriously, I have played so many video games about killing people, killing animals, killing monsters, that it is nice to play a good game like this about sustaining life for a change.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

The advertisement for this game focusses on it being a restaurant simulator. However, the business simulation part is a bit shallow: You can buy recipes and upgrade them, and after 20 days (and accomplishing some specific tasks), you get a new star for your restaurant. You can also spend money on cooking devices that unlock new recipes and other features that increase your time limits in the kitchen, or boost the "buzz", effectively the number of customer orders. Yet, you never buy raw ingredients, you do not hire any staff (even in a five-star-restaurant, you still cook, clean and serve everything on your own), you do not buy any visible pieces of furniture and position them strategically... the background for the UI is always static. The developer focussed more on the cooking itself than on restaurant management simulation, and this makes it more of a skill game.

I call it a skill game because you win it by "cooking" fast and precisely. You can do it with your mouse, clicking on every ingredient and triggering phases of preparation all with your index finger; but in my experience, it is more efficient and ergonomical to learn the key-bindings by heart. You have to press a letter for each ingredient and other keys for certain acts of preparation, and if you can type those "codes" fluently (e.g. vegetarian lasagna: "PSVCR PSVCR PSCR"), using all your fingers and without even looking at the ingredient list on the screen, you have a massive advantage. Fortunately, there is the option to practice every dish with an "official taste tester" before you put the item on your active menu and present it to real customers, and I recommend making extensive use of that option.

Now, isn't cooking and keeping the restaurant clean like work? Yes, it is. This game actually feels like work. BUT it is rewarding work: The voice-acted reactions of your customers when you serve a perfect meal ("M-hm! Hey-ey-ey!"), the balloons falling under loud applause when you receive a new star, or the successful participation in contests like the Iron Cook Challenges or in the dating programme Cook4Luv provide many opportunities to get acknowledgement for your hard efforts, and this makes Cook, Serve, Delicous! so addictive. Also, the successes and failures are always your own: If you do everything right, the customer will be happy. If you make a mistake, the customer will always notice. It is very fair, and after a bad day, you are motivated to train more and get better. The difficulty increases not so much with the upgrades of the restaurant (with the familiar five-star-system), but with the upgrades for the dishes, that become more and more complex, while simple items (like beer) always stay that way; that means that you can always adapt your own difficulty by choosing a more or less demanding selection of items on your menu of the day.

[h1]Presentation[/h1]

The graphics and sound effects are simple, but somehow still appetizing. I focussed on Italian and American cuisine, and after every two hours or so, I had to take a break because I became hungry... 

The music on the other hand was not to my liking: The title song with the repeated "Cook!", "Serve!", "Delicious!" in different overacted voices was almost annoying, and the repetitive background music is played in a modernistic style I did not enjoy - I switched the music off completely after a short while. I would have preferred if you could have chosen a type of restaurant (Italian food, Mexican food, sea food), and got the corresponding backgrounds and music. I consider this a missed opportunity on the developer's part.

[h1]Value for money[/h1]

It takes around 10-15 hours to complete the game once. You can add replayability by specializing in different kinds of food, choosing higher difficulty settings and even engaging in a competitive multiplayer mode called Battle Kitchen- which I have not tried yet. All in all, there is a lot to do, and the game is worth its price.

[h1]Verdict[/h1]

The presentation of the game can make you underestimate it: It has a very intense gameplay and can give you massive feeling of accomplishment. Also, it trains you mentally to stay calm while multitasking under pressure, a very useful ability. 7.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077333006', 'num_games_owned': 309, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 781, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1506360802}
review:
Très bon jeu indé.
Rapidement addictif, on se surprend à appuyer frénétiquement sur son clavier pour ne pas rater son plat de lasagnes (PSMCR, PSVCR, PSCR ;)
Le jeu est assez complet et a une durée de vie correcte puisqu'il y a plusieurs étoiles à obtenir pour son restaurant et que pour chacune des étoiles, il faut accomplir un certain nombre d'objectifs. De plus on est libre de développer son restaurant comme on le souhaite puisqu'on peut choisir quels aliments on achète et on doit définir soi-même le menu du jour.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001053552', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1463692524}
review:
This is a mobile game, but not a bad one and I even think that using a controller might let you make inputs faster.
Nonetheless this game nearly broke my Logitech Controller (the cheaper blue one) as the right shoulder button is heavily used and does not like that apparently.

+hectic gameplay
+cooking game (look at all this tasty food)
+simplistic but nice images for the foods
+competitive online play

-orders consist of textboxes; getting what a customer wants almost always takes more time than preparing the food itself
-freakin paperwork between the rounds
-balancing: some dishes are way to complicated to prepare without giving you a great advantage, so having different cheap dishes on the menu often does the job better
-wears down your controller heavily

Important information about changed selling conditions for the next day is given to you via ingame mail. Sadly it sometimes is difficult to distinguish between important information and spam.
Yes, they send you freakin spam mail ingame!!!
I guess it is more like managing a real restaurant but concerning this is a game I would rather like to have this aspect left out of it.

Conclusion:
Fun for a limited time but great for a cooking game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198054352435', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1463, 'last_played': 1616882049}
review:
A taaaaaaable !

Cook, Serve, Delicious est un vrai régal ! Sur le papier, la recette est pourtant simple, mais fonctionne incroyablement bien ! Le contenu est on ne peut copieux et savoureux, le tout servi par un dressing de très bonne facture.

Et le tout pour une addition au final peu salée !

Cook, Serve, Delicious... ça envoie du steak !!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009389402', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 725, 'last_played': 1484490792}
review:
When they say 'hardcore', that is not an overstating buzzword.

This game is probably the closest any cooking title will ever get to being a Hell's Kitchen simulation. The recipes are simple in execution, but what is not simple is the VOLUME in which you be cooking them. If Cooking Mama was to cooking at home, Cook, Serve, Delicious is to cooking in an environment where your lifestyle is on the line. The game eases you in with some simple difficulty and really easy to make recipes, but as you progress through restaurants in which you're going to be held to a higher standard, so to must you be able to go above and beyond. In case the day to day tedium of completing service days isn't giving you the proper motivation, the game also includes a devious betting system, which dares you complete a chain of perfect orders in a row with specific items on your menu, so no comfort zone here, unless that comfort zone is LITERALLY EVERYTHING.

But this game is by no means boring or unfair. Getting perfect days is still possible, but you'll have to manage your money wisely and deal with the ever unpredicatable orders of customers. It's no wonder this game got a sequel. I would recommend this game, but be forewarned, you're going to take a lot of hits until you eventually succeed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202799326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1975, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1014, 'last_played': 1500718842}
review: As a fan of time management games like Diner Dash, this game ticks off all my boxes and then some. The aspect of menu and chore management has enough depth to make you feel like your decisions actually matter and lets you fine tune the way you run your restaurant, which gives you a weird sense of ownership of your virtual restaurant. 11/10 will keep coming back for more justice dispensing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025214734', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1504476264}

Played this a ton for a while and it seemed to just go off my radar for some reason. Loved it and how easy it was to pick up and stop playing frequently and there was almost no issues going back to your save file and picking up right where you left off.
Sadly right now there seems to be an issue where my game will not allow me to actually play. Customers appear and their orders tick down in time limit but I am unable to select them and start on their order. Instant failure on my in-game day. Devs help!

review:
Ich habe dieses Spiel über das HumbleBundle erworben, hatte es aber vorher schon im Blick gehabt.
Mir macht es wirklich sehr viel Spaß, auch wenn es eher ein Casual Game ist.
Es kann mit steigendem Spielverlauf sehr fordernd werden und erfordert viel Hand-Augenkoordination, sowie Konzentration.

Ich kann dieses Spiel mit ruhigem Gewissen jedem empfehlen, der für Gelegenheitsspiele offen ist! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198001916639', 'num_games_owned': 2826, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1588818828}
review: Take the food making minigames from Cooking Mama, mix in the speed requirements and attentiveness from Diner Dash, and sprinkle on top just a dash of restaurant management so your store can progress and make more difficult and expensive stuff. A completely different flavor, but similar to Papers, Please, where every mistake can hurt you, but you also need to be as fast as possible. Take on challenges and bets to earn more money, purchase tougher recipes, realize your dream of owning a 5 star restaurant, do side missions like catering and iron chef challenges. It's a ton of fun and I highly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060651948', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1319, 'last_played': 1603582866}
review: I like the is game alot. There were a couple of things I didn't like about it like the Iron Chef challenges were too hard and the menu ingredients were too much to type in, e.g. Nachos. I find it ridiculous that it takes two page of ingredients and type each letter of the ingredients in for one recipe. Too time consuming.  I though it should have been one page only and double the ingreds for one key stroke like some of the other recipes. The wine was lame because it took so long to open it. There were no dessert other than ice-cream. Lastly, it would have been nice to see food get cooked or grilled on the stove instead watching a little clock on the order receipt. I wish we could have moved to another location instead of being stuck in the same building and that there was an easy, crazy, and insane mode instead of just one mode to play in. Other than that it was really good. I'm just bummed that I won't be able to finished the game because of Iron Chef Challenge. Oh, I wish instead of speed test that we could have a sell challenge which would be a nice change of pace since running the resturant is a speed challenge already. Variety of play is always nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198220847272', 'num_games_owned': 438, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2392, 'last_played': 1528886727}

author: {'steamid': '76561198086960182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 3921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1687, 'last_played': 1527250414}
review:
I usually like those kind of games and seriously, this one is worth every cent I put in it (even though I bought it in sale, hehe). I saw "hardcore" and decided this was for me a call for challenge.

The beginning is fairly easy (okay, I freaked out and rage-quitted during the first rush hour), and gets gradually more and more difficult. 
I thought 30 foods wouldn't be enough to keep me busy, but with the upgrades, there actually are a good number of recipe to unlock. I hope you have a good memory... 

Achieving a perfect day makes me feel like I'm an awesome keyboard smasher warrior cook.

Graphisms are pretty, game easy to handle but hard to master

I would definitly recommend and am patiently (not so much) waiting for the second one!

P.S. : I was stupid enough to try hardcore mode. I don't know how I'm still alive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170048439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1635104135}
review:
I feel like a God whenever I put out orders left and right during rush hour. Some people seem to wonder how one can  use the keyboard to play this game, but I'm wondering how in the world they can play it with the controller.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
- Lots of food items to choose from.
- Fast paced, fun, and most of all [b]SATISTYING[/b] time management gameplay.
- More to the game than just the preparation of food.
- Fun challenge modes.
- Lots of playtime for the price (get it on sale, of course, you dufus).

[h1]Cons[/h1]
- Gets very repetitive very quick (the [b]HUGEST[/b] setback). You've made one burger, you've made them all.
- The game outside the actual preparation of food is uninteresting and boring to me.
- The betting system where the food you need is randomized is utter garbage and I rarely use it.
- Although there is a lot of playtime, I feel like it takes too long to upgrade the stars on your restauraunt.
- Some foods have literally no point to serving, such as beer which just provides negative buzz and nothing else.

[b]Buy?:[/b] At the current price ($2.49), I would say it's worth it for a few hours of good old fun. However, don't pay the original $10 price for the game, as it isn't worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980965158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1645414847}
review:
I got a free copy of the game. As part of a deal to learn about the game engine (Game Maker).

This game makes you learn to push a few buttons to make each food. It is supposed to get repetitive very quickley. Now here is the catch. Each food item is completely diffrent. Some require simple key inputs and other require longer more complicated inputs. The actual game play part comes from able to quickly switch between food items.

You will find in a rush to please customers. Things start to mess up unless you have zen mastery of task switching. A customer comes in. Burger? M-M. 
Another customer. A baked potato? Pop it in the oven. Another customer! A salad? Cheese. Onions and carrots. Bacon and croutons. C-O-B. 
The dishes need doing! Left arrow, right arrow, left arrow, right arrow, up arrow. Left-right-left-right-up. 
Wait, the burgers! The burgers are starting to burn hurry up! 
But you have to finish the dishes first, and you do. 
Two meat patties, two cheeses, bacon, lettuce, tomatoes. M-M-C-B-L-T. Wait, what – the customer left unhappy. Oh no, two cheeses! C-C! Too late.
Health inspector issued a warning again because in all that you forgot to take out the trash.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052661422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1684884062}
review:
It's a simple game but it's addicting. I figured I would try it out before bed and 30 minutes later I just closed out because I knew I couldn't stop playing.
It's simple, you buy your kitchen equipment and recipes and then use those recipes to make a menu of four items every day. You have to switch it up though as some items have "Menu Rot" and bring down the rating of your restaurant if they're on there for too many days. You can also upgrade your food items to help bring up your restaurants rating.
It's simple but so addicting and before long I was yelling out nacho toppings and scrambling during rush hour. Oh, and you'll want to cry when it's rush hour, I promise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091672954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1513, 'last_played': 1502881080}
review: Купил эту игру по скидке за 2.79$ и не пожалел! Как за эти деньги игра стоит своего. Как по мне лучшая инди и аркадная игра об готовке еды. Много блюд, разных других квестов (таких как Iron Cook) и не однообразный геймплей. Пока наиграл 25 часов и желание играть дальше есть! Как пройду всю Cook, Serve, Delicious буду ждать Cook, Serve, Delicious 2! Она будет еще лучше!

author: {'steamid': '76561198273028274', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1584968519}
review:
很喜欢做菜的游戏，但是英文真心看不懂，四级水平看到长篇的邮件简直一脸懵逼，好想知道剧情，但是玩个游戏去查字典有点过了吧好纠结。当然我自认为我的四级是假的233并不代表大众水平。但还是期待能有中文的，最起码把书信什么的翻译过来看起来方便些也好啊！！！算了我还是去查字典吧，估计看个一遍剧情也就够了唉，来自英语渣的哀嚎。。。
总之操作上是蛮有意思的，选菜前还有练习，虽然练了还是觉得手忙脚乱，不过好在我打字快应该不会有什么大问题。刚入手，先玩玩吧，蛮有趣的。
背景音乐也挺好听的，适合休闲来一局。

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198007727142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1508781116}
review:
What I thought it was:

"Weclome sir, may I take your order? I recommend the soup. It's divine."

What I played:

"AHHHHHHH! AHHHHH! YOU'RE ANIMALS! YOU'RE ALL ANIMALS!"
*frantically throws completed orders into crowd during rush hour*
*Tries to find time to clean filthy toilet*
*Inspector giving the stink eye for not doing dishes and gives a bad rating*

10 star/10 star would clean filthy toilet again.

As an indie game, I put this right up there with 'Papers, please.' A game with a simple, almost un-gamelike concept that puts some high budget titles to shame.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134366680', 'num_games_owned': 841, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1472816704}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a great restaurant management sim. Its gameplay is intense and will challenge your multitask and memory skills. There are a lot of things to do in game as far as management goes and you can also try all the other modes if you want to just cook. The graphics and music are very basic but that really doesn’t matter much because the gameplay is solid. if you are looking for a cooking sim that will give you many hours of playing, then definitely check Cook, Serve, Delicious!.

Read the full review on Hyper Light Up
http://www.hyperlightup.com/cook-serve-delicious-review/

author: {'steamid': '76561198035740752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 251, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1482059095}
review:
Le jeu est bien... mais... mais.

Le jeu est très difficile, ce qui est une bonne chose. Il faut vraiment s'entrainer, bien penser ses menus. Mais cette difficulté, qui est en soi une bonne chose, devient rédibitoire face à la lenteur de progression.

Les journées sont rapides, stressantes, mais c'est répétitif! De mémoire il faut 20 jours pour gagner une étoile, sans compter les pourboirs. Et c'est long à remplir. Du coup tu enchaines les entrainements pour pouvoir changer ton menu assez souvent, en espérant de bon buzz et ça tous les deux trois jours. C'est long et répétitif. 

C'est le seul point négatif. Il vaut son prix, il est très bien, très intéressant, mais ils auraient mis 10 jours et moins de pouboir nécessaire j'aurais voté Oui. Mais là ça m'a lassé. 

Pour acharné.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075820042', 'num_games_owned': 3533, 'num_reviews': 453, 'playtime_forever': 2998, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2540, 'last_played': 1625799002}
review:
Insanely fun.
100% recommended.
It's a restaurant simulator where you choose the dishes you serve, and it only gets more and more stressful and challenging as you advance:
During the day, customers arrive and you have to prepare the meal they order.
There's many variations to the meals you can cook, and it's all done by typing in a series of keys, which, if you miss, ruin the dish and result in unhappy customers. 
As you progress you can acquire upgrades for your restaurant, control (to an extent) the intake of customers (by boosting the popularity of your restaurant) and unlock new and more profitable recipes to serve.

When it first came out I played this game to 100% completion, then it got a series of updates that raised the bar in terms of challenge and skill. Sadly, I've never found the time to come back to it and 100% it once more, but I recommend it whole-heartedly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045149740', 'num_games_owned': 576, 'num_reviews': 451, 'playtime_forever': 758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 758, 'last_played': 1481483622}
review:
[u]What I liked:[/u]
[list]
    [*]A decent cooking game with a unique way to cook
    [*] the rhythm of cooking during rush hour
    [*]That feeling when you know the recipes by heart and fly by those orders
[/list]
[u]What You Need to Know:[/u]
[list]
     [*]This is not a simulation game, you don’t really manage a restaurant. It’s mostly on the food minigames that is the core gameplay, no prep, tweaking food prices, supply and demand.
    [*]The beginning is very slow when not during rush hour everyday. Later in the game when at 3 star your restaurant you will have very little downtime. It’s stressful and challenging but really fun.
     [*]I do hate that can’t start the order over if you made a mistake and can force you lose the perfect day bonus, which early on  a lot compared to your daily income, later on in the game, it’s not really needed
    [*]I wish you the stats gave me more info like how many days I had an item on the menu, tips per food to try and maximize my profits bro
    [*]Cooking is a button mashing mechanic with each item being something different; chores are the same way (love the robbery minigame, sarcasm of course)
    [*]You can bet money to see how many perfect orders you can get in a row, everyday its randomized what items are needed on the menu
    [*]I played this using a controller, it just seems easier but mistakes can be made when using the analog sticks. ( I did try using the mouse and the arrow keys only, it's doable, but damn it's a clickfest. I don't know how keyboard is even plausible)
    [*]This game is very repetitive; your goal is to get to a 5 star restaurant. A checklist of requirements needs to be met to go up a star
    [*]They require 20 days minimum as the annoying requirement. This requirement will be the last one done and wish this wasn't a requirement. It would make the game shorter, more enjoyable, and less grindy
    [*]There are catering and iron chef style events that offer different challenges, but are few and don't happen till level 2 and 3 restaurants. Each level of star takes about 3-4 hours.
    [*]You are rewarded if you have a perfect day, sadly if you make a mistake in an order you can’t restart the order and have to take the penalty. You can just restart the day over if it was at the beginning, otherwise I would just take the hit and not get bonus( because money was never really an issue)
[*]It might sound like the game is bad, it’s not, it’s just not great either. I wanted it to be more of a management cooking game( plus I played this after playing Overcooked which is amazing)
 [/list]

[h1]My Score:[/h1]
[b]C[/b]

[b]Paid:$2.5[/b]
[b]Main reason for not finishing: very repetitive and tedious( plus not a real management game)[/b]

Games similar: 
[list]
    [*]OverCooked (amazing!!)
    [*]The Cooking Game (way more casual)
    [*]Pizza Express( more management style)
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198030516476', 'num_games_owned': 5534, 'num_reviews': 465, 'playtime_forever': 4592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4531, 'last_played': 1481382573}
review:
Au premier abord, ce jeu à l'air simple et fait pour les joueurs occasionnels, les enfants ou même les mamies oui mais... En fin de compte il se révèle être très addictif, et il se corse au fil du temps. 

Cook serve and delicious vous tapera parfois sur les nerfs mais il décuplera votre dextérité, votre concentration, vos réflexes et votre mémoire ; enfin bref il réveillera vos neurones engourdies à grands coups d'adrénaline.



[h1][b] LE GAMEPLAY [/b][/h1] 

Vous ne ferez pas que servir des plats dans un resto, il faudra aussi se coller à la corvée des poubelles, de la vaisselle, au nettoyage des wc, et même entreprendre une dératisation.

Au niveau social, vous devrez recevoir et satisfaire les VIP, puis passer les contrôles d'hygiène.
Parmi toute cette clientèle peut être trouverez-vous l'âme soeur mais vous devrez la charmer avec des mets délicieux puis veiller à maintenir le contact par textos et l'améliorer en répondant comme il se doit...

Au niveau du resto, vous assurez à la fois la confection des plats en prenant soin de ne pas vous mélanger les pinceaux, et le service en salle avec parfois des heures coup de feu, il vous faudra tout gérer sans laisser cramer la viande et sans vous tromper dans les ingrédients des nombreux menus qui composent votre carte.

Dans cook serve and delicious, vous êtes un chef multi tâches qui ne lésinera pas sur le travail et le courage afin de gagner ses étoiles.

Si vous passez ces étapes, comme vous êtes ambitieux, il vous faudra investir de l'argent dans de nouveaux équipements, améliorer vos recettes, faire le buzz pour attirer le plus de clients possible pour gravir les échelons afin d'atteindre le but ultime de votre carrière et votre plus grand rêve : être le riche gestionnaire d'une chaîne de restaurants 5 étoiles.

Plusieurs challenges vous attendent aussi, comme le iron cook et d'autres surprises pas toujours aussi simple qu'on ne le penserait.



[h1][b] LE PETIT MOT DE LA FIN [/b][/h1] 

Je le conseille vivement aux fans de petits jeux de gestion/simulation, et à tous les joueurs en fait mis à part à ceux qui ne jurent pas que par les grand FPS AAA.
Ce titre est pour moi le meilleur des jeux de restaurant, simple, amusant et addictif, je pense qu'il fera le bonheur de tous les amateurs du genre.



[code][h1][b]Si vous avez apprécié cette évaluation et souhaitez en lire d'autres venez suivre ma [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/39072619/]page de curation[/url].[/b][/h1][/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561198200201969', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1481369083}
review:
Classico simulatore di ristorante, con tante ricette e upgrades per la propria strumentazione.
Non è proprio il mio genere ma, se vi piace questo tipo di gioco, sappiate che è ben realizzato.
Ogni cibo ha le sue caratteristiche con relativo "giro di tasti" da cliccare per essere cucinato e servito; inizialmente l'occhio cercherà sempre le istruzioni di cottura, ma dopo poco il tutto verrà memorizzato e diventerà quasi automatico. Si può giocare sia col mouse che con la tastiera, io consiglio vivamente la tastiera! Un gioco che verte molto sui riflessi e sulla velocità del giocatore.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993519972', 'num_games_owned': 3677, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2972, 'last_played': 1432837829}
review:
Probably the greatest of all cooking-themed time management games, which really isn't saying all that much.
You will be tried. You will learn the limits of your reflexes and reaction and knowledge of the recipes and controls, through experimentation and a gradual ramping of the overall pace, and you will learn to work within those limits to get through the day with minimal errors. 

Really fantastic game, very much looking forward to the sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066490117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1480556428}
review:
It's great! I feel that everyone has pretty much covered my sentiments on the game. I actually wanted to offer a suggestion.

I have twin 9 year old sisters who are both extremely dyslexic. They struggle with reading and dont find much fun in doing so. Today, however, they saw me playing Cook, Serve, Delicious! And instantly fell in love. I set them up just playing practice on individual foods and have them read and cook the orders. I think this game has extreme educational potential as it forces a child not only to read but comprehend as well as teaching basic keyboard use all while managing a fun restaurant with personalized orders.

Unfortunately, they are kind of stuck playing in practice as all the base game modes ive tried have proven to hard or rapid for them to finish meals before guests leave. I wish this game had some kind of casual setting or kids setting where potentially the time to cook meals is significantly longer or that patrons wont leave until an order is complete.

Just a suggestion! The game is amazing on its own, i just think parents would find value in it educationally if it had such a setting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003723726', 'num_games_owned': 724, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1800, 'last_played': 1505458105}
review:
"Just one more day."

Took about 20 hours to get a platinum star restaurant and then started New Game+ and wow does this game get hardcore. There's so much content in this little game, other than the basic gameplay of cooking food (all of which are basically different and creative mini-games) and serving it to your customers, you have to worry about dating, health inspectors, VIP guests at higher levels, upgrading equipment, keeping your menu fresh and interesting, making in-game bets about how good you're going to do that day, and participating in challenges. And then on top of that there's local co-op and multiplayer battle modes including ever-changing weekly challenges, giving this game just tons of replay value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050683454', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2219, 'last_played': 1480348695}
review: This game is very good if you enjoy a fast-paced system management-like game. It takes a little while for it to get really hectic and you can easily game the system by choosing the easy, profitable rotations of food but if you challenge yourself, it can be a lot of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963907322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 714, 'last_played': 1481108328}
review:
[i]I get home from work, it's late... I've just finished a 16 hour shift, doing 80 guests for lunch and another 80 for dinner. Over 300 plates left the kitchen today. I feel like I could collapse any minute.

But before I do that, I need to do it all over again. I need to put on my chefscoat and step into the heat of the kitchen. Before I go to sleep, I need to cook soup, pasta, steak and lasagna. I need to serve it to the guests without falling behind on the tickets. Most importantly it has to be... DELICIOUS![/i]

As someone who does it for a living, I can say that this game mimics a professional kitchen perfectly. It's stressful, it's brutal and it's fun as hell! Pushing for those perfect days and challenging yourself to do it faster and better all the time is awesome. And when the musclememory starts kicking in and orders are flying out you feel like a king.
I find myself, just the way I do at work, starting to make small flourishes when I "cook", tapping out the correct sequence for the meat lasagna or the Baristobo soup without even thinking.

I thought "this game is easy, I'm memorizing everything in minutes". I wanted to prove myself and went to the Battle Kitchen mode. "I'll show them!", I told myself. It was like stepping into the kitchen of a french bistro after you'd only worked in a sportsbar before. I felt like an insecure intern who hadn't even tourne'd a potato before.
It was inspiring. I still have so much to learn, so much to discover in this game and I can't wait!

메뉴는 맥주 추천합니다 쉽거든요

현실을 잘 알려줍니다

This is the simulation game shows how shit it is to own a restaurant when you happen to cook
Aside from cooking, you have to clean up dishes, toilet, even throwing garbages

You have to set a mouce trap and icon is face of mouce wtf

but it's 75% off it's worth your money

Recommend beer it's easiest
as combo pile up, excite you more

author: {'steamid': '76561197992358669', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1483124059}
review:
I nominated this game for "The “Best Use Of A Farm Animal” Award" because, steak. Steak is definitely the best use of a farm animal. I'm just saying. 

I expected this game to be more like Cooking Mama, but it's actually a timed-response quick-fire kind of game where you have to quickly tap away at all the necessary tasks to get your orders out correctly and in time. It's more addictive then it seems and there are plenty of gameplay expansion options; it's also a lot trickier to master than you might think. And if you've completed the single player campaign there are lots of other challenges as well as a multiplayer mode. In short, there's a lot more to it and plenty of gameplay you get for the price. The graphics are cute and I hope they get a bit more polish in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161801791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1488557699}
review:
An elegant game about balancing priorities, memorizing sequences, and even a bit of managing advantages. 

There seems to be a bit of a discussion about whether there should be an "oops" button, which will allow you to undo an action so you can rectify a mistake. I'd like to have one. But I'm also willing to accept that its absence is a design choice. 

Either way: Highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052403529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2015, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1662, 'last_played': 1492963727}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious is an amazing, fast-paced, funny and challenging restaurant management simulation game.

+ Smooth playstyle
+ Diverse, upgradeable dishes
+ Motivating story mode (earn stars for your restaurant)
+ Challenge modes available
+ Funny minigames like the Cook4luv dating
+ Music and Sound effects fit nicely
+ Pizza

- highly addicting (just one more day)
- possibly stressful (I hate you, soup)
- don't play this game with an empty fridge

Overall Rating: [b] 10/10 [/b]
Go and buy it, Chef! (Can't wait for CSD2!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198140754834', 'num_games_owned': 614, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1349, 'last_played': 1591784749}
review:
Este es el típico juego que te toca en un bundle y no le harás mucho caso... hasta que se lo haces. Había oído hablar algo de él pero no sabía lo que me perdía.

Comenzaremos con un restaurante ruinoso y los platos que escojamos, para ir mejorando tanto nuestro local como nuestro menú, adquiriendo nuevos productos y recetas para los mismos. La gracia del juego es que al servir a nuestros clientes cada día, cada plato es un minijuego en sí mismo, con el que harás práctica de tus habilidades mecanográficas,  mnemotécnicas y de reflejos. Olvídate de jugar con el mouse, agarra el teclado y apréndete muchas recetas de cada plato para aligerar los pedidos... CSD! es diversión y adicción pura donde parecía que no la podía haber.

Te encontrarás memorizando los platos, cambiando las teclas para ajustar las recetas a tus gustos en el teclado, y queriendo echar una partidita más... y otra... y otra...

author: {'steamid': '76561198237716930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1617, 'last_played': 1454462190}
review: When I first started playing Cook, Serve, Delicious! I thought it might be a bit of idle fun to while away a few hours, or at least improve my typing speed through better key placement knowledge. About a week later I was playing it all the time, had worked out mnemonics for doing tricky soup orders, and was aggressively determined to serve all customers perfect food - to the point of forgetting my own dinner. Many, many, many hours later, and many achievements later, and many successful efforts to convert my friends into playing it - and I regret nothing. It's an unexpected life ruiner, but it's such good fun that it's worth all the frantic key slamming. Thanks C,S,D Crew - now where's the sequel?

author: {'steamid': '76561197987658658', 'num_games_owned': 1437, 'num_reviews': 341, 'playtime_forever': 1138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1114, 'last_played': 1527195530}
review:
https://youtu.be/BUlxpWJgh4I

Cook, Serve, Delicious est un jeu qui ne paye pas de mine mais qui est probablement un de mes jeux préférés.
Pourtant, il est super simple :
Vous dirigez un restaurant, les client arrivent, vous demandent un plat et chaque plat est composé d'ingrédients.
Jusqu'ici, vous suivez? Bien!
Mais chaque ingrédient est lié à une touche du clavier qu'il faut presser pour mettre l'ingrédient.
Par exemple : un client veut un hot-dog avec du Ketchup et de la Moutarde, vous devez appuyez sur K et M puis Enter pour que sa commande soit correcte et qu'il soit satisfait.

En gros, il s'agit d'un jeu où on tappe sur les touches du clavier et pas grand chose d'autre...lol, trop facile mec...ouais, au début mec...

Rajoutez 5 clients qui viennent en même temps, qui demandent 5 plats différents et qui ont la patience d'une gamine atteinte d'un TDA et vous sentez la pression monter.

Ce jeu, même si simpliste est prenant et donne cette petite dose d'adrénaline qui fait qu'on en redemande encore et encore. Evidemment, les recettes se complexifient au fur et à mesure du jeu, vous finirez en véritable virtuose du clavier.
Le jeu à une courbe de progression très équilibrée et propose aux joueurs des recettes très simples au début pour monter graduellement dans la complexité.

Il y a une 15 aine de recettes, toutes amééliorables (les rendant plus chères mais aussi plus complexes), les corvées qui répondent aux mêmes principes que les recettes, des objets achetables pour vous faciliter la vie (les amuse-bouches qui font patienter les clients plus longtemps par exemple).

Le jeu pourrait parraître répétitif et il doit probablement l'être pour certains, mais perso, je ne l'ai pas ressenti parce qu'il y a toujours une marge de progression et on est fier d'avoir réussi a faire ce plat, que l'on croyait si complexe au début,en 3 secondes.

Un exemple a suivre: il allie une certaine simplicité dans son principe à une exigence d'exécution rarement atteinte dans ce type de jeu. Le style graphique est sommaire et la musique est rigolo, surtout la zikmu du menu.

Vous avez 2 € ?  Achetez cette petite pépite et je suis sûr que vous allez y prendre gout.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005695451', 'num_games_owned': 758, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1285, 'last_played': 1503993353}
review:
I picked up CSD during a summer sale for $0.99 and I consider that to be an absolute steal. Although at $2.49 I still think it's worth picking up; it's clear the developers have a lot of love and effort put into this game, and I'm extremely excited for CSD2.

When you boil this game down to its base components, CSD 95% time management and hitting specific keys rapidly and accurately (eg, putting the correct ingredients down in the correct order), and 5% strategy/simulation (eg, picking which of your foods are going to go on the menu). However, this simple gameplay still has a significant learning curve and level of complexity. 

One thing that shines CSD is the sense of accomplishment as you progress. As your restaurant grows, you'll unlock nicer decor and fancier dishes, and you really do feel achievement going from your one-star shop selling french fries to eventually a five-star boutique serving complex arrangements of sushi, soups, and pastas. In that journey from a mom & pop shack to Michelin's finest, you'll eventually master all these complex dishes and figuratively be able to make music in the cacophony of your kitchen. Every key you press is punctuated with immensely fulfilling sound effects: the crinkle of 'L'ettuce as you drop it in a salad or the plop of a scoop of 'M'int ice cream as you prepare a sundae. When you're able to string together a group of complex ingredients and cooking steps, it comes together in this wonderful, satisfying feeling that you've [i]gotten good at something[/i].

I recommend this game to anybody who wants a fast-paced, bite-sized, hectic, and fulfilling game, similar to One Finger Death Punch. Bonus points if you really enjoyed the theme of Ratatouille and the idea of running your own restaurant and cooking in your kitchen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025004706', 'num_games_owned': 663, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2037, 'last_played': 1558738470}
review:
So if you're like me, your first impressions of this game were probably "Oh look, another casual restaurant game." Well, that's not actually that accurate. This game can get very fast paced and hectic. It's not so much a management game as it is an arcade type game where you are the one serving the food.

Each food has buttons that correspond to a different ingredient (like C for Cheese) or action (like the down arrow to fill beer into a mug). Guests will come in during the day and order something and you need to fill their order quickly and accurately. Most foods have different stages - for example, you prepare a steak the way the customer wants it, then start cooking it. After a certain amount of time, you need to serve it to the customer within a certain window - too soon and it's not cooked enough, too late and it's burned. By the late stages of the game you can have 6 foods on the menu each day and up to 8 customers with orders being filled at the same time. There are natural rush hours about 1/3 and 2/3 of the way through each day, providing a pretty good ebb and flow to the day.

The difficulty also scales well. Most foods can be upgraded multiple times, often getting new ingredients or new recipes that guests can order. This adds greater complexity at the benefit of higher profits. It's a good way to mix things up when you become comfortable with a given food.

There are some small things that add to the appeal, like humorous e-mails you receive at the end of each day, as well as various challenges you can get to encourage you to try new foods.

Just don't serve soup. Ever. Soup is the worst.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033571437', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1690, 'last_played': 1540835290}
review: This is a fast-paced cooking game, with a few differences. All the recipes can be "cooked" using only the keyboard, i.e. no slicing pizza with the mouse or placing vegetables precisely. As such, it feels very natural and over time, you'll begin to remember the pattern of each recipe. You can change the key-bindings (and you pretty much have to if you want to beat the hardest levels) to more appropriate places (on mine, I changed arrow key recipes to I-J-K-L). It's a little slow on old computers, but it manages to get by.
