author: {'steamid': '76561198064850410', 'num_games_owned': 770, 'num_reviews': 373, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 822, 'last_played': 1479634197}
review:
[h1]Teal Deer[/h1]
[list]
[*][b]Developers:[/b] Vertigo Gaming Inc. 
[*][b]Publishers:[/b] Vertigo Gaming Inc. 
[*][b]Initial release:[/b] Oct 2013
[*][b]Genre:[/b] Cooking Sim, Arcade 
[*][b]#Worth/NotWorth:[/b] #VeryWorth 
[/list]
[h1]Exposition, Concurrence and Summation[/h1]
Cook, Serve, Delicious is a great filler/palate cleanser with surprising depth. 

You run a restaurant inside of a business tower in which you are the sole proprietor of all things that happen. While the game is mostly casual feeling and reminiscent of classics like Diner Dash, you additionally have to run the actual cooking as well as manage the flow of customers. It may seem like a lot at first but it ramps up the difficulty fairly nicely. Additionally, you are in full control of what is on the menu itself. So if something just has too many options you can dial it down regardless. However, you can ramp it up as well giving you added buffs should you be able to maintain good customer service.

The actual cooking is incredibly satisfying, each food item has a specific way to prepare it and has its own recipes. Meaning it can only be ordered in certain ways making it an important thing to note regarding strategy in menu selection. Some types have more recipes than others. While in control of the menu you'll find some decent depth in choosing plates that require cooking and prep while other things that are instant and can be done in between the cooking stages and are a good way to increase revenue. 

There are stat buffs and debuffs that occur, such as menu rot or foods that have bad aromas early in the morning that effect you every day. Your performance can also affect your buzz which will effect the amount of customers coming in, especially during non-Rush hour times. 

There is equipment upgrades that help in the increasing of the waiting time for customers regarding their patience for you as well as equipment to help with chores that you'll need to do throughout each day. New equipment for cooking different types of food are also available. 

You'll have extra tasks to complete everyday should you choose to take them on such as bets with other chefs. There are e-mails that you'll receive after each day that are actually quite enjoyable to read. As well as warn you of upcoming events such as health inspections. 

[b]Career mode isn't the only thing[/b]
There are also iron chef challenges that occur weekly and compete with other online challengers. 

Additionally, there is a ton of control options. Options between Keyboard, 360, X1 and DS4 pads make choosing what you're most comfortable with a non-issue. 

[b]THE GIST
While frantic, the amount of of strategy in menu selection makes it rather methodical and it's extremely satisfying to make multiple dishes perfect.[/b]

[quote]More here — [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/28295405/]Station Argus[/url][/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198059379469', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1022, 'last_played': 1534089699}
review:
Picked this up during the sale on the recommendation of a friend. It didn't sound like my cup of tea at all, and like I predicted, I sucked at it. I decided to play another day, and noticed that I already knew a few dishes by heart and was rapidly improving. It's challenging yet at the same time absolutely something you can get down with practice, even for a klutz like me.

It's like no sim game you've ever played. This is multitasking, button-mashing mayhem in Hell's Kitchen minus Gordon Ramsay. And it is SO. FUN. No matter your general skill level. Get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176656030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 626, 'last_played': 1510659259}
review:
非常有趣的经营类游戏，明明是期末季却玩得完全停不下来。很多食物的制作画面也做得十分精美，譬如炸鸡时将鸡肉压下会出现的油炸碎末。明明炸鸡本身不会激起多少食欲，结果被溅起的油搞得饥饿万分……
深夜时分非常不推荐玩的一个游戏，简直是报社神作，托这个游戏的福我不仅开始学做菜并且有越吃越胖的趋势。
同时在一星级和二星级以后会解锁更多有趣的食物，尤其是二星级餐馆出现了很多新的食物做法，非常耐玩。

除了这些优点以外其实缺点也是有的，譬如：
第一个一星级达成的时间要求个人觉得设得太高了，要求20天实际上完全可以缩短到10天左右，基本上前五天差不多就能完成所有的任务目标了，后面15天完全就是磨时间，估计有很多玩家会在这一期间失去兴趣……完全可以0星升1星花5天，1星升2星花10天，这样阶梯型的进行。
升级食物花费的价格过高，对于前期钱比较紧张的玩家来说，花费1200把5块钱单价的食物升级成8块这种完全动力不足啊……后期钱又开始溢出，升级了一堆操作太复杂压根就不会拿去卖的菜品。实际上如果升级菜品略微降低一点价格要求，然后加上适当的贩卖数量要求的话，感觉更有可能留住新手玩家。
游戏模式后期偏单一，差不多升到二星级解锁了大部分食物后，可玩性就渐渐下降了。

如果是打折期间入手的话，十几块钱玩这么一个小游戏实际上蛮划算的，如果是原价购买的话感觉有点小贵。总之，见仁见智啦。

author: {'steamid': '76561198054846238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3985, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2756, 'last_played': 1665581717}
review:
Don't let the quirky graphics and the cooking theme fool you.
This game is unexpectedly good and fun!

It's not just about getting the right ingredients. You have to manage your menu, and you'll gain buzz bonus. The more buzz, the more people will come and of course, the harder it will be (risk/reward). Some items will rot if you let them 2 days on the menu, if you don't change them the 3rd day you'll get negative buzz bonus because of the smell :o
Some items are easier to make than other, but some will get you more money than others (still a good balance risk/reward).

During the normal course of the day you'll also have to flush the toilet, put out the garbage, taking care of mice, bet on your skills (and gain extra money!), try to find your soul mate, fund kickstarter projects (called click'n start :p) and dispence justice (yes T_T). I'm sure the list is not complete. The game is crazy! But in a good way :)

You'll be able to buy upgrades for your restaurant and your food (more recipes, more ingredients, better price), you'll have special event, like cooking contests, or catering for parties. You'll also be able to compete on a leaderboard on some special game modes.

For the price asked there is a lot of content, and it's good content.

There used to be a demo available. Not sure if it's stil working but  you can try there: http://www.vertigogaming.net/_files/CSDdemo1_05.exe

A CSD2 is coming this year and I can't wait to play it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198167112121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1562526829}
review:
Love this game! Similar to the "Papa's" (Pizzeria, Freezeria, Burgeria, Taco Mia) flash games that I used to play online for free when I was little. However, this game is much more challenging and gives you a lot more gameplay options and control over your own little restaurant. Weekly challenges and events at the end of each level keep this game from getting boring.

Pros:
- choose your own menu
- unlockable characters
- unlockable and upgradable food items
- practice mode for new food items
- many gameplay modes and challenges
- co-op tag team available
- gets challenging as you get more stars for your restaurant
- controllers: keyboard/mouse, xbox 360/one, ps3/4, wii, steam

Cons:
- career mode is pretty challenging for first few levels
- battle mode challenges are hard
- may get repetitive over time
- entire game is offline except for viewing scoreboards

author: {'steamid': '76561198142527733', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 2721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2291, 'last_played': 1527218990}
review:
1星的时候啊这游戏好丰富
2星的时候缺钱解锁菜肴
3星的时候钱靠相亲又失败了
4星的时候赚钱升级刷成就
5星的时候生无可恋

+内容上的丰富,以及好玩的随机事件邮件
包括立绘,美工,开工时固定的随机事件,邮件系统.有模有样的模拟餐厅的经营
额外添加拍摄节目,铁人挑战等等,换种花样玩
+特殊加成令整个游戏更加多样化
不同的菜肴组合会根据各自的属性增加Buzz指数.其中包括时令,营养,适合人群,收益等等,有些菜肴组合一起还能增加洗碗的次数,非常有意思
-再怎么换包装玩法还是一成不变
-不会简明描述顾客台词,煮个千层面我都要看三四行判断对方是否要加菜加肉,对于母语不是英语的玩家非常痛苦
(当然比不上抓小偷形容小偷样貌,小偷一来,进度全烂掉)
-花了钱买仪器感受不到变化,特别是洗碗倒垃圾,也就少洗几个少倒几袋,次数不会减少,真烦
-菜肴烹饪的细节太多
煎饼可以挑几层,煮汤加配菜这些我就忍了,我真没见过卖炒饭可以指明加什么料的,反倒沙拉就很机智的做了几个组合?
-蜜汁键位安排,配菜的键位跟单词首字母和发音联系起来的,母语非英语的非常吃亏,因为当有首字母相同的配菜单词,键位就会依据单词的第二或者第三个字母,做工序复杂的菜肴时不时得愣一下
(你问我为什么作死?因为越复杂的菜越贵啊!除了红酒!)
-边做菜边跟人约会,最不可理喻的地方
想象一下客流高峰期,你一边握着手机,一边看着汉堡肉和意面熟了没,一边还要看着肉扒有没有煎糊.同时你还要根据屏幕内容回复对方,不然就像那些等待的菜肴一样定时滑过.

总结一个字就是烦,真的超烦,事业模式里,每当餐厅成功升级一星,你的等候位置就会多一格.除非手速够快,三星之后客流量基本上没有太大的变化.你剩下要应付的就是"卧槽明明没有提高客流量为什么我会忙成doge?"很多东西三星过后没有太大的可玩价值,除了接待VIP,VIP指明的菜肴没有变化,跟Crazy David打赌的筹码也不会变化.唯一剩下的就是拿着当初你获得的金卷继续玩同样玩法的模式.
铁厨模式可以试着挑战获得蓝星解锁人物,大多的人物出自有名的独立游戏.
说真的steam成就是我玩这款游戏的动力,游戏里的统计数据还能助你查看成就进度.实在难以想象没有成就还能怎么玩下去.

[spoiler]顿时明白为什么谜之声直播再也不做这个了[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198120269804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1544660842}

author: {'steamid': '76561198142763588', 'num_games_owned': 427, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2090, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1623, 'last_played': 1507376949}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a game made by three indie developers, it is available on a number of systems, but I will of course be reviewing the PC version.

The game is a hardcore restaurant time management game. You start off with a quite ugly restaurant in the SherriShoda tower, trying to become a 5 star restaurant manager.

Gameplay is really fluid and everything feels smooth. The game progresses well and becomes increasingly difficult as you play.

Lore-wise it isn't that deep, there are some funny elements but nothing too serious, but that isn't the focus of the game anyway.

The graphics are really lovely and even though it's only been 3 years I still feel confident enough to say that they age well. The animations are smooth and even your wooden laptop will be able to handle this masterpiece.

The sound track is very good but it can become a little repetetive if you play long sessions (several hours).

PROS: 
-Supports a bunch of controllers, including the Steam Controller, Xbox 360, Xbox One, DS3, DS4 and even the Wii U Pro controller.
-Addictive
-Hardcore Restaurant Simulator
-Nice soundtrack
-Great graphics
-Not a demanding game
-Supports 2160p
-Local Co-Op
-Cheap
-Will last you many hours
-No external DRM

CONS:
-Soundtrack becomes repetetive after long gameplay sessions
-20 days for a new star feels grindy sometimes

If you like cooking games/restaurant games or other simulation games this is a must-buy.

I rate it 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198027117855', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1467534813}
review:
I think this game is fun, but it is tough! I really like all the management aspects of the game, but the keyboard spamming is far too quick for me to keep up with. Don't get me wrong, I got by on my first few days with relatively few major mistakes (6-14 mistakes per 50 orders or so). I did alright with the chores at first, but they soon overwhelmed me too. I was just a little upset that there is no easy mode. They have normal mode and extreme mode or something, but no easy! Normal is just far too difficult for me at the moment. I would much rather enjoy the game at about 50% of the speed it goes at. Currently I am rating this game about a 7/10 for me, simply because I find it too difficult. I look forward to playing it more soon, but until then I keep my fingers crossed that they will add an easy mode. I know a lot of other people enjoy the challenge, and I understand the thrill of it. I just like to use these games to relax, so relaxing + thrill doesn't really work for me well. I will continue to update my review as I play more, perhaps there are settings I could change or something. Even mod support would be great as I would love it if someone made an "easy mode" mod. Frankly, if Very Easy were available as an option I would even pick that. 

TLDR: Normal mode (currently the easiest difficulty available) was too hard for me. I would like an easy mode. Great game though! 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197969067861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1467389947}
review:
[h1]Overall: 4 out of 5[/h1]
- A decent time management game in which you serve tons of customers single handedly.

Pros:
- Learning curve is gentle. Casual gamers can just hop in.
- Yet, there is a certain strategic depth to this game. You need to figure out the best combination of food to serve at least every two days
- Great Customizability: Key mapping is customizable to your convenience for each food
- Chores give you pleasant annoyance
- You will likely lose track of time once you start playing. 

Cons:
- After figuring out which foods are easier to serve than others, it starts to feel repetitive
- Not much feel of achievement when your restaurant gets promoted to higher tier

author: {'steamid': '76561198040749571', 'num_games_owned': 1204, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1468016961}
review:
公式曰く「ハードコア レストラン シミュレーション」
レストランでオーダー通りにお料理すればよいのですが、オーダーは一度に複数来たりします。とにかく忙しい。いまポテト揚げてるからまって！！！

その日の仕事を始める前に複数のメニューの中からお店で出すものを選ぶことができます。メニューによって「ゴミが多い」「雨の日に売れる」など様々な特徴があり、経営状況やその他様々な要素を加味して選びましょう。

ただしメニューを作るのはあなたです！料理によって調理法が異なります。例えば下ボタンをホールドするだけで終わる「ビール」なんかは簡単ですがお客さんの注文通りの具を入れる「サラダ」やその上に重ねる順番が決まっている「ラザニア」などは非情に手間がかかります。焼きあがるまで待つメニュー等もありそれらにかかる時間を考慮してオーダーを処理していかないとパンク状態に……お店の評判が悪くなってしまいます。

しかし大変なオーダーをきれいに捌き切った時の気持ちよさは格別。
なんどもトライして一流のシェフを目指しましょう！

author: {'steamid': '76561198017682222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1615560176}
review:
If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

INGREDIENTS:

1. 2 tablespoons olive oil, divided
2. 1 onion, diced
3. 1 pound ground beef
4.1 pound ground pork
5. 1/2 cup Panko*
6. 2 large egg yolks
7. 1/4 teaspoon ground allspice
8. 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
9 .Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste

FOR THE GRAVY

1. 1/4 cup unsalted butter
2. 1/3 cup all-purpose flour
3. 4 cups beef broth
4. 3/4 cup sour cream
5. Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
6. 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley leaves

DIRECTIONS:

1. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion, and cook, stirring frequently, until onions have become translucent, about 2-3 minutes.

2. In a large bowl, combine ground beef, ground pork, Panko, egg yolks, allspice, nutmeg and cooked onion; season with salt and pepper, to taste. Using a wooden spoon or clean hands, stir until well combined. Roll the mixture into 1 1/4-to-1 1/2-inch meatballs, forming about 24 meatballs.

3. Add remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil to the skillet. Add meatballs, in batches, and cook until all sides are browned, about 4-5 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate.

4. To make the gravy, melt butter in the skillet. Whisk in flour until lightly browned, about 1 minute. Gradually whisk in beef broth and cook, whisking constantly, until slightly thickened, about 1-2 minutes. Stir in sour cream; season with salt and pepper, to taste.

5. Stir in meatballs and cook, stirring occasionally, until heated through and thickened, about 8-10 minutes.

6. Serve immediately, garnished with parsley, if desired.

*Panko is a Japanese-style breadcrumb and can be found in the Asian section of your local grocery store.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994971393', 'num_games_owned': 2924, 'num_reviews': 287, 'playtime_forever': 2890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2828, 'last_played': 1466953602}
review: A fun little frenetic game. The mechanics are simple, just little dexterity-based mini games. But the difficulty scales up nicely to find something that will challenge most players. The rapid-fire mini games are a great way to work on your APM, and the parallelism built into the cooking times and the customer queue are a great way to improve your awareness of game states! Combined with the fact that there are lots of cute, clever, and funny details makes this a great value for the price.

review:
[h1] Recommendation [/h1] Recommended
 
[h1] Base Game Score [/h1] B+
 
[h1] Style [/h1] Casual Management
 
[h1] Recommendation Summary [/h1] In "Cook, Serve, Delicious," you are a chef that is cooking food while running the restaurant. You use your keyboard keys to rapidly finish tasks as fast as possible. In involves memory and concentration, and it is a lot of fun. The gameplay is quite casual, and it is interesting and enjoyable. It is recommended for purchase, regardless of whether or not you are hardcore into casual gaming, or you just play a casual game every once in a while.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059415229', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 5925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3286, 'last_played': 1638579494}
review:
First, I wanted to say that this game surprised me. When I got this game I assumed that it was a typical restaurant/serving game. The artwork is actually kinda beautiful. I love how the characters look, the food looks good, and the scenery that you see outside your window doesn't lose luster. The gameplay manages to avoid being repetive and also offers different challenges that will keep you on your toes. I have not had a problem with this game, but something to ntoe is that I have never played multiplayer so I do not know how that works. 

TLDR: Game looks great, is fun to play, and has a lot of aspects that prevent boredom.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119740593', 'num_games_owned': 618, 'num_reviews': 313, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1498437999}
review:
일단 이 겜의 원조격이라 할수 있는 플스1 게임인

나의요리 라는 장잉력 넘쳐 흐르는 요리게임이 있다.

이 겜은 그 나의요리라는 겜의 컨셉을 기본적으로 따오며 

좀더 요리에 공을 들인다는 느낌의 나의요리와 틀리게 스피디한 

행동에 중점을 둔 지지배들이 좋아할만한 웹게임 느낌이다.

허나 치명적 단점이 이 겜은 빠르게 언어를 읽고 순발력 있게 

움직이는게 겜의 주 관건이나 언어 지원이 달랑 영어 하나다.

영어권과는 틀리게 다른 문화권 사람이 설령 영어를 이해하고 

알아본다쳐도 자국 언어 만큼이나 바로 눈으로 보고 동시 행동으로 

옮길수 있는 수준이 얼마나 된다고 생각을 하는건지 모르겟다.

곧 속편이 나온다고 하는데 언어지원을 폭 넓게 안하겟다는건

자기네 겜에 엄청난 자신감이 넘쳐 흐르던지 겜하는 사람을 

과대 평가하는 둘중 하나라 생각하기에 비추천이다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068563195', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 4207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 5, 'playtime_at_review': 3806, 'last_played': 1710808449}
review:
Best [strike]zombie[/strike]... er, restaurant apocalypse sim ever. 

At first glance, it looks like a charming and relaxing little casual game... but deep in it's black heart beats the war drum of frenetic madness. You, and you alone, must run this restaurant for impatient perfectionists... cooking, doing all the chores, and serving the [strike]evil legions of the damned from hell[/strike] er, hungry customers... and they just keep coming! You are Earths last hope... or at least the only place to eat in the building. The only relief to be found is at closing time... but there is always tomorrow. 

Can be very frustrating, and strangely addictive. No relaxation to be found here.

Worse, you can neither die nor kill anyone... truly cooking in hell. I love it, yet hate it at the same time. 

Your order is up! Go, go, go!

author: {'steamid': '76561198054428727', 'num_games_owned': 807, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 1751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1408, 'last_played': 1614805287}
review:
Probably the most addictive and fun cooking game I've ever played. It's satisfying, very long and has a decent amount of challenge with many different foods to cook... and serve.

 You have to strategically get your buzz up as high as possible, while also making sure your foods generate decent income. A 6 food serving limit means that every item counts. Should you go for slow cooking but high revenue meats, or smaller but instantly served salads? How about some easy to make drinks?

The only real complaints I have about the game are the robberies (take too long to do, but can be avoided by purchasing an upgrade or restarting the day), and the slow start.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046909876', 'num_games_owned': 648, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 2448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1913, 'last_played': 1590259656}
review:
I hate cooking most of the time. 

Yet, I really love Cook, Serve, Delicious. I would cook meals all the time if it was as fun as this game. 

I really like the co-op compontent to the game, allowing one person to prep foods, and the other to take in orders and serve the cooked dishes. My 5 year old and I play in this mode, and he loves seeing how quickly he can serve things up for me to prep. 

The Survival Island portion will be the death of me. Dang those nachos!

Looking forward to seeing what changes and improvements CSD2 will bring.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041354567', 'num_games_owned': 671, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1343, 'last_played': 1465673864}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious! é uma daquelas rebarbas de Humble Bundle da vida que você não dá nada pelo jogo, mas acaba descobrindo ser bem mais interessante do que aparentava à primeira vista.

Uma espécie de simulador hardcore de restaurante, a graça de CSD é controlar cada pedacinho que compõe um prato e atender a clientela de um dia todo numa jogada cuja duração não costuma ultrapassar 10 minutos - e isso enquanto mantém os combos de acertar nos ingredientes e na quantidade requerida por cada um. Pode parecer algo difícil de acompanhar no começo, mas a curva de dificuldade é bastante suave a princípio, te dando míseros 4 slots pra lidar ao mesmo tempo. Mais ainda: você ainda pode controlar o fluxo de pessoas através do menu do dia, visto que algumas comidas podem dar tanto vantagens (tipo "prato preferido na manhã") quanto desvantagens ("prato muito gorduroso" ou mesmo "bebida alcóolica"). Assim, o jogo de dará uma porcentagem de "Buzz", influenciada por outros fatores externos (como você ter passado na inspeção de limpeza, algum blogueiro te recomendar ou por algum prato ativo estar apodrecendo). Há até mesmo a opção de comprar upgrades para todos os pratos, permitindo um preço mais alto no menu, mas também tornando a refeição mais difícil de montar sem erros por haver mais ingredientes e variações de receita. Em compensação, dá pra comprar itens que podem aumentar a paciência dos clientes ou diminuir a frequência de certas tarefas, como lavar pratos, tirar o lixo e armar ratoeiras.

Talvez um dos maiores problemas do jogo seja também uma de suas qualidades: permitir o controle extremo nos pormenores por nós. Digo isso porque, pelo menos na minha experiência, o jogo começou a ficar realmente repetitivo e boring quando evitava mudar os pratos do dia, pois não queria errar os combos (podendo te dar buzz negativo) por não estar totalmente familiarizada com o "layout de teclas" cujos pratos têm por definição. Na hora de você subir seu restaurante pra uma estrela a mais, é preciso preencher uma lista de afazeres, mas como um dos requisitos mínimos é jogar 20 dias in-game, isso acaba se revelando um excesso de tempo pra preencher e aí o risco do jogo ficar chato (caso não mude muita coisa como eu) torna-se muuuuito maior. Claro, se você ficar trocando e experimentando as possibilidades ao máximo, aí certamente isso será mais difícil de acontecer.

Eventualmente, CSD também conta com eventos extras, inclusive tornando-se parte dos requisitos pra upgradear o restaurante, como supracitei. Um é servir pratos durante festinhas e o outro, um programa de TV chamado Iron Cook. Nos dois casos o tempo é mais curto ainda, os slots são uns 10 e os pratos selecionados pela ocasião podem incluir mais pormenores ainda pra aumentar a dificuldade. Por exemplo: hamburguer e pizza podem ter mais ingredientes do que sua versão mais simples, e no segundo caso, há tantas opções disponíveis que a lista forma duas páginas (!!) pra alternar enquanto você precisa, em segundos, acertar na receita requisitada. Foi por causa disso, aliás, que acabei empacando no jogo.

No momento em que escrevo, meu restaurante tem três estelas. Para chegar a quatro, fiz tudo o que precisava, MENOS terminar os quatro desafios do Iron Cook. Consegui fechar três deles, mas o último tem beirado o impossível devido ao nível maior de complexidade e o jogo só tolera que você faça DOIS erros no total. Passou pra três, tem que tentar tudo de novo. Por isso, meu conselho é: leve esse --possível-- problema em conta caso você faça muita questão de chegar até o fim de um jogo.

De resto, não há muito o que comentar. Existe um modo mais difícil ainda, em que atender os clientes torna-se um genuíno inferno na Terra (especialmente na hora do rush) e um multiplayer local no qual uma pessoa decide quais pratos fazer primeiro enquanto outra deve montá-los. Comigo, ambos foram bem dispensáveis, hahah.

Na soma das suas partes, CSD é um jogo competente no que faz e é uma boa opção de matar um tempinho em doses homeopáticas. Recomendo, no mínimo, uma olhadinha pelo que ele oferece. E ele também pode ser bastante engraçadinho  caso você leia os e-mails diários que recebe assim que finaliza uma partida (que não comentei antes por praticamente ignorá-los :p).

author: {'steamid': '76561197969749884', 'num_games_owned': 2454, 'num_reviews': 1422, 'playtime_forever': 23165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3893, 'last_played': 1516032415}
review:
Doing menial tasks repeatedly over and over for hours upon hours was never more fun. It looks like a little casual title, but it is way more than that. It is excruciatingly challenging late game, requires lots of memorization and quick reflexes as well as on the fly tactical thinking.

It's much much more than it appears to be. Spent way more time playing this than I thought I would.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029285074', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 6584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6584, 'last_played': 1507110348}
review:
10/10 Fast-Food-Restaurant-Employee-Simulator

+ Very Original game and character design
+ Detailed variety of foods and menues 
+ Online competitions

- The game needs tons of time and patience to be finished 
- Pretty slow progress
- Monotone after a while of playing 

For 9,99€ the game is a little too boring - maybe only usable for casual gaming. But if you find it on sale, I would definitely recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054384503', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 4127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2178, 'last_played': 1491157776}
review:
There's just something about cooking games that appeals to me.  Add in lots of upgrades, challenges, and lists, and the completionist in me is screaming to play more too.

One important feature to note:  You can rebind the keys used in each individual food's preparation minigame.  This may not seem like a big deal, but if you want to make the game a bit easier on yourself rebinding the keys according to whatever mnemonics you have in mind is a godsend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977497651', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1756, 'last_played': 1675875577}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025979147', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1959, 'last_played': 1537759126}
review:
First order of the day was beer, served an empty glass.
Closing order was an 'Louisiana Delight' soup.  Boiled up one slice of carrot for them.

10/10, would serve social justice again.

In all seriousness, the game does a great job of making a very simple concept (speed key memory) fun and addicting by tying in a progressive method of learning and a casual, comedic story/setting.  The game can become fast paced but with strategic restaurant purchases and no severe punishment for doing poorly, one can advance and be proficient with enough time.  Beyond the career mode, the battle kitchen offers decent single challenge events for moderate replay value.  There are some obvious lacking devices a game like this could utilize, and some more dishes/tasks would be nice, but at it's current cost (and ESPECIALLY on sale) it's well worth it.
The humour of the junk mail and dating texts actually gets me to laugh.  Worth every penny.
I no longer flush when I go at a restaurant.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020740602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1492653300}
review:
Something I always hate about management and simulation games, when you're good at them, is that you seem to run out of things to do and buy quickly. This one spreads out the earnings and the ability to buy upgrades just the right amount though. If you like wokring for your achievements and everything, then this one will last you a long time.
Also, I like the emails everyday. I like the actual menu options and switching it around depending on the weather and other factors. There's really a lot going on here and it's excellent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153413510', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 906, 'last_played': 1466099227}
review:
This game is as simple as the title suggests. Cook the food, serve it to the customer, and rake in that delicious cash!  However, something so simple very quickly gets complex. Each food has buffs and defuffs to your "Buzz". the higher the buzz the more people show up, but too much buzz may be a bit hard for you to handle. Menu rot occurs if you serve the same dishes 3 days in a row. This does not apply to foods listed as staples. which you can serve whenever. Simpler food to make does not give a good pay, and some can't even be tipped on (if it wasn't so broken with it's payout lasagna could go die in a hole) . Rush hours show up during lunch and dinner time, in which no snacks will be ordered (ice cream, pretzels, etc.) and the game almost doubles in speed. You can upgrade food to make it more appealing to the customer, at the cost of adding new recipies. Oh, that's right, food isn't always made the same way. you have to learn different recipies for every item, which speedy players will learn the names of (Kids delight is ranch and cheese salad, Dry twister is pretzel with nothing on it, etc.), but this is not neccecary as a tooltip tells you the recipie.

Those are just the basics about the FOOD. there are a whole lot more mechanics that i'll let you discover for yourself. This game comes bundled with a silly multiplayer mode, weekly challenges, ingame challenges, emails, and a whole lot more to make one of the best indie games i've played in a while.

PROS:
Fun, chaotic action
Lots of depth
Many gamemodes
Quite a bit of strategy required
Indie cameos!
Wacky artstyle
Weekly challenges (that i suck at)

CONS:
Kevin McLeod music, but they are obscure tracks. Not sure all of it is Kevin either. (not a big deal, just saying)
Can get repetitive
Quite a bit of luck involved, game is random event heavy.
Very random side note but why the heck do i start in an office building? just a bizare start, not really a con.

Overall, this game gets an 8.6/10 from me. Great, but not perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111281989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1491419109}

author: {'steamid': '76561198000368069', 'num_games_owned': 1130, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 2062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2061, 'last_played': 1637056388}
review: The whole idea behind the game is a system of increasingly difficult, increasingly fast paced simple tasks thrown at you until you either can't handle it and make a mistake (or can't complete a dish in time), or until the day is complete. Despite or because of this, it is strongly compelling. Plays very differently with a keyboard vs a controller, and for the full experience, it is worth trying both (although you will end up staying with your favourite after the first couple of plays). Looking forward to the sequel, although the original game should have more than enough dishes to keep you going for a while at least. Online leaderboards don't seem hacked yet. In short, no complaints from me, though this game may not be for everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123676709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1464467397}
review:
I've played this game for 5 hours and have already passed the time and experience of cooking I have in real life. This game really shows the mechanical skills and finesse required to cook at a high level. Its simplicity really portrays how you can make simple home-made food; and elevate it to restaurants as great as the one and only 'Gordan Ramsay.' There are many famous people I have seen pass by my restaurant in this game such as Brian 'Oddone' Wyllie and George 'HotshotGG' Georgallidis.

我已经玩过这个游戏5小时，并已经通过了我在现实生活中的时间和烹饪的经验。这场比赛真正体现出在较高的水平做饭所需的机械技能和技巧。它的简单描绘真的你如何进行简单的自制食品;它提升到餐馆一样大，独一无二的“戈尔丹·拉姆齐。 ”有许多著名的人我已经通过我的店在这场比赛中看到的传球如布莱恩' Oddone “威利和乔治HotshotGG ” Georgallidis 。

author: {'steamid': '76561198023936172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1496173645}
review:
If you need a "time killer" type of a game, this is it!

You shouldn't expect much of a tycoon or a business game here, because this is definitely not one. However, there's a minimal amount of "economy" which you should take care. This is actually a reflex-action game, where you are successful if your hand-eye coordination if good. 

I'm playing this game whenever I have long trips or waiting somewhere; doesn't need internet and much of a PC resource which means you can play for hours on power-saving mode :)

I can't "strongly" recommend the game however if you need a time killer, that's a good choice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050760341', 'num_games_owned': 688, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1501110016}
review:
Le genre de jeu que j'ai eu dans un bundle et qui trainait dans ma bibliothèque depuis longtemps jusqu'attends que je l'essai. C'était une bonne idée.

Très bon jeu qui deviens de plus en plus difficile avec l'évolution et qui propose des challenges assez difficiles. Ce jeu occupe vraiment les "down" de jeux-vidéo et fait passer le temps.

Positif: 
- Système d'upgrade
- Challenge quotidiens
- Succès Steam / Cartes à échanger
- Prise en charge de la manette

Négatif:
- Un peu redondant à la longue (toujours le même décor, long à upgrade son restaurant)


Très bon petit jeu que je recommande.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039254972', 'num_games_owned': 404, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1999, 'last_played': 1463458985}

author: {'steamid': '76561198067371366', 'num_games_owned': 2062, 'num_reviews': 581, 'playtime_forever': 1402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 911, 'last_played': 1558828700}
review:
Wow, this game is really cool! I was not at all prepared to be that entertained. The gameplay is really a casual game's gameplay, graphics too, it's repetitive... So I could not understand all these great ratings! Now I do!

The developers did a really good job, because its simple gameplay gets so much addictive: press corresponding keys to take a plate, put some ingredients, cook it, serve... delicious! Funny situations can turn out- distracted by all the dishes to wash, you get confused by the *ding!* of a potato in the oven... and serve a raw pizza to a very angry customer!

I am not done with that game, actually far from it, it feels like I am still at the beginning, it takes time to have a perfect restaurant! And yet I know every time I have ten minutes to kill, I'll try with pleasure to play 2 or 3 days and buy this fryer or this soda dispenser I've been eyeing for weeks!

I do recommend and I look forward to its sequel, such a nice little game deserves more content!

review: An extremely addicting title that falls somewhere between puzzle game and management sim. Includes a very extensive single player campaign, several online multiplayer modes, and even local co-op. Every controller in the world is supported, even the Wii U Pro controller!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041967011', 'num_games_owned': 661, 'num_reviews': 536, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1485246937}
review:
Интересная игра, но всю суть можно уловить уже в первом уровне. Рекомендовать такое не могу, так как это банальный тренажер клавиатуры. Вы будете выполнять одинаковые действия, причём сильно напрягаясь — гринд в оффлайн играх, ну кто это придумал? Системы апгрейдов тут почти нет, поэтому я не нашел стимула продолжать играть спустя 2 дня. Делать одно и то же часами, без какого-либо разнообразия... Да лучше перепройти Little Inferno, раз уж на то пошло. Кстати, блюда не выглядят особо вкусными, то ли цветность тускловата, то ли вариантивность страдает.

Также неудобно читать заказы, хотелось бы слышать их и выполнять с уст, а не постоянно бегать туда-сююда по монитору, выискавая 'нужно ли добавить сахар или нет'. Плюс очень неудобно с некоторыми кнопками, когда 'Cherry' находится, почему-то, на 'H'. Долго нужно заморачиваться с привыканием, долго нарасчивать скил, будто реально пытаешься стать поваром, ёлки. На безрыбье — отличная игра, но при обычных обстоятельствах лучше поиграть во что-то другое.

review: A simple but challenging game with great art. It is best played in short-ish sessions, I think, so it makes a nice distraction when I have a half-hour entertainment dead zone between tv shows, or if I'm only going to be on the computer for a little while and need something fun to do before I need to leave or start another task. Definitely looking forward to the sequel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198274737011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1008, 'last_played': 1649694916}
review:
An absolutely delicious game! It's so engaging and complex for a cooking game! I would definitely recommend it if you're into cooking games and enjoy a challenge. The graphics are mouthwatering, and the recipes get more and more complicated as you upgrade them. You can set your own menu for your restaurant, you have to give 100 percent of hard work every second of the in-game day, to create positive buzz (popularity) from customers, and you have to invest in your restaurant in other ways except buying new equipment. It's quite realistic to a point. I won't spoil it further. The only annoying thing I've encountered is the "menu rot" thing, having to change the dishes in your menu every couple of days, I've seen other fans commenting on it. But come to think of it, it's great to get a fresh change in menu every other day, it keeps the game interesting and creative. 
I also dislike how some of the negative buzz created by some menu items doesn't seem to be very realistic. Why would anyone mind for having alcohol on the menu? I'd say, in an office building, it's a plus.
I really love the music, it's so playful and it really keeps you engaged during rush hour, when you need to focus a lot in order to do a good job!
The customer animations and sounds are priceless. I like how they get more upper class too once you gain more stars for your restaurant.
I also love how there are a lot of in-game games, like the Iron Cook Challenge (think MasterChef).

This game is such a delight, it always demands more of you, it's a game you can truly try your best to play to perfection. Kudos to the creators for creating such fun, interesting and original content. And for making it truly challenging. I've been playing cooking games for a long time but this is by far my favorite. 

For such a reasonably small price, considering the amount of game content (some of it, high-end dishes, recently added) this game is definitely worth trying out! It's a bargain, and a must-have for any foodie with a gaming passion! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198085551904', 'num_games_owned': 1071, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1489085809}
review:
Gioco carino e divertente!
Il gioco a prima vista sembra un giochino flash, ma poi mettendosi li agiocare quel pensiero vola via, poiché il gioco sa divertire e dare un alto grado di sfida, perché si rislulta difficile andare avanti con le ordinazioni!
Non c'è mlto da diere su qeusto gioco, sulla fine è un videogame dove noi dobbiamo semolicemte rispettare le oridinazioni e creare i cibi nel minor tempo possbile senza mai sbagliare ingredienti.
Ah il prezzo di 9.99 € è un po' alto, consiglio di acquistarlo in un bundle (come ho fatto io) o prenderlo a prezzo scontato (circa a 1 o 2  €).

author: {'steamid': '76561198004006644', 'num_games_owned': 2633, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 537, 'last_played': 1586183728}
review:
This game is simply amazing , i could go in depth about all its features but in short for those looking for a comparison as to what its like , if you were a fan of a old game called Root Beer Tapper. This is the modern advancement of it.
Not only you can serve the beer to the oncoming army of people but also other foods. 

To make sure its not too arcade like they have added in stuff like a upgrade system , equipment , events to make it interesting.
if you had loved Root Beer Tapper back then you will jump in and love this game.
what i liked about this game
- management were you can customize foods, equipment 
- level up system to keep you going towards a 5 star restaurant.
- nice extra stuff to do like event, challenges, reading email, bets etc
- controls are excellent.

What i did not like
- extremely brutal learning curve for new players specially during rush hours + inspection right from day 1
- menu rot makes no sense, it should be the opposite people should like and want stuff you serve nicely.
- despite buying equipment the chores are not reduced that much at all. 
- Some of foods are a pain to serve killing your chances of getting perfect combos.

Overall the game gave me the arcade experience i enjoyed playing  Root Beer Tapper back then hopefully that gets released on steam as well sometime in future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068046234', 'num_games_owned': 1193, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1572704121}

author: {'steamid': '76561198119279482', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1412, 'last_played': 1501796964}
review:
This is by far one of my favorite games that I own in my Steam Library. When people want to know a lesser known game that I recommend, I recommend this game. 

Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a wonderful game that simulates what it would feel like being on a the line for a popular restaurant. You have to cook, you have prepare, you have to serve the food all perfectly or face the consequences. CSD is a restaurant sim, it is a cooking sim, it is the food simulator that we've been waiting for. The gameplay is excellent, the different modes are challening and bring new ways to play the game. If you want to just casually play a few rounds, you can do that, if you want to compete against those around the world, you can do that as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035423740', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1502493271}
review:
Me: Oh this looks delightful I need another fast simple throwaway type game that's just some good clean fun. 

Me an hour into this game: OH YEAH I AM MASTER CHEF, ENJOY MY FOOD, ARE YOU PLEASED BY MY COMBOS?? NO I CAN'T DO LAUNDRY RIGHT NOW I AM MANAGING A RESTAURANT, DO YOU SEE THE INTENSITY?

I did not expect this to eat into my subconcious like it is but the only reason I want to wake up in the morning is to have the most shining beautiful example of the pinnacle of foodservice. 

Also I swear to God, dude, stop ordering the Jumbo Diet with Ice and Flavor Blast I am going to kick you in the ear. 

5/5, best one star restaurant in town, would recommend.

review:
Brief review for now as I'm still quite new to the game. That said...

...I can see all my free time over the next few weeks vanishing into invidiually seasoned steaks, very precise salads, and delicious-looking ice creams that I just want to eat off the screen.

I think I will probably regain my free time just in time for Cook, Serve, Delicious 2 to come out.

There's so much to do. Even from very early on. So. Many. Things. I'm exhausted, being a chef. And I'm not really a chef.

Buy this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198129165991', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1460091062}
review:
Despite owning this game for a short time, I still recommend it to anyone who wants a fun, simple little cooking simulator for Steam. It is far superior to titles like Diner Dash that have been around for years and there are very few competitors that offer anything worth paying for. But for me, it was not worth the discounted price, even at 50% off. This seems like something that would of been happier staying on mobile or consoles, it doesn't really fit well to me on a PC. There isn't very much to do and it's very repetitive. It's really fun, but the selections are so limited and everything is really expensive. It's like a hill with a steep incline.

However, I will say that if you love typing and management type games, and are not looking for anything that is too specific or involved, this might be the game for you. I would absolutely avoid it at full price and only buy it during a sale. Try it, see if you like it, but it just wasn't the dish for me. Maybe CSD2 will change that, who knows?

review:
The best time management/cooking simulator game I've ever played. Big sort of recipes, achievements, goals, and challenges. Lovely graphics, easily rememberable and logical button mapping. Sometimes I play one session for hours, and I just don't notice it. The music matches the atmosphere, awesome soundtrack! Congrats for the developers!
Challenging. Addictive. Variable. Original. Fantastic!
This is Cook, Serve, Delicious!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025758538', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3585, 'last_played': 1558911406}
review:
It's a really fun, cute game. Can be playfully stressful as the keyboard combos turn more complex and orders come in faster, especially at the higher star ratings (which is to be expected), so be prepared to take frequent breaks if you are prone to anxiety or are just jittery by nature. 

And even if the keyboard mechanics don't reflect the real world by any stretch, this game makes me rethink ever opening my own restaurant. I still have nightmares over my first attempts at Extreme difficulty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112877446', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1551556911}
review:
너무 어려워요 재미도있고 긴장감도 넘치고 메뉴도 엄청많고 여타 타이쿤게임에 비해서 난이도가 있어요
키셋팅도 본인 편의성에 맞추어 바꿀수있고  음식 업그레이드가 되면서
추가 레시피가 늘어나서 손에 갑자기 안익혀지면 어버버 되더라구요
돈벌기는 쉬운편이지만 메뉴업글이나 주방업글하면서 나가는 돈도 많은 편이고
그렇다고 해서 돈없다고 힘든 게임은 아닌거같아요
영어가 좀 되야 할것 같아요 날라오는 메세지들중에 필요성이 있는 메세지가 잇어서
스킵하기엔 다소 무리가 있더라구요 
세일중에 구매했는데 값어치가 충분히 있다고 생각해요

author: {'steamid': '76561197978290786', 'num_games_owned': 379, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 566, 'last_played': 1460374317}
review:
An extremely well-polished polished game with simple but challenging gameplay. Each piece of food is a simple mini-puzzle, but as your restaurant gains popularity (and during rush-hours) you get allthe orders at once, which is great for inducing a feeling of flow and mastery if you nail them all, or feelings of you being *almost* good enough to do them perfectly.

The game gives you additional challenges to keep you always changing your menu and hence the mini-puzzles you're solving, and the game offers plenty of milestones and upgrades that always keep you wanting for the next upgrade for your kitchen.

While great for casual gaming, I played a solid 8 hrs after purchasing it. Would recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032650652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1573941926}

author: {'steamid': '76561198074310107', 'num_games_owned': 3073, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 3194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3113, 'last_played': 1461075147}
review:
People can and do order water with a flavor boost in this game.

Now seriously, this game is really great cooking game. It's relaxing in a way that it makes you forget about real life problems you're handling, because at the moment all you stress about is your pancakes and burger both needing final preparations because they just finished cooking at the same time, meanwhile you're trying to get that pizza done right... It offers a simple gameplay but is challenging to master once you want your every day to be perfect in-game terms.

author: {'steamid': '76561198189000417', 'num_games_owned': 340, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 981, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 975, 'last_played': 1565698001}
review:
Salut tout le monde, je vais expliquer pourquoi je recommande ce jeu en 3 étapes :).

Tous d'abord le style de jeux, personnellement j'adore les jeux comme sa (pour ce qui connaissent,  je suis une personne qui a passé de nombreuses heure sur papa tacos ou papa Burger sur jeu.fr x)) bref... Je disais donc que j'adore les jeux de gestion/restauration, le rythme et bien présent ce qui fait donc que les services pas assez vite et que les rushes hours sont très stressant.
Malheureusement il y a un petit point noir de ce côté-là...  C'est l'ennuie au bout de 4 ou 5 service, en gros c'est un jeu très bien rythmé mais très répétitif et par conséquent ennuient à la longue. (Moi je joue petit à petit de temps en temps)

Ensuite je vais parler de la personnalisation... Certes très variés dans les choix de votre carte: JAPONAIS / MEXICAIN / AMÉRICAIN ou même FRANÇAIS tous les plats y sont. Bien évidemment pas la peine de préciser que vous pouvez tout combiné. Par contre le restaurant vous ne le toucherait jamais, un type de salle par étoiles gagné et c'est tous pas de décoration ou de mobilier. Dommage car le jeu aurais était bien mieux avec une personnalisation complète...  Mais ce n'est qu'un petit détail qui vous dérangera à peine.

Et pour finir le temps de jeu. Le temps de jeu et juste fous à mon avis. Je suis à 11h et je n'et que 3étoiles et je suis bien loin de la quatrième.
Je veux dire que pour un petit jeu comme celui-ci le temps et largement suffisant pour vous occuper dans vos moments de solitude. Ce qui fait que le jeu et long et le faite des améliorations des plats qui rajoute toujours plus de choix lors de la commande du menu de la part du client, les améliorations du restaurant aussi son-là pour vous aider, une meilleure organisation pour gagner plus de temps (au départ sortir les poubelles prend 20s soit 6sac à jeter grâce à l'amélioration seulement 2 sac). Il y a aussi un mode défis et un mode "Cantine" ou vous devez envoyer 80 plats en très peu de temps. Et pour finir avec cette partie, un mode multijoueur (jamais testé mais qui m'a l'air fort sympathique). 

Pour conclure ce gros pavé de texte, je recommande ce jeu au gens qui aime ce genre de jeu, mais aussi au nouveau du genre.

Voilà maintenant que j'ai donné mon avis à vous de faire votre choix bye.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046204601', 'num_games_owned': 642, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1046, 'last_played': 1626918977}
review:
This game is a fast pace, multitasking, restaurant simulator. This seems to be the only of its kind other than the late-great Diner Dash.

+highly Addictive
+several unique dishes to cook, each with their own keys for ingredients
+several side jobs to enhance variety
+Funky Smooth sound track
+the perfect amount of difficulty (on casual mode, that is)

-If you're a perfecionist, this game will give you a hard time
-/+You NEED to be good with your keyboard (do not recommend using controller)
-/+Wait for a steam sale, got this for 0.99$ last summer.

I've spent many hours into this game and do not regret any amount of playing, it can even improve your keyboard typing skills and reaction timing. Its fun and addicting and I'd recommend it to any of my friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198275614817', 'num_games_owned': 19, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1458312313}

review:
Ya know, they say when life gives you lemons, make lemonade.

but in this case, when 5 people are ordering lasagna, and you have upgraded the dish to allow more complex ingredients,
and the health inspector walks in after you finished the first lasagna and you have to do dishes because lasagna does that,
and then WHOA NELLY ARMED ROBBERY...

you gotta keep cool. make them customers happy. its about them. not you.

just serve coffee and burgers. you'll be fine

author: {'steamid': '76561198011237505', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1504035933}
review:
I had no idea this was a thing I needed in my life. My life full of turbulence. My job that considers most of my time to belong to it and then my home life where I scramble to serve my child, my friends and my sibling. Where I cook food at a blazing speed and then sit down to relax with a game where I do the same gd thing.

I don't know where everything went wrong but this game makes it feel right. It's Diner Dash without the Diner. It's Cooking Mama without the bubbly sexism. It's Lemonade Tycoon without the effing Lemonade. I don't know. It's so many things. 

Get this game if you want lounge music softly playing in your head forever. Get this game if you want something to innocuously look delicate yet smack you around with the blunt end of a kitchen cleaver. It's fun. You don't realize it first but it's fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003019346', 'num_games_owned': 4233, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1471113291}

author: {'steamid': '76561198014502377', 'num_games_owned': 2868, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 1159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1503971877}
review: If you took an iphone game, expanded it out to be much larger than any iphone game reasonably should be, and then put it on steam, this is what you'd get. C,S,D! is a good game but it's just a series of minigames that you repeat ad-infinitum for the ultimate goal of playing more and slightly different mini-games. It's Nintendo's warioware, except without the creativity or originality. After an hour or so of playing it I realized the mini-games were never going to get better in a dramatic way or even more creative beyond what I'd already been exposed to. Kind of disappointing really, because I wanted to like it.

review:
Cook Serve Delicious is a fun enough game. It reminds me of game I played in middle school when dodging classwork. You own a restaurant and play a mini game for each item you cook for a customer. You have to rotate your food out to keep it freash and people coming back but theres not much more to it than that.

The biggest issue I had is the new food is too expensive to unlock. It would have been nice to be able to try out new a different food instead of being stuck with the same stuff for 2 hours.

Other than that though its fun enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157057527', 'num_games_owned': 191, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2172, 'last_played': 1558792773}
review:
There are two things I love about this game.  One is that it makes me hungry and makes my lunch, dinner and midnight snacks taste better after playing a round or two.   Two is the fantastic soundtrack that puts you in the mood to cook like a maniac and pound that keyboard like a madman.  The latter alone made me play non-stop and not touching my other steam games until I finished the campaign just to listen to the music.  

One of those rare games where the music alone was worth the price of admission.  And I suppose the gameplay's good too...

author: {'steamid': '76561198068439027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 699, 'last_played': 1459978573}
review:
Fast paced but simple kicthen fun! You're the cook and manager of a restaurant in an office tower. Buy equipment, check emails, balance your positive/negative buzz, make orders as quick as you can, and don't forget to stay on top of your chores!

There is now the Battle Kitchen now as well, so you can compete with other players on time challenges and things like that. An interesting additon to what the game offers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061199748', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4268, 'last_played': 1679346050}
review:
Welcome to Sherri Soda Tower, a run-down urban building with a...piece….of crap...space for you to build your….brand new thriving restaurant! No seriously, this game is awesome. Starting from scratch, your goal is to become a 5-star chef beginning with a dump of a restaurant, but it’s rent free! And no, you can’t hire any employees. Why would you do that? There’d be less money for you!

That’s right...you’ll not only cook all of the food you serve...but you’ll catch rats, throw out the garbage, wash the dishes, and even flush the toilet for the poor excuses of human beings that come through your restaurant! The good news is you take ALL THE TIPS HOME FOR YOURSELF!

On top of the mouth-watering art, and music that will make you wanna dance, this game is incredibly addictive and will leaving you wanting to finish one more day before you go to bed. It will test your reflexes and also provide numerous challenges. Just when you think you’ve mastered a food item, new recipes throw additional learning demands on you, while your customers lack the patience to put up with your ability to do things that truly only an octopus could do.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kRvilDmb8nM

review:
Frantic but fun, for a little while; I don't plan on playing it any more.  

It's the type of game I'd want to play for like 5 minutes at a time to spice up my day, but it requires too much hotkey memorization and muscle memory to not play it for much larger chunks of time.

I'm recommending this, but be sure you understand what you're getting yourself into.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995629098', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 2304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2293, 'last_played': 1505197386}
review:
[h1] Cooking Done Right[/h1]

I picked up Cooking Mama 2: Dinner with Friends back in 2008 or so for DS, which was an enjoyable little romp in cooking games that I could play on the go, with an added plus that I could share this with my less game-focused friends and family. The cutesy appeal and the cooking mini games combined into a game that I enjoyably shared with my younger girl cousins from out of town, and cemented in me an interest in the genre. So when I saw Cook, Serve, Delicious!, I saw the good reviews, figured I'd try it. I was very pleased with the results.


Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a unique cooking game that has enjoyable RPG elements intelligently spliced into a restaurant owning sim. You start out with a simple menu selling corn dogs and beer, and through an enjoyable menu customization system, you slowly build up to a fast-paced five-star restaurant. Controls let you use either a controller or keyboard (2 player co-op as well), with you needing to manage a real-time restaurant and prepare dishes quickly by pressing keys/buttons to add ingredients to different dishes. The same dish (like Pizza) could be simple or complicated depending on if they want a cheese pizza or a supreme, since you need to press a button to add every ingredient.

 The menu customization in particular is very well done, since in a manner reminiscient of Diablo 3's difficulty tuning, you can modify your game's difficulty in how you build your menu of dishes; an easy menu will be comfortable and relaxing to cook, while a more complicated menu of dishes might earn more cash while keeping you on the edge of your seat, frantically trying to multitask cooking multiple dishes at once before you lose a customer. By being able to cater my menu toward a difficulty I desired, I was able to challenge myself mechanically with my dishes as well as not get overly frustrated or overwhelmed from too many difficult dishes. 

By the end game, you will start to upgrade your favorite dishes to their highest level, making them worth more but also making them more complicated by adding new ingredients, requiring more work to prepare. This actually results in the game staying enjoyable for much longer than I expected, as steady increase in complexity meant the game was always mechanically challenging, and more importantly, not overly repetitive. In the end, I was quite enjoying whizzing through 8 dishes at a time, feeling as mechanically pleased with my ability to cook complicated dishes as I would by doing a particularly difficult combination of abilities in a MOBA or MMORPG. It really was that fun.

This is not a game with a ton of action, or a deep story, or super impressive graphics. That said, Cook, Serve, Delicious! does provide a mechanically enjoyable, great-for-all-audiences game that kept me playing for 30 hours plus. Give it a chance, and it will impress you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050834276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2974, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1686, 'last_played': 1681386687}
review: This is my favorite game ever. It's super challenging and build up nicely. Sometimes it gets a bit repeatative when only playing restaurant mode so now I switch to the other modes as well :). Looking forward to part 2!

author: {'steamid': '76561198076406993', 'num_games_owned': 453, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 962, 'last_played': 1460862106}
review:
I thought cooking was stressful in real life.

Don't let the cutesy pictures fool you—this game is the real deal. If you don't know your way around a keyboard, you're definitely going to struggle as you progress through the game.

I'm a couple in-game days and an Iron Cook win away from a 5-Star restaurant, and it's gotten to the point where I can only play a day or two in a single session before I'm so tense that I need to lie down. And yet, though it causes me extreme stress, this game is insanely fun. It's so satisfying to finish a day, and the feeling of accomplishment when you get a perfect day even with a robbery is awesome.

I definitely recommend this game if you enjoy a good challenge.

P.S. Soup is the worstttttt

author: {'steamid': '76561198157472320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1415, 'last_played': 1511372025}
review: Cook, Serve, Delicious! is defitnely an amazing experience. It caught me for a lot of hours inside this restaurant ambient. In this game you're not only the one who cooks: you do literally everything. The restaurant management, the money control, the cleaning part, the kitchen part and lots of other stuff. And of course, you need to be as fast as possible to get a perfect service. This game gives you a lot of options on what you wanna cook, you make your own menu and give your restaurant your personality. Every time you level a star up the game gets harder and harder. You can count with a lot of challenges during your gameplay - that you can chose to do it or not. Full of special services, cooking games and even a co-op mode, Cook, Serve, Delicious! it's something you wanna get. May after awhile the cooking gets repetitive, but you can always fix that with changing your menu and what you're gonna serve to your costumers. It's a great simulator which makes you want to get all of the achievements and look foward to keep playing for many hours. And after beating it, it's not over. The game counts with a extra hard mode - like it wasn't already hard enough. If you want to get pissed off, with pain in the arms and may even break your keyboard, but, with hours of fun, get that game right now!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011195085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 2811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2725, 'last_played': 1501902998}
review:
This is a great, fast paced game that will challenge your memory and your time management skills. It is also on occasion hilarious. You must juggle many tasks all at once and finish within a certain time frame. You plan your menu which is important since all foods require different things to be created, some are simple, others can be complex and add great deals of difficulty. You buy equipment and upgrades that make some tasks easier, make customers more patient, and that simply improve how much money you can make. There are also challenges that can be difficult and rewarding.

The art in this game is fantastic as is the sound track. It is also very easy to run, so even your toaster can play it.

I also feel it is worth mentioning that the developer of this game actually *cares* about the game and the people who play it. He often posts on the forums in response to bugs and requests, and have seen him actively fixing these bugs and implementing some of the requests. He is also busy working on a sequel, while not abandoning this game.

The game is fun, and the developers are not money grubbing jerks who take your money and run. This is money well spent either way you look at it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024567766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 580, 'last_played': 1625766302}
review:
It's an incredibly addicting fun little game. I do see a few flaws with how things are designed, like the meal upgrade prices needing hundreds of sales of that particular meal to make the money back while not really giving you any benefit aside from the slightly increased price at the cost of more complicated orders, or the fact that you can cruise on easy meals and score the perfect day bonus and come out ahead compared to having 6 fairly complicated meals on your menu and not getting a perfect day because well, the meals are complicated and you're prone to making at least 1 mistake. 

Despite that I still recommend this game, especially if you find it on a sale!

author: {'steamid': '76561198051587361', 'num_games_owned': 3243, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 1757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1542843330}
review:
Absolut geil :D Das Spiel trifft genau mein Niveau!
Super auch zum Nebenbei-Zocken in Vorlesungen :)

In aller Kürze:
+ Macht Hölle Spaß
+ Gameplay
+ Idee
+ Fordert im Rahmen seiner Möglichkeiten mehr als ich gedacht hätte
+ Suchtfaktor
+ Grafik (dem Spiel angemessen)
+ Vorlesungs-Spiel (man kann parallel noch zuhören und es verhindert den Da-Rein-Da-Raus-Effekt bei langweiligen Profs)

- Die Steuerung hakt manchmal etwas
- Bei der Steuerung hätte es generell noch etwas Verbesserungspotential gegeben. Zum Beispiel, dass man ein Gericht komplett neu machen kann, wenn man sich vertippt hat und das weiß.

Insgesamt absolut dicke Empfehlung. Habe das Spiel im Sale erworben, aber auch den vollen Preis ist das Spiel wert :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198020028087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 5129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2866, 'last_played': 1691710587}
review:
I'm sure everything I'm about to say about this game has probably been said before, but I'mma put my two cents in anyway.

Cook, Serve, Delicious is ostensibly a restaurant management game. In reality, it's something more like a rhythm game, especially when you get to the harder stages. You're put in charge of preparing and serving every dish and doing every chore and all of this is done by hotkeys (or controller buttons) - but watch out, 'cuz new tasks are constantly coming in and it's up to you to juggle them before the customers get impatient and leave. The better you do, the more popular your restaurant becomes and the more people come to eat there, which of course means more for you to do.

The one thing this game does well - very well, possibly better than any other game I've played - is inducing a flow state, which is to say once you get into the rhythm of handling tasks you'll be tapping away at keys like a madman and become completely oblivious to the world around you. There's no time to think, so don't: just learn the recipes off by heart and then let your instincts take over. I mean, just look at me: I play on Extreme Difficulty just because the normal difficulty is too damn slow and boring. I NEED THE RUSH. GIVE IT TO ME.

If you haven't already bought this game, please do: they're bringing out a CSD2 soon and I want it to be as fabulously spectacular as possible. Besides, don't *you* want to become so good at this game that your hands fly across the keyboard like a pair of tap-dancing spiders? Of course you do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043682538', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1490, 'last_played': 1455490312}
review: Cook, Serve, Delicious! is the pinnacle of restaurant "simulator" games. Not only do you manage your own restaurant, but you micro manage every aspect of it. From changing your menu daily, to upgrading your kitchen, to competing in challenges, to reading emails and taking bets, to purchasing new foods and upgrading them, this game is incredibly detailed. The art and music are a bit simple but it fits the theme of the game pretty well. Gameplay is mostly muscle memory with key presses, so I would recommend watching gameplay before purchasing. It's not for everyone, but if you love a good typing challenge while trying to earn five stars on your restaurant, this game is for you. Lobster is OP.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964314597', 'num_games_owned': 1322, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1585535488}
review:
There are two classes of game that you should not play first thing before attempting to go to sleep.  The first class of game is the horror / thriller genre where you are unarmed and being hunted by a genetically engineered killing machine.  The second class is a frantic restaurant simulator where you have to construct meals in parallel by mashing keys with presicion timing.

Highly recommended, but not just before bed...

author: {'steamid': '76561198126872380', 'num_games_owned': 82, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1024, 'last_played': 1477092669}
review:
The game has excellent sound design. As you perform an action in the game, whether it is changing the size of your fountain drink cup or throwing meat onto the hot grill, there is a pleasurable sound that follows. The game appears pretty simple, but actually has some depth. Each food has certain positives and negatives that you have to take into account when you plan your daily menu. A certain number of foods might be optimal in terms of profitability, and you may be tempted to include only those because you need cash, but I enjoy mastering as many foods as I own as possible. There are various other challenges, such as catering, which may require you to serve certain foods you might not be used to. Catering is a good idea, because you can make more money faster than you can in your restaurant. 

Each type of food also carries certain chores with it, which you also must do to maintain your perfect combos. The health inspector shows up every once in awhile to make sure you are doing all your chores. There is equipment that allows you to expand the foods you can cook, mitigate negatives from food you're serving, and make your chores easier.  Lately I've been more into games like this, where the goals are clear, but you have some freedom in how you achieve those goals. 

The main negative of this game is that it is repetitive and fairly demanding in terms of optimal gameplay. It's difficult to play over a long period of time, because you really need to pay attention to what you're doing. During a rush hour, you really have to keep track of which order has come in first & understand which tasks you should tackle first. You need to take cook times, length of chores, and customer patience into account. When I started having trouble with my health inspections, I first invested in an automatic dishwasher to mitigate my dish washing, which was my most time-consuming chore. After trash became the longest & most troublesome, I got the trash service. The game is very addictive, and because it can be demanding, ti is difficult to play for long periods of time. Sometimes you just have to put the pipe down and detox for awhile.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069391654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1525518441}
review: I just love this game, it reminds me of those flash games I used to play as a kid and also a little bit of the Burguer Shop series. But even more evolved because you have a ton of things to upgrade in your restaurant, recepies, services, menu etc. And even the chores like taking out the trash, cleaning dishes and flushing the toilet are your responsability. Sometimes kind of infuriating but in a totally awesome way. 10/10 would recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115305019', 'num_games_owned': 191, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 1271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1271, 'last_played': 1454194045}
review:
Score: 9/10

The main mechanic is very simple, there are a plethora of foods that you can serve, each have their own recipes. In order to correctly serve a meal you have to hit the buttons in the correct order, always at client request. Overall the game is simple, but enjoyable. It is nice to play something that does not involve violence of some sort. An extra point for having controller support, a local-coop and online multiplayer modes, so you can play with your friends!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014704153', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 968, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 968, 'last_played': 1454224391}
review:
Rather hectic and fast paced restaurant management game which reminds me of when I worked in cafes and lunch bars.

 Dislike that there is no option to have other staff, just 1 person, serving, cooking  and cleaning.
Bit too crazy as most places have at least 4 staff. Not just one person to do everything.

As a manager I would rather not do the cleaning and pay someone to do it. Wish the game allowed you to hire staff, at least a cleaner. 

Dislike how I have to do iron cook show challenges to get 4 stars. Don't think I can pass it. I can't do 5 fast paced rounds and not make more than 2 mistakes.

This is not a true restaurant sim as you're the only one working in a restaurant which is insane. You can't hire staff, you can't choose prices for the food.

Lack of realism aside I enjoy the game mostly, it's very addictive despite being stressful, frustrating and fast paced I like the challenge up to a point.

6/10. doesn't get higher as the fun eventually wears off and gets too fast, stressful, no longer fun and eventually feels worse than a real job.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152704688', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 1334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1334, 'last_played': 1454129379}
review:
看谜之声直播后自己趁打折也买来玩的游戏，终于把餐厅升到5星了，来给个好评。
做饭操作感爽快，内容炒鸡丰富，音乐动听，各方面都非常不错的休闲养成类游戏，就是比较花时间。
正篇的模式，刚开始只是简单地做做菜，菜品也比较单调，随着餐厅不断地升级，除了菜品扩大丰富，餐厅客位增加，还会增加有抢劫指证事件，疯狂Dave和机器人的菜单赌博，外卖事件，铁厨大赛，做菜恋爱，VIP服务日，还有最后的饥饿节挑战，越来越有挑战性，也越来越冲击你手忙脚乱的底线。
除了正篇模式还有其他模式，这游戏内容丰富超出想象，实在是休闲生活打发时间必备良品。喜欢这类游戏的朋友不妨玩玩看，比那些个同类型的垃圾手游真是高到不知道哪里去了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198022386880', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1453873514}
review:
Go hard or go home is a work ethic I have followed for all my life, and one I continued to follow in this game. Upon starting up, I decided to challenge myself by setting out to achieve on the maximum difficulty, even though it was recommended that I did not. Without so much as glancing at any sort of instructions, I flew blind into the first level.  It was of no suprise to me that I was of course at natural at the activity of button pressing and all goals set out by the game were fulfiled with ease. A game that may pose a challenge to the lesser minded fellows out there, but it was like childs play to me. 


i lied is well hard 69/10
