author: {'steamid': '76561198058075753', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 10159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3213, 'last_played': 1706384588}
review:
Cons of this game:
- Makes you addicted so you can fail exams and shit.
- Makes you destroy your keyboard in rage (because a weirdo customer comes in the middle of rush hour and orders a fucking weirdo food, saying "Gimme everything except THAT")
- Your fingers can hurt after a 9 hour playing session.
- The lack of further cons.

--> I love the games of this guy. He is a programming genius motherfucker. His games are bug-free. He knows exactly how to keep you hooked to the game. Just make the mistake of buying this game. And then before you know it, you are depriving yourself of sleep.

--> But enough about that shit. Let's talk about the game. Because that's what matters right? That's what we're here for. We are gamers. So we game. Games are all that matter to us. Without games, we would be empty meatbags floating in space. What was I talking about?

Pros
+ Nice music, seriously. Really cool music.
+ Funny character design (credits to Sara Gross)
+ In-depth food creation and artwork (image of the food changes as you upgrade it & shit)
+ Insanely diverse recipes and prep works
+ Nice sound effects (they pull you more into the game than you may think)
+ Single player ladder to climb and sense of progression is very motivative
+ Online leaderboards if you're into that sort of thing
+ Splitscreen multiplayer (I don't even know how, didn't try it, don't have any friends)
+ I don't have any friends that play this I mean.
+ Extra challenges seperate from the main campaign
+ Endgame stuff, new game plus, good for replayability
+ The feel of greed flowing through you as you make more money, you wanna make more money. And when you make more money, you want to make more money.
+ Upgrade and improve certain aspects of your restaurant. Functional and visual.

+++ Spam e-mails are fucking hilarious. I absolutely love whoever wrote them.

The good news is, this guy is now working on Cook Serve Delicious 2. So, all the more time to play this and hunt for achievements while waiting for the sequel. Thumbs up for 'chubigans'!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000616178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 869, 'last_played': 1487923376}
review:
Sehr schönes Spiel für Zwischendrin.
Die Grundlagen des Spiels beherrscht man relativ schnell. 
Den Schwierigkeitsgrad kann man jederzeit durch die Auswahl komplizierter/weniger komplizierter Menüzusammenstellungen beeinflussen.

Für einen Dauerbrenner fehlen mir einige Simulationsaspekte, z.B. eine anpassbare Küche oder ähnliches.
Dafür lernt man ständig neue Rezepte und kann diese durch Upgrades noch durch weitere Zutaten erweitern.

Insgesamt hatte ich schon gut Spaß für mein Geld.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042140673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2017, 'last_played': 1576879007}
review:
Just finished the entire game with achievements, and despite some problems, I still recommend it.

[PROS]
- Original concept that you don't see much. Nice for working out your typing skills, multitasking skills, reading speed, and memory.
- Nice graphics for a 2D game.
- Lean and intuitive UI.
- Achievements are actually doable in a lifetime.
- Addictive.

[CONS]
- Makes you hungry.
- Your girlfriend will think you're taking cooking lessons and have more expectations.
- Balancing problems between various foods. Some complicated foods provide little reward. So why make them? Fish, for example, are quick and easy to make (even fully upgraded, they only have 2 recipe cards), attract customers and have a very rapid return-on-investment. So why make anything else?
- The game quickly becomes repetitive. You come to expect more content out of improving your restaurant other than just a skin change and customers with more patience.
- The game describes itself as hardcore but is actually very easy. Can be done completely without ever using the optional VIPs, bets and dating mechanisms.
- It feels like the New Game Plus mode was added as a last-minute afterthought. It induces even more balancing problems and the game actually becomes even easier than before. Feels very untested.

[SPECIAL NOTES ABOUT NG+]
- Because of the constant 50% positive buzz, you'll never be in trouble of lacking customers.
- You'll actually be trying to artificially decrease the number of customers by keeping the same fatty foods on your menu for a long time and putting alcohol on the menu (going against everything you learnt in the previous game mode).
- By the time you get to a 2-star restaurant and because of all the customers, you should have enough money to get through the whole game.
- After this point, you can even go through days without touching your keyboard, failing all your food orders. The only consequence will be less customers the following day, which is actually a good thing!

Finally, the game has a major design oversight: by leaving cooked foods burning on the stove / grill (for example steak, chicken or fish), you can block several / all your prep stations from receiving new customers. This allows you to make the game simpler by effectively removing a number of prep stations for the day at 0 negative buzz (I'm not an expert at cooking, but steak burnt for 13 hours should not be viewed by customers as "average"...).
In NG+, you can use this to take a 5-minute break away from your computer or laugh at 8 idiots watching their food burn for a whole day while effectively avoiding super rush hours ("extreme difficulty" achievement :-)), robberies, chores and it gives you a free pass to safety inspections! Once you've satisfied the other items on your level-up checklist, it's a quick and easy way to go through the remaining days unaffected.

review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a first impressions review, and NOT a full review, if you want a full review, then please read better reviews then mine [/h1]

Cook, Serve, Delicious!

A simple concept can make such a great game! Cook, Serve, Delicious throws you into the restaurant owning business where you have to serve customers each day from morning to evening whilst keeping an active daily menu and buzz and managing your restaurant. The game can be challenging but it is a fun game to play and I recommend that everyone gets the game, just for the fun of it!

Now hurry up with the sequel!

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]
[i] THEPCGAMER'S BEST GAME IN STEAM LIBRARY! (What's this? :- Like some games get "Best Game of 2014" or "Best Indie Game", etc... So I have decided to make my own!) [/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198063990605', 'num_games_owned': 3313, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 1846, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1789, 'last_played': 1580350321}
review:
[I]Cook, Serve, Delicious (Cozinhe, sirva, Delicioso! XD)
Um jogo que preciso dizer que me prendeu muito e por muitas horas!
um indie casual extremamente divertido e em parte desafiador conforme você avança na campanha.[/I]

Seu objetivo é gerenciar um restaurante de 0 estrelas até 5 estrelas, conforme você avança e cumpre as metas, seu restaurante vai ganhando destaque e novas portas vão se abrindo.
Desde vender pão com mortadela e queijo, até pratos chiques e caros como lagostas a molho ulala!
Conforme ganha dinheiro, você pode comprar melhorias para seu restaurante, e o principal... novos pratos, mas eae, só isso? o jogo é só isso?
nops!...

você alem de gerenciar o restaurante, você é o cozinheiro, você precisa preparar os pratos que compra exatamente como cada cliente pedir, existem varias variáveis do mesmo prato, alguns querem seu pão sem a mortadela, e outros querem 2 mortadelas e assim por diante...
Existem duas formas de fazer as comidas, com o mouse clicando sobre os ingredientes desejados, ou o meu modo favorito que é usando as HOTKEYS de cada comida, por exemplo o T de Tomate... e o S de Sebola........ [strike](to brincando gente... QQéissu XD)[/strike] E assim por diante.
Se você decora as hotkeys de cada ingrediente e decora o padrão de cada variável dos pratos, vc consegue prepara-los na velocidade da luz xD
Que no caso é algo super necessários nos níveis mais alto, a partir de 4 a 5 estrelas, você precisa ser um deus da cozinha ou só vai se dar mau.

O jogo como falei, abre varias portas para você conforme avança, algumas delas são participar de apostas com uma pessoa que envia emails para você, passar nos testes de inspeção, entrar em concursos de culinária na TV, e vencer até um ritual culinário com uns caras malucos perfeccionistas.

Anyway... Jogo muito bom, perfeito indie casual para quem quer passar o tempo e jogar algo calmo e divertido... o game também roda em praticamente 100% dos PC's existentes por ai a fora e esta valendo a pena de verdade!
[B]Super recomendado :D[/B]

[b]LET'S [strike]COCK...[/strike] OPS! NOT THAT WORD :V[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198089488110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1495170713}

author: {'steamid': '76561197979724838', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 376, 'playtime_forever': 2149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1057, 'last_played': 1694760044}
review:
Let me contain my gushing and try to do this succinctly. CSD is a restaurant "sim" in the same sense that a bag of potato chips is food. It's quick, accessible, and makes you hungry for more. The core of the gameplay is serving a steady stream of customers via barrages of QTE's as apparently the sole existing employee, in something like Cooking Mama meets Wario Ware on crack -- especially during rush hours. Then, in your downtime between days you get to buy new foods, upgrades to existing ones, bits of equipment, and cycle your active menu to keep your "buzz" level (customer traffic) high. That's as far as the sim portion goes. The old Giant Bomb quicklook with the late great Ryan Davis sums it up well: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MfXZghp5eK4 Since release, it's also gotten a slew of free new content including about a dozen new foods, controller support, local co-op and competitive modes, Iron Chef challenges, and more. The dev is pretty active and friendly with the community, and now there's even a sequel on the way.

The art is, while largely static, easy on the eyes, while the sound design complements it perfectly and really gives the game its captivating energy. The music is fitting for both the everyday activity and rush hours, and each part of an order you assemble is punctuated by various chops, whacks, slaps, and splashes. I wouldn't change a thing about it.

For as much as I love the game, though, it does get off to a frustratingly slow start. The main metric of your progress is accumulating star ratings for your restaurant, which typically require getting a handful of perfect combos, passing a few safety inspections, doing the currently available catering side events... and playing for 20 (in-game) days since your last star upgrade. You will LONG be finished the other requirements by the time this elapses, and getting to 1 and 2 stars is a bit of a drag. On the flipside, though, by the time you get to 3 stars you'll likely be wishing that span was longer, as the game starts to ramp up in challenge FAST. I would strongly recommend you be a competent touch typist if you want to play this!

All in all, highly addictive, pretty cheap, the dev's nice, and it's easily earned a spot on my favourites list.

author: {'steamid': '76561198274394257', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1469338850}
review:
谜叔那边入坑的算我一个……这游戏，金山打字王升级加强版，还需要你结合英语六级快速阅读技巧，以及一定程度的定力……（不要慌，慌了你就输了）起初卖炸鸡和烤鱼是比较简单上手的，不是学霸不要选蔬菜沙拉和披萨，最好汽水也不要选，你不信可以试试披萨六连做，你会回来找我的……
后期有个极其坑爹的菜，烤串儿……因为要求相邻两者不能重复，你得先把顾客要求看一遍，然后做排列组合……

author: {'steamid': '76561198116883651', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1297, 'last_played': 1558793019}
review:
I'll begin to say that this game is really frustrating, and that's probably one of the reasons that makes it so fun to play. 
Cook, Serve, Delicious! gives you a very good taste of what working in a capitalist society means: to satisfy the clients always 100% while also respecting the hygiene laws is not easy at all, and at the end of every day you feel a bitter, but it doesn't stop you from getting back to work the next day. I like that there are more than one play mode, i find the catering really relaxing and the battle mode super exciting. There are also really a lot of recipes, whch you can upgrade, like your restaurant, to make the game even more interesting.

I give it 10/10 burgers!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993493763', 'num_games_owned': 900, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1452375263}
review:
I'm only two to three hours in, but I feel like I don't really want to go on--it's taken this long to even get within sight of any meaningful gameplay change.

The game starts with you managing 4 prep stations (which sometimes get bogged down with chores) to prepare food. Yes over the course of the beginning of the game you acquire money to buy new foods to put on the menu, and upgrade those foods, but a lot of the content is gated behind how many stars your restaurant is--you start with zero stars, and you have to go through 20 days to even get to being a two star restaurant (in addition to a bunch of other things that you'd have to be really bad to not have done by day 20). I believe I satisfied all of the other requirements within 8-10 days (around the first hour and a half-ish), and the past ~7 days have all just been the same thing waiting to unlock the next star.

The game is neat, and I've enjoyed it, but if this is the pace the rest of the game is going to have I'm not going to be playing much longer. As of right now I'm not even sure I'm going to come back to play out the next three days. I half expect a hard requirement of 50 more to reach two stars.

If the trailer, which accurately represents the game, looks like fun to you, the game is most certainly worth a couple bucks to take a look. It seems to have a lot of other modes and whatnot that I'm not terribly interested in but might be good for a go (co-op looks possibly interesting), just be warned of the hard cap on pacing in story mode--it may make you lose interest before you fully get a chance to enjoy the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968299723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2196, 'last_played': 1473897856}
review:
I was surprised by how much I enjoyed this game. I'm also surprised by how much I LEARNED from this game. For instance: did you know that when cooking in a restaurant, you only have one single shot at ANY order to get it right? I didn't know that! I thought I could throw it away and start over! Not so! Here are a few other free lessons before you open your own restaurant.
1- Customers are impatient jerks. If you can't cook and put together a burger within 30 seconds they are OUTTA THERE.
2- Customers are also not an understanding bunch. "Just get robbed? TS, idiot, give me my burger!"
3- When you become successful and start earning some decent money, you can still never hire employees to take care of trash and dishes or serve food. Like a real restaurant! It's all you, buddy! No employees, no payroll! Screw those guys! People want to eat food prepared by the person who cleans dishes, throws out garbage, and sets rat traps, anyway, just like the pros!
4- A secret clan of ninja cooks exist. I now fear for my life.

Those are a few of the things you'll learn about cooking. I've also greatly expanded my cooking skills in real life, too. When I'm trying to prepare a potato, for instance, I'm pressing "1" over and over again but it doesn't start baking. Eventually someone feels sorry for me and puts the potato in the oven. Success.

I've had less success eating out, however, because of this game, sadly. The waiter kept asking what I want and since I was confused why I wasn't talking to the chef, I just kept looking around the place, wondering if other people were being harassed by this guy, too. Evidently he was annoying EVERYBODY because they were too shy or scared to even look at me and were eating or drinking their single item they could order. I played along and just wrote on a piece of paper that I wanted a burger with "L", "C", and "T" with a couple of "P". He pretended to be all confused and I insisted he take it to the chef. He came back about 10 minutes later with a leek, cabbage, truffles, and pubic hair burger. Success.

All in all, this is a great game worth your time. Play it as fast as you can before the ninjas test your karate baking skill.

review: I bought this game because it was on sale, my first try I thought "easy breazy" I was doing it perfectly. And then came the rush hour and I had one of the most craziest panic I've ever had in a game. THIS GAME has a nice concept! Brings a new experience of intensity. author: {'steamid': '76561198091350365', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3246, 'last_played': 1584093221}
review:
[h1] Cook,Serve,Delicious! [/h1]

[b] COOK,SERVE,DELICIOUS 2 WAS JUST ANNOUNCED!

[h1] Summary: [/h1]
Cook,Serve,Delicious! is one addicting Restaurant Management game made by Vertigo Gaming made  available through steam. It's gameplay brings out the fast keyboard gamer in you, the graphics is simple yet gorgeous that sets the mood for the gamer. While repetitive at times, the game can really be fun and enjoyable but challenging specially during rush hours. I would recommend this game to all gamers, casuals and hardcore alike. 


[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
It's core gameplay is fresh,fun,thrilling  and fast paced but maybe repetitive for some. There are plenty of things to do from the mini-mini games like cleaning toilets,doing the dishes, drawing out a robber's face to more challenging stuff like the Battle Kitchen update which brings out the same formula but makes it seem fresh with challenges (Not for the new players tho').I find playing this in a marathon like session (I played for 5 hours straight) to be fun but quite repetitive.There is a reward system for spending countless hours in-game from the cosmetic upgrades to your restaurant when you achieve star ratings. Food can also be upgraded bringing in new ingredients making you re-memorize all the things you've come to remember when spamming for the buttons to make the dish.As you progress into the game, recipes you've known and love become more difficult and challenging giving out variety and randomness. While the game may repetitive for some, I find playing this game a fun and rewarding.

[b] 9 out of 10 [/b]

[h1] Graphics [/h1]
Before you bash the graphics for being plain and simple (Compared to AAA games like Battlefield), it does it's job really extraordinarily well. The graphics are beautifully made, while not the best, I find the artstyle to be soothing to see and the art style is just WOW. I really enjoyed the background of the outside of sherrisoda, the day and night cycle and the planes passing-by is just a beautiful sight to see. The game rewards you with a star system. The star system gives your restaurant a new look each time. 0 Stars, you would expect to see that the restaurant is in a bad condition, progressing through the game, you can see an improvement in the atmostphere and appearance of your restaurant giving out a new vibe from arriving redneck truck drivers to your VIPs, Rich and Famous. I really like the game's graphics and atmosphere.

[b] 10 out of 10 [/b]

[h1] Soundtrack [/h1]
Just WOW! The game's soundtrack is beautifully made by Jonathan Geer. The soundtrack blends well with the game's atmosphere and ambiance providing you with a classy and jazz feel to your gameplay. The music is masterfully made to suit the game and for all it's worth a must buy as well (Can be purchased as DLC)

[b]10 out of 10 [/b]

A really fun well made game from the guys at Vertigo.

[b] Think of it as [i] cooking mama [i] meets [i] guitar hero [i] [b]

[b]9.5 out of 10[b] A must buy even if the game is not on sale!

author: {'steamid': '76561198099511538', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 583, 'last_played': 1527874890}
review:
단순하다면 단순하고 복잡하다면 복잡한 식당 경영 시뮬레이터.
메뉴를 여러가지 중에서 구입하고 고를 수 있는데 각 음식마다 특성이 있어서 어느정도 생각하면서 메뉴를 정해아한다.
기본적으로 키 배열이 엄청나게 흩어져있는데 음식 메뉴마다 키 할당을 할 수 있는 게 맘에 듬.
근데 아무래도 조금 반복적인 게임이라 한 번에 몇 시간씩 하기보다는 생각날 때 30분~1시간씩 하면 재밌게 오래 할 수 있을듯.

컨트롤러도 지원하는데 굳이 키보드 놔두고 컨트롤러로 할 정도까지는...

author: {'steamid': '76561198041107842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1621922408}
review:
(Important note before the review: if you can't type fast/don't really know your keyboard well, don't buy this game.)

Pros:
+Good ambiance (day/night cycles, weather, sounds)
+Varied recipes
+Fun little events that can happen during your shifts
+Gives an actual feeling of accomplishment after each days
+Multiple upgrades for your menu and kitchen

Cons:
-Can get a bit tedious and stressful at times
-You have to have a bit of time free to fully enjoy a session of the game
-Multiplayer is local only (learned it the hard way)
-Gets repetitive

I pretty much bought this game when I was hungry so my hopes weren't too high up but I was satisfied with my choice. The game puts you in charge of a restaurant located inside a very busy office building where you need to serve hungry workers. From the get-go the game slowly guides you through the basics without taking it too slow which is quite nice. I actually felt accomplished after a full day of "work" due to the good length of the them and the challenges that you face. Rush hours make you actually feel stressed due to the sheer ammount of customers that walk inside and hearing the bell signaling the end of rush hour is so satisfying. 

With that said, the game can get a bit frustating when you cook certain items because they either take too long or require a lot of attention, making you distracted from your other dishes. Also, the cleaning part of the game sometimes makes no sense since it tells you that you have a sink full of dishes when you just emptied it a couple of plates ago.

All and all, pretty good game, fair price and good simulator.

review:
Kitchen hell.

Don't go in thinking this is a game like Cooking Mama.

CSD is almost as hard as real kitchen work.

Thank god a day takes only a few minutes, because of the sheer concentration needed.

A very, very good game that will make you use your wits, your memory, your reflexes and your best customer smile.

Caution : It's really hard at high levels. I mean it.

review: This game gives me such a nostalgia rush. My multi-tasking skills have gotten pretty good thanks to this :> Gameplay wise it's still pretty much the same, although I haven't unlocked alot of the things so I should probably not speak too soon. More upgrades though! Those always make me happy. Keep up the great work guys! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197971254499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1521, 'last_played': 1505132702}
review:
[h1]曾玩到廢寢忘食+肚子餓，不推不行。[/h1]

遊戲模式很多，從生涯模式到合作、對戰及挑戰模式都有，而生涯模式就夠玩好一陣子了，看著自己從默默無名的小咖啡館一路升到五星級高檔餐廳；從廉價垃圾食物如含糖飲料、熱狗、炸薯條賣到紅酒、牛排、龍蝦等高級食材，玩起來超有成就感！

你是餐廳內唯一的員工，店裡的所有大小工作如招呼客人、煮菜、上菜、洗碗、倒垃圾、抓老鼠、通馬桶甚至是抓搶匪…等等都只能靠你一個人完成，每道菜有不同的料理方式如煎、煮、炸、烤等，並且有多變的食材排列組合以及先後處理順序，必須牢記個別的熱鍵及注意事項，才能快速、準確的上菜。

遊戲中BUZZ值是最重要的，BUZZ值越高表示你的餐廳越受歡迎=客人流量越高=一天可以賺越多錢=越容易失誤惹怒客人反而使隔天BUZZ降低。所以量力而為很重要，畢竟尖峰時段是很可怕的，如果自己菜單上又都選最複雜難做的料理，很容易忙到崩潰。另外也要注意如果菜單一成不變、垃圾食物太多等等都會影響到BUZZ值。
與一般模擬經營類遊戲不同，玩家無法、也不需要佈置餐廳，準備工作只需要擬好每日的菜單，搭配出自己最擅長、最有利潤的組合就好，賺到的錢再拿去購買一些能使客人更有耐心等候、自己工作更快速的設備。

而用鍵盤跟搖桿完的感受截然不同，鍵盤偏向英打練習，需要熟記食材名稱對應的字母，所以有些英文基礎能力遊玩會更順利；搖桿靠的則是記憶力(對應的按鍵與方向)跟手速。

總而言之是一款非常棒的小品，輕鬆明亮的遊戲氛圍，玩起來心情會很好，遊戲中的許多料理看起來非常美味，小心玩到肚子餓喔 :D 強力推薦給想挑戰自己的抗壓性和多工處理能力，以及喜歡美食、對料理有興趣的玩家。

PS: 二代已經推出囉~不只料理種類變得更多樣，還多了場景編輯器，可以佈置自己的夢想餐廳，最佛心的是作者仍在不斷推出更新，使遊戲內容越來越豐富，強力推薦！

商店連結：
http://store.steampowered.com/app/386620/Cook_Serve_Delicious_2/

author: {'steamid': '76561198144036674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1647310092}

author: {'steamid': '76561198177882305', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1118, 'last_played': 1591453641}
review:
Was mehr so scheint, wie ein standartmäßiges Management-Zubereitungsspiel, wie man es so von Browsergames kennt entpuppt sich als umfangreiches Konzentrationsspiel, in dem es hauptsächlich darum geht schnelle Tastenabfolgen zu drücken und diese dann routiniert einzuprägen. Das klingt vielleicht stumpf, macht aber sehr viel Spaß!
Schnelle Finger sind hier gefragt. Wer denkt, hier werden die Gerichte Schritt für Schritt richtig zubereitet wird mit diesem Spiel enttäuscht sein.
Das Spiel warnt einen schon zu Beginn, dass es wohl für den ein oder anderen Spieler schwirig sein wird überhaupt zurechtzukommen, dass es aber sicherlich mit der Zeit besser wird. Und genauso ist es auch. Es ist am Anfang mühselig und macht sehr viel mehr Spaß je weiter man kommt. 

PRO: 
- chillige musikalische Untermalung
- volle und gelungene XBOX 360 Controller Unterstützung
- es gibt sogar einen lokalen KOOP Modus (für 2 Spieler) -> aber ausprobiert habe ich den bis jetzt noch nicht
- Unterschiedliche Modi, Zusatzaufgaben, Challlenges, Wettmöglichkeiten, spezielle Karten, die gesammelt werden können um weitere Modi freizuschalten, viele Gerichte, Upgrades --> kurzum: das Spiel bietet sicherlich tagelange Unterhaltung
- ein Spiel für Zwischendurch, aber auch um stundenlang am Stpück zu Spielen 
- ich mag den Humor (: Man bekommt beispielsweise ständig (what the heck-) Spammails und muss sich ein Upgrade kaufen, damit der Mailordner diese rausfiltert (:
- ich weiß nicht, ob das Spiel 10 Euro wert ist - aber mit den 2 €, die ich dafür investiert habe fühle ich mich fast schon ein bisschen mies (:

CONS:
- bereits die ersten Level sind sehr schwer
- die Gäste sehen aus wie zusammengeprügelt
- immer die selbe Ansicht, bis auf den Hintergrund, der nützlicherweise zur Tageszeit variiert, keine eigene Gestaltung des Restaurants möglich

author: {'steamid': '76561198037881716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 8674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1640583559}
review:
Satisfies my desire for a task-oriented game like the Papa's Pizzeria series, but without the obnoxious "food placement" aspects. When preparing orders, this game focuses on button or click based preparation rather than asking you to spread or place ingredients in a certain manner. Those familiar with the Pizzeria series games would know what I mean. It allows you to build up speed and accuracy faster without worrying about how evenly you distributed the chocolate sauce.

More customizability as well, like buying equipment and menu items which you have some control over once unlocked. I don't play a ton of simulation/management style games so I can't give a great breakdown in that regard, but as an occasional sim player, I've enjoyed this so far and plan to play more. I don't think I would have paid $10 for it, that's why it went on my wishlist until this sale, but for a buck or two you can't complain.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998123612', 'num_games_owned': 364, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3502, 'last_played': 1448146198}
review:
This game is for people who really enjoy repetitive/relaxing sim games. You'll be able to tell right off the bat from the gameplay video if you're going to like this or not. People either really like these types of games or they don't.

I think where this game really wins, aside from the game as a package overall (really polished, they've added new content and modes over the years, everything is "just right" when it comes to this game) is how well progressed the difficulty is as you play. You won't be making the online leaderboards as soon as you get this game, but damn, you'll be really surprised at how good you get at this game after ~10 hours. And if you like these kinds of games, you will play more than 10 hours. In one day. In one sitting.

It has just the right amount of customizability in terms of your controls & menu. The game really makes you want to play it and get really good at it, if that makes sense. And just when you think you're really good, you play the super hard mode and realize how hard this game can get.

This isn't a restaurant building sim if you're looking for that. You're not going to get to pick which chairs are in your restaurant and if you want to open a new franchise and hire workers. This is a game for people who enjoy the action of these simulation games rather than the management portion. And I LOVE IT.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076496622', 'num_games_owned': 87, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1478228661}

author: {'steamid': '76561198067891330', 'num_games_owned': 8170, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 887, 'last_played': 1450895353}
review:
[h1]Summary:[/h1]
Cook, Serve, Delicious is probably the best cooking management game with huge sorts of minigames for each meal that you can prepare. There is plenty of things to do (especially with Battle Kitchen expansion) but it still might feel too much repetitive for some people - this game is served best for about half an hour per session, not more.

[h1]Positives:[/h1]
- [b]Well-made restaurant management[/b]. It is not hard to get into the management part of the game for a new player, even though you can see plenty of options there. 
- [b]Many cooking minigames[/b]. Coming with great live cooking management of (up to) 8 meals together. It can be stressful but this stress is coming with fun!
- [b]Great keyboard controls[/b]. You can control everything with hotkeys, and that will make you faster. This is huge positive surprise this game offers, don't expect poor smartphone-ported mouse controls! ([i]For example, instead of many slow clicks, you can just remember PSMCR PSVCR PSCR for people's most favourite lasagna! :D[/i] )
- [b]Challenges[/b]. Have you finished the main part of the game? Come on, here you go, beat all those cooking challenges! 
- [b]Local co-op[/b]. Yes, you can manage a restaurant with your friends!


[h1]Neutrals:[/h1]
- [b]Battle Kitchen expansion is not for new players[/b]. You get thrown all top-level upgraded meals to you to make. Don't expect to enjoy this part of the game soon (and you might not even get there, more in negatives). Still, whole battle kitchen was added for free to CSD, so we can't critize its focus on experienced CSD gamers.
- You have to switch most of your meal offers every day for getting more customers. This is not a bad thing but it's worth noticing that the game will motivate you into trying all meals available. (Don't expect playing in style where you can just create same easy meals over and over. You'd even get really bored soon.)

[h1]Negatives:[/h1]
- [b]Might get really repetitive for you.[/b] If you just sit and play it for hours in one session, you notice that you are just doing still the same over and over. You must think of CSD as about a casual game with a bit of "fun stress" that will offer you many hours of playtime splitted into months of your life.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983063839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1435634684}
review: I'd rather have bought a pack of gum than this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049159669', 'num_games_owned': 1779, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 845, 'last_played': 1439448298}
review:
年中無休で朝から晩まで休憩なしでワンオペだけど店長なんだからしょうがないよね！

そんなカンジでひたすら客の注文をさばき続けるゲーム
１０分弱で一日が終わって、その日の稼ぎでメニューとか設備をアップグレードして、みたいな経営シミュっぽい側面もあるぞ！

料理は動作一つが１キー（ゲームパッドの場合はボタンだけだと足りないので十字キーにまで動作が割り振られる）になっていて、たとえばAボタン押したらサラダにドレッシングかける、みたいな
しかも大抵の動作は取り返しが付かない（かけたケチャップ戻せって言われても無理ですよね）のでランチタイムにスープとかケバブのめんどくさい注文出されると発狂しそうになってたのしい！

あとローカルで二人羽織プレイとかオンラインランキングとかもあるので見た目より楽しめるんじゃないかと思います
飲食店で働いている方にはおすすめできないかもしれません

author: {'steamid': '76561198019490354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4440, 'last_played': 1472430026}
review: I bought this game on a whim during the summer sale for .99, thinking that I would get a couple of hours of gameplay out of it. Wow did I underestimate! I have over 75 hours in and it STILL has some gameplay left! I am a big fan of time management and cooking games, but this takes it to another level where it feels less casual and more exciting. Although I got it on sale, if I had bought this game at full price I would still feel like I got one helluva deal!

author: {'steamid': '76561198068465411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1470, 'last_played': 1603633333}
review:
This game seems on the surface to be a casual cooking/managment game that you often find on free online games websites. This is a cooking game, and a management game, but it is quite debateable whether or not it is 'casual', although I am not saying all casual games are bad, as I have played some good ones, but it does seem to not have as many fatures as a casual game, as cooking and casual aren't always the same thing.

The reason I say this isn't a casual game, is because when you think of casual games, you would normally think of a relaxing and easy-to-play game, something where you don't need to think. This game is far from relaxing, it is a great simulation of having a panic attack. There is no easy mode, only normal and extreme, and even normal mode can seem quite impossible. Juggling all these different foods, while at the same time having to do chores, such as flush the toilet, because we all know that's a chef's job.

The gameplay in this is not only intense, but it is also centred around typing. It would be easy if it was simply typing out words, such as what the food/recipe was, but no, you have to prapere the food, and each ingrediant/action is one letter, meaning you will end up muttering to yourself while you type a ridiculous combo of letters and numbers. 

PSCR PSCR PSCR

Once you get use to one combonation of letters for a certain meal, you will then, upgrade it as you go, and struggle to learn even more keys. As well as prapering foods for consumtion, you need to amke sure they don't burn, that you don't accidentally press 4 when you meant to press 5 and serve the food undercooked.

There is so much more to be said about this game: the graphics, the music, the humour and references, the progression, the events, etc. But all that needs to be said for it, is that you should buy it and play it, as it is quite worth it's money, and is a very enjoyable game, with a very high replay value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048287429', 'num_games_owned': 265, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 6191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4916, 'last_played': 1486701264}
review:
I adore this game!  It's often the last thing I do before bed and the first thing I start after breakfast.  I've played a lot of cooking and restaurant games, and this is the best by far.

As Starcraft players already know, using the keyboard instead of the mouse makes a huge difference in playing speed.  It's a lot of fun to memorize the sequences of preparation and see how fast you can go.  Unfortunatley, in a relatively short period of time,  I've run out of new food types to purchase.  Hope there are expansion plans in the future...

author: {'steamid': '76561198057948081', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 1697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 700, 'last_played': 1472933215}
review:
I can't believe how addicting and fun this game turned to be. Totally caught me by surprise.

The game could definitely benefit from more top-level strategy - managing and upgrading your restaurant is very simple. But as far as preparing the recipes and serving customers, the gameplay is a blast.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074304878', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1104, 'last_played': 1645496513}
review:
Les jeux de cuisine sont mon plaisir coupable. Je me souviens avoir passé quelques heures à jouer en ligne à des jeux de ce style, mais j'étais toujours contrainte d'arrête après quelques niveaux puisqu'il fallait payer pour la suite (à 13 ans, je n'étais pas près d'avoir ma proche carte de crédit).

Grâce à Cook, Serve, Delicious, l'adulte en moi a pu réaliser ce "fantasme" de jeunesse d'enfin jouer à un jeu de cuisine complet. Et ce fut bon. Allez, vous aussi, faites-vous plaisir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119465030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1302, 'last_played': 1674591039}
review:
This is probably the most manic game I've ever played. When rush hour hits and you have six meat lasagnes to make your hands FLY. I have PSMCRPSMCRPSCR programmed in my muscle memory forever. After it's over, you know you have another one coming but it still somehow sneaks up on you. 

The first playthrough, I was a bit annoyed by the various cooking challenges and celebrity visitors where I had to make food other than my usual menu. Looking back on it a year or two later though, the replay value lies in the recipes I haven't learned yet and the yearn for a game I can throw the whole of my attention and fine motor skills into. I'm going to reinstall it to learn the art of soups and burgers and sushi (though you'll always find a lasagna and bottle of wine at my restaurant). 

It's a cooking and restaurant management simulation done well. I really like the fact it's based completely around the keyboard, though the mouse is always an option. If only Type To Learn was this fun. And I LOVE that it's a cooking game where I don't have to trace finaky lines across a chicken breast where if I'm one pixel off I'm bumped down to silver. The daily menu design, bad food pairings, and the fact that foods can go stale after a couple days, keeps you on your toes and prevents you from beating the game by spamming the same six recipes. Even expertise can get a bit boring after a while, and the panic of trying to navigate a new recipe in the midst of rush hour is always a fun challenge. It got grind-y at the end because I wasn't really into the cooking challenges, but I think playing it again I'll enjoy it more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122434262', 'num_games_owned': 392, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1430104263}

review: Highly recommend this game if you like fast-paced button mashers. It's incredibly addictive. I just completed all of the achievements and I think it might be time for me to stop playing (but I don't want to!). Like with Tetris, you'll  be seeing orders in your dreams. It isn't exactly a serious game, but I had a lot of fun playing. It took 37 hours to get all the achievements. Worth picking up on a steam sale. I can't wait for Cook Serve Delicious 2!

author: {'steamid': '76561198145907051', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1416, 'last_played': 1519455980}
review: Excellent game. Fun and silly, yet so challenging. I originally got this game hoping it be a fun upgrade to those diner games I played when I was little, but this is so much more. It quickly goes from mellow and friendly to intense. Don't underestimate it. I can't wait for the second one. (Also, you can play with controllers, but a keyboard will make it so much easier. Trust me.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198032450064', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 990, 'last_played': 1451964961}
review: This game is extremely anxiety provoking. However,  it's also very addictive. I like how it's a combination of buttons, memorization, and managing what tasks to do first. You're the only one working in this restaurant so you have to serve the customers, as well as perform chores such as throw out the trash and wash the dishes. It has controller support and changes the buttons depending on what controller you're using, but I think the best way to play would be on the keyboard because the buttons make a little more sense since there are more button options (i.e. press B for bacon). Would definitely recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143484612', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1471116746}

author: {'steamid': '76561197969795994', 'num_games_owned': 351, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1450955456}

author: {'steamid': '76561198040812398', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 3762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3280, 'last_played': 1475466234}
review:
I used to work in food service, and the first time I saw this, I thought "oh, no. Nonononononononono. It's too real."

I'm big enough to admit that I was wrong.

For some reason, there's a gigantic, addictive appeal in striving toward that perfect day. You can set the difficulty yourself by choosing a menu full of foods you find easy, or those that make you put your fingers in tiny casts after you've set your computer on fire and then thrown it out the window. And there is something so completely gratifying about committing every different dish to muscle memory; to watching that perfect combo number keep churning upward; to know that even at 179% buzz, you have perfected every order, done every chore, and laughed in the face of that inspector while doing it. You wouldn't think that a cooking sim would give you a rush, but oh god does it.

Is it time for CSD2 yet?

author: {'steamid': '76561198003338439', 'num_games_owned': 1230, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 1469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 761, 'last_played': 1665870156}

author: {'steamid': '76561197991288710', 'num_games_owned': 2410, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 881, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1580682635}

author: {'steamid': '76561198162073361', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1000, 'last_played': 1450312021}
review: It's hard to say what it is about this game. It's essentiaslly a clickfest for Jedi's. There's a thread of humour that runs through it that elevates it from a good timekiller to a great game. It's nicely structured as you progress from the initial run-down coffee house to the full on engine room of a classy joint. Some of the later challenges you can take to boost income are absolutely nuts, but by then you want them so bad you don't care. The 'urban' art style works really well and adds a bit of immersion but to be honest you won't really notice once you've got nacho's on the menu...

author: {'steamid': '76561198092524347', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1953, 'last_played': 1500973171}
review:
A highly addictive (albeit repetative) game, and enjoyable--except maybe when you're freaking out in the challenges/events, or when you've got 8 orders in the campaign of lasagna and burgers. But no matter how stressed I get; I find myself coming back to this game over and over again.

If I had to fault it for anything it would be that there isn't enough 'equipment' you can buy to help with customers patience. Especially when you get loads of orders coming in for things like: Lasagna, burgers and pasta (the soup is something I try to avoid altogether because I just never get a perfect day with it).

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198202524232', 'num_games_owned': 2863, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 2716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2665, 'last_played': 1674185623}
review: A very fast paced and challenging game, the game feels like the perfect mix of the speedy pace of Diner Dash, yet has the complexity and interactivity (i.e. what meals to serve to customers, what upgrades to get etc..) of a game like Order Up or Cooking Mama, the game is a very fun game and DEFINATELY a game that should be picked up if you want a fun and in-depth restraunt game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025106556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1467569830}
review: Basically "Papers, Please" but with cooking. Seems to be "just QTEs" on the surface, but it's actually surprisingly difficult with a ton of depth. Loads of fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960527255', 'num_games_owned': 1064, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1512756849}
review:
At its core, this game is the newest, best version of Mavis Beacon Teaches Typing. In fact, if nothing else, this game will teach you where keys on your keyboard are. It's fun, it's something of a learning device, and it could actually make its way into classrooms as a typing program if the teacher/school board is cool enough. Don't let that sound like this game isn't fun because it is. It's a lot more fun than I was expecting (more aggravating at times too), but it really is surprisingly engaging. 

Now, is this a game I'll play a week or a month from now? Maybe not, but I still feel like it's worth recommending. I think it's a great little "play when you're bored" type game, although maybe not something people play obsessively (I've play Half-Life pretty obsessively. If steam had record of ALL the time I've spent on that game you'd understand). essentially, it's more entertaining than those "clicking games" out there now.

Anyways, if you're really unsure, wait until CSD is on sale, but if you want a good game to occupy your time for a few days, it's still definitely worth full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040767196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2084, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1067, 'last_played': 1511491350}
review:
Absolutely addicting.
When I first started playing this game, I would wait impatiently to finish my job as a food service worker so I could come home and play a game about being a food service worker.
Play on extreme difficulty if you enjoy dying and being in hell. I sure do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198255655149', 'num_games_owned': 47, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1468776229}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998340531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1451426347}
review:
I've played a lot of cooking mama. This is not cooking mama and she is not here to make it all better. This is stressful. You not only cook the damn food for these impatient bastards but you are also in charge of flushing toilets for them, setting rodent traps, washing dishes... etc...

There are reasons I never wanted to work in the food industry. Thank god I can do it in a video game.

It's pretty fantastic, especially if you like muscle memory games and reflex based gameplay. I can already tell that I'll become quickly addicted, especially with weekly challenge mode. Definitely give this game a try. My impression at first glance was that it's a casual game, but looking deeper it's going to be brutal.

review:
A fastest-finger game all 'bout that restaurant life. A management element allows you to maintain your menu and equipment while you spend your days frantically slamming food together into what the public deems an acceptable meal.

Also, your restaurant never serves kebabs because $#@%! those things. They're not worth the time and heartache trying to get them right.

10/10 would relive my teen years again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117766603', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1446782484}

author: {'steamid': '76561198002466305', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 527, 'last_played': 1487314766}
review:
Probably the best restaraunt management sim we'll ever see in our lifetime. You're responsible for taking orders, preparing meals, and serving it to the customers. On top of that, you've got all the basic chores (washing dishes, taking out trash, dealing with pests), and it has a reasonable simulation of time to approximate what it'd feel like to deal with rush hours during lunch / dinner / etc. Inspectors can come and ruin your day if you try to skimp on chores in order to keep your customers happy.

You get to decide what equipment to buy, what dishes to prepare, and what extras to go with all of that. The kicker here is that customers want and expect you to routinely bring in new meals to suit their tastes. Preparing dishes requires you to press an ever increasing sequence of buttons in order to make them, in addition to paying attention to various prep timers involved. You can't just master a small handful of dishes, you've got to keep learning how to make new stuff in order to keep your customers happy.

Probably one of the most stressful, and well executed sims out there. Nice balance of active play and strategic decision making.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072579735', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1610482368}

author: {'steamid': '76561198056137846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 674, 'last_played': 1524165144}

author: {'steamid': '76561198072335109', 'num_games_owned': 1402, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1527451935}
review:
На фоне конкурентов, эта игра определенно выделяется, а именно тем что мы делаем ВСЕ в нашем кафе/ресторане: готовить всю жратву (которой очень уж не мало), выбрасывать мусор, мыть посуду, вина налить и т.д.Нам говорят что мы в ресторане и профессиональный шеф-повар, а складывается ощущение что мы в какой то ультра-шаурмичной и делаем просто все подряд. 

Эта игра действительно “бросает вам вызов”, потому что микрить придется аки чемпион старкрафта пытаясь везде успеть во время.В игре нам могут прийти (заскриптованные разумеется) письма по игровому email где будут так же challenge от других поваров, информация о проверках санэпидемстанций, спам, возможность заказать новые вещи из интернет магазина и прочие интересные ништяки. 

Каждый день мы выбираем меню для нашего следующего дня, ориентироваться только на дороговизну не получиться у продуктов очень много факторов которые надо учитывать, точно так же как и у проваленных/выполненных задач.Можно так же соревноваться с другими игроками. В целом игра очень сложная и вместе с тем фановая.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061926078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1344, 'last_played': 1636249645}
review:
Det är ett kul spel, men du måste kunna ditt tangentbord.
Ifall du inte kan ditt tangentbord kan du alltid använda musen, men det blir väldigt svårt och i senare nivåer så blir det nästan omöjligt med bara musen.

Men jag gillar det väldigt mycket :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197967419832', 'num_games_owned': 1360, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 1831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1676535339}
review:
An incredibly fun game that I clocked more hours into due to losing internet for a few months(steam won't track hours this way), and the DRM free version I had before buying the Steam Version.

Basically, you run a restaurant and serve food day by day. You can buy various food and drinks, each can be upgraded to not only sell for more money, but get more ingredients so you can do more recipes. Each food/drink(which I'll be calling 'menu items' from now on) has a practice area where you can make that menu item over and over, and you can even select the various recipes available to you. This is perfect for those difficult menu items so you can practice them.

As for the actual restaurant mechanic, you start the day at 9am and end at 10pm. The game moves at an accelerated time frame, so the entire in-game day takes about 10-15 minutes irl, though I've never actually timed it myself. Various customers will come in and order something off the menu items you choose for the day. Up to 4(in the beginning) orders can be placed at once, so you'll need to pick up the speed if you fall behind. 

For the actual cooking, if something requires some preparation, like a burger or pizza, then you do so. Using the Burger for example, the customer orders a BLT with 3 patties. First you slap the 3 patties on the grill and press enter, they'll start cooking and you'll be free to continue/prep other orders. When the patties are done, you can continue it. You'll start by slamming the patties on the burger with the "M"(for meat) button, then the "B", "L", "T" buttons to put on the Bacon, Lettuce, and Cheese respectively. Then press enter and your done.  For something like the pizza, where Prep is basically putting on the Customers ingredients and tossing it in the oven, you just have to wait for it to finish cooking and then bam, you're done.

The Pizza and Burger are some of the easier menu items, the rest, like the Lasagna and Soup, can become quite difficult, though they're worth more in proportion.

There are also chores like dish washing, mouse trap setting up, and garbage throwing that needs to be done during the work day. They can be difficult when they happen during peak hours(way more customers). Some menu items increase the amount of some chores, so look into the various menu items to see if they have the negative if you really don't like them.

There are a list of goals you can accomplish to proceed in the 'story' and upgrade you resturant. Stuff like serve X amount of customers or buy X amount of menu items. Also pass a few safety inspections, where an inspector stands around and you cant fail too many chores.

Along with buying food you can buy upgrades that reduce chores, increase waiting time of customers, etc.

This game is definitely worth the price and comes by it's 'Overwhelmingly Positive" rating honestly. Also, there's a 'Cook, Serve, Delicious! 2' in the works, though it's still quite a ways off and looks promising. That shouldn't stop you from purchasing this game at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071641592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1495, 'last_played': 1588393647}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998785170', 'num_games_owned': 1759, 'num_reviews': 247, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1441740782}
review: Lots of fun in small doses, but too much of the same/too much grinding to level up and unlock everything to beat the entire game. Surprisingly polished with a pretty decent amount of twitchy challenge and some depth from what initially looked like a silly casual game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058273674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 9756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6881, 'last_played': 1508566419}
review:
Casual games in general: You play sometimes and you play 10 minutes or half an hour. You just relax.

Cook, Serve, Delicious: Almost everyday, for multiple hours and at the end of the day you might feel even more exhausted than before playing. And you will love it. When playing the first time you might become frustrated and overchallanged due to the almost-every-key-in use-gameplay, but once you managed to cope, unity with delicious burgers, fried rice, shish kebob, ice cream, pizza, lasagne, etc. will be reached.

One final advice: Never play hungry. Trust me. Never.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045820895', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1702232064}
review: I work in a restaurant in real life and I can confirm that this game is a 100% accurate representation of what needs to go on for things to run smoothly. xD In all seriousness though, this game is really fun. The music and art style are both very memorable and the gameplay is challenging and enjoyable. What could be considered the "campaign mode" is full of a fun storyline, loveable humor and consistent progression of both content and difficulty. This game is very worth picking up if you have a few bucks to spare! Get cooking!

author: {'steamid': '76561197978189276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1148, 'last_played': 1522102279}

author: {'steamid': '76561198053664528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 842, 'last_played': 1665971301}
review: The Dark Souls of kitchen sims.

author: {'steamid': '76561198184471918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1442578580}
review: I broke my keyboard playing this game. Make your own macros and shortcuts for recipes and play. Can safely say I cannot play this for longer than three restaurant days because my brain stresses out... Fun for a brain teaser and faced paced as hell!

review: i work as a line cook IRL and i've found this to be the best simulator for actual busy restaurant cooking. I get my ass kicked at work and you get your ass kicked in game. Its fun in a masochistic sort of way. I have two stars at the moment, and actually play before I go into work to my timers going in my mind, i swear it helps me be a better cook IRL.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044983093', 'num_games_owned': 2349, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 2352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1486, 'last_played': 1448612169}
review:
I like playing it in short bursts, around 15 minutes per day. Any more than that and I get tired / bored.

But those 15 minutes per day are a lot of fun. I enjoy using the keyboard to quickly and efficiently put together the various food items, and I like that each item has its own quirks and method of preparation.

The gameplay is mainly this sort of frantic mix of speed and accuracy. The management side of the game is secondary, I think, but also well developed with enough room for you to decide your own menu and upgrades.

The game is playable with mouse or keyboard or controller or even touchscreen, but I highly recommend playing it with a keyboard - nothing else will give you the same edge as keyboard shortcuts.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977196230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 7029, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6455, 'last_played': 1582047645}

author: {'steamid': '76561198042237959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 241, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1446288135}
review: I want to like this - brings back memories of Diner Dash and Food Prep Flash Games. But the achievements and even upgrade list is daunting only in that you're doing the same tasks over and over to grind out yet another type of base + seasoning + sauce. The only thing that makes this game enjoyable is that rush and anxiety of serving multiple customers at once in a tight time frame. Once you know the key orders, it becomes a chore to play.. you are playing a food preparation game afterall, but the progression is too slow and increments too small. Gets boring real quick. Get it on a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033231827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1456056848}
review:
CAN'T STOP THE COOKING !

Gets super intensive quickly, great time killer and will challenge your eye/hand coordination.

Not enough food variety but since you can upgrade them, it adds a new layer of difficulty.

The Iron Cook Challenges are that, challenges, super hard, super unforgiving. You will need to train for a bit before you will start mastering some recipes and start actually making enough money for your own restaurant to raise with the stars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105677001', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 778, 'last_played': 1460915577}
review:
I remember as a preteen browsing flash game websites, ocasionally playing some restuarant simulator flash games. Customers come in, you take their order, and then you just slap together what they wanted with whatever the game gave you(Pizza, burgers, icre cream, whatever). This game is if somebody took those old flash games and notched everything up to 11. 

"Cook, Serve, Delicous!" has a ridiculous amount of customization and choices to run your restuarant. The game is split up into individual days, and on each day you can set up to 6 menu items to serve to your customers. The foods in the game range from all sorts, from the typical pizza and burgers, to breakfast foods, to steaks and wine, to even more fanciful foods like sushi and lobsters.  

But it doesn't stop there then you need to consider each upside and downside of the foods, which affect how many customers you get in a day, then there's daily chores to go along with serving your customers, then you can upgrade your foods to increase preparation options and recipes, upgrades to equipment, occasional safety inspections that decrease the time alloted for chores, catering and cooking events, and more and more and more and more! 

And this isn't even going into the Battle Kitchen option that gives even more challenges! 

Also, everything in this game is made satisfying with well made sound effects as you slap on ingredients or hearing the sound of a well poured beer. The controls are very tight and well suited for each individual meal you prepare.

 The mmusic however is one of the weaker points. It's well made music, but there's not many tracks in the game, you'll often hear repeats of tracks on each day, they're not very memorable either, but at worst they serve as suitable background music. 

And like I said earlier there are multiple recipes for each dish, so at times I can  take an order for "Pizza", but I don't know if they want a regular old cheese pizza, or if they want a Deluxe full vegetable pizza with ham, bacon, sausage, pepperoni,  AND pineapple. Which makes it tricky at times to juggle your tasks without dissapointing a customer or missing any chores. 

Overall very addicting, and very satisfying to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198183065610', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 448, 'last_played': 1446046321}
review: I first got this game for my iPad.  I bought the Steam version of the game on the cheap during the Summer sale.  Then it just sat in the cold and last weekend I felt the urge to play the game on this platform and I must say, this is a better game on Steam than on the Apple device.  The control makes more sense (I'm using the xbox controller) and what a workout each round is.  I felt an immense sense of achievement each time I finish my day despite burning my food and not serving the drinks.  I have fallen insanely in love with this game again, in fact this time, I fell harder.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054593713', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2591, 'last_played': 1688856851}
review:
When I bought CSD, I didn't know what I was getting into, it was actually on sale for like, %90 and I bought it as a sidekick small time waster along with Dead Space 2 and Burnout Paradise. The game turned out so good that I played it 47 hours, FORTY FUCKING SEVEN hours and to be honest it gave me more panic than the ultimate Dead Space 2 and I needed to be faster than in Burnout Paradise.

On an average day your panic level is high enough but on a rush hour god dammit... 

If you know a game that puts your reflexes and hand-eye coordination to the limits of humanity, shut the fuck up you haven't played this yet. 

10/10 would get migraines all over again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980636387', 'num_games_owned': 1128, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1938, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 746, 'last_played': 1569950875}
review:
I greatly appreciate this game.

As odd as it sounds, this game gives me the same rush that rockband/guitar hero gives.

Each task and order is simple individually. But when the game throws multiple orders and tasks at you with each on on a time limit, it becomes hectic and you need to enter a sort of "zone" to perfect all the orders coming in. So hectic, you will occasionally get a information overload and freeze up if you're not carful.

It's this "information overload" or "enter the zone" knife edge battle that makes this game (and rockband/guitar hero) so enjoyable during the rush moments.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964099717', 'num_games_owned': 513, 'num_reviews': 287, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1618593927}

Absolutely stunned!

While the Star Wars Battlefront beta started today, I actually uninstalled it after 3 hours of gameplay. Haven't yet played that long for Cook, Serve, Delicous! - but this has me actually HOOKED compared to that ...minimal budget Star Wars game!

TL;DR: Brain-hand-coordination clusterfuck awesomeness!

author: {'steamid': '76561198095445670', 'num_games_owned': 142, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 938, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1503816841}
review:
I love food-management games. I'm addicted to them. It's a problem.
And I can say, hands down, that this game is the absolute best of them all.
The first version I played of this game was actually the mobile version for Android, and I immediately got hooked. I hesitated buying the PC version as well at first because I thought it wouldn't be as fun. In the mobile version you prepare all the food with finger motions, so using the keyboard just seemed like it would be boring.
Boy was I wrong. I still play both versions regularly and enjoy both equally.

Cons: Honestly, I can't think of any. I have had zero issues with glitches so far and even after months of gameplay (that's including the Android version if you're frowning at my logged hours), I haven't even come close to being bored.

Pros:
* You set the difficulty level: Each day you can change up your menu you to make it as easy or as difficult as you like.
* There's a story line that doesn't get in the way: Your goal is to get a five star restaurant, but other than basic checkpoints, it's really up to you how you get there.
* So many options!: My biggest complaint about other games like this is that they eventually get too boring to play. There's only so many times you can make a pizza before you never want to see pepperonis again. But this game provides enough menu options that the monotony never has a chance to set in.
* Multiple game play options: Not only do you have your basic career gameplay, there's also weekly challenges and other "events" to keep things lively.

Overall, this game is DEFINITELY worth the $10. Honestly, I think $10 is a steal for the quality of this game.  If you're at all hesitant to buy it, take it from this food management maniac that this game is WORTH IT!

author: {'steamid': '76561198087344093', 'num_games_owned': 418, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 1179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1651723354}
review:
Have you ever wanted to COOK? Have you ever wanted to SERVE? Have you ever wanted people to say, "Mmmm, that was DELICIOUS.." Then don't go work at a real life resturant! (..U-unless you really want to..) Instead, play Cook, Serve, Delicious, a fast-paced time management game where you use keys on your keyboard (or buttons on your controller) to complete orders. Whether it's cutting fish, pouring beer, or making ice cream, someone's gotta do it, and that someone is you! With tons of foods to prepare, chores to do, and moments to cry about when you make one measly mistake, you absolutely can't go wrong with Cook, Serve, Delicious. ..Unless you're really bad at finding keys on a keyboard (or buttons on a controller), and to that I say...

Meh. .-.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045002932', 'num_games_owned': 1069, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1480452608}

author: {'steamid': '76561198124770841', 'num_games_owned': 2744, 'num_reviews': 555, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1443381966}
review:
游戏玩了一会儿就不想玩了，尤其一开始就不知道是游戏卡了还是操作按键不熟悉，游戏无反应。
这游戏半夜饿着肚子玩应该很爽，跟恐怖游一样。老实说，我不喜欢洋快餐。这些个junk food，咱们一个番茄炒蛋就能完爆。如果不行，那就再加一个鱼香肉丝。我想没有国家的料理能跟咱们比，听说法国料理不错，不过在我想象中他们都是在生吃滑不溜秋的蜗牛这种东西。有的国家甚至只有泡菜，有的国家只有寿司，有的只有咖喱，看了感觉真可怜哈哈哈哈。听说稍微好点的发达国家还tvshow一个人跋山涉水吃各种嘎嘣脆鸡肉味的虫子。咱们饿了只要下楼就是各种小吃，当然食品安全是另一回事。不管面筋是不是用过的套套做的，只要好吃，我都能很享受的给你吃下去，如果不行，那就多加点辣椒。
总之，这个关于洋快餐的游戏并不讨我喜。和名字不配，洋快餐最多只能叫make,sell,full! （制作，出售，吃饱！），咱们的菜才能叫cook，serve, delicious!(烹饪，上菜，美味！)

author: {'steamid': '76561198202040366', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1624, 'last_played': 1455218954}
review:
I've played many cooking games before. Many have. They are usually very repetitive and quite easy.

This game is nothing like them.

Every time I play this I feel like I just ran a marathon. No, I'll take that back. It was like I just ran away from an angry pack of very hungry wolves. Or customers. Same thing really.

Hella rewarding. Challenging to the very end. 5 platinum stars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062760546', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 768, 'last_played': 1573866068}
review:
Three perfect days in a row, feeling like I'm the best at this game... fourth day, got pasta and pancakes on the menu, things are getting dicey. Rush hour comes - I'm throwing together perfect orders left and right. I keep thinking I'm about to end my perfect day streak, but I survive rush hour. The clock is winding down, I'm over here smirking to myself, thinking I'm about to get four perfect days in a row. About the third to last order, I get a coffee order, which wasn't anything I had been worried about the entire day. Pancakes are usually my downfall... Well, I pour the coffee, dump in some creamer, and hit S. Sugar. They didn't want sugar. In a fit of rage, I hit S several more times. If there had been a key to throw the cup out of the window, then I would have hit that, too.

I like this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995200857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 847, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 745, 'last_played': 1449646110}
review:
I've had to put this game aside for a while because I started playing it the other day and put in over 8 hours without even realizing it. I'd really like to put some more time into it, but overall accomplishments come slowly in this game.

Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a restaurant sim, but the focus of the game is on the individual preparation of dishes, all of which are delivered in deceptively simple minigames which you have to complete in rapid fire succession over the course of each day of running the restaurant.

It's a great concept that they can get a lot of mileage out of. There's a surprising amount of depth in this game, especially since I picked it up for just 5 dollars.

There's a high number of dishes you can buy to serve in the restaurant, as well as uprgrades to all those dishes. There's a number of upgrades you can buy for your restaurant as well. There's random events that can occur during the day, and if you want your restaurant to be successful you have to manage your menu in such a way as to maximize appeal, taking various factors into account. These factors include your own abilities at the game as well.

Perhaps there's going to be a safety inspection that day, and you don't want to miss out on any chores, so you stack the menu with dishes you know you can prepare quickly and easily, so you have more opportunity to focus on things the safety inspector will pay attention to.

In addition, there's multiple modes available in the game, catering requires you to prepare a smaller number of dishes, but in faster succession and with less room for error. There's also a battle kitchen minigame, and other content that I have yet to experience because I'm only a 2 star restaurant right now.

There's competitive and co-op multiplayer as well. Including a mode that can be played with two people on the same mouse and keyboard, which is nice to see.

Like I said, a surprising amount of depth.

I understand a sequel is coming out soon, and I'm already excited for it.

There are however, some things that frustrate me about this game.

First I feel like the progression is a little slow, but that's understandable, as it encourages you to hone your skills on certain dishes before moving on. It also means that this is a game you can get a lot of mileage out of.

Also, I feel like some of the upgrades on food items are unneccesary and break the flow of the game. Lasagna, for example,  was already a difficult dish because it's slow to prepare and cook. The minigame associated with it required you to press 4 buttons in a specific sequence three times. It got easier after you memorized the sequence and I eventually got better at it. With the upgrades though, lasagna orders have more ingredients, and become randomized, completely  changing the nature of the minigame associated with it, and making it much more difficult.

I think there should be more options to customize the look and feel of my restaurant, and perhaps a chance to specialize in certain types of food rather than having a menu that changes every two days (I don't know of any restaurants that do this). I mean, I really enjoyed preparing the seafood items in the game and I would enjoy having an in-game restaurant that specialized in this, and showcased it through decor or something similar, but there are no options to do so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141541510', 'num_games_owned': 966, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 938, 'last_played': 1466916082}
review:
Reminds me of those cooking flash games I used to be obsessed with as a kid, just way way better.
Seriously. Starts off simple and gets harder and harder, it's part resteraunt sim part cooking game. Definitely worth the asking price, gameplay is ridiculously addictive and the difficulty curve allows for one to learn the game without getting too difficult too fast.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063367595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1620786316}
review:
Não julgue pelo nome ou imagens, apesar de parecer um jogo de criança, não é nada disso,
você monta refeições e gerencia um restaurante, lembra um pouco os jogos do Papa (jogos de navegador),
cada refeição tem um modo de preparo, e cada cliente pede uma variante da mesma,
cada refeição e/ou item da refeição é montado apertando um botão ou executando um comando (Jogo no controle do Xbox),
você deve verificar o pedido e acertar a combinação de botões para montar o prato,
errou e o cliente não fica satisfeito, demorou demais e ele vai embora,
muitos clientes igual mais lucro, porém menos tempo para montar cada prato uma vez que cada cliente tem um tempo para ser atendido,
hora do rush igual desespero.

Ótimo jogo, não se deixa enganar pelo nome, é um jogo para testar sua velocidade e reflexo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007367308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 3014, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2240, 'last_played': 1492652589}
review:
This game is how I exorcise my inner 'Gordon Ramsey' demons. It is a lot of fun trying to keep up with the customers' orders in this game, and I certainly picture myself inside of Hell's Kitchen while playing. 

This is a fun, casual game that has no pay wall, and a purpose or themes that clearly seperate it from a dearth of 'tap-tap' and clicker games that waste your time while smashing you into a gem/gold/ticket shop in order to progress in the game.

The game itself can be challenging or fun, depending on the kind of progress you'd like to make in advancing your restaurant. Some dishes are straightforward to make, while some are an absolutely devilish challenge. I recommend you review and practice new recipies and consider making changes to the keys for certain ingredients to be things you can easily remember. This way, you can offer an impressive menu in your restaurant while at the same time not break your fingers on your keyboard.
