author: {'steamid': '76561198248596630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1660440888}
review:
Just imagine this relaxing music in the background and then... BAAMMM upbeat music that sends you straight into panic mode because its rush hour and everyone and their grandma is asking for everything on the menu, and even including things that arent on the menu like; FLUSHING TOLIETS, CLEANING DISHES, SETTING RAT TRAPS, AND THROWING TRASH AWAY. BUT you can only do one thing at a time so your trying to pop the cork of a bottle of wine and here comes the rush hour and everyone wants a basket of fried chicken at the same time and their patience is fading and your sanity is going with it. Then the rush is gone and it is back to the regular relaxing music and your heart rate has went back to its normal pace. If your looking for a great cooking game this is the one! It feels as though you are actually running a resteraunt because you have to do everything for the place. This is the best cooking game ive played yet.
10/10
Such a great game

author: {'steamid': '76561198066193286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 879, 'last_played': 1628343661}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996548066', 'num_games_owned': 380, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 537, 'last_played': 1441609113}

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198128154787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2270, 'last_played': 1439911280}

author: {'steamid': '76561198037572211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 585, 'last_played': 1518834036}
review:
I enjoy cooking irl and I often play flash cooking games online. But this game makes me wanna set my computer on fire and kill myself.  I thought I was gonna have fun and kill time with it. I got nothing but panic attacks! 
Let me put it this way. You basically have to take control of EVERY SINGLE CHORE in the restaurant! EVERY. SINGLE. CHORE! Take orders, cook, serve, do the dishes, take the trash out, set traps for rats, stop burglers, take selfies with people, go on dates. Not to mention the stress in rush hours while an inspector is watching you, so you try your best not to miss a single chore. All while cooking for impatient ungrateful bastards who don't even flush the toilet, so I have to do that too! 
This game will hurt you mentally, physically and emotionally. Because as cute and yummy as the the food will look, you will hate every single person who makes an order. Because while you finish making a fun delicious burger. You've probably missed or burned at least 4 other orders and also hurt your arm or broke a finger, from mashing every single button as fast as you can. This makes Hell's Kitchen look like a fairy land.
But despite all that, it's so addicting and surprisingly fun. The kind of game you will keep going back to, even for just 5 minutes to see if you can do better, which you won't!

author: {'steamid': '76561198012123927', 'num_games_owned': 781, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1542949215}

author: {'steamid': '76561198073868777', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 554, 'last_played': 1523953829}

author: {'steamid': '76561198116358216', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3090, 'last_played': 1478697898}
review:
Addictive, fun & has loads of replay-ability.

This is the kind of game that the more you feel like putting into it, the more fun you can get out of it. If you just like the gimmick of cooking quickly, then you can dip in and out of the game whenever you feel like like it, and slowly complete the career mode that way. 

The game gets really good when you look at the steam achievements and begin pushing yourself to get enough plates of each category of food, try the in-game dating game (woo you love interests with great food), and push yourself out of your comfort zone by upgrading your foods until they are crazy-difficult to assemble under pressure.

I've put in over 60hours of play, and I'm still only on the first play through, with the extra difficulty available to me when I want to start again. 

Amusingly, this game isn't for everyone. I have some friends who are awesome gamers, but just can't get themselves around the gameplay style, the speed and the need to multitask and keep of your meals in mind. So, it's very satisfying when /you're/ good at it. 

It's definitely worth the £7 - and if it goes on sale - I recommend you snap it up.

Top hint, get good at the game now in time for when the second one comes out (;

author: {'steamid': '76561198179901050', 'num_games_owned': 341, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1507218052}
review:
Encore un jeu addictif dans mon inventaire Steam.
Un jeu qui vous tiendra en haleine et vous forcera à donner le meilleur de vous-même.
Egalement un excellent moyen de faire travailler sa mémoire avec toutes les touches qu'il faut retenir pour être le plus efficace possible.
Un moyen détourné pour l'étudiante que je suis de pouvoir faire de la vraie cuisine et non des pâtes tous les soirs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990132471', 'num_games_owned': 273, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1442716256}
review: Addicting little game, great to play Co-Op with your girlfriend/boyfriend.  My girl and I started to get so good at the game that orders were being executed fast and flawless and we both got into a 'zone' and she started laughing maniacly as she cooked up dishes much to my amusement.  Outside of the core time sensitive QTE gameplay, there's some RPG elements that are actually fun to mess around with and think about such as what foods to serve, and what upgrades to get for your restaurant.  Theres a campaign and some other extra modes to play around with too.  For 10 bucks this one's a no brainer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023216972', 'num_games_owned': 564, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 3366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1319, 'last_played': 1579206425}
review:
Why is this game so fun?  I have no idea.  The basic gameplay is that customers order food from you, and then you hit a sequence of keyboard keys to prepare and serve the food to them.  That's it, and yet the game is so ridiculously fun.  I love all the different events added into the game, they're good to do when taking a break from the main part where you just run your restaurant.

I'm really looking forwards to the sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165049232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 542, 'last_played': 1621951604}
review:
เป็นเกมทำอาหารที่ดี ดูเหมือนง่ายแต่เสือกยาก 
โดยเรารับบทเป็นเชฟทำอาหารที่ต้องพัฒนาร้านและเมนูตัวเองตั้งแต่ 0 ดาวไปจนถึง ระดับ 5 ดาว
0 ดาว เป็นเกมคลายเครียด
1 ดาว เป็นเกมที่ท้าทาย
2 ดาว เป็นเกมที่ทำให้เครียด
3 ดาว เป็นเกมที่ทำให้คุณเหนือกว่าคนทั่วไป
4 ดาว คุณน่าจะเป็นบ้าไปแล้ว
5 ดาว become a GOD!

ข้อดี
+ มีระบบอัพเกรตที่หลากหลาย และมันเยี่ยมไปเลย
+ มี event ทำอาหารพิเศษๆ
+ มีระบบพาเชฟ(ตัวเรา)ไปออกเดทกับลูกค้า 
+ มีระบบจับคู่ข้อดีข้อเสียอาหาร เพื่อวางแผนอาหารที่จะขาย เมนูพิเศษ รวมไปถึงวางแผนว่าเมนูแต่ละอันเราทำไหวไหม

ข้อเสีย
- การอัพเกรตดาวร้านอาหาร จะรู้สึกว่านานมาก หากเล่นแบบยิงยาวรวดเดียวจบ(มันเป็นแคชชวลน่ะนะ เล่นเรื่อยๆ หลายๆวัน)
- คนเล่นอาจทะเลาะกับตัวเอง

author: {'steamid': '76561198089939105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3760, 'last_played': 1652512766}
review:
150 Megabytes ago, a corporate tower's fantasy became a reality in a forum never seen before: Cook, Serve, Delicious! the restaurant/game. The motivation for spending their fortune to create Cook, Serve, Delicious! was to encounter new original cuisines which could be called true artistic creations. To realize their dream, they secretly started choosing the top chef of various styles of cooking, and they named their man Player 1: the invincible man of culinary skills. Cook, Serve, Delicious! is the arena where the Player awaits the challenges of picky customers from around the building.  Using all their senses, skill, luck, they are to prepare artistic dishes from the recipe cards. Every day, stress levels are on the line in Cook, Serve, Delicious!, where the Player pits their artistic creations against the masses. What demands do today's customers bring? And how will the Player fight back? The heat will be on!

Allez Cuisine! (Buy this Game)

author: {'steamid': '76561198084840314', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2013, 'last_played': 1527210114}
review:
A nice, coffee break game.

There are a few things that set this apart from other cooking/restaurant sims. I love some of the button combinations for the food. Fish is right, down, left... That combination just flies and is so much fun to press. Enchiladas are down, up, down, up... Some of the salads involve spelling OMG. The game play experience is very enjoyable if you choose food to serve that you like serving instead of focusing on profit or buzz. The music throughout the day perks me right up. The frantic pace of the lunch rush is exhilarating when you are on top of it. 

It's been awhile since my original play through of this game, but I still pop in from time to time just to have a bit of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027430395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1514, 'last_played': 1511974362}
review:
Of all the flashgames and other cooking sims i like this one the best. Why you might ask yourself as you look over the storepage and contemplate the existance of the money in your wallet and how you can lighten the burden of that heavy leather pouch.
Cause it is intense as all he....heck. You see those TV shows and all that other good stuff about how it is working in a kitchen. Seems like it's going 110 Km/h all the time right? This game is like that. You see every dish is a bit different. I'll use the soup as an example. Lets say the customer comes up and orders the soup. Well you have the boulioun cubes on U the bowtie pasta on W and the veggies like Celery (Y), Carrots (A) and Tomatoes (T) but they need to be chopped up first so for every veggie you need to press the down arrowkey three times. Keep in mind that you need to do it as fast as possible as well so if this process takes 10 seconds you're doing bad, a missclick so you add the pasta where there should be none. BAD. Take to long. The other customers will get impacient real quick and LEAVE. See how that does for your reputation.
This and the fact that the toilets needs to be flushed since some uncaring soul left a suprise to bring new exotic aroma for your establishment. The trash needs to get thrown out, the dishes need to get done and theres those annoying rodents that needs a good snappin.
ALL THIS NEEDS TO GET DONE AS WELL AS THE FOOD.
It's stressful but suprisingly fun. It's one of those fun games that manages to tire your brain out. Take brakes and keep playing.
A worthwhile buy.

review: There's just so many things this game does right. If you strip it of its theme, at the core this game is about juggling a series of mini-games and finding ways to optimize how you handle them. Don't like a particular food item's mini-game? Don't include it in your menu. You have complete control over what the game will be throwing at you. Daily challenges keep the gameplay fresh. I keep coming back to this one. I can't recommend it enough.

review:
Ever wanted to cook a lot of food without any real effort? Ever wanted to be a line cook but didn't want to deal with real life stresses of being a line cook?

author: {'steamid': '76561197961951106', 'num_games_owned': 1557, 'num_reviews': 289, 'playtime_forever': 1909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1464, 'last_played': 1527364311}
review:
The best time-management game I've played in a long, looong time. A bit disappointing it doesn't have upkeep costs such as rent and ingredient refills but it has enough depth anyway. There's plenty of foods and upgrades to keep you occupied as you master new combinations and increase the challenge at your own pace.

Also here's a major protip: when making a dish that has two pages of ingredients (such as soup or pizza), if you remember the key shortcuts you don't have to flip the page to access the other ingredients! So you can gather all necessary ingredients from the first page even though they're not listed on-screen... This makes a huge difference; pity I only found about it when I was about to get my third star.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024546296', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 2528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2528, 'last_played': 1436272321}
review:
Highly addicting game. Your main goal is to serve as many customers as you can during the workday by pressing correct button combinations for each order. You're single worker in restaurant which means you'll serve several customers at once and doing catering jobs at the same time. Customers will not wait for you forever, if you're too late serving them or not giving them exactly what they wanted, they'll leave unsatisfied, giving your restaurant negative buzz for next day, which means - less customers. Basically, your restaurant's success depends on your speed, accuracy and multitasking skills (serving 5+ orders at the same time). There's also a "manager" part of the game (between workdays) where you organize menu list for next day, responding to mails, buying upgrades, etc. Take note that this game is not a manager simulation, success depends of your skills as a cook.

This is not a game for relaxation - it's very tense from the start, the more successful you are it will be more difficult for you in later game (more complex orders, more customers) and again, you'll feel more accomplished as the game progresses. Game comes packed with many challenges and goals, including multiplayer/co-op - enough to give you dozens of playing hours. Recommended!

(I played on Xbox 360 controller so I can't speak about experience on keyboard)

author: {'steamid': '76561198124977898', 'num_games_owned': 58, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1467232188}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious is a very simple, but fun game.
I won't go into the game mechanics, since there's other reviews that probably do it much better than i would've done it.
There's really not much to complain about for me personally, any very positive review about the game I'd probably agree with.
Something I like to point out about this game is how lovely made everything is.
The sound effects as you select the ingredients, the customers and their reaction on how well you execute their orders, the music, the emails you get and the overall design. I appreciate the attention to detail.

This game offers some basic building and managing-, aswell as simple gameplay mechanics.
If you want to take it easy you can choose to only put foods and drinks on your menu that are easy to do, but if you want to achieve maximum profit or challenge yourself there's complex dishes that test your abilities - especially in rush hours.
Then there's also all sorts of challenges where you can try to set a highscore.

For casual gamers and hardcore highscore hunters alike - I fullheartedly recommend buying this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114982013', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1442767809}

author: {'steamid': '76561198063426606', 'num_games_owned': 356, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2021, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1953, 'last_played': 1552521453}
review:
Fun and, initially, simple cooking simulator with some clever features. You can use either your mouse or the keypad to prepare the meals for your customers. However I doubt you can run the restaurant successfully if you only use the mouse throughout the entire game. Still good when you're first starting out though. 
You can upgrade your food making the recipes, in some cases, more advanced and raising the prices for them.

There's boosts, negative and positive, tied to the food and different challenges outside the restaurant. You can sign up for a matchmaking sevice, have celebrities come by, health and safety representative and people might take instagram like pictures of your food, giving you more "buzz" if you give it a "thumbs up".

If you can get it when it's on sale I say go get it. Personally I got it during steam summer sale, it was a little less than £1 and well worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053365418', 'num_games_owned': 1372, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 2528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 716, 'last_played': 1548654342}
review:
At first I thought that it's only a bit better browser cooking game. I was only partially right.
If you have ever played any cooking flash games, you know what is it all about. You run low tier restaurant, earn money to buy new food, more equipment ect. in order to create renowned restaurat. You do it by preparing food and selling it to customers. Preparing itself seems to be pretty easy - you have customers' order at the bottom of the screen, and you have to press buttons corresponding to requested adds. Where it gets tricky are rush hours - they occur twice a day, and result in huge amount of customers - so you need to be fast not to make bad food. There are of course rewards for your effort - it's marked in three ways: perfect - exactly what asked; good - small mistake; bad -... pretty obvious. Good and perfect orders result in +0.5% of buzz, wile bad ones result in -0.5% of buzz (buzz is meter of popularity, the bigger the buzz, the more customers next day). Plus, perfect days result in additional money. Besides of cooking, you have also sanitary duties, like cleaning toilet, tossing garbage and so on.
After day of cooking, you go to main menu, where you check your emails (they contain spam, random events yelling in more money or higher buzz, notify you about sanitary inspection or else), spend money on new food types or their upgrades (ugraded foods *might* be a little harder, but they are a bit more profitable) or change your active menu. You can't have all your food available every day - you have to change it once per some days (with some exceptions, most of foods are affected by so called "menu root" - it was too long in your menu, and people got bored, resulting in negative buzz). Also you can buy equipment, which will make your job easier, by for example cutting amount of dishes nneded to cean by two, or making customers wait a little longer.  After some time, in main menu you will be able to acess special events - like eg. catering events. Theese are a way for you to earn nice money in 2-3 minutes. There are also bets - if you take them and complete, you get more money.
All of modern games must have some kind of multiplayer - CSD has Battle Kitchen, with plenty of game modes, like weekly game, with your score posted on the leaderboard. It also includes local coop.
Simple as it is, CSD is pretty enjoyable game. I became victiom of "one more day" within first few hours of playing. If you don't mind managing restaurant, this is a game for you. My only question - why are people in this game so depresed?

author: {'steamid': '76561198041623860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1511341289}

The best thinkg about Cook, Serve, Delicious! is that it charges customers for Ice Water.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029446690', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1483330981}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a restaurant simulator, or perhaps a line cook simulator, that is ambitious in its reach but somewhat failed in its execution. I'm not talking about the gameplay, which is fun; I'm talking about the bugs. The gameplay reminds me of old coin op serving games with modern twists; instead of pouring mugs of beer or root beer to satisfy customers, each menu item has its own recipe to be followed, many times with multiple steps. The game takes into account time of day (some people get turned off at the smell of fish cooking at breakfast) and weather conditions (rainy days mean comfort food will be popular) as you work to make the money to upgrade your kitchen and buy new appliances. 

Unfortunately, the game menus are terribly coded so that I could only read roughly a third of the buttons. This includes options menus, food selection, item purchases, upgrades, you name it. If you're not behind the counter making food for customers, there's a two to one chance you won't be able to tell what you're doing. At some point, my control scheme was changed to that for a PS controller without any indication of what key I hit or how to change it back.

I really want to like this game. Someday, with proper developer support, it might be worth buying.

review: Manic cooking fun with a layer of strategy.  It's a genius idea for a game, backed up by addictive mechanics and a flavorful presentation, both often missing in the simulation genre.  You can even fully customize every key binding to your liking, making the experience truly yours.  Although it's tempting to stick with the same foods over and over, Cook, Serve, Delicious! is still extremely fun and realizes the fantasy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004053899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 1831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1831, 'last_played': 1437977835}
review: Akin to "Restaraunt simulator meets Warioware" and "Ordinary Swedish Meal Time: The Game". Incredibly fast-paced but also quite forgiving; I'm not actually sure it's even possible to lose. Lots of different foods, mostly with their own way of being prepared, but you don't have to memorize -too- much (although it can help). You can practice foods before trying them during a workday to make sure you know what you're doing, and it has various side-games to add some variety. And if you think it's too easy, there's always Extreme Mode. I highly recommend it, even at the full $10 price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027671531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 2086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1917, 'last_played': 1591546222}
review:
More intense than all of the wars I've served in. 
My record includes: The American Civil War, The Great War, Russian Civil War, WW2 (axis and allies), Vietnam, Gulf War, Afghanistan & Iraq wars, and more. 

Also makes you learn the keyboard better than Mavis Beacon ever did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028854449', 'num_games_owned': 3153, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 626, 'last_played': 1417981986}
review:
this game is really fun and i have put a couple of hours into this, but it felt really repetative once you get to a 2 star restuarant "oh, you want me to play ANOTHER 20 in game days?!?!?!"

so i stopped playing this for like a year or more

I tried it again a few months ago and i was pleased with the updates they released (new modes, polished gameplay, etc)... but it wasn't enough to pull me full time away from "Call of Battlefield" or whatever the stuff I've been playing

Then, about a week or two ago I found this as a mobile app on Andriod and I can't stop playing that.

Will definately play this game more on andriod and on here!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994480308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 296, 'playtime_forever': 761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1684417312}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious! is basically Cooking Mama, but made much more game-y by adding in a simulator layer on top of it. Rather than just play through a series of loosely-related cooking-themed microgames, you manage an entire restaurant, and serve orders in your day-to-day with said minigames. 

Both the management system and the cooking system are fun, polished, and well thought out. There's lots of things to keep track of, buttons to press, and just enough new twists and mechanics to keep things interesting.

There's a lot to love here if you're the type who likes simple, fun games that are more than they initially appear. I highly, highly recommend Cook, Serve, Delicious! if you liked any of the following game franchises:

-Cooking Mama
-Warioware
-Lemonade Stand
-Animal Crossing
-Harvest Moon

Post script: One thing that I'd like to emphasize is that the difficulty scales extremely well. The game starts very simply and rises in complexity and intensity at a rate that I found nearly mirrored my increase in personal skill. I never felt overwhelmed or too bored. I've found that this is an extremely rare thing in video games, so I'm just trying to give credit where it's due.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063224650', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1596758795}
review:
This game is very addictive! You have to think quickly, know your keys, and get some muscle memory rapidly in order to handle some of the more complex orders. It's okay at first to need to read the orders and the ingredients and push each key in the very beginning, but if you want to turn a profit and juggle all your customers, you can't do it for long. 

"P for pasta, S for sauce, C for cheese, R for parmasean, oh I have to do that 2 more times? P...S...C...R... oh did I do that once or twice already?" quickly becomes "pscrpscrpscr." Jumbo tea with ice and flavor blast becomes Up Up Up Right I F Down Enter. 

Does that sound appealing to you? Ever tried Cooking Mama? Add in some good ol' typing games. Maybe also add a dash of rhythm games like Parappa the Rapper (for the muscle memory element). Read all the much better written good reviews and then buy this game! It's worth the $10 bucks!

author: {'steamid': '76561198137309371', 'num_games_owned': 583, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1230, 'last_played': 1694358414}

author: {'steamid': '76561198135016106', 'num_games_owned': 812, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 975, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 933, 'last_played': 1480858142}
review:
I love this game. It is clear, consise, and provides me with hours of fun every time I play. 

Remembering the recipies is somewhat difficult, but you get used to it. The SPAM and other random emails which you recieve add to the lifelikeness of the game, and makes me feel like I might actually be working at a corporate employee cafe! 

I would recommend this to anyone who likes to play challenging strategy/memory retention games, with interactive elements, and mini-puzzles to keep you constantly entertained throughout.

Even if you don't have much time, this game is definately worth the money.

I have played 16 hours so far, and will be clocking many more in the future. If you like strategy, memory recall, and mini-puzzles, then this is the game for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198048795665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1514936843}
review:
My only complaint about this game is that I cannot undo an action I have taken.  I just handed a middle aged man a basket full of raw chicken with a smile on my face and "Come again!" written in my eyes.  He was upset but it didn't prevent the woman behind him from asking for the exact same thing.  

10/10 good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117493929', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 2966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1065, 'last_played': 1663078079}
review:
I strongly recommend this game and this is coming from a person who was very skeptical about it since there's a lot of good free games of time management and cooking like the "Papa's" games. I thought in the past "What does this game has to offer me?" and now I know. 

This game has loads of strong points. EXCELLENT soundtrack, awesome and challenging jogability, great artstyle.... That's a amazingly well-done game. The advantage of it in comparison to online free games is how you're able to choose what's going on the menu of your restaurant and the progression that the game has to offer with many new and hard challenges but also cool rewards.  I really, really, really recommend it! 09/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198034846944', 'num_games_owned': 1070, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1267, 'last_played': 1663345838}
review: Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a wonderful game that is both addictive and challenging. I love pressing the keys to put together the dishes and try to serve them on time. Lots of modes have been added to make the game that more challenging and does a fantastic job in adding depth to an already fantastic game. I like the humour via the emails you receive in-game and the artwork, music and gameplay are top notch. It's one of those games you can just drop in and out of if you have a spare 5 minutes or you can play for longer in an attempt to beat the challenges.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014431795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 5259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5248, 'last_played': 1419432226}
review:
材料（手順）に応じたキーを押して料理を作るゲーム。
だいたいのメニューはボタンを押した瞬間に材料が盛り付けられるので、
パパパパッと盛り付けられるのが爽快。

自分のお店を５つ星にすればゲームクリアだがゲームオーバー要素は無く、
難易度（客の入り・メニューの難しさ）も前日の成績やメニューの組み合わせで変動するため自分で調節できる。
お金を稼いで新しいメニューを買ったり、特殊ルールの大会などもある。

難点は、英語なのでメニューレシピに慣れるまで時間がかかる事（プラクティスで試行可）と
星ひとつ獲得するのに最低２０日（１日は約５分）かかるため序盤で飽きやすい事。
空いた時間にちまちま進めるのがオススメ。

なお、メニューごとにキーバインドを変更可なので、
プラクティスで自分好みのキーバインド変更推奨。

author: {'steamid': '76561197969074911', 'num_games_owned': 753, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1438372701}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a fairly innocent looking game, which is very easy to pick up and play, but hard to master. As the manager of an up-and-coming restaurant (more like a greasy spoon at first), you'll purchase food, devise a menu, and quickly whip up tasty food for the many impatient and particular customers who enter through your doors.

In CSD, you'll do everything. Yes, you're the manager, and when you're not "in the restaurant", where the bulk of the game takes place, you'll have to take the meagre funds that you start with and buy equipment and food to sell, in the hopes of turning a profit. However, your job doesn't stop there. This business is your life.

When the restaurant opens, you'll be the waiter taking the orders, the cook slaving away over the stove, and the janitor setting traps and throwing out the trash, amongst other things. How this works is extremely simple.

Customers come in, and a picture of what they want appears next to a number at the left of the screen. Let's say it's salad. Press that number and you now have to prepare the food. A bowl of greens appears in the middle, and on the right are other options tied to buttons on the keyboard, "G" for "Green and Carrots", "C" for "Cheese" etc. At the bottom of the screen it says "I want just greens and carrots", so you press G and with a tap of enter, send it out. If you don't like the keyboard, you also have the option to use the mouse and just click the icons, or even a gamepad but I can't say if that's a good way to play or not.

That took time to type out, but you'll grasp this in about 5 seconds, guaranteed. Speed and accuracy are extremely important. Speed is important because people are impatient. Once you're preparing their food, it's okay, they'll wait as long as it takes. But then other customers come in, wanting other things, so you'd better do this one quickly or they'll leave. No money for you, and even worse: you get negative buzz.

Buzz is basically a measure of your popularity. It will increase if you're doing well, and decrease if you're doing badly. Not in the same day, mind you, but a poor performance one day (missed or inaccurate orders) will mean less buzz on the next day. Other factors affect it too, such as what foods are on your menu. Each type of food has positive and negative values, which you can view before you purchase them to put on your menu, or at any time after you've done that. Some foods are Fatty foods, and if you have too many on your menu, people start to have a negative idea of your restaurant and your buzz will go down by 5% or more. Some increase buzz, by being healthy, or by being considered to be "worthy". Aspirational foods, like fine wines and lobster. A good player will take a little time to balance their menu around foods which have lots of positive values but are perhaps difficult and time-consuming to make, and easy ones which are fatty foods or come served on a stick, like something you'd get at a noisy, smelly carnival for poor people UGH

So, you have a game of two halves. You have this calm, thoughtful management aspect of the game. No customers and no need to rush, just make sensible business decisions and try not to run out of cash. And then, when you click "open restaurant", you have this frantic button-mashing, so simple it could be a minigame on Newgrounds, and you're flinging food at impatient customers and cleaning up their mess as you go. Did I just serve that customer some raw chicken? FUCK IT MOVE ON. *wipes sweat off brow* The game actually balances the two sides very well. There is just enough meat to the management part that you can make good decisions (or bad ones) and this will affect the other side of the game, which works wonderfully because it's simple and just plain fun. You press the buttons and serve the food, and you do it FAST.

There are a couple of issues I have with the game which I fully expect to be resolved in the sequel. Firstly, you start off with a one star restaurant, which is fine, but in order to move up to two stars and start making more money, you have to do a full 20 days of service. There's no way around that, and it doesn't matter if it's a shitty 20 days of terrible service where your buzz is awful, or if you got a perfect day every time. Essentially this kind of "gating off" of the second star is to prevent the difficult from getting too much too fast, but it also limits your income and your choices. I feel it would work much better as a sliding scale. Do really badly, and you have to do the full 20 days. Do really well, and you'll bag that second star after just 10 days of service. I believe this 20 days of service applies for every star level, by the way.

Another thing, and it's super petty but I have to say it. You can practice making foods before you buy them, which is AMAZING. You don't have to spend $2000 on wine only to find that it's really tricky to make and means you get it wrong or do it really slowly. BUT, you also HAVE to do chores like washing the dishes and setting traps, and there's no way to practice doing these. You have to learn on the job, and this could fuck you up in the heat of the moment. Doesn't seem  fair to have one but not the other.

My final complaint is that customer orders are written in prose. "I'll have a salad with ranch, cheese, greens and carrots and mushrooms and onions", or whatever. I'm a good reader and can parse this all dead quick, which you absolutely need to do, so that's okay. But what about people who struggle to read? Wouldn't it better just to have bullet points:

*Cheese
*Mushrooms

Like that? None of the connectives, just what you need to know.

Anyway, fuck all that. This game is awesome. Shit, it's nearly Rush Hour, I'd better get my apron on.

review:
Um, I dunno what to say about this game. It's really good.
Yea.
If you're a perfectionist, this game might be a tad harder than it actually is, since you'll spend hours on a single day trying to get that perfect $250 bonus, but if you're just playing then who cares?
It's also rather silly, like the chicken breast upgrades. It goes from simply chicken breast, to hormone'd up chicken breast, to luxury chicken breast, to the finest chicken breast that came from chicken colosseum champs. Spoilers, I guess.
You know what? Just go buy the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002916560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1845, 'last_played': 1506278662}
review: I keep coming back to this game.  It's complex, but doable, and scratches a time management itch in a way that no other game has.  The local co-op works surprisingly well (although the person who is managing, rather than cooking, has a lot of downtime).  It IS intense, but in a good way.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984945065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1507654913}

author: {'steamid': '76561198099638686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1337, 'last_played': 1471767906}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious! hat sehr viel zu bieten! Man fängt in einem kleinen Restaurant an und erarbeitet sich mit der Zeit bis zu 5 Sterne. Auf dem Weg dorthin, gilt es neben der Arbeit Aufgaben zu meistern. Man muss alle 5 Tage (nicht in Echtzeit) Gesundheits/Sauberkeitsinspektionen bestehen, es gibt Challenges, wie Kochtouniere, Cateringservice und sogar Kochduelle mit anderen Spielern, plus einen Lokalen Co-op. Nach jedem Arbeitstag wir man reichlich mit E-Mails bombadiert, die einem helfen das Menü für den kommenden Tag zu planen. Man kann außerdem Fund-Me-Kampagnen unterstützen (zum Beispiel für bessere Toiletten), ab 2 Sternen bekommt man Anfragen für Dates (ja, man kann sogar daten!!) und ab 4 Sternen kündigen sich gerne mal VIP-Gäste an! 

Obwohl man jeden Tag kocht und serviert und es zur Rush-Hour immer sehr stressig wird, macht das Spiel nach 16+ Stunden immernoch eine Menge Spaß, da es eine sehr große Auswahl an Gerichten gibt, von denen jedes verschieden zubereitet werden muss. Die Challenges zwischendurch machen das Ganze noch abwechslungsreicher (und sind gar nicht mal so einfach). Noch dazu ist die Musik recht heiter. 

Wer an online Koch/Servier-Spielen Spaß hat, wird hier auf keinen Fall enttäuscht! Ich kann das Spiel wirklich nur weiterempfehlen! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198127811585', 'num_games_owned': 410, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 874, 'last_played': 1461600022}

author: {'steamid': '76561198046051347', 'num_games_owned': 370, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1548, 'last_played': 1544051966}
review:
So, I just finished getting the fabled 5 star rating on my restaurant, [spoiler](currently going for the elusive Platinum Star)[/spoiler] and I would definitely recommend this game to anyone who wants a challenge. Especially since it boosts your ability to multitask, (which definitely helps out with projects or assignments) and challenges your memory, accuracy, and speed. This game has really helped me multitask in many  different things, which I'd never expect from a video game. 

 [u]What I Liked[/u]
[list]
[*]The fact that it boosts your accuracy, speed, and multitasking skill.
[*]The amount of gameplay put into the game, which is surprising for this kind of genre of games.
[*]The true feeling of finally getting that last star for your restaurant, and just raking in the big money.
[*]How fun the extra events and weekly challenges are.
[/list]

[u]What I Disliked[/u]
[list]
[*]How hard some parts of the Iron Cook episodes are. 
[*]The [i]slight[/i] unresponsiveness of a controller.
[*]The fact you need a controller in order to play the game efficiently without any problems.
[/list]

Overall, this game was a very fun time, and was definitely worth the $10 investment put into it. Considering this game still adds new things over time, even if it's not needed. If you want a challenge for once, try out Cook, Serve, Delicious!

author: {'steamid': '76561198080006893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 5815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2131, 'last_played': 1463633822}
review: Really fun addictive game. Definitely a game where it is MUCH easier if you can touch type, as to assemble orders fast the best way is to use the keyboard short keys (eg. 'T' tomato, 'M' meat, 'P' pickles and you have yourself a burger!). Good range of foods, and by setting the menu you can combine foods you're learning with foods you've mastered to control difficulty easily. And weekly challenge gets you cooking the foods you might not serve as much to keep you on your toes and a master of all!

review:
The most fast paced action cooking game you'll ever play. You start out as some chump fry cook in a dive, serving cheap corn dogs and pretzels and over time you become an elder god of the culinary arts able to serve all the dishes while somehow being able to flush toilets, take out the trash and romance your love intrest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065377525', 'num_games_owned': 27, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1845, 'last_played': 1594904096}
review:
Best purchase OF MY LIFE!! Bought it during the Summer Sale for $0.99, and, to be honest, didn't think it would be that good. I. WAS. WRONG. It has specific elements that just... grab you. The way in which you complete and progress through the game and its storyline is smooth and flawless. All the different extras (other than cooking delicious food) such as the mail client (you get hilarious random emails sometimes), Extra Events, Battle Kitchen, and a wide variety of foods of different complexities to suit anyone's playing style. Plus, for the hardcore CSD-ers(?), the Extreme Mode makes it ridiculously hard for even the most experienced players. Definitely a game to add to your library, at any price. Would highly recommend. 

Key bindings for purchase: (C) Buy (S) It (D) Now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010547033', 'num_games_owned': 1422, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1466996057}
review: It's one of those games that is pretty simple to learn, but takes a long time to master. This game revolves around using hotkeys to perform tasks that involve making food and doing chores in your restaurant. On top of the main gameplay, you use the money generated from sales to buy new food items and equipment. This is a constant component because the items on your menu will "rot" over time. This means that the items that have been on your menu for more than two days will become boring to customers, and your rating will suffer. This requires you to constantly buy new items and equipment even later in the game. Even though this is all in career mode, there is a competitive "Battle Kitchen" mode that allows you to face off against others. On the technical side, the game is very minimal, which is to the game's benefit. Because of the very low system requirements, the game allows you to render 4K textures, which make the game look really good. Overall, this is a fun game to have on any system since the requirements are insanely low.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971718047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3209, 'last_played': 1502876703}
review:
This game is far more fun than it has any right to be. I picked it up during a Steam sale for the ridiculously low price of $.99, but even at ten times that much, it's remarkably good value for the money. It's addictive: the kind of addictive that sneaks up on you. "I'll play one shift," you tell yourself, and suddenly you've been flipping burgers, boiling lobsters, constructing elaborate sushi platters and chopping vegetables for soup (I hate you, soup.) for hours.

And it has a surprising amount of variety. There's a campaign mode. There's a campaign mode with added difficulty. There are online challenge modes. There's a local -cooperative- mode. All in a game that costs ten bucks at full price. Easily the best gaming dollar I've ever spent.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988181581', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 747, 'last_played': 1520868784}
review: Worked as a waiter and a cook for years. This reminds me of how that felt, trying to keep up with a whole restaurant full of customers and keep everything straight in your mind. Also scratches the Tetris nerve, the demand for precise keyboard work under pressure. Adorable art, nice progression system for your recipes. Building and rebuilding your menu to deal with each day's weirdness is really satisfying. This game almost makes me nostalgic for waiting tables. 5/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198136516068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 4232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4202, 'last_played': 1558897448}
review: Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a really fun and addicting cooking simulator game that puts your fine motor and hand-eye coordination skills to test. The game starts easy and the level of difficulty progresses as you move up the restaurant ladder and upgrade your food items. I like how the game offers different "sub-modes" for both Career Kitchen and Battle Kitchen cooking modes. Animation and food design in Cook, Serve, Delicious! are so good that I always find myself hungry whenever I play this game! Excited to see what's in store for players in the upcoming sequel! =)

author: {'steamid': '76561198055063799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1590200108}
review:
A while ago I told myself i wouldn't buy any more Indie games.
I'm glad I changed my mind because this is the best of them!
The game concept is pretty simple, serve as many people as you can to buy food and upgrade your restaurant.
Some food and drinks are more complex to prepare than others but earn you more cash. You need quick fingers as the customers come thick and fast when it reaches rush hour.
Besides serving the food you can buy equipment to keep the distractions of chores to a minimum and the health and safety officers happy.
There's an email system to keep you upto date on whats ahead and even betting and dating :D
I got this on sale for next to nothing so i was pleasantly surprised. My advice is to wishlist it and get it on sale.

Tip for beginners, don't bother with the more complex foods at first, just use the simple, easy to prepare foods, because though they sell for less, you can easily get a perfect day which will get you an extra $250

author: {'steamid': '76561197996496804', 'num_games_owned': 1594, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1699222378}
review:
I... I was not expecting to like this so much. Manage a restaurant by yourself. Pick your menu, prepare your food, prioritize your customers, do chores... etc. Practice multi-tasking and learning your food assembly by buttons on your controller. Played 3 days before writing this review.

Each day is composed of early morning and mid day luls, but there's lunch and dinner rushes. You must prepare each item on the menu by reading the customers order (burger assembly by buttons, cooking the meat patties), pouring beer by holding down left stick until the beer has a nice head on it, getting the right size soft drink cup (with or without ice), dunking the fries in the fryer until there's steam (with or without salt).... And chores! Set rat traps, flush the toilets (flush then sanitize your hands), scrub dishes, throw trash out (alternating buttons, the sanitize your hands).

Then at the end of the day, you can buy new items to serve, new equipment, and change around your menu.

And then repeat.

Buy it on sale. Buy it not on sale. It's good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047337843', 'num_games_owned': 265, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 892, 'last_played': 1640170968}
review:
This game is as addicting as crack laced pizza.....but seriously though, fuck pizza. This game confuses me though, I thought it would be a stress reliever.....but now I serve the wrong bottle of wine to customers while I sleep. The controls are pretty simple, and the mechanics are great but.....rush hours WILL make you love this game. There's a certain euphoric feeling for every perfect day you achieve, and passing the emotionless health inspector's visit feels pretty great too! <3 you fish and beer. Suck it soups and steak. Screw you health inspector, sexy robbers, and dishes. CSD is the bomb.

11/10 would beat my meat and serve it to customers again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119624197', 'num_games_owned': 361, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1486695138}
review:
In a post apocalyptic world, a mysterious plague has killed almost all the service workers in the world. You are the lone survivor, the only one left to man the very last restaurant in the entire country, equipped with only your trusty keyboard.

Yes, you even have to clean the bathrooms by yourself, because every human that comes within 5 feet of your dining establishment is apparently some sort of disgusting creature that leaves a trail of destruction and filth behind them whenever they go to a place to dispose of bodily wastes.

If you don't mind dealing with the worst restroom users on earth, then this game is for you. Also making soup du jour really sucks. And recipe never actually changes, so technically it's not even the soup du jour, it's just soup, because it's the same EVERY day. 

Still a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041949592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 605, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1488327304}
review:
Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!

This is a Quick simulation  game.



[h1]Interface/Menu/Settings[/h1]

There are 6 save slots available.
You can play the game local.
You can toggle the game in fullscreen or windowed mode.
You can toggle the sound volume.
You can toggle the music volume.

[h1]About the game.[/h1]

The game is pretty simple, You start with 0 Star class restaurant and you job is to reach 5 stars restaurant. By doing this. You have to take the order from the customers. You have to press the right button on the keyboard in order to make the order happen. Time is flowing so you can't let the customer wait for too long. Which is bringing us to the next thing, Confusion. If you have different kind of orders from 4 different food. You have to press alot of different key buttons too before the customers are gone. 

It is very repetitive.
You can upgrade your kitchen and buy other food.
The music is pretty bad.
Controls can be really confusing as you need to press buttons on the keyboard.

[h1]Other things.[/h1]

There is a frustation factor in the game. You can't cancel your order once you have selected one.
So you have to finish the order before you are able to take a new one.

I have used an xbox controller and i have used the keyboard. To be honest, The keyboard is by far more frustating then playing on a xbox controller.  You can also play this with the mouse by clicking on the red buttons. Which could be a bit easier. if you are able to click on it. but overall i think the best way to play this is with the controller.

-------------------

I Give this game a 4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197996109751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1507, 'last_played': 1506354620}
review:
Ich liebe liebe liebe dieses Spiel.
Durch Zufall darauf gestoßen kann ich es nur jedem empfehlen, der Time Management Spiele mag.

Ich finde, dass das Spiel einen hohen Wiederspielbarkeitswert hat, da es zumindest mir, immer mal wieder Spaß macht die Burger zu braten und den Salat anzurichten. Da das Spiel gegen Ende ziemlich schwer wird, ist es auch eher von Vorteil nach einer längeren Pause zuerst noch einmal komplett von vorne anzufangen um wieder in alle Gerichte reinzukommen.

Besonders gut gefällt mir auch, dass es immer noch Updates gibt und die Battles eingeführt wurden.

Da zum Spielprinzip bereits genug geschrieben wurde gehe ich nicht weiter darauf ein.

Ein klare Kaufempfehlung für ein paar wunderbare Kochstunden :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198040720902', 'num_games_owned': 568, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 2064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1572748658}

author: {'steamid': '76561198080911696', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1435701246}
review:
A whole lot of fun and actually a little intense in difficulty at some points. Definitely play with a friend or two!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NstDnxkKAyM

author: {'steamid': '76561198189346217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 4017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3084, 'last_played': 1504322598}

author: {'steamid': '76561198040395300', 'num_games_owned': 333, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 669, 'last_played': 1488333656}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious is a game I never quite anticipated enjoying. It's a game about running a restraunt. It's a very simplified version of running a restraunt, but it is every second intense, entertaining, and fulfilling, surprisingly so. Is this Cooking Mama, PC? No. This is Quickly Prepare Food For Hundreds of Starving Customers In A Twenty Minute Sitting.

Each meal has a specific recipe, one you get to know by heart. For example, a Chicken Breast is, as follows: tenderize six times, season, cook, serve, delicious. Sounds simple, right? Now cook six in ten seconds flat. It's a bit heart racing (hard to believe, I know).

The variety of recipes is vast. There are dozens of different foods, and hundreds of ways to prepare them each. They also each have there plusses and minuses- for example, there are staple foods which always have a high demand, and there are other foods, like steak and chicken which lose demand and must be replaced on your menu every few days (No worries, this change is not permanent). You're given a liberal variety in your menu- you can design it as you please with up to six items, change them between each day, and feature a meal of the day. Each food has dozens of alternative recipes, and you can upgrade each food to make more recipes available and increase the profit of your meals.

The art and soundtrack for this game are not to be ignored. They are each terrific, and fit one another like a nice hug, and fit the genre like a puzzle piece. The music consists of smooth, jazzy tunes I enjoy listening to outside of the game on a nice rainy day, and the art is complemented by it. The art has a wonderfully individual, indie feel that you'd expect, and is very warm and homey.

Altogether, this game is not a waste, and a game I'd wholeheartedly recommend. I was surprised how much I enjoyed it-surprise yourself too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048898137', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1753, 'last_played': 1494361135}
review:
I recently purchased Cook, Serve, Delicious for $0.99 via the Steam Summer Sale. It has been the best buck that i've ever spent on any game.

If you're into Time Management games like myself, seriously give this a go.

I will be looking out for any other games released by Vertigo Gaming to give them support. They gave me a lot for $0.99 so it's only fair to return the favor!

If anyone has any questions, I'd love to answer them for you. I'm not very good at pros and cons lists, my apologies.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992856964', 'num_games_owned': 1025, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 2923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1636, 'last_played': 1643487278}
review:
These restaurant-managing sims are a guilty pleasure of mine, and I think this one will keep that part of my brain satisfied indefinitely.  Smoothly polished gameplay, good variety of items to make (all with their own quirks; like having to fry or chop ingredients, and whether you cook at the start, middle, or end of preparation), and a decent amount of fluff around the edges to round out the game.  Also it actually gets seriously challenging.

You know how these games work; if not go google "Papa's Burgeria", play for ten minutes, and then come back.  It is a big pile of minigames, and you go through a game-day worth of them at a time.

* Includes non-food chores (dishes, trash, etc) that carry special penalties if you fail them
* Health inspections, which make the chores harder for a game day
* Optional dating minigame; where a special customer shows up, and if you do well on their order they'll text you during work (reading comprehension time trial)
* Optional betting minigames, where you take on extra challenges to make more income in a day
* At-your-liesure speed/accuracy trials, guised as catering jobs, iron chef competitions, and something hilarious
* Upgrade your recipes and restaurant over time, adding new complexities to recipes
* Weekly leaderboard challenges
* Amusing tidbits to read (fake spam emails, food and event descriptions)

author: {'steamid': '76561198026370403', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1944, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1485403212}

author: {'steamid': '76561198063442191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1057, 'last_played': 1460499548}
review:
ご注文は！ハンバーガー！かしこまりました！
お肉ジュー…レタスサッサッサッ…チーズぺと！トマトポン！
フライドポテトジューッ…はいお待たせしました！
ドリンクはコーラのMですね！サッー！
えっ違う…？ダイエットコーラでしたか！それは失礼！
ウワーッラザニアの具を乗せる順番間違え…てる間に
チキンが焦げ…アーーーッ！！！
（お客様の冷ややかな目線）

と忙しい感じの料理店シミュレーションゲームです。忙しい。
料理の種類は具材を乗せるだけのものから煮る焼く揚げるまで豊富。
みんな大好きSushiもあるぞ。
操作に慣れれば難しい料理を次々とお出しすることができ、
ハマれば中毒性が高くおすすめです。

最初はオンボロのお店ですがグレードが上がるごとに
外観が変わってゆくのも素敵です。目指せ５つ星レストラン。

日本語化はないようですが、具材と英語の頭文字のキーが
対応していることが多く直感的に遊べます。
（日々届くメールはきちんと読んでおいた方がよかったり、
一部お客様との会話選択肢に焦ることがあるくらい。）

author: {'steamid': '76561198057675136', 'num_games_owned': 538, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1472617921}
review:
Before you get this game, know that it's NOT a cooking game, it's more of a run your resturant using only your keyboard game. In the game, you type letters to add things to your meals. Say customer 1 wants a hamburger. You press, "1." He wants a double burger, so you put two patties on the grill, my pressing, "m," twice. You let those grill, and go back to him. Then he asks for bacon, lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, and ketchup. So you press, "b,l,t,c,k." Then press enter and you give him his burger. That's how this game works. However, you do this at ridiculous speeds. You handle multiple orders at once, charging through them faster than any cooking game should be. You also have to handle chores, so doing the dishes and throwing trash is something you have to do. And you simply dread the moment a criminal comes and you have to quickly draw a picture of him (using your keyboard) after seeing him for only a few seconds. When rush hour comes, you prepare to let your fingers fly, as you cook lasagna by typing a repeating pattern a few times. You make sure you give people drinks as well, and you have to reorganize your menu in order to make sure your customers don't get bored. And all the meanwhile, you can fuck up. You pressed the wrong button while making the lasagna, accidentally let the burgers cook too long, didn't get to that customer in time. 

And all of this, done with your keyboard.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027274104', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1167, 'last_played': 1471295498}

review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious! Released on 8 oct, 2013.

I own this game since it released, and I think its a great game and very engaging gameplay even with the challenges, my favorite game in my steam library probably.

The plusses:

+Gameplay
+Graphics
+Music
+FOOD
+Challenges
+Mood changes and weather
+Activities outside of cooking, like cleaning
+Choose your own menu

+- Frustrating at times

- There is no negative thing if I can remember well

Final rating: 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197973630279', 'num_games_owned': 416, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1438, 'last_played': 1436849043}
review:
Fun and lighthearted. For those who look fondly back on the earlier days of PC gaming where typing games were the prime of gaming, this will give a somewhat nostalgic feel of simplicity. Simple though the concepts may be, though, the infinite depth of potential improvement of typing games means there's always more to be achieved. 


As an important added bonus, it turns out if you hone your typing skills enough to impress your coworkers they'll believe you're an efficient worker when you're actually serving up digital potatoes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087291707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1152, 'last_played': 1484798317}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044560098', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 860, 'last_played': 1623129710}
review:
This is one of those simplistic restaurant simulators, but it's just amazingly addicting. It's not a AAA title, and I'm usually a AAA junkie, but this game had me hooked. I was interested to keep going on to the next day and get a "Perfect" score. It can be very challenging, especially during rush hour, but it's a load of fun. I took my laptop out while waiting for my flight and I just wanted to keep on playing this as I waited. I couldn't believe how into the game I was. Give this one a try for sure. Highly recommended! 

8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198021082387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1442663321}
review: would you like to work in a restaurant without the low mark-ups and surly customers? then this game is for you. like a bad burger, it starts off as a big juicy piece of meat but then there's a lot of grinding to be done and more often than not, it becomes a bit dry. nice analogy amirite. still fun for a fast-paced 15 minute game. for added realism, play clips of Kitchen Nightmares and up the ante as Gordon Ramsay yells at you while you cook up virtual burgers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059838133', 'num_games_owned': 753, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 4044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 680, 'last_played': 1450331790}

author: {'steamid': '76561198073163326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1271, 'last_played': 1501067667}

author: {'steamid': '76561198019879412', 'num_games_owned': 2740, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1693587427}
review: I haven't even gotten my second star yet and I can already tell you this game is insanely addictive.  The perfect "casual" game for when you don't want to think too much about story or strategy (although there is some strategy) but still feel intensely accomplished when you have a perfect day or even just a really good perfect combo.  If you're a fan of mini-games, muscle memory, and really responsive controls, you will LOVE Cook, Serve, Delicious! And even if you aren't, you really ought to give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086883185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1496648958}

author: {'steamid': '76561198057164345', 'num_games_owned': 2928, 'num_reviews': 187, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1708880622}
review: There really aren't any other games like this. Responding to requests on the fly is an interesting concept, and one that is fleshed out very well in Cook, Serve, Delicious. It's fun, and yet also quite tense - a mere second could spell the difference between serving an order and just missing it, and as you progress through the game this happens more and more often as you encounter more and more complex foods to prepare - in fact, that's my sole criticism. Some of the foods are just a little TOO complex, sometimes detracting from the experience a bit. Aside from that though, Cook, Serve, Delicious is a "delicious" little strategy-slash-management simulator which will keep you entertained for a long time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159825318', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1512091273}
review:
I played for 17 minutes, and quickly realized that I'm way out of my league. One would have to spend hours playing to get comfortable with the controls. Practice, practice, practice! The "campaign/career" is fast paced, not for "casual" gameplay. 

There is a subtle "practice" section which allows you to practice preparing a variety of food. I highly suggest that you take advantage of that! 

The combination of controls mixed with a faced paced game that requires a moderataly high level of dexterity, coordination, and quick thinking, makes for a pretty stressful experience.

Maybe an experienced guitarist or pianist would find this game easy, but I did not. I'm not giving up, however, I will continue to play until my blood pressure goes up or I collapse from exhaustion.

If you're looking for a challenging game, this is it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001332421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1440962283}
review: If you would've told me that a game about the Foodservice Industry was fun, I'd have called you crazy. That is, until I played Cook, Serve, Delicious!

author: {'steamid': '76561198037893295', 'num_games_owned': 108, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1489286602}
review: Seriously addicting- it's also tougher than most rpg food preparation games. More lifelike. <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198160739056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1552239120}
review: was on sale for only 1 euro so it was cheap. Nothing special as a genre but gameplay works perfectly on a game like this. All orders and cooking are made with keyboard commands so its nice that you dont have to use both mouse and keyboard at the same time. Good game for resetting your brains between more story driven games. And daily challenges and iron cook challenges work also as a way of practicing your typing skills. not great but not bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010303040', 'num_games_owned': 660, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1435216405}
review:
I thought this game would be more focused on managing a store, akin to a Tycoon game. Instead, it's a very repetitive game where you just click ingredients in a certain order to make food, over and over again. There are very little ways you can control the growth of your restaurant, and the few ways available mostly just allow you to click different ingredients in a different order. 

The game is very cheap (I got it for $1 on a Steam sale), but still, not recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960356205', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1455927037}

author: {'steamid': '76561198049558306', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 645, 'last_played': 1440304233}
review:
I'd recomend a control OR change the keyboard default key bindings
The key bindings for default try to connect the food with the letter (i.e. C for cheese).... But I found it more fun when I set the main keys strokes to Q-W-E-D and had secondary keys off those.

This managment game is a great experience and nice to look at. If you find the foods that aren't too complex, the flow of filling out orders is awesome. Right amount of fun and challange

author: {'steamid': '76561197999779958', 'num_games_owned': 268, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1457597383}
review:
I am about 5 hours in to this game and it is very addicting! By giving the player a chance to own their own restaurant...Cook, Serve, Delicious gives players a unique culinary experience from their PC. I like the controller support and the gameplay is very fast paced. I work in a kitchen in real life and this game somehow keeps me interested after a long shift at work. I am going to be the best chef ever, damnit!

for now I give it a solid 7/10. 

ALLEZ CUISINE!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993757686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 1582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1450, 'last_played': 1435203762}
review:
pros: windowed mode available, soundtrack fits the theme, art style, variety of menu choices & upgrades, variety of side challenges, "battle kitchen" mode: great variety of multiplayer modes & scoreboards with new challenges every week, local co-op available (keyboard+mouse & controller), good pacing on progression, over 20+ hours of content for first playthrough, new game+ available once you have beaten the game (giving bonuses while ramping up difficulty)

cons: pressing esc in the main menu before choosing a save file to load will instantly exit the game (won't ask to confirm exit), drawing the face of the criminal who robbed you makes absolutely no sense, during a service things on the right & center of the screen will overlap your orders on the left side of the screen causing you to not know which orders are ready or still require assembly, some menu combinations are completely impossible to pull off during rush hour

Overall, the best way to play this is using both keyboard and mouse to maximize your actions-per-minute multitasking. I may never own or run a restaurant but this restaurant simulator is the next best thing. An absolute blast from start to finish.

Cook, Serve, Delicious has my highest recommendation, and also worth picking up the soundtrack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018061433', 'num_games_owned': 1506, 'num_reviews': 1585, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1434582580}
review:
Ein schönes umfangreiches Restaurant Spiel


Gerade am Anfang ist man etwas überfordert, wenn man sieht, das man die ganzen Arbeitsschritte mit Tastaturtasten bewältigen werden muss oder mit Controller Tasten. Wegen dieser Überforderung wollte ich das Spiel schon links liegen lassen, aber hat man etwas den Dreh raus, macht es Spaß und ist sogar mit jedem Gericht eine Herausforderung.

Damit einem doch irgendwann nicht langweilig wird, gibt es neue Gerichte/Getränke zu kaufen, damit mehr Geld in die Kasse kommt und man wieder etwas neues (Tasten) lernt. Irgendwann hat sich das ganze eingespielt, und man ist jeden Tag konzentriert bei der Sache und möchte jeden Kunden zufrieden stellen. Auch "kleine" Arbeiten wie Müll rausbringen, Ratten fangen etc gehört in einen Restaurant Alltag.

Es gibt mehrere Spielmodis und die Lebensmittel lassen sich upgraden. Als Ziel setzt man sich irgendwann ein 5 Sterne Restaurant zu haben. Natürlich gibt es Anforderung für so ein Vorhaben wie z.B bestimmte Anzahl von Tagen die man absolvieren muss, Hygiene Amt Kontrollen etc. Oder Foderungen für Aufrüstungen an den Geräten.
Es gibt sogar Events die man erfolgreich schaffen muss wie den Catering Service. 
Also insgesamt ein umfangreiches Geschäftserlebnis. 

Natürlich muss man, die geforderten Tastatur Tasten/Controller Tasten am besten schnell drücken, 
damit die Kunden zufrieden sind. So entsteht von Tag zu Tag eine Herausforderung keine Fehler zu machen und doch schnell zu sein. 

Eine gute Grafik und Soundtrack tragen dazu bei, das alles gut harmoniert. 

Dieser ganze Alltags Ablauf macht Spaß und man ist immer gefordert. Gut umgesetzt, auch wenn die Steuerung anfangs etwas abschreckt. Aber im Nachhinein macht es Sinn und es passt alles gut zusammen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017891454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1435929260}
review:
I have to say I wasn't really expecting much for this €0,99 investment during the Steam sale but was I ever so wrong... What a fun game this turned out to be!

Basically you buy "foods" (e.g. Pasta, Salad, Soup) and "equipment" (Tip Jar, Oven, Garbage Collector, Frying Pan, etc.) that allows you to make certain foods or collect other bonuses.

The way you make food is by performing a key combo. For example, a client comes in and asks for an Italian style lasagna. And for this you press: P (pasta), S (sauce), C (cheese), P (parmesan), ENTER (to start cooking)

Each food has a certain cooking time. If you stop cooking sooner it'll be raw, if later it'll be burnt. So you need to watch out each food's clock in order to deliver a perfectly timed dish.

Also you have to do chores in between, some foods are served on a plate which in turn has you washing a lot more dishes than you would if you were cooking something for take out, for instance.

If you can get this for cheap like I did, make no mistake, get this ASAP

author: {'steamid': '76561198041457591', 'num_games_owned': 1622, 'num_reviews': 208, 'playtime_forever': 3824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1677, 'last_played': 1538991084}
review:
CSD is just hilarious and addicting. Can't really point the finger as to why it's the latter, though. Let's see...

On the plus side, it has a decent learning curve (earn money, buy extra food or upgrades). Tasks start out extremely simple, but add up over time. And each menu item handles differently, which acts even more different than the upgraded counterpart. So there's that: a steadily increasing amount of tasks on a time limit. There's no strategy aside from picking the daily menu; anything else is just an attempt at as many perfectly executed tasks as possible.

Note that this is a very, very basic game (I bet it would play well on a PC of last century). It has cute graphics, but you'll be too busy staring at the menu orders and the menu lanes to even notice. It doesn't need better graphics either (rather the contrary: it's far more important to be able to directly grasp what to do).
The music department does deserve the praise: it may be base elevator music, but it gets stuck in your head after a while. Add to that the basic sounds of you (pretty much literally) throwing food on a platter and you're done. Oh, and of course some praising/disgruntled grumbles from your peeps.

As for gameplay...keep in mind that this is NOT a simulator; it's a time management game. It may borrow quite some elements from sim-games, but all purchases, in the end, revolve around time. It's about learning the keys to the tasks by heart (down to pour coffee, 'C' for creamer, tap 'S' for each requested sugar) and execute them well. It's both stress-inducing as relaxing, as the longer you can avoid panic, the better you'll do. So in that area, it doesn't bring much variety to the table and a lot at the same time (some recipes like soup use over half your keyboard). Again: I don't really know WHY I like this game so much, but I do.

I have to note, though, that the game is clearly aimed at a touchscreen environment. I haven't played it on android, so can't say if it's easier or harder. Suffice to say that it can become pretty hard. I'm now nearly 20 hours in (I'm amazed...they really flew by!), and I'm still learning and improving. If I'd sent a video of my average 'work day' to myself about 2 weeks ago, I'd say something like "no way I could ever perform that well".
Now only to find a real life use. ;-)

All in all: a great game. Not for everyone, but at least worth trying. :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198087972400', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1538742790}
