author: {'steamid': '76561198042399368', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 985, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1453335133}
review:
I have a x47 perfect combo after the second rush hour.
No mistakes yet.
I'm just short on $ of getting an upgrade for the Steak dish.
Perfect days give me a bonus.
I figure that if I can get a perfect day, I'll easily be able to afford it.
Second Rush Hour is over, so no need to panic.
I have this in the bag.
x52 combo.
Day is ending.
53rd order, just before closing.
Salad.
I read the order: "Mushrooms, tomatoes, greens, and carrots."
Binds are paired together  for easier serving.
I press M for Mushrooms and Tomatoes.
I press T for Tomatoes.
Too late, I relalize my mistake, as Thousand Ranch Dressing is slathered over my salad.
I freeze in absolute disbelief; I just ruined my perfect day.
I slowly press G for Green and Carrots and give the salad to my customer.
"x52 COMBO!"
Day ends.
I go to the menu.
I am $8 short of the Steak Upgrade.
Rage quit.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198028170280', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1439782643}
review:
[b]Cook, Serve, Delicious![/b] may be misconstrued as [i]just[/i] a restaurant simulator. I'm not saying it isn't also that -- mainly it is that -- but when you dig into the meaty goodness that is [b]Cook, Serve, Delicious![/b] you will find a game bristling with mini games, management options, and more content than you can scrape off the industrial cooking hood. Like grease. But it's not gre- this analogy ran away with me...

Just like how this game ran away with my heart! 

Breaking it down this game contains elements of a lot of the games I absolutely love like [i]Roller Coaster Tycoon[/i] (management sim) or [i]Wario Ware[/i] (rapid mini games) and then maybe a little bit of [i]Papers, Please[/i] (mundanity as a game). However, as somebody who has played a lot of Street Fighter and other such fighting games, I've quickly come to realize that this game has something else, and that is fighting game appeal. Sort of. The only games I get this zoned in on when things get hairy are fighting games, and where each mini game is a series of button combos and directional inputs, it is very hard for me to see the difference. 

Well, okay, you don't beat up a car for extra freaking points, but you get the idea!

[b]Cook, Serve, Delicious![/b] allows me, as the player, to hone my restaurant like a fighting game character. I'm super good at Cammy like I'm really good with beer, burgers, ice cream, fish, and lasagna. When you build your menu, you get to customize the nuanced way in which you want to play the game. Eventually I had to try all of the other foods, but for the most part I was content with a certain number of food items in such a way that I mastered them.

This game is absolutely solid and contains a great deal of twists in the way the game presents itself. And hey, if I mess up a meal I don't get mad at myself for doing so. The game is rapid fire enough that it allows the mistake to happen and then moves on. And lets face it, serving some one a bowl of just celery and soup stock can be hilarious!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994503040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1554996109}
review:
If you have always wondered if opening a restaurant will make you crazy, this is the game for you! Otherwise, it'll just make you insane. The end.

Restaurant owner simulation? Noooooo

It's also unrealistically realistic.... what do I mean? You'll tear your hair out over the 8 people per day that can't be bothered to flush for themselves but 40x perfect combos don't give you any extra money. You can't take back a food thats just mildly undercooked but serving beer in an office building is frowned upon. You'll actually hear yourself groan when that final customer comes in 3 minutes before closing... just like real life!

And you'll continuously pull your hair out because none of the upgrades seem worth getting at this point.... no supercooker or auto servers here. You'll be doing the same set of chores till the day you die... because even with a dishwasher, you still have to do 50% of the dishes.

So yes, I recommend it, but only because it describes itself as a hardcore restaurant sim. I thought I purposely avoided those -- I must have bought it by accident because I kinda just wanted a casual management role.

review:

You'll start with a few thousand dollars and 20 foods to choose from for your menu, as well as a host of restaurant equipment and a virtual email account that connects you to the people of SherriSoda Tower. Nearly everything is unlocked from the start of the game for you to purchase; 

Rate: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198042857737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1075, 'last_played': 1487454885}
review: This game is very hectic...but for real the game is great and is so much fun to play, especially if you're bored and looking for something to do. The gameplay is almost entirely keyboard oriented but a mouse and gamepad (controller) will work to. The selection of foods to add to the active menu and the speciality foods add alot of variation into the game making it all the more fun. It's a great game to play but it can be just as or more intense than a competitive match in CSGO. I guarantee that you will not find a better cooking game for this price nor will you dislike it if you buy it. It is very hard to hate this cooking masterpiece. Also it can help quite nicely for people who can't type without looking at the keyboard because you need to remember some of the keys.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071285118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 656, 'last_played': 1637209526}
review:

Pros:

+ Challenging

+ Nice art.

Cons: 
- Once in a while the game will crash, usually after an Iron Cook Challenge. I've only had it happen once so far.

Thanks to Felicia Day for showing me this game on her Twitch stream.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053083938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1435020640}
review:
I think what we have here is a well designed sim game that is more of a precise button mashing extravaganza than an actual game. There are plenty of features, but it comes off as rather tedious and at times frustrating.

I don't think there's much detail to give on this game. You set your menu, make some food (which is basically intense button mashing on a timer), then you get the happy hour rush and button mash faster, and then eventually the day ends. You feel tired, you feel bored, and you feel annoyed. Having worked in the service industry before, I can tell you, this delivers a true-to-life experience. The only way it could be more real is if you were sweaty, covered in food, and sleep deprived... Maybe we have to wait for the Oculus Rift version...

Anyways, you have to hit each food order's buttons precisely and it turns out to be a rather frustrating experience. The game looks like a tough casual game, but it's far from it. It's a tough hard-core game with a casual UI/graphics that requires fast reflexes, precision and planning. I don't think it's a bad game, but it's not the kind of game that interests me or would interest those with similar tastes to mine. I just found it to be too tedious to be fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960428254', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1434754466}
review:
Ever had a "waiter dream?" Play with caution.
Playing this game gave me anxiety on the first level, despite being well made and fun.  I started feeling like I was at work, but falling behind on orders and customer service hard and fast, even though I knew intellectually that I was at home after a long day, and lucky to not be closing, my guts didn't. Expect to fail a bunch early on in the game; and if you are a waiter failing this much might give you a panic attack.
If you spend all day sitting, staring at a screen counting the minutes until you are off the clock, this could be a fun and exciting game for you. 
If you have a job where you have to move fast to keep up with customer demand, know what you're getting into. The makers did a great job, but maybe tooo good of a job.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040000742', 'num_games_owned': 252, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1434461995}
review:
Обычная игра про ресторан, такая же на первый взгляд как на IOS или Android каких сотни. Но эти разработчики добавили в нее нечто иное. Что бы приготовить блюдо его нужно купить, что бы его готовить нужно купить фритюр и так по каждому пункту меню. Суть ясна и не невыполнима, сделай свой ресторан на 5 звезд. 

Что бы не скучать есть игровые режимы их около 5-6 (на скорость, память или ловкость) они дают некое подобие адской кухни, где призами являются повора из других игр, фильмов и комиксов за которых можно продолжать соревноваться в списках лидеров или с другом. Такой себе таймкиллер на 10-20 часов к тому же очень приятно и удобно сделанный. За чисто символическую сумму в 20 рублей я залип. За 249 рублей такую можно приобрести на планшет и играть в общественном транспорте, но не на компьютере.

5 куриных крылышек из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198031113887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1023, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1629235669}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009922173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1526951490}
review:
An addictive game that keeps you coming back!

Cook, Serve, Delicious at first seemed like your typical flash game you'd find on an old website but it's so much more than that. Select what YOU want to serve at your restaurant, rotate new foods every day if you want, or just serve the same thing for a few days (not recommended!). This game is a lot deeper and more deeper than I thought it would be. I assumed this game was just a cooking game, the generic "Press A for cooking" game, but it's strategy, time management, and customer satisfaction. The game itself has great mechanics and being able to bind actions to different keys is very helpful. This game is so much fun and I suck at describing games. If you find it for under 5$, get it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198104675383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1435350192}
review: Very Delicious Game, Makes me Fell Hungry evertime,

author: {'steamid': '76561198066148512', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1434755861}
review: Holy Hell. This game is intense. I have been working in the food service industry for over three years now, and i have to say that this game captures the stress and fun of working in a kitchen. After the first work day in the rat hole restaurant, I felt as if i had gone through a lunch rush at work, and it felt satisfying. If youve never worked in a kitchen or enjoy working in food service, this is the game for you to play every once in a while. If you work in a restaurant and hate your job, i would stay away from this piece.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015397133', 'num_games_owned': 1960, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1942, 'last_played': 1647929803}
review: I might be addicted to this game. I keep coming back to it over and over again. I leave it alone for awhile, but the simplicity and yet real strategy you can put into the game makes this game fun long after you think you've mastered all the mechanics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146837151', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1566, 'last_played': 1583629250}
review: This is an excellent game for the price, particularly when on sale. I am generally a fan of cooking sims anyway, but this game is wonderful. The art is charming and the music original. There are so many different challenges and things to unlock that you get a fair bit of gameplay from it. It can also be quite challenging as during busy spells you have to really remember which key does what! 10/10 would recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056092379', 'num_games_owned': 887, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1690076501}
review: I just want to say this game looks AMAZINGLY fun. Reminds me of that Spongebob Lights Camera Pants minigame from my childhood. Unfortuately, as of right now, the Linux (Ubuntu at least) version has issues with gamepads. My Logitech F310 works for any other game I own, but not this one. The game DOES recognize it, but doesn't respond to any button presses. Until they fix it, I'm afraid I have to say stay away. The developer(s) seems very helpful in the forums, but have not found a solution yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076453041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1220, 'last_played': 1449679143}
review: I probably enjoy this game a little too much!  The "hardcore" description is most accurate.  This is a button mashing, mallet wielding, mneumonic inventing, chaos managing, toilet flushing nighmare of a joyride.  Lasagna for love!

author: {'steamid': '76561197974162527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1308, 'last_played': 1664844552}
review:
It's like Restaurant Tycoon meets WarioWare.  It's very much a "flow" game, at least during the day, with a lot of attention devoted to triaging the proper order to attend to food orders to keep more slots open and make sure you don't get bogged down at once, while getting absorbed in the quick little minigames involved with preparing each dish.

Meanwhile, there's enough of a "strategic" layer to keep things interesting with prioritizing upgrades and juggling your active menu, and it keeps adding in more layers as you go; I do appreciate that once they unlock the "flirting-on-the-job" minigame, it just asks "are you interested in dating men or women", not "which are you".  (Though it doesn't let you select "both"!)

Some of the upgrade descriptions and spam e-mails are also quite funny, making me laugh out loud in a few cases.

All in all, probably the best dollar I've spent in a while.  10/10 would accidentally serve customer raw chicken while the health inspector's watching again

fuck lasagna tho srsly, that's some fighting-game-combo shit right there

author: {'steamid': '76561198065534982', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1583117720}
review:
Compré este juego por dos razones, la primera, por que salía a muy buen precio por las ofertas y segundo, por que pense que sería divertido para mi hermana, cuando lo jugué por primera vez para probarlo me lleveuna sorpresa muy grande y es que este juego puede llegar a ser muy adictivo y complicado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018894642', 'num_games_owned': 1516, 'num_reviews': 300, 'playtime_forever': 1809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1527519726}
review: Actually a pretty fun game, and a great price during the Steam Summer sale. If you like games where you start off at the lowest point to rise to the ranks in a chosen profession then this is for you. It can really be frustrating at times too when you have a bunch of chores like doing dishes pop up at rush hour. I grew up with my parents owning a restaurant my whole life and the frustrating part is true to life, lol. Enjoyable, fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150217948', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1047, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1611521045}
review:
Un petit jeu bourré d'inventivité pour vous rendre vos sessions sur Cook,Serv Delicious ! absoluement géniales ! Des musiques entrainantes que l'on aime écouter et fredonner, des contrôles à éclater de rire lorsque la "Rush Hour" arrive !

author: {'steamid': '76561198067651140', 'num_games_owned': 2126, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1434892474}
review:
[table]
    [tr]
        [td][h1]You'll Enjoy This Game If You Like:[/h1][/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Customisation and Unlockables[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Frantic Gaming[/td]
        [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Working for minimum wage[/td]
     [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Time management[/td]
     [/tr]
[/table]

I was expecting a Cooking Mama clone but it actually seperates itself out by using a series of key presses to complete your orders rather than physically prepeating the food yourself. This is good or bad depending on your tastes but it does make for a special kind of manic gaming that captures your complete attention.

The game is difficult, there's no denying that, but after a bit of practice muscle memory will take over and you'll be serving pizzas and salads at super human speeds. One thing that I would suggest is to map the key bindings for each individual meal as if it doesn't make sense to you it will slow you down massively. For example, for some reason unbeknownst to me, to add sausage to a pizza, you must hit the "M" key - I changed it to "S"... you know, for "Sausage"...

There's money management, food menu management and time management at play here with lots to think about before you even start your day cooking. Buying new equipment and foods, upgrading them and perhaps most importantly, making sure you select the right menu to get the most out of the day are all key to your success.

A lot of fun can be had here but as mentioned the prework (which is equally is fun) is also required.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044245840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1491996155}
review:
Fun game.
Challenges your mind with multitasking and quick thinking.
If you are into repetitive strains on your mind then this is great.
If you are looking for a more laid back experience, you will not have it here.
This game makes cooking interactive, hectic and fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988591838', 'num_games_owned': 380, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1687441557}
review:
Very similar to the first game "Ore No Ryomi" that came out in like 2004-2005 which was great. (The game is still good, just was an old Game Maker game)

You need to manage orders/chores by performing a microgame of sorts to cook the food and each one has a time limit before the customer gets fed up and leaves. Very fast paced and somewhat difficult as it relies on quickly figuring out what to do (as orders change from customer to customer) and then using the right ingredients.

Only problems I have is that I felt like it is overcomplicating a game that is meant to be simple by adding variables to what food you can serve depending on variables such as if it's a fatty food, creates a lot of dishes etc. The first game was quite simple in this regard. Also removed the morning paper from each day which was pretty funny to read in the first game.

As you need to make very quick decisions and know the hotkeys to place the ingredients, it's very important that the game can properly convey this at a glance. Unfortunately it does this a bit worse than the original game but it should be fine if you spend awhile to adjust.

Overall a good game to play for awhile. Works best on keyboard due to keys matching the first letter of each ingredient.



It's good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073356653', 'num_games_owned': 508, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1507190891}

author: {'steamid': '76561198132910613', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1644464275}

However, the soundtrack is upbeat at rush hours and slow for the rest of the day making my virtual resturaunt day easier. Make your menu however you feel. This game is fantastic! Buy it! What are you still waiting for? Buy it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042530935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 525, 'last_played': 1524768202}
review: Cook, Serce, Delicious! to gra typu First Person Cooker, w której gracz wciela się w postać zdegenerowanego sprzedawcy smażonych kurczaków. Pnąc się po drabinie sukcesu nasz antagonistyczny protagonista powoli zdobywa wystaraczające wpływy u tak zwanych "Żelaznych Szefów Kuchni", którzy szybko dostrzegają jego potencjał i przyjmują go do swojego gangu. Rozgrywka jest uroizmacona różnymi romansami rodem z Mass Effecta oraz atakami szalonych fanatyków wegetarianizmu na twoje imperium alkoholu, kobiet lubujących pizzę i przepysznych dań z całego świata. 11/10 - true masterpiece

author: {'steamid': '76561198065485063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1109, 'last_played': 1453030558}
review: A nice game to play, if your bored. :) With a high difficulty to keep you busy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056035662', 'num_games_owned': 548, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1075, 'last_played': 1469388794}
review:
You get lots of orders at a time, only to find yourself under pressure to cook all of them exactly right and serve them in time. On top of that, there's (almost) always chores to make: doing the dishes, taking out the garbage, setting up rat traps... not that fancy, is it? And still, when you manage to do everything just fine, it feels SO satisfying! The game manages to keep that tension up most of the time, making you feel that you're just one step away from screwing up your combo -because, after all, you are-, and yet it always seems to be a manageable challenge. It's just exhilarating to get everything right!

On top of that, the atmosphere is sublime - the graphics are cute, and all the music and sounds fit together perfectly. There's nothing that feels out of place in here - the attention to detail is exquisite.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133405124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1449035294}
review:
Fast paced game where you have to multitask orders given to you from customers, routine work like taking out the trash, and the occasional robbery.

This game has a great interface, so players with high APM can process large ammounts of orders and tasks with just their keyboards.
Also has a nice touch of humor, added with the artwork and music creates a great atmosphere.

Very addictive, combined with lots of replay value will make you spend hours if not tens of hours on this game.

9/10
Recommended for anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026808738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1187, 'last_played': 1499059758}

author: {'steamid': '76561198039113886', 'num_games_owned': 891, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1967, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1906, 'last_played': 1524260336}
review:
A cooking and restaurant simulator were you press a bunch of keys/buttons as fast as possible in order to satisfy your customers.

[list]
[b][u]Pros[/u][/b]
[*]Addicting gameplay
[*]A lot of food to choose for your menu
[*]Tons of upgrades (Restaurant and Food) that changes the format of button pressing.
[*]Challenges/Tournaments
[*]Local-Co op 
[*]Great replay-value
[/list]

[list]
[b][u]Con[/u][/b]
[*]At times, a few of the food choices are difficult to pull of if you put it in your "Daily Special" slot like SOUP and PASTA >.<. ([b]NOTE[/b]: [i]I played with Keyboard, so it might be easier with a controller[/i]).
[/list]

This is probably one of my favorite games here on Steam. I highly reccomend it if you are into these types of games. I definitely will continue to play this game for its challenges and being the "World's Best Restaurant."

author: {'steamid': '76561198115151260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 633, 'last_played': 1651972980}
review:
This is quickly becoming one of my favorite games. It's quick to pick up, but depending on your typing skills can be difficult to master. The difficulty doesn't ramp up too quickly (in fact, at times, I wish it ramped up faster), so you have plenty of time to practice dishes before the speed becomes overwhelming. Where I initially thought there was a potential for the game to go stale relatively quickly, the amount and frequency of upgrades available for the food make sure you're never bored with what you're serving. Additionally, I love that the opportunities to play the Weekly Challenges, Endurance Challenges, etc are available right from the beginning, so that you can play them whenever, though I wouldn't recommend trying it until you've had some practice!

Overall, this adorable, fun game was well worth the $10 I paid for it, so if you're on the fence, buy it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198055433233', 'num_games_owned': 1911, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 1369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1527445909}
review:
The most hardcore-Casual restraunt simulater there is!

Easy to pick up and fun to master controls (Gamepad or personally keyboard :3) with a vast amount of recipies you have to cook....FAST!

The game can be forgiving but also quite tough, you have to stay calm and keep on your toes, making perfect with practice  and planning accoringly putting you memory and fingers to the test.

Very addicting - Simular to pringles, you start one day but when you pop you cant stop :3
but very fun to play in short burts too if you have the control.

Can be very cheap and I definately recoment giving it a shot, not quite a typing teacher but definately a test of your cool and reactions!

author: {'steamid': '76561197968057076', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1877, 'last_played': 1438679526}
review:
Recommended for people who lost their jobs as border security officers in glorious People's Republic of Arstotzka.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167277670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1422187682}
review:
昔コントローラーを2台壊すほどハマったPSの「俺の料理」というゲームにかなり近いです。
違いは直感的だったコントローラー操作ではなくキーボードで調理する事、細かく要求されるトッピングに瞬時に対応しないといけない事。
なので、タイピングソフトの様な面もあるかな？
レストランを経営、というシュミレーションではなく調理場に立って朝から晩まで忙しく料理を作ってお客さんに提供し続けるゲーム。
タイピング完了して即サーブできる料理と、焼くなどの作業で10秒くらいしてからじゃないとサーブできない料理があり、お客さんが待ってくれる時間は限られているので効率よく調理していく必要があります。
英語が読めなくてもだいたいは理解できます。(ゲーム内のメールフォルダに1日数通来るメールは大抵ダイレクトメール的などうでも良いものなので読まなくて大丈夫です)
たまにやりたくなるし、少しの時間でも遊べる良いゲームだと思います。
過酷な昼ラッシュを捌ききる達成感もあり、食べ物系のミニゲームとか好きな方は300円前後のセール期間などにいかがでしょうか？

author: {'steamid': '76561198069236065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1159, 'last_played': 1434526250}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a fantastic restaurant simulator. You get to choose everything that occurs, including whether to invest in certain equipment for certain foods, what goes on the menu in any given day, and decide what kind of restaurant YOU want to run. The sound effects are absolutely fantastic and Jonathan Geer did a really great job with the soundtrack. There's more that I want to say, which is why I made a video review on it, which you can view [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7Af6smvGUwM] here.[/url]

I would go as far as recommending this game at full price. However, if you want to wait for a sale, you'd be a fool not to pick it up at a cheaper price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017232540', 'num_games_owned': 1474, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1630, 'last_played': 1683022290}
review:
Um divertido jogo de time management culinário. A sistemática do jogo consiste em vc acertar a combinação das receitas - através do mouse, e teclado - acertando a sequencia dos ingredientes, e tempo de preparo dos pratos, sofrendo a pressão dos seus clientes impacientes (chatos). Vc vai se sentir na pela da sua mãe quando cozinha, pois não terá a ajuda de nenhum funcionário, nem para lavar louça, nem para tirar o lixo, muito menos para matar os ratos. 

A sua recompensa claro será o dinheiro, que vc utilizará para investir em mais pratos, e equipamentos. e tornar seu restaurante em um 03 estrelas do guia Michelin. Também há opção de competição online para tentar tornar o jogo mais dinâmico.

Depois de horas de jogando este jogo, ganhei meu diploma de Gastronomia 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198079828169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1669572130}
review:
Borrowing heavily from free online flash restaurant sims such as the [i]Papa's Pizzaria[/i] series, [i]Cook, Serve, Delicious![/i] is different enough to make it worth its asking price.

First off, it's much more streamlined than those online games. Everything in the game can be accomplished with hotkeys, so there's no mouse work required if you don't want to use it. It also has controller support, but I found just as much if not more success with a keyboard. This lack of a mouse "decorating" stage also makes this game much less stressful than the Papa ones. From your main screen you can see everything that's cooking, chores that need to be done, and orders that are coming in, and you can tend to each of these with a simple button press. While it's very overwhelming and stressful (by design) nothing ever feels completely out of your control.

On sale you can't go wrong with this game and it's worth full price to anyoen who enjoys business/restaurant sims or time management games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025472290', 'num_games_owned': 607, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1466985841}
review:
I was skeptical when I bought this for $1.00 on the 2015 Summer Sale, but I love it. It's casual and silly, but it's loads of fun, and there's lots of depth. Plus I'm learning some Spanish by looking up each food as I start serving it. (I wish that were a feature of the game, but whatever.)

Pros:
 + Cute graphics
 + Nice sound effects
 + Keyboard shortcuts for almost everything
 + Lots of depth for replay value

Cons: 
 - Some menus don't allow keyboard use
 - That's pretty much it

Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064198421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 846, 'last_played': 1434776059}
review:
So it's a cooking game, but definitely so much fun! Easy yet challenging. Beautifully done for the price. Humor within in game emails. Not sure how anybody would play with a controller. Using a keyboard is the easiest so you can pound out food combos really fast. Iron chef section is fun, however, if you're just starting, having the extra slots for food orders is very challenging. Think about what foods you purchase before you start. You can test them out before purchasing. I highly recommend doing so. Some food orders take a lot of work and can slow you down or just down right slay you in a rush hour. There are some improvements I wish that could be made. It is so minor, but I wish we could choose our restaurant colors. I'm only to the first star, but I wish my restaraunt was a not white with red n yellow. I'd prefer blue n purple or some other combo. I also wish you could purchase a new restaurant or discover another elsewhere so the window you look out of looks different. A window over looking the ocean with seagulls flying and umbrellas would be super cute. Also, there are rainy days. I love this touch. For the price, I am thoroughly impressed with this game. 
Have fun cooking!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027388002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 711, 'last_played': 1470721279}
review:
If you're looking for a fun short game to fill your library - one that you'll play while waiting for someone getting out from the shower, this is the one!

Very intense keyboard smashing (hitting a few different keys in sequence within a second) food stall simulation game. 

This game is straightforward 1) cook 2) serve 3) customer's satisfaction but it does provide a variety of playstyle by letting you decide which dish you wanna put on the menu before the work day starts. Eg. on a rainy day, Food A trends. on a hot day, Food B stinks. Things like requests and challenges give the game a bit more goal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064016758', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1434597337}
review:
As the Chef of Cook Serve Delicious, it was hard rising up through the ranks of food, my manager screaming at me to put tomato sauce on raw dough, customers refusing to throw money on the table, no, they had to have some mother effing tip jar, and to make matters worse, when i actually gave them the right food they still stomped off pissed off because their god damn beer wasn't foamy enough. Or maybe the fact that i couldn't just throw empty cups at people for them to serve themselves their own soft drinks! I mean why?! Are you crippled? Apparently they are, tipless sons of beaches. 

But you know what.. I was fine with all of that... Until I realized I was missing ingredients and had to click the effing SPACEBAR! I mean why?! There's enough room on the beginning keybinding page to NOT have to press SPacebar. So as my customers refused to throw their tips at me, I had to figure out that the reason they were stomping off pissier then a bunch of somalian pirates forced to listen to Brittany Spears at seaside as they run away from her strange wavern roars is because half the friggen ingrediants were missing from my point of vision and guess what? Nothing led me to see, hey, there's an image over here to click over to ANOTHER friggen page of conveluded bull jizz that I didn't even know about.

So on my last day of work, both my manager and I threw beer mugs, uncooked chicken, raw potatos, and pizza dough at people then screamed YOU'RE FAT ENOUGH as we threw lettuce at them for their Bull jizz salads. And... They friggen liked it!

My god! We worked so hard with so many pissy people for so long that when we started throwing crappy food at them they started to like it! It's like Stockholm syndrome for restraunts!

Life lesson of the day, just throw raw dough at people, they'll get the messege, if not, start firing the raw chicken at them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014926595', 'num_games_owned': 775, 'num_reviews': 967, 'playtime_forever': 3229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3214, 'last_played': 1472191751}
review:
Original Review:

Too much d*mn reading involved.   If you want action and don't want to be bothered reading every little thing it shoves down your throat, look elsewhere.


2nd Chance Review:

Okay, so after giving it some thought, I decided to give this game a 2nd chance.  I felt I may have been a tad too hasty in negatively rating this game after being enraged by the bombardment of text in the tutorial.  At the time, I only had 2 achievements.  I now have all 52 achievements.

This game isn't as bad as I thought.  It provides a nice challange and provides a nice time waster.


Pros:

Nice music
Great meals  (With many recipes to keep you occupied)
Great challenges
Amusing Spam E-mails (I leave the spam filter off)


Cons:

Can be a tad repetitive (You can change up your menu, but after a while, you may get bored of the mechanics)
Cumbersome tutorial (Bombards you with text when you just want to jump in and figure it out for yourself.  I feel it's best to figure this one out without a tutorial)


I know, I've had a change of heart, but I recommend this title.  It helps you organize tasks, organize priorities, and understand the basics of operations Management.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197972200330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1434595358}
review: Incredibly fun, surprisingly deep game. It's not what I expected, exactly, but the game actually has a lot more variety than it appears at first glance, and it does an impressive job at simulating peak-time pressure.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963852059', 'num_games_owned': 927, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1440204799}
review:
While it's basically an ascended Flash game, Cook Serve, Delicious is surprisingly addictive.  You take on the role of a new restaraunteur, manage your menu, serve customers, and perform daily chores.  Food service and chores are carried out via keybinds, allowing you to excel at them once you start comitting things to memory. 

The game isn't without its problems, however.  Some aspects of the game run counter to logic, such as leaving food on the menu too long actually detracting from your "buzz."  The near-inability (in the beginning) to avoid the 3 "Fatty McFats" foods penalty is quite annoying too.

In the end though, Cook, Serve, Delicious is a fun distraction.

author: {'steamid': '76561198188141949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 846, 'last_played': 1665428881}

review: By far the best food prep game I've played. Much like Cooking mama or any of the other popular flash/app games. Unlike those though, this feels like a full game. Simple concept, lots of different recipes and challenges to master. Just enough story and distractions to keep the 'story' interesting. Also, being able to remap keybindings is a huge plus. Highly recommend it to anyone who wants a game they can play in small increments. 13 hrs and counting in my first few days, quite addicted.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084395274', 'num_games_owned': 668, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 912, 'last_played': 1505337766}
review:
The game is awesome, at the first look you can think it's just a browser game on Steam, but when you start playing it turns really addicting!
The game brings a big challenge, you need to serve your customers while you do simple chores like wash dishes and throw the trash out, and awkward chores like flushing the toilet (apaprently the customers can't do it) and fending off robbers.
Some recipes, you just need to press a key or two, but for others you need lots of ingredients, and every upgrade adds more ingredients, turning the game really challenging.
The game also have an enjoyable atmosphere, with good music and simple, but still pretty graphics.
The only bad things about the game are the low variety of recipe, the slow progression of stars, and we should be able to change our restaurant's appearence, it only changes when we get a new star.
The game is simple, but still addicting, great for fans of this kind of games, and have a good atmosphere for new players in this kind of game.
7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198085540427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1440512604}
review:
Also known as Cock Server Delicious when you type the title too fast

author: {'steamid': '76561198015337264', 'num_games_owned': 1296, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1434573926}
review:
50% recommend, 50% don't reccomend, but let me explain:

Cook, Serve, Delicious is absolutely a fun game.  But unfortunately it's not an original game.  I've played variations of this on 'free' flash based webgame sites for literally decades now.  It makes it a little hard to justify the price.  Now what it does, it does very well.  The action is faced paced and the graphics are very good.  But ultimately I keep coming back to the fact that this is essentially a 'diner' game much like I've played before.

So in the end, if that's the type of game you like, then you'll like this game a lot.  Just don't expect a whole lot of innovation.

review:
When I first saw it on the steam sale front page, I thought it was one of those overly priced IPad restaurant city wannabe games.

But its not. Think of it as, when a time management restaurant city type game meets a keyboard word typing game. But instead of typing words, you're typing keybinds to certain ingredients to create a pizza.

It's intense af. Because if you're a perfectionist like me, you'd want to get a full perfect combo. 

For the price I paid, it's great game and time waster.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054467838', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1499132966}
review:
一款經營餐廳的遊戲，
比較特別的是藉由敲打熱鍵來完成顧客想要的餐點，
途中也會遇到得清掃廁所、倒垃圾洗碗盤等等的狀況，

簡單來說是這樣的遊戲
+敲打鍵盤熱鍵來完成餐點
+途中也會遇到要掃廁所、倒垃圾、洗碗的狀況
+一切都得靠鍵盤熱鍵來處理
+菜單可以自訂、熱鍵的按鈕可以自訂
+比較像是考驗反應速度和鍵盤位置記憶的遊戲

author: {'steamid': '76561198107939318', 'num_games_owned': 809, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1434418265}
review:
The interface is crude.  It is not well made like the Flipline (Papa's) franchise.  The most practical approach is to use a keyboard/mouse combinative input, where the optimal approach changes for every task.  Default configuration is M for mustard on a corndog, but it is Y on another dish because M represents something else.  It would be best to use the keyboard for everything as it's so much faster, but having to use the arrow keys along with the rest of the keyboard makes it quite unatural to play as a typing game.

I think the food items' bonuses and maluses are well planned, and conceptionally the game is fine, but the implementation is very lacking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053233264', 'num_games_owned': 4490, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1441294564}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious is a stressful, somewhat difficult but rewarding game. Requires extreme focus and will fatigue you within the first half hour. I can see putting in 30+ hours in this game easily.


Pros:
Colorful, sharp graphics
Decent music
Challenging gameplay
Tons of achievements
Cheap price

Cons:
Eyes Burn
Extreme fatigue after 30 minutes of playtime
Makes you hungry

author: {'steamid': '76561198036334172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1690859424}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198061391634', 'num_games_owned': 919, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 1102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 527, 'last_played': 1528377733}
review:
Pros:
+ satisfying sound effect
+ nice music
+ simple hectic fun touch-typing gameplay
+ challenge mode
+ local co-op

Cons:
- too much "up" and "down" parameter for every food
- I wish the bind key marked in ingredient as a capital letter
- 20 days to go to first star is kinda a little dragging

Cook, Serve, Delicious is a simple and weird game. It feels more like shortcut-memory game, where every recipe is have different way to cook and ingredient. It's fun and addictive. Recommended!

EDIT: for more actual review

author: {'steamid': '76561197979473310', 'num_games_owned': 143, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1434810646}
review: It has 10$ worth of content. It's just locked behind a grind wall. It took me 3 hours to get to 2nd star resturant, 20 days ingame, it will take anouther 20 days to get 3rd star. With a total of 5 star resturants it's ~15 hours for the career mode alone, if you wanted to unlock all the recipes (minigames) it could take 30+ hours. That's the length of an average 60$ AAA game. A 10$ game should take 5-10 hours and be amazing. This game could have been amazing, but it feels like it was designed for mobile gaming.

review: I put a ton of hours into this game on mobile and liked it so much I bought it again on Steam.  In a way it's hard to believe there aren't more games like this already.  The variety in recipes and the consistently tough but satisfying gameplay are very well balanced and it has that addicting "just one more shift" quality that makes it hard to put down.  I highly recommend Cook, Serve, Delicious!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042210751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1618568502}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious is a restaurant management sim / typing simulator. Now, I know you’re all thinking this game can’t mustard up anything special, but trust me when I say the steaks are high. This game is not for chickens and if you aren’t well seasoned it’ll be out of the frying pan and into the fryer with you. CSD keeps dishing out special orders as thing progress, spicing things up with competitions, catering, even a chef dating sim. What you have here is the cutting edge of interactive culinary entertainment, so check, please, and see this 5-star game. I’m sure after you’ve had a taste of what this game offers, you’ll eat it right up. That is, if it can cater to your tastes.

Bon appetit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085918222', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1676364315}
review:
Ever thought of being a chef? 
This game doesn't teach u how to be a chef, it lets u experience the chaos that happens in a restaurant setting
Learn about the importance of customer satisfaction and the risks that have to be taken to achieve success.
Nah im just kidding

This is a simple arcadie game where the gameplay is about you pushing buttons(No reference to stanley parable)
Simply put, this is a memory game.
It has excellent replay value and very addictive.

Very well made game in general, gentle learning curve, challenging and fun to play

Buy this game if u:
Want to improve ur memorizing skills
Are Bored
Have too much money
Enjoy pressing buttons
Likes the idea of 2D food

Dont buy this game if u:
Don't want to improve ur memorizing skills
Aren't Bored
Don't have too much money
Don't enjoy pressing buttons
Disike the idea of 2D food

author: {'steamid': '76561198131924289', 'num_games_owned': 2210, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1435088351}
review:
Graphic── 畫面：☆☆☆
Character──角色：─
Scenario──劇情：☆☆☆
Single player──單機：☆☆☆☆
Multiplayer──多人：？
Durable──耐玩度：☆☆☆☆
Feature──特殊賣點：餐廳經營+眼明手快。
Rating──整體給分：8.5/10

Gameplay：
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oZENQieOWKw

認識我的人都知道，我基本上不玩經營類的遊戲，
這款除了特價外，另一個特別去玩的理由，是因為朋友小愛特別喜歡這類型的遊戲。
以下簡單介紹。

遊戲一開始，會讓玩家嘗試上菜。
熱狗、飲料等，真正進入主畫面後，可以單人遊戲也能Co-op，
當然，要先好好練習！所以先玩單人經營。

單人模式中，沒有菜色就不能開店，所以必須先用開店資金添購幾道料理，
最初別選太複雜的，熱狗、啤酒、生魚片都是簡單好賺的首選。
有了菜色，記得加道Menu上，然後就能開店囉！
開店後，右上角時間會慢慢跑，一秒約等於遊戲兩分鐘左右。
除了客人點餐外，也會有「馬桶不通」、「抓到老鼠」、「垃圾傾倒」等小問題要解決。
中餐與晚餐時間會有大量客人，請小心！
每完成一道料理，都會有Combo，Combo越高，越容易往下一星級邁進！

大家一起來經營五星級餐廳吧！（當然，我也還在努力中）

author: {'steamid': '76561198095203095', 'num_games_owned': 831, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1527404031}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970566417', 'num_games_owned': 462, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1417208077}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious is a restaurant "super mini game" where you manage a menu (selecting your dishes and their options), unlock new meals to make, and participate in a few sundry mini games.

The meat of the game is in the daily cooking, which progresses through a morning, noon, afternoon, and evening - each punctuated by rush hours, inspections, chores, and picky persnicky customers that demand you make their food JUST SO. Like some other typing game, you make your food by assembling it with hotkeys on the keyboard (or you can use the mouse if you're not feeling awesome that day) and the faster you type the quicker you cook. Rush hours can get pretty intense, especially if you have complex food items with many options like hamburgers or pizza, where you also have to manage the oven and deliver the hot food to the customer while in the middle of prepping the next one!

Additionally, with the cooking arena, daily challenges, a rather nice "combo" system to force you to keep the menu fresh and a few side quests (like dating or gambling), CSD keeps an enjoyable experience reasonably well seasoned and fresh in small portions. Wholeheartedly worth the money, and a big tip to boot!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018610494', 'num_games_owned': 1014, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 3516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3396, 'last_played': 1580371067}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018763605', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 10848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2953, 'last_played': 1505360548}
review:
Super fun restaurant-themed game! I wouldn't call it a sim because you don't have a huge amount of control over the restaurant. It's more of a fast-paced strategy game that requires good memory and quick reflexes. 

You are basically a one-person restaurant. You have to set a menu each day, and you don't want to keep the same food on for too long because you'll recieve a penalty (keeps you from just breezing through the game after getting good with a few foods). This becomes deceptively complicated as you go. Too many unhealthy foods and people will find your restaurant less appealing (resulting in less customers), but people tend to like comfort foods when it's raining. More complex recipes generally make you more money, but so does getting an unbroken streak of perfect orders, which complicated dishes make it harder to do. And then what do you do when you get one of the special challenges that offers a huge cash bonus if you use certain recipes and get a long streak with them, but they're ones you're not very good at?

The recipes themselves amount to QTEs, effectively. Each key (or button, if using a controller) corresponds to an ingredient or action. I haven't played with a controller, but the keybindings for each recipe are fully customizable so you can go with makes the most sense to you. And you'll need to do that, because you can't be as fast as the game requires without memorizing some combos. It's very challenging and nerve-wracking at first, but it feels really satisfying when you get to the point where your fingers just fly over the keys so fast, the ingredient screen barely showed up.

There's also a significant time management factor when you're serving customers. You might want to start steaks and potatoes before fast things like ice cream and drinks because you know the former will have a cooking time after you get the ingredients together... But maybe it's rush hour and you're trying to shove as many people out the door as possible, so you take all the fast orders as they come and only get the slow ones when the customer is about to ditch.

Profits are the main way you progress through the game. You'll advance in restaurant stars as you go, unlocking more and more twists and challenges, such as dealing with health inspectors or getting robbed. The money you earn can buy upgrades for your restaurant, new recipes, or upgrades for existing recipes (which raise the price of the dish but also add complexity). 

The game can get reptitive because it ramps up slowly, but I think that's also a plus. This means more levels, so the fun lasts longer. This isn't the sort of game you marathon anyway, but one you pick up and play a few levels whenever you've got the time.

The game is definitely worth its full price, so if you see it on sale, jump on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100176389', 'num_games_owned': 655, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1454828796}
review:
Playing this game is probably one of the best decisions I have ever made in my life.
To the simple man, this game may seem a simple button masher, but look beneath its simple exterior, and a whole world of truths unfolds. We see the story of a few simple people coming to a simple resteraunt, but as the resteraunt grows, so do the bonds between them. 
We see Leo, a major playah, and his never ending battles with the cruel, relentless Dennis. 
We see Darren, as he trys to win the heart of the ever kind, ever drinking Phil. Alas, Darren has never been able to muster up the courage to win the heart of Phil, so he decides to drown his sorrows in fish and grape sodas. 
I eagerly look forward to the turning of the next page of this gripping, tear-jerking story.

There may be no story set out for you by the game itself, but isn't the point of life to experience it to the fullest? You must create your own path, your own story, and as Phil has said: 
"The people who you love must care for who you are, not what you are."

So are you willing to dive into the deep lore, the rich passion, that this game has to offer? Do you have what it takes? 
Don't be a Darren, be strong in yourself, BELIEVE in yourself. Don't look back. Don't let the regrets of yesterday inflict apon the hopes of today, or the promise of of the future. Take the plunge into the greatest experince of your life.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967337416', 'num_games_owned': 1334, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1448835285}
review:
Echt spaßig für Zwischendurch. 

Man muss wie in einem echtem Restauran/Imbiss erstmal Waren kaufen und auf die Speisekarte setzen. Dort kommt es drauf an ob die Gerichte ausgewogen sind oder zu dem jeweiligen Betrieb passen. Wenn die Planung abgeschlossen ist muss man sich an die Theke stellen und die Wünsche der Kunden bedienen. Dort ist zum Teil echt gutes Multitasking gefragt, da während der Rush Hour das ein oder ander Gericht zeitgleich kommt und man nebenbei noch Teller waschen muss oder den Müll rausträgt.

Für den Preis von 0,99€ im aktuellen Steam Sale SOFORT zugreifen.

Viel Spaß :)

review: A wonderful game where you, a humble joe with dreams of becoming a 5star chef with no standard industry certification emark on a magical journey from greasy spoon to high star establishment.A fast paced raw chicken punching ride where balancing risk of salmonella for your customers and missing your bathroom break all while your baked potato burns to charcoal is the daily grind. 11/10 would tenderise chicken again.

review: I don't get it why this game is so popular. I bought this on a summer sale deal so I only paid 99cents but I still kinda regret my purchuse. This isn't really a sim at all, it's just a raise against the clock style game where you have to put orders together before the timer runs out. I was hoping for a sim like Pizza Tyccon or something. This isn't anything like that at all. Sorry but I don't like this game.

review: Stressful, but in a good way! Very challenging, basically operating on muscle memory, but you can't trust muscle memory completely, such as when you have 5 orders waiting and someone wants a Large Grape Soda WITH Ice and you click over and then have to stop and go "wait wait okay, where's the g*dd*mn "I" key for the ice okay there it is crap crap go" but then you realize you only gave them a Medium and your streak is ruined. 5 stars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024125361', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2254, 'last_played': 1665701796}
review: I never thought that I would get into cooking games but this quirky, quick paced, restauranteer simulator is freaking gorgeous in both aesthetics and design.  This is the hallmark of a well crafted game that I have enjoyed for hours on end that starts off with simple recipes that anyone can learn to play that over time gets more complicated.  The best part is it doesn't feel like I was thrown to the wolves with no chance to adapt.  I would recommend this to anyone looking to play a quick but enjoyable video game that has a surpising depth to it if you keep playing.

review: I'll be honest, this is not a game for everyone. However, if you're into fun, casual, time management games then this is a MUST own. It may take a little bit of practice, but this is game will offer a rewarding experience through it's plethora of recipes and replayability. With an astouding amount of content and variation this restaurant manager is a worthwhile pick-up for its price.

review: Cook Serve Delicious. What can I say about this game? Well its great for those who wonder what its like trying to build a restaurant from the ground up. author: {'steamid': '76561198052820807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 556, 'last_played': 1450546409}
review:
First off, this game is tagged incorrectly. It's not a simulation. The only thing this simulates is how it feels to be the service industry when you're the only member of staff who still even gives a shit. This game WILL beat that out of you though. By the way, you are THE only member of staff. You "manage", prep, cook and clean while hoping that your customers don't get pissy and storm out giving you a bad reputation because you took too long doing everything BY YOURSELF. 

Bonus: You get to keep all the tips for yourself though.

As for the strategy or management  tags? This is not that kind of game. Any form of management is minimal and can even hardly qualify as being called that. For instance, setting your menu. What restaurant changes its menu every two days? Pretty ridiculous and utterly bothersome because you can't plan out a steady, money making menu to help your business grow and gain recognition.

I enjoyed this game, I really did. I was hooked for almost a whole week where I'd come home from whatever I was doing that day and play it for (at most) an hour a night. Thing is, it got really boring really fast. It becomes mundane, stressful and repetitive with all of the short timed QTEs that you do for EVERYTHING. Gotta make a salad? Mash some buttons. Gotta wash some dishes? Mash some buttons. Pour a cup of coffee? Mash some buttons.

They've tried hard to add variety to this game with catering events and iron chef challenges but it's all just the same thing each time, just some buttons are pushed in different orders depending on what the customers/judge wants. Oh, and did I mention that all of these things are timed QTEs?

If you like casual indie games that you don't wanna play for too long, this is your game but I wouldn't recommend paying too much for it.

If you don't like the idea of flushing the toilets for your customers in between preparing orders, I would avoid this game like the plague.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009667110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 3213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1492040024}

author: {'steamid': '76561198060881237', 'num_games_owned': 283, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 632, 'last_played': 1596405659}
review:
If you want a game that could really kill the time this is it. Below I will show the pros and cons of the game.
 PROS:
-Great graphics.
-It runs with smoothness on my computer. (That is a very big statement as my computer is completely rubbish.)
-Even if you don't like cooking you will probably find this game very enjoyable.
-The game starts easy for beginners and picks up in difficulty at the right time.
-Many upgradables.
-Nice, soothing music.
-Variety of different foods to make with different side effects.

CONS:
-So far, I don't think I see any.

Hope this game has been helpful in your purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995233987', 'num_games_owned': 571, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 5802, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2274, 'last_played': 1504845425}
review: I made like a burjer or something I don't know where are my meds

author: {'steamid': '76561198027963856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 21031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16943, 'last_played': 1558740799}
review:
At the time of writing this I have clocked over 300 hours of this game (so far). Cook, Serve, Delicious is by far the most fun I have ever had playing a cooking game in my life. The controls are so well translated on controller that it actually mostly makes logical sense and feels like you are slapping the stuff together as fast as you can. 

Quickly found myself addicted as I finished the game and realized I could restart with three times the difficulty all over again, testing my reaction/speed and understanding of the ingredients placement on my controller scheme. This is for sure a controller game. I have difficulty playing this with the keyboard controls. If you have a controller you should consider getting this game. Just for the fun of playing alone it is an awesome game but in co-op cooking modes (where you switch out every few seconds) it becomes even more fun. 

There is so much to unlock in this game and it is challenging even for a seasoned videogame player. I hope to see Cook, Serve, Delicious expand itself into a full blown game where you could be cooking in a multiplayer mode while friends are running the front of house/dining room and plating guests while you cook in the back while other team mates are washing up. (just a nerd dream) 

This is one of the most addictive games ever. Thumbs up :D

review: I adore this game. I've been playing this game for years (though I only downloaded on Steam recently) and it is amazing. It's really innovative in the way it lets you do the combinations for food orders. Not only that but it's really funny. Most of the time even if you mess up a level you're not that upset. I also really like the addition of the battle kitchen. Definately worth checking out and supporting the creators.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006875525', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 244, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1433476580}
review: This game is a well designed QTE with interesting foods and upgrades for the foods. I felt the game was too much of a grind, and did not want to put in hours and hours of QTE to get to the next levels. For this reason, I do not recommend. author: {'steamid': '76561198066782955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1463, 'last_played': 1527363508}
review:
Absolutely amazing. This is what you get when you get a cooking simulator not focused on the minute details of actual cooking but focuses instead on having fun.

Addiciting gameplay with enough elements throughout your play to keep thing "spicy" as it were.
Getting each star for your restaurant comes with new challenges and new recipes to ensure you come back and have fun every time.

Soundtrack is absloutely delightful with funky diner and elevator music. Can't recommend this game enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063894332', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1433363576}
review:
This is actually a bit of a weird one. It's got all the makings of a bad game, what with repetiveness, little in the way of cosmetic upgrades, constant grinding and being very much a button mashing game. However, in spite of all this, the game is actually a very, very good game. There's just something about this game that keeps you wanting that extra slice and has you grilling for another go behind the counter.

The only criticism I actually have for this game at all is that multiplayer only works locally. Please. In this day and age where half your friends are at the very least in another country?

Nevertheless I'd definitely have bought this game, even if the price was doube what it is.

15/10 and I'll have fries to go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015171654', 'num_games_owned': 1081, 'num_reviews': 306, 'playtime_forever': 550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1483436465}
review:
You go in thinking this game is going to be a piece of cake and come out knowing exactly what Hell's Kitchen feels like. To keep up with the pace of everything you have to be some kind've of intelligent mutli-tasking octopus or else you gotta be really on top of everything and know your shit like the back of your hand. Yes. It can be that intense. 

It's a pretty staright forward game. You build up your restaurant from nothing to something and can even compete in competitions and host catering parties. It's a surprisingly extensive game for a simulator type. 

I think my ultimate favourite part of this game are the emails. Some of them are just so off the wall, it's fantastic. I wish my inbox was that creative. 

Bottom line? I LOVE IT!

author: {'steamid': '76561198071585789', 'num_games_owned': 1433, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1496277143}

author: {'steamid': '76561197968716621', 'num_games_owned': 1563, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1433189952}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EgsrmQeGA0Q

This si more of a QTE game rather than anything else. It's masked as a restaurant management and simulation, but trust me, that's not what this game is. The tags for this game are badly thought out. You DO get to run a restaurant, and choose what food it serves and get money but the thing is... you don't sit back and watch OTHERS serve the actual food. YOU have to do it.

So you end up doing the dishes, and putting meat and stuff on a hamburger and so on. On a timer. That's the entire actual gameplay.

So, while I do think it's an okay game, I was mislead. I thought it was a REAL management sim.

review:
Ultimate button-mashing experience, I played a lot of the "Papa's *insert food related title*" flash games online so this was naturally right up my alley. I feel that I have gotten plenty of playtime out of this game and I'm just now finishing up the last achievement after 55 hours which may not seem that high but you can only button mash for so long after you've reached a platinum level restaurant :) 

Definitely recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198051445842', 'num_games_owned': 480, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1443657580}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a wonderful game. Every day, you have to take into account things like "menu rot", which is where customers get sick of eating the same things at your restaurant day in and day out.

Also, CSD also gets a major thing right about the food industry: it's ever-changing and hectic as all get out.

Seriously, though. If you haven't picked up this game, do it already.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086361067', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1432559355}
review:
想借助这个类型的游戏忆童年来着，后来发现不切实际：难呀。
窝打字也算快的了，然而用起键盘来，啊——脚趾都恨不得用上。

（bacon的对应键位是B而butter是Y的感受，…请好好体会。）
（而且，自定义键位也痛苦。）
----------------------------------------------------------

……快来看这个游戏里的电邮……好多冷笑话。
电邮正在开发【煮菜相亲】功能，真是够了！
（做出一边做饭一边脱胸罩/牛仔裤的段落我才服！）

便宜红酒就叫做le cheap，
真的还不如叫le 狗蛋呢……酒会哭的……

练习单元里的顾客穿着“the official taste tester”的黄色印花T恤，
我也想要一件。
----------------------------------------------------------



美术风格醇厚非常喜欢，原声有点滥熟，背景音乐一般是关掉的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198046297681', 'num_games_owned': 1530, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1440104340}
review: As a restaurant worker I can tell you first hand that there are not enough people asking if everything is gluten free, 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198006644172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1582449309}
review:
It's a game that literally requires the skills to pay the bills. This is a crazy frenetic button-hitting game that requires speed and finesse. There are also strategic elements to it as well.

As a chef, you are required to do all the cooking yourself (although this may change - still on the first chapter) and you are required to make keypresses that correspond to the order that you take. However, you'll likely be recieving more than one order at a time and you'll have to choose what to take first! In addition, before this all even starts, you'll be buying food, upgrading it and trying to figure out what combinations will yield the most profits and buzz to get your restaurant running. 

The game looks simple and cartoony on the surface, but has an interesting bit of strategic gameplay. Definitely worth picking up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198167253330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 995, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 486, 'last_played': 1595847050}
review:
레스토랑 주방의 전투적인 상황을 간접적으로 체험할 수 있는 게임
긴장감에 어깨는 승천하고 긴박함에 심장은 쿵떡쿵떡!
와인은 코르크마개를 따서 줘야하고, 핫도그도 다 똑같은 핫도그를 주지않는다. 고객의 입맛에 따라 바뀌는 레시피라 쉽게 질릴일도 없고 난이도도 그리 쉽지만은 않다. 날씨 등등 여러가지 옵션에 영향받기도 하고 음식이나 장비를 업그레이드 할 수도 있다.
은근히 디테일해서 '청소하기 짜증나!',  '악아앜 손님 가지마! 좀만 기다려!", "앜 (요리가)탄다 타!' ...진심 어느새 이렇게 소리치고 있게 된다. ㅋㅋ :3c

아직 배틀모드는 적응이 덜 된 상태라 못해봤지만....
뭐야 이거....재밌어.......소름돋아..........;;;

할인할때 사면 금상첨화인 게임.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116348426', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 907, 'last_played': 1641746553}
review:
Very fun, hectic game that is sort of a mix between business building and quick-key action. You choose what is on your menu every day (with various foods having different effect on your 'daily buzz' aka your footfall) and during each day you prepare, cook and serve the food as requested by pressing quick-keys as fast as possible. There are also daily emails with bets, extra cash and funny little notes, upgrades to the kitchen and the food items, some mystery tickets and various levels of restaurant you climb your way up. 

Not much story here, but a lot of button-frantic fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993567513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 292, 'playtime_forever': 935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 935, 'last_played': 1431457566}
review:
Restaurant cooking simulator where you try to complete as many orders as you can, then spend your earnings on upgrades. I used an x360 controller to play. Cooking meals is somewhat like Cooking Mama, but here there's no gestures: you press a button/direction for a certain ingredient/action and almost all recipes are just inputting the right ingredients. You then cook it for a certain time and send it off before it gets burnt. A few early recipes just involve holding the down direction for a certain amount of time to fry the food, and a couple complex recipes require you to put the ingredients in a certain order. It's not too complex to learn (you start out with fewer ingredients/recipes until you upgrade the foods) but the biggest problem will be doing them fast enough so that your other orders don't suffer. I avoided upgrading certain foods to avoid the complexity. Upgraded wine can be pretty cost-effective if you don't like the complexity because it mostly requires mashing one button. Upgraded soup was my least favorite thing to do because of the sheer number of ingredients involved.

Campaign mode is the big draw for me (earn upgrades, do events, read random e-mails), but there's also a nice multiplayer and challenge/score attack mode. Pretty fun if you like simulations or mastering sequences.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045431856', 'num_games_owned': 328, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1708670754}

author: {'steamid': '76561198038820071', 'num_games_owned': 415, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1148, 'last_played': 1558990123}
review:
I HATE RUSH HOUR ! :P

6 Orders at a time, but customer CAN'T WAIT ! 
Put Bacon before onion and they MAD at me ! 
Robbery stolen money, police want me to draw his face while I taking orders, HE CAN'T WAIT !
Got a lot of equipment to cook and run restaurant, but CAN'T HIRE ANY EMPLOYEE !

Well, at least I know how hard to open a restaurant. This game is very addictive by the way, fun and so intense, when the order went bad, you will lost your mind. (I do :P)

Worth to check it out, challenge but so much fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006431970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2398, 'last_played': 1449260921}
review:
Things you think/say while playing this game: 

"She came in at 9 AM, ordered a bottle of cheap wine, got plastered, went to work, and still has a job! I want her job."

"You A HOLE! y u order lobster a minute before closing?!"

"ZOMG that guy got a raw fish!"

"Guy orders burger with 1 patty. I gave him 3. He should be happy!"

Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125499603', 'num_games_owned': 2035, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 3732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2716, 'last_played': 1447880598}
review:
Fun & addicting. Should try this at home, lol
Story mode is nice to get through and see your restaurant expanding with the time. 
After completing it, the real thing starts with a crazy speed.
Oh and this game has ninjas!
And finally there's a modus which gives you by surprise orders. There's a leaderboard too, so even after completing the game, it can be played again and again (and again) w/o really becoming boring.
For more detailed impressions you may check my blog posts about 'Cook, Serve, Delicious!' aswell:
https://henryetha.wordpress.com/category/cook-serve-delicious/

author: {'steamid': '76561198003999386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1450532612}
review: This game is pretty much everything I wanted from a restaurant sim game. I love I can change out keybindings so they make more sense to me, I like I can customize my restaurants menu to serve exactly the style I want. There's a definite satiisfaction I get out of a long string of combos and the rare perfect day, and the pacing is done in such a way I can easily hop in the game when I need a mental break and be back out in 15 minutes--or I can enjoy a longer play session. I definitely recommend this game to anyone who likes these sorts of sim games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028724797', 'num_games_owned': 1479, 'num_reviews': 237, 'playtime_forever': 2034, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1619, 'last_played': 1584276712}
review:

I loved this game so much! 
Sometime it became a little bit repetitive, especially in later days, because you have no motivation to keep playing since you unlocked everything you need from long time...  but you can play it "competitively" in different game modes, so longevity is not an issue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036316241', 'num_games_owned': 660, 'num_reviews': 292, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1388287337}
review:
쿡, 서브, 딜리셔스입니다!

허름한 음식점의 지배인이 되어서 손님들에게 기계처럼 음식을 만들어 주다가 간판을 내리게 되거나 게임이 라이브러리에서 삭제되게 되는 평범한 게임인데 적당히 시간 때우기엔 나쁘지 않고 게임 내의 다양한 종류의 레시피가 있으면서도 하필이면 김치가 없기에 결국 추천을 할 수 없는 게임입니다.


제작자가 김치의 위대함을 모르다니 정말 안타깝네요.

예로부터 김치의 데우스 엑스 마키나적 효능 덕분에 우리 조상들은 김치를 신(神)김치라고 불렀으며 각종 오랑캐들도 김치에 놀라 그것들을 갓(God)김치라고 부른 것은 명백한 사실인데

author: {'steamid': '76561198058156743', 'num_games_owned': 1669, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 1397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1287, 'last_played': 1438296372}
review: At first, I wasn't expecting much out of this game when I first laid my eyes on it, simply due to not being interested in these kinds of games in general. However, after getting this in a humble bundle, I gave it a shot and man is this a blast. It is literaly just a series of glorified quick-time event, but it's actually entertaining rather than in most other games that actually makes it annoying to go through. The goal of Cook, Serve, Delicious is work your way up from a zero star restaurant all the way up to a five star restaurant and is it very satisfiying to perfectly serve all of your customers at the end of the day. My only regret is that I wish I wasn't being such a cheapskate when paying for my humble bundle. Ah who am I kidding? I do this almost everytime I buy a game.
