author: {'steamid': '76561198086513533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 5019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1632447196}
review:
レストランを経営するゲームなのだけど、これがまた凝ってて食べ物作るのが妙に難しい、客の注文内容もあるしトイレが詰まったりネズミ捕り設置や皿洗いということも発生するので、マウスとキーボードをさっさと動かさないと悲惨なことになる　
序盤は、アイスクリームやフライド系の揚げ物・ビールなど簡単だけど　多めにもらえる料理でやるといいかもしれません
日本語化やWikiが現状ないので、多少の英語力と直感で覚えないと、なにやればいいかさっぱりだと思います。
現に、自分はラザニアをよく失敗する理由がわからないので、サラダなど簡単なトッピング単語がわかる系ばかりにしています。
ぬるく感じたら難しい料理もいくつかあるので、たくさん稼いでアップグレードしていくと　
なかなかニヤニヤできるところもあると思われます。
ちなみに、このゲーム　BGMが結構素晴らしいです。　ノリノリのジャズ系が多いので　そういうの好きな人にも曲目的でオススメできると思います。

author: {'steamid': '76561197970308024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1419468154}

author: {'steamid': '76561197990727038', 'num_games_owned': 479, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4135, 'last_played': 1657375001}
review:
If you enjoy games such as Elite Beat Agents, Osu! Tatakae! Ouendan and its ilk, then you'll enjoy Cook, Serve, Delicious. Ultimately, it's a game about achieving perfection. You'll have PSCR PSCR PSCR engrained in your head as you learn how to cook Lasagna. 

The game recently in late 2014 received a huge free update which introduced Battle Kitchen, allowing players to complete globally and see how they stack on the leaderboards. It's a great fun game which if you have your friends watch you play will make them think you're insane, but they just don't understand.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043119721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1483, 'last_played': 1500150514}
review:
One of the most compelling games I've played in a long while - the varied and challeging recipes, pleasing aesthetic and catchy music make you want to keep cooking, even if career mode can feel like a grind. It also has one of the best learning curves in a game; while you start tentatively sending out pretzels and corndogs, by the later stages of career mode, you'll be juggling 8 complex orders at once with no problem. 

Can't recommend it enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070828069', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 721, 'last_played': 1435371861}
review:
I bought this because it seemed interesting and I've only been playing for about two hours but I can say that this game is going to be a problem in my life.
A very, very good problem.
If you're trying to decide whether or not to invest that small amount of money into this game - do not think, just do.
It blows me away that no matter how deep into the game you get, there's no way that it can ever feel old.
You can tell that the developers spent a lot of time thinking of every little detail.
Bravo to them.

review:
Really fun game with lots of content. You have to make food for your customers using various keyboard combinations or using a controller. You have to make sure you press the right buttons in the right sequence with the right timing or you might screw up an order (which will cost you money). Overall a really cool game that offers lots of variety and replayability.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052109022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1649555312}
review: This is a great game. Totally a fun way to kill some time. You work as a chef in a resturant. You also flush toilets and catch rats. Why? Because you can that's why. Or you can ignore the nastiness that's going on behind the scenes, continue to serve up food and get a poorer rating at the end of the day. It works on a daily basis with upgrades for the food you serve, the restruant, the equipment etc. The sound effects are adorable, and I love the art style. My only complaint would be that I would like more artwork of the people, but it's not really a complaint seeing as this game is amazingly well done and polished. Upgrade your shop, trap all them rats because screw PETA and button mash your way to the top of the resturant. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198034105550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 11006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1704057796}
review: Very easy to learn, hard to master. Really fun to play, and it is awesome watching your restaurant go from a 0 star nothing to a 5 star world class eatery.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025318089', 'num_games_owned': 367, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 618, 'last_played': 1505294794}
review: This is one of those games that looks like it has to be either poorly made, or terribly boring. In reality, it's one of the best simulators that I've ever experienced. As you run your restaurant, you're forced to balance pleasing the customers, and pleasing the health inspectors by keeping up with upkeep. All actions are made simple, but not so simple that they can be done without thought. Unlike some games which feature cooking, you're not given simple "Cook" and "Serve" buttons. Instead, you are most often left to assemble dishes with simplified "one key = one ingredient" style combinations (e.g. PSCR PSCR PSCR makes a lasagna [Pasta, Sauce, Cheese, Parmesan]). It's simple in theory, until the lunch rush leaves you hectically trying to push through order after order, all while balancing the need to wash dishes and toss out trash. There's no deep story to the campaign, but somewhat forced menu changes and the always random orders will ensure that days vary heavily and keep you on your toes. Overall, it's well worth the pick up. 8.5/10

review:
Jogo Excelente,

Tudo começa em um restaurante bem simples, conforme você avança pode tornar seu restaurante um 5 estrelas.

Todos os pratos do game podem ser melhorados, ficando mais complexos a cada upgrade.

Para alcançar uma estrela a mais para seu restaurante existem alguns objetivos à serem alcançados Ex : Completar 20 dias, 10 dias perfeitos, upgrade em 10 comidas.

Além de preparar os pratos, você tem que manter o restaurante limpo. Ex : Dar descarga no banheiro . HUEHUHE

Completando um dia sem nenhum erro você consegue a perfeição, e ganha um bônus no final do dia.

Quem gosta de jogos do gênero não se arrependerá de comprar esse ! 11/10.

review: One of the more underrated indie games on Steam, this game will force you constantly be on your toes as your diner goes from a 0 star waterhole to a 5 star world class eatery. author: {'steamid': '76561198012993408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1319, 'last_played': 1514929567}
review:
When I first looked at this game I thought it'd be another one of those iphone-ish games that I'd just get bored of after an hour or so. 

I was very wrong.

This is one of my absolute FAVORITE games of all time. It's challenging, quirky, and just plain fun. The fact that they update the game pretty frequently is also a bonus. The new foods and  challenges are great and the art is so nice and relaxing to look at. Not to mention the music which, while repetitive, fits perfectly with the game.

My only problems with the game aren't even really 'problems'.

1: More food options (they've been very good at adding more options, I'm just greedy for more)
2: The fact that the game is almost unforgivingly hard with just the keyboard. The gamepad works much better with the controls.

Overall, these 'problems' don't realy effect the game in the slightest and it's one of my favorites. I highly reccomend it to anyone who wants a good challenge and who's looking for a game that doesn't just end after a couple of restuarants.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002567771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 2306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1582, 'last_played': 1558908564}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious is a fun little casual game where you use your keyboard(Or mouse) to cook ingredients by selecting the right option for several small minigames that mostly have to do with the order in which items are added, and adding the right items to an order. It's beautiful in its simplicity and has short (10-15 minute) days which you can quickly play during a break, or when you're just bored for a while. The artstyle comes together quite well and the gameplay works out while letting you set your own difficulty - You can pick and choose what items to serve, between 3 and 6 different ones every day and can decide to get easy things, hard things, or a mix of both. In addition, the game has challenges which will allow you to test your skill at some of the foods.
Coupled with this is a progression as you take your restaurant from 'that greasy junk joint' that people visit for lunch but not much else all the way to a 5-star restaurant selling lobsters and fine wine throughout the day. You will be offered challenges to make perfect combos, and you may get a VIP along the way asking for specific foods.

Sadly, the one thing I did not manage to figure out in this game are the robberies, in which you need to identify a masked man who just sort of walks past the background with 6 or so variables. How do you do this, you ask? I haven't got a clue I say. If you know a way to identify and sketch the face of someone wearing a mask that covers all their features, then you'll do fine. Otherwise, you won't be able to complete the robbery chore in this game. Luckily, the robbery is the rarest of events, so you will not see much of it either way.
Edit: Thanks to the comment below for explaining the robbery! I didn't even think to look there

There are online challenges, and there is a multiplayer mode which I have not explored, along with several unlockable chefs which...I don't know, you don't seem to see your chef during the game so I don't really understand the point of it.

Either way, it's a casual amusing game that you can spend a long time on, with simple gameplay lending to a lot of replay value

author: {'steamid': '76561198049543355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 986, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 923, 'last_played': 1480278316}
review:
A perfect day from me, 107% buzz in 4 star restaurant!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V4kwS2Xtx1s&list=UUyCfNHYR16NC4F8ypcaCxaA

Have you ever dreamed of being the greatest chef but... just couldn't chalk it up?
Cook, Serve, Delicious! definitely gives you an opportunity to make your dream come true. But damn, man, achieving perfection in this game is as challenging.

In Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a simple game, in which you just serve dishes, and clean up after customers as well as you can. You run a restaurant, from 1 star, and you slowly make your way to the top - 5 star restaurant, by  just simply doing your job. 

But man, serving 8 dishes and cleaning up after customers, might be damn challenging.
Definitely sth to check out yourself!
I've bought the game in humble bundle for less than 2$, and i have played it over 10 hours yourself. definitely well spent money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015807157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 597, 'last_played': 1418152438}
review:
Kiedy tylko zainstalowałem tę grę zaraz skradła mi z życia sześć i pół godziny! Naprawdę wciąga i naprawdę uzależnia.
Mało ci stresu w życiu? Proszę bardzo - oto produkcja dla ciebie. Zmierz się z chaosem godzin szczytu i spróbuj zadowolić wszystkich klientów w kolejce po swój kawałek rozkoszy (mowa cały czas o zawodzie kucharza). 

Ta gra przetestuje twoją odporność na stres, zdolność koncentracji i organizacji czasu. Jak prawdziwa kuchnia, a wiem co mówię, bo parę lat w kuchni się przepracowało aż pot po dupczym rowie lał się niczym Niagara. 

Grę cechuje miła dla oka kreskówkowa grafika, równie fajne i idące w parze z obrazem dźwięki i muzyka.

Polecam zagrać, tym bardziej, że na serwisach aukcyjnych do wyrwania jest za niecałe 8 złotych! Choć, uwierzcie mi - jest warta sporo więcej! I piszę to z pełnym przekonaniem.

Bardzo wysoko / 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089963770', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 420, 'last_played': 1563200018}
review: This is one of the most addictive games I've played in ages and I both love and hate it. It's stressful, frustrating, and much more complex than a diner dash game which is probably it's closest comparison. It's a lot more in depth than you'd expect from a typical management game and you can prevent the risk of it becoming tedious by changing up your menu each day, each food has a different way of cooking. I recommend for anyone who enjoys a strategy or a time management game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158944444', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1562315348}

author: {'steamid': '76561198071705315', 'num_games_owned': 92, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 633, 'last_played': 1646448648}
review:
I just bought Cook Serve Delicious.  This game is so simple in design but it is insanely addictive.  

Basically, you start off with a cheap little diner in an office tower and have to work your way up to a 5-star restaurant.  Essentially, you are the cook and have to prepare orders for the customers that come in.  It's a very casual game that doesn't have any difficult business strategies or anything like that.  You just have to be quick with either the keyboard or mouse during rush hour.

It kinda reminds me of Tetris or those kinda of games but with food.  It's pretty neat and only $4.  It's worth a shot if your looking for something different and light.

I'm usually only into very deep games but this has me hooked for some reason.  Definitely a major two thumbs up for the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016501303', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2476, 'last_played': 1706591170}
review:
This game is so much more fun than it has any right to be. I can't believe how much content and variety is in this game. Great art, controls, sound, little tidbits of humour and jokes. Really well made and a really good time.  

Unexpectedly brilliant. Buy it on sale and be caught off guard by this oddball masterpiece.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136712286', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1406720431}

author: {'steamid': '76561198047672933', 'num_games_owned': 474, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1432176023}
review: Cooking games may not be everyone's kettle of fish (ha ha), but I think Cook, Serve, Delicious is worth its price whiile on sale, and possibly even off sale if you're into the genre. If you've seen any gameplay trailers, you'll know what the game is like. You complete the correct sequence of button presses to make dishes, clean up your restaurant, and a few other things. It takes time to get used to these patterns, but once you do, you'll fly through the days. There are so many dishes you can learn, that you'll always find yourself learning something new. Where I find the game shines is the restaurant management system. Instead of just producing food for an unknown entity, you can get tip for certain items more than others, need to manage your menu sdo that more people come, you can cater events. I could've played for at least 18 hours ( I had just reached a 2 star restaurant), but my attention was sucked by other games. All in all, this game will be a joy for anyone who likes cooking games, or reflex test games. 7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029679773', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1424973168}
review:
I've played Cook, Serve, Delicious mainly on my android so don't let my hours confuse you.


If you have played the flash games "Papa's Freezeria/Pizzeria/Burgeria/Et ceteria" and enjoyed them, then this is the game for you. This game is that, but much much more. +Controller Support, +Adjustable Key Bindings, +Weekly Challenges, +Food Variety, +Steam Trading Cards, +4-Player Mode +2-Player Co-op Campaign +etc.


Before your day starts you are able to choose what is on your menu, read emails, buy upgrades, and other cool secret stuff (like making bets!).  Menus must be updated every so often as food will get "stale" (boring), and customers will eat elsewhere. Also, certain foods have "properties" associated with them. Put too many greasy foods on the menu and cooking will be quick and simple, but customers will be deterred. Put too many things like "soup" and "pizza" on the menu and customers will pay more, but cooking will be difficult.

"Cooking" is extremely fun. If you know your way around a keyboard the game will be a walk in the park for you; that is, if you play on normal. The game offers many different ways to challenge yourself such as Extreme mode, and Endurance mode.

If you're a money conscious person like me, the game is also sold on the Humble Store! 

Hope you buy, and have fun playing!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971688412', 'num_games_owned': 1005, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1640, 'last_played': 1621291173}
review:
A pretty unique idea centered around button mini-games to cook meals.  You continually buy new menu items, upgrade your restaurant and foods so you get that nice leveling up feel.  Beating the later levels feels pretty satisfying because it is due to your own skills expanding and not just getting power ups which is rewarding.  There are some minor upgrades to help you but you feel like it's your own skills.

Nice game to spend a few minutes on at the end of the day, especially if you can get in the zone just zen out on cooking.  Each day is about 15 minutes if you spend time choosing upgrade between days so it's good if you're tight on gaming time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042251261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1648332825}

review: A neat little game I got a while back when it first came out, buy new recipes and get overwhelmed the next business day as you try to make a ton of orders without making mistakes. A nice game to have available when looking for something that is easy to learn, but still very challenging to master.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013842507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3309, 'last_played': 1418750289}
review:
I'm a huge sucker for restaurant time management games such as Diner/Cooking Dash, Papa's Gameria series, etc. Out of any restaurant time management games I've played, this one is the most unique.

It's highly customizable where you get to pick up to 6 different menu items each with varying difficulty and drawbacks. They can be as stupidly easy as slapping on some condiments and calling it a day, and others are very meticulous as to what order its ingredients need to be in.

Needless to say, this game gets super complicated super fast. It's very fast-paced and it gets really hectic later in the game. It makes the game challenging and that's what makes it super fun. Don't think the main game is hard enough? Finish the main game to unlock the New Game+ that is way harder.

There are new challenges every week that are ranked against other players, and you can refine your abilities even more with the new Battle Kitchen mode. There's lots to do with this game and it keeps pulling out new features that'll make you want to come back.

I highly, HIGHLY recommend this game if you like time management or cooking games. You won't get a game like this anywhere else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129569457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 821, 'last_played': 1507150503}
review:
한마디로 평하자면 손가락 타자암기 게임.
레벨을 거듭할수록 손가락으로 얼마나 빨리 타자를 암기해서 치는가가 관건이다.
나는 워낙에 무언가를 치는 걸 좋아하는 덕후라서 완전 내 타입.
계산기나 피아노나 타자치는 걸 좋아하고 음식 좋아하면 강추.
가끔씩 한번 해야 더욱 재밌고 한번 몰아서 하면 지루하다.
그럼에도 오기를 자극하는 게임.
그래서 오늘 나는 또 두시간째...

author: {'steamid': '76561197960461306', 'num_games_owned': 695, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 1657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1607, 'last_played': 1417663269}
review: Strangely addictive. I never buy a game for full price, but I have no regrets buying this one. There's really not much to it, but once you get in the flow, it's really satisfying to complete order after order perfectly...

author: {'steamid': '76561198045140409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 830, 'last_played': 1495715305}
review:
I love Cook, Serve, Delicious! I find myself getting honestly frustrated when I accidentally hit '3' instead of '4' during rush hour and accidentally send off a half-cooked fish, but that's the fun of running a frantically big restaraunt all by yourself. Some orders are going to be mucked up.

I agree to some extent that the mechanics get boring. I certainly couldn't finish the whole game in one sitting. In fact, after getting to three stars I became a little unenamoured and stopped playing for a month, only to start craving the fast-paced action and pick it right up again.

This is not a game with a story to hang onto but rather a game with addictive mechanics which you will want to come back to again and again. I do still want to upgrade my restauraunt fully, I'm looking forward to seeing the end, but it's the desire to hit the big combos and get a handle on the perfect steak which will bring me back time and time again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085602340', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 840, 'last_played': 1504489717}
review:
Let's be honest here, games of seemingly mundane things are fun. Cook, Serve, Delicious! Is no exception by any stretch of the means, it starts as a pretty slow paced cooking game, you serve the basics, like Pretzels, or Corn Dogs, maybe some Fries/Chips if you're feeling up to it, slowly you advance to slightly more advance things, such as Burgers, Fish, Pancakes. 

And then begins rush hour, a twice an ingame day experience that's out to make your life a living hell, What's this? Three people need Lobster and another 2 need wine while a Fish is Cooking? QUICK OPEN THE WINE, GET THE LOBSTERS RIGHT!

Once you get down to the late game, I.e Three stars or later, the game boils down to a fast paced rush of exhilleration (Pardon the pun there), and even once you get five stars, the game doesn't end there, bonus challenges like Iron Chef, or a Hardmode, where Rush hour becomes even more brutal and fast paced, in which making one mistake is vicious and affects you brutally. Alternatively, why not try multiplayer? One person handles which dishes to prepare, the other whips them up ready to cook, or serve, or something.

Overall, this game is highly reccomended for time wasting, and I say definately pick it up if you have the cash

author: {'steamid': '76561198042613527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4120, 'last_played': 1419637277}
review:
I started out thinking "Well, I'll just relax with this restaurant managment game" and before I realized what was going on i was dating some short woman with a potato fetish and had become a media darling due to my participation in a series of televised  cooking competition while some guy tried to sell me his slightly used latex gloves.
No but really. This game is a really good one, well worth the money and kept me entertained for hours upon hours. 

Pros:
- A nice balance between stressful and skill based (the skill you will learny quickly, everything will run much smoother once you've become familiar enough with the dishes to know which button to press for which ingredient and so on. 
- Charming graphics and animations.
- A certain sense of accomplishment is always allowed but not forced upon the player, hence players who prefer calmer playthrough can choose to not drown themselves in repetable tasks that really don't get you that much in the game anyhow while players who need encouragement to sustain their interest can work towards the daily challenges available to you.
- A nice increasing curve of challenge which allows the player ot become accostumed to the frantic stress of their expanded restaurant before there's a new upgrade.
- You get to build your own restaurant freely and the menu of the restaurant freely as there are so many dishes available and you have to purchase most of them to make them available to you, then upgrade them.
- A certain feeling of the game being realistic as a result of the mechanism around buzz and daily popularity. 

Cons:
- The sounds of the game become really annoying over time, the mumbling of the customers in particular.
- The buttons stuck a few times for me when i tabbed out or opened the steam overlay and I had to reboot the game.
- Although I quite enjoyed the fact that you were forced to get accustomed to each star to your restaurant and the customers that come with in the beginning, 20 days seemed excessive at the end as I was mostly just wanting to finish the game when I'd finished all extra material and has 15 days left for my restaurant to gain its last star. At that point i just forced myself through the gameplay, which is never a good thing. 

Conclusion: 
A good game indeed. Well worth the purchase.
For people who may be thinking of getting this game: don't rush doing your challenges, you have lots of time. And keep dedicated to your dating life in the game, your partners will all break up with your eventually (my heart is at this point as dark and bitter as my soul) but they will give you nice prizes upon doing so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007042683', 'num_games_owned': 1310, 'num_reviews': 212, 'playtime_forever': 978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 946, 'last_played': 1443247347}

author: {'steamid': '76561198068004834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1224, 'last_played': 1460261906}
review:
I thought that Cook, Serve, Delicious (CSD) was one of the best hidden gems available on Steam when I first found it. Now that this new and FREE expansion pack has come out, I also think that it's one of the best deals on Steam.

Cook, Serve, Delicious features a very simple style of game play: basically, it's all about having sharp reflexes and knowing you home row keys. Orders come up, and then you, as a cook, follow the simple commands to cook each order. But before you know it, your fingers are flying across the keyboard serving up orders with ridiculous speed! 

This style of game play could easily become repetitive before long, but your recipes, and thus your button commands, are always changing, keeping the game play fresh. Newer recipes are added to old ones and are often more difficult and complex, consequently constantly increasing the difficulty of the game even as the player becomes more familiar with recipe commands.

Outside of the core game play (the back end of the restaurant, if you will) the options are also very solid. There are plenty of goals to meet, new foods and impactful upgrades to purchase, and a number of challenges to accept outside of the core game mode to keep things interesting. And on top of it all, the game is oozing with originality and humor. The art style is fun and unique and complements the game play quite well.

This newest expansion pack adds a number of new game play modes, but it will take some experience with the standard game modes before newcomers will be ready for these tough new challenges. The addition of leader boards, coop modes, and weekly challenges are all welcome additions as well.

I personally do not have any major issues with the game. It's well thought out, highly original, and has plenty of content for its price tag. It's a game that I think is totally deserving of its $10 and is game that I would recommend that absolutely anyone give a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975017173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1419744349}
review:
"CSD" is a fun, relatively light game that combines keyboard skills (at least, if you choose to use the keyboard, though I think that's optimal), a little bit of memory, task prioritization and multi-tasking. If that's all you need to know, you'll enjoy it.

A "hardcore restaurant sim"? Heh, no... Not quite. No surly wait staff swiping each others' tips, no customers getting angry despite getting their orders right because they said one thing and meant another, no equipment breakdowns or grease fires. You *will*, however, have to flush the toilet half a dozen times a day, bait rat traps within a tight time window, receive money from celebrity chefs for serving customers without a mistake, and make three hundred dollar bets with a random anonymous stranger over e-mail.

You buy new foods and then never pay for them again, unless you choose to upgrade them. The most challenging part of making a pizza is remembering that olives are tied to the "V" key and onions to the "N". And your customers will grouse if you give them a jumbo water with ice instead of a large water with ice (though they'll still pay soda prices for water... apparently the Tower has no drinking fountains.)

None of this is suggesting changes to the game (I'd just as soon run a restaurant in the game's largely happy and straightforward world!), but if you're expecting a hardcore restaurant simulation, you might be a bit disappointed. If I did have to lodge one complaint, it would be that one has to do twenty "days" of service in order for one's restaurant to gain a "star", even if one's customer service is consistently perfect. This seems to have far less to do with anything believable within the game's "world" than with not wanting players to trundle through the amount of content the game provides too quickly. I understand that, but I don't have to applaud it.

What "CSD" offers is a colorful, fun, easy to grasp game that you can play for twenty minutes and walk away feeling you've done well. In that niche, it performs admirably.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053803540', 'num_games_owned': 619, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1111, 'last_played': 1442763448}
review:
Вот так смотришь на Cook, Serve, Delicious! и думаешь "Ну...и чем меня может удивить эта игра в стиле бесплатный флеш треш Закусочная Венди", тогда явно не стоит даже пытаться, но а если же думаешь "Хмм, я уже как пару месяцев ведущий шеф повар у Венди, может быть мне попробовать проявить себя и тут?", тогда welcome!

Ну а если серьезно, то что мы имеем. Все закручивается и заверчивается с того, что в одном замечательном здании выделяется место под ресторан, место весьма сомнительное, как и посетители, которые туда захаживают, но это все только начало большого пути до 5 звезд, VIP гостей и лобстеров в меню. В игре представлен достаточно разнообразный выбор блюд, к каждому из них свой подход в плане приготовления. Для готовности некоторых достаточно нажать пару кнопок, но а с другими стоит уже повозиться. Кроме непосредственно готовки в игре также присутствуют различные мини-игры на тему менеджмента ресторана. Упс какой-то неряшливый посетитель забыл смыть за собой в туалете, теперь это наша задача, а вот накопились грязные тарелки, кто будет все это мыть? [strike]Конечно же мы.[/strike] Но только услугами горничной все не ограничивается, нам также нужно грамотно делать вложения в плане инноваций как самого ресторана, так и и блюд, следить за составом меню, уровнем привличения клиентов и многое другое. Возможно, кого-то отпугнет достаточно быстрый темп геймплея, но даже здесь на первых этапах игры можно варьировать блюда в меню относительно сложности их приготовления, чтобы натренироваться и привыкнуть к управлению так, что потом лазаньи вместе с пиццами и салатами будут разлетаться направо и налево.

Cook, Serve, Delicious! однозначно достойный кандидат на место в библиотеке игр, и главное, у игры есть то самое милое очарование инди-проектов, когда казалось бы все просто, но при этом крайне интересно и привлекательно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078376765', 'num_games_owned': 556, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 10159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5317, 'last_played': 1625135424}
review:
플래시 게임에서 다뤄지던 요리라는 다소 식상하고 지루할 수 있는 소재를 새롭게 재해석한 액션 버튼연타 게임입니다. 식당을 운영하면서 요리재료의 종류와 순서에 맞는 키를 빠르게 눌러 요리를 완성하고 서빙을 하면 됩니다.

Good :
버튼액션 요리게임이라는 플레이 방식의 신선함.
질릴 수도 있는 게임방식을 극복한 훌륭한 스테이지 구성과 적절한 난이도, 도전과제. 빵빵한 게임 볼륨.
여자(남자) 꼬시기 등, 위트 있는 다양한 퀘스트와 서브 컨텐츠.
지속적인 업데이트를 통한 컨텐츠 추가, 패드 지원 등 여러 피드백을 실천하는 개념제작자.

Bad :
이 게임에 무슨 단점이 있는지 모르겠네요.
굳이 꼽자면 다소 빈약한 그래픽 정도나 고티버전이 없다는 거겠죠.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980464130', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 1376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 930, 'last_played': 1416762301}
review:
This game is far more engaging than it has any right to be.
At first glance, it looks like a really simple game. It is. It's very easy to pick up, learn, and play. It's very intense during the lunch rush, with some lulls between to chill out and practice.
The game isn't realistic at all with its 8 dollar sodas, but that only adds to the entertainment when people stroll in to pay for a beer at 9 am, too. All the while, wondering why the hell someone would pay 8 dollars for a small water...

If you wanna get reductive about it, it's a set of QTEs, but there are light strategies involved with remembering how long foods take to cook while juggling your customers and cleaning chores. Lightweight management stuff like organizing your menu and improving it keep it fresh.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144614467', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 931, 'last_played': 1505266320}
review:
A game that both challenges reflex and a bit of memory. Be warned though, if your a perfectionist, then this game will have you salty by the end. This is not your standard papa's pizzeria flash game, this is a hardcore game in which you can't stay on the same order for more than 5 seconds, and if you miss an order, especially during a rush hour, you will surely ruin your own flow. And if you're me, a lot of emotions will be exerted. Other than that, this game is one of my more favorite indie games on steam for having the combination of rythem and challenge in the kitchen. And be warned, you will become addicted to this game. SO GET IT YOU NERDS!

If you won't give me a tip, get out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111932813', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 1047, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1047, 'last_played': 1436355609}
review:
[h1]PSMCR PSMCR PSCR = recette des lasagnes à la viande[/h1]

En gros: "Un jeux ou on sert à manger et où on nettoie les chiottes."

Dans le détails: CSD est un jeux qui va vous entrainer au multitasking et sous son aspect gentil et humoristique se cache un [b]jeux de scoring qui demande une exécution quasi parfaite[/b]... donc si vous voulez un "Cooking Mama" sous acid, vous allez être déçu car le public visé n'est pas du tout le même ^^

Vous gérer votre restaurant, chaque jour vous gérez les commandes des clients et les corvées/événements aléatoires.
Vous avez, avant de commencer chaque jour, un budget pour acheter votre bouffe et votre équipement(pour cuisiner les plats ou pour réduire la fréquence d'apparition des corvées).
En plus de çà, chaque jour est différents: certains aliments on des bonus/malus selon le temps et les demandes de vos clients, donc il y a un peu de préparation à faire.
Les parties sont courtes et intenses, mais la progression est assez lente: 3,5 heure pour avoir ma première étoiles sur les 5 au final, çà peut donner une estimation de la durée de vie, mais les recettes valent... plutot cheres donc au final on avance petit à petit et on a le temps de bien enregistrer les différentes recettes(qui peuvent être très compliquées).
Enormément de challenges et évenements annexes et une difficulté extrême pour les méga bourrins qui connaissent toutes les recettes par coeur et qui peuvent géréer 8 clients en même temps(respect!)
C'est graphiquement simple; un jeux bourré d'humour et une soundtrack très variée qui va de la bossa nova à la musique d'acensceur(type "Les Sims") à des musique 8-bits...

C'est une bonne surprise qui vaut largement son prix pour qui adhère au concept, et qui peut à la fois satisfaire les gamers préssés comme les joueurs chevronnés qui ne jurent que par la durée de vie.

P.S.: SE JOUE AU CLAVIER... vous ne réussirez à rien avec votre souris, le jeux est trop exigeant/rapide pour çà... donc ceux qui sont alergiques aux raccourcis claviers, s'abstenir :P

[i]Edit: les challenges hebdo ont été ajoutés depuis cette review, et offrent VRAIMENT des raisons de revenir sur le titre. Et il y a régulièrement des gens qui y jouent. Donc le titre offre une très bonne durée de vie, même pour celui qui serait lassé de la (trop?) longue campagne solo d'une vingtaine d'heure.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198096664097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 2084, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1460365074}
review:
The title says it all! Cook, Serve, Delicous! is a game that's worth your money. Do you need a stress reliever game? This can be one of them if you like to take out your stress through a fast-paced game.

I totally recommend this game to everyone. This is a very nice arcade game with upgrades for your food from one star to 3 stars. You can even buy equipments that will help your business. Experience a game where you don't just serve the food but you also prepare and cook it yourself. A unique feature of this game is that you also need to find the time to do your chores like flushing the toilet, throwing out the trash, washing the dishes, etc.

Time management is the key. Beware of rush hour, when your buzz (the chance of customers coming to your restaurant) is high, efficiency and concentration is needed. You don't want a single customer get mad at you, would you?

Pros:
+ The game is very realistic in terms of all the work present in a restaurant/food chain

+ You don't just continuously play with the same food items on your menu since there are buzz conditions where serving a food for 3 straight days will lead to a menu rot (the food is not in demand anymore) stat to the food which means if you still serve it, it'll decrease the number of customers that will come to your restaurant/food chain.

+ Addicting to the bone!

Cons:
+ It'll take a bit of practice to get used to the key bindings since it has a lot of buttons involved for every food.

Note: A new feature called the kitchen battle is still on beta where you battle other players in cooking, I guess, I haven't tried it though.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999259031', 'num_games_owned': 412, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1503012232}
review:
This might be the most demanding title in my library. Underneath its casual-friendly theme and its welcoming artstyle lies a game of frantic keyboard slapping. 

If you thought you were good at multi-tasking, think again. If you thought you were good at memorizing keystroke sequences, let's see how good you are. This is as close as a human being will come to being a food-slinging robot as will be possible until the coming Robopocalypse. 

It's well crafted. It's fun. It's exactly what you already want, stop reading this and get the game already you're wasting time that you could be using to MAKE PIZZAS FOR VIRTUAL PEOPLE AHHH GODDD

review:
It's a fun simon say's type game and you get to choose the difficulty in a sense by chosing which foods and drinks you plan to have for the day (all of which have their own buttons to press...You can rebind the buttons, which can help alot)

It looks very simple but it can be very hard.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067967924', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1415601548}
review: too many cooks

author: {'steamid': '76561198024972289', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2817, 'last_played': 1485315363}
review:
A wonderful game that makes me angry enough to eat my own goddamn hands.
It goes from simple to insanely complex and hectic with but a moment's notice. Perfect days can be destroyed by a rush hour of patrons who all want soup. What button do I press? Did I just add olives or onions to this dish? What button corresponds to which sushi? Huh? Oh god.
Basically, the game is incredibly high tension. And when you thread the needle and have a perfect day, you feel like the god king of cooking. I'd recommend this game to just about anyone.

If you enjoy any cooking games, you should enjoy Cook, Serve, Delicious.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020926771', 'num_games_owned': 644, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1420415312}
review:
My wife, who enjoys casual games and especially cooking games, loves this game. 

I hate all those things, and I also love this game. 

It positively oozes with love and care from its developer. This is a great example of the kind of thing that indie developers can do that big companies never could. A game that uses the best casual game mechanics, but with hardcore difficulty, with an amazing variety of content, and without any crummy monetization bullshit. You can tell this is a labor of love, particularly considering the huge new expansion that adds tons of new modes including a co-op campaign, completely for free, over a year after its initial release.

Tip: Play this with a great big clicky keyboard. So fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002734128', 'num_games_owned': 3350, 'num_reviews': 918, 'playtime_forever': 2248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1503492729}
review:
"Cook, Serve, Delicious!" is a wonderfully addictive game that takes the best parts of Diner Dash, Hot Dog King, and Restaurant Empire and crams them all into one nice, meaty package.  It will definitely test your reflexes and can be a bit hardcore at times in terms of difficulty, yet it manages to keep you engaged in a way that encourages you to do better.  I highly recommend it to those who enjoy time management and simulation games.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PLpCmlkiupI

author: {'steamid': '76561198033676254', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1690625171}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025757418', 'num_games_owned': 941, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2171, 'last_played': 1505005811}
review: I bought this game because I love all time management sims, no matter how terrible they are. I was expecting to be entertained for maybe an hour or two, but this is honestly one of the best games of the genre I've ever played. The mechanics are polished and keeps it just the right level of challenging without being frustrating, and the art design is nothing short of charming. The addition of things catering, the iron cook competition, and even dating is sure to keep anyone who's a fan of restaurant sims playing for days.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972381235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1452568012}
review:
This game is a blast. To be honest, I think its underrated as a MLG warmup tool. It gets your hands moving faster than you'd believe! Its a really enjoyable game. The only knock against it is that it takes a little too long to level up your restaurant. I wish they had made this a little more accessible to people who aren't interested in investing a lot of time into it in order to advance through the levels. After all, while the game is a lot of fun, it does feel grindy after a while and the lack of progress can be disheartening.

Overall, its a game worth owning.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048532932', 'num_games_owned': 845, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2991, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1313, 'last_played': 1612911751}
review: This is honestly one of the most fun and interesting games I've played in a while. So many little things come together to make it feel fantastic. The aesthetic design is great. The visuals are interesting and varied without being overwhelming, and the sound effects when preparing food make it so satisfying. The soundtrack is also great, and it perfectly fits the tone of the game. There's jazz, funk, samba, all sorts of styles, and all of them can be either driving or relaxing.The game is also well balanced, which may seem like a weird thing to say, but there was never one setup that I knew I could coast through the whole game with. The game makes you change up your menu and buy and upgrade your foods to make it more varied and challenging. And boy, does it get challenging. But it never punishes you for some bs reason. If you get punished, it's because you made a mistake. And since you can arrange your own menu, you only make it as difficult as you want to. Most of the time, anyways. This game is so fantastic, and I cannot praise it highly enough. It may be one of my favorite games. You may not have the same experience as I did, but I would still highly reccommend that you at least try out this game. At $10, it's a great buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071981927', 'num_games_owned': 744, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 686, 'last_played': 1426647959}
review:
This game, after watching a youtuber play it, seemed fun, so i got it. 

I can't explain why, but its one of THOSE games that you become addicted to when you play it. The game presents itself as it is: You run a resturaunt (Seemingly alone with no other staff), you cook food, server it, earn money, buy new foods, repeat.

However, you have some things i myself have NEVER seen in resturant games before:

-You can cater to outside sources
-You can participate in a speical challange (Like the iron cheif in ORDER UP!)
-You have an e-mail system where you can get e-mails which can either help or hurt you (Also junk mail is sent)
-You can be robbed
You must keep up with chores (Washing dishes, taking out the trash, toilet maintenance, and setting rat traps) While also making sure you keep your customers happy

Now, all this CAN seem overwhelming, and it is at first, but once you get used to it and buy some upgrades (You can upgrade multiple things to help you, as well as upgrade your shop), it becomes just paying attetion. Not to mention, it contains FULL keyboard support, so while serving customers, you don't have to touch your mouse at all if you don't want to.

All in all, Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a truly unique game that i enjoy, and many other people would enjoy as well. It depends on your taste in games, but if you like unqiue games, you just HAVE to give this game a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074217543', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 16753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5046, 'last_played': 1680029328}
review: Basiclly, a Ridiculiously Fast Cooking-Layering-Grilling-Baking-Cutting-Dating-Investing Simulator. Which is really fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025411841', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 2518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1187, 'last_played': 1640443675}
review:
Un jeu qui possède sa bonne dose de difficulté (qui va crescendo), aussi bien jouable à la manette qu'au clavier. Dans ce jeu vous dirigez un restaurant dont le but est de se retrouver au sommet de l'art culinaire. Préparez de splats (il semble que l'on soit l'unique employé), entretenez votre cuisine, améliorez vos ingrédiens et apprenez de plus en plus de recettes pour devenir le restaurant le plus hype de toute la ville.

Cela peut laisser sceptique mais si vous cherchez un jeu qui dure pendant bien longtemps et qui entraîne votre coordination oeil-main, vous venez de le trouver. Règles simples, challenge élevé. Seule chose à lui reprocher : n'existe qu'en Anglais. Ce qui n'est pas une si grande gêne en soi.

Attention, ce jeu a des effets secondaires tels que : l'impression d'avoir bien dépensé son argent, addiction, envie de manger ou de boire, "masturbation" de clavier et/ou de manette par moments, petites douleurs articulaires.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981706607', 'num_games_owned': 4129, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 1338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1267, 'last_played': 1430007320}
review: This is one of the most stressful games I've ever played.  And I put over 20 hours into it over a period of weeks, always coming back to it to serve another day.  You are running a restaurant, but the complexity of it severely outstrips your regular diner dash style game.  Almost every food has multiple recipes (there are something like 35 different hamburger combinations possible), and your menu has upwards of 20 items, of which you can serve 4-6 on any given day.  Manage service, janitorial requirements and a variety of other tasks.  It's hard to describe how complex and yet how engaging this game is.  It is seriously stressful, especially on the later levels, but pulling off 88 orders in a row perfectly is a rush; this is really an underrated and great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987679709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 771, 'last_played': 1502059447}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025010678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1415584890}

author: {'steamid': '76561198023734662', 'num_games_owned': 466, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1453949053}
review:
The first time I saw this game was on a live stream, and with that I put it on my wishlist. Having picked it up recently... I am not disappointed in the least.

The gameplay is simple and tight with an addictive "1 more day" type of feeling to it. The feeling of that first perfect day was awesome as well as once you get into the swing of things learning the buttons for each dish and being able to hammer them out with precision. It's a simple concept with a tycoon type feel to it rising from a simple 0 star to the 5 start goal. I'ce only just gotten into this game and I forsee many hours being spent in it. Cook, Serve, Delicious is HIGHLY reccomended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048804031', 'num_games_owned': 1854, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1408876041}

author: {'steamid': '76561198112417199', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2485, 'last_played': 1656414672}
review:
I really like this game! I can finally say I can cook, at least.

But a question: Is there any chance we can potentially see more foods added to this? I like the current variety, but that's why I also want just a bit more things to boggle your mind with and still keep up with all other restaurant related matters.



Long story short, I can highly recommend this game to anyone who wants to heighten their senses and learn to multitask.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158120283', 'num_games_owned': 69, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 958, 'last_played': 1637934469}
review:
일러스트 보는 점은 별로 였다.
일단 키 설정 했으면 재료 암기는 필수이고, 기타 등등은 키 설정 못하는 것 같지만,
편리 하게 누를 수 있도록 키를 맞추어 놓은 것 같을 정도로 플레이가 편리했다. 그 점에서 호감을 표한다.
방향 조작키를 응용한 점은 다 비슷하겠지만, 여러 가지 청소상황을 표현시킨 아이디어가 있다는 점은 좋았다.
버튼 하나 차이로 호감을 져버리고 분주 하다는 촉박감이 긴장감과 몰입도를 높여주는 효과가 있어
오기가 생기는 점도 있고 리셋 처리도 가능해서 재도전을 할 수 있는 기회를 제공해 주는 점도 좋았다
메뉴는 다양해지는데 하다보면 한쪽으로 치우치는 느낌도 든다.
고기가 익힌 다음에 조리하는 것은 신경이 너무 쓰이므로 메뉴에 넣고 싶지 않는 점 조작과 그 안에 소모되는
시간을 생각하면 불편하다는 조리 형식만 제외하고는 지장 없이 하기 편하다
다만 인디 게임이니 가끔씩 손을 움직이는 게임 정도만 인식 된다는 느낌이다

author: {'steamid': '76561198098463358', 'num_games_owned': 526, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1678498423}

author: {'steamid': '76561198010019421', 'num_games_owned': 2599, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 3111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3099, 'last_played': 1577662863}
review:
I don't know if putting the establishment on the top floor of an office building is such a good idea.   You seem to be open seven days a week with no free time, your customers are picky as hell, and any prospective love interest just uses you for your cooking and abandons you for more interesting pursuits even if you do everything right.  

And what kind of platinum-star restaurant only does takeout and doesn't have any staff other than the owner? 

But seriously, very entertaining game (if you aren't afraid of using the keyboard, anyway) and big thumbs up to the developers to expand on the game (extreme difficulty, battle kitchen, etc) without charging players for a DLC.  Kudos to all of you.  

Bananas Foster/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198062157695', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 639, 'last_played': 1449908434}
review:
I love this game so much. Very recommended for people that crave for more hardcore restaurant simulation game, because when you play this game, it feels like you really taking care of your own restaurant. And the little details here and there make the game even more interesting.

What makes this game even more recommended is because the developer, David Galindo, had been so helpful to fellow indie developers by sharing his experience on how to be indie game devs. The story was inspiring as well.

I'll be waiting for your next simulation game! (hopefully it will be restaurant-related again :))

author: {'steamid': '76561198058814191', 'num_games_owned': 981, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1029, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 916, 'last_played': 1693643856}

author: {'steamid': '76561198061811163', 'num_games_owned': 226, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 515, 'last_played': 1414839769}
review:
In Cook, Serve, Delicious you run a restaurant progressing from a basic establishment with a  modest selection of recipes to a 5 star restaurant offering more advanced food. The player has the responsibility of performing every action needed to run the restaurant (taking the orders, preparing the food, cooking, collecting the money).
The game can be played solely using your keyboard or gamepad, which adds to its fast nature. You will be put under a lot of stress when facing multiple customers and thus incorrectly execute seemingly simple tasks.
For a game that isn't supposed to be played for many hours consecutively the progression from day to day can often be neglegible leading to a lack of motivation to keep playing.
Anyway I recommend the game due to its unique concept.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036173034', 'num_games_owned': 1588, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 1050, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1590081395}
review:
At first glance, this might seem like an uninteresting clone of some other game in the genre. After much time playing, I can say first-hand that this is a great and addictive game unlike other games I've seen. You will have to frantically mash buttons on a keyboard (or click on the buttons) in a certain time limit to prepare your appetizing dish. 

                                                               8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198119535138', 'num_games_owned': 217, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 1060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1445566757}

author: {'steamid': '76561197965038766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 680, 'last_played': 1475280044}
review:
An addictive resturaunt sim for foodies looking to train their cordination, multitask, and time utilization skills.
Don't even bother using a mouse to prepare foods, it's all about memorizing the fast keyboard commands.  
Work your way up to 5 stars dishes in a 5 star resturaunt.  A simple concept full of rich development gameplay. 
Perfection is key, but do not go crazy when you slip up a few things...every bit of training and progress counts.
My advice, invest a ton in wine and fish for an early cash boost.  Lasagna is easily the most stressful.
Highly recommended, but don't play on an empty stomach!

author: {'steamid': '76561198049183091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 190, 'playtime_forever': 5284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 25, 'playtime_at_review': 612, 'last_played': 1710526141}
review: So addictive. You have to deal with multiple customers, the amount of which you have to serve at once increasing the further through the game you get, with many different foods that require different making skills, and while the mouse is easier to remember and use, keyboard shortcuts are quicker, you have to find an accurate balance. You will start off failing, but after an hour or so it will become second nature. Very complex and deep game mechanics exist as you get further in too, such as bets and upgrades.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005029877', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1620386435}
review:
Before I can actually say anything about the game I have to say that Chubigans, the man responsible for this creation, is easily one of the coolest and nicest indie developers I have ever had to write to.  And just on that aspect alone he deserves your money, but then he made this game and it's worth ever penny spent.

Some would say, "this game is casual." And to them I suggest they try multi-tasking a queue of 5 burger orders at once during rush time while still needing to flush a toilet, give a thumbs up on social media, and set a mouse trap while the health inspector is watching.  That is twitch control so furious that even some pros couldn't take it.  But somehow even with the game going as frentic as it does it's still fun just making food and taking all the orders.

Definitely one worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056993739', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 1452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1103, 'last_played': 1495761855}

author: {'steamid': '76561198069799953', 'num_games_owned': 320, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1437443523}
review:
An interesting little game to have found. Once again I got this game through Humble and I enjoyed wasting a few hours on Cook, Serve, Delicious!

Basic keyboard (or controller) commands help you to prepare customer food orders. at the end of each day you can use the money you earned from customer orders to upgrade your menu or restaurant. 

There's no serious gaming here, but it is a fun little waste of time that I suspect young kids would enjoy. Heck I enjoyed the hour I spent playing.

[Edit] To respond to some of the comments: It's just an opinion. It's a genuinely good game, it's just not the type of game I'd invest hours upon hours on. It has the feel of a more casual game. I like that about it. It's not pretending to be anything other than what it is. It kind of reminds me of the old game 'Ant War'.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986709871', 'num_games_owned': 627, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1269, 'last_played': 1632164893}
review: I love this game. It is addictive, difficult, fast-paced and awesome. There is humor in the email system if you take the time to read them. It is sort of like WarioWare with the fast paced mini-games, except each mini-game is creating food that was ordered. I highly recommend this game to anyone who likes a challenge. It has high replayability because you can customize your menu many different ways and master different foods. It now has a + mode for after you beat the game. The first "Super Rush Hour" you do is insane. It keeps me coming back for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076561296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 867, 'last_played': 1417971142}
review:
Neste jogo, além de ser o dono de um novo restaurante, você é cozinheiro do mesmo.

O objetivo é transformar seu restaurante de periferia em um 5 estrelas, com direito a cardápio refinado e clientes VIP.

Para conseguir aumentar suas estrelas, tem uma sequencia de requisitos mínimos, entre eles um tanto x de dias de trabalho, dar um upgrade nas comidas, atender festas particulares, passar nas inspeções sanitárias e etc.

O cardápio é meio limitado, poderia ter mais ampla variedade de comidas, mesmo elas tendo seus upgrades, e com isso criando uma diversividade do mesmo prato ( exemplo a lasanha, que começa só a básica, após o upgrade além da básica tem também a de vegetais e de carne).

No dia do trabalho, você além de atender os pedidos, tem que armar ratoeira, limpar o banheiro, lavar os pratos, e tem que fazer muitas vezes na hora do rush ( maior movimento de clientes) ou você perde um dia perfeito ( onde todos são atendidos exatamente o que pediram, e tudo foi limpo).

Além de ganhar um bônus de dinheiro, um dia perfeito rende mais gorjetas que o normal.

Enfim, é um jogo de gerenciamento ( saber onde investir no começo), junto de culinária, pois muito dos pratos são pratos famosos e reais, o que lhe acaba ensinando umas coisas a mais.

Recomendo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198076891170', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1411967640}

author: {'steamid': '76561198094304077', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1510, 'last_played': 1463618886}
review: If you want to play a restaurant sim, this is the best game for the genre. CSD is an incredibly deep and meaty (pun intended) experience. Unlike other restaurant sims, this is played behind the counter, rather than an overhead restaurant view, making the game more immersive. Along with buying foods for your restaurant, you'll be upgrading them and adding more ingredients. There is also catering for office parties, cooking in an iron chef parody, and an intense version of the normal game wer you must perfect all orders or walk home in shame. Along with those, you can date people by cooking their favorite foods and take up bets to make a lot of cash. Overall, CSD is a very deep game that'll have you playing for hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072265390', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1415565889}

author: {'steamid': '76561197961377588', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 677, 'last_played': 1483546008}

author: {'steamid': '76561198059998161', 'num_games_owned': 847, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1433955563}
review:
Restaurant sahibisiniz ve amacınız olabildiğince fazla para kazanmak, müşterileri yiyecekler konusunda mennun etmek ve işletmenize yıldız kazandırmak üzerine ilerleyen bir oyun. Basit bir arayüze sahip ve gün içerisinde müşterilere yemek yetiştirmeye çabalamakla meşgulsünüz. Servisi en kısa sürede halletmek için sürekli klavye tuşları ile aranızı iyi tutmanız lazım. Günün belli saatlerinde de müşteri yoğunluğuyla mücadele etmelisiniz ve hata yapmadan tamamlamaya bakmalısınz. Yeni yemekler menüye koymalı, menü tercihlerini arttırmalısınız.

Basit eğlence oyunu olsa da yönetim oyunlarına merakınız ve ilginiz varsa kısa sürede alışabileceğiniz bir yapım. Kolay oynanabilirlik ile bağımlılık yaratıyor ve sürenin nasıl geçtiğini anlamıyorsunuz bile. Yaratıcı ve tasarım bakımından başarılı. Kesinlikle eğlenceli ve denemeniz gerekli.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119746771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 1423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1506194416}
review: Running around really fast, you will learn the hotkeys in a short amount of time and become a great chef. Good game for when you have a bit of downtime.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085224806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1503635524}
review: awesome.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971020587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 2612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2549, 'last_played': 1416353945}
review:
This game is a nightmare!!!! Man do I get muddled up, trying to think what they have ordered and to press the right buttons. In general this game puts you on a timer and depending which dish has been ordered you need to press the correct buttons before the timer runs out. Its fun at first but quickly becomes a chore, if it wasnt for the achievements id of stopped playing after about a hour. Its not that the way its been implemented is poor its just... to me, the game mechanic is very boring. You may feel differently ofcourse. One thing I guess it does well is to make you feel like your rushed off your feet in the kitchen, trying to get the orders out before the dishes burn etc. As you progress in the game you upgrade your dishes, which adds more choices to the customers and in turn sends u that lil bit more bat shit crazy. If you dont expect to much I doubt your be to dissapointed with the game. Overall I give it 5/10

Edit: I feel the need to edit this review because once ive got a little further in the game im finding myself enjoying it alot more, the new game+ which opens once youve got as far as a platinum restaurant is super fun, you need lightning reactions and quick eyes to survive... im trully enjoying it. Therefore im changing the score to positive and the rating to 7 out of ten

author: {'steamid': '76561198041758070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1469466852}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious! Is a very intresting little game. Way more than I expected when I first got it. I thought it was going to be a simple cooking game and serve it with little challenge. But what I got instead was detail on what to buy, certain upgrades and level up in stars.

At the start you buy a restaurant which has no stars because you just started. You get certain goals you have to do in order to rank up. The goal of the game is to reach 5 stars as far as I can tell so far as I'm only at 3 stars at the momment.
With the money you earn from food you have to buy foods so you can cook for that day. Be carefull what you choice as you need to balance out how long one thing is to make with another.
To cook. It's easy if you know every button on your keyboard. As each button from A - Z can have a role in whatever you cook. For example Bacon may be "B" and Lettuce being "L" sometimes more than one starting letter can be in the food such as Cheese and Chicken so it puts it to another letter or if you want you can change it yourself.

I have played a few hours of this game now and do enjoy going back onto this game for a few hours. If you have extra money and want to learn your keyboard. I say try this game out. You know where every key is at the end of this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984076972', 'num_games_owned': 4967, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1142, 'last_played': 1416648886}
review:
Il s'agit d'un jeu de "gestion" d'un restaurant, où le joueur doit préparer les commandes du menu qu'il a composé, en tapant les touches correspondant à la commande. D'abord simple (2 ingrédients par type de mets), les menus deviennent de plus en plus complexes (la pizza aux diverses accommodations, la brochette et la soupe deviennent rapidement des cauchemars). Il faut en plus jongler entre les corvées (vaisselle, chasse à la vermine, poubelles, WC) et l'afflux de clients grâce au buzz de votre restau qui dépend de son statut (nombre d'étoiles), du menu (les clients préférant des menus à basse calorie), du plat du jour, de la variété de l'offre, du temps qu'il fait et surtout, de la qualité du service.
Ajouter à cela un inspecteur sanitaire vérifiant que l'on effectue les corvées, des vols à résoudre en établissant un portrait robot, des critiques culinaires à soigner parfois au détriment des autres clients et des romances possibles et on obtient un jeu qui devient de plus en plus addictif, celui-ci offrant en outre des défis de rapidité, des paris ainsi que des menus "leaderboards".

author: {'steamid': '76561197960379083', 'num_games_owned': 2694, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1421443700}
review:
Played this with a x360 controller which worked well. It doesn’t really simulate cooking but instead it simulates the pressure of working in a busy restaurant really well. The game is nicely paced, rush hours actually become frantic panic as you try to get orders out fast without making a mistake, followed by quieter lulls which come as a relief to let you recover. 

The game does become a bit repetitive but I found myself coming back to it often to play in short bursts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054672630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1770, 'last_played': 1471844253}
review:
What can I say about this game? Well its very fun cause you get to make what the customers want to eat. At first you will start at a low star restaurant, decent amount of cash to buy food and equipments, and few customers. When you start playing, it will start slow with some customers who want this or that. At a certain hour, you will enter Rush Hour which means you wll get lots of customers who will enter your restaurant like crazy. Meaning once you complete an order, another one will come in but you will get lots of money for doing it. Don't forget to clean your duties like take out the trash, wash dishes, flush the toilet, and set mouse traps. If you fail to do those chores, you will get a bad reputation which is bad. During each day you play (game day, not real life), you will get some letters that will tell you how well u did at your restaurants, get some bonus cash, buzz to increase your restaurant popularity, and other times you'll just get spam mail which is kinda hilarious to read but gets annoyed real quick.

To receive your first star restaurant, you must follow the requirements like complete 20 days; have inspection 3 times; and so on. Plus, you can even upgrade your food which will give you more cash but there are some foods that have some complicated commands to input but you can memorize it and you will have no problems. If you don't wanna run your restaurant, there's another game option where you can do a catering and participate in a cooking show. You do well, you'll earn good amount of cash but you cannot repeat those challenges, its like one of those one time event.

Cook, Serve, Delicious! is absolute a fun cooking game. You will be in the zone when Rush Hour arrives and you just wanna keep on playing till you reach a 5 star restaurant.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057849814', 'num_games_owned': 1156, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 2074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2019, 'last_played': 1415844329}
review:
[h1]AT A GLANCE[/h1]
(Full review follows below)

[list]
[*] [b]Game Name:[/b] Cook, Serve, Delicious!
[*] [b]Original Release:[/b] 2013
[*] [b]Genre Tags:[/b] Management; Simulation; Fast-Paced; Casual; Unique
[*] [b]My Overall Grade:[/b] A
[*] [b]Estimated Playtime (Campaign):[/b] 20-40 hours
[*] [b]Multiplayer Aspect:[/b] Optional
[*] [b]Recommended To:[/b] Novelty seekers; Casual gamers 
[/list]	

[h1]REVIEW[/h1]
I found [b]Cook, Serve, Delicious![/b] to be a fun and refreshing experience.  It’s pretty simple, very easy to get into, and extremely addictive.  Little things get added as you progress (like dating, special challenge tournaments, investments, upgrades and such) but for the most part you just do the same thing from day (level) 1 to day 100.  Luckily right about when you start to get over it, you find yourself at the finish line.

I was a little intimidated by it before I tried it, because it looks like it can be one of those frustrating and difficult games, where you need twitch reflexes and expert precision... but it’s actually surprisingly easy.  You do need to be fast and precise, but like: you can't even lose.  I went through some days purposely messing up every single order to see what happens, and nothing happens except for you slowing your progress to the end of the game.  That said, don't think it’s not challenging.  If you want to really conquer the game, you'll want to try to get perfect days as much as you can... and that can be quite a challenge.  Also the special challenge tournaments you need to beat for the last few sections of the game are a little challenging, but they are certainly beatable.

I will be honest though, the entire aspect of the game is simply a test of your ability to perceive stimuli and coordinate multitasking of entering codes into a keyboard.  That's the whole game.  Slowly the complexity of the keyboard codes goes up, the number of things you need to multitask goes up, and little other aspects are sprinkled in to keep your mind on its metaphorical toes.  But it's fun.  And it's fresh and different.  I like puzzlers and braintwister games and I certainly hadn't experienced anything like [b]Cook, Serve, Delicious![/b] until I played [b]Cook, Serve, Delicious![/b]  If you enjoy mentally stimulating games then I think you'll like the fresh and enjoyable experience this game provides.

Update:  With the free update of "Battle Kitchen Edition" there is now local multiplayer, weekly challenges, leaderboard contests, and some new character unlockables and customization.

[i][url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/murphyslawyercuration#curation]Follow my curation page to see more of my recommendations![/url][/i]

review: This game is incredibly fun and easy to learn, with plenty of fantastic humor to accompany it. This game is well worth the money, and it's a steal for what you get. Easily one of my favorite games. It's a quick going game, so it can be played when you have a small amount of free time on your hands, but has a continuity in the storyline to where it can be played for hours on end. It's constantly changing and always a fun, interesting challenge. Buy it, it's well worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014101835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1249, 'last_played': 1474691941}
review:
Let's just say this game is really addictive. Initially, I felt the game was a little intimidating with regards to having to design an optimal menu, so I actually left the game in my library for a few days before finally getting to purchasing the needed menu; maybe the problem is because I always try to min-max my choices.

Anyway, once that's out of the way, things actually got more and more interesting and guess what, I am HOOKED!!! The game is challenging initially with some menu items, like soup. But as you get the hang of it, it's really not that difficult. The game allows upgrades of food, there's catering events, betting events, and many more; even dating and competition - but I am not that far into the game yet.

Right now I am only 19.9 hours into the game and I just got my 2-star restaurant. It's considered slow because I am a perfectionist and if I don't get a perfect day (i.e. not a single mistake), I won't let it slide and will restart the entire day. If you are not like me, the game may be much easier. But I think aiming for the perfect day everyday is part of the fun! :D

Another good thing is that you are free to decide how much time you want to commit to this game in a setting because sometimes, you just don't have a lot of time at one sitting to play a more serious game like Assetto Corsa. You can decide how long or how short you want to play it, good for busy people like me.

This is a really fun game and I highly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041449479', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 789, 'last_played': 1487328301}
review:
This game has to be at the top of your list if you love a good Sim. 
Whike the game doesn't let you customise your store, or some of the more complicated business matters, it focusses on the actual day to day menu writing and cooking (and serving) of meals. 
Each meal is a series of buttons and clicks to add elements to the dish. It all seems so simple, and it probably is. But boy is it challenging. You would think that after a while you would be able to master it and get perfection every service day, but the aaddition of new meals, challenges galore, and the need to serve a perfect day is enough to keep you coming back every day for another day at the griddle.

Great game! Definitely work $10. A funny, engaging, combo chasing game.
