author: {'steamid': '76561198003132759', 'num_games_owned': 1573, 'num_reviews': 185, 'playtime_forever': 1610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1256, 'last_played': 1420940532}
review:
I installed this just to collect the trading cards. 20 hours of gameplay later, and I'm still going.

It neatly combines charm, humour and light strategy with the increasingly challenging task of preparing and serving the meals.

Although it could have felt grindy, with each star requiring twenty days of service, the game constantly encourages you to change your menu though special events (VIPs, dates, bets) and "menu rot", meaning that you can't just stick with the "safe" dishes like fish and salads - nachos, burgers and the damned soups need to be on the menu at times as well. This ensures that it's constantly fresh and challenging. 

It's a deceptively deep game, and one with plenty of potential enjoyment.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999201261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1060, 'last_played': 1410019337}
review:
Love this game. Fun and a great time waster. Nothing complex here but entertaining and keeps you sharp. Highly recommend!

Pros:
Fun
Easy to learn, hard to master
Lots of variety
Mini games keep it fresh
Lots of control/options
Perfect learning curve

Cons:
Graphics a bit dated, but didn't bother me personally
Gets a bit old after a while

Thanks for Cook, Serve, Delicious! !!

review:

게임자체의 게임성에 별다른 기대 없이 했기때문인지 나름 괜찮은 게임이었다고 생각한다.
다만, 요리과정이나 조리과정이 단지 키보드를 누르는 것으로 진행되기 때문에 좀더 디테일하고 수준 높은 요리 게임을 원하신 다면 추천하지않는다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027589352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2013, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 859, 'last_played': 1447941769}
review:
This feels like the kind of game that helps build memory and awareness.  Each 'day' in the game is like a ten-minute exercise to wake up your brain!  I love it!

Folks have been asking me what I think of it and I keep describing it as a blend between 'Papers, Please' and 'Game Dev Tycoon'.  You spend the active days tapping together the orders given by your customer and the time between managing your menu and checking out special events and optional goals to grow your restaurant.  Good casual fun!

review:
Very simple, yet somehow addicting game.
Had great fun completing it the first time, but NG+ is too hard for me (not saying it is impossible to do, it's just impossible FOR ME to do).
I guess it's one of the games that's only generating fun by throwing constand unlocks and upgrades at you, but if it actually IS fun, why not.
I got this little gem by purchasing the humblebundle, there are certainly games which cost me 50 bucks which entertained me for far less hours.
I think i read that work on part II is in progress, looking forward to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037430125', 'num_games_owned': 979, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2016, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2016, 'last_played': 1408449604}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious! Es un juego de habilidad donde tienes que servir comidas rapidamente y sin cometer errores, además de gestionar tu restaurante de una manera simple. 

Probablemente hayáis jugado a algo parecido. Por mi parte, se me parece mucho a la saga de Papa's Pizzeria en Kongregate.

El juego es bastante adictivo al principio, pero acaba por resultar repetitivo al cabo de un tiempo.

Tiempo para terminar(restaurante platino): Aproximadamente 20-25 horas.
Tiempo para conseguir 100% en Steam: 30-40 horas.

Por mi parte, totalmente recomendado si lo encontráis en un bundle o algo así, claro que no es un juego para todos, puede resultar algo estresante, aquí dejo un vídeo mío jugando: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=osTSwgk8KPA

author: {'steamid': '76561198063456617', 'num_games_owned': 421, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 1903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1672059395}
review:
[b]TL;DR - This is a QTE-based simulation that has as much to do about cooking as [i]Game Dev Tycoon[/i] has to do about game development.  This can definitely be classed as a casual game, but the balance between grinding for the next 'star' for your restaurant is balanced by the new meal/equipment rewards.  The game lacks much depth, but is still very addictive and fun - I'd recommend to anyone who is after pick-up/put-down play that can be extended for hours without much additional effort.[/b]

Cooking is done by selecting the customer (1-9) and following through with the preset key-presses needed to cook the meal they requested ('k' for 'ketchup' etc) within the allocated time-slot; the more orders you complete perfectly, the greater your 'buzz' value, which, in turn, brings in more customers. While this system works pretty well, on recipes with a large number of potential ingredients you can end up encountering difficulties - Cabbage, Celery and Cinnamon can't ALL be bound to the letter 'C', so you can end up having some unintuitive combinations.

Beyond the time-management and, essentially, typing-speed - the only other depth to the game is in the money resource-management - which can be spent on either more recipes (each with their own pros/cons based on times-of-day and clientelle) and equipment (which gives passive bonuses - eg. need to do non-earning chores [such as cleaning the loo] as often).

My biggest complaint about this game is that it feels artificially long - it takes 20 days to earn your next 'star', even if all the other criteria has been met - making it sometimes feel like a bit of a grind if the unlocks you're earning each day are not for the recipes you're hoping for.  That said, the game does a good job of feeding you rewards often enough to keep you playing, and those days that you manage to get a perfect score do feel like a real achievement.

This is not the 'war and peace' or 'charles dickens' of gaming - it's a fun throwaway game that is more fun than you're probably expecting it to be.  Definitely recommended - particularly if [i]Game Dev Tycoon[/i] ticked some of your boxes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048863294', 'num_games_owned': 4745, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1897, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1524, 'last_played': 1438669729}
review:
Juego sencillo pero muy entretenido y adictivo, donde la idea es que cada día sirvas a la mayor cantidad de personas posible, cumpliendo además con los quehaceres diarios como lavar los platos, sacar la basura, atrapar ladrones que nos intentan robar, etc. obteniendo la mayor cantidad de ganancias posibles, con las que luego podrás comprar nuevas comidas, actualizar las que ya tienes y comprar equipamiento para el restaurant para hacer las tareas más eficientemente y así cumplir los requerimientos para poder aumentar la cantidad de estrellas de tu restaurant. En particular, la forma de atrapar a los ladrones que entran a robar tu restaurant es bastante divertida, debiendo armar un identikit/retrato del ladrón exactamente como lo describe un testigo para que la policía lo atrape. Luego de cada día que juguemos debemos organizar el día siguiente, el menú y los desafíos a tomar y revisar nuestra casilla de mails. Muchos de los mails que llegan en la casilla de TowerMail son muy divertidos y sin duda te sacarán más de una sonrisa.

No lo considero para nada un juego casual dado que verdaderamente requiere tener mucha habilidad en cuanto a memoria, atención y capacidad de multitarea. Al comienzo puede aparentar ser un poco monótono, pero a medida que comienzan a llegar desafíos, eventos de catering y un montón de extras adicionales al trabajo diario, se hace bien llevadero. Incluso una vez avanzado el juego se agregan un par de opciones más con desafíos diarios y challenges particulares para concursar en leaderboards específicos de Steam.

La música es muy placentera y carnavalesca (muy parecida a las clásicas bossas de los Sims o Tropico), y se pone un poco más tensa en las rush hours u horas pico, haciendo sentir la presión que en algunos casos conllevan, ya que se suelen juntar muchas órdenes a la vez y esto hace que estemos literalmente a dos manos intentando completarlas.

En cuanto a los mandos, a mi gusto la forma más cómoda de jugarlo es con teclado, ya que permite mapear las diferentes acciones a teclas particulares según la primer letra del ingrediente o cualquier otro criterio, siendo completamente configurable para cualquiera de las comidas e ingredientes. Lo jugué también con un mando de XBox360, dado que soporta varios tipos de mando, pero en este caso se hacía menos mnemotécnico y más difícil acordarse de los atajos, aunque seguro no es más que acostumbrarse.

Lo que vendría bien a mi gusto es información histórica sobre como nos ha ido a lo largo de los días, además de poder cargar otra de las partidas guardadas sin tener que reiniciar el juego. Me pasó por ejemplo que al jugarlo con alguien que recién comenzaba tenía por un lado mi partida con mi restaurant de 3 estrellas y otra con uno de 1 estrella (más sencillo) y cada vez que nos turnábamos debíamos salir del juego y volver a entrar para cargar la otra casilla. [i][b]UPDATE[/b]: estas cosas están solucionadas con los nuevos updates que han sacado los devs, que además agregan una gran variedad de desafíos adicionales single y multiplayer, varios tipos de local co-op, entre otras muchas características que hacen al título todavía más interesante[/i].

Resumiendo, sin duda es un juego que va a poner a prueba tu capacidad para multitarea y concentración, y puede llegar a ser muy estresante tan pronto como comiencen a acumularse muchas tareas al mismo tiempo a medida que el restaurant va ganando estrellas y se vayan agregando más estaciones. Le doy un 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198052580844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 821, 'last_played': 1407672220}
review:
Délirant!
Ce n'est pas vraiment un jeu de gestion/simulation comme on pourrait le croire.
Le but du jeu est plutôt de martyriser son clavier avec beaucoup de précision! Il faut être capable de mémoriser les raccourcis clavier (à la souris c'est injouable) pour traiter les commandes le plus rapidement possible sans faire d'erreur (sans oublier les corvées: faire la vaisselle, sortir les poubelles, s'occuper des chiottes...)
On se prend vite au jeu et c'est assez marrant, à essayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073868405', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1505539527}
review:
Interesting game, really interesting. No, I mean, seriously, interesting game.

A very detailed as well as well-organized food/chef simulator. Kinda like Citizen Burger Disorder but it's easier and again, better-organized than that game.

Could be boring if you keep playing for a long time period, an inevitable problem for all simulation game.

If you like to cook, you are very likely to enjoy this game. Don't play for too long one time. 3-5 ingame days per time is the most appropriate time period.

Recommended purchase from HB instead of Steam since it's more likely to meet the discount on HB.

Just finished Day 5, may update this review as I keep playing.

There is no help for you guys listening me to explain pros and cons of this game. Try it out. The proof is in the pudding.

If you think I'm right, please give thumbs-up. Thanks.

Until then, farewell.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Update 1: 1 star restaurant achieved.

Have played for 20+ ingame days and this game still attracts me. Perfect day could be pretty hard to get if not manage food properly. Really don't want to meet customers who want "La-Cheap Wine" or its upgrade version since my fingers will become kinda sore and sweaty.

Working on 2 star restaurant so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095402252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1514145171}
review:
This game is totally worth your money. Starting out it may seem easy but as you move into the game it becomes much more difficult, rush hour guests, crimanals to catch, chores and much more. As the game progresses you unlock new upgrades you can buy as well as certian events being unlocked which makes it fresh all the time. Also, the Star system is great in my opinion always giving you a goal to strive for and with bets, and leaderboard challange it can always feel rewarding to complete a day. The managment aspects are good as well, buzz is a very hard thing to manage and at first you will be stucj at about 30% buzz. Finding foods that work toghther and give off positive buzz is essential. It also has a extreme difficulty mode for once you have mastered the normal story it is a big challange. Also, (at least in my opinion) the music in-game is great and I could listen too it all day.

 I couldn't cover everything in the game but buy it for yourself and trust me you will get your moneys worth. go play Cook, Serve, Delicious and serve up some amazing dishes.         

 P.S This game may make you hungry... VERY hungry

author: {'steamid': '76561198048917216', 'num_games_owned': 2273, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 2560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2560, 'last_played': 1407246577}
review:
作为一款休闲游戏而言实在是太细腻了，从菜肴的逸闻趣事，到相亲网站和众筹商品的模拟，无不体现出制作者的用心。

真希望后期能加入按键提示，天价卖都成啊

author: {'steamid': '76561198082738582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1570340660}
review:
78/100
Amazing small game, 3 hours feels like enough to give a basic rating.
Pros/Cons:
+Fast paced
+Dont just cook, have to do other work (Garbage, Dishes, Flush the toilet)
+/-Upgrades (They make your dishes harder to make, but bring more money in)
+/-Rush hour (Big bucks)
-Not enough recepies

Seeming how it is a small game, theres not much to rate, but I can tell you, this is a good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074727384', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 763, 'last_played': 1696886441}
review:
After a friend had me play this game when I was over one day, I only wanted to play it more! So when I finally got my hands on a copy of my own, I've done nothing but play it for hours when I could.

It tests your reflexes, and your ability to stay calm and work under pressure. It's a simple game, with simple fun, with bits of humor thrown in here and there. With new fun features being added to add more goals, more challenges, and more fun, this highly addictive game is worth picking up. Especially if you have a few hours to kill.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967616444', 'num_games_owned': 1029, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1085, 'last_played': 1496563633}
review:
Do you have aspirations of becoming a world-famour chef? Of running a five-star restaurant? And, perhaps more importantly, are you a bit of a masochist? If you answered yes to any of these questions, and you're not overly attached to your sanity, you'll probably enjoy CSD.

CSD puts a bit of an arcade spin on food service. You will of course be running the restaurant by yourself, but that shouldn't be a problem, right? You'll just have to prepare food for all the customers, keep on top of the restaurant chores (those dishes won't do themselves), and generally keep on top of everything during rush hour. Upgrade your restaurant to service more and more people, buy and unlock more complex and difficult recipes, continue to run the restaurant completely by yourself, try not to let the health inspector know your restaurant has a rat problem, try and impress that cute girl (or guy) who has a thing for that one recipe you couldn't cook if your life depended on it, agree to do catering for events where the guests seem to do nothing but crowd the food bar and insist on difficult dishes, OH GOD I WANT MY DESK JOB BACK.

Psychiatrist sessions sold separately.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049185996', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2363, 'last_played': 1417310805}
review: If you like simulators and food, this game is perfect for you! You need to serve food in your restaurant which it will be improving little by little. Every day you need to plan your menu, to be atent to different events like rainy days... You need to spend your money to buy new foods or improve your older ones. Also, at the same time you serve the food you need to throw away your rubbish, clean the dishes or the toilet. A fun game that with practise can be a perfect game and improve your achievements average :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198123418255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1668, 'last_played': 1479605985}
review: After I was able to get my game to launch using the "rollbackmac" patch, I was immediately sucked into this game. I used to work food service so this could have been part of the draw, but it's a great game even if you haven't struggled your way through a rush hour with impatient customers in real life. The review that really sold me on picking this up during the Steam Summer sale was the one suggesting it was for those who like "crying and stress." I didn't go back to the review to find the users name, but thank you kind person for ensuring that I didn't pass this treasure up.

review:
Lo cierto es que no soy aficionado a este tipo de juegos, pero para ser franco lo cierto es que engancha bastante, me he sorprendido a mi mismo. 
No solamente tienes que estar preparando los platos tienes muchas otras cosas que hacer en el juego, como comprar los alimentos, actualizarlos, comprar mejoras para la cocina, pasar impecciones, concursar en caterings...
Yo lo compre en humble por 1€ para pasar el rato... pero nada de eso, te picas un monton. A sido un € muy bien invertido.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097624421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1407153728}
review:
Well, if there is one game that simulates the life of a fastfood worker rather well, it's probably this one. Tedious and repetitive tasks, customers without patience, and someone from management who never shows his face ordering you to change up stuff every few days for no good reason. Things people working in the fastfood industry probably don't get in real life: betting on how many happy customers they can serve in a day, dating other fastfood workers through your inbox, quite bothersome safety inspections and $300 a day in profits. 

Sadly enough, neither the realistic parts nor the additions are all that interesting. Timewaster with very slow progression. Keep working, keep getting achievements, spend money on recipes and upgrades, and other not so interesting stuff. 

Maybe the boss fight at the end is superawesome. I wouldn't know. Can't be bothered to finish it.

It isn't that expensive, and it's definitely got hours and hours of gameplay. If you're into this kind of stuff, that is.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966447930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1428638181}
review:
I have mixed feelings about Cook, Serve, Delicious! While it's initially a lot of fun, preparing the same foods over and over again quickly becomes repetitive. To its credit, the game attempts to mix things up by introducing concepts like the catering mode (cook a smaller selection of food!) or daily bets (cook very specific foods!) but these extra modes did little to keep my interest.

I couldn't bring myself to finish Cook, Serve, Delicious! so I've got to give it a thumbs down. But if it goes on sale for cheap, I wouldn't fault you for picking it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006403923', 'num_games_owned': 1593, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1334, 'last_played': 1630042106}
review:
Fun game that'll give you hours and hours of time-killing power!
I bought too many recipes when I first started this game, and restarted after day 2.

On my current try, I started with 3 recipes: Fried Chicken, Salad and Beer

Pouring beer is a no-brainer. Stop pouring as soon as the head appears.
Salads are easy to assemble with the keyboard. 
Fried chicken is just dipping it in the frier, and then putting it on the plate. I got a little ahead of myself a few times, and served raw chicken. Ooops. ;)

Overall, a fun game that is an easy buy if it's on sale or part of a bundle.

EDIT: SOUP IS PAINFUL TO MAKE. AVOID!

author: {'steamid': '76561198017082598', 'num_games_owned': 691, 'num_reviews': 272, 'playtime_forever': 2003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2003, 'last_played': 1521456470}
review:
[h1]Kto jeść nie lubi, niech spłonie, a kto lubi, niech zagra w [i]Cook, Serve, Delicious![/i][/h1]


W mojej skromnej opinii Cook, Serve, Delicious! to jedna z najlepszych gierek zręcznościowych, w jakie grałam w ostatnim czasie (czyli w sumie tylko ta...). Kiedy załączam CSD, to wszyscy się śmieją, że Narwana [i]naparza w żarcie[/i]. No nie oszukujmy się, ale każdy lubi jedzenie, nierzadko w dużych ilościach…

Cook, Serve, Delicious! to nie tylko składanie hamburgerów, ale również 48 ciekawych osiągnięć, o które warto się postarać, a co za tym idzie - trzeba rozegrać od 20 godzin wzwyż. W tej grze urzekło mnie również otrzymywanie wiadomości na skrzyknę e-mailową, w których są spam (zwykle śmieszne notki, warto czytać), informacje o dostępnym wyposażeniu, prośby o dotacje na rozmaite projekty, przypomnienia o dostępnych ulepszeniach, możliwość zakładów, zapowiedzi inspekcji sanitaryjnych i...

(przełyka ślinę)

...NO DOBRA! Powiem to! W Cook, Serve, Delicious! można też randkować! W opcjach wybieramy pożądaną płeć i co jakiś czas możemy (nie musimy) się zgadzać na randki. W opisie persony widnieje, co chciałaby sobie zjeść - następnego dnia musimy jej to przyrządzić, lepiej dobrze, bo jeszcze się obrazi i tyle będzie z romansu. Zamówienia od potencjalnej sympatii są oznaczone serduszkiem - SŁODKIE! To taka ciekawostka w sumie. No i można też polubić zdjęcia jedzenia ozdobione filtrami na aplikacji typu Instagram.

Oczywiście dążymy do restauracji 5-gwiazdkowej i gości bynajmniej nieprzypominających żuli spod sklepu z niedopitymi jabolami w rękach. Chcemy jak najwięcej VIP-ów oznaczonych złotą gwiazdką. Mimo to, nawet mając kuchnię rozwiniętą do maksimum, musimy: czyścić toaletę, stawiać pułapki na szczury, myć gary i wyrzucać wory ze śmieciami. To takie małe utrudnienie pomiędzy wykonywaniem zamówień. Rodzajów jedzenia jest właściwie od cholery, że tak to ujmę kolokwialnie. Fast food, mięsne rarytasy, owoce morza... O właśnie, są takie dania, które do karty menu da się przypiąć permanentnie, np. kawa, piwo czy zupa, inne należy wymieniać po dwóch dniach, inaczej maleje zadowolenie ogólne klienteli. Na wyższym poziomie mamy już sześć slotów na potrawy, ale potrzeba nam tylko trzech dań, żeby przejść kolejny dzień. Kasę zbiera się całkiem dobrze, nie mamy żadnych restrykcyjnych nakazów, ile pieniędzy powinno się nagromadzić. Dzień roboczy trwa od 9 rano do 10 wieczorem i to od zawartości menu zależy, ile się zarobi. Napiwki również istnieją.

Rozgrywka jest przyjemna, ale nie myszką, tylko na klawiaturze. W końcu to zręcznościowa gra, heloł! Ładna grafika.

Plusem są także dodatkowe wydarzenia, np. catering, na którym obsługujemy gości i dostajemy za to wynagrodzenie. Najcięższe są Głodowe Igrzyska, ale ja dałam radę, więc wy też dacie radę - zbierajcie złote bileciki!

Niestety są minusy. Na przykład to, że nie możemy ingerować w wygląd restauracji i nie wiemy, kim jest szef kuchni. No tak, to ja, ale fajnie by było mieć możliwość jakiejś personalizacji głównej postaci. Nieważne. Właściwie to pierwsze razi najbardziej, ale można się przyzwyczaić do wyglądu sali. Polecam tę grę, mnie bardzo wciągnęła!

[i]Zapraszam na moją stronę [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/27231431/]kuratora Steam[/url]. Na pewno znajdziesz tam coś dla siebie.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198034306697', 'num_games_owned': 1401, 'num_reviews': 614, 'playtime_forever': 3947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3810, 'last_played': 1417214408}
review:
A pretty spot-on simulator of being stressed out in a restaurant.
The orders will stress you out, the chores will stress you out, and even your dates will stress you out when they try to text you when you have a load of orders waiting or during rush hour. The best part about that is you can't stop and get back to your orders; you have to finish your little chat AND THEN are you allowed to go back making the food. The same goes with food.
[b]Not enough micromanagement in this game but still a nice stress simulator.[/b]


Side-note: When you "beat" the game and decide to start up "Extreme Difficulty" then get ready to pull your hair out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005376543', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 2393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1573, 'last_played': 1472750711}
review:
fun, Fun, FUN!

I love Cook, Serve, Delicious. It's fun, it's humorous and it's so relaxing to play!

CSD is a game based on a simple concept. You have a restaurant, you make a menu and at any moment you can have customers coming in for some variety of food you have put on your menu. Cooking requires typing correctly in a sequence to prepare your food and serve it.

There are a lot of additional factors to "spice up" the gameplay, like Rush Hours (two per day, lunch and dinner, a lot of customers come in at the same time), VIPs (they want to eat specific things), Robberies (you need to help the police identify the criminal), Romance (people who love specific things you cook), the Iron Cook challenge (Iron Chef spoof, you have to cook extremely fast), the Hunger Festivities (you have to cook perfectly ALL varieties of a certain food item in a sequence), Bets (you are challenged to have a specific menu) and a few other things here and there which I'm surely forgetting.

All in all, totally worth your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078452579', 'num_games_owned': 572, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1406315477}
review:
This game was actually far better than i thought it would be. I got it as part of a bundle and tried it out assuming it would be something along the lines of the many facebook cooking games. However it is much more in depth and you actually have to make each dish before you serve it. Some are relatively simple and only a few button clicks to make, however some are quite complicated and require a bit of timing to get right. 

Overall its a good game to pass some time, nothing too amazing but definately a step in the right direction for these types of games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970853734', 'num_games_owned': 1911, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 723, 'last_played': 1474757609}
review:
This game is REALLY simple. It's so simple and provocative to me as a programmer that i did not created and released this game. This game is soooo simple in technical and visual parts but this game can give you a lot of damn good time. You may stop playing after some hour but you want to go back and continue playing because it is so simple and fun that you cannot stop playing it.

The gameplay is simple: Customer order then you serve him\her. You have to accomplish things when the customer ordering something like putting the correct toppings on the food or cooking it and pressing the button in the correct time to serve it to the customer. Oh and don't forget about the rush hours which occurs 2 times a day. Of course like in every restaurant there are some cleaning you have to do like cleaning the toilet (2 button needs to be pressed not simultaneously) or cleaning dirty plates etc... . You can create your daily menu from more than 25+ food in the game. You can buy things to extend the patience of the customers and other things. The game gets harder when you get more stars for your restaurant.

If you are really fast and like to challenge yourself in this game there is an extreme difficulty for you. It will speed up a lot of things for you. The rush hour in this mode will be really challenging for most of the people.

I really recommend this game to you to get it and play with it. It's really simple and fun for a simple game that is unbelievable. This game contains a lot's of things that you expect a game like this and MORE. It is also good for relaxing after working. If you are still reading this and not owning\playing this game then go and get it NOW!

Have fun with it :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197998547567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1925, 'last_played': 1406949293}
review:
I've clocked in quite a lot of time with Cook, Serve, Delicious! , and can attest to its addictiveness. It is a game which places you under the stress of following repeated sets of instructions at a sometimes rapid pace. The setting is that of a restaurant where you, the head chef, must develop your instruction-following skills to exceptional standards.

The presentation is pretty straightforward and functional, with the art style cartoonish without sacrificing the necessary detail. The humour is quirkily offbeat and in places (primarily the food descriptions) mildly satirical. If you get gripped by addiction like I did you're likely to be annoyed by the music after awhile, although the sound effects are vital for you to be cooking at your best: difficulty can be applied by simply muting the game.

Although the game tries to enliven the cookery grind with betting, health inspections, tournaments and a rather bland dating system, the core elements remain unchanged from start to finish. I doubt the creators could have done any better without essentially building minigames from the ground up. Regardless, this is by definition a title of limited scope.

I do recommend this title, however given the aformentioned shallowness I also recommend buying it when it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119419833', 'num_games_owned': 108, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1468134570}
review: This game is surprisingly addicting for it's simplicity. You have to work in the back and in the front of a restaurant. You choose which foods to serve, buy upgrades, and do all of the chores like washing the dishes. This game is extremely fast paced with an ever increasing difficulty. By the time you have managed to work your way from being a one-star restaurant to being a 5-star you will know every person and what they order very well. This game is an overall amazing game that is amazingly difficult and addicting. 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198041543513', 'num_games_owned': 749, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1406315893}
review:
If you like restaurant management games, then you will enjoy this one.

The aesthetics are nice, the food art is well done and the background city view from your window changes with the day/night cycle very seamlessly. The music is okay, I play my own while running this game. 

The controls are very straightforward - you can use the mouse and/or keyboard. The key bindings are very intuitive (usually first letter = key you have to press; ex: b for bacon), and you can change them around to suit your playstyle. The learning curve is minimal to moderate, the main difficulty comes from juggling tasks efficiently in order to maximize your score multiplier (perfect days give you cash bonuses). Once you get used to the key bindings (highly recommend using primarily the keyboard vs. the mouse as it can be significantly faster) you can complete your orders very quickly.

The tutorial is nice and quick, and there is always a guide to the right of the screen when you are completing your orders. In the preplanning area, you can practice with any of the food items to see if you'd like to add them to your active menu. There is quite a variety of food available, and you can upgrade certain foods in order to charge more for them. Some items require you to have additional equipment, like a grill for your hamburgers.

There are also restaurant upgrades like a tip jar or light snacks to increase the time your customers will wait for you to take their order before leaving. Customers do not have a happiness gauge (you can take their order even when their ticket is almost empty with no penalty) - what matters is getting the order perfect. You cannot go back if you make a mistake, so balancing speed accuracy (speed-accuracy tradeoff lol) is critical to success (and perfect days).

Rush hour usually occurs during lunch time and dinner, giving you a boost to customer intake. Different foods have pros and cons - for example, if you have more than 3 "fatty" foods, then you will get a negative rating to your "buzz," which determines how many clients enter your restaurant. Other foods may not generate tips and/or have menu rot (they decrease in popularity and generate negative buzz if they remain on active menu for more than 2 consecutive days). The baked potato takes much longer to prepare, however, it also has a modifier to tipping - generating higher value and more frequent tips.

A good game if you enjoy restaurant management, reminded me a lot of Cooking Mama. Give it a try if you are interested.

Recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982740443', 'num_games_owned': 2421, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1554, 'last_played': 1433314984}
review:
Après 22 heures de jeu, je n'ai pas encore atteind la fin. Le jeu n'est pas très dur au début si vous savez bien manier le clavier, mais il devient plus difficile dans les "Extra Events" de fin du jeu. Le nombre de client augmente aussi au fur et à mesure de votre progression ainsi que le nombre de plats à préparer en même temps.
Je trouve quand même le jeu assez répétitif à cause du nombre de jours de service à jouer pour gagner une étoile ( 20 jours par étoile ) mais par petites sessions le jeu est amusant et demande du skill.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042023224', 'num_games_owned': 1587, 'num_reviews': 1027, 'playtime_forever': 2059, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1961, 'last_played': 1483332609}
review:
예전에 싸이월드, 버디버디가 한창 흥하고 플래쉬 게임들 많을 때 흔히 보이던 식당 경영 게임. 의외로 스팀에 이런 게임이 별로 없더라... 

단순히 메뉴 몇 가지 정해두고 들어오는 손님들 접대하는 재미도 있고, (다행히 없는 메뉴 달라고 꼬장피우는 진상은 없다.) 이걸 기본으로 식당의 인기도 관리라던가 메뉴 업그레이드라던가 식당의 청결 같은것도 신경쓰게 되서 생각보다 게임이 단순하지만은 않다. 음식들의 경우, 각 음식마다 필요한 조작이 제각각이라 나름 각자 요리하는 맛이 난다. 가끔 요리마다 해당되는 재료의 키가 달라 힘들텐데, 그런 사람들을 위해 각 음식의 키 변경까지 지원해주기도 하는 친절함을 보여주기도 한다. 이 외에 아이언 챌린지, 헝그리 페스티브 같은 특별 이벤트 같은 것도 게임의 재미에 감초같은 역할을 해주기도 하고. 

옛날에 즐겼던 플래쉬게임 같은 단순함에, 이거저거 할 것도 제법 많은 심오함을 동시에 보여주기도 한다. 제법 오래, 그리고 재미있게 즐길 수 있는 게임.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040347174', 'num_games_owned': 596, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1563631183}
review:
[h1][b]"A Scrumptious delight"[/b][/h1]

Your restaurant is on the roads, you have limited funds and your choices are equally limited. Thus begins the story of this simulator making You, the owner, begin an uphill task of putting together a restaurant on the rocks by being the chef, the cleaner, the guard and just about everything including flushing the toilet while remembering to sanitize your hands whilst the health inspector watches on.

The quirky, fun elements begin to pour into your daily mailbox. From receiving invitations to hosting dinner parties to wagering bets, testing your tryst with perfection while administrating a strict regime for the food critics. The game starts to climb the [b]'addict tree'[/b] as your hotel develops into a finer establishment that attracts the town's more reputable folk along with their thick wallets.

Cook, Serve,Delicious! can get a bit repetative at times but the rise in difficulty keeps the dull moments at bay. This is definitely [b]NOT[/b] for the people that love action or other platforms that revolve around an objective story. This is for people that can spare a couple of hours to sit back and have fun.

[h1][i]My personal verdict: 4/5[/i][/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198099256300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1405998723}
review:
FAZIT: Ein kurzweiliges Spiel für zwischendurch, aber 8,99€ sind zu teuer!

Ich hatte das Glück, dieses Spiel in einem Bundle dabei zu haben, und da ich diese Art von Spiel mag, habe ich es gleich getestet. InGame hat man sein eigenes Restaurant, und muss Kunden bedienen. Man startet von einer Übersicht aus, 
und muss als erstes seine Speisekarte zusammenstellen. Danach beginnt der erste Tag, und man muss die Gerichte der Speisekarte zubereiten und servieren. Gesteuert kann das ganze mit Tastatur, Maus + Tastatur oder Gamepad werden. 

Um neue Gerichte zu kaufen, benötigt man zwischen 600$ und 800$, was sich als problematisch erweist, da man pro zubereitetem Gericht im Schnitt 5$ verdient. So muss ich erst einmal 3-4 Tage spielen, um ein neues Gericht kaufen zu können, bzw. ein Upgrade für ein bereits vorhandenes. Mir wurde das schnell zu monoton - daher gibt es hier einen Minuspunkt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016951566', 'num_games_owned': 615, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1498985559}

うん、面倒な注文する客は嫌になるよね･･･昼のピークタイムにマ○ドで塩抜きポテトを頼むの止めよう

author: {'steamid': '76561198025235725', 'num_games_owned': 535, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1561328989}
review:
A fun and addictive fast-paced game, which will put you on edge in fear of messing up just one tiny button press, or just being too slow for your own good.

This game is all about reacting as quick as lightning and having a wide understanding of the recipes you are able to follow with your current ingredients. Each time a client enters your restaurant, you will have to deal with them as quickly as possible before they get tired of waiting. Following their indications, you will have to press a very specific series of keys in order to fulfill their order, while other clients begin to get impatient and are about to quit your restaurant.

Many factors influence how well your establishment will be doing, not only in general but also during each day.  Depending on your menus and achievements during the day, your restaurant will have more or less popularity throughout the different days you will be playing. Different times of the day and some events make your restaurant's popularity vary during the day itself, having some small peaks in clients at some points. However, this does not compare to the Rush Hours you will be facing twice per day, having clients beginning to stack behind the counter and orders accumulating 4 at a time.

Overall, highly recommended for players who want somewhat of a test of their reaction and memorization skills; not recommended for a casual and laid back experience. This game can be arcade-ish, but it's definitely not too casual in a relaxing sense.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045022612', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1469210546}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027836118', 'num_games_owned': 1846, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1415934489}
review: Cook, Serve, Delicious! is, at its heart, a mashup of Cooking Mama and Diner Dash, but it replaces the casual game trappings with more difficult challenges to complete and with more going on with the underlying (basic) economic simulator. The cooking minigames are mostly easier than what you'd find in Cooking Mama, and this allows them to be completed quickly, which is essential to surviving the lunch/dinner rush. The result is a game that while resembling the aforementioned games with a dash of Wario Ware thrown in for seasoning, ends up somehow being better than the sum of its parts. Recommended.

review: I really enjoy the mechanics of this game.  It's imperative that you know how to type properly so that you don't make errors.  There is an appropriate increase in difficulty for every "star" you attain.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993334025', 'num_games_owned': 1225, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 1626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1626, 'last_played': 1434789959}
review:
日本語の情報が少ないゲームなので簡単な攻略ガイドを書きました
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=463460013

ファストフードの店員になりお客さんの注文を正確にこなすゲーム
メニューは自分で設定することが出来、レストランの稼ぎから新しいメニューを購入することもできる
お客さんの注文を短時間で理解するため英語を読む必要があるが基本的に平易な文章で中学レベルの英語が理解出来てればOK

ミッションをこなしレストランの星数を上げていくのが基本的な目標となるが、ある程度慣れていても20日は仕事をこなさないとレベルアップしないため作業ゲームになりがちなのと、焼いたり茹でたりする工程の入るメニュー（パスタ、ハンバーガー等）があると難易度が跳ね上がるが難しさの割に特に稼ぎが増えるわけではないため無理にメニューに並べる必要がない。特別ケータリングミッションでハンバーガーとパスタだけやるミッションがある以外では避けることも可能。よく言えばユーザーが難易度をコントロール可能であるが、簡単な作業ゲームと感じる人もいるかも

とは言え、キーボードやコントローラを使いラッシュ時の注文を捌き切った時の快感があるのも事実。時間内にさばいたお客さんの数のsteamランキングもある。ただ$10の価値は正直見いだせない
セールの時にでもどうぞ

追記：
上で簡単な英語なのでOKと書きましたが途中で発生するデートチャットイベントと強盗の似顔絵作成イベントだけは速読が出来ないと難しい気がします
特に強盗イベントは発生したらリセット安定というか英語関係なく難しすぎる気が…

--- 以下は5つ星レストランになった後の追記 ---
ゲームバランス的に言えば比較的序盤のバーガー、パスタ、ベイクドポテトといったあたりのメニューがキーアサイン（変更可能）的にも難しく、後半のステーキや鳥の胸肉が比較的簡単なためメニューの解禁順番は調整の余地ありのように感じた。実際の料理の工程重視で操作を決めたのはある意味間違ってないと思うが、一方で店頭に並べるメニューを矯正させるミッションモード的なものを充実させた方がよいように感じた。一応ちょっとした賭けやVIP客の実績などでそういうのはあるが…
またものによっては客の注文の仕方が難しいのでちょっとした英文速読の勉強になるかもしれません（とはいってもある程度注文の仕方は決まってるのでパターンではありますが）
あと最後に解禁されるEXTRA EVENTのゲームプレイ音楽は無駄に荘厳で好きです。[url=http://jonathangeer.bandcamp.com/track/hungry-festivities-gameplay][u]ここ[/u][/url]で聞けます。

author: {'steamid': '76561198063622547', 'num_games_owned': 394, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 944, 'last_played': 1557621346}
review:
As a person who started playing online games with the likes of "Papa's Pizzaria" and it's various sequels, I was wary that this might be just as tedious. However, that was not remotely the case.

Cook, Serve, Delecious! is an immersive restaurant simulator, allowing a wide amount of variety among foods, with an intricate "buzz" system which has you balancing up the fatty foods with those that are ideal for a rainy day. The minigame style serving portions for each meal is intuituve and fully uses the entire keyboard, and constantly adds new features to keep you entertained.
You must also attempt to survive safety inspectors by performing chores like rubbish as fast as possible, resulting in hectic button mashing as the overwhelming "RUSH HOUR" sign appears.

The only gripe I had with the game was the slow progress when attempting to buy new features, as earning money takes a long time. However, with the bets and events, it does make the grind for that lasagne upgrade less dull.

I heartily recommend this game to anyone who wants an odd diversion to the normal PC games, even if it may be a long slog overall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109831915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2897, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1288, 'last_played': 1490905800}
review:
Great game! I have played a lot of restaurant simulations/games, but none has been as good, or as addicitive, as this one. It is not a standard time management game. Instead of just choosing the correct food and giving it to the correct customer, you have to press the correct key or button in the correct order. Depending on what dishes you put on the menu, it can be really easy, or as I prefer it, really challenging. And it can get frantic. You have to be in complete control of your hands and what's happening on the screen, all the time. It's not just a fun game, but it's also a great workout for gamers.

The only negatives I have is that you cannot change the menus, decide what ingredients to serve or customize the restaurant. But those are very small issues, since this games offers something different than the typical restaurant management game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997793695', 'num_games_owned': 717, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1530837502}
review:
Imagine a restaurant sim with one employee tasked with doing every sing order and chore in the restaraunt after doing a line of cocaine and you basically have Cook, Serve, Delicious. It's deliberately simple in control. Each letter on the keyboard corresponds to an action on the keyboard. The fun comes from memorizing these so that you can get the food and do chores in a timely manner. It's manic, but overall a satisfying experience. It also has controller support, but I'd say to stick with mouse and keyboard. A controller requires the player to tab through extra menus; button mappings aren't nearly as intuitive as something like C for chocolate or whatever.

I highly recommend this fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984892694', 'num_games_owned': 816, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1405811591}

author: {'steamid': '76561198081547188', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1405708662}
review:
The core game mechanic is okay with press the correct buttons as fast as you can. picking food items and upgrades is okay. 
but the game lacks any real depth, there is no business like simulation, such as keeping stock, hiring employes, profit vs expenditure, ect. the cooking aspect is also very simplified.

This game is by no means a simulation of any kind, and is ultimately just a time waster and in my option not a very fun one.
Also of note there is no way to spend money to spruce up or decorate your restraurant.

also the security upgrade is insultingly stupid, 
1. it cost 500 dollars to put up a sign?
2. how does saying no guns allowed effect someone who wants to enter your establishment and shoot you? they don't care about the law, why would they care about your sign?

This game is suppost to be for fun so why the crappy political message?

author: {'steamid': '76561198002804113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1406398070}
review:
[h1]Rating: 6/10 (With Injured Fingers)[/h1]

This game is as difficult and frustrating as it can get. Yet I give this game a recommendation, why? Because after all you go through in this game, the result you get is some good fun. It can get exciting when you get a nice combo by serving your customers in rush hours, making dishes that can be tricky on the keyboard. The variety is good enough for a casual game, and the soundtrack is pretty good. I also strongly suggest taking breaks between in-game days or you'll end up with fatigued hands (Lots of key mashing).

author: {'steamid': '76561197970589211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 2294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1421, 'last_played': 1683580760}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious is  very challenging, but extremely rewarding. You can see that the Developers have put in a lot of effort and the art style and presentation shows this. The gameplay is extremely fast and you’ll have to concentrate as orders fly through the restaurant left right and centre. Learning the correct key bindings is important as when you have eight orders on the go, you will need to remember them! 

If you are looking for something that isn't what you would usually play, then this is it. You will not be disappointed. It's humorous, clever, addictive and very challenging....

author: {'steamid': '76561198018161255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 242, 'playtime_forever': 1491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1486, 'last_played': 1429035711}
review:
식당 경영 게임. 요리의 조리법과 특성을 고려해 하루 하루의 메뉴를 선택하고 메뉴의 조리 과정 외에도 식당 자체의 관리 전반을 '홀로' 책임지는 경영 게임. '타이쿤'이라 흔히 불리는 장르와 크게 다르지 않다. 

 여러 요리의 구성이나 상황의 발생, 업그레이드 등의 요소들도 충실하고 만족스럽지만 이 게임의 가장 큰 특징은 "단축키"를 적극 활용한다는 점. 바로 그 점이 이 게임의 개성이자 매력 요소이다. 보통 마우스로 이리 저리 하기 마련인데 이 게임은 마우스로는 도저히 감당할 수 없다. 각 요리의 조리 과정이나 아니면 쓰레기를 치우는 등의 관리 과정에서 모든 행동이 키보드의 단축키로 배정이 되어있는데 이를 통해서 속도감 있게 일을 처리하는 것이 게임 진행의 핵심이다. 

 현실성 있게 점심 시간대와 저녁 시간대에 "Rush Hour"가 발동되는데 이 시간대에 취약한 성격을 가진 음식을 메뉴로 가지지 않는 한, 밀려드는 주문에 정신없이 조리며 행동을 하게 되는데 지나고 나면 이걸 어떻게 소화했나 싶을 정도이다. 운영을 하다보면 어느 정도 주력 메뉴들을 두기 마련인데, 그 때문에 더 수월히 단축키로 일을 진행시킬 수 있다. 

 음식의 종류도 꽤 여럿 있지만 음식 마다도 업그레이드를 할 수가 있어 같은 메뉴에서도 더 많은 변수들을 둘 수 있다. 이 때문에 쉽게 질리지 않고 재미있게 즐길 수 있는 것 같다. 전체적으로 아주 만족하고 Steam에서는 보기 드문 게임인데 이런 장르의 게임을 좋아하는 플레이어라면 한 번 플레이해볼 만하다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994177206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1402427010}
review: Cook, Serve, Delicious! will appeal to almost everyone who enjoyed playing the several time management games with cooking themes that were really popular about 10 years ago. The game has plenty of unique ideas, all of the foods have unique mini-games for preparation/cooking and have different properties that will change your restaraunts popularity based on time of day, weather, and other foods on your menu. However, the game get's stale really quick, and unfortunately there are a few foods that really end up being the best, so you have very little reason to change up your menu. If the game added more food options (both new foods and new complications to existing foods) and worked on making all of the foods on the menu worth while, I could see reccomending this game. However, as of now, the game falls flat.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986021662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1404668258}
review:
Gordon Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmare Simulator is the most amazing game I have played this year. It's made by the most amazing developer and the game itself is the most amazing if not THE most amazing game I have ever played. Lastly, on a related note I don't think Whitney deserved to win Masterchef USA season 1 at all and I think the judges should be ashamed.

Thirdly, the game doesn't have Gordon Ramsay's voice or face anywhere in the game at all so i'm a bit let down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120570904', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 9037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7457, 'last_played': 1495640755}
{'steamid': '76561197997995208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2047, 'last_played': 1435437756}
review:
[h1]Why do I like this game?[/h1]
I have to admit, on the surface, a game like Cook, Serve, Delicious! just sounds stupid. Why did I end up liking it so much?

I think it's the combination of time management and typing things as fast as humanly possible that turns it from tedium into a game. There's actual [i]strategy and planning[/i] involved and necessary when it comes to deciding what foods to put on your menu, what tasks can be ignored if you need to catch a robbery suspect or text while on the job. It's bizarre.

Then, when I almost had all the achievements, the game got updated to have a HELL difficulty. So I played it even more. I don't know that I'll necessarily revisit the game, now that I've managed to see and achieve everything, but I liked accomplishing it all.

At the very least, I enjoyed it more as a "type as fast as you can" game than I've enjoyed Typing of the Dead...zombie games aren't my bag, even if typing ones are!

author: {'steamid': '76561198033718417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1168, 'last_played': 1498434266}
review:
This game seemed like a fun little time waster, and that is exactly what I got.  It is just an overall pleasent casual style game.  The difficulty ultimately depends on what food you serve day to day, but nothing is so hard as to seem unfair.  "cooking days" are just short enough so as not to be overwhelming, and the letters and minigames are fun as well.

If you like casual pick up whenever games, you could do much worse than this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005327559', 'num_games_owned': 706, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 795, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1453602649}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious is classified as a Hardcore Cooking Simulation where you take the helm of the brand new resturant in Sherrisoda Tower. Cooking requires ingredients thrown together using every button on the keyboard. Your task is to upgrade your resturant to a five star by serving perfect food and getting buzz.

I recommend this game to anyone who wants a different form of simulation.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970353906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1467977173}
review:
Multitasking digitized!

Cook, Serve, Delicious is one of those games that takes a simple concept and takes it to a level of rewarding interaction seldom seen in other games of much larger scope. Getting through a day of orders perfectly, is fun, challenging and rewarding in many aspects. Play it for anywhere between 10 minutes or a couple of hours a week, and this game should stay fresh for a long time. 

An amazing game that i feel every game designer should take a look at, as well as every game fan should give a try. The only thing I'm still hoping for is some DLC, cause this game seems ideal for it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198107483255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1469391915}
review: This game is addictive. I can play it for hours, but I always stop because I start to do horrible and I don't want to mess up my percentage lol. It's a silly indie, simulation, management game and if you like that stuff you'll love this. I know I do. Although I can't quite get use to just using my keyboard, I'm a faster typer, but THE PRESSURE MAN!!! Anyway, buy the game. It isn't much, I caught it on sale ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198084943725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1050, 'last_played': 1503195670}
review: This game is a very fun "type-to-play" game.  Basically you're a short-order cook at your own restaurant in a recently renovated sky rise.  To play the game, you assemble food by entering key combinations in the proper order.  Throw in a mix of additional time management, an ever changing menu, side-bets with the AI or with the Steam community, and a simple plot of trying to land a girlfriend and you have a nice little casual gaming experience.  If you're looking for a game to help knock out 15 - 45 minutes here or there, pick this title up, hopefully you'll be as pleasantly surprised as I was.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007428578', 'num_games_owned': 1799, 'num_reviews': 380, 'playtime_forever': 2270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 839, 'last_played': 1544870415}
review:
Don't let this game deceive you. It's a pretty challenging and addictive little game that has a lot of charm and is a lot of fun. You  basically run a restaurant and have to prepare and cook food for customers.  The game is broken up into a day where you will try and serve as many customers as you can while trying not to get there orders wrong. Sounds easy enough but try doing it with recipes that require more complex preperation and trying to serve 8 customers at once. 

The game has a wide variety of recipes which you can buy and upgrade and before each day you can customize your menu. There are also additional challenges you can do like catering missions or competing in an Iron Chef competition. You also have to do chores as well as preparing meals and this adds to the challenge. 

The game is really nicely animated as well with decent music and gives the game a lot of charm. It isn't a game i found i could play for long time though. I found it better for maybe a quick 20 minutes to half an hour at a time as it can start to feel repetitive at times. It doesn't help that you have to do at least 20 days before being able to upgrade your restaurant which makes the game feel a little dragged out.

The Good
- Easy game to pick up and play but a difficult one to master, providing a decent challenge.
- Gameplay is fun and theres enough to give the game a bit of variety with so many recipes and challenges available.
-Nice animated style that adds to the games personality.

The Bad
- Gets a bit repetetive after a while and isn't a game i could play for long periods.

Overall this is a nice fun game perfect for jumping in and out of when you've got a few minutes to kill which is also accessible while still able to provide a challenge. 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198093241919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1206, 'last_played': 1498698997}
review:
Fast sure fingers, and knowing your limitations are what will help you suceed the most in CSD. One of the most important things you can learn is what foods are going to be hard for you to memorize and get you mixed up. For me it's those darned Baked Potatoes. CSD is a really fun game that makes me wish I knew how to cook.

RIP Ryan Davis.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021431874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 792, 'last_played': 1591389752}
review: Game is super fun and fast paced. Everything I want out of a casual game. I can sit down before work, play a day and then i'm out the door. and when I have the day off, i will play it for hours. The difficulty is actually my favorite part. It doesn't stay static like some games but continues to get even more difficult. I even feel guilty when I mess up an order. The challenge system is fun and interesting and (again) challenging! best part about it is that the achivements aren't impossible either. 10/10 will continue to play over and over again

author: {'steamid': '76561198076886763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1404341319}
review: Customers don't like getting free ice cream. Customers don't like getting a free upgrade on their drink. Customers don't throw the drink in your face if you get it slightly wrong. Customers are kind of ok with missing ingredients. Customers don't care if you serve the guy who came after them, as long as they get their food in time. Customers don't get bored waiting for the food to be prepared, as long as you have taken their order. The customers in this game are the opposite of real world ones. 10/10 I love the stress.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021155753', 'num_games_owned': 979, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1009, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 741, 'last_played': 1565546963}
review:
"SHIT I PRESSED THE WRONG BUTTON AGAIN, MY PERFECT DAY HAS BEEN RUINED"

This sums the game up, and that's not a criticism. It's stressful, exhausting and sometimes downright cruel but there is a lot of satisfaction that comes with nailing a really hard rush hour session, or even getting a perfect day despite moments of worry. 

Really addicting too, it'll always strive you to play another day and next thing you know, it's 4am. Worth the money, either at retail or on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076326263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1641713578}
review:
If you like food, you must buy.

Pros:
- Good and upbeat music, great use of sound fx
- Delicious looking food, nice visuals, colorful, you can see time change out the window
- Has some humor elements that make you chuckle
- Many things to do besides cooking (you have to complete chores and catch a burglar)
- Very fast paced
- You can choose your own menu each day
- Each food requires different skills and techniques so it doesn't seem repetitive
- Different challenges (catering, making bets with Crazy Dave to complete certain tasks)
- Food items are upgradable, you can buy grills/stoves
- You can use keyboard, mouse, or controller (prefer keyboard cause it's easier)
- Quick and easy tutorials. Lets you test out the food before you buy
- The daily buzz element is pretty cool and makes game more realistic

Cons (seems like a lot but they're minor)
- Limited food items to choose from. There's only about 20 something total
- Can get stressful during rush hour (but that's what makes it exciting)
- Not many things to do once you complete the game (but it takes a while)
- Simple gameplay. Place ingredients together by pressing buttons.
- Earning money is really slow. You have to work several days in order to buy one item
- Cannot customize restaurant
- Certain features are never seen. Like buying a dishwasher. You bought it. It decreases the # of times you wash the dishes. But you never actually SEE the dishwasher in the game. Same thing with trash disposal, new toilet, etc.

Got the game during summer sale for 3.99. Definitely worth the money. Addictive and fun. Many features in the game makes it realistic (such as serving soup on rainy days will attract more customers, having health inspectors, receiving awkward emails). 

Pros > Cons
A great buy. 10/10 Totally recommended.  Have fun!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198077401131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1661649259}
review: This game is a great restaurant simulation. Ive always wanted my own restaurant and now I can. It seems like your actually running a real restaurant because theres rush hour like in real life, you have to take care of chores, you have to give customers their orders before they get angry and leave, every once in a while a health inspector comes and rates your restaurant, and my favorite you can make your own menu. I totally recommend this game to others.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032088199', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2781, 'last_played': 1416974877}
review:
Should be called Cook, Scream, Delicious! Because this game will frustrate you. The only thing missing from this game is buying your own groceries.

The first play through is very fun, although it can be repetitive you end up changing your menu due to buying new foods, or the weather, or just getting as much buzz as possible. At around 3 or 4 stars, you end up using the same menu. The bets really help change that up, as well as VIPs and dating. 

The second playthrough, on extreme difficulty, on the other hand could be better. At first, yes it is intense, its hard, but messing up doesn't matter anymore. Making money? You will have tonnes. You will end up making only the easiest foods (fish, chicken, beer, etc.) just so you can get those last few achievements. Lets face it, it gets boring because you get accustomed to it and the star level requirements are exactly the same as on normal. It would be much more difficult and "extreme" as you put it if the requirements to get to the next star was different. Perhaps a buzz % requirement instead, where we are forced to use the more complicated foods to get that buzz. Or have an upgrade requirement on certain foods you must have on your menu? I am getting by the game mode right now with beer, coffee, chicken and fish, alternating them when the other rots. I'm being somewhat forced through almost 100 in game days till I get that mysterious email (estimate as I have not gotten it yet).  It's not fun now, its just a chore.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965513148', 'num_games_owned': 692, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1547639107}
review:
Si crees que este es un juego de Facebook. Estas equivocado.
Esta empresa explota con Cook, Serve, Delicious! tu capacidad de soportar el estrés y tu habilidad de multitarea. Como ya hizo con The Oil Blue.

Mientras se hacen las hamburguesas para un cliente, haces una ensalada en 2,3 segundos, sirves una cocacola en 1,4 segundos, una cerveza en 2 segundos, terminas la hamburguesa en 1,3 segundos, lavas los platos en 2 segundos y..... tardaste demasiado, se fue un cliente.

Es un tipo de juego que no le gusta a todo el mundo, pero si eres de esos, este es tu juego.
Cook, Serve, Delicious! es Hardcore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080592822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2904, 'last_played': 1639535607}

author: {'steamid': '76561198020316844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 987, 'last_played': 1395617568}
review: Innovative, witty, and addictive, this cute little game will really get its hooks in you!  Who knew running a restaurant could be so much fun?  From the satisfying combos to the amusing e-mails and simple social interactions, you'll find yourself pushing forward to make the most perfect meals for hours on end!  Fantastic learning curve, it allows even beginning gamers to grasp the mechanics and ease into the game at their own pace.  Take a step back from shooting zombies or casting magic, let your mind drift into the charming world of Cook, Serve, Delicious!

author: {'steamid': '76561198020238721', 'num_games_owned': 428, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1488507302}
review: Cook serve delicious is a similar game to metal gear solid. Enjoy stealthly cooking a variety of food, and serving beer in this action-packed "Weed'em up". Some of the unlockable equipment include: Aborted fetus, portable drilldo, and even you very own sanic doll. The most stressful part of this game is a segment in City escape when you have to feed a donkey laxitives to have it shit out important intelligence. Enjoy serving that one guy who keeps coming back for beer, and only beer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073190017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1969, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1238, 'last_played': 1488487239}

author: {'steamid': '76561197989696272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1406680401}
review:
I enjoyed playing Cook, Serve, Delicious for a couple of hours, after which it became a bit too repetitive for my tastes. Maybe I bought too much equipment too soon -- maybe I splurged on expensive food recipes. I'll never know! 

It has a good moment-to-moment frenzy, without getting overly stressful or complicated. The graphics, while not dazzling, are charming in their own way, and the audio was nice enough too -- only tenderizing chicken elicited complaints from eavesdroppers (it requires repeating the same audio file 6 times, preventing me from winning any popularity contests).

In any event, I found myself having completed all of the goals for the first major progress marker (becoming a 2-star restaurant) on day 10, and had another 10 days to repeat before I could unlock the next set of challenges... alas. Maybe I'll get around to it, but... maybe not.

I hope more indie games explore cooking as a mechanic. It'd be excellent if Cook, Serve, Delicious were the beginning of a genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063052935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1435658928}
review:
I love this game! For the price, you get fun gameplay thats easy to pickup and play along with a lovely art style that I quite enjoy. As the game progresses, you have the option to make it harder for yourself with the difficult dishes to prepare, or go the easier route with simple dishes that is a good way to get the hang of the game. The upgrade choices are decently vast (though I would have liked to see a few extra dishes, however a minor complaint) and gives you the option to decide how you progress to the higher tiers of the game and at what speed / difficulty.

I would recommend this game for those that want a relatively casual game (and I mean that in a positive way) that, while a bit "grind-ey" can be enjoyable and fulfilling when you get your first star with your restaurant.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092502225', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1456192239}
review: I can't explain to you why this game is as amazing as it is. There's something really addicting to it once you get into it though. When you start getting into this weird zone and not even thinking about the orders you're typing, it's a very blissful state. If it at all seems interesting to you, I recommend whole heartedly you pick it up on a steam sale. I'm not 100% I'd say it's worth full price, but if you really want it, I wouldn't tell you not to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055453050', 'num_games_owned': 404, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1597054930}
review: This is seriously one of the most fun time-wasting games I've ever had the chance to play. More involved and more difficult than other popular cooking sims, there's definitely enough playtime to make up for the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065654325', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1616305335}
review: This gmae may seem simple on the outside, but that's just why I love it. I played this expecting to just get a little fun out of it, but it turned out to be very challenging and taxing (in the good ways). The stress put on by rush hour just makes it even more of a test, and when you pull off that perfect combos of tons of food in a row, you'll feel really good. Not to mention, there are tons of modes and events, in addition to the main story. And, to top it all off, it has an amazing soundtrack that perfectly compliments the tense moments, and highlighting the calm before the storm. I highly recommend picking up this game for hours of fun working your restaurant to the acclaimed 5 star level, and becoming the next Iron Cook.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967259639', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2096, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1278, 'last_played': 1505450791}

author: {'steamid': '76561198066434263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1563, 'last_played': 1400340629}
review: I bought this game on a whim to kill maybe a few hours but ended up sinking almost 30 (and counting!) hours into it. It's incredibly addicting. You upgrade recipes and types of foods, and there are all sorts of different kinds of challenges. Towards the end, when you actually have a five star restaurant the games gets VERY STRESSFUL but still so so addicting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025310418', 'num_games_owned': 656, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1509, 'last_played': 1505251466}
review: Per tutti gli amanti dei giochi di cucina. Non solo dovremo preparare i pasti (cosa che, man mano che saliremo di livello diventerà sempre più difficile), ma dovremo riuscire a gestire al meglio il nostro ristorante: organizzare il menù del giorno (cosa che influenzerà la quantità di clienti che attireremo), lavare i piatti, buttare la spazzatura, riuscire a superare il controllo sanitario, gestire clienti V.I.P. e ladri... è presente anche la modalità "Eventi" in cui dovremo occuparci del servizio catering, partecipare ad uno show televisivo e sopravvivere ai terribili Hungry Festivities... Insomma, chiunque come me ami i giochi di cucina, non dovrebbe lasciarsi sfuggire Cook, Serve, Delicious! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198032696607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2062, 'last_played': 1406833830}

author: {'steamid': '76561198127073992', 'num_games_owned': 373, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5776, 'last_played': 1704414531}
review: I've played through plantium on one save. I absolutely love this game. I think it is fun, yet slightly frustrating when you try so hard to get a perfect day and just slip up on something so simple like filling a beer or not completing a chore. It's brilliant. I love it, and I absolutely love playing it! Huge thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094790766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1913, 'last_played': 1702344305}
review:
While the slightly cartoonish graphics would be a put-off for some people, once you play for a while, it becomes evident that this game is actually a very challenging, very fun game where you have to memorize dozens of keys and what they stand for, and even more recipes for dozens of foods for a game where difficulty will continue to ramp, partly based on the game, and also on your choices of foods to cook for the day. The game has a surprisingly deep level of combinations you make for your menu, having quite a bit of factors to consider in order to have a successful, yet balanced menu for the day.

It's almost as if it's some type of "rhythm" game, where once you get used to the foods, you begin to make them in your own fashion of what ingredients you put in first, or whatever.

Overall, fun game, pretty worth buying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069565258', 'num_games_owned': 766, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1099, 'last_played': 1435166897}

author: {'steamid': '76561198082394081', 'num_games_owned': 477, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 2011, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 537, 'last_played': 1498658922}
review:
Not your average Restaurant Sim game. Rather than micro-manage, Cook, Serve, Delicious is an addictive indie game that focuses on the concept of making food. In a Simple Simon methodology, you are a budding chef and restaurant owner, aiming for the (5) stars of culinary fame. Following the simple tutorial is enough to get you going where you progress from having no stars, through to 5 and the ultimate fame .. who knows maybe Masterchef is next.

At any rate, game play is simple. All you really need is a keyboard, though it has the option for mouse + keyboard use. The music is catchy, the graphics quirky, simple and fun. You earn money by keeping your patrons happy and fed, and in turn can spend money on upgrading your food and some time management perks like a dishwasher and rat catcher. Every task uses the Simple Simon concept of pushing buttons in order then watching the timer and managing orders when things get busy.

It's a little bit of Restaurant Tycoon but more like Cooking Dash and those type of games. For the price, you could do much worse. I recommend you put your chef hat on and give this a go.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997506993', 'num_games_owned': 1127, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 2346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1981, 'last_played': 1533242081}
review:
I loved this game. There's no steep learning curve. The pace is very slow at first, but as you get to upgrade your menu and attract more customers, the game speeds up. In the end you're going to hammer your keyboard like mad. The food items make a satisfying sound as you slap them together.

Oh, and it's not all about recipes. You need nimble fingers in order to set traps for rats, clean the bathroom, take out the trash, send lovey dovey text messages to your date and identify the guy who just robbed you. All this while your daily dishes are burning.

There are also various cooking challenges you can accept if you want. It's all pretty well balanced and enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000028789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2766, 'last_played': 1494247957}
review:
Une des plus belles surprises dans ma vie de joueur.
 
Fun et agréable, ce jeu à out d'une bombe en puissance avec pourtant un principe simple et pas forcément amusant : faire de la cuisine à grande échelle pour des clients exigeants.
Cette petite bombe vous propose de devenir le plus grands des cuistos dans la lignée d'un Master Chef version jouable où le seul but de votr evie sera de contenter parfaitement et rapidement un maximum de personnes.

Un système de "buzz" bien pensé pour influencer la fréquentation et forçant à s'aventurer dans la jouabilité en changeant les menus à la carte régulièrement assurent un plaisir constant. La difficulté croissante et les évènements ponctuels viennent constamment garder l'interêt du joueur que 'lon est pour vous enfermer pendant des heures dans un torrent d elasagnes, soupes et crudités !

Un titre peu connu qui mérite de faire partie de la collection de tous joueur qui se respecte.
