review: This game is fantastic. Easy to get into, and can be challenging as you progress, and buy recipes with more complicated key inputs. Some of them are hard to do quickly! Cook, Serve, Delicious is definitely one of my go to games to play!

author: {'steamid': '76561197962767542', 'num_games_owned': 3167, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 2030, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1897, 'last_played': 1431889672}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious! est un petit jeu totalement barré dans son concept. Un jeu de fast-food c'est quand même la classe. Le jeu est addictif à souhait, et devient de plus en plus difficile. Aucun succès compliqué, bien que le succès du perfect en extrême difficulté, peut poser problème. Un 100% Farm pour un 100% succès entre 30 et 35 heures.
J'ai bien aimé, même si au niveau des plats on a pas de french touch.
Il faut admettre également que le jeu devient lassant après 15 heures de farm intensif pour gagner toutes ses étoiles de chef cuistot. Il vous faudra donc vous armer de patience pour venir à bout de Cook, Serve, Delicious!

author: {'steamid': '76561198021054870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2408, 'last_played': 1527272053}
review: This is a really fun time management game. The focus is on cooking dishes and not on seating patrons or fixing up your restaurant. The art style is cool and the controls are smooth. If you like this sort of game, then this is a game you will definitely enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047984072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1131, 'last_played': 1484581456}

author: {'steamid': '76561198029224473', 'num_games_owned': 356, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1491513804}

author: {'steamid': '76561198095384550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 799, 'last_played': 1473212265}
review: Cook, Serve, Delicious is a quite a game. You start with some cash to make a start up resturant buisness, it's a lot of fun for any simulation lover. The game might seem boring at first, but once you get into it, it opens up more. You get to purchase loads of foods, breakfast/lunch/dinner. Later on when you ahieve 2 or so stars you get catering events, and by 3 or 4 you get to be an iron cook. More about the gameplay you use either A. Your mouse, or B. Your keyboard, such as ice cream would be "V" for 1 scoop vanilla, and 'C' would be a cherry. You can also click on the button corresponding to the ingriedent. Lastly it may seem repitive, but once you finish a day (9/10 mins), you may get an email saying, "20% more buzz today," that makes you want to do just one more day. Overall I give the game a 8/10. I would like to see more features added, though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053390502', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2317, 'last_played': 1455995224}

author: {'steamid': '76561197978902089', 'num_games_owned': 8120, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 1793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 971, 'last_played': 1643173073}
review: When messing around on Game Maker, I found a game called 'Ore No Ryomi 2 - The Restaurant' on their community. This was probably the most addictive and fun food-related game I've played. It requires that you have fast fingers, a good memory and technique. This updated, paid version of the game was an absolute shock to me when I saw it on Steam, and it is definitely something I would recommend to someone who wants a simple yet fast-paced game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198075197059', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2772, 'last_played': 1592912992}
review: This game is highly addictive, it's one of those games when you can't stop thinking "One more day, one more day" and the fact that each day is only ten minutes, you continue to think it isn't that long, hence the ridiculous hours I have sunk into this game. Also a fantastic example of indie developers succeding in making their games worthy of a full Steam release. If you have RSI or stiff joints then you should reconsider before buying, yet I cannot reccomend this game highly enough for the price of £6.99 or less on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041160665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1476408885}
review:
I bought this game on a whim, because it kinda reminded me of the Papa's Restaurant flash games. I'm really glad I did. The gameplay is perfectly paced, ranging from somewhat slow during off-hours to extremely hectic during Rush Hour. Requires reflexes and precision normally only required for games like Bloody Trapland or I Wanna Be The Guy. Don't be distracted by the not-so-great visuals. The gameplay is fantastic, and isn't that what games are all about?

WARNING: This game WILL make you hungry. Do not play if you haven't eaten in a while.

8.3/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197968758307', 'num_games_owned': 2356, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 825, 'last_played': 1473219293}
review: This game gives you the thrill of completing a repetative task quickly and precisely. Probably could get the same thrill from clicking on colored lights in the same order, or getting a job at McDonalds. But that would require REAL effort.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960420670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 725, 'last_played': 1415847628}
review: This is almost entirely a series of very brief, Wario Ware-like mini-games, but the sound and visual design render them enormously satisfying. Each correct button press registers right in the brain's pleasure center. You'll soon develop your own favorite foods to prepare, as each one has its own distinct feel. Each round lasts just about the perfect length of time. A great game to induce that "flow" state in your brain.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136538081', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1417917005}
review: Love this game, very simple to pick up.  It is easy to get addicted, it draws you in wanting to get as many perfect days as you can.  The graphics are good, bright and easy to see.  If you love cooking/simulation games, definatly worth giving it a go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090493870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1645375426}
review: So, I never really play super casual games like this but seeing NerdCubed's playthrough I thought I'd give it a go. It is a fun game. Highly addictive, mostly due to the quirky music, characters and gameplay elements. These all give you a massive adrenaline rush when trying to keep up with the mountains of customer orders. If you want a game to pass some time without having to get deeply immersed, play this!

author: {'steamid': '76561197983725374', 'num_games_owned': 4710, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 710, 'last_played': 1621556243}
review:
I am a huge fan of indie "casual" games (Peggle, Sequence, and World of Goo are good examples of games I like) and 'Cook, Serve, Delcious!' is exactly what I'm looking for in a game like that. This game is hugely addicting and has a surprising amount of freshness and replay for a game that has such simple mechanics. It definitely can seem overwhelming at times but that makes it oh so rewarding when you start to master recipies and get perfect days. I would absolutely reccomend this game to anyone.

P.S. Soup can go die in a fire.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025808649', 'num_games_owned': 356, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1401557650}

author: {'steamid': '76561197988922750', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 853, 'last_played': 1553201745}
review:
Originally posted as part of The State of Busy Gaming - 2014: Evolving tastes for portable, PC, and console treats in bite-sized portions: http://www.busygamernation.com/2014/05/the_state_of_busy_gaming_-_201.html


I bought this game on impulse during a Humble Indie Bundle flash sale, and it's one of the best PC games I've enjoyed in years. It's basically one of those cooking/restaurant management "sims" similar to Cooking Mama, which I enjoyed briefly on the Nintendo DS. But this one grabbed me and won't let go. I liken it to BioShock: If you read my review, I would try to savor that game by playing for brief spurts and then I'd shut down my console - only to reboot it just minutes later. This became a cycle that continued until I gave up and powered through the story. I'm doing the same thing here, only it only takes a second to reboot and about five minutes to play through another day in my restaurant's life.

You also can use a keyboard or DualShock 4, but I have the iconic Xbox buttons memorized better than the PlayStation buttons - which makes reading and reacting to the on-screen button cues easier. One small error can ruin a "perfect day" and the resulting $250 bonus. The game includes enough distractions to throw you off your game, from online dates who demand difficult dishes executed perfectly (and then text you as you're completing the evening's orders) to robbers who must be identified from a witness description to prevent a costly loss in hard-earned revenue. Building the right menu to succeed requires strategy and sometimes extra practice with complicated dishes to maximize profits and build buzz. You also must complete clean-up chores to avoid a devastating health inspection.

I only wish there were a console version (the iOS version's free demo convinced me that tapping isn't nearly as fun as using a controller). I might just have to try the HDMI output on my laptop so I can play this on a bigger screen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049119297', 'num_games_owned': 2365, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 771, 'last_played': 1469912454}
review: Very fun game. Definitely repetitive but not in the worst way. Keeps things new as you level up and easily worth the price. Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127717426', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 668, 'last_played': 1478896591}
review: bardzo pysznie, zdecydowanie polecam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057341071', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 961, 'last_played': 1590873826}
review:
This is my personal favorite restaurant sim!

Sure, if you really think about it it's just a stupid typing game, but no. It's actually something more than typing. Owning a restaurant isn't as easy as you thought and so proves this game. You start off from a crappy restaurant in a tower, putting ketchup and mustard on corn dogs and serving burgers. But as you move on, you'll be serving soups, pastas and other top notch foods, becoming the finest restaurant to date.

But it's not just that. You must arrange your menu, depending on the weather, the people and what the VIP like (when they come), earning additional daily buzz, which means more money in a day. 

With the restaurant there are also problems. You must do things like wash dishes, trap mouses (on the first steps) or flush toilets. But there are things such as the Protection Due, the -previously mentioned- VIPs and robbers. 

What makes this game addicting is the fact that it has a lot of ways to play the game. You can start by saving money for buying a new food, or for upgrading another one. There are bets, Steam Leaderboards and extra stuff that really make this greater than most cooking sims.

You like fast paced gameplay and cooking? Then Cook, Serve, Delicious! is the thing for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072313288', 'num_games_owned': 290, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1477881194}
review:
If you like games where you quickly have to click or type the correct keys to complete a task, you will like this game.  The premise is to improve your restaurant from 0 star to 5 star status.  To do this you buy different recipes/foods, upgrade them and purchase additional upgrades for your restaurant.

Its a great game and worth the money although it is a bit of a grind after awhile.  there are some mini-games and additional challenges to break up the monotony of the day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124284319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1481331090}
review: This is a great that can get very challenging at times. I love the graphics, and the sound. It requires quick-thinking and great reaction times, it might also improve your reaction times. This game is very adicting, and you will want to play it all the time. I've also found that this game does die out over time, or maybe that's just for me. It's a great game and if your thinking about getting it, do get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024728051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1527421966}
review:
a fun and quirky game for casual times.

You probably wont play this full time while sat at your pc, but it's great for those times on a laptop while waiting. (IE. during travel)

if you can pick this game up for anywhere around €10/15,- try it out. If you're like me and have an hour or 2/3 to spend a week doing nothing but just sitting, this is the game for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198051862721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1454954115}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious is an enjoyable game that requires the player to execute various key patterns in order to make customers' orders in a timely and accurate fashion.  A customer comes in and places an order from a menu you (as store owner) have personally selected.  You must execute the key pattern (different for every food type) to match the order (a peperoni pizza, two scoops of vanilla ice cream with sprinkles, etc) all while making sure your customer doesn't get impatient and, god forbid, walk out.  You earn money per sale, and your customers' happiness determines your business flow.

With the money you earn you can purchase new menu items, upgrade already existing items, and purchase new equipment and upgrades for your restaurant, all with the goal of working up to five star status.  Having perfect accuracy and timing for your orders earns you combos, which get you extra cash  if you place bets on yourself.  The better you do, the more buzz you will get from the public, and the busier and more difficult the game will become.    

It can get old, and at times does seem a little bit like work, but for a cooking and restaurant management sim it is great.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998548966', 'num_games_owned': 2242, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1200, 'last_played': 1527447326}

review: a small, yet enjoyable game. this cooking sim puts you in the place of the owner of a crappy old resteraunt. luckly as you get more customers you can get special upgrades that basicly renovate your resteraunt, unlock new foods, or some special events. This game is absolutly full of charm, from the music, to the art-style, everything looks great. this game also does that thing that all animes do with food, as in  make it look f**king amazing! the few cons i have with this game is the progress, and the replay value, the game doesn't have many foods, and upgrading them usually doesn't change that much about it, so there is really no sense of progression, this, combiened with how long it takes to jump through enough hoops to make your resteraunt better, it really comes out at about even, over all this is a charming game that gets very reppetitive later on. 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074623672', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1636771669}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009316076', 'num_games_owned': 833, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 2482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1801, 'last_played': 1482119368}
review:
This is a fantastic game, and I cannot recommend enough that you purchase it.

You open a restaurant in an office tower, and your ultimate goal is to raise it up to a 5 start restaurant that everyone will want to eat at. You manage your menu to make sure you have food that fits the weather (sunny or rainy), fits the clients (maybe that hot chick from a dating site is coming, or even a VIP guest) and keep your menu items fresh (you've had fish on the menu for two whole days, switch it out!). You can also upgrade the food to make it better (and allow you to charge more for it). 

The game is fast paced and very hectic. You prepare and serve the food as the orders come in. Some things are simple, and some are not. Pretzel? Serve it plain, with salt, with butter, or with both. Fried chicken? Deep fry until cooked and put a basket and serve. Nachos? If they want meat, you have to cook it, if not don't worry. Then you need to make sure you get everything on the nachos they want. Soup? Make sure the noodles are correct, make sure you add the right ingredients, and don't forget to individually chop the vegetables. See what I'm getting at?

The beauty is that this allows you to essentially make the game as easy or as hard as you want. You could make the game hard by serving easy to prepare food, or hard to prepare food. You could serve soda, making sure you choose the right cup size, pour the right flavor, figure out if they want ice, etc. Or you could just serve beer and fill a mug and give it to them. It's brilliant. 

You also do chores; throwing out garbage, flushing toilets, and cleaning dishes, all of which must be done while you take orders and prepare food. What, you think you hire help at this place? Nope you're a one man show. There's a lot of micromanagement involved; take the order for the pasta, cook the noodles, make someone a salad, pour someone a beer, come back to the pasta order and add the toppings, flush the toilet, etcetera. 

The keys for each task can also be binded individually as well, so if you don't like it, change it. The art style is pleasant, and the music fits the game really well. The little additions like taking on catering jobs and additional cooking challenges, and being able to earn money by making in-game bets for in-game money just add to it. 

CSD is like LSD; you'll get hooked on it and you may not be able to stop.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047536700', 'num_games_owned': 959, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 5484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2685, 'last_played': 1506542752}
review:
I have been playing this game for months and I still really enjoy it. It's slightly repetitive, but there are numerous easter egg quirks throughout the game that will make you laugh out loud and stay engaged. (Tip: read the e-mails. They are all excellent.) The difficulty scaling is just right, it keeps you wanting to play more in order to unlock more recipes/items and become a master chef. Looking back, it's amazing how much better I have gotten. When I first started playing I thought there was no way I'd be able to do the 5-star restaurant since I was having some trouble..I thought I'd bitten off more than I could chew (pun intended). But now I get in the zone and am normally able to beat it with ease (I just rage whenever I don't get a perfect day. Curse you multiple soups during rush hour!) Lots of fun, constantly being updated, and it's a casual game that you can pick up whenever you're craving to play. Definitely worth the money, a great addition to anyone's game library!

EDIT: Yes using a keyboard/mouse is easier to use. However the fact that they made this work as well as they did with controller support is incredible. I thought for sure it would be really difficult considering the amount of ingredients some foods have but they proved me wrong — kudos!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014849103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 3375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2558, 'last_played': 1583622566}
review:
As a competitive typing enthusiast [i]and[/i] a food lover, I stood no chance of resisting this game's charms. And ample charms they are: the art is full of life, the music is groovy, the sound design provides great feedback (I love the [b][i]thwack![/i][/b] as I lay down ingredients), and there's a surprising amount of content for what looks like a simple casual game at first glance. Even the writing is subtly clever.

So, what's typing got to do with this? It's pretty simple: [b]I get to press lots of keys really quickly to make delicious food appear.[/b] It's extremely satisfying.

If the gameplay looks daunting, fear not; the difficulty is highly adjustable by customising your active menu. As part of progression, you'll be buying new food items and upgrading them (making them more profitable but also, in most cases, adding complexity to their preparation). But when/whether you do this is up to you. Likewise, you can set up your menu to only include easier foods, or you can give yourself a challenge by filling it with difficult ones, or anything in between. This makes the game much more accessible, and it's part of why I feel confident in recommending this game to just about any kind of gamer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119409902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 944, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1604812290}
review:
Estuvimos jugando este juego con mi hermana por horas. Personalmente, siempre quise jugar un juego así, donde hubiese que introducir series de comandos para obtener un resultado (En este caso, preparar comida, ¡jajaja!) 

El juego cuenta con un reloj simulado. Deja que te acostumbres en las primeras horas de la mañana y luego cuando llegas a la hora pico (Rush Hour) tienes que ponerte a preparar comida y hacer limpieza del restorán como loco. A veces te trabas por querer hacer todo rápido, pero eso es lo divertido del juego.

Para no aburrir a la clientela, debes cambiar el menú de cuando en cuando. Claro, hay comidas que nunca les aburren, como la cerveza o la ensalada. Cuentas también con una gran variedad de platillos que podrás ir adquiriendo posteriormente; cada cual se prepara de manera distinta, lo cual le agrega grán variedad al juego.

En general, si buscan un juego con temática y gameplay novedoso, "Cook, Serve, Delicious" es LA opción.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100751172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1749, 'last_played': 1657484837}

author: {'steamid': '76561198010506140', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 682, 'last_played': 1612013911}
review:
Having been weened off Flash Games, I expected this to be a clone of the Papas' series. However upon buying and testing it out, I discovered it is more than that. It combines elements of humor, with a rather intelligent keyboard layout system to preparing meals that will become second nature after a day or so. It keeps things interesting even for those who mastered the ingredients keyboard shortcut by having a pair of in game hour long rush hours every day to keep you on your toes.

At the time of writing, I am at the 2nd Star of my restaraunt despite hours poured into the game, and plan on finishing it over the next few weeks. Definitely money well spent, and recieves my recommendations.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004842640', 'num_games_owned': 1058, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 1783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1468, 'last_played': 1446920253}
review:
Eu acabei de SONHAR com esse treco. Não estou acreditando.

Não, eu não sonhei que estava em um restaurante insanamente cheio no qual eu era a única responsável, atendendo aos pedidos de centenas de pessoas simultaneamente enquanto cuidava da limpeza do local e fazia até retratos falados dos assaltantes.

Eu sonhei com a tela do jogo mesmo. Com musiquinha e tudo. Acordei horrorizada ao perceber isso ("AFF, estou sonhando com aquele joguinho do Steam"). Essa introdução é apenas para demonstrar o quanto esse jogo é VICIANTE. Uma vez que você realmente "entre" nele - ou seja, internamente aceite o desafio de fazer do seu restaurante o melhor - é impossível sair. Geralmente eu saio do jogo quando minhas mãos estão duras, doendo tanto que é impossível atender aos pedidos com a rapidez necessária para tal. 

O jogo é simples. Premissa simples (atenda aos pedidos do seu restaurante rapidamente, evite errar - e use o dinheiro para melhorá-lo e evoluir no jogo), visuais simples, trilha simples. Mas é eficiente no que se propõe a fazer. E divertido (exceto quando a gente perde um combo no final de um dia no restaurante, aí é estressante). 

Recomendo totalmente. Para ser melhor do que é, só se tivesse um modo multiplayer (eu sou uma defensora ferrenha do single player, mas esse jogo especificamente me parece muito adaptável ao multi).

author: {'steamid': '76561198081331633', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1458896930}
review: This is the most hectic cooking game on the planet!!!!!!!!!!1

author: {'steamid': '76561198098308609', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 1434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1392, 'last_played': 1511550922}
review: Sinceramente, es un muy buen juego que combina cocina (no muy relevante), gestión (no mucha, pero la suficiente como para ser relevante) y habilidad, ya que para cocinar debemos tocar múltiples teclas. La música es muy buena y los gráficos son geniales. Lo único que critico es que luego de 12-13hs se convierte repetitivo. Tampoco está traducido, que no es un problema en sí, el problema viene en que se asocia los ingredientes a sus iniciales (en inglés) y puede complicar un poquito las cosas. Más allá, un muy buen juego, y además barato, muy recomendado.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969189065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 558, 'last_played': 1489322183}

author: {'steamid': '76561198124415749', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1065, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1436451124}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a pretty casual and fun game. It's all about maintaining composure, paired with proper timing and precision typing. There's plenty of achievements to beat and a variety of food recipes to try out. Mastering the preparation method for certain recipes or landing a perfect day play session can be very satisfying. It's slow and easy at first, but tension builds up quickly at later stages of the game. Would recommend if you're into casual games, it's definitely not for everyone. It may get repetitive for some fairly quickly. 

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197966107556', 'num_games_owned': 1086, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 1020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 630, 'last_played': 1627922870}
review:
Gioco parecchio casual ma divertente. Il meccanismo di gioco è semplice ma diventa mano a mano più difficile, ciò nonostante è il giocatore a dettare il ritmo scegliendo il menù del ristorante includendo piatti più o meno difficili.

Il gioco naturalmente utilizza una serie di espedienti per farci cambiare ogni giorno il menù per non farci prendere troppa confidenza con le stesse 3 ricette.

Nonostante sia un gioco multipiattaforma con una bella versione per iPad la versione per PC è splendidamente convertita e permette di giocare usando combinazioni di tasti, o se si preferisce giocare sul grande schermo anche un joypad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015084130', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 788, 'last_played': 1678553018}
review:
Cook, Serve. Delicious is a simple yet intensive restaurant game. The game isn’t stellar great, but it serves its purpose: being an addictive time-killer.

The fun of restaurant game is to satisfy the ever-growing number of customers as menu and ingredient variety piles up. CSD is able to deliver the experience in a solid manner. UI is not bad, menu variety is acceptable, and atmosphere articulation is amiably done. It’s easy to pick up and it takes a while to master.

The nemesis of such genre is perhaps repetitiveness, which brings in boredom. CSD doesn’t have something uniquely memorable. It gets the genre’s intentions done but that’s it. Food and equipment upgrades fail to utilize the computational power of PC and do not provide immerse and varying experience. Lacking sudden events also makes the game predictable, hampering the already average gameplay. UI can also need some patching for friendlier interaction. At last, the game progress is annoyingly slow, even for a PC game. It doesn’t grasp the importance of  quick immersion and thus may easily lose hook on players. Players just can't feel the much needed encouragement from the developers when playing the game.

I always love cooking like Gordon Ramsay. Season. Mop. Hot pan. Touch. Turn. Beautiful. Slice. Serve. Done. I guess I can’t really do that here.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197994362842', 'num_games_owned': 1200, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1502935023}
review: So this game looked so casual to me at first. Then playing it...it kicked my butt and that was okay because I was having fun. I was surprised to learn that this had alot of challenge to it. When asked by another friend of mine to describe CSD all I could come up with is: Restaurant Sim/Fighting Game. Because of the combos, button mashing, quick pace; this was almost like Street Fighter meets Hells Kitchen. If you're looking for something to dive into, kill a couple minutes or hours even then Cook, Serve, Delicious is your game. I can't wait to see more from this developer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008669487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1579, 'last_played': 1527532914}
review:
* Inventive ways to cook - not just button mashing
* Beautiful design/graphics
* Excellent difficulty curve that increases at your own pace
* Easy to play - incredibly difficult to master. Equally fun as a moment's entertainment as a full-focus tryhard
* Good variety of foodstuff, with various upgrades and equipment to buy for balanced costs
* Quick, responsive controls, intuitive to me and if not to you they're fully costumizable and you can play with mouse or keyboard or gamepad (or combinations thereof if you want to complicate things)
* Extra modes like catering, and leaderboard challenges

I play this game on keyboard, and it's become almost meditative at this point. I know the lasagna recipes in my sleep :P I've gotten so much fun out of something so cheap! Strongly recommended for anyone who likes... er, what genre is this?

author: {'steamid': '76561198018872195', 'num_games_owned': 764, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 2489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 689, 'last_played': 1652145693}
review: Very fun game, and for the price I paid for it I am getting well above my money's worth from it. I also love the fact it has full controller support something that you just don't see enough of in games on PC these days, some games were just made to work better with a controller than a keyboard and mouse. The game all around has catchy music that doesn't get annoying after hearing it for the 30th time and it progressively get's more complicated to play but it doesn't go from being super easy to super hard you have a middle ground which is something else I've seen lacking in most cooking simulation games. All in all I give this game an 8 out of 10. And for the price who can really complain about it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006697906', 'num_games_owned': 10414, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1697400253}
review:
7/10

+ a nice and original idea implemented well, the only other restaurant sim game i can remember is restaurant empire 1+2
+ seems like a casual game , but has enough depth in gameplay to keep you interested, you choose the daily menu, upgrade staff that help doing the job faster and more efficiency, you accept daily challenges, there are a lot of things happening
+ good progression of the story, becoming more difficult every day, good length for this type of game
+ good controls, either clicking with mouse or pressing the right keybort button

- very basic presentation, could use more polish in the graphics department
- you dont create the recipes, they are just there to choose, something that is the most important and satisfying aspect of gameplay in restaurant empire games
- restaurant empire is much better if you want the best game in the genre

author: {'steamid': '76561198088490530', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2163, 'last_played': 1523482810}
review: Un jeu addictif et jouissif, qui ne perd pas du rythme au fil du jeu. On a envie de connaître toutes les recettes et de les upgrader au maximum, d'avoir un beau restaurant et des clients heureux à travers des challenges complexes, tordues et toujours sympathique. En plus de ça, une ambiance règne tout au long du jeu, une ambiance gaie et chatoyante, drôle par moment et parfois étonnante. Testez vos capacités à exploser votre clavier, devenez un pgm des touches, achetez ce superbe jeu. Sérieusement. Ca en vaut la peine. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197998165570', 'num_games_owned': 1587, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1558892123}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious is a charming restaurant management/cooking game that puts you in charge of a restaurant in an office tower. It is simple and easy to pick up, while at the same time taking tons of mastery to fully perfect and maximize a day. 

Cook, Serve, Delicious starts you off with a no star, unknown diner operating within an office tower. You start off with some cash, and choose what dishes you'd like to serve. Each dish has an effect on your restaurant's appeal to customers, with certain dishes being attractive for a few days, others being staples that are always popular, while some have negative or positive effects at certain points in the day. The dishes are served up by you as the day runs by, with each dish having a different cooking process, with some dishes having several variations thanks to a multitude of ingredients. You must try your best to cook the meal to perfection while also doing it as fast as possible, while juggling multiple orders and restaurant chores as well.

As you move on, you unlock more recipes, or upgrade current recipes to add to its price, but also adding complexity to each dish. You can also upgrade your restaurants equipment to help with your day-to-day, increasing your customer's patience, decreasing the frequency of chores, and so on. You aim to complete goals to increase your restaurants rating, thereby giving you a higher-class clientele and access to cooking challenges and such.

The game displays itself in a 2D, cartoon world. It is colorful and charming, with many of the food looking quite delicious while still keeping a stylized flair to it. The game's interface is clear and concise - each dish will show you what keys to press to perform actions, and the UI is kept lean and simple, making the game very easy to play.

Cook, Serve, Delicious is an excellent cooking game and will draw you in with ease. Soon, you'll be finding yourself wanting to  cook faster and faster while balancing complex recipes such as soup and pasta, which is quite daunting thanks to the many ingredients in both. This game is a splendidly designed game. If I had to compare it to another game, I would say it acts like a much more cheerful version of Papers, Please in terms of gameplay - simple, but increasingly complex, yet also very satisfying.

Fully recommend this game. Have fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081984692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 2340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 655, 'last_played': 1648269758}
review: This fast paced marvel is on my favorites list. It looked intersting to start with, and it just sucked me in more and more. I kinda just want to stay at a certain level. I like to hone my skills with the keyboard memorization and such. Most people will look at this  game and think its foolish and pointless in a sense. I actually think this game is a skill tester. I also think it could be helpful for kids. When in school, I had a special class that was literally to help me memorize where all the keys were, how to put my hands in a proper position that gave me the utmost advantage with hand cordination. It has truly helped me and this game reminds me alot of that exercise. It makes you remember certain patterns and orders and ingredients. Its also a recipe zone, so if you plan to be a cook in the future, you can get a small hint of cooking knowledge from this. I definetly recommend this to people who like challenges and are good/bad at hand-eye cordination. I also give it a 8/10 :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197984786018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2054, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1394, 'last_played': 1467308629}
review:
Great game to train hand coordination, typing speed and muscle memory.

The game has a dynamic difficulty curve as it lets you choose which dishes to serve (which are very differing in their complexity) and how much customers you want to attract ("Buzz" is used here as a metric to determine how much visitors you will have). 
This results in the game adapting to your playstyle in terms of speed and difficulty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045145245', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 765, 'last_played': 1456632830}
review:
This is entirely WAY too fun.  It's not like many of the other popular cooking games.. no actually pushing butter around the pan ala "Cooking Mama", nor serving people & taking orders like the awful Diner shockwave games.  
This is more like the best cooking game of all time - Order Up for the Wii.  It's more Restaurant play - cleaning up, putting together pre-made ingredients, deciding which dishes to buy & which to upgrade, and personalizing per the order.   Order Up on the Wii was a magnificent game, and this builds on that idea by making it keyboard-friendly, thus MUCH faster.

Side note - my daughter & her friend streamed this on twitch & loved yelling at the customers.  They were able to split between arrow-keys/mouse for one player and 1/2/3/4 & S for the other.. it was a fun vision of teamwork that I found myself missing when I played alone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129840294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1635243528}

author: {'steamid': '76561197992567771', 'num_games_owned': 2159, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 2590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2431, 'last_played': 1629923257}
review:
Cook Serve Delicous ist ein Indie Game von einem kleinen Entwickler. Der Programmierer des Spiels hat vor vielen Jahren schon eine Freeware mit dem gleichen Spielprinzip herausgebracht und hat sich mit diesem Spiel den Traum erfüllt seine Spielidee von damals zu vollenden.

Wie der Name schon vermuten lässt geht es um viel Essen und ein Restaurant. Man eröffnet im SherriSoda Tower eine kleine "Bude" und darf sich dann klassisch bis zum Luxus Platin Restaurant hocharbeiten. Man kauft sich die ersten Gerichte, stellt die Speisekarte zusammen und kauft sich mit dem ersten verdienten Geld schnell eine Fritteuse oder einen Grill. 
So geht das Spiel dann immer weiter und außer ein paar Challenges, die es später ziemlich in sich haben, gibt es nicht mehr. Was das Spiel ausmacht ist die Liebe zum Detail. Die Grafiken sind wunderschön handgezeichnet und die Texte der Gerichte und Upgrades sind herrlich lustig geschrieben. Mit der Zeit baut man sein Restaurant immer weiter aus und auch die Speisekarte bekommt bessere Gerichte als schnöde Pommes oder Pizzen. Dazu kann man die Gerichte auch noch upgraden, dadurch steigert sich die Qualität der Zutaten und es bringt mehr Geld im Verkauf.

Ein weiteres tolles Feature is der Buzz, je nachdem wie abwechslungsreich die Karte ist und welche Faktoren wie Regen oder Abendgelüste beachtet bekommt man Buzz und mehr Kunden strömen in das Restaurant, das wird vor allem ab Mitte des Spiels ziemlich stressig. 

Für Cook Serve Delicous sollte man die Tastatur mit ihren Tasten auswendig beherrschen, das Zehnfingersystem bringt auf jeden Fall Vorteile. Man kann sich zwar alle Tasten frei belegen, ich fand die Standardbelegung aber schon ziemlich gut und hatte kein Bedarf daran etwas zu verändern. Meistens ist es so das eine Bestellung reinkommt und man das Gericht dann zubereiten muss, dabei muss man zum Beispiel das Fleisch punktgenau braten, den Burger mit den richtigen Zutaten belegen oder Zutaten in die Suppe schneiden, das alles wird immer über je eine Taste ausgelöst. Später lernt man dann sich bestimmte Muster für bestimmte Gerichte anzulernen damit man diese umso schneller zubereiten kann, gegen Ende des Spiel wird es nämlich Stress pur jedes Gericht perfekt zuzubereiten, dafür braucht man blitzschnelle Reflexe.

Für mich ist Cook Serve Delicous eines der besten Indie Spiele des Jahres 2013 und ich hatte viel Spaß mit dem Spiel. Um das Spiel komplett durchzuspielen und alle Achievments zu sammeln benötigt man rund 40 Stunden, was für so ein Indie Spiel eine beachtliche Spielzeit ist. Cook Serve Delicous ist aber wirklich nur für Fans des Genres Micro Management zu empfehlen, man muss solche Spiele einfach mögen, ansonsten wird man es sehr schnell langweilig finden.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053439657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1764, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1224, 'last_played': 1506027665}
review:
This is a really great game, it has tight controls, a good system for serving, which gets really addicting after a while, and also a really clever way of "leveling up". There are always new challenges when you completed the previous ones, so you never have nothing to do. THIS IS NOT AN ORDINARY COOKING MAMA GAME. This is special, fun, addictive and a really great game.
10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198044924596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 706, 'last_played': 1654769021}
review:
Quite funny game - a great morning game to wake up your brain. Would be cool with an expert mode where there are no free periods. 

Also would be great if the developers changed the name Smorgasbord to Fingerfood or something (corndog, pretzel... wtf??). Do not downgrade this fine Danish gastronomic art, as smorgasbord is - that would be the same as saying a filet mignon is a pizza!

author: {'steamid': '76561198080491487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1381, 'last_played': 1398276206}

author: {'steamid': '76561198077966351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 631, 'last_played': 1520385704}
review:
"Cook, Serve, Delicious!" is a spectaucular, original game. It is one of the few simulations I have played that actually drew me into the role of the job. Cooking and cleaning are fast-paced and demanding! My favorite part of the game are the e-mails that appear in the main menu; which add to the realism of being a restaurant owner. The burgers and pizzas are my favorite foods to make. On the other hand, the kabobs and soups are a real pain in the ass. I am also surprised to see a robbery action during the main game, and it makes things even more frantic when trying to complete the day. Overall, this is a very good game and I highly recommend purchasing it!

Suggestions to the developers of this game:
1) A form of online and offline cooperative and competative style of gameplay.
2) The ability to view recipe cards outside of the main game.
3) Endless Mode: an endless shift that gets progressively harder.
4) Custom Mode: being able to create new recipes, how many orders (4-8) allowed at one time, etc.
5) Add more of a variety of music and voices.
6) Being able to redo challenges without having to start a new game file.

review: Delightful graphics, simple but challenging gameplay, and packed with minor details that help flesh out the environment.  The varied and humorous e-mails are always fun to read after each day.  I also like the detail that went into describing all of the food.  It was way more in-depth than I would have expected.  The game can feel grindy at times but there is enough to help break up the monotony such as daily challenges, chores, and catering events.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107541912', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 967, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 894, 'last_played': 1490307812}
review: Un jeu super, technique et agréable. On se prend vite au jeu du cuisto qui monte en qualité son restaurant, à coup de courtes sessions de jeu (5min pour une journée de service), et les défis sont tous simplement déments !!

author: {'steamid': '76561197988316302', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1460214930}
review:
"Oh what a fun, casual looking game!" WRONG! This is THE most hardcore gaming experience in Steam. Your hands and fingers will be screaming from agony long before you get to one star, but at the same time the game is so addicting and fun that you cannot help, but to keep on playing.

If you do play all the way to five stars you will win the admiration of everyone and everything and you'll have a chance to apply for a professional CSD! team once it surpasses Starcraft in South Korea.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083072026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 2408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2278, 'last_played': 1561917224}
review:
Original March 2014: I bought this on a whim when it was first released on Steam, because I enjoy time management games. This is the most frantic, detailed one I've ever played. It's very easy to succumb to "just one more turn!" over and over again. The game is difficult at first when you're learning the speed and combinations, but you will quickly get the hang of it. I just unlocked my four-star restaurant, and CSD is a game I always look forward to playing. I can't wait to see what else the developer has in store!

Update Nov 2016: This is my best random purchase on Steam. I noticed it when it came out, and I really like the Cooking Dash games, so I took a chance. I'm still playing it three years after release, and it's one of my favorite games. Perfect learning and difficulty curve, and the sense of satisfaction when you get a perfect day is awesome. You can easily play a very quick session if you want to (each day only takes about ten minutes), but I often found myself playing for hours. I can't wait for CSD2!

author: {'steamid': '76561198019171073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1514392713}

author: {'steamid': '76561198039079439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1461383964}

author: {'steamid': '76561198014529131', 'num_games_owned': 44, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 5565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2868, 'last_played': 1616260239}
review:
A game that encourages you to know your mouse and/or keyboard extremely well, the game itself is very enjoyable and surprised me with its level of complexity. Playing with the mouse and keyboard, I had a blast trying to make as many proper meals as I could without losing any customers. 

The game increases to get complicated as your buzz dictates how many visitors you have, and with the upgradable foods it makes even the simplest of recipes- coffee- still a timing challenge. The game doesn't get monotonous after a while, and even after getting all five stars and most of the achievements, I'm playing again and having the same amount of fun as I did the first time. 

An Insaniquarium for the keyboard and/or mouse, it is a game that I'll always keep on my desktop for when my brain needs a little break.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993374317', 'num_games_owned': 1553, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1651296957}
review:
I can't quite put my finger on what makes this game so great. It's this perfect blend of reflex-based chaos and management sim, that works oh so well. 

The visuals are really clean, simplistic, and pleasing to the eye. The music is fantastic. The sound effects are fitting. The gameplay itself is extremely fast-paced and can become downright madness. It's simply put- a blast. It harkens back to what games should be: fun. If you find yourself looking for a nice change of pace, or something to alleviate that stress brought on by excessive amounts of surviving any of the digital wastelands dominating the Top Seller list, give this a shot. You won't be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964177568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1969, 'last_played': 1663595148}
review:
Quite simply, an amazing game. You may get frustrated. You may want to curse the developer. But 99% chance when you get mad and want to curse, it's your own fault. A brilliant, simple game, that keeps you coming back for more.
If you dont know the mechanics of the game, they are simple. I will give a simple example, to not spoil anything.
Say you want to serve a Baked Potato in your restaurant. It might have two recipes. ABCX and ABCY. So customers order one of the two. You hit those keys, serve it up, get your money and everyone is happy. Perhaps you want to serve a steak? You buy it from the food menu. Maybe it has 4 different types of steaks that people order, for example HGFF, HGFY, HHFY, and DHFT. Now you have two items, with six recipes you have to recall. At first it's easy, brilliant. But then it just keeps going and going. Add other issues like flushing the toilet (perhaps Arrow Up, Arrow Up, Arrow Down, repeated 4 times) and it just gets to be crazy fun.
Its a brilliant game, well worth the money. When I mess up, I want to blame someone else for it, but I know its just a simple game, and it makes me want to continue. Just about as addictive as it gets.
If you suck using the keyboard, then this isnt the game for you. If you prefer the mouse, I doubt this is the game for you. But if you suck at the keyboard, you still have a chance as you can change ANY recipe to what you want. So if you mess up an order, its your fault.
I have not finished the game yet, but with 20+ hours into the game, I simply cannot see that the developer might let me down in the final challenges. 
I wrote this review before I finished the game simply because if it were to end right now, the value of the game would be worth it.
I recommend this game, unless you just are terrible at the keyboard. Otherwise, its a surprising and challenging game that keeps me coming back .  I would be honored to work for this developer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027433390', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 557, 'last_played': 1436899863}
review:
What makes this game is the atmosphere and the customization. I really feel like I own a little place, and I like it. I like the rain that falls on the window, it reminds me of actual rainy days, and that also makes me feel good, cozy even. It's the little things, I guess.
A bit grindy, but that doesn't come into effect. Very satisfying to have 'Perfect Days' or win bets, getting to a one-star restuarant is an achievement and it feels like it. You even get a remodel when you hit a new star.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197981616554', 'num_games_owned': 1559, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 764, 'last_played': 1442018714}
review:
While appearing to be a food service simulator, Cook, Serve, Delicious feels more like a mini-game compilation in the vein of WarioWare. You are in charge of single-handed running the busiest restaurant in the world, and are expected to prepare and serve each meal promptly and to order. This is simple with cheaper dishes such as corn dogs and fish filet; however, as the game progresses, and you are asked to prepare more complicated meals, the pace mounts exponentially. Balancing your menu not only involved making sure you don't serve the same thing too often: it also involves balancing your menu so that you don't serve too many difficult dishes at once. For those not satisfied with the normal progression, random bets and Steam challenges are here to give you the opportunity to grab extra bragging rights.

Honestly, CSD is one of the best cooking games I've played, and it's definitely worth the full $10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062490448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 796, 'last_played': 1478122361}
review:
Jeu très intéressant et prenant avec beaucoup de fun au final!
Il serait intéressant de pouvoir refaire les challenges pour gagner plus d'argent et avoir une plus grande diversité de nourriture encore!

author: {'steamid': '76561198036169221', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1391740942}
review: Fun game and gets very challenging during rush hour

author: {'steamid': '76561197967021411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1921, 'last_played': 1437033722}
review:
When you look at the screenshots and trailers this game might look like a browser game. I took the risk of buying it during the Christmas sale, I didn't regret that decision. After a few hours of playtime you notice this game offers a lot more content than a browser game.

The variation in dishes and possibilities to upgrade those dishes, combined with 'chores' (for example: cleaning the toilet) makes each day of service different. The extra events that are included in the game are fun and challenging, they are also handy to learn the key bindings to be more efficient in serving your food on daily basis.

The steam achievements, steam cooking challenges and leaderboards give the game a competitive aspect.

In my opninion the game is very simple but it works. It's fun and addictive. You can easily play Cook, Serve, Delicious! for 30-40 hours until you have fully completed it.

Even at it's current price I could advice anyone to buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031299653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1515133721}
review: I'm absolutely delighted to see a polished, extended version of this great restaurant sim that I fell in love with so many years ago.  Offers substantial nostalgia for anyone who has played the orignal and the game now has a nice, new look and a fair bit of comedy in the writing.  Appeal for anyone that likes microgames and multi-tasking, but definitely offers a hardcore challenge.  CSD boasts a progression system that is both fair (doesn't feel grindy) and rewarding.  Gameplay is too stressful to be monotonous, but this game is such a blast that it doesn't seem right to think of it as stress.  Definitely an addicting game, but I've loved every minute of it (including the 30+ hours my friend and I spent playing the original back in 2005/2006).  Hipster Cat out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997577561', 'num_games_owned': 1427, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1233, 'last_played': 1445038993}
review:
It's a typing game about food. No, wait, it's a food game about typing.

It's Typing of the Dead without the zombies, but with more hamburgers, steaks, lobsters, and cilantro. OK, there's no cilantro. But there's anchovies. And when someone wants them on a pizza, you have to oblige no matter how much it hurts.

It's frantic. You're juggling multiple orders while new ones keep coming in in a roughshod attempt to get them all in perfect order. A maintained combo means better pay at the end of the day. Rewards await those who pull off the perfect day. Juggle a menu between highly complicated dishes with expensive prices and easier ones that don't quite make as much. Customize your menu to match the requirements for, and then beat the pants off of, the daily bet. Compete in Iron Che—I mean Cook. Iron Cook, yes—challenges. Grow from a meager hole-in-the-wall diner to a five star establishment, complete with whiny, needy celebrities to indulge!

Try to keep up. You won't. You'll try, but you won't. And then, one day, you will. It will be glorious. And all the while you'll have one hell of a time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058818878', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 955, 'last_played': 1589589591}
review: Simple, Fun, and Fast Paced. The keyboard demands your reflexes are up to date or your in for a really bad time. For those who think it is another restaraunt simulator like the Papa's _____eria Series, it kind of is, but is also different. you can get an assortment of foods on your menu, upgrade foods or other things, and compete in extra events ranging from easy to HARDCORE (yeah, all caps for the intesity). There is something for everyone in this game, I higly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045520315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1449209283}

author: {'steamid': '76561198017600886', 'num_games_owned': 502, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 2604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 898, 'last_played': 1449306332}
review:
オススメ度　☆★★★★

よく俺の料理に似てると言われています。私は俺の料理はパッケージしか見たことないので何とも共感できません。
ゲームというより、作業をこなす感じです。そこが良いんです。

レストランをあなたは一人で切り盛りします。
オーダー拾って料理を作って給仕して皿を洗ってゴミを捨ててトイレを流して
ネズミを捕まえて強盗の似顔絵を書いて出会い系サイトの彼女に料理を作ってその後営業中でもメールで会話をして
・・・ファッキンビジー（クソ忙しい）です。


ずっと忙しいわけではなく、ランチタイムとディナータイムで１日に２時間ずつラッシュアワーが来ます。
そこが書き入れ時なのでたくさんの料理をお客さんに食べて幸せになってもらいましょう。

author: {'steamid': '76561198120606077', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3281, 'last_played': 1418574423}
review: Cook, Serve, Delicious! is so much more fun and challenging than I thought it would be. I figured the game would be like the Papa's -ria games that populate the Internet, but this is a legit management game where every single decison is up to you. While the first few rush hours are the most frightening, throat-clenching thing imaginable, they soon come to seem like just a slightly different part of gameplay - normal, even (yes, they are simply because they're built into the game, but it's a metaphor). But, my point, is that the game is an excellent piece of work with wonderful dashes of humor, challenge, and favorite passtime-material.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007237884', 'num_games_owned': 1024, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1410717344}

author: {'steamid': '76561198091554156', 'num_games_owned': 392, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 3824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1009, 'last_played': 1628478788}
review: Another fun time waster, with a scaling challenge level as you progress. Has some silliness to it as well, and it appealed to me plenty as a cook.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079589846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1607, 'last_played': 1451923979}
review: Highly addictive. The game isn't as easy as you would think it would be at the beginning but your fingers quickly adapt. Has high levels of re-playability and is quite humorous. The challenges were the right level of difficulty to make to keep playing. Once you finish all of the challenges/achievments it's still fun to pass the time. You can combine foods on your menu to give yourself a challenge or you can pick the easiest ones just to pass the time. Overall great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056405327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1499736622}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a high octane restaurant sim, complete with typing elements and a whole lot of stress. The game is simple and enjoyable (as long as you can handle making a few mistakes here and there) and is also surprisingly replayable and long for a petty price tag of $9.99.

Players are tasked with building up a menu of food items and successfully getting through a day with serving as many customers as possible with a minimal number of complaints. In order to cook the food on the menu, players must either use their mouse or keyboard to assemble all the required components of the item - more complex food (like sushi or salad) require more components, whereas simpler items (like coffee and pretzels) require less components. The player then has to find the perfect balance between high-income food items and low-complexity food items in order to turn a hefty profit and insure that customers don't walk out of the restaurant with an empty stomach. Over time, catering missions, contests and better food becomes available - these make sure that you don't get tired of playing the game after a few hours, and trust me, you won't.

The graphics are a simple art style that is neither good nor bad. The music found in the game changes depending on the time of day - Spanish fiesta music plays during the afternoon whereas calm and weary music plays before closing time. There isn't much of a story, except for the goal to constantly improve the restaurant's star rating, but you will find that the game doesn't need one since it is more or less an arcade title.

For $9.99, you're going to find that this game is a great deal. I picked it up during the WInter Sale for $4.99 - maybe keep a look out for it in the upcoming Summer Sale if you want to save money. This game could easily serve as a time-killer OR a full-fledged personal favourite, depending on whatever mood you are in. The bottom line however: it's great, buy it and you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040482378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1438239578}
review: Most stressful game I have ever played in my life. 10/10 would not reccomend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025853424', 'num_games_owned': 1136, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 2376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1361, 'last_played': 1499367766}
review:
you can find my full review here:
http://draksaite.blogspot.co.uk/2014/02/post-of-day-small-game-thursday.html

To sum up:
Good things: the game is highly addictive, it requires skill and keeps you engaged by making you continuously challenge yourself. Going trough one day is really fast (only takes 7 minutes), so it's the perfect game to play even when you can't dedicate a lot of time to gaming daily.

Bad things: it requiring you to pass 20 days to go up a star makes the game a bit stretched out. When you reach about 10 days towards your new star the game settles down. The buzz is no longer over the roof and you're used to the difficulty, so suddenly the days start feeling slow. I would have preferred more stars, but less days required to gain a star.

In short, I would recommend it.

review: This game is so awesome, that it is highly addicting. Only play this game when you have free time on your hands! author: {'steamid': '76561198068738339', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 761, 'last_played': 1510015799}
review:
Its a simple game, but pretty fun to play. It reminds me a lot of online flash games in the simulation genre. ITs easy to learn how to play, each food you prepare (as you can tell from the trailer) has a different button combination or different things you have to remember such as the order of ingredients or not to let certain foods cook to long.
As you earn money you can buy more kinds of food and upgrades for the food as well as new items to help you each new day you start. 
For a casual, light sim game I really enjoyed it and its a nice challenge. 
I had no bugs or any other tech. problems.
I give it a thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035652848', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1617140236}

author: {'steamid': '76561198082383002', 'num_games_owned': 3292, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 1797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 45, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1709700142}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious não é o tipo de jogo que você decora seu restaurante e faz o cardápio, você na verdade é o cozinheiro, e mais, o dono do seu próprio micronegócio! A jogabilidade se assimila bastante ao clássico jogo em flash do Bush servindo cachorros-quentes, - só que ao invés de usar o mouse, você usa o teclado e apenas ele - mas além de preparar cada comida, você às vezes deve também ter o trabalho de lavar a louça , levar o lixo, limpar o banheiro, se for assaltado, deve descrever à polícia o assaltante, dar um "tweet" para divulgar o restaurante, enfim...

O jogo conta com 2 sistemas diferentes: O primeiro é baseado no seu cardápio, sendo que cada comida tem aspectos positivos e negativos, sendo alguns desses, variáveis de acordo com o dia, e isto irá impactar no reconhecimento do seu restaurante... Como por exemplo, para aspectos positivos, comidas para dias ensolarados, dias chuvosos, party-time, bebidas noturnas  e também, para os negativos,  fast food, doces, mau cheiro,  nunca dão gorjeta, menu enjoativo, etc. sendo o menu enjoativo algo importante, pois quando a comida fica tempo demais no menu, ela acaba dando pontos negativos, portanto, seu cardápio deve ter uma rotação diária...

O segundo sistema baseia-se nos preparos das comidas, onde basicamente cada comida tem um preparo diferente, alguns bem simples, como peixe, outros ridiculamente complexos (como lasagna)... Além disto, cada cliente irá pedir a comida de um modo diferente, portanto, se não ler o que ele quer, ou pior, dar além do pedido, você não o fará totalmente satisfeito ou até mesmo, fará ele achar o restaurante negativo, dando uma reputação (buzz) negativo. Os clientes são impacientes, porém há como aprimorar para fazê-los esperar mais... Ah, o jogo também possui horários normais e horas de pico de clientela...

Cook, Serve, Delicious! é um excelente jogo com uma jogabilidade simples, porém interessante e desafiadora, a trilha sonora é boa, isto é, se adequa ao jogo, a mecânica flui bem, a estética dos gráficos é boa, porém, o jogo deixa a desejar em alguns quesitos, como a ausência de poder estar em português (o que dificulta para quem não domina a língua inglesa),  a ausência total de um roteiro, ou ao menos a premissa de um, um cardápio escasso, poucas tarefas e poucos challenges

author: {'steamid': '76561198042029841', 'num_games_owned': 503, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1391904506}
review:
Nota: 10/10 (Recomendado!)

Parece ser mais um daqueles jogos de cozinha em que o cliente chega e você simplesmente entrega o que ele pede, mas não é! Cook, Serve, Delicious! é bem completo, você precisa usar o teclado para completar os pedidos, existem fatores que afetam seu ganho, como o clima e a hora do dia. Você precisa comprar as comidas que irá server, cada uma tem pontos positivos e negativos, que variam desde o tempo de preparo até comidas que fazem com que ratos apareçam! Existem atualizações em alguns pratos, você vai jogando e habilitando melhoria nos pratos. Alguns pratos precisam de adicionais que devem ser comprados à parte, como fritadeira, penelas, etc.

Outro ponto interessante é que ao mesmo tempo que os pedidos aparecem, você precisa cuidar do seu restaurante, jogar lixo fora, armar ratoeiras, lavar os sanitários, lavar a louça suja!

Existem algumas exigências que fazem com que seu restaurante suba de estrela até chegar a 5 estrelas, algumas tarefas devem ser completas para isso.

O jogo é frenético! Por você só usar o teclado acaba ficando mais dinâmico e rápido!

author: {'steamid': '76561198031729345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1869, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 922, 'last_played': 1462446921}
review: Holy crap, I'm in love. Not since FTL has a very simple premise been pulled off so complexly and flawlessly. The game gets you learning and flowing in with it, while incorporating some really fun and cool strategies. Customizing your menu is fun, and you get to see the payoffs and downsides during the day/play part. Very fun game, I'd be happy with it at three times the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053169389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1391837510}
review:
Fun at first .... but, by day 8, I had all requirements for 1 star except for 20 days running my restaurant... perhaps it's my attention span, but I stopped playing soon after from tedious day to day rotating foods.... menu board limit increased, but items  go "rotten" after two days.. give us 1 star sooner, and let us keep our menu longer ....what if I like selling Fish 'n Chips (fries) to folks that enjoy it for more than 2 days ...it is my restaurant and it is a big tower with many customers ... what if Joe who chose pizza one day, fried chicken the next, but can't order what was on the menu his first day there?...give it 5-7 days for a food, so Joe can try something new each (working) day!

It's still a fun game, I wouldn't not reccommend...it might work for others

author: {'steamid': '76561198005275893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2340, 'last_played': 1505335099}
review: One of the most addictive games I've played in a long time. This game is a great way of testing your keyboard skills in terms of efficiency and accuracy. At the same time it is challenging you mentally by asking you to memorize all the different key bindings in order to serve your food as quick as possible. The ultimate experience for the gamer who likes the race of collecting money and spending it, improving your restaurant, but also making it more demanding. The more you upgrade, the more money you will generate, as long as you hit the right keys!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000801794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1459608641}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027112798', 'num_games_owned': 2426, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2879, 'last_played': 1484317635}
review:
"Your food is just meh. I might come back, dunno"
SherriSoda Tower worker (God damn you!)

  A great game, that gives you everything that it promises. It is casual, very grindy, very addictive and it is really funny. It is both simple and hardcore X) You start with 0 star restaurant and in couple hours you know every hobo that comes to drink beer to your place at 9 am. It is incredible funny to play with your family, sitting nearby, watching your poor restaurant management. To give names to all the visitors, to invent their biography, and to comment their choices like "Omg lady it's you again and you want more ice cream?! you already ordered 3 scoops of ice cream in the morning, you won't fool anyone here by changing your clothes". 
  So you work your way to 5 stars and posh ladies, ordering wine and lobster. Both music and  art style are lovely, food is drawn yummy and appetizing, and it makes you want to cook it in real life. Side missions like dating, vip guests, robbery and hardcore catering\iron cook events gives you healthy dose of fun and competitive expirience. 
  I recommend it to people who admit existence of their inner child, who understand that it is just a very cute&casual simulator, who are curious enough to read all the spam letters and food description, and who will addictively push wrong buttons while cooking the most horrible soup in the universe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090304979', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1669061553}
review: decent game

author: {'steamid': '76561198032788858', 'num_games_owned': 1105, 'num_reviews': 678, 'playtime_forever': 955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 955, 'last_played': 1391331939}
review:
Виртуальная готовка.

Самое главное - это не столько экономический симулятор (чуть-чуть совсем), сколько казуальная игра про постоянную готовку пищи в угоду оголодавшим. Второй вопрос - геймплей, да он тут ни меняется как не играй, хоть 5 часов, хоть 105. Т.е. игра настолько проста, что мы или готовим еду или составляем меню на день. Причем, чтобы достичь хотя бы самых легких целей (1-звездный ресторан), нужно тупо задрачивать, изо дня в день повторяя на 101% одинаковые операции. Как выглядит процесс готовки..смешно сказать, вы просто нажимаете кнопки, соответствующие определенному ингредиенту блюда, главное не ошибиться в порядке укладки, вот и все. Такому можно радоваться пару-тройку часов (периодически возвращаясь), однако тратить на это десятки часов (причем игра вас заставляет делать это, тупо дни даже промотать нельзя) скучно и бесполезно.

Сделай лазанью сам! 4,5 из 10 :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197993521516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1431437790}
review:
Adrenaline inducing, thrilling and stressful (but in an enjoyable way!), Cook, Serve, Delicious! accurately replicates the high octane rush of working in a restaurant. This isn't your mum's time management sim! CSD demands lighting-fast reflexes as you juggle cooking, cleaning, sanitation and drawing robber mugshots after they rob you - ALL AT THE SAME TIME.

A must for any fan of fast-paced action games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974708447', 'num_games_owned': 639, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 2125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1433, 'last_played': 1574809235}
review: I can't believe how many hours I put into this game. At it's base it's a pretty silly concept and simply just a typing/memorization game, but it's pretty addictive. It does get repetitive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021133017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 1741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 899, 'last_played': 1527453578}
