author: {'steamid': '76561197976688119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1200, 'last_played': 1456684938}
review:
Frantic lunacy, in the best possible way.  Despite its designation Cook, Serve, Delicious! is not a 'casual' game in the usual sense - it's possible to fire it up for a ten minute go, but in reality you'll be sat there an hour later wondering where the time went.

Luck plays a small part, but this game rewards learning.  It allows you to become better at it as you become better at it, which is something that has become surprising rare in recent games.  A clean, simple concept executed in a very solid way, this is one of the best games I've played in recent years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011698177', 'num_games_owned': 913, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1565589034}
review: Never thought owning a restaurant could be this much fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198021319158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 869, 'last_played': 1460281713}
review: It is a great game.It can much relax me when tired playing those big games.Besides,Serving dishes really helps me to plan doing somethins :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198045590272', 'num_games_owned': 2262, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3084, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1139, 'last_played': 1481715044}
review:
This game isn't what it looks at that is postive. If you think this is just a simple push the button-system think again, cause you will have a lot more fun with it then just simple pushing some buttons. It's a fun addictive cooking/restaurant-sim. You manage your menu and your restaurant while juggling all the guests that visit you with their wishes. 

You begin simple and small with a few guests and few recipes. There you can learn everything the game has to offer. Small building up everything. Also you have to switch out the different recipes and that way the game always offers his varriation. It can be enormously frantic though. And that can be a big con for a lot of people. So before buying this, you should keep that in mind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028896786', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1392268796}
review:
Buy for no better reason then it seems to hypnotize you once you start playing. You get into that rythmic trance wherein the gameplay has you clicking and moving to a certain pace. Faster and faster at times and then periods of low.

You also just need to do that next game to better than the day before, to try for bigger combos and also to constantly upgrade your restaurant. There are so many constant goals to be working towards in the short and long term that you're always fixed on the prize ahead. That magnificent shiny.

It is a very familiar game with influences from a lot of the management genre like Diner Dash and such, even those city based games and technically they would only be above the regular facebook game rabble... you know.. being as you're not sacrificing your friends sanity for the sake of some limited resource. I like it though and that makes me feel dirty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025466017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2168, 'last_played': 1497319326}
review: this game ruined my life 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198058164310', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1587659342}
review:
'Cook, Serve, Delicious!' is a well-made and fun game to play. Within the first couple of hours of playing I found a good strategy to go by to make good money. However after that the game does become a little reptitive, although it is still interesting because of the constant changes you will have to make to your menu to retain 'buzz'. In the later game it gets quite challenging and can be frustrating at points when trying to deal with lots of customers at once.

Overall this game is a well-made, interesting, slightly repetitive but still challenging game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007974446', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 3223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1570, 'last_played': 1457230423}
review: Amazingly great fun no matter what platform you're playing on. It's quick, simple and you can spend as much or as litle time playing it as you want. It's just you, some orders and the food you can't burn! The only bad thing I can say about this game is that it doesn't have an online Multiplayer mode so I can have a cook off with my friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020663239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1432963106}
review: I think its quite the fun game. Its so amazing how you gotta learn each combination and remix them everytime you start a new day. Its super addictive and fun and if you like cute simple games that get more complicated with time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040533421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1020, 'last_played': 1519187644}
review: Highly addicting and extremely fun! Be sure to take a break every 3 hours though...

author: {'steamid': '76561198022172146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 2587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2587, 'last_played': 1477843405}
review:
A deceptively amazing title, this seems like it would be similar to the management aspect of Diner Dash, and the preparatory aspect of Cooking Mama. However, structure it all in the fast-paced microgame style of WarioWare, and Cook, Serve, Delicious comes up as an absolute joy. My only major criticism is the lengthy amount of time it takes to advance one star, but with the content on offer, it works well with the game's relentlessly addictive nature. If you're looking for something that's not too challenging on the surface, this isn't a bad choice, although be warned that it gets rather hectic depending on the volume of customers and what you've chosen for your day's menu.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198089084167', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 12170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1936, 'last_played': 1594696276}
review: This game is amazingly addictive, one of the best restaurant sims I've played.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999597393', 'num_games_owned': 1357, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1076, 'last_played': 1505768276}
review:
In this game you're basically a one-man army, apart from the fact that you don't kill people, you cook food. 
Seriously, it's harder to cook food than to kill people, no doubt about that. 

Jokes / whatev aside, this is a very fun game. I kind of knew what I was going to play because I had seen a 2-3 parts of a YT Let's play of CSD. The feeling when playing is completely different from when watching it, though. 
For some people, it might get repetitive quick. I'm on day 88 or something like that, and when I'm in the menus or not in the game, I think : " Urrgh, do I really want to play? It's just the same stuff over and over again". But when I actually start playing it's instantly fun again.

Conclusion : Buy it if you like this genre of games. I didn't know I did, but this game convinced me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026468941', 'num_games_owned': 1131, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 704, 'last_played': 1415697730}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970783816', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1550043784}
review:
Who keeps ordering a chicken breast right as we're closing!

It's a very basic game, choose your menu items and enter key combinations to put them together correctly and get them out to the customers. In practice rush hours are absolutely frantic as you struggle to pour beer and make salads while customers get impatient and dishes need to be washed. It's not the sort of thing you can play while splitting your attention somewhere else but it's a rush to play in short bursts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086881055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1129, 'last_played': 1478520704}

author: {'steamid': '76561198038079024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1863, 'last_played': 1398422857}
review:
This is not a sim in any way.  This is more like a restaurant version of "Simon Says".  Cook, Serve, Delicious is a quick paced game, with lots of humor, great background music, and an escalation of difficulty that isn't easy, but isn't overwhelming.  

One of the best "little" games I've played in a long time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998332513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 754, 'last_played': 1500250216}
review:
Intense multitasking action. Tap tap tap tap tap.

This is probably the best game in my library, and I'll be really sad when there's nothing left to do but daily challenges.

It gets intense in such a lovely way, and it's quite a funny feeling when your hands automagically produce complicated recipes, serving up dishes without having to avert your gaze from the keyboard.

It's severely limited in that you can't choose the price of your meals, and it does get a little bit grindy, but I'll play it for an hour at a time and come back to it whenever I feel like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062945380', 'num_games_owned': 557, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 5658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1018, 'last_played': 1703172645}
review:
I saw this game being played and I thought it would help me pass a couple of hours, so I bought it. Immediately upon starting the game I was greeted with a warm, pleasing athstetic that is simply a sneaky mask for the cruel, relentless gameplay that it is built on. As soon as you think you have it under control, a new piece of equipment is unlocked, which unlocks a massive array of new dish possibilities. What happens when you have bought said equipment and mastered every single recipie (A very daunting task indeed)? Answer, you attain a new star, with it ensues more customers, more upgrades, new side jobs, etc.

On top of this, the game offers many different little storys or upgrades through the email system. It even has it's own version of Kickstarter! 

Overall, this is a brilliant game and I fully reccomend it to fans of this genre!

author: {'steamid': '76561198048465363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 623, 'last_played': 1486962081}
review:
So Friken Insane

author: {'steamid': '76561197965310164', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 966, 'last_played': 1390312097}
review:
The game is artifically padded with having to complete 100 days to beat the game. Many of the items have too many choices to perfectly do during rush hour, so using food items that are simply made like chicken and steak in order to complete perfect days for bonuses really limits gameplay. If you want to use complicated items, using the mouse is too difficult as it requires too many clicks. You have to memorize the order names along with all of the keyboard binds to be successful and that is tedious. Rebinding the keys of each item to the left hand would alleviate that problem, but that should've been an option from the start.

More like Click, Type, Headache!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027923225', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1111, 'last_played': 1506819313}

author: {'steamid': '76561198011941760', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1517, 'last_played': 1391661033}
review:
Hope ya know your keyboard well, because you'll be scrambling all over it! Eggs!

This is a very fast-paced and hectic game, challenging as you make it really. Choose all the delicious foods you want to serve, and watch your fingers clamber around in the hopes of leaving all your customers happy. There's tons of visual and audible cues for just about everything you'd want to know about that is happening amidst all the chaos too. The graphics make this game a bad idea to play while hungry though, as everything looks so mouthwatering.

It's a wonderful game, if you have the ability to handle all that's going on at once!

author: {'steamid': '76561197991292717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 781, 'last_played': 1563223637}
review: PLAY IT. YES. So good. One of, if not THE best tycoon games I've played. So much depth and attention to detail.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054045772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1410032445}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025295530', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1437010902}
review: Watched some videos of this game and thought on it for a while before buying, and I definitely do not regret the purchase. It's a very fast-paced and stressful game, but in a good way. The sense of humor throughout is a plus, and the actual core of the gameplay is very responsive and interesting. The balance between being able to take as much time as you want planning a menu and deciding on whether you can afford to buy any new equipment and the high-speed service portions is very nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111270774', 'num_games_owned': 554, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3068, 'last_played': 1463267686}
review: A really fun game. It's a bit challenging at first but then that becomes part of the fun as you get better and you can buy more food items and have an upgraded restaurant. Hoping for some DLC in the future! Oh... and just as a warning the game is horribly addicting!

author: {'steamid': '76561198051307288', 'num_games_owned': 489, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 991, 'last_played': 1505778982}
review:
A game that is the king of cooking. This game has NO right to be anywhere NEAR how fun it is. The hectic and the mind bendingly fast merge together to become some kind of super being of death and destruction. AND IT'S SO GOOD. 

P.S. Im writing this while the wounds are still hot. I was in the italian iron cook challenge. I had never served wine or pasta, and this was new to me. I got to the last dish. A pasta. I had all the strikes. One more, and I was out. It was an order, red sauce, bacon, and red peppers. I press the meatball button. I sit there, weeping as the meatballs lay there. TAKE THEM OFF!!! TAKE THEM OOOOOOF!!! Last dish, last round. I serve it. Challenge. Failed. :(

author: {'steamid': '76561197997724945', 'num_games_owned': 4607, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 2019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2019, 'last_played': 1390140863}
review: What a game this one is and what a great joy to play it was. I always heard great and many things about Cook, Serve, Delicious! back when it was mobile only and even though everytime I looked at gameplay videos and screenshot of the game I honestly thought this was not really the kind of game I'd enjoy but when it came to PC I knew I had atleast to give it a shot, and so I did. And how wrong I was, since the first couple of days I enjoyed it greatly. The game consists in upgrading your restaurant from 0 stars to 5 stars and eventually Platinum. To gain enough "prestige" to gain the next star you usually need to play 20 days, I think each day takes around 7 minutes or so to complete, and besides that you ocasioanally have to pass atleast 4 safety inspections which can be done by not failing a chore everytime the inspector visits your restaurant, such as cleaning the toilet, washing dishes, putting the garbage away and setting traps for mice. Eventually, the further you progress you'll unlock special events, first are the catering events which pay you an "X" amount for each person you successfully serve, then it's the Iron Chef (or Iron Cook) TV series in which you can only fail 2 orders and the last event is the Hunger Festivities which you cannot fail a single order and usually all the foods are fully upgraded. There's a various amount of stuff in which you can spend your money on, for example, you can upgrade or buy new foods, everytime you upgrade a food it increases the amount of money that you get by serving that food, besides that you can upgrade your restaurant by buying stuff that will help you out such as "Fun Menus" and other stuff that will increase the time that a customer waits for you to serve them their meal but you can also get items to help you on the chores. The type of food you serve on your restaurant also has an impact on your "buzz", basicly the more buzz percentage you have the more people will show up on your restaurant that day, like, fast foods will give you less buzz while healthy foods will give you more buzz and even increase the chance of getting a tip from the customers who order that food. The gameplay is pretty simple, you can use either the mouse (which I think it's a bad idea) or the keyboard to complete your orders, at first it is really slow paced but later on during rush hours it gets really hectic because you get alot of people. I find the graphicstyle to be rather good looking and charming, along with the visual upgrades that your restaurant gets everytime you gain another star and the way that the more stars you have the more "fancy people" will show up on your restaurant, you can clearly notice that by their better clothes and accessories along with the time VIPs start showing up. If there's one thing that accompanies you throughout the entire game is the main music of the game which despite listening to it for over 30 hours while I played Cook, Serve, Delicious! I still find it to be really charming and relaxing to listen to and it certainly fits the right spot everytime you play in my honest opinion. Honestly, Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a very unique game and you'll probably won't find one like it out there or atleast this well polished and well made. It's impossible to go wrong with this game, you should certainly buy it when you have the chance if it's something you think you can dig into, of course some people might not like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964150853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1389930561}
review:
Only 4ish hours in and this is a great game.

It's far more than a simple resource management sim. You actively create the foods through keyboard strokes to add ingredients. This gives the game a fast-paced rhythm / DDR feel.

The game seems really deep, with your culinary options (and gameplay) growing as you work / play. You can upgrade foods and equipment, which increase the complexity of the actions you need to complete to cook the foods. This adds a new level of challenge whenever you feel you have mastered a dish.

The game appears to have an "Iron Chef" parody that you can star on eventually, which is a super cool concept.

On sale, this game is a steal if you like quirky simulation games. And I sure do, I'd play a typing simulator if it existed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084096845', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 751, 'last_played': 1394680133}
review: This game is a little rough at the start but it is all about repetition and practice. Especially the beginning where you are without the cleaning upgrades. This is not like those facebook/miniclip cooking games this actually can become very intense and it's is about building your repertoire more than making payments. I wish this game had a better variety of food but it still has the staples of what is common. If you like food I don't see why you would not purchase this, I get hungry playing it all the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060922530', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2014, 'last_played': 1409417124}

Reccomended highly especially for the price, it is definatly as fun as its worth maby even more

author: {'steamid': '76561197997077277', 'num_games_owned': 1104, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1967, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1967, 'last_played': 1437486386}
review:
I just decided to give another chance to this game due to the mass amount of updates the devs gave in the two past years and this game just went awesome.
but why ? I don't know, the game is still the same, but it becames addictive. The game now gave you weekly challenge and missions outside the solo mode, the game seem a little easier than before and less punitive.
Still, it's just a "smash button" game, you have to learn the different pattern and use your keyboard skills to put the letter sequence as fast as possible (the worst recipies are soup and pasta, just because in one onions is binded to "O" and in other it's bnided to "N", this kind of nonsense just break the game because you have to go fast and  you can't stop to think to this kind of stuff.

I give the game an overall 4 stars, and I'm hoping the best for the sequel (cook, serve delicious 2), in which devs promise us over the quintuple recipies and much more to do. Hope so !

author: {'steamid': '76561198040251828', 'num_games_owned': 1912, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1493761885}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious! is a surprisingly fun game. While the controls will likely cause carpal tunnel, the gameplay is addictive. Finding the right balance for your restruant, and working your way to the top is fun. The steady pace, and different "rush" times provide a nice change to the tempo. Changing your menu can result with great sucess, or horrible failure.

I give it a 4/5. Why not 5/5? Well, mainly because of the fact that one little slip up on a customer's order results with negative debuffs. Sure the keyboard is small, but this game really makes you realize how small it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002217428', 'num_games_owned': 1214, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 816, 'last_played': 1497053409}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043284605', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1975, 'last_played': 1448316358}
review: While there isn't much here, what is present is surprisingly addictive and fun.  This is basically a restaurant simulator where speed and precision are the order of the day.  I say precision because any wrong button pressed is almost a guaranteed wrong order.  Learning the hotkeys is the most efficient way to succeed but - if you are quick - using the mouse is still a viable option.  This game can also be an exhausting stress-test at times so I recomend it in smaller doses than I took it in with.

review: I really can't express how much I love this game.  It's so addicting and there are so many different things to do and consider when preparing your menu.  I only have a 2-star restaurant so far, but I'm really excited to see where things go. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197998307332', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1505832986}
review:
I'm not entirely sure why, but this pretty much turned out to be one of the most fun little games I've played in ages. Visually, it's ridiculously charming, the cooking is frantic and fun, and the music! The whole game sounds fanastic. When you're not doing the day-to-day restaurant running, there's a bunch of side challenges to have a crack at, there's various bets and challenges to attempt, and some leaderboards for more competitive people to duke it out over. Best of all? The game's just consistantly hilarious. Between every day, you get sent "emails" in game, and most of them are normally information and rewards, but there's a steady trickle of spam you get that's just bloody brilliant. Every written sections of the game is fantastically done.

Basically, it's a fast-paced battle to keep your customers happy and get them back out the door as fast as possible, but it's also a hilarious one. Check it out, it's worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059166521', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1389684698}
review:
Certe je n'ai pas beaucoup d'heures de jeu écoulés encore mais franchement j'ai été étonné de ce jeu. J'adore...!

On se laisse vite entrainer dans la dynamique d'un propriétaire de restaurant qui cherche à bien servir ses clients tout en rendant cela rentable.

J'ai trouvé la vitesse de début un peu excessive, mais on réalise vite que certains achats judicieux d'équipement nous permettront de pouvoir reprendre notre souffle. Commence alors le défi de vouloir mener l'entreprise à bien en gagnant chacune des 5 étoiles.

J'y retourne de ce pas, j'essai encore de débloquer ma première étoile mais l'inspecteur m'a donné une mauvaise évaluation parceque les rats courraient dans mon restaurant....il est difficile quand même non..?

Et pour ceux qui hésitent du au fait que le jeu est en anglais, je précise qu'un faible niveau d'anglais comme le mien suffit. Cela dit une version francaise serait apprécié quand même puisque la vitesse d'exécution des demandes entre beaucoup en ligne de compte.

review:
The first time I heard about Cook, Serve, Delicious! was on a GiantBomb Quicklook by Ryan Davis. I immediatly pirated the game to see if it really was that good... needless to say, it is. An instant buy for me given my background in cooking.

It really conveys the feeling of working in an actual kitchen and the joy, speed, and anxiety that comes from it. If you like to cook this is definitly worth a go!

Great Dev, great game, just support them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004085300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1558319172}
review: As a five year crew person in a busy fast food store, Cook, Serve, Delicious re-creates the fealing of hussle and bussle of a busy day as you rush to press every key on the keyboard in a finger dance that can best be descirbe as lightning fingers. The game on the outside appears to be an hard and frustraing game, but it is not. I find it relaxing and really fun. If you like rapidly increasing the muscle mass of your fingers will play a restraunt sim then this is the game for you. If you hate food, then avoid this game, because this game will make you hungry... and thristy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022860597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2047, 'last_played': 1472679256}
review:
This game has to be the best game I've gotten on steam in the entire year of 2013 and is easily one of the best indie games I've played on steam since the beginning of time, roughly matching the quality and fun of Don't starve for me.

The game stars you, a chef/waiter/caterer/sanitation engineer/janitor/exterminator/dishwasher/vigilante, yes you do absolutely everything in this restaurant eponymously named cook, serve, delicious. It sounds kind of tedious but in reality it is more precarious then anything, with managing all actions being a really tough balencing act, esspecially during rush hour.
The gameplay is increadibly fast-paced and hectic, although less so in the beginning so you have time to adapt to the difficulty curve.

My only gripe with the game is the system requirements, on my desktop it runs fine but there are occasional times when the game will drop frames when rush hour starts that can mess up an otherwise perfect day in game.

Future suggestions (Incase the developer takes time to read this crap)
1. Better streamlining of the code & performance options (Idk how the game treats 4+ core cpus)
2. Additional recipes using new equipment (Right now smoothies/milkshakes come to mind)
3. More character models for the game (The current ones repeat slightly too much for my taste)

Overall this is a fantastic game that deserves to have a much bigger following then what it currently has, with a few more updates it would not be crazy to put this game in my top 25 list of the best games I've ever played.

Addendum: I am aware that the same game developer(s?) make a game with the same hectic fast switching task game called "The oil blue". Personally I just could not get the hang of this game as the admitedly very nice art style distracts from the gameplay and overall it plays much more clunky and despite being slower, is seemingly more difficult and much less fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032343456', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1475598431}
review: A fantastic, simple game that gets much more challenging the longer you play! Really relaxing and fun to just kick your feet up, grab your keyboard and cook, cook, cook! The variety of food and upgrades always keeps the gameplay interesting, grab it on sale!

author: {'steamid': '76561198072175852', 'num_games_owned': 355, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2021, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1745, 'last_played': 1580410549}
review:
After spending hours playing this game, I am fairly certain that I could open up a Michelin star restaurant successfully... :)

It's a super fun and addictive game. It's not extremely hard, but not easy either. It helps pass the time. There are just so many aspects to it. I really enjoyed diner dash and cooking mama, so it was a great fit for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019159937', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1495642891}
review: Absolutely!  This is a fantastic and challenging game and I would have easily spent 20$ on it

author: {'steamid': '76561198003651138', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 922, 'last_played': 1568493410}
review:
I went into this game thinking it would be a pleasant if not brief diversion, something easily digested and moved on from. I was wrong. The action starts out intense and only gets crazier as you buy new dishes and upgrade those you have; rush hours, which are already scary, become absolutely insane when you have to cut vegetables for soups or make steaks with all the different seasonings in different quantities. 

The game is simple enough to get right into but it offers just enough advancement and development to keep the player interested. I should say so; I'm about to play some more.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960411258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1527446845}
review:
Would you like to work long hours of grueling manual labour in the restaurant industry with no pay? 

"Yes ofcourse!" you say. Then Cook, Serve, Delicious is the game for you.

Experience the wonder of carpal tunnel as you struggle to open bottles of wine,wash dishes, and throw out the trash. 

Feel the rage of having your customer walk off disgruntled because you seasoned his steak 2 times instead of 3.

Upgrade your restaurant with more complex foods and desserts to push you way beyond what you are capable of.


I rate this game 37 out of 42 baked potatoes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972268032', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1442490008}
review: Frustrating game. If working in a fast food joint is anything like this, they should be paid double.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029318657', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1516663179}

author: {'steamid': '76561198075472158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3040, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2204, 'last_played': 1616685188}
review:
When I first tried this game, I was unable to play due to the extreme unresponsiveness when both clicking and using the hotkeys. I came back to the game later on, hoping it would be different, and I'm glad that I did. The problem seemed to resolve itself and I have not had the issue since. If you were experiencing this same problem and gave up on the game, I encourage you to come back and try it again.

The GOOD:

Simple, but charming artwork.
Catchy and enjoyable music.
Fast-paced and exciting.
Many different elements outside of "make this dish" such as dating, health inspections, chores, betting, the concept of "menu rot," robberies, three types of mini games, and an email system which includes spam messages.
Can use hotkeys, mouse, or a combination of both. Can create/edit the hotkeys to your liking.
Manages to be simplistic and inviting to learn while offering a challenge.
Enjoyable, despite its repetitiveness.
At least 20 hours of playtime before completing the game (in my experience).
A fun game for any foodie or fan of cooking games.

The BAD:

Once all food and equipment has been bought and upgraded, there is nothing to spend your money on, though it continues to accumulate.
Not much incentive to play the game once you have fully upgraded your restaurant and earned all achievements.
The three mini games are too similar. One of them is only more challenging because you must be perfect, where the others allow some mistakes to be made.

Overall, I recommend this game. I bought this when it was on sale for a few dollars. I feel the amount of playtime and enjoyment I got from the game was more than fair for that price. Even though I have completed the game, I am still working on some of the achievements and I find it fun. If a Cook, Serve, Delicious 2 came out, I would buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018193619', 'num_games_owned': 576, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 2238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1056, 'last_played': 1417679442}
review:
俺の料理というゲームが似ているとのこと（本人はやったことがないので不明）
注文された品を指定された内容どおりに作って出す。ショートカットキーを利用するのでブラインドタッチは必須
フランクフルトやポテトを作る店からはじまり、やがてポテトやバーガー、パスタやコーヒー、ステーキにワインと
ジャンクフードからレストラン店に主力が変化していく。何故か串焼きやら寿司やらもある
料理には一長一短があるため、いきなり高性能なのを出しても設備が追いつかずに苦しむだけなのは良いバランスだと思える

非常にオススメ。やりごたえもあるし時間つぶしにやるとハマりやすいタイプ
スープを主力に出来る人は凄いと思います

author: {'steamid': '76561198073096101', 'num_games_owned': 158, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1695357039}
review: I actually got this game while it was on sale. I love cooking games, so I thought 'Why not?' The game's pretty fun, but fast-paced. The cooking part is simple; just press the letters that correspond to a certain ingredient. You have chores to do too, such as taking out the garbage and washing dishes. I dread rush hour times because you have to serve multiple customers and do chores as well. It's a bit slow to earn money in the beginning, so spend your starting allowance wisely. There are other ways to earn money such as accepting bets, doing challenges, etc. What's great is that you can actually try out dishes before purchasing them. There's more to this game, but you have to try it out for yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971646268', 'num_games_owned': 1227, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 602, 'last_played': 1393317296}

author: {'steamid': '76561197983285757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 494, 'last_played': 1419835886}
review:
GOTTA COOK FAST.

Manage your time, manage your responsibilites, and be the best damn burger flipper slash FIVE STAR MOTHERFUCKING GORDON RAMSEY you can be! Memorize how to maximize the efficiency of your recipes and other restaurant owning responsibilities to make the most out of every single day. This game is a great risk/reward arcade-style time management/button mashing game that is definitely worth your time.

This game is good. Real good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054601224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1422823147}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996685479', 'num_games_owned': 2386, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 2662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1793, 'last_played': 1501360215}
review:
This is a totally addictive game! I often play it thinking that I'll just do a day or two of service and then I discover that 2 hours have passed.

It's pretty rewarding to see your restaurant gaining stars, mastering the preparations and passing the various challenges. There are some dishes that will give you a hard time of course (my personal nightmares were upgraded pasta, nachos and fully upgraded lasagna).

Oh, and it's playable with mostly the mouse as well, as I did just that and I used the keyboard only for certain chores and for selecting the food to prepare and send out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044136838', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 942, 'last_played': 1389586031}

A great indie surprise. The gameplay is almost reminiscent of the Guitar Hero series, and is great for short bursts.

- Progressing through the game and unlocking new items or features can take a while
- Can become repetitive

author: {'steamid': '76561197967680889', 'num_games_owned': 1009, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 1994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 763, 'last_played': 1587915451}
review: This game is fantastic. Highly addictive gameplay that's very rewarding and excellent use of sound. Build up from a greasy fried chicken joint to a world class five star restaurant. Probably one of the most fun games I've played this year.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990595469', 'num_games_owned': 501, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1404542323}
review: This is a fun gem and one I suggest. It's a mix between strategic games from Maxis circa the 1990s and cute social games for the Facebook crowd. The end result is a highly addictive, challenging restaurant manager with a lot of heart--it took me completely by surprise. The developer also seems to really care about the game; he posts publicly and thoughtfully about it, even apparently adding a free expansion pack to it prior to its Steam release. By purchasing it, you're supporting niche games and indie devs. To me, there's honestly a lot worse things you can get for $9.99. It's completely worth checking out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070403360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1076, 'last_played': 1524323621}
review:
PV通りのレストラン経営ゲーム。維持費などの概念は無いのでひたすら料理して稼いでレシピの購入やアップグレードを繰り返します。
マウスでも操作可能ですが基本的にはキーボード操作でタイピングソフトのようなプレイ感です。
普段の営業はメニューを自由に選べるので苦手な料理は出さないことも可能。
英語が苦手だと注文を素早く正確に読み取ったりキーバインドを覚えるのがちょっとだけ難しい。

author: {'steamid': '76561197978228620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 3113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1664, 'last_played': 1391376798}
review: I am surprised at how much I loved this game. This is not a "casual game" like those PopCap things. It gets really nitty gritty without bogging you down with details and giving you a steep learning curve for how to start playing. The only thing I wished it allowed you to do is to pick the decor of your restaurant. The "emails" you get to read are highly amusing, adding an atmosphere and element of surprise everyday. Highly recommended.

review:

Great combination of time management and reaction button presses.
Recommended for getting perfects each day: Cycle one slot with different foods everyday and use staple foods for other slots.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032282158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 692, 'last_played': 1389420384}
review:
Un jeu assez original dans son concept mais finalement assez dur à prendre complétement en main.
La première étoile n'est pas très dure à obtenir car on peut se contenter des plats les plus simples à faire mais par la suite cela se complique car il y a de plus en plus d'ingrédient à gérer, de situations et donc de boutons.
On peut gérer au point en click mais je doute de l'efficacité car au final les raccourcis sont à mon humble avis plus rapides mais cela demande un peu de mémoire car il faut jongler entre 15 et 30 boutons (suivant la manière de jouer) dont il faut se souvenir à quoi ils correspondent en fonction du plat ou de la situation.
Le système de jeu est en tout cas très addictif et c'est tant mieux car il faudra pas mal de temps de "travail à la chaine" pour boucler les succès dont une partie sont quantitatifs.
Un bon petit jeu que j'aimerai bien voir débarquer sur ma Galaxy Note.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022164071', 'num_games_owned': 1347, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 1435927302}
review:
reposted from my tumblr: 

Why CSD is my game of the year

CSD is one of those games that could be called Casual: The mechanics are easy to understand, yet the game manages to keep you busy and engaging, whilst allowing you to adjust the level of challenge in each consecutive playthrough. The way the gmae does this is by allowing you to decide that’s on the days many. The foods that need more prep and cooking allow you to earn more money, but because of the complexity of the preparation and making of the dish, it becomes more difficult to manage over the rush hour periods of the day.

Moreover the game even has some light management stuff going on for it: Each day you can change the menu you have to make it include less challenging foods, as well as replace menu items that have begun to rot (i.e. the foods have been on the menu for too long and customers aren’t interested in them). So with these days you might remove one complex menu item and replace it with another to keep yourself fresh in the eyes of customers.

There’s also the factor of safety insepctions, robberies as well as bets and stuff that’ll make the gameplay each day more or less hectic.

No IAP stuff

I like the fact that the game doesn’t make you buy some mooncredits in order to unlock speciality foods like coffee and stuff. No, all the things and all the foods can be aquired by being really clever and good with the menu items. This makes it a fair game, and this paragraph rather poorly written.

Should I play this game?

In my opinion yes. Even though it looks like a ‘casual’ game, there is a need for good finger dexterity and use of mouse if you are going to keep making wodnerful dishes and making your cutomers happy. There are NO DLC packages released, so you only pay 8.99 euros for the whole game. The game’s simple and easy to understand, and you might even get the cooking bug after playing this game!

Final grade:

If Mauve is considered to be unpleasant, and purple is the color of exhuberance, i am giving this game a STRONG BEIGE.

GOTY of 2013

author: {'steamid': '76561198072156781', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1434963551}
review:
Back during the Autumn Sale, I was browsing through the vast catalog of games, and came several titles of games, that were drastically cut down in price. Among these games, included blockbuster titles like Payday 2, Saints Row 4, Arma 3, yet, though I chose to buy a few cheaper games (you know, more bang for your buck). At checkout, I ended up purchasing 3 games, one in which was called Cook, Serve, Delicious.

From the store page, the game appears very similar to diner dash; an indie/arcade game, also focused on the food business. The screenshots were pretty interesting, as well as the description. However, without too background knowledge, (being none of my friends owned this game, and there was no available demo), I blindly started playing the game, and immediately loved the game. Like any games, I immediately pointed out the pros and cons, and here they are.

Pros: The game has a large portion of "menu options".  100+ hours of gameplay (depending on if you do side activities or not).  Provides a realistic aspect of the food business, by allowing gamers to have to change around the menu, in order to gain a higher "daily buzz" rating.  Detailed textures for both the food and the restaraunt.

Cons: Game takes to long to level up.   There are a few noticeable glitches (with the Coffee menu item active, trying to use the mouse to select the item, does not work).   

Graphics - For this style of game, it is definitely well detailed.  Anti-aliasing works well, without creating too much extra stress on your system.  

Sounds - I could do without the elavator music as background music, for this game.   Some of the sounds for the menu items being cooked, sound pretty rediculous. Then again, some of them sound really realistic.

Overall - I would suggest this game. Being the game is at an already low price, I would have to say, if you like indie games, or any addicting games, I would have to suggest this, among all others.

8.5 of 10 - Rating

author: {'steamid': '76561197968380563', 'num_games_owned': 916, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 3376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1420, 'last_played': 1597357568}
review: I got this game for about $4.00 on the Holiday Sale and expected to get a laugh or two and uninstall it. Instead, I've played it for about 16 hours and still want to keep playing. Trying to maintain a perfect combo, especially during Rush Hours, and challenging yourself to find the right menu which balances quickness/efficiency and cost effectiveness makes this a very addictive game. Cook, Serve, Delicious has a lot to offer, especially if you are pretty good at typing and have quick reflexes. It will challenge you. It doesn't look like much more than a tablet game but it is a lot of fun. Oh and also: fuck soup.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969913402', 'num_games_owned': 3553, 'num_reviews': 250, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1434489471}
review:
If you've ever wanted the thrill of running a restaurant, well this is a game so you're not going to get any thrills like that.  However if you've ever wanted the thrill of pretending you run a restarant with tasks done in the form of minigames, then there are lots of thrills to be had here.

First off, you start out with 4 menu slots and enough cash to buy some stuff.  You can buy a grill, a fryer, an industrial stove for making soups and stuff, etc.  You also get to pick food ranging from simple to complicated, and quick to "needs lots of prep time".  Food can also be upgraded to allow you more options and more money. 

A typical day goes like this: you choose your menu items, you start the day and people stop in and give you orders.  It could be "I need a large water with flavor blast and no ice" or "one corn dog with nothing on it" or maybe even "3 meat patties, cheese bacon and tomato" or whatever.  As long as you don't make any mistakes and don't take too long, the customer is happy and you get some extra "buzz" from it.  Make a few mistakes and the customer walks away unsatisfied but otherwise ok (no buzz).  REALLY screw things up and he gets mad and you lose buzz.

Oh and while you're doing all of this, there's dishes to be done, there's trash to throw out, rat traps to reset, toilets to flush, and the occasional blog post that needs thumbing up because it could raise your buzz.  

The game is relatively simple, but yet it's just challenging enough to make you feel like you accomplished something when you go a full day with no bad orders, or if you made a really good streak of perfect orders.  It takes some practice to get used to it, and sometimes adding a new item to the menu can throw you off your game, but you really have to keep changing up the menu to keep it fresh and interesting (both for you and for the customers in game).

The game is very charming with jazzy music that plays at various times of the day, for various weather conditions, and during rush hour (among other events).  The art style is kinda like a childrens book, but it doesn't detract from the game and maybe adds a little flavor to it (since the customers you get depend on how good your restaurant is).  

If you dislike minigames or QTE style games, you should probably pass on CSD, but if you like trying to multitask and you don't mind the physical challenge of having to hit certain keys (sometimes in a certain order) then this is worth a look.  I've enjoyed CSD... maybe you will too?

author: {'steamid': '76561198034319315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1403122753}

author: {'steamid': '76561197994768862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1381675114}
review:
Cook, Serve, Delicious is a button masher cooking game well suited for people liking casual games. It gives you a nice experience of fighting against the clock to serve all you customers. The only negative aspect of the game is the amount of time that is needed to get to the next level. It does become a bit of a grindfest to get to a 5 star restaurant. But from the other side, it will give you an incentive to keep on playing.

The gameplay felt refreshing as I didnt see this implementation of using other keys on your keyboard than the regular awsd in a lot of games. You can also choose to use your mouse, but after a few cooking days you will want to switch to using your keys.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040019889', 'num_games_owned': 588, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1484022728}
review: Fast paced, all controls customizable, tons of options, upgrades are fun, leveling is fantastic, great, great, great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974232715', 'num_games_owned': 637, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1558946989}
review:
You start out running your small restaurant where your job is to serve as many customers through the day with no mistakes on their orders. The level of customers is determined by your restaurants "buzz" percentage which is given based on factors like what kinds of foods your serving, how well you did the previous day on orders or if say it is raining outside and people feel like comfort food. Before you start each day you manage your menu items as well as check your email which provides tips. As you earn money you upgrade your menu items and expand your restaurant. 

The choices you make before the day start have a great effect on how easy of a day you will have. Each order has you type out a series of keyboard shortcut keys in order to perform the various steps to create the order. If you stack your menu with fried foods your day will be pretty easy but you will also earn not very much profit. It becomes fun to see how much money you can make while at the same time keeping your menu at a pace you will be able to perform without errors.

Have playes this for many hours, I would recommend it highly

author: {'steamid': '76561197961268942', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1606953403}
review:
Great game.  The actual game side of it is very fun and addicting, and gets far more challenging the further you get (as you get new food upgrades it adds new steps to preparation and such).  I still haven't even gotten 1 star yet, you need 20 days of service for that and I'm at about 15, but I feel like I've played it long enough to form an opinion.  It may get wildly different from here on out, but I feel like I've already gotten my money's worth.

Also, fuck, Ryan Davis.  :(  Very touching tribute achievement to one of the greatest men in the industry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118834181', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1388111888}
review:
I am a real chef and I found this game challenging and kinda interesting, but it's actually the same kind of game as the flash games of the Papa series, you just have all the food options togheter to be bought and used. you have to unlock different foods, and levelup to have more menu options or unlock more equipment. In the description it seems like you'll be free to set up your own style of restaurant, deciding what to sell. So I thought will be interesting to use my experience on organizing a kitchen menu and see if the game was responding well, rewarding my strategies. but that's not how the game works. You are actually forced to change most of the items every 2 days, so your menu won't be very personal or strategic. you're not able to change the price (it changes automatically with upgrades of food), which is the most important strategy when you run a restaurant (stupid example: deciding to make easy food with a cheap price to attract people, and then selling drinks very expensive).
the other problem is that the restaurant improvements will have to be unlocked by your levelling up, so again, you won't be able to choose a strategy, you'll just be guided through the upgrades in the way they wanted to.

you have to be super focused to play, and the dishes have a mental amount of toppings and different recipes (I had to cut off the soft drinks, as there are 5 different taps and 3 different sizes plus ice option, and when it's busy you go crazy reading the checks and serving the correct thing), so you'll go crazy during the busy hours. so yes, the game is challeging and addicting, but be aware that it's not what it seems from the description, and in the strategic side you won't basically have anything to do to make the difference..

author: {'steamid': '76561198116217360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1527443039}

author: {'steamid': '76561197984865906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 656, 'last_played': 1499342208}
review: Addicting. It's like a frantic rhythm game when you get into it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022087448', 'num_games_owned': 605, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 734, 'last_played': 1391966057}
review:
Addicting mix of managing game and rhythm/combo game. The managing parts seem trivial at first, but putting together the right menu for the day gets an increasingly difficult strategic decision. The game can get very exhausting if the menu isn't done properly.

Playing it on a keyboard is strongly recommended.
You can listen to podcasts while you play (rhythm tasks should get automated pretty fast).

Only downside is that one of the requirements to getting a "Star" on your restaurant (i.e. progressing) is a certain amount of days in service which is pretty high, at the beginning at least.

Oh and that the music/sounds have no sliders, you can only toggle them -.-

author: {'steamid': '76561198110130835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1081, 'last_played': 1483130911}

author: {'steamid': '76561197964087717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1500057319}
review:
A nice decent restaurant sim game, more focused on the kitchen part instead of serving tables like many other games out there. 
It starts out as a time waster but it makes you go that extra day every time. The difficulty ramps up nicely but the prices for the dishes go up quite fast and thre is some grinding involved because of that. 
Allthough it doesn't bother me much, it can put some people off. 

The stress that the game gives during rush hours in the later difficulties is really fun and self-rewarding when you manage to get through it and make a "perfect day". 

Fun game, bought it at sale but I think it's worth the full price as well.
This will be a game I will be coming back to every so often.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022630265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4, 'last_played': 1388678523}
review:
Generally a good game but needs improvement.

The fast paced nature of the game at later levels really keeps you on your toes with the menu rotting mechanic making sure that you keep switching between foods to keep you from getting too used to certain menu items. The price of improving recipes is a little steep but gives incentive to keep playing however there are some problem areas that need focus on.

I encountered two problems while playing this game which has forced me to not include two food items on my menu.

1) The soda order of "large cola with ice and fruit blast" 

2) The steak order of "everything you have, doubled, except citrus"

One of these order maybe a bug, the other is ambigious and in the course of a busy day with 60+ customers when you reach the higher levels, you can't waste time deciding exactly what the order consists of. 

Whenever i got these orders I fulilled them as i thought i should, large cola with ice and fruit blast but still only got a satisfactory rating from that customer.

The steak order could be intepreted as whether to include 1 citrus coating or none at all which doesn't help.

Should a sequel be planned, i highly recommend having someone proof read the orders so they are as clear as possible.

Other recommended improvements:

- Having a back function so if you know you messed up a order, you can go back to the start of that order at the cost of time instead of continuing someone's order, knowing you got it wrong but having nothing you can do about it

-When selecting your active menu, having a hover tool tip over each food that shows its modifiers instead of having to keep going to the "buy food" category to see them.

This is a good entry in the food sim category, the art is decent and actually makes me feel hungry when I'm playing this on a empty stomach with music that matches the atmosphere of the game that changes depending on rush hour and the time of day which is a nice touch.

The game is well designed with a lot of ways to earn extra money while testing your reflexes with a incentive of trying differnt food selections that you may not usually consider having on your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972432366', 'num_games_owned': 1112, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 692, 'last_played': 1453572566}
review:
I'd heard people raving about this game for a little while, but put off getting it because I didn't understand how a restaurant management sim could be so good. I've never been so wrong. Cook, Serve, Delicious is one of the most addictive games I've played in a long time. Every once in a long while a game comes along that just executes every single thing it set out to do, and executes those things perfectly. This is one of those games.

It's a deep game, mechanically speaking. You have access to a large number of different foods, restaurant equipment, and upgrades that can make it easier to manage your customers, prepare your food, or earn the almighty dollar (which in turn lets you buy and upgrade more food, natch). But despite this, the game has one of the softest learning curves I've ever seen, gently letting you flourish from a struggling corn dog cart jockey to a masterful soux chef and maybe even find some love along the way.

The biggest key to the success of CSD has to be it's intuitive nature. Not since Wii Sports have I played a game that has such natural feeling controls. After a few minor stumbles along the way (v for olives, n for onions) I find myself juggling prep stations with ease, pounding out orders quickly, glancing at the minimum info I need and making sure I'm not feeding anyone raw fish, unless they want it.

Finally, the art and sound really seal the deal. The background music keeps things hopping and peaks and ebbs when it needs to, and the distinctive sounds for various events keep you focused on what's important. The perfect "whoof" that I heard the first time I set something on fire was particularly memorable, but the separate dings for dishes that are ready vs. prepped are  essential.

In short, this is a fantastically well put together game that has given me more hours of enjoyment than several "AAA" titles (that cost me far more, to boot) and I can think of exactly zero reasons that would make me hesitate to recommend this game to anyone. Unless of course you're some kind of fun-hating grump.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031295529', 'num_games_owned': 460, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 4712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4108, 'last_played': 1617496255}
review:
*This is regarding the new update recently. A new game+ feature has been added which gives you a $15,000 starting bonus, all secondary foods unlocked, starts with 6 prep stations, Munchies detractor is disabled, 50% buzz forever, customer count + achivement progress + food pins from your Platinum Star save will be imported (it won't ask you which if you have multiple saves however,) difficulty increase coming from decreased customer patience and Super Rush Hour. Basically even at the start of the new game, you are already on Platinum ++ difficulty with everything on hyper mode. If Platinum wasn't fast enough for you, you'll love new game +. I'm definitely enjoying the difficulty ramp, but at the moment it does look like some combos might be impossible if going for the Perfect Day. Hopefully further upgrades will make such combos possible later in the game. 



The Good:
Ability to rebind keyboard controls
Food effects to prevent boring menu
Multiple profiles for different users
*Hello there New Game +

The Bad:
Your stupid dates
The menu to rebind your keys needs some work
Lack of new game + (no longer applies in the latest update)

[b]Cook, Serve, Delicious![/b], or CSD, is one of the better cooking/restaurant management games I've had the fortune of playing.  Unlike some of your typical games in the same genre, CSD has controls that relies almost entirely on keyboard as opposed to tapping/clicking.  I'm also happy to say I don't have to control a little sprite to deliver food/pick up orders from your customers.  Only thing you need to manage is prepping your food.  Customers will just show up and tell you exactly what they want.  Anything from that point on is just Simon Says with the instructions.  Everything in CSD can almost be played with just your keyboard.  Your mouse is only needed to navigate the menu or turn on/off the music and sound effects in the upper right corner.  All the shortcuts for ingredients can be rebind in the main menu.  It's not the most intuitive interface and does need some work, but it'll get the job done.  I am ok with the default keys for the ingredients, but some people may definitely want to rebind the Onion ingredient's key (it's either O or N on different dishes) and some of the more complex dishes.  I find the food effects in CSD also refreshing.  It prevents the players from using the same menu and stock only the most profitable munchies at all times.

Money will be an issue when you start since everything is pretty expensive.  There are times where you'll be offered a chances to "gamble."  It's not really gambling since usually, it's very dependent on your cooking skills and your ability to keep a perfect combo chain going.  The cooking challenges are also a place to rack up some quick cash.  Unfortunately these challenges are one time only until you've maxed your resaurant, but by then I doubt you'd be short on cash.

Some potential problems people may have with the game is how repetitive the game can get, since you really are just taking orders and jugggling meat.  20 days to advance to the next level was too long for me.  Usually by 5-8 days I'm fairly proficient at managing chores, customers, and the difficult recipes.  Chores happen in the form of random events.  You need to clean up the garbage, trap the rat, wash the dishes, clean the restroom, and occasionally nab the robber.  The robber happens rarely.  But when he shows up, you can bet that you'll lose your perfect combo streak on higher difficulty.  One thing I also want to nitpick is the dating aspect in the game.  I find it very distracting in the game.  I know it's an optional thing just to get some free gold tickets ($2000 each in the shop,) but everytime your date texts you you are also juggling customer orders.  There's a good chance that you'll lose your combo because your stupid date can't be bothered to text faster or text you after work.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998461248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1392025448}
review:
This is the most stressful game I've played in ages.
That said, it does very much emulate my time as a fast food worker.

The basic premise to this game is this; You own a restaurant, you make food by pushing buttons really fast, and you strive to keep every customer happy by making everything quickly and correctly whilst pushing those buttons. The trick is, most foods, or at least the most valuable foods per order, require multiple ingredients and button presses, whilst also having multiple possible recipes. So when you start selling pizzas for example, the first pizza you get ordered might be cheesy bread (select order, hit cheese then cook), but then the next might be a deluxe (select order, hit every topping you have then cook). So the standard production pipeline is get order, identify exact order, press buttons really quickly from the recipe that you maybe remember because reading each order entirely is too slow, and then hope you haven't taken too much time and let other customers or chores expire whilst cooking this first order.

Add on top of this standard events (rush hours and health inspectors making you work harder), an ever-increasing difficulty (you start off only holding 4 orders concurrently, but as you gain stars you have to juggle more and more customers) and an increasing complexity in the orders, and you have the perfect recipe for terrible amounts of pressure.

This game is absolutely franctic.

As for the decor, it's a bit on the kiddie side, but honestly if you're paying too much attention to the bright colours and somewhat silly intro song you're probably not going to play well anyway.

If you're looking for a game to whip you into submission with el dente pasta, then you're going to love this game.
Frankly, I found it hard to keep my own energy up through the entire day of cooking, but I still think it's brilliant gameplay, and I love torturing myself so I have to give it 4.5/5.

This game is just one of the best tests of muscle memory that I've seen in ages.



Some final thoughts:
This game is in effect a very good touch typing tool. All the hotkeys are usually related to the ingredient that they supply, either by first or second letter. You can rebind them, but then I think you'll have trouble in later, more ingredient intensive levels, as you won't be as easily able to link the button to the ingredient.
Also you can play the entire game with the mouse, but I dare say you'll have trouble keeping up.

And lastly, you can change the difficulty on the game. Sort of.
While I haven't gone looking for a precise difficulty setting, there is a "buzz" mechanic in the game that determines how many customers come to your restaurant. If you want, you can deliberately sabotage your "buzz" to prevent as many orders coming in the next day. This makes it easier to complete every order, but also makes your business less profitable which prevents advancement towards new skills and recipes.
That said, you get $250 if you complete every order in a day perfectly, and you have betting opportunities based on successful order streaks, so it may well be wise to scale back the customers if you're having trouble and then recoup your losses through these other bonuses.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076082127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 7591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 692, 'last_played': 1696772701}
review:
This game is very fun.

The good thing about this game compared to your standard cooking games is it doesn't just get faster and faster until you absolutely can't keep up; you can keep up (with skill and practice!)

If you are learning how to type, or you are wanting to up your wpm, this game is an awesome tool to help you do that. I type 93wpm but have always been pretty shocking with my numbers. Having played this game my numbers are now pretty good (trust me, you don't want to click the wrong number in this game!) Of course, this relies on you using the keyboard instead of the mouse, but I think that you will need to master the keyboard in order to master this game.

I actually think this would be a really cool tool to use when interviewing candidates for jobs such as administration, because it demonstrates a few skills:

Typing accuracy
Ability to follow instructions
Attention to detail (did that say "salt please" or "no salt please"?)
Ability to quickly learn new systems, for example, learning that 'Y' is 'butter' even though you would not naturally think that
Time management (sure, that order came in first, but I should put that lobsters on to cook first)
Quick thinking
Ability to perform under pressure

And likely more.

The only negative I've encountered is that the same ingredient (for example, 'sour cream') in two different menu items has a different key registered for it (for one item it is 's', for another it is 'c'), however you ARE able to change the key registry manually for all ingredients.

All up, fun fun fun, have played about 12 hours of it so far, looking forward to playing more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010915189', 'num_games_owned': 404, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1501751596}
review: Cook, Serve, Delicious is a fast paced, mad game, which teaches you to multitask and speed type like you've never done so before. It's not easy, but after your first few days dishing out meals and washing dishes you'll never want to stop. It has an addictive quality - just one more day so I can buy that food, or level my restaurant up a star. In other words - it's awesome. I love it. I bought it on sale but I think it's well worth the full price.

review: Cook, Serve, Delicious! is not a regular restaurant simulation.  You play as the waiter and the chef.  You take the orders, cook the food and serve it to your waiting customers.  The game is fast paced as you juggle between attending to customers and keeping your restaurant clean.  It keeps your interest with upgradable food items, new restaurant equipment, and challenges.  Very fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063421704', 'num_games_owned': 169, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1478504998}
review: I thought this game would be somewhat fun but I was surprised by how AWESOME IT IS! The game depends on the keyboard and the controls are simple but to actually make every dish perfect quickly enough to still do chores and take others orders is pretty hard. Once you catch onto a recipe you upgrade it and you have to struggle with learning the new recipes and items all over again. The game is just the right amount of challenging and interesting to make you want to play for long periods. I've already played for a few hours and gotten my first star! I can't wait to be a five star chef. My boyfriend is thinking about buying it since I love it so much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025265244', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1108, 'last_played': 1437134461}
review: This is basically that kind of flash game about serving some sort of food and micro-managing the ingredients and cooking and stuff with little minigames (come on, you know the one)... except it's good. Like, really good. With surprisingly good gameplay and a side order of tongue-in-cheek humour, this game really stands out as something different, but still very welcome. If you wouldn't mind a fun, but simple time-waster to play now and then with some good jokes to keep you in high spirits the whole way then I would recommend this. It's no triple A title that will leave you thinking about its message after it's done, but it'll keep you smiling while it's still going. Well worth its quite modest price, despite its deceptive appearence.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989122531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1664679137}
review:
This is quite possibly one of the most entertaining, challenging, and overall crazy games I've played... ever.  You run a restaurant in a office building skyscraper, and it all falls on you to make money, improve your skills and menu, and take it to the top - the fabled 5 Star rating!

Just beware - because oh too soon will you absolutely dread rush hour with demanding patrons, yet you'll love every single hectic second.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030751242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1481503419}
review: A surprisingly fun and challenging game! Worth every pennies and can be played easily casual by not putting up challenging menues, or go all out and try to raise your restaurant to a 5 star winner and feel the surprising stress of it! (I still hate that baked potato...).

author: {'steamid': '76561197971619232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 984, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1418336945}
review:
I've been a fan of Vertigo Games for a long while now, ever since playing their "Ore No Ryomi" game, so it really was not much of a surprise that Mr. Chubigans (founder and primary designer) was planning on making a sequel.

The game itself borrows heavily from the PS1 game "Ore No Ryouri" in that it is essentially a simulator of running a restaurant entirely by yourself. No waitstaff, no chef, just you, a kitchen, and a counter full of customers. The game itself is played entirely with the keyboard, selecting first the customer/ticket you wish to service, then hitting the correct keys to process the order correctly.

The controls do get a little frustrating at times, but it appears that Mr. Chubigans has added a key binding menu for each dish, so any you have particular trouble with can now be changed. Also, the graphics are impeccably watercolor style, and the music/sound design make this game far more relaxing than you would expect from the time-management genre. Highly recommended for the price!

author: {'steamid': '76561197984658225', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 2249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1883, 'last_played': 1538414237}
review:
Ich bin bis jetzt noch nicht so weit im Spiel, kann aber sagen das es eine Menge Spaß macht. 
Multitasking ist das Zauberwort, welche Bestellung zuerst, welche dauert länger, mache ich erste diese und bis sie fertig ist kann ich schnell die anderen abarbeiten usw.
Dazu 2 mal am Tag "Rush Hour", Mittags und am späten Nachmittag.
Es kommt auch ein Inspektor um das Restaurant zu überprüfen.
Zwischendurch kleine Wetten ob man mit bestimmten Menüs auf der Karte eine vorgegebende Anzahl Kombos schafft, Catering-Wettbewerbe wo man eine bestimme Anzahl Kunden bedienen muss mit max. 3 schlechten Bestellungen.
Später kommen noch die Hunger Festivities wo man die Gerichte ohne Fehler zubereiten muss, ein Fehler und man kann wieder von vorne anfangen. Die einzelnen Wettbewerbe hierzu muss man sich aber erst mit goldenen Tickets kaufen. 8 Stück pro Wettbewerb.
Weiterhin kan man diverse Personen daten, diese wollen ein bestimmtes Gericht essen, hat man es perfekt zubereitet chatten sie nachher noch mit uns. Hierbei sind die richtigen Antworten zu geben damit sie noch ein Date wollen. Dummerweise passiert das während des laufendem Betriebs und geht quälend langsam voran.
Deswegen gehen grundsätzlich viele Bestellungen kaputt oder verschwinden.

Ansonsten ein spaßiges Spiel, würde es aber nicht zum jetzigen Vollpreis kaufen.
Ich selbst habe gewartet bis es im Angebot war.
